Sense.DEF: the 16th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十六个字母
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=provisional, used on cars to show that the driver is a learner and has a provisional licence 学员驾驶执照﹐实习驾驶执照
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=page 页
the abbreviation of 缩写=penny or 或 pence 便士
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus fare was only 50p.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车票价只有50便士。

Sense.DEF: used in written music to show that a part should be played or sung quietly
Sense.TRAN: 柔声地﹐轻轻地﹐弱〔用于乐谱中﹐表示该部分演奏或演唱时应用轻声〕

Sense.DEF: peer-to-peer computer systems make it possible to exchange files, software etc between two computers, even though they are not connected to each other
Sense.TRAN: 对等网络的﹐点对点技术的

Sense.DEF: person-to-person methods of paying for something allow the person buying something on the Internet to pay the person who is selling it
Sense.TRAN: 〔支付方式〕个人对个人的〔指网上购物直接付款给卖家〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: P2P payments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 个人对个人支付款项

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=postage and packing 邮资和包装费
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please send 80p to cover p & p.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请寄80便士以支付邮资和包装费。

Sense.DEF: father – used by children or when speaking to children

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=per annum 每年

Sense.DEF: electronic equipment that makes someone’s voice loud enough to be heard by large groups of people
Sense.TRAN: 有线广播系统﹔扩音系统

Sense.DEF: someone who works as a secretary for one person

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=political action committee 政治行动委员会

Sense.DEF: the speed at which something happens or is done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pace of change in our lives is becoming faster and faster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们生活的变化速度越来越快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Public spending continues to rise at a steady pace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共开支继续稳步上升。

Sense.DEF: the speed at which someone walks, runs, or moves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You need to step up the pace of your exercises.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该加快训练速度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lucy set off at a leisurely pace back to the hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西迈着悠闲的步子出发回宾馆。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He quickened his pace , longing to be home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他加快步伐﹐盼望着早点回到家中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic slowed to a walking pace .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车流速度减缓﹐犹如步行。

Sense.DEF: a single step when you are running or walking, or the distance you move in one step

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took a pace towards the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝门口走了一步。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Rebecca walked a few paces behind her mum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丽贝卡走在妈妈身后几步远的地方。

Sense.DEF: to change or increase as fast as something else, or to move as fast as someone else
Sense.TRAN: （与某物/某人）并驾齐驱﹐步伐一致
Sense.EXAMPLE: Salaries have not always kept pace with inflation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资上涨的速度往往赶不上通货膨胀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The supply of materials cannot keep pace with demand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物资供不应求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slow down! I can’t keep pace with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢点！ 我跟不上你了。

Sense.DEF: to show how well you can do something
to make a person, vehicle, animal etc show how well they can do something
Sense.TRAN: 测试某人/某物的本领[性能]﹔使某人/某物展示本领[性能]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The test driver puts all the cars through their paces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试车手测试了所有的车辆。

Subsense.DEF: if a company sets the pace, it does something before its competitors or to a better standard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Japanese firms have been setting the pace in electronic engineering.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本公司在电子工程方面一直处于领先地位。

Subsense.DEF: to go faster than the other competitors in a race, who then try to achieve the same speed
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在比赛开始时〕领先﹐定速度〔使其他参赛者跟随〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Italians set the pace for the first eight laps.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前八圈意大利队一马当先。

Sense.DEF: to make something happen or develop more quickly than it would do normally
Sense.TRAN: 使加快速度﹔使加速发展

GramExa.EXAMPLE: measures designed to force the pace on alternative energy policies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在加快实施替代能源政策步伐的措施

Sense.LEXUNIT: be able to stand the pace
Sense.DEF: to be able to deal with situations where you are very busy and have to think and act very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you can stand the pace, working in advertising pays well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事广告业报酬很高﹐只要你能适应紧张的工作节奏。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rapid pace of change creates uncertainty.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 快速变化造成了不确定性。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pace of life in the countryside is slower.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡间的生活节奏更慢。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The economy was growing at a slow but steady pace.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济增长速度缓慢但稳健。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: at the pace that suits you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This allows each child to learn at his or her own pace.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这使得每个儿童都能以适合自己的速度学习。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very slowly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Reform is proceeding at a snail’s pace.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革正以蜗牛般的速度推行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely quickly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Singapore prospered and modernized at a breakneck pace.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新加坡以极快的速度实现了繁荣和现代化。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in a very fast and hurried way

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pace of change is quickening.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 变革的速度在加快。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The market may still be growing, but the pace is slowing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场或许在持续增长,但是速度在放慢。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: happen more quickly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Support for the campaign is gathering pace.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持这场运动的人越来越多。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: continue to do something or happen as quickly as before

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pace of change accelerated dramatically in the early 1980s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪80年代初,改革的步伐大大加快。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had to adjust to a different pace of life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不去适应另一种生活节奏。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘in your own pace’ or 或 ‘on your own pace’. Say 而要说 at your own pace .

Sense.DEF: to walk first in one direction and then in another many times, especially because you are nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found Mark at the hospital, pacing restlessly up and down .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看见马克在医院里焦躁不安地踱来踱去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sam stood up and paced the floor, deep in thought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆站起身﹐在屋里踱来踱去﹐全神贯注地思索着。

Subsense.DEF: to control the speed that you move at in a race, so that you still have energy left near the end
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Nicky paced herself and came through the ranks to win.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼基控制好自己的速度﹐超过了一个又一个选手﹐最终获得了胜利。

Subsense.DEF: to organize your life and activities so that you do not have too much to do
Subsense.TRAN: 调整自己的生活[活动]节奏
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You need to pace yourself and decide which tasks are the most important.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该调整一下自己的节奏﹐将工作分出轻重缓急来。

Variant.LEXVAR: pace sth ↔ off, pace sth ↔ out

Sense.DEF: to measure a distance by walking across it with steps of equal length
Sense.EXAMPLE: The director paced out the length of the stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位导演步测了舞台的长度。

Sense.DEF: a small machine that is placed inside someone’s chest in order to help their heart beat regularly
a person or horse who goes to the front in a race and sets the speed that the others must try to achieve
a person or team that is winning in a competition, and that others have to try to defeat
Sense.EXAMPLE: That left him three strokes behind the pacesetter, Parry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那样一来﹐他落后领先者帕里三杆。

Sense.DEF: a person or company that is considered to be a leader in a particular area of activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new company, now seen as the industry’s pacesetter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家现在被视为该行业领头羊的新公司

Sense.DEF: a game that is popular in Japan, in which you can win money or prizes by making balls fall into particular places in a special machine
Sense.TRAN: 弹珠机﹐爬金库﹐扒金宫〔流行于日本的一种游戏﹐弹珠跌进盘上特定的地方就可以领取奖金或奖品〕

Sense.DEF:
an animal with thick skin, such as an
elephant
peaceful and loving or wanting peace
Sense.TRAN: 平静的﹐安宁的﹔爱好和平的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a normally pacific community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平日里静悄悄的社区

Sense.DEF: a rubber object that you give a baby to suck so that it does not cry
something that makes people calm
the belief that war and violence are always wrong
someone who believes that wars are wrong and who refuses to use violence
Sense.TRAN: 和平主义者﹐反战主义者

Sense.DEF: to make someone calm, quiet, and satisfied after they have been angry or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re right,’ Rita said, in order to pacify him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是对的。”丽塔安抚他道。

Sense.DEF: to stop groups of people from fighting or protesting, often by using force
Sense.TRAN: 〔常指运用武力〕平息〔战争﹑抗议〕﹐使实现和平
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economic reforms are needed to pacify and modernize the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要进行经济改革使该国实现和平和现代化。

Sense.DEF: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: I forgot to pack my razor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忘记把剃须刀放入行李包了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you finished packing yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你行李收拾完了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kelly packed her things before breakfast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯莉早饭前整理好了行装。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’d better pack your bags. We’re leaving in an hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好把自己的行李收拾好﹐我们一小时后出发。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall I pack us a picnic?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要不要带点大家野餐吃的东西？

Sense.DEF: to put something into a box or other container, so that it can be moved, sold, or stored

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now wild mushrooms are available all year, packed in handy 25g boxes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今﹐野生蘑菇全年有售﹐25克一小包。

Sense.DEF: to go in large numbers into a space, or to make people or animals do this, until the space is too full

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fifty thousand fans packed into the stadium.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五万名球迷涌进了体育场。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sheep had been packed into a truck and transported without food or water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些羊被塞入一辆卡车运走﹐不给吃也不给喝。

Sense.DEF: to cover or fill an object with soft material so that it does not get damaged

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Glass must be packed in several layers of paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃必须用纸层层包裹。

Sense.DEF: to press snow, soil, sand etc down so that it becomes hard and firm
Sense.TRAN: 把〔雪﹑土壤﹑沙等〕压实［捣固］

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pack the soil down firmly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把土壤压实。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place and not return, especially because of a disagreement
to carry a gun
to have a very strong or impressive effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Spanish wine, with the flavour of honey, packed quite a punch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种蜂蜜味道的西班牙葡萄酒劲很大。

Sense.DEF: to put something back in a box, case etc where it is usually kept
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christmas was over and the decorations packed away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节过后﹐装饰品都被收了起来。

Sense.DEF: to do a lot in a limited period of time, or fit a lot of information, ideas etc into a limited space
Sense.TRAN: 〔在有限的时间里〕赶做〔大量的事〕将〔大量的信息等〕塞进〔有限的空间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We packed a lot of sightseeing into two weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在两周的时间内我们游览了大量的景点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In an essay of 2,000 words, you can pack a lot in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇2,000字的文章能写很多内容。

Sense.DEF: if a film, play etc packs people in, it attracts large numbers to come and see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any film starring Tom Cruise always packs them in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆·克鲁斯主演的电影总是很卖座。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing a job or activity that you are not enjoying
Sense.TRAN: 停止〔不喜欢的工作或活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After one year, I packed in university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年以后﹐我从大学退学了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I feel like packing it all in and going off travelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我真想放下手头的一切去旅行。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop doing something that is annoying you
Sense.TRAN: 别闹了﹐住手〔用于告诉某人停止做讨厌的事〕

Sense.DEF: if a machine packs in, it stops working because there is something wrong with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Halfway to the airport, the engine packed in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去机场的半路上﹐发动机坏了。

Sense.DEF: to send someone to stay somewhere for a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 把…打发走〔去某地待一段时间〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents used to pack us off to camp every summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的父母过去每年夏天都打发我们去度假营。

Sense.DEF: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the holidaymakers had packed up and gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数度假者已经收拾好行李走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gave her a hand packing up her clothes and stuff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我帮她打点衣物用品。

Sense.DEF: to put something into a box or other container, so that it can be moved, sold, or stored
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry. The removal men will pack everything up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐搬运工会把每样东西都打包的。

Sense.DEF: to finish work at the end of the day
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What time do you pack up?’ ‘Oh, about six.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你什么时候下班？”“嗯﹐六点左右。”

Sense.DEF: if a machine packs up, it stops working because there is something wrong with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photocopier’s packed up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复印机又坏了。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something, especially a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: He packed up his teaching job after only three months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仅仅三个月后他就辞去了教职。

Sense.DEF: something wrapped in paper or packed in a box and then sent by post or taken somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pack of three T-shirts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三件一包的T恤衫

Sense.EXAMPLE: Send away for your free information pack today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天就来函索取免费资料包吧。

Sense.DEF: a small container, usually made of paper, that something is sold in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pack of cigarettes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一包香烟
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 10 oz pack of frozen peas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盒10盎司的冻豌豆

Sense.DEF: a bag that you carry on your back, especially when climbing or walking, used to carry equipment, clothes etc

a complete set of
playing card s
a group of wild animals that hunt together, or a group of dogs trained to hunt together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wolf pack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狼群

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pack of hounds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群猎狗

Sense.DEF: a group of the same type of people, especially a group who you do not approve of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A pack of reporters were waiting outside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群记者等在外面。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be leading the pack/be ahead of the pack
Sense.DEF: to be more successful than the other people or companies you are competing against
Sense.TRAN: 处于领先地位﹐占据优势

Sense.DEF: something you are told that is completely untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t believe what it says in the paper - it’s a pack of lies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别相信报纸上说的——全是一派谎言。

Sense.DEF: a group of children who belong to a particular children’s organization
a thick soft piece of cloth that you press on a wound to stop the flow of blood
Sense.TRAN: 〔压在伤口上止血用的〕敷布﹐裹布﹐绷带

Sense.DEF: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

Sense.DEF: the paper or plastic container that food or other goods are sold in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a package of meat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一包肉

Sense.DEF: a set of ideas or services that are suggested or offered all together as a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔建议或提供的想法或服务的〕一套﹐一揽子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has announced a package of measures to assist affected areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府宣布了一整套措施以帮助受影响地区。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many banks are offering financial packages for students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多银行向学生提供各种助学金计划。

Sense.DEF: a set of related programs sold together for use on a computer

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 软件包/文字处理软件包/制图软件包等

Sense.DEF: to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent
Sense.TRAN: 把…装箱﹔将…包装好〔准备出售或寄出〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The code informs us where and when a product was packaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个代码告诉我们一件产品的包装地点和包装时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The videos were packaged up, ready for distribution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些录像带已经包装完毕﹐等待付运。

Sense.DEF: to prepare something for sale, especially by making it attractive or interesting to a particular group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为了增加某商品对某一群体的吸引力而〕包装
Sense.EXAMPLE: books that are packaged for mass readership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为吸引大众读者而包装的图书

Sense.DEF: a holiday organized by a company at a fixed price that includes the cost of travel, hotel etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheap package deal to Tenerife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特内里费廉价旅游套餐

Sense.DEF: an offer or agreement which includes several things that you must buy or accept together
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Commission attempted to bring all three proposals into one package deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会试图将全部三项提议合并作一套建议。

Sense.DEF:
a
package deal 1
the container or material that a product is sold in
Sense.TRAN: 包装盒[瓶﹐袋]; 包装材料
Sense.EXAMPLE: plastic packaging
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料外包装

Sense.DEF: the process of wrapping something for sale
Sense.EXAMPLE: the date of packaging
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包装日期

Sense.DEF: a way of making something seem attractive and interesting to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the packaging of the company image
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司形象的包装

Sense.DEF: an animal used for carrying heavy loads, for example a horse
extremely full of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a packed courtroom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挤满人的法庭

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The island was packed with tourists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛上满是游客。

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of a particular type of thing
Sense.TRAN: 充满某物的﹐有大量某物的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new magazine packed with exciting recipes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本收录大量诱人食谱的新杂志

Sense.DEF: if you are packed, you have put everything you need into cases ready to go somewhere
pressed, arranged etc closely or not closely together
Sense.TRAN: 紧密地/稀松地/密密地压[排列]在一起
Sense.EXAMPLE: houses tightly packed in rows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鳞次栉比的房屋

Sense.DEF:
food such as sandwiches and fruit that you take with you to work, school etc for
lunch
a cinema, restaurant etc that is packed out is completely full of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影院﹑餐馆等〕挤得满满的﹐满座的

Sense.DEF: someone who works in a factory, putting things into containers

Subsense.DEF:
a container made of paper, plastic, or
cardboard
that something is sold in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a packet of envelopes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一包信封
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a packet of cigarettes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一包香烟

Subsense.EXAMPLE: a cereal packet
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦片包装袋

Subsense.DEF: a small flat paper or plastic container that a liquid or powder is sold in
Subsense.TRAN: 〔装有供出售的液体或粉末的〕小袋
Subsense.EXAMPLE: packets of ketchup and mustard
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一袋袋番茄酱和芥末

Sense.DEF: a small flat package that is sent by post or delivered to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul tore open the packet as soon as it arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗一收到包裹就拆开了。

Sense.DEF: to cost a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bet that car cost him a packet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢打赌那辆车花了他一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: a quantity of information that is sent as a single unit from one computer to another on a network or on the Internet
a boat that carries letters, packages etc and usually passengers at regular times
a method of sending information stored on a computer, usually across the Internet. Long messages are broken into pieces and put together again when they are received.
Sense.TRAN: 包交换﹐分组交换〔一种通过因特网传送计算机数据的方法﹐即把长信息分割成片段传送﹐收到之后再组合〕

Sense.DEF: a horse used for carrying heavy loads
a mass of ice floating in the sea
when you put things into cases or boxes so that you can send or take them somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 包装﹐打包﹐装箱﹔收拾行李
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can do my packing the night before we leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以出发前一晚收拾行李。

Sense.DEF: the material used for packing things so that they can be sent somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use plenty of packing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请包装厚实。

Sense.DEF: a large strong wooden box in which things are packed to be sent somewhere
someone who collects and stores things that they do not really need
a trip through the countryside on horses, for fun or as a sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔为消遣或运动的〕乡间骑马旅行

Sense.DEF: a formal agreement between two groups, countries, or people, especially to help each other or to stop fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Warsaw pact
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华沙条约

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two countries signed a non-aggression pact.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国签署了互不侵犯条约。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a defence pact with the USA
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和美国签署的防御协定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a peace pact between the rebels and the government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军和政府之间的和平协议

Sense.DEF: a thick flat object made of cloth or rubber, used to protect or clean something, or to make something more comfortable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Press on the wound with a large pad of cotton wool.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用大块药棉按住伤口。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Use an abrasive pad for stubborn stains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用百洁布擦洗顽固污渍。

GramExa.GLOSS: a pad that you wear to protect a part of your body when you are playing a sport

Sense.DEF: several sheets of paper fastened together, used for writing or drawing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a box of paints and a sketch pad
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盒颜料和一本速写本

Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep a telephone pad and a pen to hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手边准备一本电话记事簿和一支笔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pad of paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本拍纸簿

Sense.DEF: a piece of flat ground where small aircraft can land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital has built a helicopter pad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家医院建了一块直升机停机坪。

Sense.DEF: the flesh on the bottom of the foot of a cat, dog, etc
someone’s apartment or the room where they live

the leaf of a
water lily
to walk softly and quietly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cat came padding silently back to its home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只猫悄无声息地回家来了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She padded barefoot down the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她光着脚轻轻地下了楼。

Sense.DEF: to fill or cover something with a soft material in order to protect it or make it more comfortable
Sense.TRAN: 给（某物）装衬垫﹔用软物覆盖（某物）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: jackets padded out with a soft cotton filling
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 带柔软夹棉层的外套

Sense.DEF: to dishonestly make bills more expensive than they should be

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the bills of Medicare patients
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虚报医疗保险病人的账目

Sense.DEF: to make a speech or piece of writing longer by adding unnecessary words or details
Sense.TRAN: 〔用多余的话或细节〕拉长〔演讲﹑文章等〕﹐扩充〔某物〕的篇幅
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t pad out your answer to make it seem impressive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要夸夸其谈﹐显得你的回答很高明似的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His autobiography is padded with boring anecdotes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的自传因为加了不少无聊的轶事而拉长了篇幅。

Sense.DEF: filled or covered with a soft material to make it thicker or more comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shoes are padded to protect the foot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双鞋有软垫﹐可以保护脚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a padded headrest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带软垫的头枕

Sense.DEF: a special room in a hospital for people who are mentally ill. The room has thick soft material on the walls so that the person in it cannot get hurt.
Sense.TRAN: 〔精神病院的〕软墙病房﹐软壁小室

Sense.DEF: soft material used to fill or cover something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a helmet with protective padding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有保护衬垫的头盔

Sense.DEF: unnecessary and uninteresting details or words that are added to make a sentence, speech etc longer – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 凑篇幅的词句﹐冗词赘句〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a short pole that is wide and flat at the end, used for moving a small boat in water
when you walk for pleasure without shoes or socks in water that is not very deep
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it’s not too cold, we can go for a paddle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不太冷的话﹐我们可以蹚水玩玩。

Sense.DEF:
a small round flat
bat
with a short handle, used for hitting the ball in
table tennis
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ping-pong paddle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乒乓球拍

Sense.DEF: a tool like a flat spoon, used for mixing food
to move a small light boat through water, using one or more paddles

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I desperately tried to paddle for the shore.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拼命向岸边划去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She and her husband paddled a canoe down the Mississippi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和丈夫划着独木舟沿密西西比河顺流而下。

Sense.DEF: to walk for pleasure without shoes or socks in water that is not very deep
Sense.EXAMPLE: children paddling in the sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在海边蹚水嬉戏的孩子们

Sense.DEF: to swim with short quick movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog was paddling furiously after the ducks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗在水里拼命划水追赶鸭子。

Sense.DEF: to hit a child with a piece of wood as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 用戒尺打〔孩子﹐作为惩罚〕

Sense.DEF: to do things yourself, without help from anyone else
a large old-fashioned boat that moves by using steam to drive a large wheel attached to the side
Sense.TRAN: 明轮船〔由船侧部分露出水面的大轮推动的蒸汽轮船〕

Sense.DEF: a small pool or plastic container of water which is not very deep, for children to play in
a small field in which horses are kept
a piece of ground where horses are brought together before a race so that people can look at them
a field in which rice is grown in water
a state of being angry or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news put Mum in a bit of a paddy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这消息让妈妈大为光火。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for someone from Ireland. Do not use this word.
a police vehicle used to carry prisoners
a lock that you can put on a gate, door, bicycle etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He undid the padlock and eased back the lid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开挂锁﹐轻轻推开箱盖。

Sense.DEF: a priest, especially one in the army
a happy song of praise, thanks, or victory
a man who has sex with a young boy
Sense.TRAN: 〔与男童发生性行为的〕鸡奸者

Sense.DEF: a doctor who deals with children and their illnesses
the area of medicine that deals with children and their illnesses
someone who is sexually attracted to children
a Spanish dish made with rice, pieces of meat, fish, and vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 〔用肉﹑鱼和蔬菜烹制的〕西班牙大锅饭﹐西班牙什锦饭

Sense.DEF: pagan religious beliefs and customs do not belong to any of the main religions of the world, and may come from a time before these religions
Sense.EXAMPLE: ancient pagan temples
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老的异教寺庙

Sense.DEF: someone who believes in a pagan religion
Sense.TRAN: 异教徒﹐非主流宗教的信徒

Sense.DEF: someone with few or no religious beliefs – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 宗教信仰淡薄的人﹔无宗教信仰的人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: one side of a piece of paper in a book, newspaper, document etc, or the sheet of paper itself
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑报纸﹑文件等的〕页﹐面﹔〔纸的〕一张
Sense.EXAMPLE: The full address is given on page 15.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 详细地址见第15页。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will find the answers over the page .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 答案见下页。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 400﹣page novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本400页的小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: We took out a full page advertisement in the ‘Village Voice’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在《村声》上投放了一整版广告。

Sense.DEF: all the writing etc that you can see at one time on a computer screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a web page a single screen of writing, pictures etc on a website
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网页

Sense.DEF: a student or young person who works as a helper to a member of the US Congress
if a group of people are on the same page, they are working well together and have the same aims
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to get environmentalists and businesses on the same page to improve things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要使环境保护主义者和企业同心协力以改善状况。

Subsense.DEF:
a boy who served a
knight
during the Middle Ages as part of his training
Subsense.TRAN: 〔中世纪以服侍骑士作为训练的〕学习骑士

Subsense.DEF:
a
pageboy 2
Subsense.TRAN: 〔酒店﹑俱乐部等的〕侍童 门童﹐青年男侍

Sense.DEF: a boy who in the past served a person of high rank
an important event or period of time
Sense.TRAN: 历史上的一页〔指某重要事件或时期〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I glanced back to the previous page.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我往回扫了一眼前一页。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: See the diagram on the opposite page.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 参见对页图表。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The answers are on the right-hand page.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 答案在右手页上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: （of a newspaper）
the part of a newspaper that deals with sport, art etc
with nothing on it
which has not yet been written on

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I turned the page in order to find out what happened next.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我翻过这一页看接下去发生了什么。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Turn to page 8 for more details.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 详情见第8页。

Collocate.COLLOC: flick/flip/leaf through the pages of sth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: turn them quickly
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 快速翻看［浏览］某物的页面

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be very noticeable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: One mistake jumped off the page.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一页上有个明显错误。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Write your name at the top of the page.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在页面顶端写上姓名。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: See the note at the bottom of page 38.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 参见第38页页末注释。

Sense.DEF:
to call someone’s name out in a public place, especially using a
loudspeaker
, in order to find them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用扩音器在公共场合〕呼叫
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hurried to the reception desk and asked the girl to page her husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她急忙跑到前台﹐请女服务员用广播呼叫她的丈夫。

Sense.DEF:
to send a message to someone’s
pager
asking them to go somewhere or telephone someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was constantly being paged during meetings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开会时接二连三收到传呼。

Sense.DEF: to press a special key on a computer that makes the screen show the page after the one you are reading
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not there, so page down and see if you can find it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不在那儿﹐按下页键找一找。

Sense.DEF: to look at a book, magazine etc by turning the pages quickly
to press a special key on a computer that makes the screen show the page before the one you are reading
an organized public show, often performed outdoors, where people dress in decorated or unusual clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a colourful pageant of Scotland’s past
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重现苏格兰历史的绚丽盛典

Sense.DEF: a public competition for young women in which their appearance, and sometimes other qualities, are compared and judged
a series of historical events that are interesting and important
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pageant of African history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲历史的缤纷长卷

Sense.DEF: impressive ceremonies or events, involving many people wearing special clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔许多人穿着特殊服装的〕盛大庆典﹐盛况

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pageantry of a military ceremony
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事典礼的盛况

Sense.DEF:
a boy who helps the
bride
as part of a wedding ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔婚礼中陪伴新娘的〕男伴童﹐小男傧相

Sense.DEF: a young man who works in a hotel, club etc, delivering messages, carrying bags etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒店﹑俱乐部等的〕侍童﹐门童﹐青年男侍

Sense.DEF:
a woman’s
hairstyle
in which very straight hair is cut shorter at the front than at the back, and turned under at the ends
Sense.TRAN: 娃娃头〔一种发梢向内卷曲的女式直短发〕

Sense.DEF:
to steal a
webpage
and send it to a
search engine
under a different name and address, so that anyone who goes to that webpage is sent straight to a different website, often a
pornographic
website

a small machine you can carry in your pocket that can receive signals from a telephone. It tells you when someone has sent you a message, or wants you to telephone them, for example by making a noise.
the number of people who read a page in a magazine, newspaper etc
the process of giving a number to each page of a book, magazine etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑杂志等的〕页码编定﹐页码标注

Sense.DEF:
a Buddhist
temple religious building
that has several levels with a decorated roof at each level
used to show that you disapprove strongly of something

the past tense and past participle of
pay

Sense.LEXUNIT: a fully paid-up member of sth
Sense.DEF: if someone is a fully paid-up member of a particular group, they strongly support what that group likes or believes in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fully paid-up member of the celebrity circuit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名流圈子里的忠实一员

Sense.DEF: someone who has paid the money needed to be a member of a club, political party etc
Sense.TRAN: 已缴纳会[党]费的会[党]员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The competition is open to all paid-up members of the Women’s Institute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女协会所有已缴纳会费的会员都可以参加该竞赛。

Sense.DEF: a metal or wooden container with a handle, used for carrying liquids
Sense.EXAMPLE: a milk pail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛奶桶

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pail of water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一桶水

Sense.DEF: the amount of liquid a pail will hold
the feeling you have when part of your body hurts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain is getting worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼得越来越厉害了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a sharp pain in her leg.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到腿上一阵剧痛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Greg was in a lot of pain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格疼痛万分。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of unhappiness you have when you are sad, upset etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pain and grief of bereavement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丧亲之痛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hated to say the words, for fear of causing pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不愿说那些话﹐怕伤害了别人。

Variant.LEXVAR: be a pain in the ass/arse/backside/butt

Sense.DEF: to be very annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were times when Joe could be a real pain in the neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候乔真的很讨人嫌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a pain, having to go upstairs to make the coffee every time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次都得上楼去煮咖啡﹐真讨厌。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take/go to (great) pains to do sth
Sense.DEF: to make a special effort to do something
Sense.TRAN: 煞费苦心做某事﹔十分努力地做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s taken great pains to improve his image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他煞费苦心要改善自己的形象。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be at pains to do sth
Sense.DEF: to be especially careful to make sure people understand what you are saying or what you plan to do
Sense.TRAN: 小心翼翼地做某事〔以免别人误解〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roy was at pains to point out that English was the only exam he’d ever failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伊特地说明英语是他唯一曾经考试不及格的科目。

Sense.DEF: as a reward for something you worked to achieve – used especially when this is disappointing
Sense.TRAN: 作为辛劳的报酬〔尤指结果令人失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fetched the file, and all I got for my pains was a dirty look from Simon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去拿来了文件﹐而我得到的回报竟是西蒙厌恶的一瞥。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you can only achieve something, for example become fitter, by suffering or working hard
Sense.TRAN: 不劳无获﹔一分耕耘﹐一分收获

Sense.DEF: at the risk of being killed as punishment, if you do not obey
Sense.EXAMPLE: Communist activity was prohibited on pain of death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去禁止共产主义活动﹐违者处死。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Later that evening, the pain was really bad.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天深夜,疼痛非常剧烈。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I woke up with a terrible pain in my side.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 醒来时我身体一侧疼得很厉害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ever since the accident, Mike’s suffered from severe back pain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 自那次事故之后,迈克一直忍受着背部的剧痛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very severe
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pain in my eye was excruciating.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的眼睛痛得受不了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: short but severe
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She felt a sharp pain in the back of her throat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到喉咙里一阵剧痛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not severe
a slight but continuous pain
felt all the time
pain that you suffer from for long periods of time
a severe pain that goes from one part of your body to another
very severe, as if you have been burnt

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a terrible pain in my stomach.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我胃痛得厉害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The dentist told me that I wouldn’t feel any pain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 牙医跟我说我一点都不会觉得痛的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Despite being in great pain, he managed to call for help.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管忍受着剧痛,他仍设法呼救了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She suffers from chronic pain in her legs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她忍受着腿部慢性疼痛的折磨。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The guards enjoyed inflicting pain on them.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 看守们喜欢给他们施加痛苦。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it less severe
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Exercise can help to relieve lower back pain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼有助于减轻腰痛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that you have a pain in a part of your body
becomes less severe
a drug or treatment that makes pain less severe
their ability to bear pain

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone has a few aches and pains when they get older.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 上了年纪后人人都会有些小病小痛的。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 'big pain'. Say 而要说 terrible pain or 或 severe pain .

Exponent.DEF: the feeling when part of your body hurts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A broken leg can cause a lot of pain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 腿部骨折会产生剧痛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He felt a sharp pain in his chest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到胸口一阵刺痛。

Exponent.DEF: a continuous pain, especially one that is not very bad. Most commonly used in compounds such as headache , toothache , and backache .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔持续的,尤指不十分剧烈的〕疼痛〔多用于构成复合词,如 headache,toothache 和 backache〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt an ache in my back after decorating all day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 装修了一整天,我感到背有点痛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Driving gives me a headache .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 开车让我头痛。

Exponent.DEF: a sudden slight pain that comes and then disappears quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I bent down I felt a twinge in my back.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我俯身时感到背上一阵微痛。

Exponent.DEF: an uncomfortable feeling in your body, or a slight pain
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The procedure takes five minutes and only causes slight discomfort.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个过程为时五分钟,仅有些许不适。

Exponent.DEF: a feeling of great pain, or a situation in which you feel a lot of pain
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the agony of childbirth
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 分娩的剧痛
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was in agony by the time I got to the hospital.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到医院时已痛得很厉害。

Exponent.DEF: continuous physical or mental pain, which makes someone very unhappy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I just wanted someone to put an end to my suffering.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真想有人来结束我的痛苦。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the suffering of the earthquake victims
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震灾民的苦难

Sense.LEXUNIT: it pains sb to do sth formal
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is very difficult and upsetting for someone to have to do something
Sense.TRAN: 某人因不得不做某事而感到苦恼

Sense.DEF: in sport, the point that you reach when you continue trying to do something, even though you are in pain, very tired, or injured
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育运动中〕痛楚[疲劳﹐受伤]的难关
Sense.EXAMPLE: Iona reached the final, but she had to go through the pain barrier to get there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾奥娜进入了决赛﹐不过她是克服伤痛才走到这一步的。

Sense.DEF: someone’s expression, voice etc that shows they are worried, upset, or slightly annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 痛苦的表情/神色/声音等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat stiffly, with a pained expression on his face .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他僵坐在那里﹐脸上带着痛苦的表情。

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body is painful, it hurts
Sense.EXAMPLE: stiff painful joints
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 僵硬疼痛的关节
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is your arm very painful?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的手臂很疼吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The neck becomes swollen and painful to the touch hurts when you touch it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脖子肿起来了﹐一碰就疼。

Sense.DEF: making you feel very upset, or very difficult and unpleasant for you
Sense.TRAN: 令人痛苦[难受]的﹔困难的﹐令人不快的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sobbed as he recalled the painful memory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 回想起那段痛苦的往事﹐他啜泣起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Venice was a painful reminder of her marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尼斯是个伤心地﹐让她回想起自己的婚姻。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He and his wife took the painful decision to switch off their son’s life support machine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和妻子痛苦地决定切断儿子的生命维持器。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the long and painful process of growing up
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 漫长而艰难的成长历程

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It can be painful to leave the house in which you were born.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开自己出生的房子会很痛苦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The divorce was painful for both of us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚让我俩都感到痛苦。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even hearing his name was painful to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至连听到他的名字都让她觉得痛苦。

Sense.DEF: causing physical pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: a painful blow on the head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头部遭到的疼痛一击

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an excruciatingly painful death
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其痛苦的死亡

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was finding it painful to breathe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现呼吸的时候很痛苦。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s behaviour or a performance is painful, it is so bad that it embarrasses people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s painful to watch her making the best of a terrible script.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看着她尽全力去演好那个蹩脚剧本﹐真是令人心痛。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use painful to mean ‘feeling pain’. 想表达感到疼痛的意思时﹐不要用painful: He didn’t feel much pain (NOT 不说 feel very painful) at first! 起初他并没有觉得很疼！

Section.SECHEADING: WHEN A PART OF YOUR BODY HURTS 身体某部位疼痛

Exponent.DEF: used for describing a part of the body that hurts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her leg is still painful where she broke it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她腿上骨折的地方仍然很痛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: painful joints
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛的关节

Exponent.DEF: painful when touched
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The skin around the wound is very tender.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤口周围的皮肤一碰就痛。

Exponent.DEF: painful and difficult to move
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a stiff neck.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脖子发僵。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her body was stiff from sitting in the car for so long.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在汽车里坐了这么久,身体都僵硬了。

Exponent.DEF: painful as a result of a wound, infection, or too much exercise
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因受伤﹑感染﹑运动过度而〕疼痛的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: sore muscles
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酸痛的肌肉
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sore throat
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 喉咙痛
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The wound was sore and red.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤口红肿疼痛。

Sense.DEF: very – used to emphasize a bad or harmful quality that someone or something has
Sense.TRAN: 非常地〔用于强调不好或有害的特性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: painfully thin arms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其纤细的手臂
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a teenager, I was painfully shy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十几岁的时候非常害羞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road to peace is a painfully slow process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平之路是个很漫长的过程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are only too painfully aware of the damage his actions have caused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们非常清楚他的行为所造成的损害。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was painfully obvious he’d rather not see her again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很显然﹐他不愿意再见到她。

Sense.DEF: with pain or causing pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robyn swallowed painfully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗宾痛苦地吞咽着。

Sense.DEF: needing a lot of effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the knowledge that he had so painfully acquired
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他艰难学到的所有知识

Sense.DEF: a medicine which reduces or removes pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overdose of painkillers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过量止痛药

Sense.DEF: able to reduce or remove pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: painkilling drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 止痛药

Sense.DEF: causing no pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: a painless death
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无痛死亡

Sense.DEF: not difficult or unpleasant to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train is a quick and painless way to travel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车是一种快捷轻松的旅行方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interview was relatively painless .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试相对容易。

Sense.DEF: very careful and thorough
Sense.TRAN: 小心的﹔费尽心思的﹔精心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work had been done with painstaking attention to detail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作被一丝不苟地完成了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris described in painstaking detail what had happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯非常详细地描述了所发生的事情。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The old painting was painstakingly restored.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅旧画被精心地修复了。

Sense.DEF: a liquid that you put on a surface, using a brush to make the surface a particular colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a can of blue paint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一罐蓝色油漆
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wet Paint used as a warning on signs when something has just been painted
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆未干
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole house could do with a fresh coat of paint .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整座房子该重新粉刷一次了。

GramExa.GLOSS: old paint that is starting to come off the surface

Sense.EXAMPLE: All this room needs is a lick of paint paint used to make a place more attractive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个房间只要刷上点涂料就行。

Sense.DEF: tubes or dry blocks of a coloured substance, used for painting pictures
Sense.EXAMPLE: acrylic and oil paints
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丙烯酸颜料和油画颜料

Sense.DEF: to put paint on a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ceiling needs painting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天花板需要粉刷了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: brightly paintedhouses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粉刷得很亮丽的房屋

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We painted the door blue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把门漆成了蓝色。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paint the walls in a contrasting colour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用对比色粉刷墙壁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The living room was painted in pastel shades of pink and blue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起居室被漆成淡雅的粉色和蓝色。

Sense.DEF: to make a picture, design etc using paint
Sense.EXAMPLE: A white cross was painted on the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门上画着白十字架。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turner is famous for painting landscapes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特纳以风景画闻名。

GramExa.GLOSS: paint using a particular type of paint
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He paints mainly in acrylics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他主要用丙烯酸颜料作画。

Sense.DEF: to put a coloured substance on part of your face or body to make it different or more attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children’s faces were painted to look like animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们的脸被涂成动物的模样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d painted her toenails with red nail polish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把红色指甲油涂在自己的脚指甲上。

Sense.DEF: to describe someone or something in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s often been painted as a tough businesswoman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经常被描述成商界女强人。

GramExa.PROPFORM: paint a grim/rosy/gloomy picture of sb/sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dickens painted a grim picture of Victorian life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狄更斯描绘了一幅暗淡的维多利亚时代生活图景。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The article painted him in a bad light described him in a way that made him seem bad .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章把他写得很坏。

Sense.DEF: to go out to bars, clubs etc to enjoy yourself
Sense.TRAN: 〔到酒吧﹑夜总会等处〕花天酒地﹐寻欢作乐

Crossrefto.REFLEX: not be as black as you are painted

Sense.DEF: to cover part of a picture or sign with paint so that it can no longer be seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The name of the firm had been partially painted out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的名称有一部分被油漆盖住了。

Sense.DEF: to cover a picture or surface with new paint
Sense.TRAN: 用新的颜料[涂料]覆盖…的画面[表面]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much of the original decoration was painted over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原来的装饰图案大部分被新的涂料覆盖了。

Sense.DEF: a game in which you shoot small containers of paint at people
a small box containing dry paint that you mix with water
a brush for spreading paint on a surface
someone who paints pictures
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gerry’s ambition was to become a portrait painter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里的志向是成为一名肖像画家。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is painting houses or other buildings
typical of painters or painting
Sense.EXAMPLE: painterly images
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绘画形象

PIC.HEADING: PAINTINGS 绘画
PIC.PICCONTENT: abstract 抽象画；landscape 风景画；still life 静物画；portrait 肖像画

Sense.DEF: a painted picture that you put on a wall for people to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of valuable paintings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批珍贵的画作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a large painting of his father on the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上有一张他父亲的大幅肖像画。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you help me hang this painting put it on a wall ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮我把这幅画挂起来好吗？

Sense.DEF: the act or skill of making a picture, using paints
Sense.EXAMPLE: Degas’ style of painting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德加的绘画风格
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Cubist school of painting a particular style used by a group of people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立体画派

Sense.DEF: the work of covering a wall, house etc with paint
if a car has a paint job, it is painted again
Sense.EXAMPLE: old cars that are given a quick paint job before being sold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售前匆匆漆过的旧车

Sense.DEF: a powerful chemical substance used to remove paint from walls, doors etc
paint on a car, house etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She noticed the peeling paintwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她注意到了剥落的油漆。

Sense.DEF: an object that is made from two similar parts that are joined together
Sense.TRAN: 〔由连在一起的相似两部分构成的〕一副﹐一把﹐一条

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two pairs of jeans
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两条牛仔裤
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pair of black tights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条黑色裤袜

Sense.DEF: two things of the same type that are used together
Sense.TRAN: 〔由两个一起使用的同类东西组成的〕一双﹐一对

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new pair of sandals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双新凉鞋

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt as if every pair of eyes in the room was on her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得似乎屋里的每一双眼睛都在注视自己。

Sense.EXAMPLE: earrings, £5 a pair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耳环﹐5英镑一副
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of skis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副滑雪板
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have five pairs of free tickets to give away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有五套双人票要免费送出。

Sense.DEF: in groups of two
Sense.TRAN: 两个一组地﹐成对地﹐成双地
Sense.EXAMPLE: We worked in pairs for the role-play exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们两个一组地进行角色扮演练习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leaves of the tree are arranged in pairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种树的叶子是成对生长的。

Sense.DEF: two people who are standing or doing something together, or who have some type of connection with each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔一起做某事或相互关联的〕两个（人）﹐一对
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pair are looking for sponsorship from local businesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两人正在寻求当地企业的赞助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pair of dancers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对舞伴

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use pair to talk about a husband and wife (or two people in a similar relationship). Use couple. 指夫妇俩或者是两个有类似关系的人时﹐不要用pair而要用couple: They’re a nice couple (NOT 不说 pair). 他们是很美满的一对。

Sense.DEF: used when you are angry or annoyed with two people
Sense.TRAN: 你们/他们两个 〔用于生气或厌烦时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, get out, the pair of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哦﹐滚出去﹐你们两个。

Subsense.DEF:
a male and a female animal that come together in order to
breed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pair of doves
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对鸽子

Subsense.EXAMPLE: a breeding pair
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交配的一对

Subsense.DEF: two horses that work together

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’ve only got one pair of hands
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are busy and cannot do any more than you are already doing
Sense.TRAN: 我只有一双手〔意指在忙着﹐干不了更多的工作〕

Sense.DEF: someone who helps you do something when you are busy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having an extra pair of hands during busy periods can take the pressure off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁忙时段多一个帮手可以减轻压力。

Sense.DEF: someone you can trust and depend on because they are sensible – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 可靠的人〔尤用于新闻报道中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colleagues regard him as a safe pair of hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同事们认为他办事可靠。

Sense.DEF: to put people or things into groups of two, or to form groups of two

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were each paired with a newcomer to help with training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都和一名新手组对﹐帮助他们训练。

Sense.DEF:
if animals pair, they come together in order to
breed
to come together or bring two people together to have a romantic relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the others were pairing off and I was left on my own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他人都出双入对﹐就剩我形单影只。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My aunt was forever pairing me off with unsuitable men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姨妈总想把我和不适合的男人配成一对。

Sense.DEF: to become friends and start to have a relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: We learned later that he and Tanya had paired up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们后来得知﹐他和塔尼娅交往了。

Sense.DEF: to work together to do something or to put two people together to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They first paired up in the screen adaptation of ‘Grease’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们首次合作是在电影改编版的《火爆浪子》中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have paired up writers and artists, and commissioned linked works.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把作家和画家结成搭档﹐委托创作相关作品。

Sense.DEF:
if animals pair up, they come together in order to
breed
a pattern consisting of curved shapes used on cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paisley shawl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩斯利花纹披肩

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
pyjamas

a green vegetable similar to
cabbage
that is used in Chinese cooking
a very offensive word for someone from Pakistan or India. Do not use this word.
relating to Pakistan or its people
Sense.TRAN: 巴基斯坦的﹔巴基斯坦人的

Sense.DEF: someone from Pakistan
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 20-year-old Pakistani
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个20岁的巴基斯坦人

Sense.DEF: a close friend
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been pals since we were at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们上学的时候就是好朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old pal a friend you have had for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老朋友

Sense.DEF: used to speak to a man in an unfriendly way
Sense.TRAN: 老兄﹐小子〔对男性不友好的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, pal, I don’t want you hanging around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐小子﹐我不许你在这儿闲逛。

Sense.DEF: if you pal around with someone, you do things together as friends

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was nice having someone to pal around with.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人做伴真好。

Sense.DEF: to become someone’s friend

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She palled up with Neil while travelling round Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在欧洲旅游的时候她和尼尔成了朋友。

Sense.DEF: the official home of a person of very high rank, especially a king or queen – often used in names
Sense.TRAN: 王宫﹔宫殿﹔〔官位极高者的〕府邸〔常用于名称中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buckingham Palace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白金汉宫

Sense.DEF: the people who live in a palace – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 住在王宫里的人﹔王室〔用于新闻报道中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Palace has announced that the Duke and Duchess are to separate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室宣布公爵和公爵夫人即将分居。

Sense.DEF: a large beautifully decorated house
Sense.TRAN: 富丽堂皇的大房子﹐豪宅
Sense.EXAMPLE: the splendid palaces of Florence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗伦萨的豪宅

Sense.DEF: a situation in which the people who work for a leader take control and remove that leader’s power
Sense.EXAMPLE: He deposed his father in a palace coup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一场宫廷政变中废黜了自己的父亲。

Sense.DEF:
a
knight a soldier of high rank
in the Middle Ages who was very brave and loyal

a British spelling of
paleo-

a British spelling of
paleolithic

a British spelling of
paleontology

belonging or relating to the period of time in the Earth’s history, from about 570 million years ago to about 245 million years ago, when fish, insects,
reptile s
and some plants first started to exist
Sense.TRAN: 古生代的〔古生代距今约5.7亿到2.45亿年﹐当时地球上鱼﹑昆虫﹑爬行动物及一些植物开始出现〕

Sense.DEF: palatable food or drink has a pleasant or acceptable taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very palatable wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口感极佳的酒

Sense.DEF: an idea, suggestion etc that is palatable is acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 〔主意﹑建议等〕合意的﹐可接受的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They changed the wording of the advertisement to make it more palatable to women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们修改了广告的用词﹐使之更受女性欢迎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The truth, as always, is slightly less palatable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真相总是有点让人难以接受。

Sense.DEF:
the
roof top inside part
of your mouth
the sense of taste, and especially your ability to enjoy or judge food
Sense.EXAMPLE: It tasted very strange, at least to my untrained palate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这东西尝起来怪怪的﹐至少对于我这未经训练的味觉来说是如此。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of dishes to tempt your palate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人胃口大开的一系列菜肴

Sense.DEF: a palatial building etc is large and beautifully decorated
Sense.TRAN: 豪华的﹐富丽堂皇的﹐宫殿似的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a palatial country residence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富丽堂皇的乡村住宅

Sense.DEF: in the past, an area which was controlled by someone who represented the ruler
unnecessary trouble and anxiety that makes something seem more important than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could have done without all this palaver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们本可以不那么麻烦的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a palaver over nothing!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是白忙一场啊！

Sense.DEF: having a skin colour that is very white, or whiter than it usually is
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked very pale and drawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去非常苍白憔悴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suddenly went pale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然脸色煞白。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sharon went deathly pale and looked as if she might faint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎伦脸色变得惨白﹐好像要晕倒似的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an elderly, pale-faced woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位脸色苍白的老太太

Sense.DEF: a pale colour has more white in it than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: pale blue curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡蓝色的窗帘

Sense.DEF: pale light is not bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pale gray dawn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幽暗的黎明

Sense.DEF: something that is similar to, but not as good as, something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cheese is a pale imitation of real Parmesan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种干酪是帕尔梅森干酪的仿制品﹐但味道要差一些。

Sense.DEF: if your face pales, it becomes whiter than usual because you have had a shock
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kent’s face paled when he saw that Rob had a knife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯特看到罗布拿着把刀子﹐顿时面无血色。

Sense.DEF: to seem much less important when compared to something bigger, worse, more serious etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The amounts of money involved pale into insignificance when compared with the sums spent each year on research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及的金额与每年花在研究上的费用相比就是沧海一粟。

Sense.DEF: to seem small or unimportant compared to something else
Sense.TRAN: 相比之下微不足道﹐相形失色

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today’s economic problems pale in comparison with those of the 1930s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的经济问题和20世纪30年代的相比是小巫见大巫。

Sense.DEF: offensive or unacceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: His opinions are entirely beyond the pale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点让人根本无法接受。

Sense.DEF: a type of light-coloured beer that is sold in bottles
relating to very ancient times

relating to the
stone age the period of time thousands of years ago when people used stone tools and weapons
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paleolithic axe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧石器时代的石斧

Sense.DEF:
the study of
fossil s ancient bones, plants etc that have been preserved in rock
a thin curved board that an artist uses to mix paints, holding it by putting his or her thumb through a hole at the edge
the colours that a particular artist uses or the colours in a particular painting
Sense.TRAN: 〔画家或一幅画所用的〕一组颜色

Sense.DEF: the choice of colours or shapes that are available in a computer program
a knife that bends easily and is not sharp, used for spreading a substance, for example in cooking or painting
Sense.TRAN: 〔烹调用的〕圆头刀﹔〔画家用的〕调色刀﹐画刀

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that a law court orders someone to pay regularly to a former partner that they were living with but were not married to
Sense.TRAN: 〔非婚同居者分手后一方被判付给另一方的〕生活费

Sense.DEF: an ancient document on which the original writing has been covered over with new writing
Sense.TRAN: 〔古时原有文字被新内容覆盖的〕再生羊皮纸卷

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase such as ‘deed’ or ‘level’, which is the same when you spell it backwards
Sense.TRAN: 回文〔指顺读和倒读都一样的词或短语﹐如deed或level〕

Sense.DEF: a wooden or metal post that is pointed at the top, or a fence made of these posts
Sense.TRAN: 尖木桩﹔尖铁条﹔尖桩围栏
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new paling had been erected around the yard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 院子周边竖起了新的尖桩围栏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: iron palings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁尖桩

Sense.DEF: a strong fence made of pointed posts
a line of high straight cliffs, especially beside water
if something palls, it becomes less interesting or enjoyable because you have experienced it before
Sense.TRAN: 〔因体验过而〕失去吸引力﹐令人发腻
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gradually, the novelty of city life began to pall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渐渐地﹐城市生活的新鲜感开始消失了。

Sense.DEF: a thick dark cloud of smoke, dust etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A pall of thick grey smoke hung over the buildings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些建筑物的上空笼罩着厚厚一层灰色的烟幕。

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant quality that seems to be in a place or situation
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的阴影[不好气氛]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is enveloped in a pall of neglect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个地区笼罩在一片荒凉的气氛中。

Sense.DEF:
a cloth used to cover a
coffin a box containing a dead body
a soft silver-white metal that is often combined with gold and silver, and used to cover an object with a very thin layer of metal. It is a chemical element: symbol Pd
Sense.TRAN: 钯〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Pd〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who helps to carry a
coffin
at a funeral
Sense.TRAN: 〔葬礼中的〕护柩者﹐扶灵人﹐抬棺者

Sense.DEF: a large frame, used for storing or carrying heavy things
Sense.TRAN: 〔供储存或搬运重物用的〕托板﹐运货板
Sense.EXAMPLE: wooden pallets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木制托板

Sense.DEF:
a rough cloth bag filled with
straw
, used in the past for sleeping on
to reduce the effects of illness, pain etc without curing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chosen carefully, the oils may not only palliate but also cure the condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果仔细挑选﹐挑到的精油不仅可以缓和症状﹐还可以治愈疾病。

Sense.DEF: something done to make a bad situation seem better, but which does not solve the problem
Sense.TRAN: 权宜之计﹐治标不治本的方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: short-term economic palliatives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济上短期的权宜之计

Sense.DEF: a medical treatment that will not cure an illness but will reduce the pain
very pale, especially in a way that looks weak or unhealthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: pallid cheeks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苍白的脸颊

Sense.DEF: not very interesting
Sense.TRAN: 乏味的﹐无趣的﹔无生气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pallid performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乏味的演出

Sense.DEF: when someone’s skin is very pale in a way that makes them look weak or unhealthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sleepless night had added to her pallor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一夜未眠﹐她的脸色更加苍白。

Sense.DEF: very friendly with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s pally with Steven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和史蒂文很要好。

Sense.DEF: the inside surface of your hand, in which you hold things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She looked at the coins in her palm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看了看手中的硬币。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He held the pebble in the palm of his hand .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把那颗卵石握在手心里。

Sense.DEF: a tropical tree which grows near beaches or in deserts, with a long straight trunk and large pointed leaves at the top
Sense.EXAMPLE: coconut palms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 椰子树

Sense.LEXUNIT: hold/have sb in the palm of your hand
Sense.DEF: to have a strong influence on someone, so that they do what you want them to do
Sense.TRAN: 把某人攥在手心里﹐完全操纵[控制]某人

Sense.DEF: to tell someone what is going to happen to them in the future by looking at the lines on their hand
to hide something in the palm of your hand, especially when you are performing a magic trick or stealing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指变戏法或偷东西时〕把…藏在手心里[藏于手中]

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to accept or buy something that is not of good quality or is not the thing that they really want
Sense.TRAN: 哄骗某人接受…﹐把…骗卖给

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tried to palm off his old books onto me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想哄我买下他的旧书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dealers sometimes palm off fakes as genuine works of art.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候艺术品经销商会把赝品充当真品来卖。

Sense.DEF: to give someone an explanation that is not true but that you hope they will accept
Sense.TRAN: 〔借口某事〕欺骗搪塞某人﹐骗过某人

Sense.DEF: a small video camera that you can hold in your hand
Sense.TRAN: 掌上摄像机﹐手提摄像机

Sense.DEF: someone who claims they can tell what will happen to a person by looking at the lines on the palm of their hand
the art of looking at the palm of a person’s hand to tell what will happen to them in the future

the oil obtained from the nut of an African
palm tree

a
mobile phone
which is also a small computer that can store information, send emails, or connect you to the Internet

a
palmist
a palm-sized computer, PC etc is small enough to fit in your hand
Sense.TRAN: 掌上电脑/个人计算机/个人数字助理

Sense.DEF: the Sunday before Easter in the Christian Church
Sense.TRAN: 棕枝主日﹐圣枝主日〔基督教中复活节前的星期日〕

Sense.DEF: a very small computer that you can hold in your hand
a tropical tree which grows near beaches or in deserts, with a long straight trunk and large pointed leaves at the top

a horse that is a golden or cream colour, with a white
mane
and tail
Sense.TRAN: 帕洛米诺马〔体毛呈金黄或奶白色﹐鬃毛和尾毛为白色〕

Sense.DEF: a feeling that is palpable is so strong that other people notice it and can feel it around them
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a palpable sense of relief among the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 众人显然都感到如释重负。

Sense.DEF: complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: What he said is palpable nonsense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全是胡说八道。

Sense.DEF: to touch part of someone’s body in order to examine it
if your heart palpitates, it beats quickly in an irregular way
Sense.TRAN: 〔心脏〕急速而不规则地跳动﹐悸动

Sense.DEF: if you have palpitations, your heart beats quickly in an irregular way
an illness that makes your arms and legs shake because you cannot control your muscles
very friendly with someone – used especially when you disapprove of this
Sense.TRAN: 亲密的﹐友好的〔尤含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a paltry amount of something is too small to be useful or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: paltry sum of money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微不足道的一点钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received only a paltry £25 a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每天只能拿到可怜的25英镑。

Sense.DEF: unimportant or worthless
Sense.EXAMPLE: paltry issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不重要的议题

Sense.DEF: the large flat areas of land covered with grass in some parts of South America
Sense.TRAN: 〔南美的〕潘帕斯草原﹐无树大草原

Sense.DEF: a type of tall grass with silver-white feathery flowers
to look after someone very kindly, for example by giving them the things that they want and making them feel warm and comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spent her childhood as the pampered daughter of a wealthy family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出身于一个富裕家庭﹐从小娇生惯养。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pamper yourself with a stay in one of our luxury hotels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到我们的豪华酒店来尽情享受一次吧。

Sense.DEF: a very thin book with paper covers, that gives information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a political pamphlet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治宣传册

Sense.DEF: someone who writes pamphlets giving political opinions
Sense.TRAN: 〔表达政治见解的〕小册子作者

PIC.HEADING: PANS 锅；盘
PIC.PICCONTENT: wok 铁锅；roasting pan AmE【美】/roasting tin BrE【英】烤盘；cake pan AmE 【美】/cake tin BrE 【英】蛋糕烤盘；lid 锅盖；handle 手柄；saucepan 深平底锅；frying pan 煎锅；casserole 炖锅；griddle 平底铁锅

Sense.DEF: a round metal container that you use for cooking, usually with one long handle and a lid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a frying pan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炒锅
Sense.EXAMPLE: pots and pans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锅碗瓢盆
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cook the pasta in a large pan of boiling water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把意大利面放在一大锅开水里煮。

Sense.DEF: a metal container for baking things in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cake pan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕烤盘

Sense.DEF: a wide, usually round, open container with low sides, used for holding liquids
the bowl of a toilet
to be wasted or become useless or ruined
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business is rapidly going down the pan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意每况愈下。

Sense.DEF: to strongly criticize a film, play etc in a newspaper or on television or radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔在报纸﹑电视或广播上〕严厉批评〔电影﹑戏剧等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie was panned by the critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影遭到了评论家的猛烈批评。

Subsense.DEF: if a film or television camera pans in a particular direction, it moves in that direction and follows the thing that is being filmed
Subsense.TRAN: 〔拍摄电影或电视时摄影机〕摇摄﹐摇动拍摄
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The camera panned slowly across the crowd.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影机镜头慢慢扫过人群。

Subsense.DEF: to move a camera in this way

Sense.DEF: to wash soil in a metal container in order to separate gold from other substances

GramExa.EXAMPLE: panning for gold in Alaska
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在阿拉斯加淘金

Sense.DEF: to happen or develop in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to see how things pan out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得看看事情如何发展。

Sense.DEF: including all people
Sense.EXAMPLE: pan-African unity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泛非团结

Sense.DEF: something that people think will make everything better and solve all their problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔解决所有问题的〕万应灵丹﹐万全之策

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no panacea for the country’s economic problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决该国经济问题没有万应灵丹。

Sense.DEF: a way of doing things that makes them seem easy and exciting, and makes other people admire you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They played and sang with great panache.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们潇洒地边弹边唱。

Sense.DEF:
a light hat for men, made from
straw
a thin flat round cake made from flour, milk, and eggs, that has been cooked in a flat pan and is eaten hot

very thick
make-up
for your face, that is worn especially by actors

shrove tuesday
, when people in Britain traditionally eat pancakes
Sense.TRAN: 薄煎饼日〔即忏悔星期二﹐在英国按传统吃薄煎饼〕

Sense.DEF:
a
gland
inside your body, near your stomach, that produces
insulin
and a liquid that helps your body to use the food that you eat
a large black and white animal that looks like a bear and lives in the mountains of China
a small animal with red-brown fur and a long tail that lives in the southeastern Himalayas
Sense.TRAN: 〔产于喜马拉雅山脉东南部的〕小熊猫﹐小猫熊

Sense.DEF: a small black and white police car
Sense.TRAN: 〔车身为黑白两色的〕巡逻警车

Sense.DEF: a disease that affects people over a very large area or the whole world
a situation in which there is a lot of noise because people are angry, confused or frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔人们因感到愤怒﹑迷惑或恐惧而引起的〕大混乱﹐嘈杂﹐骚乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was complete pandemonium in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里乱哄哄的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the verdict was read pandemonium broke out in the courtroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣判的时候法庭上乱成一团。

Sense.DEF: to give someone anything they want in order to please them, even if it seems unreasonable or unnecessary – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some newspapers feel they have to pander to the prejudices of their readers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些报纸觉得必须迎合读者的偏见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Highly trained staff will pander to your every whim .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 训练有素的员工会满足你的一切心血来潮。

Sense.DEF: to do or start something that will cause a lot of other problems
Sense.TRAN: 打开潘多拉的盒子﹐引发种种祸患
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report could open up a Pandora’s box of claims from similar cases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇报导可能会开启潘多拉魔盒﹐引发类似事例的索赔。

Sense.DEF: a piece of glass used in a window or door
Sense.EXAMPLE: a window pane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块窗玻璃
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pane of glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块玻璃

Sense.DEF: a speech or piece of writing that praises someone or something a lot

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词

Subsense.DEF:
a group of people with skills or
specialist
knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject
Subsense.TRAN: 〔由选定人员组成的〕专家咨询组

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A panel of experts has looked at the proposal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组专家审核了那项提议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There will be at least three senior doctors on the panel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家小组中至少有三名资深医生。

Subsense.DEF: a group of well-known people who answer questions on a radio or television programme
Subsense.TRAN: 〔由知名人士组成的在广播或电视节目中回答问题的〕答问小组

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have two senior politicians on our panel tonight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚参加讨论的有两位资深政界人士。

Subsense.DEF: a group of people who are chosen to listen to a case in a court of law and to decide the result
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The panel spent 14 hours going over the evidence.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团用14个小时审核了证据。

Subsense.DEF: a flat piece of wood, glass etc with straight sides, which forms part of a door, wall, fence etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔门﹑墙﹑栅栏等的〕镶板﹐嵌板﹔窗玻璃片
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a stained glass panel
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块彩色镶嵌玻璃
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There were a few panels missing from the fence.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 栅栏上有几根板条不见了。

Subsense.DEF: a piece of metal that forms part of the outer structure of a vehicle
Subsense.EXAMPLE: One of the door panels was badly damaged and had to be replaced.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块车门板严重损坏﹐必须更换。

Subsense.DEF: a piece of material that forms part of a piece of clothing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a skirt made in six panels
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由六块裙片拼成的裙子

Sense.DEF: a board in a car, plane, boat etc that has the controls on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑飞机﹑船等的〕仪表板/控制面板

Sense.DEF: a thin board with a picture painted on it
covered or decorated with flat pieces of wood

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The walls were panelled with oak.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙壁上都镶着橡木板。

Sense.DEF: long or square pieces of wood that are used to cover and decorate walls
one of a group of well-known people who answer questions on a radio or television programme
Sense.TRAN: 答问小组成员〔在广播或电视节目中回答问题的一组知名人士之一〕

Sense.DEF: a short thin nail that is used for fastening thin pieces of wood together
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来把薄木板钉在一起的短而细的〕镶板钉

Sense.DEF: a small motor vehicle used for delivering goods
a sudden feeling of pain, sadness etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a sudden pang of guilt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵罪恶感突然涌上她的心头。

Sense.DEF: a long, thin area of land that sticks out from a larger area
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Texas panhandle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得克萨斯锅柄地带

Sense.DEF: to ask for money in the streets
Sense.EXAMPLE: homeless people panhandling in the subway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在地铁里行乞的无家可归者

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong feeling of fear or nervousness that makes you unable to think clearly or behave sensibly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children fled in panic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们惊慌地逃走了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a feeling of sheer panic complete panic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 惊恐万分的感觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got into a panic when she couldn’t find the tickets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她找不到票﹐慌了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole nation is in a state of panic following the attacks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击过后整个国家一片恐慌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She suffers from terrible panic attacks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她时常会出现一阵极度慌乱之感。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people are suddenly made very anxious, and make quick decisions without thinking carefully

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recent panic over the safety of baby milk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近对婴儿奶粉安全性的恐慌

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wave of panic selling in Hong Kong
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 香港的恐慌性抛售浪潮

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you have a lot to do and not much time to do it in
Sense.EXAMPLE: the usual last minute panic just before the deadline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照例事到临头手忙脚乱

Sense.DEF: a situation in which everyone is busy and anxious because something needs to be done urgently
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was panic stations here on Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五这里是一片忙乱。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly feel so frightened that you cannot think clearly or behave sensibly, or to make someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started to panic when he saw the gun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看见枪就慌了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t panic! We’ll soon get you out of there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别慌！我们马上就把你从那儿弄出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The protests became more violent and many people were panicked into leaving the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议变得更加激烈﹐吓得许多人离开了那个国家。

Sense.DEF: a button that you can press to call for help if you are being attacked
to do something quickly without thinking enough about it, because something unexpected or dangerous has suddenly happened
Sense.TRAN: 惊慌失措﹐在紧急情况下慌乱行事

Sense.DEF: very nervous and anxious
Sense.EXAMPLE: By ten o’clock she was starting to get a bit panicky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了十点她开始有点不安起来。

Sense.DEF: so frightened that you cannot think clearly or behave sensibly
Sense.TRAN: 惊慌失措的﹐恐慌万分的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy suddenly looked panic-stricken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西突然显得惊恐万状。

Sense.DEF: one of a pair of baskets or bags that you carry one on each side of an animal or a bicycle
Sense.TRAN: 〔挂在动物背上或自行车两边的〕驮篮﹐挂篮﹐挂包

Sense.DEF: a basket in which someone carries a load on their back
an impressive show of special clothes, decorations etc, especially at an important ceremony

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a glorious panoply of colours
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五彩缤纷的壮丽场面

Sense.DEF: a large number of people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a panoply of men in grey suits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大批穿灰色西装的男子

GramExa.GLOSS: the whole range of something

Sense.DEF: an impressive view of a wide area of land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tower offers a panorama of the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从塔上可以一览城市的全貌。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a breathtaking panorama of mountains
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 群山的雄伟景观

Sense.DEF: a description or series of pictures that shows all the features of a subject, historical period etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a panorama of life in England 400 years ago
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 400年前英格兰生活的全景图

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a panoramic view of the valley

Sense.DEF: a simple musical instrument made of short wooden pipes of different lengths, that you play by blowing across their open ends
a small garden plant with brightly coloured flowers
not polite an offensive word for a man who seems weak and too much like a woman
Sense.TRAN: 脂粉气的男子﹐娘娘腔的男人

Sense.DEF: to breathe quickly with short noisy breaths, for example because you have been running or because it is very hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came in panting after running up the steps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跑上台阶﹐气喘吁吁地走了进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was panting for breath .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上气不接下气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog lay panting on the doorstep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗躺在门阶上喘着气。

Sense.DEF: to say something while you are panting
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I can’t run any farther,’ she panted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她气喘吁吁地说:“我跑不动了。”

Sense.DEF: to want something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came in panting for a cup of tea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走了进来﹐急着想喝杯茶。

Sense.DEF: long trousers with wide legs, that become tight at the bottom of your legs

a
removal van
the religious idea that God and the universe are one thing and that God is present in all natural things
all the gods of a particular people or nation
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一民族或国家所信奉的〕诸神﹐众神
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Roman pantheon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马众神

Sense.DEF: a group of famous and important people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a leading figure in the pantheon of 20th-century artists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪艺术名流的领军人物

Sense.DEF: a religious building that is built in honour of all gods
a large wild animal that is black and a member of the cat family

a
cougar
a piece of women’s underwear that covers the area between their waist and the top of their legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of lacy panties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条蕾丝女式内裤

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
pantyhose

a curved
tile
used for covering a roof
pantomime
an instrument used to make a smaller or larger exact copy of a drawing, plan etc
a thing on top of an electric train which takes electric power from an electric power line above it
Sense.TRAN: 〔电气列车顶上的〕导电弓架﹐受电弓

Sense.DEF: a type of play for children that is performed in Britain around Christmas, in which traditional stories are performed with jokes, music, and songs
Sense.TRAN: 童话剧〔英国在圣诞节前后演出﹐用笑话﹑音乐和歌曲演绎传统故事〕

Sense.DEF: a method of performing using only actions and not words, or a play performed using this method
Sense.TRAN: 哑剧[默剧]表演艺术﹔哑剧﹐默剧

Sense.DEF: a situation or behaviour that is silly
a very small room in a house where food is kept
a piece of clothing that covers you from your waist to your feet and has a separate part for each leg
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing dark blue pants and a white sweater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着深蓝色长裤和白色毛衣。

Sense.DEF: a piece of underwear that covers the area between your waist and the top of your legs

Sense.LEXUNIT: bore/scare etc the pants off sb
Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very bored, very frightened etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always bores the pants off me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是让我厌烦透顶。

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone very easily in a game or competition

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb puts his pants on one leg at a time
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is just like everyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go on, ask him for his autograph - he puts his pants on one leg at a time just like you do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去吧﹐跟他要一个签名——他和你一样﹐没什么特别的。

Sense.DEF: since someone was a very young boy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve known Eric since he was in short pants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克很小的时候我就认识他了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: do sth by the seat of your pants
catch sb with their pants down

Sense.DEF: very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The concert was pants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场音乐会糟透了。

Sense.DEF: a woman’s suit consisting of a jacket and matching trousers
a very thin piece of women’s clothing that covers their legs from the toes to the waist and is usually worn with dresses or skirts

a very thin
sanitary pad
films, programmes, books etc that are badly made or badly written, are intended for entertainment only, and have no serious value
Sense.TRAN: 〔无甚价值的〕消遣性电影[电视节目﹐书籍等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hollywood produces a lot of pap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞制作出大量低俗电影。

Sense.DEF: very soft food that does not have a strong taste, like the food that babies eat
Sense.TRAN: 软食﹐半流质食物〔类似婴儿食品〕

Sense.DEF:
if a famous person is papped, one of the
paparazzi
takes a photograph of them without asking them, for a newspaper or magazine
Sense.EXAMPLE: The singer was papped coming out of a nightclub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名歌手被狗仔队偷拍到从夜总会出来。

Sense.DEF: a way of talking to or about your father
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good morning. Papa!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上好﹐爸爸！

Sense.DEF: the position and authority of the Pope
Sense.TRAN: 教皇的职位﹔教皇的职权

Sense.DEF: the time during which a Pope is in power

another spelling of
poppadom
relating to the Pope
Sense.EXAMPLE: a challenge to papal authority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对教皇权威的挑战

Sense.DEF: photographers who follow famous people in order to take photographs they can sell to newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 追逐名人的摄影记者﹐狗仔队

Sense.DEF: the large yellow-green fruit of a tropical tree
material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll get you a piece of paper so you can write the number down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你找张纸﹐你好把号码写下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have a pen and paper?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有笔和纸吗？

Sense.DEF: a newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen today’s paper?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到今天的报纸了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll read about it in tomorrow’s papers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会在明天的报纸上看到的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Sunday papers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周日报纸

Subsense.DEF: pieces of paper with writing on them that you use in your work, at meetings etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I left some important papers in my briefcase.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把一些重要文件落在公文包里了。

Subsense.DEF: documents and letters concerning someone’s private or public life
Subsense.TRAN: 〔有关私人生活或公众生活的〕文件﹐书信
Subsense.EXAMPLE: While I was organizing Simon’s papers I came across his diaries.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在整理西蒙的文件时发现了他的日记。

Subsense.DEF:
documents concerning a
divorce

official documents such as your
passport
,
identity card
etc
Subsense.TRAN: 证明﹔证件〔如护照﹑身份证等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My papers are all in order they are legal and correct .
