Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的证件全都是合法有效的。

Subsense.DEF: if you put ideas or information on paper, you write them down

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You need to get some of these thoughts down on paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得把这些想法中的一些写在纸上。

Subsense.DEF: if something seems true on paper, it seems to be true as an idea, but may not be true in a real situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s a nice idea on paper, but you’ll never get it to work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理论上这是个好主意﹐但你永远无法付诸实践。

Sense.DEF: a set of printed questions used as an examination in a particular subject, and the answers people write
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exam paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考卷
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a stack of papers to mark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一堆试卷要批。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The geography paper was really easy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地理试卷真容易。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing or a talk on a particular subject by someone who has made a study of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scientific paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学论文

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a paper on psychology
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理学论文
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Professor Usborne gave a paper on recent developments in his field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 厄斯本教授就自己领域的新动态发表了讲话。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing that is done as part of a course at school or university
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为学校课程作业的〕文章﹐论文

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a paper on the Civil War
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇关于南北战争的论文

Sense.DEF: a report prepared by a government or committee on a question they have been considering or a proposal for changes in the law
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will publish a discussion paper on the future of the BBC.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将发表一篇关于英国广播公司前景的讨论报告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the 1998 White Paper on political reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1998年政治改革白皮书

Sense.EXAMPLE: a working paper a report that is not final on funding the Health Service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于为医疗保健系统提供资金的初步工作报告

Sense.DEF: paper for covering and decorating the walls of a room
Sense.EXAMPLE: a floral paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花卉图案的壁纸

Sense.DEF:
stock s
and
share s
that can be bought and sold on a financial market
soft thin paper used for cleaning yourself after you have used the toilet

Sense.LEXUNIT: not worth the paper it is written on/printed on
Sense.DEF: if something such as a contract is not worth the paper it is written on, it has no value because whatever is promised in it will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔合同等〕毫无价值的﹐不会兑现的

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Each recipe was written down on a separate sheet of paper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每道菜谱分别写在一张纸上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can I have another piece of paper?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 再给我一张纸好吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a small piece
good quality paper for writing letters
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can you fetch me a piece of writing paper and a pen?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给我去拿一张信纸﹑一支笔好吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with nothing written or printed on it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The package was wrapped in plain brown paper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 包裹是用棕色空白纸包装的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: printed with horizontal lines, for writing
coloured paper for wrapping presents
very thin paper for wrapping things
paper made from waste paper

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 'write on a paper'. Say 而要说 write on a piece of paper .

Sense.DEF: made of paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paper bag
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纸袋

Sense.DEF: written or printed on paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: The brochure is available in electronic and paper versions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小册子电子版和印刷版均有。

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning documents showing that you have passed particular examinations, used specially when you think that experience and knowledge are more important
Sense.TRAN: 纸质资历﹐证书〔尤用于认为经验及知识更重要时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paper qualifications are no guide to ability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 证书绝不是衡量能力的准绳。

Sense.DEF: existing only as an idea but not having any real value
Sense.EXAMPLE: paper profits a record of the value of something, that is not real until the thing is sold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纸上盈利﹐账面利润
Sense.EXAMPLE: paper promises
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 徒具空文的保证

Sense.DEF: to decorate the walls of a room by covering them with special paper
to try to hide disagreements or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to discuss disagreements honestly without papering over the cracks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该开诚布公地讨论分歧而不是遮遮掩掩。

Sense.DEF: a book with a stiff paper cover
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shelf full of paperbacks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放满了平装书的书架

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her first novel sold over 20,000 copies in paperback.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她第一部小说的平装本卖了两万多册。

Sense.DEF: a boy who delivers newspapers to people’s houses
an official process that prevents you from doing something quickly because it involves writing or reading a lot of documents
Sense.TRAN: 繁冗的文书工作﹐繁文缛节

Sense.DEF: a small piece of curved wire used for holding sheets of paper together
a small metal object like a button used to hold several pieces of paper together
a girl who delivers newspapers to people’s houses
a knife for opening envelopes
money made of paper, not coins
someone whose job is doing unimportant office work
Sense.TRAN: 〔办公室中处理琐事的〕文书﹐办事员

Sense.DEF: the job of delivering newspapers to a group of houses
a shop that sells newspapers and magazines, and also things such as tobacco, sweets, and cards
very thin
Sense.EXAMPLE: paper-thin walls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常薄的墙壁

Sense.DEF: an enemy or opponent who seems powerful but actually is not
Sense.TRAN: 纸老虎〔指外强中干的敌人或对手〕

Sense.DEF: a sheet of soft thick paper that you use to dry your hands or to clean up small amounts of liquid, food etc
documents and records that show what someone has done, especially ones proving that someone is guilty of a crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔记录过往行为的﹐尤指证明某人犯罪的〕文件档案
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paper trail led investigators straight to the White House.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件档案把调查者直接引向美国政府。

Sense.DEF: a small heavy object used to hold pieces of paper in place
work such as writing letters or reports, which must be done but is not very interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police work involves so much paperwork these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今当警察也要做这么多文书工作。

Sense.DEF: the documents that you need for a business deal, a journey etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔商贸﹑旅行等所需的〕资料﹐文件
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m leaving the solicitors to sort out the paperwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备让律师们去整理文件。

Sense.DEF: something such as skin or leaves that is papery is very dry and thin and a little stiff
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮肤﹑树叶等〕像纸的﹐薄而干硬的﹐质地似纸的

Sense.DEF: a soft substance made from a mixture of paper, water, and glue, which becomes hard when it dries and is used for making pots and other objects
Sense.TRAN: 混凝纸浆〔干燥后变硬﹐用于制罐等物品〕

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for a member of the Roman Catholic Church, used especially by Protestants
Sense.TRAN: 天主教徒〔尤为新教徒所用侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF: a type of bag attached to a frame, which you use to carry a baby on your back
Sense.TRAN: 〔背负幼儿用的有框架的〕背袋

Sense.DEF: a Native American baby or young child

a red powder made from a type of sweet
pepper
, used for giving a slightly hot taste to meat and other food

a medical test that takes cells from a woman’s
cervix
and examines them for signs of
cancer
Sense.TRAN: 巴氏涂片〔一种探查子宫颈癌变的检查〕

Sense.DEF: a plant like grass that grows in water
a type of paper made from papyrus and used in ancient Egypt, or a piece of this paper
to be at the same level or standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wages of clerks were on a par with those of manual workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文员的工资和体力劳动者的工资差不多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will have Christmas decorations on a par with anything on show at the MetroCentre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要让自己的圣诞装饰品能和地铁购物中心的相媲美。

Subsense.DEF: to feel a little ill or lacking in energy
Subsense.TRAN: 感觉有些不舒服﹐健康状况欠佳﹔没精神
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been feeling a little under par the last couple of weeks.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几个星期我一直感觉有些不舒服。

Subsense.DEF: to be less good than usual or below the proper standard
Subsense.TRAN: 在一般水平以下﹐达不到标准
Subsense.EXAMPLE: None of the people who’d auditioned were really up to par.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有试镜者中没有一个真正达到标准。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The champion was playing well below par.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位冠军选手远没有发挥出正常水平。

Sense.DEF: to be what you would normally expect to happen – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 不出所料﹐意料之中〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Long hours and tough working conditions are often par for the course in catering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作时间长﹑工作环境恶劣在餐饮业里是家常便饭。

Sense.DEF:
the number of
stroke s
a good player should take to hit the ball into a hole in the game of
golf
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫球击球入洞的〕标准杆数
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last hole is a par five.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一洞的标准杆数为五杆。

Sense.DEF:
the value of a
stock
or
bond
that is printed on it when it is first sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔证券或债券的〕票面价值﹐面值
Sense.EXAMPLE: bonds sold at 97% of their par value
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以面值的97%销售的债券

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The notes are currently trading at 10% above par.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些票据目前以高于面值10%的价格买卖。

Sense.DEF:
a
paratrooper

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=paragraph〔文章的〕段﹐段落

Sense.DEF: beyond
Sense.EXAMPLE: the paranormal strange unnatural events, beyond normal experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超自然现象

Sense.DEF: very similar to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: terrorists wearing paramilitary uniforms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着准军事部队制服的恐怖分子

Sense.DEF: relating to a profession and helping more highly trained people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paramedic someone who helps a doctor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医务辅助人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paralegal someone who helps a lawyer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师助手

Sense.DEF:
relating to
parachute s
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paratrooper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伞兵
Sense.EXAMPLE: paragliding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 翼伞滑翔运动

Sense.DEF: a short simple story that teaches a moral or religious lesson, especially one of the stories told by Jesus in the Bible
Sense.TRAN: 〔道德或宗教〕寓言〔尤指《圣经》中耶稣所讲的故事〕

Sense.DEF: a curve in the shape of the imaginary line an object makes when it is thrown high in the air and comes down a little distance away

BrE a common drug used to reduce pain, which does not contain
aspirin
Sense.TRAN: 扑热息痛﹐对乙酰氨基酚〔一种不含阿司匹林的常用镇痛药〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment fastened to the back of people who jump out of planes, which makes them fall slowly and safely to the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: a parachute jump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跳伞

Sense.DEF: to jump from a plane using a parachute

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They parachuted into Vietnam in 1968.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1968 年﹐他们跳伞降落到越南境内。

Sense.DEF: to drop something from a plane with a parachute

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Supplies have been parachuted into the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 补给品被空投到该地区。

Sense.DEF: someone who jumps from a plane with a parachute
a public celebration when musical bands, brightly decorated vehicles etc move down the street
Sense.EXAMPLE: a victory parade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜利游行
Sense.EXAMPLE: the St Patrick’s Day parade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣帕特里克节庆祝游行

Sense.DEF: a military ceremony in which soldiers stand or march together so that important people can examine them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a military parade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事检阅

GramExa.GLOSS: be standing or marching in a parade
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 在接受检阅﹔在列队行进
GramExa.EXAMPLE: troops on parade
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受检阅的部队

Sense.DEF: a line of people moving along so that other people can watch them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fashion parade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时装表演

Sense.DEF: a series of people, events etc that seems to never end
Sense.TRAN: 一连串没完没了的人[事]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a constant parade of young men coming to visit her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断有年轻男子来看她。

Sense.DEF: a street with a row of small shops
to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The marchers paraded peacefully through the capital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行队伍有秩序地列队穿过首都。

Sense.DEF: if you parade your skills, knowledge, possessions etc, you show them publicly in order to make people admire you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young athletes will get a chance to parade their skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻运动员将有机会一展身手。

Sense.DEF: to walk around, especially in a way that shows that you want people to notice and admire you
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指炫耀地〕走来走去﹐招摇而过

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A trio of girls in extremely tight shorts paraded up and down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个女孩穿着极紧身的短裤招摇过市。

Sense.DEF: if prisoners are paraded on television or through the streets, they are shown to the public, in order to prove that the people holding them are important or powerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoners were paraded in front of the TV cameras.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯被带到电视镜头前曝光。

Sense.DEF: to proudly show something or someone to other people, because you want to look impressive to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She paraded her new team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她炫耀自己的新团队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: war medals paraded for public admiration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为供民众瞻仰而展示的战争勋章

Sense.DEF: if soldiers parade, or if an officer parades them, they march together so that an important person can watch them

Sense.LEXUNIT: parade as sth/be paraded as sth
Sense.DEF: if something parades as something else that is better, someone is pretending that it is the other better thing – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 冒充为某事物/被冒充为某事物〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just self-interest parading as concern for your welfare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这貌似关心你的幸福﹐实则只是自私自利。

Sense.DEF: a place where soldiers practise marching or standing together in rows
a model or example that shows how something works or is produced
Sense.TRAN: 〔展示工作原理或制作方法的〕模型﹐例子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the basic paradigm of the family tree
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家谱的基本模式

Sense.DEF: a very clear or typical example of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pius XII remained the paradigm of what a pope should be.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 庇护十二世一直都是教皇的榜样。

Sense.DEF: an important change in which the usual way of thinking or doing something is replaced by another way of thinking or doing something
a place or situation that is extremely pleasant, beautiful, or enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful tropical paradise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美丽的热带乐园
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel felt like paradise after two weeks of camping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个星期的野营之后﹐酒店让人感觉像是天堂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A home near the sea is my idea of paradise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠近海边的家是我理想中的天堂。

Sense.DEF: a place that has everything you need for doing a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔所需物一应俱全的〕乐园﹐乐土
Sense.EXAMPLE: The market is a shopper’s paradise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个市场是购物者的乐园。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hawaii is a paradise for surfers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏威夷是冲浪者的天堂。

Subsense.DEF: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives
according to the Bible, the garden where the first humans, Adam and Eve, lived

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be living in a fool’s paradise

Sense.DEF: a situation that seems strange because it involves two ideas or qualities that are very different
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a paradox that in such a rich country there can be so much poverty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在如此富有的国家却有这么多的贫穷现象﹐真是矛盾。

Sense.DEF: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼﹐反而会打到更多的鱼。

Sense.DEF: the use of statements that are a paradox in writing or speech
in a way that is surprising because it is the opposite of what you would expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paradoxically, the prohibition of liquor caused an increase in alcoholism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矛盾的是﹐禁酒反而导致酗酒的增加。

Sense.DEF:
a kind of oil used for heating and in lamps, made from
petroleum
or coal

a soft white substance used for making
candle s
,made from
petroleum
or coal

a sport in which you jump off a hill or out of a plane and use a
parachute
to fly for long distances before floating back down to the ground
Sense.TRAN: 滑翔伞运动﹐翼伞滑翔运动

Sense.DEF: someone who is perfect or is extremely brave, good etc – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 完（美的）人﹔典范﹐模范〔常为幽默用法〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a paragon of virtue
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美德的典范

Sense.DEF: part of a piece of writing which starts on a new line and contains at least one sentence
Sense.EXAMPLE: the opening paragraphs of the novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小说开篇的几个段落

Sense.DEF: a small brightly coloured bird with a long tail
someone whose job is to help lawyers do their work
Sense.TRAN: 律师助手﹔法律事务助理

Sense.DEF: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不同地点或不同时间的两事物之间的〕联系﹐相似（之处）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Entering the world of fine art, she found many parallels with the world of fashion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当她踏入美术界后﹐发现这里与时装界有许多共通之处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are many parallels between Yeats and the Romantic poets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叶芝和浪漫主义诗人之间有很多相似之处。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: books that attempt to draw parallels between brains and computers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图比较人脑和计算机相似处的书籍

Sense.DEF: together with and at the same time as something else
Sense.TRAN: 和某人/某物一起﹔和某人/某物同时
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to pursue her own career in parallel with her husband’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在丈夫追求事业的同时﹐她也想追求自己的事业。

Sense.DEF: be greater, better, worse etc than anything else
Sense.TRAN: 没有可相比拟的事物﹔无可匹敌
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poverty of hill farmers had no parallel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人比山区农民更穷了。

Sense.DEF:
an imaginary line drawn on a map of the Earth, that is parallel to the
equator
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 38th parallel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 38度纬线

Sense.DEF: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 线与CD线平行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: two parallel roads
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两条平行的道路

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was travelling parallel to her previous route.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在的行进线路和先前的线路平行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The railway is parallel with the canal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条铁路和运河平行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

Sense.DEF: similar and happening at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Social changes in Britain are matched by parallel trends in some other countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国发生社会变革的同时﹐其他国家也出现了相似的趋势。

Sense.DEF: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某事〕同时发生﹔与〔某事〕相似
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rise in greenhouse gases parallels the reduction in the ozone layer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在温室气体增加的同时﹐臭氧层在变薄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His career parallels that of his father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的事业轨迹和父亲的如出一辙。

Sense.DEF:
two wooden bars that are held parallel to each other on four posts, used in
gymnastics

the state of being
parallel
with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a parallelism between fatigue and the ability to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疲劳与能否入睡有关。

Sense.DEF: a flat shape with four sides in which each side is the same length as the side opposite it and parallel to it
when several computers work on a single problem at one time, or the process by which a single computer can perform several operations at the same time

an international sports event held every four years for
disabled
athletes who cannot use a part of their body properly. It is held after the
olympic games
, in the same city.
if something paralyses you, it makes you lose the ability to move part or all of your body, or to feel it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her legs were partly paralysed in the crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在撞车事故中她的双腿部分瘫痪。

Sense.DEF: to make something unable to operate normally
Sense.TRAN: 使不能正常运作﹐使陷入瘫痪
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fear of unemployment is paralysing the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对失业的恐惧使经济陷于瘫痪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Motor traffic was paralysed in much of the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城市大部分地区的汽车交通陷于停顿。

Sense.DEF: unable to move part or all of your body or feel it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident left him permanently paralysed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次意外事故使他永久瘫痪了。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 脖子以下/胸部以下/腰部以下瘫痪

Sense.DEF: unable to think clearly or deal with a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: paralysed by fear
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吓得不知所措的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: paralyzed with shock
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 惊呆了的

Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood paralysed for a moment, and then ran away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在那里一时呆若木鸡﹐然后跑掉了。

Sense.DEF: the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body or feel things in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: paralysis of the lower body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下半身瘫痪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The snake’s poison causes paralysis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种蛇的毒液会引起身体麻痹。

Sense.DEF: a state of being unable to take action, make decisions, or operate normally
Sense.TRAN: 不知所措﹔〔行动﹑决策﹑运行等〕瘫痪﹐停顿
Sense.EXAMPLE: a period of political paralysis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段时间的政治瘫痪

Sense.DEF: very drunk
suffering from paralysis

someone who is
paralysed

the American spelling of
paralyse
someone who has been trained to help people who are hurt or to do medical work, but who is not a doctor or nurse
Sense.TRAN: 〔非医生或护士的〕护理人员﹐医务辅助人员

Sense.DEF: a set of fixed limits that control the way that something should be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The inquiry has to stay within the parameters laid down by Congress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查必须局限于国会设定的范围之内。

Sense.DEF: a paramilitary organization is an illegal group that is organized like an army
Sense.EXAMPLE: extremist paramilitary groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极端分子的非法军事组织

Sense.DEF: relating to or helping a military organization
Sense.TRAN: 与正规军有联系的﹐准军事的﹔辅助正规军的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the paramilitary police
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准军事警察

Sense.DEF: more important than anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: During a war the interests of the state are paramount, and those of the individual come last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争时期国家利益是首要的﹐个人利益置于最后。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women’s role as mothers is of paramount importance to society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性作为母亲的角色对社会至关重要。

Sense.DEF: someone who you have a romantic or sexual relationship with, but who you are not married to
an unreasonable belief that you cannot trust other people, or that they are trying to harm you or have a bad opinion of you
a mental illness that makes someone believe that they are very important and that people hate them and are trying to harm them
paranoid
Sense.TRAN: 多疑的﹔患偏执狂的﹐患妄想狂的

Sense.DEF: believing un-reasonably that you cannot trust other people, or that they are trying to harm you or have a bad opinion of you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Malcolm got really paranoid, deciding that there was a conspiracy out to get him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔科姆很多疑﹐认定有人阴谋要害他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has always been paranoid about his personal security.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是对自己的人身安全疑神疑鬼。

Sense.DEF: suffering from a mental illness that makes you believe that other people are trying to harm you
Sense.TRAN: 患偏执狂的﹐患妄想狂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patient suffering from paranoid schizophrenia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个偏执型精神分裂症病人

Sense.DEF: paranormal events cannot be explained by science and seem strange and mysterious
Sense.TRAN: 不能用科学解释的﹔超自然的﹐神秘的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ghosts and other paranormal phenomena
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鬼以及其他超自然现象

Sense.DEF: strange and mysterious events in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: researchers investigating the paranormal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查超自然事件的研究人员

Sense.DEF: a low wall at the edge of a high roof, bridge etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔屋顶﹑桥梁等边上的〕矮墙﹐护墙

Sense.DEF:
a protective wall of earth or stone built in front of a
trench
in a war

Sense.LEXUNIT: put/stick your head above the parapet
Sense.DEF: to take a risk
a lot of small things that belong to someone, or are needed for a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 私人（小）物品﹔〔某项活动所需的〕用具﹐装备
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric kettle and all the paraphernalia for making tea and coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把电水壶以及沏茶和煮咖啡的全套用具
Sense.EXAMPLE: travelling paraphernalia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行装备

Sense.DEF: the things and events that are connected with a particular activity, especially those which you think are unnecessary
Sense.TRAN: 〔与某项活动有关的〕烦琐手续﹐复杂程序
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the usual paraphernalia of bureaucracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官僚制度一整套惯常的繁文缛节

Sense.DEF: to express in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written
Sense.EXAMPLE: To paraphrase Finkelstein, mathematics is a language, like English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芬克尔斯坦的意思是﹐数学是一门语言﹐就像英语一样。

Sense.DEF: a statement that expresses in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written
inability to move your legs and the lower part of your body
someone who is unable to move the lower part of their body, including their legs
the scientific study of mysterious abilities that some people claim to have, such as knowing what will happen in the future

a strong poison used to kill
weed s
Sense.TRAN: 百草枯〔一种强力除草剂〕

Sense.DEF:
a sport in which you wear a
parachute
and are pulled behind a motor boat so that you fly through the air
Sense.TRAN: 〔由摩托艇牵引的〕帆伞运动﹐水上拖伞运动

Sense.DEF:
a sport in which you wear a
parachute
, and are pulled along by a car so that you go up into the sky and float back down to the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔由汽车牵引升到空中然后飘降地面的〕牵引式降落伞运动

Sense.DEF: a plant or animal that lives on or in another plant or animal and gets food from it
Sense.TRAN: 寄生植物﹔寄生动物﹔寄生虫

Sense.DEF: a lazy person who does not work but depends on other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 靠他人为生的人﹐寄生虫〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: living in or on another plant or animal and getting food from them
Sense.EXAMPLE: parasitic fungi
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寄生真菌

Sense.DEF: a parasitic person is lazy, does no work, and depends on other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕寄生虫似的﹐靠他人为生的

Sense.DEF: a parasitic disease is caused by parasites

a type of
umbrella
used to provide shade from the sun

a soldier who is trained to jump out of a plane using a
parachute
a group of paratroopers that fights together as a military unit
to boil something until it is partly cooked
an object that has been wrapped in paper or put in a special envelope, especially so that it can be sent by post
Sense.EXAMPLE: The parcel was delivered last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个邮包上周送到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sends regular food parcels to his family in Libya.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他定期给在利比亚的家人邮寄食品包裹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a parcel of clothes and blankets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一包衣服和毯子

Sense.DEF: an area of land that is part of a larger area which has been divided up
Sense.TRAN: 〔土地的〕一块﹐一片〔指已被分割的较大块土地的一部分〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a parcel of farmland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块农田

Sense.DEF:
a small quantity of food that has been wrapped up, usually in
pastry
Sense.TRAN: 食品的馅料〔通常指油酥点心中的馅料〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be part and parcel of sth

Sense.DEF: to divide something into small parts so that it can be sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new owner has parceled off many of the company’s assets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新老板把公司的许多资产分成小份以出售。

Sense.DEF: to divide or share something among several people
Sense.EXAMPLE: They didn’t want the federal government parceling out food supplies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不希望联邦政府分配食品供给。

Sense.DEF: to make something into a parcel by wrapping it up
Sense.EXAMPLE: She parcelled up the photos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把照片包了起来。

Sense.DEF: to divide something into small parts, especially so that it is easier to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 把…分成小份〔以方便处理〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: University education is often parcelled up into specialist teaching units.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学教育常常被细化为各门专业学科。

Sense.DEF: a bomb which is wrapped like a parcel and sent by post, and is intended to explode when it is opened
the slowest and cheapest system of sending parcels by post in the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国最慢﹑最便宜的〕包裹邮递系统

Sense.DEF: if the sun or wind parches something, it makes it very dry
very dry, especially because of hot weather
Sense.TRAN: 焦干的﹐干枯的〔尤因天气炎热〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the parched African landscape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 焦干的非洲地貌
Sense.EXAMPLE: his parched lips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他干裂的嘴唇

Sense.DEF: to be very thirsty

a children’s game in which you move a small piece of plastic around a board after throwing
dice
Sense.TRAN: 巴棋戏〔一种掷骰子后走步数的儿童棋类游戏〕

Sense.DEF: a material used in the past for writing on, made from the skin of a sheep or a goat
thick yellow-white writing paper, sometimes used for official documents
Sense.TRAN: 〔有时用于书写正式文件的〕仿羊皮纸

Sense.DEF: a document written on parchment
Sense.TRAN: 羊皮纸文件﹔仿羊皮纸文件

Sense.DEF: used humorously when speaking to someone you know well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Howdy, pardner!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好﹐朋友！

Sense.DEF: used when you want someone to repeat something because you did not hear it
Sense.TRAN: 请重复一遍﹐请再说一遍〔没听清对方的话希望重复一遍时的用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Hurry up Jonathan!’ ‘Pardon?’ ‘I said hurry up!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “快点﹐乔纳森！”“你说什么啊？”“我说快点！”

Sense.DEF:
used to say ‘sorry’ after you have made an impolite sound such as a
burp
Sense.TRAN: 对不起﹐请原谅〔在发出打嗝等不礼貌的声音后的道歉语〕

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verb pardon in spoken and written English. 动词pardon在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to officially allow someone who has been found guilty of a crime to go free without being punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two spies were pardoned yesterday by the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名间谍昨天得到了总统的赦免。

Sense.DEF: to forgive someone for behaving badly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He could never pardon her for the things she had said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他永远不会原谅她说的话。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb may be pardoned for doing sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is easy to understand why someone has done something or why they think something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone reading the advertisement might be pardoned for thinking that the offer was genuine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些看了那则广告认为报价属实的人都情有可原。

Subsense.DEF: used to say ‘sorry’ politely when you have accidentally pushed someone or interrupted them
Subsense.TRAN: 对不起﹐请原谅〔无意中碰到某人或打断某人说话时的礼貌用语〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Oh, pardon me, I didn’t mean to disturb you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐对不起﹐我不是有意要打扰你。

Subsense.DEF:
used to say ‘sorry’ politely after you have made an impolite sound such as a
burp
Subsense.TRAN: 对不起﹐很抱歉 〔在发出打嗝等不礼貌的声音后的礼貌用语〕

Subsense.DEF: used before you politely correct someone or disagree with them
Subsense.TRAN: 对不起﹐不好意思〔在纠正或不同意某人时的礼貌用语〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: James, if you’ll pardon me, you’ve got it all wrong.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯﹐不好意思﹐你全都搞错了。

Subsense.DEF: used to politely get someone’s attention in order to ask them a question
Subsense.TRAN: 对不起﹐劳驾〔为提问而吸引别人注意力时的礼貌用语〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Pardon me, can you direct me to City Hall?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳驾﹐您能告诉我去市政厅怎么走吗？

Sense.DEF: used to politely ask if you can interrupt someone, ask them a question, or tell them something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pardon me for saying so, but you don’t look well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请原谅我这么说﹐不过你看上去气色不太好。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to say something which you think may make you seem not to know enough or not to be polite enough
Sense.TRAN: 请原谅我的无知/无礼等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pardon my ignorance, but what does OPEC stand for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请原谅我的无知﹐OPEC代表什么？

Sense.DEF: used when you are saying that you are sorry for using an impolite phrase
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a bit of a cock-up, if you’ll pardon the expression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事搞得有点混乱﹐请原谅我这么说。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that you are sorry for using a swear word
Sense.TRAN: 请原谅我讲了无礼的话〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used when you are annoyed because you think someone has answered you angrily for no good reason
Sense.TRAN: 请原谅我活着让你受气了〔表示因别人无缘无故气冲冲地回答而感到恼火〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Shut up, Callum!’ ‘Well, pardon me for breathing.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “闭嘴﹐卡勒姆！”“请原谅我活着让你受气了。”

Sense.DEF: an official order allowing someone who has been found guilty of a crime to go free without being punished

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tyler was convicted but was granted a royal pardon one given by a king or queen .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒被判有罪﹐但得到了王室赦免。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to forgive you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Walter begged her pardon for all the pain he had caused her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃尔特请求她原谅自己给她造成那么多痛苦。

Sense.DEF: pardonable mistakes are not very bad and can be forgiven
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had made the pardonable mistake of trusting the wrong person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他信任了不该信任的人﹐这样的错误可以原谅。

Sense.DEF: to cut off the outer layer of something, using a sharp knife
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pare the rind from the fruit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 削去水果的外皮。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the amount, number, or size of something as much as you can
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm has not been able to pare costs fast enough to match competitors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司一直没能迅速削减开支﹐难以与对手抗衡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country’s defences have been pared to the bone reduced as far as possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的防御能力已被削减至最低水平。

Sense.DEF: to reduce something, especially by making a lot of small reductions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The list was pared down for the final interviews.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名单上的人数逐步减少﹐直到确定了最后面试人选。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Even in its pared-down form, the contract was unacceptable.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使已经删减过﹐这份合同还是让人无法接受。

Sense.DEF: the father or mother of a person or animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children under 14 should be accompanied by a parent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 14 岁以下儿童须由一位家长陪同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eggs are guarded by both parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些蛋由两只亲鸟共同守护着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melissa’s spending the weekend at her parents’ house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅利莎正在父母家度周末。

Sense.DEF: something that produces other things of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: New shoots appear near the parent plant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母株附近冒出了新枝。

Sense.DEF: a company which owns a smaller company or organ-ization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Land Rover’s new parent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路虎公司新的母公司

Sense.DEF: someone’s parents and the country and social class they are from
Sense.EXAMPLE: an English-born man with Irish parentage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出生于英格兰的爱尔兰裔男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was born in France in 1670 of unknown parentage nobody knows who his parents were .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1670 年他出生于法国﹐家世不明。

Sense.DEF: relating to being a parent and especially to being responsible for a child’s safety and development
Sense.EXAMPLE: parental responsibility
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母的责任
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opening a new school will increase parental choice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开办一所新学校将会扩大父母的选择范围。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parental consent is required before the operation can take place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术前须征得父母同意。

Sense.DEF: time that a parent is allowed to spend away from work with his or her baby
a company that controls a smaller company or organization

a round
bracket

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The figures in parentheses refer to page numbers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圆括号内的数字表示页码。

Sense.DEF: if you say something in parenthesis, you say it while you are talking about something else in order to add information or explain something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In parenthesis, I should add that the results have not yet been proven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 插一句﹐我想补充的是这些结果还未得到证实。

Sense.DEF: said or written while you are talking or writing about something else in order to explain something or add information
Sense.TRAN: 补充性质的﹐附带说明的
Sense.EXAMPLE: parenthetical references to his childhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于他童年时期的补充说明

Sense.DEF: the state of being a parent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Story-reading should be one of the great joys of parenthood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 读故事是做父母的最大快乐之一。

Sense.DEF: the skill or activity of looking after your own children
Sense.EXAMPLE: The program aims to teach young men parenting skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一计划旨在向年轻男性教授育儿技巧。

Sense.DEF: the parents of your husband or wife
Sense.TRAN: 配偶的双亲﹔公婆﹔岳父母

Sense.DEF:
a
pta
the very best of a particular thing
Sense.TRAN: 最好的﹐最优秀的﹐卓越的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Auguste Escoffier, master chef par excellence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥古斯特·埃斯科菲耶﹐顶级大厨

Sense.DEF:
a sweet food made of layers of
ice cream
and fruit
Sense.TRAN: 冰激凌水果冻〔由多层冰激凌和水果制成的甜点〕

Sense.DEF: someone who everyone hates and avoids
a system in which the money that people have risked on a horse race is shared between the people who have won
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛马赌博中由赢家分享全部赌金的〕同注分彩赌博法
Sense.EXAMPLE: par-imutuel betting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同注分彩赌博

Sense.DEF: a machine used to calculate the amount of money that people can win when they risk it on horse races
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛马的〕派彩计算器﹐同注分彩计算器

Sense.DEF: thin narrow pieces of something that have been cut off
Sense.EXAMPLE: nail parings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剪下的指甲
Sense.EXAMPLE: cheese parings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶酪碎屑

Sense.DEF: the area that a priest in some Christian churches is responsible for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Father Doyle moved to a new parish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多伊尔神父调到了新的教区。

Sense.DEF: a small area, especially a village, that has its own local government
Sense.EXAMPLE: elections to the parish council
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行政区议会选举

Sense.DEF: the main Christian church in a particular area
an official who works for a Christian church in a particular town or area
someone who lives in a parish, especially someone who regularly goes to a Christian church there
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指定期参加教区教堂活动的〕教区居民

Sense.DEF: concerned only with what happens in a small local area
Sense.EXAMPLE: parish pump politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 区域性政治

Sense.DEF: an official record of the births, deaths, and marriages in a parish
Sense.TRAN: 〔有关教区居民出生﹑死亡及婚姻的〕教区记事簿

Sense.DEF: someone from the city of Paris in France
the state of being equal, especially having equal pay, rights, or power
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指薪金﹑权利或权力的〕相同﹐相等﹐同等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women workers are demanding parity with their male colleagues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女职工在要求与男同事享有同等的待遇。

Sense.DEF: equality between the units of money from two diffe-rent countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个不同国家的货币单位的〕平价﹐等价

Sense.DEF: a large open area with grass and trees, especially in a town, where people can walk, play games etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go for a walk in the park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去公园散步吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a park bench
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园长椅
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flat overlooking Hyde Park
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套可以俯瞰海德公园的公寓

Sense.DEF: a large area of land in the country which has been kept in its natural state to protect the plants and animals there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Lake District National Park
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖区国家公园

Sense.DEF: a large enclosed area of land, with grass and trees, around a big house in the countryside

the field where a game of football or
rugby
is played
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was easily the best player on the park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无疑他是绿茵场上的最佳球员。

Sense.DEF: the field where a game of baseball is played
to put a car or other vehicle in a particular place for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t park here - it’s private property.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能把车停在这里——这是私人宅邸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t find anywhere to park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到地方停车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She parked the car on the drive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把车停在了私人车道上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a line of parked cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排停放着的汽车

Sense.DEF: to put something in a particular place for a period of time, especially in a way that annoys someone
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某物〕放在〔某处﹐尤以令人不快的做法〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He parked a load of papers on my desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把一大摞文件放在我桌上。

Sense.DEF: to sit down in a particular place, especially with the intention of staying a long time
Sense.TRAN: 坐在某处〔尤指打算待上一段时间〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Connie parked herself on the sofa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 康妮坐到了沙发上。

Sense.DEF: to put a car or other vehicle in a particular place for a period of time

a thick warm jacket with a
hood
Sense.TRAN: 风雪大衣﹐派克大衣〔带兜帽的御寒夹克〕

Sense.DEF: a system in which you leave your car outside a busy town and then take a special bus to the centre of the town
Sense.TRAN: 停车转乘法〔把汽车停在繁忙城市的外面﹐换乘公共汽车进城〕

Sense.DEF: the act of parking a car or other vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLE: No Parking used on signs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止停车
Sense.EXAMPLE: a £45 parking fine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 45英镑的违章停车罚款

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t find a parking space near the shops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在商店附近找不到停车位。

Sense.DEF: spaces in which you can leave a car or other vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLE: Free parking is available at the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店提供免费停车位。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment in a car which prevents it from moving when it is parked
Sense.TRAN: 【美】停车制动器﹐手制动器﹐手刹﹐手闸

Sense.DEF: a building with open sides in a public place where cars can be parked
Sense.TRAN: 公共停车库﹐多层停车场

Sense.DEF: one of two small lights next to each of the main lights at the front of a car
an open area for cars to park in
a machine at the side of a road which you have to put money into if you park your car next to it
an official notice fixed to a vehicle, saying that you have to pay money because you have parked your car in the wrong place or for too long
Sense.TRAN: 违法[超时]停车罚款通知单

Sense.DEF: a serious illness in which your muscles become very weak and your arms and legs shake
Sense.TRAN: 帕金森（氏）病﹐震颤（性）麻痹

Sense.DEF: the idea that the amount of work you have to do increases to fill the amount of time you have to do it in – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 帕金森定律〔指增加工作量以填满工作时限﹐幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to look after a public park in British towns
an area of land with grass and trees, surrounding a big house in the countryside
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is set in ten acres of parkland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店坐落在一片十英亩的绿地中。

Sense.DEF: land with grass and trees which is used as a park
Sense.EXAMPLE: a narrow strip of parkland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条狭长的公共绿地

Sense.DEF: the sport of running through city streets and jumping between buildings

a
ranger 1
a wide road with an area of grass and trees in the middle or along the sides
Sense.TRAN: 〔中间或两旁有草地和树木的〕林园大道﹐林荫大道

Sense.DEF: used to talk about railway stations that have large areas for cars to park
cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a bit parky outside today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天外面有点冷。

Sense.DEF: expressed in the words that a particular group of people would use
Sense.TRAN: 用医学上的/广告上的等说法[用语]
Sense.EXAMPLE: In military parlance this is known as a fast retreat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用军事术语说﹐这就叫做快速撤退。

Sense.DEF: expressed in the words that most people use
Sense.EXAMPLE: These schemes are known in common parlance as ‘private pensions’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些方案的通俗说法是“私人养老金计划”。

Sense.DEF: to use advantages that you already have, such as your skills, experience, or money, and increase their value by using all your opportunities well
Sense.TRAN: 使增值﹐使更有价值﹔成功地利用〔才能﹑经验或金钱等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He owned five movie theaters, which he eventually parlayed into hotels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拥有五家电影院﹐最后他以此进军酒店业。

Sense.DEF: a discussion in which enemies try to achieve peace

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs
Sense.EXAMPLE: They demanded a free parliament and press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF:
the main law-making institution in the UK, which consists of the
house of commons
and the
house of lords
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕议会〔由上议院和下议院组成〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has actually increased its majority in Parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府事实上增加了它在议会中的多数席位。

Sense.DEF: the period during which the British Parliament meets
Sense.EXAMPLE: We expect to get these laws passed during the present parliament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们期望这些法律能在本届议会通过。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was elected to parliament in 1997.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她于1997年入选议会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try to be elected
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ms Jackson stood for Parliament as a Labour candidate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊女士作为工党候选人参加议员竞选。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be elected as a member of parliament
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tony Blair first entered Parliament in 1983.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼·布莱尔于1983年进入议会。

Collocate.COLLOC: a bill is passed by parliament
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it is made into a law
it goes through the process of being made a law
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 一项议案经由议会讨论通过

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be considered by parliament
officially end parliament before holding an election

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was the Conservative member of Parliament for Edgbaston.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是埃德巴斯顿区的保守党议员。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a law that has been passed by parliament
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their rights are guaranteed by Act of Parliament.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的权利有《议会法案》作保障。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a position as member of parliament
when its members are working

Sense.DEF: a member of a parliament, especially one who is very experienced
relating to or governed by a parliament
Sense.TRAN: 议会的﹐国会的﹔由议会[国会]支配的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the world’s oldest parliamentary democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上最古老的议会民主制

Sense.DEF: a shop or type of business that provides a particular service
Sense.TRAN: 冰激凌店/殡仪馆/文身店等

Sense.DEF: a room in a house which has comfortable chairs and is used for meeting guests
a game that can be played indoors, such as a guessing game or a word game
Sense.TRAN: 室内游戏〔如猜谜或文字游戏〕

Sense.DEF: a female servant who was employed in large houses in the past to clean the rooms and serve guests
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时受雇清理房间﹑招待客人等的〕客厅女仆

Sense.DEF: in a very bad or dangerous condition
Sense.TRAN: 状况极坏的﹔非常危险的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country’s police force was in a parlous state in 1990.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1990 年该国的警察部队危机重重。

Sense.DEF: a hard Italian cheese
Sense.TRAN: 帕尔马干酪 〔一种意大利硬干酪〕

Sense.DEF: only interested in things that affect your local area – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 只关心本地区的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local newspapers tend to be very parochial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方报纸往往只关心当地事务。

Sense.DEF: relating to a particular church and the area around it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the parochial church council
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教区的教堂理事会

Sense.DEF: a private school which is run by or connected with a church
Sense.TRAN: 〔由教会兴办或与教会有关的〕教区学校﹐教会学校

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing, music etc or an action that copies someone or something in an amusing way
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章﹑音乐等的〕滑稽模仿作品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a brilliant parody of classical dance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一出对古典舞蹈精彩有趣的模仿作品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He swung the door wide open in a parody of welcome.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一下子把门大开﹐夸张地表示欢迎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her performance contains a strong element of self-parody when someone makes fun of their own style .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的表演包含了强烈的自嘲元素。

Sense.DEF: something that is not a correct or acceptable example of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Although his comment was a parody of the truth, Diana was upset by it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然他的话歪曲了事实﹐但还是让黛安娜很不安。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The trial was a parody of justice very unfair .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场审判是对正义的嘲弄。

Sense.DEF: to copy someone or something in a way that makes people laugh
Sense.EXAMPLE: His style has often been parodied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的风格经常被人滑稽地模仿。

Sense.DEF: permission for someone to leave prison, on the condition that they promise to behave well

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was released on parole after serving two years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服刑两年后他获得假释。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She will become eligible for parole in 19 months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 19 个月以后她将符合假释条件。

Sense.DEF: to allow someone to leave prison on the condition that they promise to behave well
the people who decide if a prisoner should get permission to leave prison
a sudden expression of strong feeling that you cannot control

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Had she cut her wrists in a paroxysm of guilt?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是否因为强烈的负罪感而割腕的？

Sense.DEF: a sudden, short attack of pain, coughing, shaking etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔疼痛﹑咳嗽﹑颤抖等的〕突然发作﹐阵发

Sense.DEF: small flat blocks of wood fitted together in a pattern that cover the floor of a room
Sense.EXAMPLE: a parquet floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶木地板

Sense.DEF: the crime of killing your father, mother, or any other close relative
a tropical bird with a curved beak and brightly coloured feathers that can be taught to copy human speech
if you learn something parrot fashion, you repeat what someone has just said without understanding it
Sense.TRAN: 鹦鹉学舌般; 机械地
Sense.EXAMPLE: We recited poems parrot fashion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们鹦鹉学舌般机械地背诵诗歌。

Sense.DEF: to repeat someone else’s words or ideas without really understanding what you are saying – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 不假思索[不明就里]地重复﹐鹦鹉学舌般重复〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just parroted his father’s opinions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是机械地重复父亲的观点。

Sense.DEF: to defend yourself against someone who is attacking you by pushing their weapon or hand to one side
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is far easier to parry a direct blow than to stop it forcibly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对直接击打﹐挡开要比硬碰容易得多。

Sense.DEF: to avoid answering a question that is difficult to answer or that someone does not want to answer
Sense.TRAN: 回避〔难以回答或不愿意回答的问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He parried all her questions about his work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回避了她所有关于他工作的问题。

Sense.DEF: to describe the grammar of a word when it is in a particular sentence, or the grammar of the whole sentence
Sense.TRAN: 对〔句中的词或句子〕作语法分析

Sense.DEF: a member of an ancient Persian religious group in India
extremely unwilling to spend money
Sense.TRAN: 极度节俭的﹐吝啬的﹐小气的

Sense.DEF: a herb with curly leaves, used in cooking or as decoration on food
a vegetable with a thick white or yellowish root
a Christian priest or minister
the house where a parson lives
the piece of flesh at the tail end of a bird, usually a chicken, that has been cooked
Sense.TRAN: 〔烹调过的〕禽类尾部﹐〔通常指〕鸡屁股

Sense.DEF: a piece or feature of something such as an object, area, event, or period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The front part of the car was damaged.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车的前部损坏了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In parts of Canada, French is the first language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在加拿大的部分地区﹐法语是第一语言。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cost of living is becoming unbearable for retired people in our part of the world where we live .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们这里﹐生活费用已经高得让退休人士难以承受了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: More heat is lost through the head than any other part of the body .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 头部散发的热量比身体其他部位都要多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: in the early part of the 19th century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 19世纪早期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The best part of the holiday was the food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假期里最开心的事是吃东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can see the final part of that series on Tuesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期二你能看到那部连续剧的大结局。

Sense.EXAMPLE: For part of the day, you will be outside doing practical work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们每天将有一部分时间在户外实际操作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I shall be explaining this further in Part Two.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个我会在第二部分做进一步解释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Getting Dad to agree will be the hard part.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让爸爸同意会是很难的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The jobs attracted people from all parts of the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些工作吸引了世界各地的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the traditions that are an integral part of Jewish life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和犹太人生活息息相关的传统

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film is very violent in parts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影有些片段非常暴力。

Sense.DEF: one of the separate pieces that something such as a machine or piece of equipment is made of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lay all the parts out before you start assembling the model.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始组装模型之前把所有的零件都摆放出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: engine parts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机部件

GramExa.GLOSS: kept for when a part breaks, needs replacing etc

Sense.DEF: some, but not all, of a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Part of the money will be spent on a new playground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部分钱款将用于建造新操场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Part of the castle was destroyed by fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城堡的一部分毁于火灾。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Part of me hates him I partly hate him .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点恨他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Poor working conditions are only part of the problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶劣的工作条件仅仅是问题的一方面。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘(the) most part of’. Say 而要说 most of: We spent most of (NOT 不说 most part of) the morning shopping. 我们那天早上大部分时间在购物。

Sense.DEF: if something or someone plays a part in something else, they are involved in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Health education will play a part in preparing us for old age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康教育将为我们进入老年生活做好一定准备。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain should play its full part in the negotiations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国应全力参与这些谈判。

GramExa.PROPFORM: play a big/important part in sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pictures play an important part in publishing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图片在出版业中起到重要作用。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a part to play (in sth)
Sense.DEF: to have a particular job or be responsible for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church used to have a more important part to play in the community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会曾经在社区中发挥过更大的作用。

Sense.DEF: to be involved in an activity, sport, event etc with other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: About 400 students took part in the protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约有400名学生参加了抗议活动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to take part but she was too ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想参加﹐但她病得太厉害了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At college I took an active part in student politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大学里我积极参与学生政治活动。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘take a part in’ something. Say 而要说 take part in something.

Sense.DEF: to not be involved in something
Sense.TRAN: 未参与某事﹐未卷入某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took no part in the fighting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有参与那场打斗。

Sense.DEF: to not want to be involved in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a plan to change the production style, and he wanted no part of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有计划要改变生产方式﹐他不想参与其中。

Sense.DEF: nearly all of something
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的绝大部分/大部分
Sense.EXAMPLE: We waited for the best part of an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等了近一个小时。

Sense.DEF: a lot or more than half of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large part of the budget will be spent on advertising.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大部分预算将花费在广告上。

Sense.DEF: most of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They controlled the greater part of North Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们控制了北非的大部分地区。

Sense.DEF: to some degree, but not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: His reluctance to help could, in part, be explained by his poor eyesight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不愿意帮忙﹐在某种程度上可能是由于他视力不好。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in large part/for the most part
Sense.DEF: mostly, or in most places
Sense.TRAN: 多半﹐在很大程度上﹔在大多数地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: Success was due in large part to good teamwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功在很大程度上归因于良好的团队合作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the most part he worked patiently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数时候他工作很有耐心。

Sense.DEF: to be included or involved in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Falling over is part of learning how to ski.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学滑雪少不了要摔倒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you decide to work for our organisation, you will be part of a great team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你决定为我们机构工作﹐你将成为我们优秀团队中的一员。

Sense.DEF: to be one of the things that make up something larger or more important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Practical work forms an integral part of the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实习是这门课必不可少的一部分。

Sense.DEF:
a
parting
the words and actions of a particular character in a play or film
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could someone take the part of Romeo, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能请谁来扮演罗密欧吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katharine’s playing the part of Mary in the school play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳在学校的话剧中扮演玛丽一角。

Sense.DEF: the music that one type of instrument or voice within a group plays or sings
Sense.EXAMPLE: The violin part is difficult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小提琴部分很难演奏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The choir sings in four-part harmony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个合唱队用四部和声演唱。

Sense.DEF: used to say how much of each substance there is or should be in a mixture
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prepare the glue with one part powder to three parts water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用一份粉和三份水来配制胶水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sulphur dioxide level in the air was 32 parts per billion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气中二氧化硫的含量是十亿分之三十二。

Subsense.DEF: to look like a typical person of a particular type
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In his smart suit, he certainly looked the part.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着考究的西装﹐他看上去真像那么回事。

Subsense.DEF: to perform well and seem likely to be successful – used in sports reports
Subsense.TRAN: 崭露头角〔用于体育报道中〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s beginning to look the part on the soccer field.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始在足球场上崭露头角。

Sense.DEF: to wear suitable clothes for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got a new high-powered job, and she’s certainly dressing the part.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她找到一份位高权重的新工作﹐当然穿得符合自己的身份。

Sense.DEF: what a particular person did in an activity that was shared by several people, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 某人在某事中的参与〔尤指不好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was imprisoned for six years for his part in the murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因参与谋杀而被监禁了六年。

Sense.DEF: in the particular area that you are in
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t get many tourists in these parts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这一带没有多少游客。

Sense.DEF: to support someone in a quarrel or argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad always takes my brother’s part when we argue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和弟弟争吵的时候﹐爸爸总是站在弟弟那一边。

Sense.DEF: used when saying what a particular person thinks or does, as opposed to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: For my part, I prefer living in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就我而言﹐我宁愿住在乡下。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on sb’s part/on the part of sb
Sense.DEF: used when describing a particular person’s feelings or actions
Sense.TRAN: 某人所感觉[做]的﹔就某人而言
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was probably just a mistake on her part.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能只是她的一个失误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has never been any jealousy on my part.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从没有感到嫉妒。

Sense.DEF: to accept jokes or criticism about you without being upset
Sense.TRAN: 对某事一笑置之﹐对某事物并不见怪

Sense.LEXUNIT: be part and parcel of sth
Sense.DEF: to be a necessary feature of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working irregular hours is all part and parcel of being a journalist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作时间无规律是记者这一行的基本特征。

Sense.DEF: to have been in a place for so long that people no longer notice you
Sense.TRAN: 习以为常的人[物]﹐久在某处故不被人注意的人[物]

Sense.DEF: someone who is able to do many different things
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a man of many parts: writer, literary critic and historian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个多面手: 既是作家﹐又是文学评论家和历史学家。

Exponent.DEF: something that together with other things forms a whole
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It looks like part of a car engine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 它看上去像汽车引擎部件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The best part of the movie was the end.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影最精彩的部分是结尾。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hardest part is getting started.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 万事开头难。

Exponent.DEF: a small part of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some bits of the book are really funny.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 书里有些段落很有趣。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I didn’t read the bottom bit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有读底下那部分。

Exponent.DEF: one of several different parts that you join together to make something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of the pieces of the jigsaw puzzle was missing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一块拼图不见了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The furniture comes in several pieces.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 家具是分成几个部分送到的。

Exponent.DEF: a part of a machine or process
Exponent.TRAN: 〔机器或过程的〕部件﹐组成部分
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company supplies engine components for trucks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司提供卡车引擎部件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Education is a major component in a child' s growth and development.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育是儿童成长发育过程中的重要部分。

Exponent.DEF: a part of something that is clearly different and separate from other parts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The test is divided into two sections.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 测验分为两部分。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the reference section of the library
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆的参考书阅览区
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the string section of the orchestra
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 管弦乐队的弦乐部

Exponent.DEF: one of the numbered parts that a book is divided into
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The opening chapter of the book sets the scene.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书的开篇介绍了背景。

Exponent.DEF: one of the parts that a film or play is divided into
Exponent.TRAN: 〔电影或戏剧的〕镜头,场面,片断
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some scenes had to be cut because they were too violent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些镜头因为太暴力而不得不剪去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: act 1, scene 2 of the play
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部戏的第二场第一幕

Exponent.DEF: a part of a story on the television or the radio, which is told in separate parts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I missed last week’s episode.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我错过了上周的那一集。

Sense.DEF: to move the two sides of something apart, or to move apart, making a space in the middle
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he parted the curtains, the sunlight flooded into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拉开窗帘﹐阳光洒进屋内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd parted to let him through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群分开让他通过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ralph’s lips parted in a delighted smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫咧嘴开心地笑了。

Sense.DEF: to separate from someone, or end a relationship with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: They parted on amicable terms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们友好地分手了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has parted from his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和妻子分居了。

Sense.DEF: to be prevented from being with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were hardly ever parted in 30 years of marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结婚30年﹐他们几乎从没有分开过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hates being parted from the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不愿和孩子们分离。

Subsense.DEF: to go in different directions after having gone in the same direction
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The two women parted company outside their rooms.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名女子在各自的房间外分手告别。

Subsense.DEF: to end a relationship with someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: George parted company with the band in 1996.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治于1996年脱离了乐队。

Subsense.DEF: to disagree with someone about something
Subsense.TRAN: （和某人）意见不合﹐（和某人）有分歧
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He parted company with Lloyd George over post-war diplomacy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和劳合·乔治在战后外交问题上意见不合。

Sense.DEF: if you part your hair, you comb some of your hair in one direction and the rest in the other direction
to give something to someone else, although you do not want to
Sense.TRAN: 〔不情愿地〕放弃〔某物〕﹐舍弃〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m reluctant to part with any of the kittens, but we need the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不愿舍弃任何一只小猫﹐但是我们需要钱。

Sense.DEF: if something is part one thing, part another, it consists of both of those things
Sense.TRAN: 部分是某物﹐部分是某物﹔既有某物﹐又有某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exams are part written, part practical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次考试既有笔试﹐又考实际操作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room is part sitting room, part bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个房间既是起居室﹐又是卧室。

Sense.DEF: not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project is part funded by the council.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目部分由地方议会出资。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The object was part hidden by the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那东西半掩在草丛中。

Sense.DEF: payment of only a part of something, not all of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave them £10 in part payment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我先付了他们10英镑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is one of the people who own something
to eat or drink something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Grandmother likes to partake of a small glass of sherry before lunch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 祖母喜欢在午饭前喝一小杯雪利酒。

Sense.DEF: to take part in an activity or event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a woman’s fundamental right to partake in club affairs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女参与俱乐部事务的基本权利

Sense.DEF: to have a certain amount of a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 有点…﹐带有几分〔某种性质〕

Sense.DEF:
a part of a garden with areas of flowers surrounded by low
hedge s
in a formal pattern
a way of buying a new car, television etc in which you give your old car, television etc as part of the payment
Sense.TRAN: 以旧换新折价交易（法）﹐部分抵价交易（法）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company takes the buyer’s property in part exchange .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司收下了买家的房产作为其抵付购买新房的部分款额。

Sense.DEF: the production of a new plant or animal from a female without the sexual involvement of the male
not complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exhibition was only a partial success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次展会只获得部分成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

Sense.DEF: to like something very much
Sense.TRAN: 特别喜欢某物﹐偏爱某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m very partial to cream cakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我特别喜欢吃奶油蛋糕。

Sense.DEF: unfairly supporting one person or one group against another
Sense.TRAN: 偏向一方的﹐偏袒的﹐不公平的

Sense.DEF: unfair support of one person or one group against another
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problem of partiality in news reporting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻报道中有失公正的问题

Sense.DEF: a special liking for something
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物的特别喜爱[偏爱﹐癖好]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a partiality for Moorish architecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对摩尔式建筑的偏爱

Sense.DEF: not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The operation was only partially successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术不尽如人意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember that you are partially responsible for their unhappiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住﹐你对他们的不幸负有部分责任。

Sense.DEF: unable to see well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reading aids have been provided for partially sighted pupils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已为弱视的学生提供了助读工具。

Sense.DEF: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an active participant in the negotiations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 积极参与谈判的人

Sense.DEF: to take part in an activity or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some members refused to participate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些会员拒绝参加。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone in the class is expected to participate actively in these discussions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全班同学都应该积极参与这些讨论。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They welcomed the opportunity to participate fully in the life of the village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很高兴有这个机会充分参与到该村的生活中去。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Participate is never followed immediately by a noun, or by ‘on’ or ‘to’. Say that you participate in something.participate后面绝对不能直接跟名词或on﹑to﹐而要说participate in something: More people should participate in elections (NOT 不说 More people should participate election). 应该有更多的人参与选举。

Exponent.DEF: to do an activity together with other people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He always participates in classroom activities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直参加课堂活动。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The people should have the right to participate in discussions about their future.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人民应有参与讨论自己未来的权利。

Exponent.DEF: to participate in something. Take part is less formal than participate and is more common in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 参加〔不如participate正式,更常用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nearly 500 teams took part in the competition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 差不多有500支队伍参加比赛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was asked to take part in a TV debate on drugs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被请去参加有关毒品问题的电视辩论。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Anyone who is over 18 can take part.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何年满18岁者均可参加。

Exponent.DEF: to take part in something in a useful way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone can play a part in improving the security of their neighborhood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都可以在提高社区安全方面起到积极的作用。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Schneider played a key role in getting the organization started.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 施奈德在该团体建立时起了关键作用。

Exponent.DEF: to take part in an activity in some way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has denied being involved in the murder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他否认自己卷入这宗谋杀案。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a big project and many people were involved.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个大项目,许多人都参与其中。

Exponent.DEF: to actively take part in the work of an organization such as a political group or church
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is very active in the church’s work with homeless people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常积极地参与教会帮助无家可归者的工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She is no longer active in politics.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不再积极参与政治了。

Exponent.DEF: to take part in a competition or race
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Athletes from all over the world will be competing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自世界各地的运动员将参加角逐。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s hoping to compete in the Olympic Games.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望能参加奥运会。

Sense.DEF: the act of taking part in an activity or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for your participation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你的参与。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We want more participation in the decision-making.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想更多地参与决策。

Sense.EXAMPLE: entertainment with plenty of audience participation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多观众参与的娱乐活动

Sense.DEF: a participatory way of organizing something, making decisions etc is one that involves everyone who will be affected
Sense.EXAMPLE: a participatory democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众参与的民主

Sense.DEF: using a participle, or having the form of a participle

PronCodes.PRON: 'pɑːtɪsɪp ə l, 'pɑːtəsɪp ə l, pɑː'tɪsɪp ə l, pɑː'tɪsəp ə l

Sense.DEF:
one of the forms of a verb that are used to make tenses. In English,
present participle s
end in -ing and
past participle s
usually end in -ed or -en.
a very small piece of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: dust particles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尘埃

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tiny particles of soil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 细小的土壤颗粒

Sense.LEXUNIT: not a particle of truth/evidence etc
Sense.DEF: no truth etc at all
Sense.TRAN: 没有一点真实性/证据等
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s not a particle of truth in what he says.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说的话没有半点是真的。

Sense.DEF: one of the very small pieces of matter that an atom consists of

an adverb or
preposition
that can combine with a verb to form a
phrasal verb
Sense.TRAN: 〔与动词构成短语的〕小品词﹐虚词

Sense.DEF: a machine used in scientific studies which makes the very small pieces of matter that atoms are made of move at high speeds
the study of the way that parts of atoms develop and behave
Sense.TRAN: 粒子物理学﹐高能物理学

Sense.DEF: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other
Sense.EXAMPLE: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most students choose one particular area for research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a particular type of food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某一类食品

Sense.DEF: special or great
Sense.TRAN: 特殊的﹐特别的﹔不寻常的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should pay particular attention to spelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该特别注意拼写。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For no particular reason , he quit the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么特别原因他就辞了工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Of particular concern is the rising cost of transportation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特别令人担忧的是交通成本日益上升。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had nothing particular planned.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有什么特别的计划。

Sense.DEF: very careful about choosing exactly what you like and not easily satisfied
Sense.TRAN: 讲究的﹔挑剔的﹐吹毛求疵的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marty’s very particular about his food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

Sense.DEF: especially
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a good concert - I enjoyed the last song in particular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一场不错的音乐会——我尤其喜欢最后那首歌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Was there anything in particular that you wanted to talk about?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有什么特别想谈的吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘What did you want?’ ‘Oh, nothing in particular.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想要什么？”“噢﹐没什么特别的。”

Sense.DEF: the facts and details about a job, property, legal case etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You may be required to give particulars of the change in your financial position.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能会被要求详细说明你财务状况的变化。

Sense.EXAMPLE: For further particulars , contact the College secretary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲了解详情﹐请与学院秘书联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send your particulars details such as your name, address, profession etc to the address above.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请将个人资料寄往上述地址。

Sense.DEF: in every detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: The documents were identical in almost every particular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文件几乎在每个细节上都是完全一样的。

Sense.DEF: a quality that makes something different from all others
Sense.EXAMPLE: the particularity of her style of writing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她写作风格的特色

Sense.DEF: the quality of being exact and paying attention to details
a detail
to give the details of something
more than usual or more than others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve was in a particularly bad mood when he got back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫回来时情绪特别不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant is particularly popular with young people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家餐厅尤其受到年轻人的欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are hoping to expand our business, particularly in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望扩大业务﹐尤其是在欧洲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: British farmers, particularly those producing lamb, are very worried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国农场主﹐尤其是养羊羔的农场主﹐非常担忧。

Subsense.DEF: not very
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not particularly impressed with their performance.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是特别欣赏他们的表演。

Subsense.DEF: not very much
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want to come to the party?’ ‘Not particularly.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想来参加聚会吗？”“不是特别想。”

Sense.DEF: harmful dust in the air, especially produced by car engines
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指空气中由汽车引擎排出的〕有害微粒［颗粒］

Sense.DEF: an occasion when two people leave each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: an emotional parting at the airport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人伤感的机场离别
Sense.EXAMPLE: the moment of parting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离别时分

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave her a light kiss on parting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 分别时他轻轻地吻了她一下。

Sense.DEF: the line on your head made by dividing your hair with a comb
Sense.EXAMPLE: a centre parting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔头发的〕中分

Sense.DEF: the point at which two people or organizations decide to separate
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个人或机构〕决定分手的时刻﹐决定分道扬镳的地步

Sense.DEF: a kiss etc that you give someone as you leave
an unpleasant remark that you make just as you are leaving, especially at the end of an argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指争论结束时说的令人不快的〕临别狠话
Sense.EXAMPLE: As her parting shot, she told me never to phone her again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临别时她丢下一句狠话﹐叫我再也不要打电话给她了。

Sense.DEF: strongly supporting a particular political party, plan or leader, usually without considering the other choices carefully
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某个政党﹑计划或领导人〕偏袒的﹐盲目支持的
Sense.EXAMPLE: British newspapers are highly partisan .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国报纸的立场壁垒分明。

Sense.DEF: relating to the fighting of an armed group against an enemy that has taken control of its country
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nature of partisan warfare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游击战的本质

Sense.DEF: someone who strongly supports a political party, plan, or leader
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个政党﹑计划或领导人的〕坚决支持者﹐忠贞分子﹐死硬分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a media campaign to represent Democrats as angry partisans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把民主党人描述成愤怒的死硬派的媒体宣传

Sense.DEF: a member of an armed group that fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country
a thin wall that separates one part of a room from another
the action of separating a country into two or more independent countries

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the partition of India
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对印度的分割

Sense.DEF: to divide a country, building, or room into two or more parts
to divide part of a room from the rest by using a partition
Sense.EXAMPLE: They partitioned off part of the living room to make a study.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把客厅隔出一部分当书房。

Sense.DEF: a word which comes before a noun and shows that only part of something is being described, for example the word ‘some’ in the phrase ‘some of the cake’
Sense.TRAN: 部分量词〔表示部分的词﹐如短语some of the cake中的some〕

Sense.DEF: to some degree, but not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poor weather was partly responsible for the crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气不好是造成坠机事故的部分原因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s problems are partly due to bad management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司的问题部分是由于管理不善造成的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is partly because of her sick mother that she hasn’t taken the job abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有接受那份去国外的工作﹐部分原因是母亲病了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group is funded partly by the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个团体的部分资金由政府提供。

Sense.DEF: one of two people who are married, or who live together and have a sexual relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: Discuss your worries with your partner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和伴侣谈谈你的忧虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only 29% of lone parents receive financial support from their former partners .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有29%的单身家长得到他们前配偶的经济资助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sexual partner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性伴侣

Sense.DEF: one of the owners of a business
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a partner in a law firm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一家律师事务所的合伙人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The senior partner has retired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级合伙人退休了。

Sense.DEF: someone you do a particular activity with, for example dancing or playing a game against two other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clare’s my tennis partner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔是我的网球搭档。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take your partners for the next dance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挑选下一支舞的舞伴吧。

Sense.DEF: a country or organization that another country or organization has an agreement with
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nigeria is our principal trading partner in Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼日利亚是我们在非洲的主要贸易伙伴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group is a junior partner less important group in the PLO’s governing coalition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体是巴解组织执政联盟中的一个小派别。

Sense.DEF: two people who have planned and done something together, especially something that slightly annoys other people – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指恶作剧的〕同伙﹐共犯〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to be someone’s partner in a dance, game etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在跳舞﹑游戏等中〕做…的同伴[搭档]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I used to partner him in tennis matches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过去常在网球比赛中与他搭档。

Sense.DEF: the state of being a partner in business

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been in partnership with her for five years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和她合伙已经有五年了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s gone into partnership with two local doctors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已和当地的两名医生合伙开业。

Sense.DEF: a business owned by two or more people
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s one of the most successful partnerships in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它是该国最成功的合伙企业之一。

Sense.DEF: a relationship between two people, organizations, or countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个人﹑组织或国家之间的〕合作关系﹐伙伴关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several youth charities have formed a partnership to help these homeless teenagers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为帮助这些无家可归的少年﹐一些青年慈善团体建立了合作关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The close partnership between Britain and the US will continue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国和美国将继续保持亲密的伙伴关系。

Sense.DEF: one of the types into which words are divided in grammar according to their use, such as noun, verb, or adjective

the past tense of
partake
a fat brown bird with a short tail which is shot for sport and food
a song that consists of several voice parts, usually singing without a piano etc
someone who has a part-time job works for only part of each day or week
Sense.EXAMPLE: a part-time job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兼职工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: women wishing to return to work on a part-time basis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望以兼职形式重返职场的女性

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She wants to work part-time after she’s had the baby.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 生完孩子后她希望干一份兼职工作。

Sense.DEF: for some of the distance or after some of the time has passed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got the bus partway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在半路上了公共汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She left partway through the two-year contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两年的合同没有到期她就离开了。

Sense.DEF: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having a small party this evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今晚有个小聚会﹐庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The university threw a party to welcome them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学举办联欢会欢迎他们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you going to the party tonight?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚你去参加聚会吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I met John at a party a couple of months ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个月前我在一次聚会上遇到了约翰。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the party spirit the way someone feels when they are really enjoying a party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加社交聚会的乐趣

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: a political organization with particular beliefs and aims, which you can vote for in elections
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have always voted for the Labour Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直投工党的票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He failed to win the party’s nomination for President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他未能获得党内总统候选人提名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conference is open to all party members.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次会议向全体党员开放。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: a group of people who go somewhere together or do a job together
Sense.TRAN: 〔共同去某地或做某事的〕一组﹐一队﹐一群

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a party of tourists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群游客

Sense.EXAMPLE: There were several students in our party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们小组里有几名学生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A search party was sent out to look for the missing climbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支搜救队被派去寻找失踪的登山者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rescue party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援队
Sense.EXAMPLE: Admission is free for school parties .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校团体免收入场费。

Sense.DEF: one of the people or groups who are involved in a legal argument or agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: helping the two parties to reach an agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有助于双方达成协议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sees himself as the innocent party in this dispute.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为自己在这场纠纷中是无过错方。

Sense.DEF: to be involved in an activity or decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was not a party to this discussion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有参与这次讨论。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Labour Party and the Conservative Party are the two main political parties in Britain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党和保守党是英国的两大政党。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The leadership race within the Republican Party is almost over.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党内的领导权之争已差不多结束。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a party that is not in power
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The tax increase was criticized by opposition parties.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高税收遭到了反对党的抨击。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the party in power
