Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s been a Conservative party member for 20 years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成为保守党员已有20年。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He met with opposition party leaders.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他会见了反对党领导人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who represents a political party in an election
strong supporters of a party
someone who works hard for a party
a political party’s official plan or position on important subjects

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you think the Labour Party can win the next election?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为工党会在下次大选中获胜吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: From 1945 until 1951 the Labour Party was in power in Britain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1945 年到1951年期间工党是英国的执政党。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: begins to be the government

Exponent.DEF: a social event when a lot of people meet together to enjoy themselves by eating, drinking, dancing etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’re having a party for Sarah’s 40th birthday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开派对庆祝萨拉的40岁生日。

Exponent.DEF: an informal party
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Christmas is the perfect time for a family get-together.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节是家人团聚的最佳时光。

Exponent.DEF: a large formal party where people dance
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the end of term ball
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: （学）期末舞会

Exponent.DEF: a large formal party, especially one after a wedding or to welcome an important person
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The wedding reception is at a nearby hotel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼招待会安排在附近的一家酒店。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a reception for the Thai Foreign Minister
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 欢迎泰国外交部长的招待会

Exponent.DEF: a large formal or official party
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He has been asked to play at many corporate functions (=an official party held by a company).
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被邀请到许多公司宴会上表演。

Exponent.DEF: a party or special event that is organized in order to celebrate something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the country’s 50th anniversary celebrations
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的50周年庆典

Exponent.DEF: a party, especially a big one that a lot of famous people go to – used especially in journalism
Exponent.TRAN: 盛典,盛大的聚会〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the star’s birthday bash
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位明星的生日盛典
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a picture of him at a Hollywood bash
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在好莱坞盛大庆典上的一幅照片

Exponent.DEF: a party
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’re having a do to celebrate Margaret’s birthday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们办了个派对为玛格丽特庆生。

Exponent.DEF: a party where people are invited to someone’s house for an evening meal
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I met him at a dinner party.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在一次家宴上碰到他的。

Exponent.DEF: a party that you have when you move into a new house
a party that people go to in order to talk and have a drink together for a few hours
a party where people dress in special clothes, for example to look like a famous person or a character in a story
a social event just before a wedding, for a woman who is getting married and her female friends
Exponent.TRAN: 〔只有女性参加的〕准新娘聚会

Exponent.DEF: a social event just before a wedding, for a man who is getting married and his male friends
Exponent.TRAN: 〔只有男性参加的〕准新郎聚会

Exponent.DEF: an event at which people give presents to a woman who is going to have a baby or get married
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为即将分娩或结婚的女性举办的〕送礼会

Sense.DEF: to enjoy yourself with a group of other people by drinking alcohol, eating, dancing etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过饮酒﹑吃饭﹑跳舞等〕取乐﹐玩乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s party!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家尽兴玩吧！

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys going to parties and drinking a lot of alcohol, and behaving in a loud and often rude way
Sense.TRAN: 热衷于参加社交聚会的人﹐社交动物

Sense.DEF: a small gift that people give to children at a party
Sense.TRAN: 〔社交聚会上送给孩子的〕聚会小礼物

Sense.DEF: someone who is at a party
Sense.EXAMPLE: young partygoers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会上的年轻人

Sense.DEF: the official opinion of a political party or other organization, which its members are expected to agree with and support

GramExa.GLOSS: to support the official opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He refused to toe the party line.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒不遵从该党的路线。

Sense.DEF: a song, dance etc that you often perform to entertain people at parties
Sense.TRAN: 聚会保留节目指某人常在聚会上表演的歌曲﹑舞蹈等〕

Sense.DEF: relating to activities in which people try to get support for one political party in a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a party political broadcast on television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视上的政党宣传广播
Sense.EXAMPLE: party political propaganda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政党宣传

Sense.DEF: activities that are concerned with getting support for one political party in a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision was influenced by party politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一决定受到党派政治的影响。

Sense.DEF: someone who spoils other people’s fun
a dividing wall between two houses, apartments etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔两座房屋或公寓等之间的〕界墙﹐共有墙

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for someone from a low social position who has suddenly become rich and powerful
Sense.TRAN: 暴发户﹐新贵〔含侮辱意味〕

Sense.DEF:
a dance in
ballet
performed by a man and a woman
a piece of soft cloth that is worn by women around their shoulders
to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd parted to let the truck pass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群分开让卡车通过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave me a smile as he passed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经过时对我微笑了一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We passed a group of students outside the theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在戏院外从一群学生身旁经过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I pass the sports centre on the way to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上班的路上经过体育中心。

Sense.DEF: to go or travel along or through a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: He passed along the corridor to a small room at the back of the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿过走廊来到大楼后面的一间小房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We passed through the gates into a courtyard behind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们穿过几道门进了后面的院子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were just passing through travelling through a place and thought we’d drop in to see you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正好经过﹐于是就想到顺便来看看你。

Sense.DEF: to put something around, through, or across something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He passed the rope carefully around the post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把绳子小心地绕在柱子上。

Sense.DEF: a road, river, or railway line that passes a place goes through or near the place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road passes right through the town centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条路正好穿过镇中心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main railway line passes just north of Manchester.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条铁路干线正好经过曼彻斯特北面。

Sense.DEF: to hold something in your hand and give it to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pass the salt, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把盐递过来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you pass me that bag by your feet?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能把你脚边的那个包递给我吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She passed a cup of tea to the headmaster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她递给校长一杯茶。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I passed the note back to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把纸条递还给她。

Sense.DEF: to give information or a job to another person so that they can deal with it
Sense.TRAN: 把〔信息或工作〕转给某人〔以便处理〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll pass the information on to our sales department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会把信息转给我们的销售部。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve passed the enquiry over to the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把调查事宜转给了警方处理。

Subsense.DEF: if time passes, it goes by
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The days passed slowly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日子慢慢地过去。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She became more ambitious as the years passed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年年过去﹐她变得愈加雄心勃勃。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They sat in silence while the minutes passed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间一分一秒地过去﹐他们坐着沉默不语。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hardly a day passes without more bad news about the economy there is bad news almost every day .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有哪一天不传出经济方面的坏消息。

Subsense.DEF: if you pass time or pass your life in a particular way, you spend it in that way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We passed the winter pleasantly enough.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相当愉快地度过了那个冬季。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We played cards to pass the time to help us stop feeling bored .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打扑克牌消磨时间。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that they spend time doing something rather t han pass time.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们表示花时间做某事时,常说spend time,而不说 pass time
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I spent the whole day watching TV.

Subsense.DEF: to succeed in an examination or test
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Did you pass all your exams?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你考试都及格了吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He hasn’t passed his driving test yet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还没有通过驾驶考试。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She passed with flying colours got very high marks .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以高分通过。

Subsense.DEF: to officially decide that someone has succeeded in an examination or test
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The examiners will only pass you if they feel that you have done the work properly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有考官认为你把工作做好了﹐他们才会让你通过考试。

Subsense.DEF: to officially accept a law or proposal, especially by voting
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指以投票方式〕通过〔法律或提案〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Plans to extend the hotel have now been passed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扩建酒店的计划现已获得通过。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The motion was passed by 16 votes to 11.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项动议以16票对11票获得通过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first Transport Act was passed in 1907.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首部《交通法》于1907年通过。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has passed new legislation to protect consumers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府通过了新法律以保护消费者。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The United Nations Security Council has passed a resolution asking the two countries to resume peace negotiations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国安全理事会通过了一项决议﹐敦促两国重启和平谈判。

Subsense.DEF: if a law or proposal passes an official group, it is officially accepted by that group
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bill failed to pass the House of Representatives.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项法案没有在众议院获得通过。

Sense.DEF: if something passes between people, they speak to each other or do something together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A glance of recognition passed between them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对视了一下﹐认出了对方。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Please say nothing of what has passed here today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天在这里说的一切请严格保密。

Sense.DEF: to say something that gives your opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I can’t pass any comment on this matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于这件事我恐怕无可奉告。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He passed some remark about doctors being paid too much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说了一些医生工资过高的话。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately not say anything when someone says or does something that you do not like
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物不予理会[不加追究]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carla made some comment about my work but I decided to let it pass .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡拉对我的工作作了一些评论﹐但我决定不予理会。

Sense.DEF: to end or stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a couple of hours the storm passed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个小时之后暴风雨停止了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The feeling of sickness soon passed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶心的感觉很快就过去了。

Sense.DEF: to kick, throw, or hit a ball to a member of your own team during a game

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He passed to Beckham on the edge of the penalty area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把球传给在禁区边缘的贝克汉姆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you allowed to pass the ball back to the goalkeeper?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 允许把球回传给守门员吗？

Sense.DEF: to become more than a particular number or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of unemployed has passed the two million mark for the first time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业人数首次突破两百万大关。

Sense.DEF: to happen without anyone noticing or saying anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: His resignation passed largely unnoticed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎无人知晓他辞了职。

Sense.LEXUNIT: pass the time of day (with sb)
Sense.DEF: to talk to someone for a short time in order to be friendly
to change from being controlled or owned by one person to being controlled or owned by someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The land will pass to my son when I die.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我死后土地归我儿子所有。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Control of these services has now passed into the hands of the local authorities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些机构现在转由地方当局管理。

Sense.DEF: to change from one state or condition into another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chemical passes from a liquid to a solid state during the cooling process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种化学物质在冷却过程中由液态转化为固态。

Sense.DEF: to officially decide how a criminal will be punished, and to announce what the punishment will be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judges no longer have the power to pass the death sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官们再也无权判处犯人死刑。

Sense.DEF: to give your opinion about someone’s behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to pass judgment on my colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想评论我的同事。

Sense.DEF: to give no answer to a question because you do not know the answer
Sense.TRAN: 不知道﹔〔因不知道答案而〕略过
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Who won the World Cup in 1998?’ ‘Pass.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “1998 年谁赢了世界杯？”“过。”

Sense.DEF: to not accept an invitation or offer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I’ll have to pass on that offer of coffee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝咖啡还是免了吧。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone does not talk about something that is secret
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry. Not a word of this will pass my lips.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐这件事我一个字也不会说出去。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone does not eat or drink a particular thing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Not a drop of liquor has passed my lips.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我滴酒不沾。

Sense.DEF:
to let out a waste substance from your
bladder
or
bowel s
Sense.EXAMPLE: See your doctor immediately if you pass any blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果便中有血要马上去看医生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was having difficulty passing water letting out urine .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他排尿困难。

Sense.DEF: to happen
to offer or show something to each person in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pass the cookies around, would you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把小甜饼分发给大家﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: if someone or something can pass as someone or something, they are similar enough to be accepted as that type of person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: His French is so good that he can pass as a Frenchman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的法语太好了﹐很可能被当成法国人。

Sense.DEF: to die – use this when you want to avoid saying the word ‘die’
to go past a person, place, vehicle etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They all waved as they passed by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们经过时都挥手致意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you be passing by the supermarket on your way home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你回家的路上经过超级市场吗？

Sense.DEF: if something passes you by, it happens but you are not involved in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt that life was passing her by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己未受到生活的眷顾。

Sense.DEF: to give or teach something to people who are younger than you or live after you

GramExa.PROPFORM: pass sth down (from sb) to sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tradition has been passed down from father to son for generations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一传统由父传子﹐世代相传。

Sense.DEF: if something passes for another thing, it is so similar to that thing that people think that is what it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: With my hair cut short, I could have passed for a boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是把头发剪短﹐或许会被当成男孩。

Sense.DEF: if an event passes off well, badly etc, it happens in that way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The visit passed off without any serious incidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次访问没有发生太大的意外。

Sense.DEF: to make people think that someone or something is another thing
Sense.TRAN: 把某人/某物冒充为… 假称某人/某物是…
Sense.EXAMPLE: They bought up pieces of old furniture and passed them off as valuable antiques.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们收购旧家具﹐然后假称它们是值钱的古董。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He passed himself off as a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他谎称自己是医生。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a piece of information that someone else has given to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She said she’d pass the message on to the other students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她会把消息传给其他学生。

Subsense.DEF:
to give something, especially a disease, to your children through your
gene s
to give a slight illness to someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One catches the virus and they pass it on to the rest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人感染这种病毒﹐然后传染给其余的人。

Sense.DEF: to make someone else pay the cost of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any increase in our costs will have to be passed on to the consumer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们增加的任何成本都得转嫁给消费者。

Sense.DEF: to die – use this when you want to avoid saying the word ‘die’
to become unconscious
Sense.EXAMPLE: I nearly passed out when I saw all the blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到那么多血我差点昏过去。

Sense.DEF: to finish a course of study at a military school or police college
to give something, such as books or papers, to everyone in a group
if you pass someone over for a job, you choose someone else who is younger or lower in the organization than them
Sense.TRAN: 〔某项工作〕不考虑某人﹐跳过某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the second time I’ve been passed over for promotion someone else has been given a higher job instead of me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这已经是第二次没有得到升职机会了。

Sense.DEF: if you pass over a remark or subject, you do not spend any time discussing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔谈话中〕忽略某事﹐对某事不加理会
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to pass over this quite quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一点我想一带而过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we’d better pass over that last remark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们最好不要理会最后那句话。

Sense.DEF: to not make use of a chance to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t think you should pass up the opportunity to go to university.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你不该放弃上大学的机会。

Sense.DEF: an official piece of paper which shows that you are allowed to enter a building or travel on something without paying
Sense.TRAN: 出入证﹐通行证﹔（免费）乘车证
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guard checked our passes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警卫检查了我们的通行证。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They issued us with free passes to the theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发给我们那家剧院的免费入场券。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can buy a cheap one-day bus pass .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以买一张便宜的一日有效的公共汽车乘车证。

Sense.DEF: a successful result in an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will need at least three passes to get onto the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你至少需要三门及格才能上这门课。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you get a pass in English?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你英语考试及格了吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: The pass mark the mark you need to be successful is 55%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 及格分数是55分。

Sense.DEF: when you kick, throw, or hit a ball to another member of your team during a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was a brilliant pass by Holden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是霍尔登的一记精彩传球。

Sense.DEF: to try to kiss or touch another person with the intention of starting a sexual relationship with them
a high road or path that goes between mountains to the other side
Sense.EXAMPLE: a narrow, winding mountain pass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狭窄蜿蜒的山道

Sense.DEF: one part of a process that involves dealing with the whole of a group or thing several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the first pass we eliminated all the candidates who didn’t have the right experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一轮我们淘汰了所有不具备相关经验的候选人。

Sense.DEF: a movement in which an aircraft flies once over a place which it is attacking
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机等在攻击目标上空的〕飞越

Sense.DEF: if things have come to a pretty or sorry pass, a situation has become very bad
fairly good, but not excellent
Sense.TRAN: 过得去的﹐尚可的﹐还好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was excellent and the wine was passable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭菜很好﹐酒还过得去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can do a passable imitation of the maths teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他模仿数学老师还真有点像。

Sense.DEF: a road or river that is passable is not blocked, so you can travel along it or across it
Sense.TRAN: 〔道路或河流〕可通行的﹐能通过的

Sense.DEF: in a way that is fairly good, but not excellent
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were one or two passably funny jokes but it was mostly dull.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一两个笑话还算滑稽﹐不过大多数挺无趣的。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow area with walls on either side which connects one room or place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: My office is just along the passage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的办公室就在过道旁边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked down a narrow passage to the back of the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿着一条狭窄的通道来到大楼的后面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an underground passage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地下通道

Sense.DEF: a short part of a book, poem, speech, piece of music etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑诗歌﹑演讲﹑乐曲等的〕一段﹐一节

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He read out a short passage from the Bible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朗读了《圣经》里的一小段。

Sense.DEF: the movement of people or vehicles along a road or across an area of land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bridge isn’t strong enough to allow the passage of heavy vehicles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座桥不够坚固﹐无法让重型车辆通过。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides agreed to allow the free passage of medical supplies into the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都同意允许医疗用品自由运入该地区。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was guaranteed safe passage out of the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得到保证可以安全离境。

Sense.DEF: when a new law is discussed and accepted by a parliament or Congress

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bill was amended several times during its passage through Congress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项法案在提交国会通过时作过几次修正。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They are expecting the new legislation to have quite a rough passage be discussed and criticized a lot through Parliament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们预计新的法律在议会通过时会遭遇重重困难。

Sense.DEF: a journey on a ship

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents couldn’t afford the passage to America.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母付不起去美国的船费。

Sense.DEF: a tube in your body that air or liquid can pass through
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nasal passages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼻道

Sense.DEF: a way through something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police forced a passage through the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察在人群中辟出一条通道。

Sense.DEF: the passing of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: With the passage of time, things began to look more hopeful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着时间的流逝﹐事情开始显得更有希望。

Sense.DEF:
a
passage 1
Sense.EXAMPLE: He led me down a narrow passageway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带着我穿过一条狭窄的过道。

Sense.DEF: a book in which a record is kept of the money you put into and take out of a bank account
no longer modern or fashionable
a group of people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a whole passel of kids
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群孩子

Sense.DEF: someone who is travelling in a vehicle, plane, boat etc, but is not driving it or working on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆﹑飞机﹑船舶等的〕乘客﹐旅客
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither the driver nor the passengers were hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机和乘客均未受伤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a crash involving a passenger train
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及一辆客运列车的撞车事故

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rail passengers now face even longer delays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路旅客目前面临着更长时间的晚点。

Sense.DEF: someone in a group who does not do their share of the group’s work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company can’t afford to carry any passengers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司养不起吃闲饭的人。

Sense.DEF: the seat in the front of a vehicle next to the driver
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车驾驶员旁边的〕乘客座位﹔副驾驶座位

Sense.DEF: someone who is walking past a place by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sell drinks to passersby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们卖饮料给过路的人。

Sense.DEF: used to show that a person or subject is referred to many times in a book or article
Sense.TRAN: 多处﹐到处﹐各处〔用于表示某人或某话题在书或文章中出现多次〕

Sense.DEF: the process of time going by
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the old traditions have died out with the passing of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着时间的推移﹐大多数古老传统都已消亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The passing of the years had done nothing to improve his temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岁月的流逝一点也没有让他的坏脾气有所好转。

Sense.DEF: if you say something in passing, you mention it while you are mainly talking about something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔在谈论别的事情时〕顺便说起某事﹐附带提及某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did mention his brother’s wife, but only in passing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他确实提到了他的弟媳﹐但只是顺带而已。

Sense.DEF: the passing of something is the fact that it has ended
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old regime was defeated, and few people mourned its passing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧政权被打垮﹐几乎没有人对其消亡感到痛惜。

Sense.DEF: the passing of a person is their death – use this when you want to avoid using the word ‘death’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing could fill the gap in her life left by his passing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去世后什么都无法填补她生活的空虚。

Sense.DEF: going past a place or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael watched the passing cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔注视着来往的汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A passing motorist stopped to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位驾车经过的司机停下来帮忙。

Sense.DEF: the days, weeks, years etc that pass
Sense.TRAN: 流逝的一天天/一周周/一年年等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her grief became less intense with the passing years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着光阴的流逝﹐她的悲伤不那么强烈了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With each passing day she grew stronger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一天比一天强壮起来。

Sense.DEF: a passing thought or feeling is short and not very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had only ever shown a passing interest in sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于体育运动﹐他只是曾经表现出一时的兴趣。

Sense.DEF: a passing remark is one that you make while you are talking about something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made only a passing reference to her achievements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仅仅顺便提了提她的成就。

Sense.DEF: a very strong feeling of sexual love
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes were burning with passion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼中欲火燃烧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her passion for a married man
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对一名有妇之夫炽烈的爱

Sense.DEF: a very strong belief or feeling about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spoke with considerable passion about the importance of art and literature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他激动地谈起艺术和文学的重要性。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The issue arouses strong passions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事激起了人们强烈的情绪。

Sense.DEF: a very strong liking for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his passion for football
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对足球的热爱

Sense.EXAMPLE: Gardening was her great passion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她酷爱园艺。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become very angry
the suffering and death of Jesus Christ
showing or involving very strong feelings of sexual love
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a brief but passionate love affair with an older woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和一个比他年长的女子有过一段短暂而炽热的情史。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very passionate young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位感情热烈的年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a passionate lover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有激情的爱人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a passionate kiss
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激情的一吻

Sense.DEF: someone who has a passionate belief believes something very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a passionate supporter of women’s rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女权利的狂热支持者
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a passionate belief in justice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚信正义。

Sense.DEF: if you are passionate about something, you like it a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: She developed a passionate interest in wild flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对野花产生了强烈的兴趣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve always been passionate about football.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直酷爱足球。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Peter is passionately involved in environmental issues.

Sense.DEF: a climbing plant with large attractive flowers
a small fruit which has a brown skin and many seeds
Sense.TRAN: 鸡蛋果﹐洋石榴﹐西番莲果

Sense.DEF: with no strong feelings of love
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dull, passionless marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乏味且没有激情的婚姻

Sense.DEF: a play that tells the story of the suffering and death of Jesus Christ
someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: their passive acceptance of their fate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对命运的消极接受

Sense.DEF: a passive verb or sentence has as its subject the person or thing to which an action is done, as in ‘His father was killed in a car accident.’

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He listened passively as his sentence was read out.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣布对他的判决时他只是被动地听着。

Sense.DEF: the passive form of a verb, for example ‘was destroyed’ in the sentence ‘The building was destroyed during the war.’
a way of protesting against something or opposing a government without using violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tried to achieve their aims by passive resistance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图通过非暴力抵抗达到他们的目的。

Sense.DEF: the act of breathing in smoke that is in the air around you when someone else is smoking cigarettes

the
passive 2

to make a verb
passive
, or to become passive
a key that will open several different locks in a building
a Jewish religious holiday when people remember the escape of the Jews from Egypt
Sense.TRAN: 〔犹太教纪念犹太人逃离埃及的〕逾越节

Sense.DEF: a small official document that you get from your government, that proves who you are, and which you need in order to leave your country and enter other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have an Irish passport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我持爱尔兰护照。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They need to check that your passport is in order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要检查一下你的护照是否有效。

Sense.DEF: something that makes it easy for you to achieve success, good health etc
Sense.TRAN: 获取成功/健康/爱情等的通行证
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw a good diet as a passport to good health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为合理饮食能带来健康。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t assume that winning a talent contest is a passport to success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要以为在才艺比赛中得了奖今后就一定会成功。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have a Canadian passport.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我持加拿大护照。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can apply for an Italian passport if your parents are Italian.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果父母是意大利人,可以去申请意大利护照。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was born in India but has a British passport.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出生在印度,但有英国护照。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is officially acceptable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: For travel abroad, you must have a valid passport.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 出国旅行必须拥有有效护照。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who has a passport

Sense.DEF: the place where your passport is checked when you leave or enter a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took us ages to get through passport control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们花了好长时间才通过护照检查关口。

Sense.DEF: a secret group of letters or numbers that you must type into a computer before you can use a system or program
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用计算机系统或程序所用的〕密码
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enter your password, then click on the ‘proceed’ icon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 键入密码﹐然后点击“继续”图标。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give your user name and password.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 输入用户名和密码。

Sense.DEF: a secret word or phrase that someone has to say before they are allowed to enter a place such as a military camp
done, used, or experienced before now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judging by her past performance, Jane should do very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从以往的表现来看﹐简应该会干得很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From past experience she knew that it was no use arguing with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据过去的经验﹐她知道和他争论是没有用的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Study some past exam papers to get an idea of the questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细看看以前的一些考卷﹐了解一下考题。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a period up until now
Sense.EXAMPLE: the events of the past year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去一年中发生的事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the past two weeks, 12 people have died of the disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去两周内已有12人死于这种疾病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has been feeling tired for the past few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些天来她一直感到疲倦。

Sense.DEF: finished or having come to an end
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winter is past and spring has come at last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天过去﹐春天终于来临。
Sense.EXAMPLE: writers from past centuries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前几个世纪的作家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tradition rooted in times long past
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起源于很久以前的传统

Sense.DEF: having held a particular position in the past or achieved a particular honour in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a past president of the golf club
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家高尔夫俱乐部的前任会长

Sense.EXAMPLE: a celebration for past and present employees of the newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为该报社的前雇员和现雇员举办的庆祝会
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bruce Jenner, a past Olympic champion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁斯‧詹纳﹐前奥运会冠军

Sense.DEF:
relating to the
past tense
later than a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s ten past nine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是九点十分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should be finished by half past 30 minutes after the hour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该可以在30分钟之后完成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was past midnight when the party ended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派对结束的时候已经过了午夜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on Annie, it’s long past your bedtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐安妮﹐早就过了你的上床时间了。

Sense.DEF: further than a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital’s just up this road, about a mile past the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院就在这条路上﹐经过学校再往前约一英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are parking spaces over there, just past a little further than the garage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那边有停车位﹐就在那个车库过去一点的地方。

Sense.DEF: up to and beyond a person or place, without stopping
Sense.EXAMPLE: She waved as she drove past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开车经过的时候挥了挥手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you be going past my house on your way home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你回家的路上会经过我家吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that someone passes close to you and does not stop
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 径直经过〔强调经过但没有停留〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Monica hurried straight past me and down the steps.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫妮卡从我身边匆匆经过﹐走下了台阶。

Sense.DEF: if a period of time goes past, it passes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Weeks went past without any news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几周过去了﹐一点消息也没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hours seemed to fly past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个小时一晃而过。

Sense.DEF: beyond or no longer at a particular point or stage
Sense.TRAN: 过了﹐不再处于〔某一点或某一阶段〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roses were already past their best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰花已经败了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reid never really got past the stage of copying other artists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里德从未真正脱离模仿其他艺术家的阶段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pot of yoghurt well past its sell-by date
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一罐早已超过保质期的酸奶
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Italian singer who was then past her prime no longer strong and active
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时已经过气的意大利女歌手
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m past caring about my appearance I do not care about it any more .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已不再关心自己的外表了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I wouldn’t put it past sb (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: used to say that you would not be surprised if someone did something bad or unusual because it is typical of them to do that type of thing
Sense.TRAN: 我认为某人很有可能（做某事）〔指坏事或不寻常的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t put it past Colin to cheat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科林作弊我可不奇怪。

Sense.DEF: too old to be able to do what you used to do, or too old to be useful
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕比不上年轻时﹔〔物〕太旧而无用
Sense.EXAMPLE: People seem to think that just because I’m retired, I’m past it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们似乎认为我退休了就不中用了。

Sense.DEF: something that is past due has not been paid or done by the time it should have been

Subsense.DEF: the time that existed before the present

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lake was smaller in the past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这湖以前要小些。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Good manners have become a thing of the past something that does not exist any more .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以礼待人似乎已成了过去式。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s time she stopped living in the past thinking only about the past and began to think about her future.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不该再沉湎过去﹐应开始想想将来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She allowed her mind to drift towards the recent past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让自己的思绪飘到了不久以前。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I did a law degree some time in the dim and distant past a long time ago .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很久以前我攻读过法律学位。

Subsense.DEF:
the
past tense

Sense.DEF: used to say that an unpleasant experience has ended and can be forgotten
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mustn’t think about it. It’s all in the past now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你千万不要再想那件事﹐现在一切都过去了。

Sense.DEF: the past life or existence of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: At some time in its past the church was rebuilt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史上这座教堂曾重建过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman who ran the bar had a very shady past events in her past which might be considered bad .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开这酒吧的女人有非常见不得人的过去。

Sense.DEF: an Italian food made from flour, eggs, and water and cut into various shapes, usually eaten with a sauce
Sense.EXAMPLE: I eat a lot of pasta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我经常吃意大利面食。

Sense.DEF: a soft smooth food, made by crushing meat, fish etc
a soft thick mixture that can easily be shaped or spread
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mix the powder with enough water to make a smooth paste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把粉末和足够的水混合调成均匀的糊状。

Sense.DEF: a type of glue that is used for sticking paper onto things
Sense.EXAMPLE: wallpaper paste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贴墙纸的糨糊

Sense.DEF: pieces of glass that are used in jewellery to look like valuable stones
to stick something to something else using glue
Sense.EXAMPLE: A notice had been pasted to the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张告示被贴在了门上。

Sense.DEF: to make words that you have removed or copied appear in a new place on a computer screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Data can be pasted into word processing documents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据可以粘贴到文字处理文件中。

Sense.DEF:
flat stiff
cardboard
made by sticking sheets of paper together

Subsense.DEF:
a small coloured stick for drawing pictures with, made of a substance like
chalk
a picture drawn with pastels

Sense.DEF: a light colour such as pale blue or pink
Sense.TRAN: 淡而柔和的色彩〔如淡蓝色或粉红色〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a room beautifully furnished in soft pastels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以柔和色彩装饰的漂亮房间

Sense.DEF: pastel colours are light and pale
Sense.EXAMPLE: pastel blue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡蓝色
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls were painted in pastel shades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙壁被粉刷成了柔和的色彩。

Sense.DEF: drawn using pastels
Sense.TRAN: 用彩色粉笔画的﹔用蜡笔画的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a set of four small pastel drawings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套四幅小蜡笔画

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper with writing and pictures stuck on it that shows what a page will look like when a book or magazine is produced
Sense.TRAN: 拼贴版样〔用于制作书刊〕

Sense.DEF:
a liquid, usually milk, that is pasteurized has been heated using a special process in order to kill any harmful
bacteria
in it
a piece of writing, music, film etc that is deliberately made in the style of someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章﹑音乐﹑电影等的〕模仿作品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film is a pastiche of the Hollywood Wild West.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影模仿了好莱坞西部片。

Sense.DEF: a work of art that consists of a variety of different styles put together
Sense.TRAN: 风格驳杂的艺术作品﹐混成作品﹐集锦

Sense.DEF: the practice of making a piece of writing, music, film etc using the style of something else or using a variety of different styles
Sense.TRAN: 模仿[混成]的艺术手法[实践]

Sense.DEF: a small round sweet, sometimes containing medicine for a sore throat
Sense.EXAMPLE: fruit pastilles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水果润喉糖

Sense.DEF: something that you do because you think it is enjoyable or interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reading was her favourite pastime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阅读是她最喜爱的消遣方式。

Sense.DEF: the activity of moving words from one place to another on a computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔文字在计算机屏幕上的〕粘贴
Sense.EXAMPLE: cutting and pasting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剪切与粘贴

Sense.DEF: an easy defeat of someone in a game or competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔在游戏或比赛中的〕轻松获胜

Sense.DEF: a severe beating
someone who is very skilled at doing something and has done it many times before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s a past master at exploiting other people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很会利用别人。

Sense.DEF: a Christian priest in some Protestant churches
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pastor of Carr’s Lane Congregational church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔里公理会教堂的牧师
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pastor Martin Niemoller
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁·尼默勒牧师

Sense.DEF: relating to the duties of a priest, minister etc towards the members of their religious group
Sense.EXAMPLE: his pastoral work among the congregation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在教堂会众中的牧灵工作

Sense.DEF: typical of the simple peaceful life in the country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a charming pastoral scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的田园景象

Sense.DEF: relating to the duties of a teacher in advising students about their personal needs rather than their schoolwork
Sense.TRAN: 〔教师对学生〕生活辅导的﹐心理辅导的
Sense.EXAMPLE: pastoral care at the school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的生活辅导

Sense.DEF:
the form of a verb used with the verb ‘to have’ in
perfect
tenses (for example ‘eaten’ in ‘I have eaten’), or with the verb ‘to be’ in the
passive
(for example ‘changed’ in ‘it was changed’), or sometimes as an adjective (for example ‘broken’ in ‘a broken leg’)
the form of a verb that shows that the action described by the verb was completed before a particular time in the past, formed in English with ‘had’ and a past participle

smoked
beef
that contains a lot of spices

a mixture of flour, butter, and milk or water, used to make the outer part of baked foods such as
pie s
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来做烘焙食物外皮的〕油酥面团

Sense.DEF: a small sweet cake, made using pastry
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Danish pastry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹麦油酥糕饼

Sense.DEF: a form of a verb that shows that something happened or existed before the present time, typically a form such as ‘walked’, as in ‘I walked away’
pasture
land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
Sense.EXAMPLE: large areas of rough upland pasture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大片起伏的山地牧场
Sense.EXAMPLE: the lush pastures of the southern counties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南部各郡茂盛的牧场

Subsense.DEF: to move cattle, horses etc into a field to feed on the grass
to make someone leave their job because you think they are too old to do it well
Subsense.TRAN: 〔认为某人年纪太大而〕使某人离职﹐使某人退休

Sense.DEF: a new and exciting or better job, place, or activity – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 更刺激[更好]的新职位[地方﹐活动]〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to say goodbye to Paul who leaves us for pastures new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想向保罗道别﹐他要离开我们另谋高就了。

Sense.DEF: to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass
if animals pasture on a particular area of land, they eat the grass that is growing there
pasture
a pasty face looks very pale and unhealthy

a small
pastry
case filled with meat, vegetables etc and baked
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Cornish pasty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康沃尔肉馅饼

Sense.DEF: having a very pale face that looks unhealthy
to lightly touch someone or something several times with your hand flat, especially to give comfort
Sense.EXAMPLE: He patted the dog affectionately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他亲热地轻轻拍了拍那只狗。

Sense.DEF: to praise someone or yourself for doing something well
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can pat yourselves on the back for a job well done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们干得很出色﹐可以自我表扬一下。

Sense.DEF: a friendly act of touching someone with your hand flat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Dodd gave the child a pat on the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多德夫人轻轻拍了拍那个孩子的头。

Sense.DEF: a small flat amount of butter
praise for something that you have done well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex deserves a pat on the back for all his hard work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯干活十分卖力﹐应该受到表扬。

Sense.DEF: a pat answer or explanation seems too quick and too simple and sounds as if it has been used before
Sense.TRAN: 〔回答或解释〕脱口而出的﹐预先准备好似的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are no pat answers to these questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题没有现成的答案。

Sense.DEF: to know something thoroughly so that you can say it, perform it etc immediately without thinking about it
Sense.TRAN: 对某事滚瓜烂熟﹐对某事熟悉得可随口说出[随即表演等]

Sense.DEF: to refuse to change your opinion or decision

PIC.HEADING: PATCHES 徽章﹔补丁﹔眼罩
PIC.PICCONTENT: patch 补丁;eye patch 眼罩;patch AmE 【美】/badge BrE 【英】徽章

Sense.DEF: a small area of something that is different from the area around it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We finally found a patch of grass to sit down on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最后找到一小片草地可以坐下来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Belinda watched a patch of sunlight move slowly across the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝琳达看着一小片阳光从墙的一边缓缓移到另一边。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Look out for icy patches on the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心路上结冰的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cat with a white patch on its chest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胸部有一块白斑的猫
Sense.EXAMPLE: He combs his hair over his bald patch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把头发梳过来盖住秃掉的地方。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of material that is sewn on something to cover a hole in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a jacket with leather patches at the elbows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肘部有皮革补丁的短上衣

Sense.DEF: a small area of ground for growing fruit or vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于种水果或蔬菜的〕小块土地
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strawberry patch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小块草莓地

Sense.DEF: a small computer program that is added to software to solve problems
a piece of material that you wear over your eye to protect it when it has been hurt
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a black patch over one eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一只眼戴着黑眼罩。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of cloth with words or pictures on it that you can sew onto clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔缝在衣服上带有文字或图画的〕缀饰﹐徽章

Sense.DEF: a period of time when you are having a lot of difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gemma’s going through a bad patch right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰玛眼下过得很艰难。

Sense.DEF: an area that someone knows very well because they work or live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Policemen know what’s going on in their home patch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察了解自己辖区的情况。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not be a patch on sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to be much less attractive, good etc than something or someone else
Sense.TRAN: 远不如某人/某物﹐比某人/某物差得远
Sense.EXAMPLE: The second film isn’t a patch on the first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二部电影比第一部差远了。

Sense.DEF: to repair a hole in something by putting a piece of something else over it
to make something quickly or carelessly from a number of different pieces or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔用碎料〕仓促拼制﹔〔把不同的观点〕草草拼凑
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new plan was quickly patched together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项新计划很快就拼凑出来了。

Sense.DEF: to end an argument because you want to stay friendly with someone
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某人〕和解﹔解决 分歧〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to patch up your differences before he leaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量在他走之前解决你们之间的分歧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He went back to patch things up with his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回去想跟妻子和好。

Sense.DEF: to repair a hole in something by putting a piece of something else over it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to patch up the hole in the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得修补屋顶上的洞。

Sense.DEF: to give quick and basic medical treatment to someone who is hurt
Sense.TRAN: 快速处理﹐临时包扎〔伤者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We patched up the wounded as best we could.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽可能地给伤者包扎好。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
perfume
made from the leaves of a South East Asian bush
a type of sewing in which many coloured squares of cloth are stitched together to make one large piece
Sense.TRAN: 〔由各色方形布片拼缝而成的〕拼布工艺（品）﹔拼缝物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patchwork quilt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拼布被﹐百衲被

Sense.DEF: something that is made up of a lot of different things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a patchwork of woods and fields, typical of the English countryside
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树林和田野纵横交错﹐一派典型的英国乡村景象
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The area was a patchwork of local industries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区是本地各家企业的集中地。

Sense.DEF: happening or existing in some areas but not in others
Sense.TRAN: 局部地区的﹔零散的﹐斑驳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: patchy fog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 局部弥漫的雾气

Sense.DEF: not complete enough to be useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: His knowledge of French remained pretty patchy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对法语仍然是一知半解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is only patchy evidence of the animal’s existence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一些零星的证据表明这种动物存在。

Sense.DEF: good in some parts but bad in others
Sense.EXAMPLE: The performance was patchy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出有的部分精彩有的部分没什么意思。

Sense.DEF: the top of your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: his bald pate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他光秃秃的头顶

Sense.DEF: a soft food made from meat or fish, that you can spread on bread
Sense.TRAN: 〔可涂抹在面包上的〕肉酱，鱼酱

Sense.DEF:
your
knee cap

a special document that gives you the right to make or sell a new
invention
or product that no one else is allowed to copy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He applied for a patent for a new method of removing paint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他申请了一项除漆新方法的专利。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He wants to take out a patent on his new type of dustbin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想为他的新型垃圾桶取得专利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drugs are protected by patent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药品受专利保护。

Sense.DEF: protected by a patent
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patent lock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专利锁

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is clearly a lie etc
Sense.TRAN: 明显的谎言/胡说/不可能等

Sense.DEF:
to obtain a special document giving you the right to make or sell a new
invention
or product
thin shiny leather, usually black
Sense.EXAMPLE: patent leather shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漆皮皮鞋

Sense.DEF: very clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treatment is patently not working.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疗法显然没有什么效果。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To say that the proposal has no disadvantages at all is patently untrue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要说这项提议完全没有缺点显然是不正确的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s patently obvious that you’re in love with her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很显然你爱上她了。

Sense.DEF:
a medicine which can be bought without a
prescription a written order from your doctor
Sense.TRAN: 成药〔指不需处方就能买到的药〕

Sense.DEF: father
a father or a man who is the head of a family
Sense.TRAN: 父亲﹔〔男性〕家长﹐一家之主

Sense.DEF: paternal feelings or behaviour are like those of a kind father towards his children
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan took a paternal interest in my work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹像父亲一样关心我的工作。

Sense.DEF: your father’s mother, brother etc
when people in charge of an organization or society protect the members and give them what they need but do not allow them any freedom or responsibility
the fact of being the father of a particular child, or the question of who the child’s father is
Sense.TRAN: 父亲的身份﹔生父身份的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paternity of the child is in dispute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个孩子的生父是谁尚有疑问。

Sense.DEF: a period of time that the father of a new baby is allowed away from work
a legal action in which a mother asks a court of law to find proof that a particular man is the father of her child, usually in order to claim financial support from him
a track that has been made deliberately or made by many people walking over the same ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked nervously up the garden path towards the front door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提心吊胆地沿着花园的小道向前门走去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-worn path across the grass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草地上被踏出的小径
Sense.EXAMPLE: Follow the path along the river to the bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿着河边的小路走到那座桥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a path leading to the summer house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往避暑别墅的小径

Sense.DEF: the space ahead of you as you move along

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police cleared a path through the protesters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察从抗议者中开辟出了一条通道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Damian blocked their path.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达米安挡住了他们的去路。

Sense.DEF: the direction or line along which something or someone is moving
Sense.TRAN: 〔事物或人移动的〕方向﹐路线 轨道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tornado destroyed everything in its path .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 龙卷风摧毁了沿途的一切。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She walked into the path of an oncoming vehicle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走到了迎面有辆汽车驶来的路中。

Sense.DEF: a plan or series of actions that will help you achieve something, especially over a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 〔有助于实现某事的〕道路﹐途径
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career path
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业发展道路

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She saw a college degree as her path to success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她认为大学学位是自己通往成功的途径。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope you will choose a different path.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你会选择一条不同的道路。

Sense.DEF: if two people’s paths cross, they meet by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our paths did not cross again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩没再相遇过。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: lead sb up the garden path

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is pathetic is so useless, unsuccessful, or weak that they annoy you
Sense.TRAN: 无用的﹔差劲的﹔令人生厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re pathetic! Here, let me do it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真没用！来﹐让我做吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know it sounds pathetic now, but at the time I was frightened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道现在听起来挺窝囊﹐不过当时我很害怕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vic made a pathetic attempt to apologise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克很勉强地道了歉。

Sense.DEF: making you feel pity or sympathy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child looked a pathetic sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个孩子看上去很可怜。

Sense.DEF: the idea of describing the sea, rocks, weather etc in literature as if they were human
Sense.TRAN: 感情误置〔文学中对大海﹑石头﹑天气等的拟人化描述〕

Sense.DEF: someone who goes ahead of a group and finds the best way through unknown land
a person who discovers new ways of doing things
something that causes disease in your body
pathological behaviour or feelings happen regularly, and are strong, unreasonable, and impossible to control
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为或感情〕非理智的﹐无法控制的﹐病态的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pathological hatred of women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对女人的病态憎恨
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pathological liar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病态说谎者

Sense.DEF: a mental or physical condition that is pathological is caused by disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: pathological conditions such as cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌症等疾病

Sense.DEF: relating to pathology

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Stephen was almost pathologically jealous of his brother.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬几乎是病态地嫉妒自己的弟弟。

Sense.DEF: the study of the causes and effects of illnesses
the quality that a person, situation, film, or play has that makes you feel pity and sadness
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑境况﹑电影﹑戏剧具有的〕激起怜悯[伤感]的性质﹐伤感力﹐煽情
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pathos of the woman trying to keep her lover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个女人试图留住爱侣的哀婉之情

Sense.DEF: a path
a series of nerves that pass information to each other
the ability to continue waiting or doing something for a long time without becoming angry or anxious
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t have the patience to sit sewing all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可没有耐心整天坐着缝缝补补。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a good listener who has infinite patience
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个极具耐心、善于倾听的人

Sense.DEF: the ability to accept trouble and other people’s annoying behaviour without complaining or becoming angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll need patience and understanding if you’re going to be a teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你要当老师﹐就得具备耐心并能体谅他人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has no patience with time-wasters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受不了浪费时间的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop being patient and get angry
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m beginning to lose patience with you people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始对你们这些人失去耐心了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It will take time and patience to get these changes accepted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要让这些变革为人接受﹐需要时间和耐心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Celia’s patience suddenly snapped and she told them to shut up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西莉亚突然忍不住了﹐叫他们住口。

GramExa.PROPFORM: the patience of Job/the patience of a saint
GramExa.GLOSS: very great patience when someone is annoying you
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 约伯/圣人的耐心〔指极大的耐心〕

Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry’s negative attitude is beginning to try my patience make me lose my patience .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利消极的态度开始让我失去耐心了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to wait calmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patience, my dear. Some things take time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耐心点﹐亲爱的﹐有些事情是要花时间的。

Sense.DEF: a card game for one player
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital
able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只能耐心点﹐等我打完电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Louise was very patient with me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易丝对我很有耐心。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He waited patiently for Katherine to speak.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他耐心地等凯瑟琳开口讲话。

Sense.DEF:
a greenish layer that forms naturally on the surface of
copper
or
bronze
a smooth shiny surface that gradually develops on wood, leather etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔木头﹑皮革等表面因年久而产生的〕光泽

Sense.DEF: the appearance of being wealthy, successful etc
Sense.TRAN: 有钱人/成功者等的神采[气派]

Sense.DEF: a flat hard area near a house, where people sit outside
glass doors that open from a living room onto a patio

a shop that sells cakes and
pie s
, especially French cakes, or the cakes it sells
a spoken form of a language used by the people of a small area and different from the national or standard language
an old man who is respected as the head of a family or tribe
Sense.TRAN: 〔年长而受人尊敬的男性〕家长﹔族长﹔年高德劭的男性

Sense.DEF:
a
bishop
in the early Christian church

a
bishop
of the Orthodox Christian churches who is very high in rank
Sense.TRAN: 牧首〔东正教的最高级主教〕

Sense.DEF: ruled or controlled only by men
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patriarchal society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父权制社会

Sense.DEF: relating to being a patriarch, ortypical of a patriarch
Sense.TRAN: 家长的﹔族长的﹔家长[族长]特有的

Sense.DEF: a social system in which men have all the power
a social system in which the oldest man rules his family and passes power and possessions on to his sons
typical of a member of the highest class in society
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pat-rician manner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高贵的举止

Sense.DEF: belonging to the high class of people that governed in ancient Rome
the crime of murdering your father
property given to you after the death of your father, which was given to him by your grandfather etc
someone who loves their country and is willing to defend it – used to show approval
having or expressing a great love of your country
Sense.EXAMPLE: patriotic songs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱国歌曲
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not very patriotic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是很爱国。

Sense.DEF: to go around the different parts of an area or building at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Armed guards patrolled the grounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装卫兵巡逻场地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an area patrolled by special police units
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由特警部队巡逻的地区

Sense.DEF: to drive or walk around an area in a threatening way
Sense.TRAN: 气势汹汹地在〔某地带〕驾车游荡[走来走去]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gangs of youths patrolled the streets at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上一帮帮年轻人在街上气势汹汹地游荡。

Sense.DEF: when someone goes around different parts of an area at regular times to check that there is no trouble or danger

GramExa.EXAMPLE: police on patrol in the city centre
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在市中心巡逻的警察

Sense.EXAMPLE: The security forces increased their patrols in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全部队加强了对该地区的巡逻。

Sense.DEF: a group of police, soldiers, vehicles, planes etc sent out to search a particular area
Sense.TRAN: 巡警队﹔巡逻车队﹔巡逻机队
Sense.EXAMPLE: a US border patrol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国边防巡逻队

GramExa.GLOSS: used by the army or police
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔军队或警方用的〕巡逻艇/巡逻车

Sense.DEF:
a small group of
boy scout s
or
guide s
a police car that drives around the streets of a city
a police officer who regularly walks or drives around a particular area to try to prevent crime
someone employed by a car owners’ association in Britain who goes to give help to drivers by the road
Sense.TRAN: 〔由英国车主协会雇用﹑给司机提供帮助的〕公路巡视员

Sense.DEF: someone who supports the activities of an organization, for example by giving money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wealthy patron
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有的赞助人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a patron of the arts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术的赞助者

Sense.DEF:
a famous person who is officially involved with an organization, such as a
charity
, and whose name is used to help advertise it
Sense.TRAN: 名义赞助人〔支持慈善组织等的名人﹐名字常用于有关的广告宣传中〕

Sense.DEF: someone who uses a particular shop, restaurant, or hotel
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店﹑餐馆或酒店的〕顾客﹐主顾
Sense.EXAMPLE: facilities for disabled patrons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供残障顾客使用的设施

Sense.DEF: the support, especially financial support, that is given to an organization or activity by a patron
the support that you give a particular shop, restaurant etc by buying their goods or using their services
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for your patronage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢您的惠顾。

Sense.DEF: a system by which someone in a powerful position gives people help or important jobs in return for their support
Sense.TRAN: 〔有权势者为报答支持者而给予的〕恩惠

Sense.DEF: a woman who supports the activities of a person or organization, by giving money or using their name in advertising
to talk to someone in a way which seems friendly but shows that you think they are not as intelligent or do not know as much as you
Sense.TRAN: 以貌似亲切却高人一等的态度对待
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t patronize me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别对我摆出一副纡尊降贵的样子！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The program focuses on kids’ interests without patronizing them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该节目以平等的态度关注孩子们的兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to use or visit a shop, restaurant etc
to support or give money to an organization or activity
someone who is patronizing talks to you in a way that shows they think you are less intelligent or important than them
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话时〕自命不凡的﹐高人一等的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patronizing attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自命不凡的态度
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patronizing tone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高人一等的语气
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t mean to sound patronizing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有自命不凡之意。

Sense.DEF:
a Christian
saint
who people believe gives special protection to a particular place, activity, or person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: St. Christopher, the patron saint of travellers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣克里斯托弗﹐旅行者的主保圣人

Sense.DEF: someone who is easily tricked or deceived, especially so that they take the blame for someone else’s crime
Sense.TRAN: 易成为替罪羊者﹐易上当受骗的人

Sense.DEF: if something, especially water, patters, it makes quiet sounds as it keeps hitting a surface lightly and quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rain pattering on the window panes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 啪嗒啪嗒敲打窗玻璃的雨

Sense.DEF: the sound made by something as it keeps hitting a surface lightly and quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the patter of footsteps
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 啪嗒啪嗒的脚步声

Sense.EXAMPLE: the pitter-patter of raindrops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噼噼啪啪的雨声

Sense.DEF: fast, continuous, and usually amusing talk, used by someone telling jokes or trying to sell something
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲笑话等时的〕快板﹐顺口溜﹔〔推销物品时〕一口气说出的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to look at the cars without getting the sales patter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看汽车时难免要听推销员的那套话。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to mean that someone is going to have a baby
Sense.TRAN: 将要有小宝宝了〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are we going to hear the patter of tiny feet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要有小宝宝了吗？

Sense.DEF: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done
Sense.TRAN: 〔事情发生﹑发展﹑完成的〕模式﹐方式﹐形式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: changing patterns of behaviour among students
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生中不断变化的行为方式
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The child showed a normal pattern of development .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个孩子表现出正常的成长模式。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They noticed patterns in the data.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们注意到了数据中的规律。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A general pattern began to emerge .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个总体模式开始显现。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern always develop in the same way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

Subsense.DEF: a regularly repeated arrangement of shapes, colours, or lines on a surface, usually as decoration
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a black and white striped pattern
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑白条纹图案

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pattern of dots
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 点状图案

PIC.HEADING: PATTERNS 图案
PIC.PICCONTENT: checked 方格纹；floral 花卉；paisley 佩斯利涡旋纹；striped 条纹；polka dot 圆点；tartan BrE【英】/plaidAmE【美】苏格兰格纹；zigzag 锯齿纹

Subsense.DEF: a regularly repeated arrangement of sounds or words
Subsense.TRAN: 〔声音或词汇有规则排列的〕模式
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A sonnet has a fixed rhyming pattern.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十四行诗有固定的韵律。

Sense.DEF: a thing, idea, or person that is an example to copy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book set the pattern for over 40 similar historical romances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书为40多本类似的历史言情小说树立了典范。

Sense.DEF: a shape used as a guide for making something, especially a thin piece of paper used when cutting material to make clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以制作某物的〕模型﹔〔服装的〕纸样
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dress pattern
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连衣裙的纸样

Sense.DEF: a small piece of cloth, paper etc that shows what a larger piece will look like
to be designed or made in a way that is copied from something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exam system is patterned after the one used in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种考试制度是仿效日本建立的。

Sense.DEF: to form a pattern on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tiny white flowers patterned the ground like confetti.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色的小花犹如五彩纸屑点缀着地面。

Sense.DEF: decorated with a pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: a patterned carpet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有图案的地毯
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brightly patterned dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花样鲜艳的连衣裙

GramExa.EXAMPLE: wallpaper patterned with roses
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有玫瑰图案的壁纸

Sense.DEF: the development of particular ways of behaving, thinking, doing things etc that are the result of copying and repeating actions, language etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: cultural patterning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文化模式的形成

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the patterning of parent-child relationships
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲子关系模式的形成

Sense.DEF: patterns of a particular kind, especially on an animal’s skin
small, flat pieces of cooked meat or other food
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beef patty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛肉饼

Sense.DEF: less than is needed of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a paucity of information
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 资料[信息]缺乏

Sense.DEF: a man’s fat stomach
someone who is very poor
to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She paused for a moment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她停顿了一下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He paused for breath , then continued up the hill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停下来歇口气﹐然后继续上山。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘No,’ he replied, without pausing for thought .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “不是的。”他不假思索地答道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe paused to consider his answer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔停顿了一下考虑怎么回答。

Sense.DEF: to push a button on a tape player, CD player, computer etc in order to make a tape, CD etc stop playing for a short time
a short time during which someone stops speaking or doing something before starting again
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a pause while Alice changed the tape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯换磁带的时候出现了短暂的停顿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a long pause , she went on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停了好一会儿﹐她才继续下去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an awkward pause in the conversation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈话中尴尬的停顿

Sense.DEF:
a control which allows you to stop a
cd player
,
video recorder
etc for a short time and start it again
a mark () over a musical note, showing that the note is to be played or sung longer than usual
to make someone stop and consider carefully what they are doing
Sense.TRAN: 使某人停下来（仔细考虑）
Sense.EXAMPLE: an avoidable accident that should give us all pause for thought
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应能让我们都停下来反思的一次本可以避免的事故

Sense.DEF:
to cover a path, road, area etc with a hard level surface such as blocks of stone or
concrete
Sense.TRAN: 〔用石块或混凝土板〕铺〔路﹑地面等〕﹐铺砌﹐铺筑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city centre streets are paved with dark local stone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心街道用当地的深色石块铺砌而成。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a paved courtyard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面铺砌过的院子

Sense.DEF: to make a later event or development possible by producing the right conditions
Sense.TRAN: 为某事物铺平道路﹔为某事物创造条件
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Supreme Court decision paved the way for further legislation on civil rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最高法院的这一判决为公民权利方面的进一步立法铺平了道路。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the streets are paved with gold
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is easy to become rich quickly in a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 遍地是黄金〔表示在某地能迅速发财〕

Sense.DEF: a hard level surface or path at the side of a road for people to walk on
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small group of journalists waited on the pavement outside her house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一小群记者守候在她家外面的人行道上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pavement cafe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路边咖啡馆

Sense.DEF: the hard surface of a road
Sense.EXAMPLE: As she fell off the bike, her head hit the pavement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从自行车上摔下来﹐头部撞在了路面上。

Sense.DEF: any paved surface or area
to work very hard to get something, especially a job, by going to a lot of different places
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为找工作等而〕四处奔走
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent the next six months pounding the pavement in search of a job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的六个月他为了找工作而四处奔走。

Sense.DEF:
a temporary building or tent which is used for public entertainment or
exhibition s
and is often large with a lot of space and light
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于公共娱乐或展览的〕临时建筑物﹐大帐篷
Sense.EXAMPLE: the German pavilion at the World Trade Fair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界贸易博览会上的德国展馆

Sense.DEF:
a building beside a sports field, especially a
cricket
field, used by the players and people watching the game
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指板球场旁的〕运动员更衣室，休息室，看台

Sense.DEF: a very large building with big open areas used for sports and other public events
Sense.EXAMPLE: victory before a home crowd at Maples Pavilion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在枫树体育场主场观众面前取得的胜利

Sense.DEF: material used to form a hard level surface on a path, road, area etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: brick paving
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺路砖材

Sense.DEF:
an area covered in a hard level surface such as blocks of stone or
concrete
a paving stone
one of the flat pieces of stone that are used to make a hard surface to walk on

a light cake made of
meringue
, cream and fruit

an animal’s foot that has nails or
claw s
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lion’s paw
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狮爪

Sense.DEF: someone’s hand – used when you are annoyed or angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人的〕手〔用于不悦或生气时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your filthy paws off me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的脏爪子从我身上拿开！

Sense.DEF: if an animal paws a surface, it touches or rubs one place several times with its paw
Sense.TRAN: 用爪子[前足﹐蹄等]抓[触﹐扒﹐刨]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dog’s pawing at the door again – let him out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只狗又在扒门了——让它出去吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His horse pawed the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的马刨着地面。

Sense.DEF: to feel or touch someone in a rough or sexual way that is offensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d had too much to drink and started pawing me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他先是喝多了酒﹐然后开始对我动手动脚。

Sense.DEF:
one of the eight smallest and least valuable pieces which each player has in the game of
chess
someone who is used by a more powerful person or group and has no control of the situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔被更有权势的人或团体利用的〕马前卒﹐喽啰

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They became pawns in the political battle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们成了政治斗争中的走卒。

Sense.DEF: to leave something valuable with a pawnbroker in order to borrow money from them
to persuade someone to buy or accept something that you want to get rid of, especially something of low quality
Sense.TRAN: 卖掉〔某物﹐尤指质量不好的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let him pawn off an old bike on you – get a new one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他把破自行车卖给你﹐去买辆新的吧。

Sense.DEF: to present something in a dishonest way
Sense.TRAN: 〔以不诚实的方式〕展现某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tabloids often pawn off gossip and trivia as real news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通俗小报经常把闲言碎语和鸡毛蒜皮的事当成真正新闻刊登出来。

Sense.DEF: someone whose business is to lend people money in exchange for valuable objects. If the money is not paid back, the pawnbroker can sell the object.
a pawnbroker’s shop
the large yellow-green fruit of a tall tropical tree
to give someone money for something you buy or for a service
Sense.EXAMPLE: How would you like to pay?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想怎么付款？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum paid for my driving lessons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈支付了我驾驶课的学费。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’d get a discount for paying cash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现金付款有折扣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I pay by credit card?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以用信用卡付款吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t even offer to pay me for the ticket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他甚至没有提出要给我买票的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ray paid some kids to wash the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷花钱雇了一些孩子洗车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I paid him $5 to cut the grass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我付给他5美元叫他割草。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wanted to be paid in dollars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想收取美元。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: The object of pay can be the person you give money to or the amount of money you give. pay
F2NBox.TRAN: 的宾语可以是支付的对象,或支付的数目
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay you in advance.
I’ve already paid £700.
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use pay followed directly by a noun referring to the thing you are buying. Use pay (an amount of money) for something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要在pay后面直接跟你要买的东西,要用pay for sth 的形式 ﹐其中 pay 后可以跟一定数量的 钱
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay for the tickets.
I paid £100 for this jacket.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了100英镑买这件夹克衫。

Sense.DEF: to pay money that you owe to a person, company etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I forgot to pay the gas bill !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忘记交煤气费了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You pay tax at the basic rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你按基本税率交税。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it okay if I pay you what I owe you next week?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我欠你的钱下周还行吗？

Sense.DEF: to give someone money for the job they do
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much do they pay you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们付给你多少报酬？

GramExa.PROPFORM: pay sb $100 a day/£200 a week etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re only paid about £4 an hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每小时的报酬只有4英镑左右。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some lawyers get paid over $400 an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些律师每小时收费超过400美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We get paid weekly on Fridays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每星期五领工资。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of the workers are very badly paid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些工人中有很多人工资非常低。

GramExa.GLOSS: work you are paid to do
time when you are not working but are still paid

Sense.DEF: to watch, listen to, or think about someone or something carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I wasn’t paying attention to what you were saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我没有仔细听你说的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They paid no attention to ignored him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不理会他。

Sense.DEF: to give money to someone because you are ordered to by a court as part of a legal case
Sense.TRAN: 缴纳〔法庭要求支付的费用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had to pay a £35 fine for speeding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她必须缴纳35英镑超速罚款。

GramExa.GLOSS: give someone money because you have done something against them
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 支付（…）赔偿金/损害赔偿金
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company were forced to pay £5,000 in compensation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司被迫支付了5,000英镑赔偿金。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Martins was ordered to pay court costs of £1,500.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁斯被勒令支付1,500英镑诉讼费。

Sense.DEF: to say something good or polite about or to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister paid tribute to the work of the emergency services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长表扬了应急服务部门的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I came by to pay my respects visit or send a polite greeting to someone to Mrs Owens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来拜访欧文斯夫人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was just trying to pay her a compliment .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正想夸奖她。

Sense.DEF: if a particular action pays, it brings a good result or advantage for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crime doesn’t pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪不会有好结果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It pays to get some professional advice before you make a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作决定之前征求一些专业性建议是有好处的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would pay you to ask if there are any jobs going at the London office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问一下伦敦分公司是否有职位空缺对你有好处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting some qualifications now will pay dividends bring a lot of advantages in the long term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长远来看﹐现在取得一些资格对将来有好处。

Sense.DEF: if a shop or business pays, it makes a profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the pub doesn’t start to pay, we’ll have to sell it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这家酒馆还没有开始赢利﹐我们将不得不把它卖掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The farm just manages to pay its way make as much profit as it costs to run .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家农场仅能维持收支平衡。

Sense.DEF: to experience something unpleasant because you have done something wrong, made a mistake etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因犯错误等而〕吃苦头/付出代价

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Williams is now paying the price for his early mistakes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯现在正为以前犯下的错误付出代价。

Sense.DEF: to visit a person or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to pay my folks a visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定去看望一下父母亲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you have time, pay a visit to the City Art Gallery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有时间﹐去参观一下市美术馆。

Sense.DEF: to stop something from happening or spoil plans for something
Sense.TRAN: 使某事落空﹐破坏某事的计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bad exam results put paid to his hopes of a university place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糟糕的考试成绩让他上大学的希望破灭了。

Sense.DEF: to suffer or be punished for something you have done wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll make him pay !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要让他付出代价！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They paid dearly for their mistakes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为自己的错误付出了巨大的代价。

Sense.DEF: to pay for everything that you want without having to depend on anyone else for money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sofia worked to pay her way through college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索菲娅自食其力读完了大学。

Sense.DEF: if something you buy pays for itself, the money it saves over a period of time is as much as the product cost to buy
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new boiler would pay for itself within two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台新锅炉用两年就够本了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone will be in a lot of trouble about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the boss finds out you were late again, there’s going to be hell to pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果老板发现你又迟到﹐你可要遭殃了。

Sense.DEF: to pay much more for something than it is really worth
Sense.TRAN: （为某物）付费过高﹔（为某事）花费过大的代价

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb has paid their debt to society
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone who has done something illegal has been fully punished for it
Sense.TRAN: 某人〔指违法者〕已受到应有的惩罚

Sense.DEF: to treat someone, especially a woman, carefully and with respect, so that they will like you or help you
Sense.TRAN: （向某人）大献殷勤﹐讨好（某人）〔尤指女人〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: he who pays the piper calls the tune
Sense.DEF: used to say that the person who gives the money for something can decide how it will be used

Exponent.DEF: to give someone money for something you are buying from them, or a service they are providing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I paid a lot of money for that computer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 买那台电脑我花了不少钱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You have to pay to park your car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 停车得付费。

Exponent.DEF: to pay for something for someone else, or to provide the money needed to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We will meet the cost of your travelling expenses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会支付你的差旅费。

Exponent.DEF: to pay for something for someone else, especially when you do not want to, or do not think that you should
Exponent.TRAN: 为某人付钱〔尤指你不愿意或认为你不该付的情况〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: As usual, the taxpayer will have to foot the bill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 还是老样子,纳税人要为此买单了。

Exponent.DEF: to pay for something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My company will pick up the tab for all moving costs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我公司要为所有的搬运费买单。

Exponent.DEF: to pay a lot of money for something because you have to and not because you want to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had to fork out £500 to get his car fixed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只得花500英镑把车修好。

Exponent.DEF: to pay the bill after eating a meal, staying in a hotel etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用餐﹑住酒店等之后〕付款,结账
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She went down to the hotel lobby to settle the bill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下楼到酒店大堂结账。

Exponent.DEF: to pay a particular amount of money for something – used especially when saying how much you are willing to pay
Exponent.TRAN: 付款,支付〔尤指愿意付多少钱〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How much will you give me for the car?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 买这辆车你打算付我多少钱？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you $50 for the lot for everything.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些一起算,我给你50美元。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that someone else will pay for your meal, drinks etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Order whatever you like – this is on me!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 随便点,我付账。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drinks are on the house the bar, restaurant etc will let you have them for free.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒水饮料由店里请客。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the money that you owe them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay you back on Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期五还你钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re paying back the loan over 15 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要在15年内还清贷款。

Sense.DEF: to make someone suffer for doing something wrong or unpleasant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay Jenny back for what she did to me!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮这样对待我﹐我要报复她！

Sense.DEF: to put money in your bank account etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you remember to pay that cheque in?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你记得把那张支票存进去了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve paid $250 into my account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已把250美元存入了我的账户。

Sense.DEF: to give someone all the money you owe them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay off all my debts first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先我要还清欠款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He finally paid his overdraft off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于还清了透支款。

Sense.DEF: if something you do pays off, it is successful or has a good result
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teamwork paid off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 团队合作成功了。

Sense.DEF: to pay someone their wages and tell them they no longer have a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two hundred workers have been paid off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两百名工人拿到工资被解雇了。

Sense.DEF: to pay someone not to say anything about something illegal or dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 用钱封住某人的嘴〔使其对非法或不诚实的事情保持沉默〕﹐付封口费

Sense.DEF: to pay a lot of money for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why is it always me who has to pay out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么总得由我来付那么多钱？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Altogether he had paid out almost £5,000 for the improvements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经总共付出差不多5,000英镑的整修费用了。

Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或机构因保险理赔﹑投资﹑竞争等〕偿付﹐支付（钱款）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Insurance companies were slow paying out on claims for flood damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险公司在赔付洪水损害时拖拖拉拉。

Sense.DEF: to let a piece of rope unwind
to make an official payment of money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clancy’s share of the inheritance was paid over to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克兰西应得的那份遗产已经转到他名下了。

Sense.DEF: to pay money that you owe, especially when you do not want to or you are late
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不情愿或延迟〕付清﹐偿还〔欠款〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She refused to pay up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝偿还欠款。

Sense.DEF: money that you are given for doing your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff have been working without pay for the last month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个月员工们干活没拿到工资。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tax is deducted from your pay every week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项税收每星期从你薪水中扣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was suspended on full pay until the hearing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聆讯之前他停职留薪。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in someone else’s pay is working for them, often secretly
Sense.EXAMPLE: an informer in the pay of the police
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名警方雇用的线人

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Nurses often work long hours for relatively low pay.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士往往工作时间长,而工资相对较低。
