Collocate.EXAMPLE: The work was steady and the pay was pretty good.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作稳定,薪水相当不错。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Workers demanded higher pay.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人要求提高工资。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the same pay for the same type of work
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The women at the factory went on strike for equal pay.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂的女工为争取同工同酬而举行罢工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not including overtime pay or bonuses
after tax etc has been taken away
for extra hours that you work
pay when you are on holiday
pay when you are ill
pay while a woman takes time off to have a baby
pay when there is no longer a job for you

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Teachers will be awarded a 6% pay increase this year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年教师将得到6%的加薪作为奖励。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you get promoted, will you get a pay rise?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你升职了,会涨工资吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Staff were asked to take a 10% pay cut.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工被要求接受10%的减薪。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the amount paid every hour, week etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many workers in the catering industry are on low rates of pay.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食服务业的许多员工工资率较低。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the money you earn every week or month
when no one’s pay is increased
official request for more pay
disagreement between an employer and employees about pay

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘the salary pay’. Just say 而只需说 the pay .

Sense.DEF: a bill, debt etc that is payable must be paid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tax is payable on the interest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利息要支付税金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fee of £49, payable by the tenant
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一笔应由租户支付的49英镑费用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: State pensions become payable to women at age 60.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性年满60岁就可以拿到国家养老金。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The rent is payable in advance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金须预付。

Sense.DEF: a cheque etc that is payable to someone has that person’s name written on it and should be paid to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cheques should be made payable to the National Trust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支票应该写明付给国民信托组织。

Sense.DEF:
a pay-as-you-go
mobile phone
or Internet service is one that you must pay for before you can use it
Sense.TRAN: 〔手机或因特网服务〕预付费的

Sense.DEF: the money or advantage you gain from a business, project, or something you have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The immediate payback for them is publicity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他们来说立竿见影的回报是获得了公众关注。

Sense.DEF: when you do something to make someone suffer because of something they have done to harm you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I guess it’s payback time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想该是报仇雪耻的时候了。

Subsense.DEF:
the period of time in which you will make a profit on an
investment
the period of time over which you must pay back money you have borrowed

Sense.DEF: a cheque that someone receives as payment for their wage
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weekly paycheque
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张周薪支票

Sense.DEF: the amount of wages someone earns
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nice fat paycheck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰厚的工资

Sense.DEF: the day on which you get your wages
to make a valuable or useful discovery, especially one that makes you rich or successful
a system for paying tax in which tax is taken from workers’ wages and paid directly to the government
Sense.TRAN: 所得税预扣法〔从工资中扣除所得税﹐直接缴给政府〕

Sense.DEF: the person or organization to whom money, especially a cheque, must be paid
someone who pays someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: tax payers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳税人

Sense.DEF: a book containing forms that you use when you put money into your bank account
a form that you use when you put money into your bank account
the amount of goods or passengers that can be carried by a vehicle, or the goods that a vehicle is carrying
Sense.TRAN: 〔运输工具的〕最大载荷﹐有效载荷﹔〔运输工具的〕装载货物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The helicopter is designed to carry a payload of 2,640 pounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种直升机设计的最大载荷为2,640磅。

Sense.DEF:
the amount of explosive that a
missile
can carry
a powerful person or organization that secretly pays and controls another person or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assassin’s paymasters were never identified.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名刺客的幕后操纵者始终没有查出来。

Sense.DEF: someone who is responsible for giving people their wages that they are owed, for example an official in a factory or the army
Sense.TRAN: 〔工厂﹑军队发放工资﹑军饷的〕出纳员

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that has been or must be paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can make a payment in any bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在任何一家银行付款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They fell behind on their mortgage payments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们未按期支付按揭还款。

Sense.DEF: the act of paying for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are severe penalties for late payment of taxes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟缴税款要支付高额罚金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most hotels here accept payment in dollars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的大多数酒店都接受美元付款。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Payment can be made by cheque or credit card.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以用支票或信用卡付款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We do accept payment in instalments paying in small amounts over a period of time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们确实接受分期付款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She demanded payment in advance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要求预先付款。

GramExa.GLOSS: in order to pay for something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: cheques received in payment for goods supplied
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 收到的支付货款的支票

GramExa.GLOSS: when an amount has been paid
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any item can be reserved on payment of a deposit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 支付订金就可以预订任何物品。

Sense.DEF: a way of paying for something with goods or services instead of money

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was supposed to make payments of $250 a month.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每月应该付款250美元。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You will receive a cash payment on your 65th birthday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你65岁生日时会收到一笔现金付款。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be able to make regular payments
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was having trouble meeting the interest payments.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他难以支付利息。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not make payments when you should

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Home buyers have seen their monthly payments go up by more than 50 percent.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 购房者发现自己每月的付款额增长了50%以上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a payment in cash
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He provided pills to athletes in return for cash payments.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向运动员提供药物,换取现金。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a small payment for something you are buying, when you will pay the rest later
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We were able to put a down payment on an apartment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以支付一笔预付款买公寓。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a payment of interest on a loan
a payment towards a loan on your house
a payment that is made before something is finished or settled
an additional payment because success has been achieved

Sense.DEF: an advantage or profit that you get as a result of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事之后的〕良好结果﹐好处
Sense.EXAMPLE: With electric cars there is a big environmental payoff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用电动汽车﹐环境会大有改善。

Sense.DEF: a payment that is made to someone, often illegally, in order to stop them from causing you trouble
Sense.TRAN: 〔为收买某人而付的〕钱财﹐贿赂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Union leaders allegedly received huge payoffs from the company’s bosses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说工会领导收受了那家公司老板的巨额贿赂。

Sense.DEF: a payment made to someone when they are forced to leave their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average payoff to staff was about £2,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工的平均遣散费大约是2,000英镑。

Sense.DEF: the illegal practice of paying someone to use their influence to make people buy what your company is selling
Sense.TRAN: 行贿〔利用某人影响推销产品〕

Sense.DEF: the money that is paid to someone to use their influence
a large payment of money to someone, for example from an insurance claim or from winning a competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔保险索赔﹑竞赛获胜等得到的〕大笔付款
Sense.EXAMPLE: There should be a big payout on this month’s lottery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个月的彩票奖金数额应该很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the victims have been offered massive cash payouts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一些受害人已经获得了巨额现金赔偿。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money someone earns
an envelope containing someone’s wages
a method of reading books and other material on the Internet, and paying only for what you read

a pay-per-view television
channel
makes people pay for each programme they watch

a public telephone that you can use when you put in a coin or a
credit card
Sense.TRAN: 〔投币式或插卡式〕付费公用电话

Sense.DEF: an increase in the amount of money you are paid for doing your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some company directors have awarded themselves huge pay rises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些公司董事已给自己大幅加薪了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 4% pay raise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4%的加薪

Sense.DEF: if someone is on the payroll of a company, they are employed by that company
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company now has 350 people on the payroll.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司目前在职员工有350人。

Sense.DEF: the activity of managing salary payments for workers in a company
Sense.EXAMPLE: the payroll department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薪资管理部
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computerized payroll system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机化的薪资管理系统

Sense.DEF: the total amount of wages paid to all the people working in a particular company or industry
Sense.EXAMPLE: the annual payroll was $88 million
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年度工资总支出为8,800万美元

Sense.DEF: a tax that is taken from someone’s wages and given directly to the government
Sense.TRAN: 薪金税﹐工资税〔从薪水中扣除后直接上缴政府〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper that an employed person gets every time they are paid, showing the amount they have been paid and the amount that has been taken away for tax

television
channel s
that you must pay to watch
a computer that is used by one person at a time, either at home or at work
Sense.EXAMPLE: People can use their PCs to do their banking from home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们可以在家通过个人电脑办理银行业务。

Sense.DEF: a police officer of the lowest rank
used to describe language, behaviour, and attitudes that are carefully chosen so that they do not offend or insult anyone
Sense.TRAN: ﹝语言、行为、态度﹞政治上正确的﹐政治得体的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not PC to describe people as disabled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说别人残废有歧视之嫌。

Sense.DEF: a small flat object which stores information that can be added to some computers
Sense.TRAN: PC卡〔可插接至某些计算机的信息存储设备〕

Sense.DEF: used in writing when stating the amount of rent to be paid each month
Sense.TRAN: 每（历）月〔用于说明每月应付的房租〕

Sense.DEF:
a doctor you go to when you are ill, who may treat you or advise you to see a
specialist a doctor who deals with a particular part of the body
Sense.TRAN: 初级保健医生﹐基层保健医生

Sense.DEF:
someone whose job with the police is to
patrol walk around
an area in order to make the people who live or work there feel safer, and to find out about criminal activity in that area. PCSOs do not have the same rights and duties as an ordinary police officer.

a very small light computer that you can carry with you, and that you use to store information such as telephone numbers, addresses, and
appointment s
. Some PDAs can send and receive email, and connect to the Internet.
Sense.TRAN: 个人数字助理﹐掌上电脑

Sense.DEF:
a way of storing computer
file s
so that they can be easily read when they are moved from one computer to another
used to say that something should be done immediately
sport and physical activity taught as a school subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: a PE teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育老师

Sense.DEF: a round green seed that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable, or the plant on which these seeds grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: roast chicken with peas and carrots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤鸡配豌豆胡萝卜

Sense.LEXUNIT: like two peas in a pod
Sense.DEF: exactly the same in appearance, behaviour etc
stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pea-brained idiot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白痴

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is no war or fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country is at peace with its neighbours for the first time in years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是多年来该国与其邻国第一次和平共处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the end of the century, France had made peace with Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那个世纪末﹐法国和英国议和了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a city where people of different religions have lived together in peace for centuries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同宗教的人们和平共处数百年的城市
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to bring peace to the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为该地区争取和平的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dangerous situation which threatens world peace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威胁世界和平的危险状况

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lasting peace between the two sides
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方的持久和平

Sense.EXAMPLE: An uneasy peace continued until 1939.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不稳定的和平局面维持到1939年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Northern Ireland peace talks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北爱尔兰和平会谈
Sense.EXAMPLE: an international peace conference
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际和平大会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the peace treaty that ended the First World War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 终结第一次世界大战的和平条约
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Middle East peace process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中东和平进程

Sense.DEF: a very quiet and pleasant situation in which you are not interrupted

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll leave you now and let you get dressed in peace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在不打扰你了﹐让你安安静静穿衣服。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish she would just leave me in peace .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望她能让我清静会儿。

Sense.EXAMPLE: All I want is some peace and quiet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想清静清静。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being calm, happy, and not worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: the search for inner peace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对内心安宁的追求
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having household insurance is supposed to give you peace of mind .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上了家庭保险会让人心里踏实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lynn seems to be more at peace with herself these days calm, satisfied, no longer worried about anything .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳恩这些天显得更加悠然自得了。

Sense.DEF: to end a quarrel with a person or group, especially by telling them you are sorry
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过道歉〕和某人[某团体]和解[言归于好]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann wanted to make her peace with her father before he died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安想在父亲去世之前和他言归于好。

Sense.DEF: to stop people from fighting, arguing, or causing trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US is sending troops overseas in order to keep the peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国向海外派兵以维持和平。

Sense.DEF: to keep quiet even though you would like to say something
to behave in a noisy or violent way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Macklin was charged with disturbing the peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克林被指控扰乱治安。

Sense.DEF:
words that are said during a funeral service for someone who has died, or written on a
gravestone
Sense.TRAN: 安息〔在葬礼上所说或刻在墓碑上〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is peaceable does not like fighting or arguing
Sense.TRAN: 不爱打斗[争吵]的﹐温和的﹐和气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always been a very peaceable man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直是个很温和的人。

Sense.DEF: a peaceable situation or way of doing something is calm, without any violence or fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are now hoping for a peaceable end to this dispute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在希望这次争端最终可以得到和解。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The two communities live together quite peaceably.

Sense.DEF:
a US government organization that helps poorer countries, by sending them
volunteer s people who work without payment
, especially young people, who teach skills in education, health, farming etc
Sense.TRAN: 和平队〔美国政府组织﹐向贫困国家派遣青年志愿者，教授教育﹑保健﹑农业等方面的技能〕

Sense.DEF: the money that is saved on weapons and is available for other purposes, when a government reduces its military strength because the risk of war has been reduced
Sense.TRAN: 和平红利﹐和平效益〔由于战争风险降低﹐政府通过削减军费而节省下来用于其他用途的资金〕

Sense.DEF: a peaceful time, place, or situation is quiet and calm without any worry or excitement
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a peaceful afternoon without the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们不在﹐我们度过了一个宁静的下午。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s very peaceful out here in the woods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这树林里真安静。

Sense.DEF: not involving war, fighting, or violence

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a large but peaceful demonstration outside the US Embassy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国大使馆外发生了一次大规模的和平示威活动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must try to find a peaceful solution to the conflict.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须努力寻找和平解决冲突的方法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a political change achieved by peaceful and democratic means
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过和平民主手段实现的政治变革

Sense.EXAMPLE: the use of nuclear power for peaceful purposes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核能的和平利用
Sense.EXAMPLE: The countries in Europe have established a peaceful co-existence they exist together without fighting .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲各国已形成和平共处的局面。

Sense.DEF: peaceful people do not like violence and do not behave in a violent way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a noisy but peaceful group of demonstrators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群喧嚷但和平的示威者

Sense.DEF: a group of soldiers who are sent to a place in order to stop two opposing groups from fighting each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The United Nations has decided to send a peacekeeping force into the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国决定向该地区派遣一支维和部队。

Sense.DEF: believing strongly in peace rather than war
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peace-loving nation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热爱和平的国家

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to persuade other people or countries to stop fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US sees itself as a peacemaker in the region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国视自己为该地区的调停人。

Sense.DEF: something you give to someone to show them that you are sorry and want to be friendly, after you have annoyed or upset them
Sense.TRAN: 〔为表示歉意和友好而赠送的〕和平礼物﹐谢罪礼

Sense.DEF: a pipe which Native Americans use to smoke tobacco, which is shared in a ceremony as a sign of peace
Sense.TRAN: 〔美洲印第安人的〕和平烟斗〔仪式上同抽一根烟斗 作为和平象征〕

Sense.DEF: a period of time when a country is not fighting a war

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the highest military award given in peacetime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平时期授予的最高军事奖章

Sense.DEF: a round juicy fruit that has a soft yellow or red skin and a large, hard seed in the centre, or the tree that this fruit grows on
a pale pinkish-orange colour
something or someone that you think is very good
Sense.TRAN: 有吸引力的物[人]﹐特别惹人喜爱的物[人]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anderton scored a peach of a goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德顿射入一个好球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan’s a real peach .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简真讨人喜欢。

Sense.DEF: used to describe skin that is an attractive pink colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peaches and cream complexion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白里透红的肤色

Sense.DEF: pinkish-orange in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: peach curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桃红色的窗帘

Sense.DEF:
half a peach served with ice cream and
raspberry
juice
tasting or looking like a peach
Sense.EXAMPLE: a delicious peachy flavour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香甜的蜜桃味

Sense.DEF: very good or pleasant
a large bird, the male of which has long blue and green tail feathers that it can lift up and spread out
a peacock or peahen
a light green colour

a female
peacock
the time when something or someone is best, greatest, highest, most successful etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The British Empire was at its peak in the mid 19th century.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英帝国在19世纪中叶处于全盛时期。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales this month have reached a new peak .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本月的销售额创了新高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most athletes reach their peak in their mid 20s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数运动员在25岁左右达到巅峰状态。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s past his peak as a tennis player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为网球运动员他已过了巅峰期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil production is down from its peak of two years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油生产已比不上两年前的鼎盛时期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hotel rooms are difficult to find at the peak of the holiday season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 节假日高峰期酒店一房难求。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the peaks and troughs of the US economy high and low points
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国经济的起起落落

Subsense.DEF: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
Subsense.EXAMPLE: snow-capped mountain peaks
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白雪覆盖的山顶
Subsense.EXAMPLE: jagged peaks
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嶙峋的山峰

Subsense.DEF: a mountain
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mount McKinley is Alaska’s highest peak.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦金利山是阿拉斯加的最高山峰。

Sense.DEF: a part that forms a point above a surface or at the top of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whisk the egg whites until they form stiff peaks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将蛋清搅打至起尖发稠。

Sense.DEF: the flat curved part of a cap that sticks out in front above your eyes
to reach the highest point or level
Sense.TRAN: 达到顶峰﹐达到最高水平
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales peaked in August, then fell sharply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售额8月份达到最高点﹐然后急速下降。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wind speeds peaked at 105 mph yesterday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天的风速最高达每小时105英里。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 最好［高］的﹔高峰时期的﹔巅峰状态的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gasoline prices are 14% below the peak level they hit in November.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽油价格比11月的最高点下跌了14%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shampoo designed to keep your hair in peak condition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令秀发保持最佳状态的洗发水
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you phone during the day you pay the peak rate for calls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白天打电话要支付高峰时段电话费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: periods of peak demand for electricity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用电需求高峰时段

Sense.DEF: the peak time or period is when the greatest number of people are doing the same thing, using the same service etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extra buses run at peak times .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通高峰时段加开公共汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hotel prices rise during the peak season .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高峰季节酒店房价上涨。

Sense.DEF: looking pale and ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re looking a little peaked this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今早你看起来有点憔悴。

Sense.DEF: a peaked cap or hat has a flat curved part at the front above the eyes
looking pale and ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s looking a bit peaky today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他今天看起来有点不舒服。

Sense.DEF: a sudden loud sound of laughter

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could hear peals of laughter coming from the hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到门厅传来哈哈大笑声。

Sense.DEF: a loud sound of thunder

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A loud peal of thunder crashed directly overhead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声惊雷就在头顶上方炸响了。

Sense.DEF: the loud ringing sound made by a bell
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sudden peal of bells broke the silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然响起的铃声打破了寂静。

Sense.DEF: a musical pattern made by ringing a number of bells one after the other
if bells peal, they ring loudly
Sense.TRAN: 〔钟或铃〕发出响亮的声音﹐鸣响
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bells pealed out on Christmas Day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钟声响彻圣诞日。

Sense.DEF: to make a loud sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lightning flashed and thunder pealed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电闪雷鸣。

Sense.DEF: a pale brown nut in a thin shell which grows under the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: a packet of roasted peanuts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一袋烤花生

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel workers get paid peanuts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店工作人员的薪酬十分微薄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m tired of working for peanuts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受够了为一点点小钱而卖力。

Sense.DEF: a soft food made from crushed peanuts, which is eaten on bread or used in cooking
a sweet juicy fruit that has a round base and is thinner near the top, or the tree that produces this fruit

a small round white object that forms inside an
oyster
, and is a valuable jewel
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pearl necklace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍珠项链
一串珍珠

Sense.DEF:
a hard shiny substance of various colours formed inside some
shellfish
, which is used for making buttons or to make objects look attractive
wise remarks – used especially when you really think that someone’s remarks are slightly stupid
Sense.TRAN: 真知灼见﹐智慧的结晶〔尤为反话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for those pearls of wisdom, Emma.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多谢你的金玉良言﹐埃玛。

Sense.DEF: to give something valuable to someone who does not understand its value
a small round drop of liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pearls of the morning dew
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早晨的露珠

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is especially good or valuable
Sense.TRAN: 极其优秀的人﹔特别珍贵的东西

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s a pearl among women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是女性中的佼佼者。

Sense.DEF:
small grains of
barley
that are used in cooking

an important US naval base in Hawaii, which was suddenly attacked by Japanese planes in December 1941. Many warships were destroyed or damaged, and this caused great shock and anger in the US, and made the US start fighting in World War II.
Sense.TRAN: 珍珠港〔美国在夏威夷的重要海军基地﹐1941年12月遭日本空军偷袭﹐这一事件促使美国加入第二次世界大战〕

Sense.DEF: pale in colour and shiny, like a pearl
Sense.EXAMPLE: pearly white teeth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍珠般洁白的牙齿
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pearly grey jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带珍珠光泽的灰色短外套

Sense.DEF: the entrance to heaven – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 天国之门〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: if an activity or situation goes pear-shaped, it goes wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole thing went pear-shaped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整件事出了问题。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is pear-shaped has wide
hip s
and a fairly small chest
Sense.TRAN: 〔体形〕梨形的〔指腰部和臀部宽﹑胸部窄的体形〕

Sense.DEF: a poor farmer who owns or rents a small amount of land, either in past times or in poor countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔从前的或贫穷国家的〕农民﹐佃农
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most villagers are peasant farmers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数村民是农民。

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for someone who does not behave politely in social situations or is not well-educated
Sense.TRAN: 乡下人﹐土包子﹔缺乏教养的人〔侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF: all the peasants of a country

a dish made of dried
pea s
, boiled with
ham
to make a thick yellow substance that is eaten hot or cold

a small tube used by children to blow small objects, especially dried
pea s
, at someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 射豆枪〔一种儿童用来吹射干豆子等的玩具枪〕

Sense.DEF:
a very thick
fog

a black substance formed from decaying plants under the surface of the ground in some areas, which can be burned as a
fuel
, or mixed with soil to help plants grow well
a small smooth stone found especially on a beach or on the bottom of a river
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beach was covered with smooth white pebbles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滩上布满了光滑的白色卵石。

Sense.DEF:
a surface for the outside walls of houses, made of
cement
with a lot of very small round stones in it
a long thin sweet nut with a dark red shell, or the tree that it grows on
something bad which someone does, especially involving sex, which is not regarded as very serious or important
Sense.TRAN: 小错误﹐小过失〔尤与性有关〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The public is willing to forgive him for his peccadillos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众愿意原谅他的小过失。

Sense.DEF: a wild animal like a pig that lives in Central and South America
if a bird pecks something or pecks at something, it makes quick repeated movements with its beak to try to eat part of it, make a hole in it etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: birds pecking at breadcrumbs on the pavement
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在人行道上啄食面包屑的鸟儿

Sense.LEXUNIT: peck sb on the cheek/forehead etc
Sense.DEF: to kiss someone quickly and lightly
Sense.TRAN: 匆匆地轻吻某人的面颊/额头等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pecked her father lightly on the cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她匆匆轻吻了一下父亲的面颊。

Sense.DEF: to eat only a little bit of a meal because you are not interested in it or not hungry
Sense.TRAN: 吃一点点〔因不喜欢或不饿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pecked at her food in silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她默默地吃了几小口。

Sense.DEF: a quick light kiss
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a quick peck on the cheek .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他匆匆地轻吻了一下她的脸颊。

Sense.DEF: an action in which a bird pecks someone or something with its beak
used to tell someone to stay cheerful even when it is difficult to do so
a social system within a group of people or animals in which each member knows who has a higher or lower rank than themselves
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或动物群体中的〕社群等级﹐权势等级
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody wants to be at the bottom of the pecking order .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也不想处于社会底层。

Sense.DEF: slightly hungry
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was feeling a bit peckish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得有点饿。

Sense.DEF:
a chemical substance that is found in some fruits and is sometimes added to
jam
and
jelly
to make it less liquid
your chest muscles
strange, unfamiliar, or a little surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a peculiar smell in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里有一股怪味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Something peculiar is going on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出了怪事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems very peculiar that no one noticed Kay had gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人注意到凯已经走了﹐这好像很奇怪。

Sense.DEF: if something is peculiar to a particular person, place, or situation, it is a feature that only belongs to that person or only exists in that place or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem of racism is not peculiar to this country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族歧视问题并非只有这个国家才有。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a strange and slightly crazy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been a little peculiar lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近他有点怪异。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a very peculiar child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个非常古怪的孩子。

Sense.DEF: to feel slightly ill
something that is a feature of only one particular place, person, situation etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某地方﹑某人或某情况等的〕特点﹐独特性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lack of a written constitution is a peculiarity of the British political system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有一部成文宪法是英国政治制度的一大特点。

Sense.DEF: a strange or unusual habit, quality etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margaret regarded her mother’s peculiarities with a fond tolerance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛格丽特宽容地看待母亲的怪癖。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being strange or unfamiliar

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was well aware of the peculiarity of her own situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常清楚自己情况的怪异。

Sense.DEF: something that is peculiarly British etc is a typical feature only of British people etc
Sense.TRAN: 英国人/女性/中产阶级等特有的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peculiarly American idea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国人特有的想法

Sense.DEF: in a strange or unusual way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Theo had been behaving peculiarly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西奥的举止一直很古怪。

Sense.DEF: especially
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peculiarly difficult question
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特别棘手的问题

Sense.DEF: relating to or consisting of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was trying to get a pecuniary advantage for himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拼命为自己敛财。

Sense.DEF: relating to teaching methods or the practice of teaching
a teacher, especially one who thinks they know a lot and is strict in the way they teach
Sense.TRAN: 教师﹔〔尤指〕严厉且自视博学的教师

Sense.DEF: the practice of teaching or the study of teaching
one of the two parts of a bicycle that you push round with your feet to make the bicycle go forward
a part in a car or on a machine that you press with your foot to control it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She put her foot down on the accelerator pedal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她踩下了油门踏板。

Sense.DEF: a part on a piano or organ that you press with your foot to change the quality of the sound

Sense.LEXUNIT: put/press/push the pedal to the metal

Subsense.DEF: to drive a car, truck etc very fast
to work harder or faster, especially so that you can win a game
Subsense.TRAN: 拼命干﹔加快速度〔尤指为了在比赛﹑游戏中获胜〕

Sense.DEF: to ride a bicycle

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Andrew pedalled up the road towards the town centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁骑着自行车沿这条路去市中心。

Sense.DEF: to turn or push the pedals on a bicycle or other machine with your feet
Sense.TRAN: 踩动〔自行车或机器的〕踏板
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was pedalling furiously very fast .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她飞快地踩着踏板。

Sense.DEF: a container for waste that has a lid which is opened by pressing part of it with your foot
a small boat that you move forward by pushing pedals round with your feet
someone who pays too much attention to rules or to small unimportant details, especially someone who criticizes other people in an extremely annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 拘泥于规则[细节]的人﹔学究﹐书呆子
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s not exactly what it means.’ ‘Pedant.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不完全是那个意思。”“书呆子。”

Sense.DEF: paying too much attention to rules or to small unimportant details
Sense.TRAN: 拘泥于规则[细节]的﹔学究式的﹐书呆子气的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people can be very pedantic about punctuation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人会对标点符号过于讲究。

Sense.DEF: to sell goods to people, especially goods that people disapprove of because they are illegal, harmful, or of not very high quality
Sense.TRAN: 售卖〔非法的﹑有害的或劣质的货品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were accused of peddling drugs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被控贩卖毒品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who peddle cigarettes to young children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卖香烟给小孩子的人

Sense.DEF: to try to sell things to people, especially by going from place to place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farmers come to Seoul to peddle rice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民们到首尔来兜售大米。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a door-to-door salesman peddling his wares selling his goods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挨家挨户兜售货物的推销员

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade people to accept an opinion or idea which is wrong or false
Sense.TRAN: 散布﹐兜售〔错误的观点﹑主张〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: politicians peddling instant solutions to long-standing problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣扬用速效方法解决长期问题的政客们

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
pedlar
someone who sells illegal drugs
a man who has sex with a young boy

the base on which a
pillar
or
statue
stands
Sense.TRAN: 〔柱子或雕像的〕基座﹐台座﹐柱脚
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Grecian bust on a pedestal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基座上的古希腊胸像

Sense.DEF: a solid vertical post that supports something such as a table
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pedestal of the dentist’s chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牙医椅子的座墩

GramExa.GLOSS: a bowl to wash your hands in, supported by a pedestal

Sense.DEF: to admire someone so much that you treat them or talk about them as though they are perfect
Sense.TRAN: 非常敬慕某人﹐把某人当成偶像崇拜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women are both put on a pedestal and treated like second-class citizens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性既受人仰慕又被视为二等公民。

Sense.DEF: someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars
ordinary and uninteresting and without any imagination
Sense.TRAN: 平淡无奇的﹔乏味的﹔缺乏想象力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a painting that is pedestrian and unimaginative
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乏味又缺乏想象力的画作
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rather pedestrian student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名相当平庸的学生

Sense.DEF: relating to pedestrians or used by pedestrians
Sense.EXAMPLE: pedestrian traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人流
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pedestrian walkway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人行通道

Sense.DEF: a specially marked place for people to walk across the road
to change a street or shopping area so that cars and trucks are no longer allowed
Sense.TRAN: 使成为行人专用区﹐使成为步行区

Sense.DEF: a shopping area in the centre of a town where cars, trucks etc cannot go
Sense.TRAN: 〔市中心禁止车辆通行的〕步行购物区﹐行人区

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
paediatrician

the American spelling of
paediatrics
a treatment for feet and toenails, to make them more comfortable or beautiful
the parents and other past family members of an animal or person, or an official written record of this
Sense.TRAN: 血统﹔家系﹐家谱﹔〔动物的〕纯种系谱

Sense.DEF: the history and achievements of something or someone, especially when they are good and should be admired
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指好的事物或受景仰之人的〕历史﹐过去﹔成就﹐成绩
Sense.EXAMPLE: Founded in 1781, the school has an excellent pedigree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该校成立于1781年﹐有着辉煌的历史。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scientist’s academic pedigree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位科学家的学术成就

Sense.DEF:
a pedigree animal comes from a family that has been recorded for a long time and is considered to be of a very good
breed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pedigree greyhound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良种灵𤟥

Sense.DEF: a three-sided part above the entrance to a building, especially on the buildings of ancient Greece
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指古希腊建筑门顶上的〕三角顶饰[楣饰]

Sense.DEF: someone who, in the past, walked from place to place selling small things
an instrument that measures how far you walk

the American spelling of
paedophile
to pass liquid waste from your body
liquid waste passed from your body
an act of passing liquid waste from your body

GramExa.PROPFORM: go for a pee/have a pee
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have I got time to go for a pee before we leave?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走之前有时间让我去撒个尿吗？

Sense.DEF: to look quickly at something, or to look at something from behind something else, especially something that you are not supposed to see

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carefully he peeked through the glass window in the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心翼翼地透过门上的玻璃窗窥视。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Paula opened the box and peeked inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葆拉打开盒子往里看了一眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shut your eyes and don’t peek!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闭上眼睛﹐不要偷看！

Sense.DEF: if something peeks from somewhere, you can just see a small amount of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moon peeked out from behind the clouds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月亮从云层后面露出了脸。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Diane took a quick peek at herself in the mirror.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜匆匆照了一下镜子。

Sense.DEF: a game you play to amuse young children, in which you hide your face and then show it again, or the word you say when you play this game
Sense.TRAN: 躲猫猫〔把脸一隐一现地逗小孩的一种游戏〕﹔猫儿〔玩这种游戏露出脸时说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peekaboo! I see you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫儿！ 我看见你喽！

Sense.DEF: to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 剥去[削去]〔水果或蔬菜〕的皮
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peel and dice the potatoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把马铃薯去皮并切成丁。

Sense.DEF: if skin, paper, or paint peels, it comes off, usually in small pieces

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The paper was peeling from the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纸从墙上脱落。

Sense.EXAMPLE: New skin grows, and the damaged skin peels off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新皮肤长出﹐受损的皮肤脱落。

Sense.DEF: to lose an outer layer or surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls were peeling from the damp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙面受潮起了皮。

Sense.DEF: to remove the outer layer from something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peel away the waxed paper from the bottom of the cake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 揭去蛋糕底部的蜡纸。

Sense.DEF: to take your clothes off
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom peeled off his wet T-shirt and shorts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆脱掉湿了的T恤衫和短裤。

Sense.DEF: to take a piece of paper money from the top of a pile of paper money
Sense.TRAN: 〔从一叠纸币的最上端〕拿出20美元/50英镑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manville peeled off a 20, and pressed it into the man’s hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼维尔从一沓钞票上面拿了一张20块的纸币﹐塞到那男人手中。

Sense.DEF: to leave a moving group of vehicles, aircraft etc and go in a different direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two motorcycles peeled off from the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两辆摩托车脱离了车队。

Sense.DEF: the skin of some fruits and vegetables, especially the thick skin of fruits such as oranges, which you do not eat
Sense.TRAN: 〔水果和蔬菜的〕外皮〔尤指橙子等不能食用的厚皮〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: orange peel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橙皮

Sense.DEF: a special type of knife for removing the skin from fruit or vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 〔水果或蔬菜的〕削皮刀﹐剥皮器

Sense.DEF: pieces of skin that have been removed from fruit or vegetables
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put the potato peelings on the compost heap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把削下的马铃薯皮倒在混合肥料堆上。

Sense.DEF: to look at something quickly and secretly, especially through a hole or opening
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过孔眼﹑开口处〕窥视﹐偷看

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The door was ajar and Helen peeped in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门虚掩着﹐海伦往里偷看。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henry peeped through the window into the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利从窗户向厨房里窥视。

Sense.DEF: if something peeps from somewhere, you can just see a small amount of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could see her toes peeping out from under the sheet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看见她的脚趾从被单下露出来。

Sense.DEF: to look at something because it is interesting or attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: On our website you can peep our video interview with R&B’s newest supergroup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们的网站可以观看到节奏布鲁斯最新超级组合的采访录像。

Sense.DEF: a quick or secret look at something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jon took a peep at his watch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔恩瞥了一眼手表。

Sense.DEF: a sound that someone makes, or something that they say, especially a complaint
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has not been a peep out of them since bedtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们上床后一点动静都没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peep of protest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议声

Sense.DEF: a short high sound, like the sound a mouse or a young bird makes
Sense.EXAMPLE: the peep of a chick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小鸡的唧唧声
Sense.EXAMPLE: loud peeps from the smoke alarm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟雾警报器发出的刺耳嘀嘀声

Sense.DEF: a word meaning ‘people’, used in magazines

Sense.TRAN: 躲猫猫﹔猫儿〔玩躲猫猫游戏时所说的话〕

Sense.DEF: a small hole in a door or wall that you can see through
someone who secretly watches people, especially people who are taking off their clothes, having sex etc
Sense.TRAN: 窥视者〔尤指偷看别人脱衣服﹑性交等〕

Sense.DEF: a type of show in which a man pays for a woman to take her clothes off while he watches through a window
Sense.TRAN: 偷窥脱衣表演﹐偷窥脱衣秀

Sense.DEF: a box containing moving pictures that you look at through a small hole
your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc
Sense.TRAN: 同龄人﹔社会地位相同的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff members are trained by their peers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工由同事培训。

Sense.DEF:
a member of the British
nobility
to look very carefully at something, especially because you are having difficulty seeing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因看起来费劲而〕盯着看﹐凝视
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was peering through the wet windscreen at the cars ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正费力地透过淋湿的风挡盯视着前方的汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Philippa peered into the darkness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲莉帕凝视着暗处。

Sense.DEF: all the British peers considered as a group
the rank of a British peer

a woman who is a member of the British
nobility
a group of people, especially people who are the same age, social class etc as yourself
Sense.TRAN: 同辈群体﹐同龄群﹔社会地位相同的一群人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the TV shows that are popular with his peer group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到他同龄人欢迎的电视节目

Sense.DEF: better than any other
Sense.EXAMPLE: the peerless blues musician B.B. King
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 举世无双的蓝调音乐家比比金

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling that you must do the same things as other people of your age if you want them to like you
Sense.TRAN: 同辈间的压力﹐同龄人间的压力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teenagers often start smoking because of peer pressure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年往往由于同龄人的压力而开始吸烟。

Sense.DEF:
a computer system etc in which all of the computers are connected to each other and they do not need a
server a main computer that controls all the others
Sense.TRAN: 对等[点对点]架构/网络/技术等
Sense.EXAMPLE: How will peer-to-peer technology be important to the average Internet user?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对等技术对普通因特网用户有什么重要性？

Sense.DEF: annoyed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peeved at his silence, she left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他的沉默感到生气﹐就走开了。

Sense.DEF: easily annoyed by small and unimportant things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids were peevish after so long in the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们坐了这么长时间的汽车﹐随时会发脾气。

Sense.DEF:
a
lapwing
a short piece of wood, metal, or plastic that is attached to a wall or fits into a hole, used especially to hang things on or to fasten things together
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于挂物或固定用的木头﹑金属或塑料〕短钉﹐挂钉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah hung her coat on the peg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉把外套挂在衣钩上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a table fitted together with pegs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张用钉子钉起来的桌子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pattern made with coloured pegs on a board
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木板上彩钉构成的图形

Sense.DEF: a small plastic or wooden object used to fasten wet clothes to a thin rope to dry
Sense.TRAN: 〔晾衣服用的塑料或木制〕衣夹

Sense.DEF: a pointed piece of wood or metal that you push into the ground in order to keep a tent in the correct position
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于固定帐篷的木制或金属〕桩

Sense.LEXUNIT: take/bring sb down a peg (or two)
Sense.DEF: to make someone realize that they are not as important or skilled as they think they are
Sense.TRAN: 杀某人的威风﹐挫某人的傲气
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evans is an arrogant bully who needs taking down a peg or two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯傲慢霸道﹐真该杀杀他的威风。

Sense.DEF:
a wooden screw used to make the strings of a
violin
,
guitar
etc tighter or looser
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于调节小提琴﹑吉他等弦线松紧的〕弦钮﹐琴栓

Sense.LEXUNIT: a peg to hang sth on
Sense.DEF: something that is used as a reason for doing, discussing, or believing something
Sense.TRAN: 做某事[相信某事]的理由[借口]﹔话题﹐谈资
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a peg to hang it on, the tournament had the 100th anniversary of Nehru’s birth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本次锦标赛是为了纪念尼赫鲁百年诞辰。

Sense.DEF:
a small amount of strong alcoholic drink, especially
whisky
or
brandy

Crossrefto.REFLEX: square peg in a round hole

Sense.DEF: to set prices, wages etc at a particular level, or set them in relation to something else
Sense.TRAN: 把〔价格﹑工资等〕固定在一定水平﹔与…挂钩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dividend was pegged at 6.1p.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 股息限定在6.1便士。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a currency pegged to the American dollar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与美元挂钩的货币

Sense.DEF: to fasten something somewhere with a peg
Sense.TRAN: 用钉[桩]固定〔某物〕﹐把…钉牢
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tent flap was pegged open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帐篷的门帘被掀开固定住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside, a woman was pegging sheets to a washing line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋外﹐一个女人正把床单夹在晾衣绳上。

Sense.DEF: to believe or say that someone has a particular type of character, or that a situation has particular qualities
Sense.TRAN: 认定〔某人〕为〔某种性格的人〕﹔认定〔某事〕有某种特质
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d had him pegged as a troublemaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他是个惹事坯子。

Sense.DEF: to work hard and with determination

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pegged away at her essay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坚持不懈地写论文。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from winning in a sport or from increasing the amount by which they are winning – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔在体育比赛中〕扳平﹔遏止…的势头〔用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were pegged back by an equaliser from Jameson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆森把比分扳平﹐遏制了他们的势头。

Sense.DEF: to die, or to fall down because you are tired
to fasten wet clothes to a washing line to dry
Sense.TRAN: 把〔湿衣服〕夹在晾衣绳上晾晒

Sense.DEF: to mark a piece of ground with wooden sticks
thin board with holes in it, into which you can put pegs or hooks to hang things on
Sense.TRAN: 〔有孔眼可装钉或钩挂物的〕配挂板

Sense.DEF: an artificial leg, especially a wooden one
a word or expression that is pejorative is used to show disapproval or to insult someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔单词或话语〕贬义的﹐用于侮辱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: For hard-line Republicans, the word ‘liberal’ had become a pejorative term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对强硬派共和党来说﹐“自由”一词已成了贬义词。

Sense.DEF: a Pekinese dog
a very small dog with a short flat nose and long silky hair
relating to or living in the deep sea, far from shore
Sense.EXAMPLE: pelagic fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深海鱼类

Sense.DEF: a large water bird that catches fish for food and stores them in a deep bag of skin under its beak
Sense.TRAN: 鹈鹕﹐塘鹅〔一种大型食鱼鸟〕

Sense.DEF:
a place on some roads in Britain where someone who wants to cross the road can stop the traffic by pushing a button that changes the
traffic lights
Sense.TRAN: 〔行人想过马路时可控制交通灯的〕自控人行横道

Sense.DEF:
a disease that makes you feel tired and that causes problems with your skin and

, caused by a lack of a type of B
vitamin

Sense.DEF: a small ball of a substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: food pellets for rabbits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 团粒兔食

Sense.DEF: a small ball of metal made to be fired from a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: shotgun pellets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猎枪弹丸

Sense.DEF: quickly and in an uncontrolled way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children ran pell-mell out of school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们一窝蜂地跑出学校。

Sense.DEF: very clear
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pellucid stream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清澈的小溪

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of wood or cloth above a window that hides the rod that the curtains hang on
to attack someone by throwing a lot of things at them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The marchers were pelted with rocks and bottles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行者遭人投掷大量石块和瓶子。

Sense.DEF: to be raining very heavily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rain pelted the windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨打在窗户上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s pelting down out there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外边大雨滂沱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cold wind and pelting rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒风暴雨

Sense.DEF: to run somewhere very fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three huge dogs came pelting into the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三条大狗窜到街上。

Sense.DEF: the skin of a dead animal, especially with the fur or hair still on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔从动物尸体上剥下的〕生皮﹔带毛兽皮

Sense.DEF: the fur or hair of a living animal
moving as fast as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nancy ran at full pelt to the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希拼命向学校跑去。

Sense.DEF: in or relating to the pelvis

the set of large wide curved bones at the base of your
spine
, to which your legs are joined
dried meat, beaten into small pieces and pressed into flat round shapes
an instrument for writing or drawing with ink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ballpoint pen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圆珠笔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a felt-tip pen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毡头笔

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please fill out the form in pen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请用钢笔填写此表。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a pen and ink drawing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢笔画

Sense.DEF: a small piece of land enclosed by a fence to keep farm animals in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sheep pen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 羊圈

Sense.DEF: to begin to write

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=penitentiary监狱

Sense.DEF:
a
penalty
, used especially when talking about football
to write something such as a letter, a book etc, especially using a pen
Sense.EXAMPLE: a song penned by George Clinton
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治·克林顿写的歌

Sense.DEF: to shut an animal in a small enclosed area
to be restricted or forced to remain in a small place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Norma felt restless and penned in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺尔玛犹如笼中困兽﹐焦躁不安。

Sense.DEF: relating to the legal punishment of criminals, especially in prisons
Sense.TRAN: 刑罚的﹐惩戒（性）的〔尤指入狱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the penal system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刑罚制度

GramExa.GLOSS: a special area of land where prisoners are kept

Sense.DEF: when someone is punished by being kept in prison and made to do hard physical work
very severe
Sense.EXAMPLE: penal rates of interest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极苛刻的利率

Sense.DEF: a set of laws and the punishments for not obeying those laws
to punish someone or treat them unfairly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two students were penalized very differently for the same offence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名学生犯了同样的过错﹐受到的处罚却大不相同。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Women feel professionally penalized for taking time off to raise children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性认为休假带孩子在职业上对自己不利。

Sense.DEF: to punish a team or player in sports by giving an advantage to the other team
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team was penalized for wasting time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队因拖延时间而受到处罚。

Sense.DEF: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔因违反法律﹑规则或合约而受到的〕惩罚﹐处罚
Sense.EXAMPLE: No littering. Penalty $500.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止乱扔垃圾。 违者罚款500美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Withdrawing the money early will result in a 10% penalty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提前支取这笔钱将被处以10%的罚金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The penalty for a first offense is a fine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 初犯将处以罚款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drug dealers face severe penalties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒贩面临严厉处罚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If he is convicted, he could receive the death penalty be killed as a punishment .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦定罪﹐他可能会被判处死刑。

Sense.DEF: something bad that happens to you because of something you have done or because of the situation you are in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the penalties of being famous is the loss of privacy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成名的弊端之一就是失去隐私。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If you don’t do the job right, you will pay the penalty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是不好好干活的话﹐你会有麻烦的。

Sense.DEF: a disadvantage in sports given to a player or team for breaking a rule
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育运动中对犯规者的〕判罚﹐处罚
Sense.EXAMPLE: Woodson received a penalty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伍德森受到了处罚。

Sense.DEF:
a chance to kick the ball or hit the
puck
into the
goal
in a game of football,
rugby
, or
ice hockey
, given because the other team has broken a rule
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球中的〕点球﹔〔橄榄球﹑冰球中的〕罚球
Sense.EXAMPLE: Townsend kicked a penalty in a rugby game in the last minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一分钟﹐汤森罚进了一球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leeds were awarded a penalty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹队获得一次点球机会。

Sense.DEF:
the area in front of the
goal
in football. The team opposing you is given a
penalty
if you break a rule there.

an area off the ice where a player in
ice hockey
must wait after not obeying a rule
a penalty area
the part of a contract which says what someone will have to pay or do if they do not obey the agreement, for example if they do not complete work on time
Sense.TRAN: 〔合同中对违约方的〕惩罚条款

Sense.DEF:
a
penalty 4
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球中的〕点球﹔〔橄榄球﹑冰球中的〕罚球

Sense.DEF:
a note made on a driver’s
licence
to show that they have done something wrong while they were driving. If someone gets 12 penalty points, they are no longer allowed to drive a car.

an occasion when each team in a football match takes penalty kicks until one team misses the
goal
– used as a way of deciding which team will win when the ordinary part of the match has ended in a
draw
something that you must do to show that you are sorry for something you have done wrong, especially in some religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤见于某些宗教的〕苦修﹐补赎

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We prayed and did penance together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一起祈祷并苦修。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: as a penance for his sins
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为对他所犯罪恶的补赎

Sense.DEF: something that you have to do but do not enjoy doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working in the garden was a kind of penance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在花园里干活是件苦差。

Sense.DEF:
a plural of
penny
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few pence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几便士
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 20 pence stamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚20便士的邮票

Sense.DEF: if you have a penchant for something, you like that thing very much and try to do it or have it often
Sense.TRAN: 一种/某人对某事物的嗜好[爱好]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a penchant for fast cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对跑车的酷爱

Sense.DEF: an instrument that you use for writing or drawing, consisting of a wooden stick with a thin piece of a black or coloured substance in the middle
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sharp pencil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尖尖的铅笔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blue pencil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝色铅笔

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a note written in pencil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用铅笔写的便条

Sense.EXAMPLE: a pencil sketch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铅笔速写

Sense.DEF: to write something or make a mark with a pencil
Sense.EXAMPLE: a name pencilled on the envelope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用铅笔写在信封上的名字

Sense.DEF: to make an arrangement for a meeting or other event, knowing that it might have to be changed later
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pickford has been pencilled in as Robson’s replacement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮克福德被暂定为罗布森的接替者。

Sense.DEF: a bag or box to carry pens and pencils in
someone who has a boring unimportant job in an office
a small instrument with a blade inside, used to make pencils sharp
Sense.TRAN: 削铅笔器﹐卷笔刀[器]﹐铅笔刨

Sense.DEF: a long narrow straight skirt
Sense.TRAN: 直筒长裙﹐铅笔裙〔一种窄而直的长裙〕

Sense.DEF: a jewel, stone etc that hangs from a thin chain that you wear around your neck
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruby pendant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红宝石吊坠

Sense.DEF: hanging from something
Sense.TRAN: 悬挂着的﹐下垂的﹐吊着的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pendent lamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吊灯

Sense.DEF: while waiting for something, or until something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales of the drug have been stopped, pending further research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药已经停售﹐等待进一步研究。

Sense.DEF: not yet decided or settled
Sense.TRAN: 未定的﹐未决的﹔待定的﹐待决的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many trade disputes are pending, awaiting the outcome of the talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多贸易争端悬而未决﹐等待会谈结果。

Sense.DEF: something that is pending is going to happen soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pending election
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即将举行的选举

Sense.DEF: a container for keeping papers, letters etc that have not yet been dealt with

a small piece of electronic equipment that uses
flash memory
to store information and can be fitted into a computer
Sense.TRAN: 笔式驱动器﹐随身存储器〔使用闪存来存储信息并能插入计算机的小型电子装置〕

Sense.DEF: hanging down loosely and swinging freely
Sense.EXAMPLE: pendulous breasts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松垂的乳房

Sense.DEF: a long metal stick with a weight at the bottom that swings regularly from side to side to control the working of a clock
used to talk about the tendency of ideas, beliefs etc to change regularly to the opposite
Sense.EXAMPLE: After several years of Republican government, the pendulum will undoubtedly swing back and voters will elect a Democrat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由共和党执政数年后﹐选民无疑会掉过头来﹐选出一位民主党人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pendulum of fashion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 时尚的钟摆

Sense.DEF: to enter something and pass or spread through it, especially when this is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 进入﹔渗入﹔刺入﹔穿过﹐穿透
Sense.EXAMPLE: bullets that penetrate thick armour plating
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿过厚装甲的子弹
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sunlight barely penetrated the dirty windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光几乎照不进那些肮脏的窗户。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Explorers penetrated deep into unknown regions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 探险者深入到了未知地区。

Sense.DEF: to start to sell things to an area or country, or to have an influence there
Sense.TRAN: 打进〔某地区或国家的市场〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few U.S. companies have successfully penetrated the Japanese electronics market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很少有美国公司成功打入日本电子产品市场。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in becoming accepted into a group or an organization, sometimes in order to find out their secrets
Sense.EXAMPLE: KGB agents had penetrated most of their intelligence services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克格勃特工已渗透到他们大部分的情报部门。

Subsense.DEF: to succeed in understanding something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Science has penetrated the mysteries of nature.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学已揭开了大自然的奥秘。

Subsense.DEF: to be understood, with difficulty
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What could I say that would penetrate his thick skull ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我该说什么才能让他这个呆瓜明白呢？

Sense.DEF:
if a man penetrates someone, he puts his
penis
into a woman’s
vagina
or into someone’s
anus
when having sex
to see into or through something when this is difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: My eyes couldn’t penetrate the gloom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的眼睛看不清暗处。

Sense.DEF: a look etc which makes you feel uncomfortable and seems to see inside your mind
Sense.TRAN: 锐利的目光/眼睛/凝视等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of penetrating dark eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双穿透人心的黑眼睛
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a penetrating stare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眼神犀利地看了她一眼。

Sense.DEF: showing an ability to understand things quickly and completely
Sense.TRAN: 有洞察力的﹐思维敏锐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: questions that are intelligent and penetrating
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机智而尖锐的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: a penetrating analysis of the issue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对那个问题精辟的分析

Sense.DEF: spreading and reaching everywhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: the penetrating cold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺骨的寒气

Sense.DEF: a penetrating sound is loud, clear, and often unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音〕响亮的﹐刺耳的 尖利的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high, penetrating voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尖利刺耳的嗓音

Sense.DEF: when something or someone enters or passes through something, especially when this is difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cover the entire device to prevent water penetration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把整台设备都罩住以免进水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The attack failed to lead to any deep penetration of enemy territory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次进攻没能深入敌区。

Sense.DEF: the degree to which a product is available or sold in an area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rise in import penetration of the domestic market
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内市场进口商品占有率的提高

Sense.DEF: when a system of beliefs enters a society and becomes accepted
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种信仰在某一社会的〕渗透

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the penetration of Marxism into Latin America
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思主义在拉丁美洲的传播

Sense.DEF: when someone joins and gets accepted by an organization, business etc in order to find out secret information
Sense.TRAN: 〔为刺探情报对某团体﹑企业等的〕渗入

GramExa.EXAMPLE: foreign penetration of the British secret service
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国势力对英国特工部门的渗透

when a man puts his
penis
into a woman’s
vagina
or into someone’s
anus
a special ability to understand things very clearly and completely

sex in which a man puts his
penis
into a woman’s

or into someone’s
anus
able to get into or through something easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: penetrative missiles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿透性导弹

Sense.DEF: showing an ability to understand things quickly and completely
Sense.TRAN: 思想敏锐的﹐有洞察力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: penetrative observations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敏锐的观察

Sense.DEF: someone you write friendly letters to, especially someone in another country who you have never met
a large black and white Antarctic sea bird, which cannot fly but uses its wings for swimming

a type of medicine that is used to treat infections caused by
bacteria

relating to the
penis
a piece of land almost completely surrounded by water but joined to a large area of land
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Korean peninsula
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝鲜半岛

Sense.DEF: the outer sex organ of men and male animals, which is used for sex and through which waste water comes out of the body
feeling sorry because you have done something wrong, and are intending not to do it again
Sense.EXAMPLE: a penitent expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愧疚的表情

Sense.DEF:
someone who is doing
penance
Sense.TRAN: 苦修者﹔忏悔者﹔告解者﹔苦行赎罪者

Sense.DEF: relating to being sorry for having done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: penitential journeys to famous shrines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前往著名圣地的忏悔之旅

Sense.DEF: a prison – used especially in the names of prisons
Sense.EXAMPLE: the North Carolina state penitentiary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北卡罗来纳州立监狱

Sense.DEF: a small knife with blades that fold into the handle, usually carried in your pocket
an electric light that you can carry in your hand and that is almost as small as a pen
the art of writing by hand, or skill in this art
Sense.EXAMPLE: children practicing their penmanship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 练习书法的儿童

Sense.DEF: a name used by a writer instead of their real name
a long narrow pointed flag used on ships or by schools, sports teams etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔船只﹑学校﹑运动队等用的〕三角旗

Sense.DEF: the prize given to the best team in the American and National League baseball competitions
Sense.TRAN: 〔颁发给美国联盟和国家联盟棒球比赛中冠军队的〕锦标

Sense.DEF:
a plural of
penny
someone who is penniless has no money
Sense.TRAN: 一文不名的﹐一贫如洗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Uncle Charlie was jobless and penniless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查理叔叔没有工作﹐一贫如洗。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow pointed flag, especially one carried on the end of a long pole by soldiers on horses in the Middle Ages
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指中世纪骑兵举的〕三角旗﹐三角矛旗

Sense.DEF:
a
pennyworth

Subsense.DEF: a small unit of money in Britain. There are 100 pence in one pound.
Subsense.TRAN: 便士〔英国货币单位﹐100便士合1英镑〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bus fare is 80 pence.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车费是80便士。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a 50p piece coin
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚50便士的硬币
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A loaf of bread costs 70p.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条面包70便士。

Subsense.DEF: a coin worth one penny
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve only got a few pennies left.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只剩几个一便士硬币了。

Sense.DEF:
a coin that is worth one
cent
in the US or Canada. One hundred pennies are equal to $1.
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国或加拿大的〕一分钱硬币

Sense.DEF:
a British unit of money or coin used until 1971. There were 12 pennies in one
shilling
Sense.TRAN: 便士〔英国1971年前使用的货币单位或硬币﹐12便士合1先令〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a book costing only sixpence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只卖6便士的书

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fourpenny cigar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卖4便士的雪茄
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a threepenny bit coin
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚3便士硬币

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone has no money or that something did not cost any money
Sense.TRAN: 一个便士也没有﹐一文不名﹔〔某物〕不花一分钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t got a penny on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身上一分钱也没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It didn’t cost me a penny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那东西没花我一分钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died without a penny to his name .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死时一文不名。

Sense.DEF: all of an amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel was expensive but it was worth every penny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家酒店很贵﹐但每分钱都花得很值。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was determined to go to Australia even if it took every penny of his savings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他下定决心﹐即使花掉所有积蓄也要去澳大利亚。

Sense.DEF: used to say that money is needed and even a small amount is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every penny counts in the battle to save the rain forests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在拯救热带雨林的战斗中﹐每一分钱都很重要。

Sense.DEF: the only money that is left
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s down to her last penny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的钱已经所剩无几。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a penny for your thoughts/a penny for them
Sense.DEF: used to ask someone who is silent what they are thinking about
Sense.TRAN: 你在想什么〔用于询问沉默不语的人〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: in for a penny, in for a pound
Sense.DEF: used to say that because you are already involved in something, you will complete it whatever time, money, or effort is needed
Sense.TRAN: 一不做﹐二不休﹔有始有终
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh well, it’s done now. In for a penny, in for a pound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐现在干完了﹐有始有终嘛。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has finally understood something that they had not understood before
to be very common and easy to get, or cheap – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 廉价而易得﹔不值钱〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rings like these are ten a penny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的戒指根本不值钱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: turn up like a bad penny
Sense.DEF: if someone you dislike turns up like a bad penny, they appear when they are not wanted
involving very small amounts of money, and not important
Sense.TRAN: 涉及金额很小的﹐没什么价值的
Sense.EXAMPLE: penny ante schemes to make money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微不足道的赚钱计划

Sense.DEF: a bicycle with a very large front wheel and a very small back wheel, used in the late 19th century
Sense.TRAN: 〔19世纪晚期使用的〕前轮大后轮小的自行车

Sense.DEF: unwilling to spend or give money
Sense.EXAMPLE: penny-pinching governments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吝啬的政府

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument like a small pipe with six holes, that you play by blowing
the amount of something that you could buy with a penny in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pennyworth of sweets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一便士的糖果

Sense.DEF: the study of prisons and the punishment of criminals
someone you make friends with by writing letters, especially someone who lives in another country and who you have never met
someone who has a boring unimportant job in an office
an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: At what age can you start drawing your pension ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从多少岁可以开始领取养老金？
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you are self-employed, you should think about taking out a private pension .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你是自由职业者﹐应该考虑办理私人养老金事宜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people find it hard to live on a basic state pension .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人发现仅凭国家基本养老金不能养活自己。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pays a quarter of her salary into a pension plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将每月工资的四分之一用于养老金计划。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave their job when they are old or ill, and pay them a pension
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于年老或疾病而〕使〔某人〕退休并发放养老金
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not everyone wants to be pensioned off at 65.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 并非每个人都希望在65岁退休领取养老金。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something because it is old or not useful any more
Sense.TRAN: 〔因陈旧或不再有用而〕丢弃〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the old ships have been pensioned off
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多旧船已被废弃。

Sense.DEF: a small cheap hotel in France and some other European countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔法国或其他一些欧洲国家中的〕廉价小旅馆

Sense.DEF: giving someone the right to receive a pension
Sense.TRAN: 有享受养老金[退休金]资格的
Sense.EXAMPLE: 36% of the population were of pensionable age .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 36%的人口属于可以享受养老金的年龄。

Sense.DEF: pay from which money is regularly taken for a pension
Sense.TRAN: 供计算养老金的报酬/工资等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The employee’s contribution is 5% of pensionable salary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工缴纳的数额是供计算养老金工资的5%。

Sense.DEF: a book that the British government gives to pensioners, which allows them to collect their pensions
Sense.TRAN: 〔由英国政府发放的〕养老金单据簿

Sense.DEF: someone who receives a pension
Sense.TRAN: 领取养老金[退休金]的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: old age pensioners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领取养老金[退休金]的老人

Sense.DEF:
a large amount of money that a company
invest s
and uses to pay
pension s

an arrangement in which you pay money regularly into a pension fund while you are working, so that you will receive a
pension

a
pension plan
thinking a lot about something, especially because you are worried or sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan looked pensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简神情忧伤。

Sense.DEF: a flat shape with five sides and five angles
a shape like a star with five points, often used as a magic sign
Sense.TRAN: 五角星形（符号）〔常用作魔法的标记〕

Sense.DEF: a line of poetry with five beats, or the beat of a poem like this
Sense.TRAN: 五音步诗行﹔五音步诗律

Sense.DEF: a sports event involving five different sports

the seventh Sunday after Easter, when Christians celebrate the appearance of the Holy Spirit to the
apostle s
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教的〕圣灵降临节〔复活节后第七个星期日〕

Sense.DEF: a Jewish religious holiday 50 days after Passover
Sense.TRAN: 〔犹太教的〕五旬节〔为逾越节后第50日〕

Sense.DEF: relating to a group of Christian churches that believe in the Holy Spirit’s power, such as the power to cure diseases
a very expensive and comfortable apartment or set of rooms on the top floor of a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: a £7 million London penthouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套价值700万英镑的伦敦顶层高级公寓

Sense.DEF: pent-up feelings or energy have not been expressed or used for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: years of pent-up anger and frustration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 积压多年的愤怒和挫败感

Sense.DEF: not the last, but immediately before the last
Sense.EXAMPLE: the penultimate chapter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒数第二章

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say the next to last or, in British English, the last but one rather than use penultimate .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 the next to last, 或在英国英语中说 the last but one, 而不说 penultimate
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the next to last chapter
the last but one chapter ( BrE 【英】 )

Sense.DEF: an area of slight darkness
the state of being very poor
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died in penury in 1644.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1644年他穷困潦倒而死。

Sense.DEF: someone who does boring or physically hard work for low pay – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔从事枯燥或重体力工作﹑报酬很低的〕苦力﹐苦工〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: someone in Mexico or South America who works as a type of slave to pay back debts
Sense.TRAN: 〔墨西哥或南美的〕抵债苦工﹐抵债奴

Sense.DEF: a garden plant with large round flowers that are dark red, white, or pink
used as the plural of ‘person’ to refer to men, women, and children
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many people were at the meeting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多少人到会？
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least 40 people were killed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少有40人遇害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the people who live next door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在隔壁的那些人

Sense.DEF: people in general, or people other than yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t care what people think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不在乎别人怎么想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People can be really mean sometimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候人真的很卑鄙。

GramExa.GLOSS: people who work or are involved in the theatre etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel was full of business people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店里住满了商务人士。

Sense.DEF: the people who belong to a particular country, race, or area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pledged that he would never lie to the American people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他保证绝不对美国人民撒谎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Basques, a people of northwestern Spain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴斯克人﹐西班牙西北部的一个民族
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the peoples of Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲各民族

Subsense.DEF: all the ordinary people in a country or a state, not the government or ruling class
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The people rebelled.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众奋起反抗。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Rice formed the staple food of the common people .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米饭是老百姓的主食。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The party try to portray the prime minister as a man of the people someone in power who understands or is like ordinary people .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党试图把首相描绘成一个亲民的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: belonging to or popular with the ordinary people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the People’s Liberation Army
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人民解放军
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Diana – the people’s princess
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴安娜﹐受民众爱戴的王妃

Subsense.DEF: used in court cases to represent the government of the US or of a particular state
Subsense.TRAN: 美国政府﹔州政府〔用于诉讼案〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The People vs. Romero
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府诉罗梅罗案

Subsense.DEF: the people that a king or leader rules or leads
Subsense.TRAN: 〔国王的〕臣民﹔〔领袖统治的〕人民
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The king ordered his people to prepare for war.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王命令他的臣民准备作战。

Subsense.DEF: the people who work for a person or organization
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A manager’s job is to make his or her people feel part of the system.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理的职责就是让其下属有归属感。

Subsense.DEF: your relatives, especially your parents, grandparents etc
Subsense.TRAN: 家人﹐亲属﹔〔尤指〕父母[祖父母等]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do your people live round here?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你家里人住在附近吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is the person you would least or most expect to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why should he, of all people, get a promotion?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么偏偏是他应该获得晋升呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You of all people should have known better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在所有人中你本应该是最清楚的。

Sense.DEF: used to get the attention of a group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Listen up, people!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意听﹐各位！

Sense.DEF: if a country or area is peopled by people of a particular type, they live there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an island peopled by hardy sea folk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 住着吃苦耐劳﹑在海上讨生活的人的一座岛屿

Sense.DEF: if a story or someone’s imagination is peopled by people of a particular type, it is full of them
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种类型的人〕充斥于〔故事或想象〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her world was peopled with imaginary friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的世界里充满了想象出来的朋友。

Sense.DEF: a large car with about eight seats, used especially by people with families
Sense.TRAN: 八座小客车﹐小型面包车

Sense.DEF: the ability to deal with people well
Sense.TRAN: 处理人际关系的技巧﹐和人打交道的能力
Sense.EXAMPLE: A doctor needs people skills as well as technical knowledge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生要具备专业知识以及与人打交道的能力。

Sense.DEF: to make something or someone more active or interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team needs a few new players to pep it up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支球队需要一些新人来增加活力。

Sense.DEF: physical energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enthusiastic player, full of pep
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位满腔热情﹑精力充沛的球员

Sense.DEF: a powder that is used to add a hot taste to food
Sense.EXAMPLE: salt and pepper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盐和胡椒粉

Sense.DEF: a hollow red, green, or yellow vegetable, eaten either raw or cooked with other food
if something is peppered with things, it has a lot of those things in it or on it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a speech peppered with amusing stories
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿插了许多有趣故事的演讲
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The surface of the moon is peppered with craters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球表面布满陨石坑。

Sense.DEF: if bullets pepper something, they hit it several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: Machine gun fire peppered the front of the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机枪的火力不断攻击大楼的正面。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone a lot of questions, one after the other
Sense.TRAN: 连珠炮似的向某人提问
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reporters peppered him with questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者们连珠炮似的向他发问。

Sense.DEF: to add pepper to food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pepper the steak well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将胡椒粉均匀地撒在牛排上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: peppered salami
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加了胡椒粉的萨拉米香肠

Sense.DEF: pepper-and-salt hair is starting to become grey
the small dried fruit that is crushed to make pepper
a very low rent
Sense.TRAN: 象征性租金﹐极少的租金

Sense.DEF: a piece of kitchen equipment used to crush peppercorns to make pepper
a plant with a strong taste and smell, often used in sweets
a sweet with the taste of peppermint

an Italian
sausage
with a strong taste
a small container with little holes in the top, used for shaking pepper onto food

a substance used especially by the police for controlling people. It contains red pepper and is
spray ed
into people’s eyes to make them blind for a short time.
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指警察用于制服他人的〕辣椒喷雾剂

Sense.DEF: tasting or smelling of pepper
becoming annoyed easily

a
pill
containing a drug that gives you more energy or makes you feel happier for a short time

a meeting at a school before a sports event, when
cheerleader s
lead the students in encouraging their team to win
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校体育竞赛前的〕动员大会

Sense.DEF: a liquid in your stomach that changes food into a form that your body can use

a group of
cheerleader s
who perform at school sports events or pep rallies
a short speech intended to encourage someone to work harder, win a game etc
Sense.TRAN: 鼓舞士气的讲话﹐激励性讲话
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alam gave the Pakistani team a pep talk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿拉姆对巴基斯坦队作了一番讲话﹐以鼓舞士气。

Sense.DEF:
a painful
ulcer
inside someone’s stomach
during each hour etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The park attracts four million visitors per year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座公园每年吸引400万游客。

GramExa.GLOSS: used for measuring speed
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 每小时…英里/公里〔用以测量速度〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a speed limit of 40 miles per hour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时40英里的限速

Sense.DEF: for each
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much does it cost per kilo?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每公斤多少钱？
Sense.EXAMPLE: rooms costing £40 per night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每晚收费40英镑的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Admission is £9.95 per adult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成人门票每位9.95英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My car does 12 miles per litre for each litre of petrol .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的汽车每升汽油跑12英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meal cost $25 per head for or by each person .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那顿饭人均花费25美元。

Sense.DEF: according to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work was carried out as per your instructions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作是按照您的指示进行的。

Sense.DEF: used when something annoying happens which has often happened before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenny was late, as per usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮照例迟到了。

Sense.DEF: a walk around a place, especially a slow walk for pleasure

a
pram
for each year
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salary of $40,000 per annum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4万美金的年薪

Sense.DEF: a type of cotton cloth, used especially for making sheets
used to describe the average amount of something in a particular place, calculated according to the number of people who live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s per capita income
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的人均收入
Sense.EXAMPLE: the number of crimes that occur per capita
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人均犯罪数

Sense.DEF: to understand or think of something or someone in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even as a young woman she had been perceived as a future chief executive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至在年轻时﹐她就被看成未来的总裁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Often what is perceived to be aggression is simply fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看起来气势汹汹的表现往往只是恐惧而已。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children who do badly in school tests often perceive themselves to be failures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学校考试中成绩不好的孩子经常会认为自己很失败。

Sense.DEF: to notice, see, or recognize something
Sense.EXAMPLE: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天早上﹐他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫不能辨别颜色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He perceived that there was no other way out of the crisis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为没有其他办法可以摆脱危机。

Sense.DEF: equal to five, ten etc parts out of a total of 100 parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 10% increase in house prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 10%的房价上涨
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company with a 40 percent stake in the project
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那个项目中拥有40%股份的公司

Sense.DEF: completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I agree with you a hundred percent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我百分之百同意你的看法。

Sense.DEF: an amount equal to five, ten etc parts out of a total of 100 parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bank charges interest at 14%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行收取14%的利息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eighty percent of the population voted. 80%
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 的人口参加了投票。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Percent is only used after a number. If you are referring more generally to part of an amount, use percentage. percent仅用在数字之后﹐如要更笼统表示某数量中的一部分﹐可用 percentage: A high percentage (NOT 不说 percent) of the population was illiterate. 绝大部分人口是文盲。

Sense.DEF: an amount expressed as if it is part of a total which is 100

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The percentage of school leavers that go to university is about five per cent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 中学毕业生上大学的比例约为5%。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tax is paid as a percentage of total income.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 税款是按照总收入的百分比支付的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A high percentage of married women have part-time jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已婚妇女兼职的比例很高。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest rates fell by six percentage points 6% .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利息下降了6个百分点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The numbers are small in percentage terms when calculated as a percentage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按百分比来看﹐这些数字很小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Crime figures showed significant percentage increases.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪数量的百分比有显著增加。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: If the noun that follows a percentage of is plural, use a plural verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果 a percentage of 之后的名词是复数,其后要用复数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Only a small percentage of people are interested in politics.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一小部分人对政治感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: a share of the profits
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gets a percentage for every record sold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每卖出一张唱片她都可得到一份提成。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there is no percentage in doing sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that doing something is not going to help or be useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no percentage in worrying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 担心也没有用。

Sense.DEF: one of 100 equal-sized parts that a group of people can be divided into – used especially when comparing people’s scores in a test or levels of health
Sense.TRAN: 百分位数〔尤用于比较测验成绩或健康水平〕

Sense.DEF: something that is perceptible can be noticed, although it is very small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small but perceptible change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微小但可以察觉的变化
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sound was barely perceptible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那声音几乎听不见。

Sense.DEF: the way you think about something and your idea of what it is like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: children’s perceptions of the world
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童对世界的认识

Sense.EXAMPLE: the public perception of the government’s performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众对政府表现的看法

Sense.DEF: the way that you notice things with your senses of sight, hearing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: drugs that alter perception
