Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改变感知的药物
Sense.EXAMPLE: visual perception
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 视觉

Sense.DEF: the natural ability to understand or notice things quickly
Sense.TRAN: 洞察力﹔理解能力﹔感知能力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ross shows unusual perception for a boy of his age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗斯所表现出的洞察力对于他这个年纪的男孩来说是很不寻常的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is perceptive notices things quickly and understands situations, people’s feelings etc well – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 观察敏锐的﹐洞察力强的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perceptive young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个观察敏锐的年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: highly perceptive comments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精辟的评论
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re right. That’s very perceptive of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说得对﹐你看得很透。

Sense.DEF: a branch or stick where a bird sits
a high place or position, especially one where you can sit and watch something
Sense.TRAN: 高位﹐高处〔尤指人可以坐着看某事物的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She watched the parade from her perch on her father’s shoulders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她骑在父亲的肩上观看游行。

Sense.DEF: a type of fish that lives in lakes and rivers
to be in a position on top of something or on the edge of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house perched on a cliff above the town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢位于悬崖之上俯瞰城镇的房屋

Sense.DEF: to sit on top of something or on the edge of something
Sense.TRAN: （使自己）坐在某物的上面[边上]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bobby had perched himself on a tall wooden stool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博比坐到了一张高高的木凳上。

Sense.DEF: if a bird perches on something, it flies down and sits on it
perhaps
Sense.EXAMPLE: One day perchance I shall tell you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 或许有一天我会告诉你的。

Sense.DEF: by chance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave now, lest perchance he find you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在就走吧﹐免得不巧被他发现。

Sense.DEF: quick to notice and understand things
Sense.TRAN: 目光敏锐的﹐洞察 [理解]力强的

Sense.DEF: if an idea, feeling, or piece of information percolates through a group, it gradually spreads

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The message has begun to percolate through the organization.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那消息开始在整个机构中传播开来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: These ideas were slow to percolate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些观念流传得很慢。

Sense.DEF: if liquid, light, or air percolates somewhere, it passes slowly through a material that has very small holes in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rainwater percolates down through the rock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨水顺着岩石的裂缝渗下去。

Sense.DEF: if coffee percolates, or if you percolate it, you make it in a special pot in which hot water goes up through a tube and then passes down through crushed coffee beans
a special pot in which coffee is percolated
musical instruments such as drums, bells etc which you play by hitting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tonight we have Paul Duke on percussion playing a percussion instrument .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我们请到保罗·杜克先生负责打击乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a range of percussion instruments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组打击乐器

Sense.DEF:
the people in an
orchestra
or band who play musical instruments such as drums, bells etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔管弦乐团或乐队的〕打击乐器组

Sense.DEF: the sound or effect of two things hitting each other with great force
Sense.TRAN: 〔两物猛烈相撞产生的〕撞击声﹔振动﹐震动

Sense.DEF: relating to or sounding like percussion instruments
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the piano such chords have a fine percussive effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢琴上这些和音有很好的打击乐效果。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that an employer pays a worker for each day that is worked
an amount of money that a worker is allowed to spend when doing his or her job, for example on a business trip
Sense.EXAMPLE: a per diem allowance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日津贴

Sense.DEF: for each day or on each day
Sense.EXAMPLE: workers who are paid per diem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按日结算工资的工人

Sense.DEF: punishment after death
complete destruction or failure
Sense.EXAMPLE: an alcoholic on the road to perdition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个走向毁灭的酒鬼

Sense.DEF: a long journey
Sense.EXAMPLE: His peregrinations took him to India.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他游历到了印度。

Sense.DEF: a hunting bird with a black and white spotted front
peremptory behaviour, speech etc is not polite or friendly and shows that the person speaking expects to be obeyed immediately
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑说话等〕专横的﹐霸道的﹐盛气凌人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peremptory demand for silence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要人肃静的蛮横要求

Sense.DEF: continuing or existing for a long time, or happening again and again
Sense.TRAN: 持续的﹔长久的﹔反复出现的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lack of resources has been a perennial problem since the beginning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财力不足从最初起就一直是个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teddy bears are a perennial favorite with children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰迪熊一直受到孩子们的喜爱。

Sense.DEF: a plant that is perennial lives for more than two years
a plant that lives for more than two years
a Russian word meaning ‘rebuilding’, used to describe the social, political, and economic changes that happened in the former USSR in the 1980s
Sense.TRAN: 重建〔俄语﹐指20世纪80年代苏联发生的社会﹑政治和经济变革〕

Sense.DEF: not having any mistakes, faults, or damage
Sense.TRAN: 完美的﹐完好的﹐十全十美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His English was perfect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的英语很地道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was in perfect condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车的车况极佳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re very lucky to have perfect teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能拥有一口完美的牙齿太幸运了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perfect performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完美的演出
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a perfect world, we wouldn’t need an army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在理想世界中﹐我们不需要军队。

Sense.DEF: as good as possible, or the best of its kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather was perfect the whole week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个星期天气都非常好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perfect example of Gothic architecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其典型的哥特式建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clothes were a perfect fit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这身衣服太合体了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perfect solution to the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决此问题的绝佳方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ronnie was in perfect health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 龙尼十分健康。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when something happens at exactly the right time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Good, you’re home. Perfect timing – dinner’s on the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好极了﹐你回来啦。 正好﹐晚饭摆上桌了。

Sense.DEF: exactly what is needed for a particular purpose, situation, or person
Sense.TRAN: 最适当的﹐完美的﹔理想的
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s perfect! Just the way I wanted it to look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那太完美了！ 正是我想要的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crusty bread is the perfect accompaniment to this soup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脆皮面包是这种汤的绝配。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The land is perfect for sheep farming.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片土地最适合养羊。

GramExa.PROPFORM: perfect way/place/time etc to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She thought she’d found the perfect place to live.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己找到了理想的住所。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a perfect day for a picnic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 野餐的理想日子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the perfect actor for the part
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 扮演这个角色的最佳人选

Sense.DEF: said when you are answering someone who has criticized you or someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: So I made a mistake! Nobody’s perfect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是犯了个错误！人无完人嘛。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a perfect right to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that it is reasonable for someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a perfect right to know what’s happening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全有理由了解目前发生的事情。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone has a particular quality completely
Sense.TRAN: 完全陌生的人/十足的傻瓜/十足的好人等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a perfect idiot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己是个十足的傻瓜。

Sense.DEF: to make something as good as you are able to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mock trials help students perfect their legal skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模拟庭审有助于学生们完善自己的法律技能。

Sense.DEF: the form of a verb which is used when talking about a period of time up to and including the present. In English, it is formed with ‘have’ and the past participle.
able to be improved or made perfect
Sense.TRAN: 可臻完美的﹐可完善的﹐可改进[改善]的

Sense.DEF: the state of being perfect
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father expected perfection from all of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲期望我们都尽善尽美。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the search for technical perfection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对技术的精益求精

GramExa.GLOSS: perfectly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The beef was cooked to perfection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛肉煮得恰到好处。

Sense.DEF: the process of making something perfect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the perfection of his golf swing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他高尔夫挥杆技术的完善

Sense.DEF: to be perfect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her performance was pure perfection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的表演炉火纯青。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not satisfied with anything unless it is completely perfect
Sense.TRAN: 力求完美者﹐完美主义者﹐凡事求全者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many top athletes are perfectionists who drive themselves to excel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多顶尖运动员都是不断超越的完美主义者。

Sense.DEF: completely – used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 完全地﹐十足地〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s perfectly normal to be nervous before a performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出之前觉得紧张再正常不过了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sale was perfectly legal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔生意完全合法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can get a perfectly good coat at Sears for a lot less money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以少花很多钱在西尔斯百货商店买到一件非常好的外套。

Sense.DEF: in a perfect way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plan worked perfectly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个计划非常奏效。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The steaks were perfectly cooked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛排做得好极了。

Sense.DEF:
the
past participle

the ability to correctly name any musical note that you hear, or to sing any note at the correct
pitch
without the help of an instrument
Sense.TRAN: 绝对音感〔听到音高后准确说出音名或不借助乐器唱出音高的能力〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is perfidious is not loyal and cannot be trusted
when someone is not loyal to another person who trusts them
to make a hole or holes in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A broken rib had perforated her lung.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根肋骨骨折﹐刺穿了她的肺部。

Sense.DEF: something that is perforated has a hole or holes cut or torn in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perforated eardrum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿孔的耳膜
Sense.EXAMPLE: perforated coupons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有孔眼线的优惠券

Sense.DEF: a small hole in something, especially one of a line of holes made in a piece of paper so that it can be torn easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: the perforations in a sheet of stamps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一版邮票上的齿孔

Sense.DEF: when something makes a hole or holes
because it is necessary
to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children perform two plays each school year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use perform to say what person an actor pretends to be in a play, film etc. Use play. 表示演员在戏剧﹑电影等中扮演某角色﹐不用 perform﹐要用play: John Wayne played (NOT 不说 performed) a Roman soldier in the film. 约翰·韦恩在那部电影中扮演一名罗马士兵。

Sense.DEF: to do something, especially something difficult or useful
Sense.TRAN: 做﹔执行﹔履行﹔实行〔尤指有难度或有用的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surgeons performed an emergency operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外科医生做了一个急诊手术。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The official opening ceremony was performed by Princess Margaret.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方开幕式由玛 格丽特公主主持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An analysis of the survey data was performed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对调查数据进行了分析。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责﹐她被解雇了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: software that performs a specific function
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 执行特定功能的软件

Sense.EXAMPLE: The leadership cannot be expected to perform miracles improve a situation in a way that seems impossible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要指望这个领导班子能化腐朽为神奇。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone carries out an operation, a study etc rather than use perform .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 carry out an operation, a study etc , 而不说 perform
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The operation was carried out by a team of surgeons.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次手术由一个外科医生团队实施。

Subsense.DEF: to work or do something well, badly etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Many religious schools perform well academically.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多教会学校学业成绩非常好。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The team performed poorly on Saturday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支球队星期六表现很差。

Subsense.DEF: if a product, business etc performs well or badly, it makes a lot of money or very little money
Subsense.TRAN: 〔产品﹑生意等〕经营得好/不好等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The economy is performing well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济状况良好。

Sense.DEF: when someone performs a play or a piece of music

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their performance of Mozart’s Concerto in E flat was finely controlled and dramatic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们演奏的莫扎特《降E大调协奏曲》张弛有度﹐不同凡响。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This evening’s performance will begin at 8.00 pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的演出8点开始。

Sense.DEF: how well or badly a person, company etc does a particular job or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sean’s performance at school has greatly improved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖恩在学校的表现进步很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was impressed by the team’s performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队的表现让我印象深刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country’s economic performance so far this year has been good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐该国今年的经济状况很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shareholders blamed him for the company’s poor performance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股民认为他应对公司业绩不佳负责。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her disappointing performance in the Olympics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在奥运会上的糟糕表现
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exam results are used as performance indicators things that show how well something is done for schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校将考试成绩当成衡量学生表现的指标。

Sense.DEF: the act of doing a piece of work, duty etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the performance of his official duties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 履行他的职务

Sense.DEF: how well a car or other machine works
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s performance on mountain roads was impressive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车在山路上的性能令人惊叹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an imaging system using high-performance very effective technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运用高性能技术的成像系统

Sense.DEF: a process that takes a lot of unnecessary time and effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shopping at the markets turned out to be quite a performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那些市场购物原来这么麻烦。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Samuel Jackson gives a terrific performance as Elijah.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞缪尔·杰克逊扮演的伊莱贾很出色。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We can go to the evening performance if you prefer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你愿意,我们可以去看夜场演出。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are fine performances by Kathy Bates and Daryl Hannah.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯茜·贝茨和达丽尔·汉娜的表演很出色。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: good and easy to remember
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There were memorable performances from Madonna and U2.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦当娜和U2乐队的一些演唱令人难忘。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one showing great skill
one performed for people who are watching
one performed by a single musician, not a group

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘have a performance’ or 或 ‘make a performance’. Say 而要说 give a performance.

Sense.DEF: a type of art that can combine acting, dance, painting, film etc to express an idea
Sense.TRAN: 综合表演艺术﹔杂合艺术

Sense.DEF: a drug or product that is used illegally by people competing in sports events to improve their performance
Sense.TRAN: 提高体育比赛成绩的药物/产品/补充剂等

Sense.DEF: money that you earn for your work, which is increased if you do your work very well
Sense.TRAN: 与工作表现挂钩的薪酬﹐绩效工资

Sense.DEF: an actor, musician etc who performs to entertain people
Sense.EXAMPLE: circus performers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马戏演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a better songwriter than performer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他更擅长写歌﹐而不是演唱。

Subsense.DEF: someone who does a particular job or activity well or badly
Subsense.TRAN: 〔工作或活动中〕表现良好/出色/糟糕等的人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Star performers are rewarded with bonuses.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表现最出色的人有奖金。

Subsense.DEF: a product, business etc that makes a lot of money, or that makes very little money
Subsense.TRAN: 畅销/滞销产品﹔经营出色/很糟的生意
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Newcastle Brown Ale is an outstanding performer in the British beer market.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽卡斯尔棕啤在英国啤酒市场很畅销。

Sense.DEF:
arts such as dance, music, or
drama
a liquid with a strong pleasant smell that women put on their skin or clothing to make themselves smell nice
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing the perfume that he’d bought her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她擦了他买给她的香水。

Sense.DEF: a sweet or pleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: It had the delicate perfume of roses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它有玫瑰的幽香。

Sense.DEF: to make a place have a sweet pleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lilacs perfumed the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丁香花的香气弥漫在空气中。

Sense.DEF: to put perfume on something
a place where perfumes are made or sold
the process of making perfumes
a perfunctory action is done quickly, and is only done because people expect it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a perfunctory smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他漫不经心地笑了笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The applause was perfunctory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 掌声听上去是在敷衍了事。

Sense.DEF: a structure made of posts built for plants to grow over in a garden
used to say that something may be true, but you are not sure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps she’s next door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她也许在隔壁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps it will snow tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天可能会下雪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It won’t take so long next time, perhaps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许下次不用那么久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t think you understand.’ ‘Well, perhaps not .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想你不明白。”“嗯﹐也许吧。”

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use may or might rather than use perhaps it/she/they etc will .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们常用may或might,而不用perhaps it/she/they etc will
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It might snow tomorrow.

Sense.DEF: used to give your opinion, when you do not want to be too definite
Sense.TRAN: 也许〔用于表达不十分确定的观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is perhaps her finest novel yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这或许是她迄今为止最好的一部小说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The industrial revolution was, perhaps, the most important event in history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业革命也许是历史上最重要的事件。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a number is only a guess
Sense.TRAN: 也许﹐可能〔用于表示某个数字仅仅是猜测〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was large, perhaps 20 feet square.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个房间很大﹐可能有20英尺见方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps 200 people were there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里可能有200人。

Sense.DEF: used to politely ask or suggest something, or say what you are going to do
Sense.TRAN: 也许﹐或许〔用于表示礼貌的请求或建议﹐或自己将做什么〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought perhaps we’d have lunch in the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想或许我们可以在花园里吃午餐。

Sense.DEF: great danger, especially of being harmed or killed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They put their own lives in peril to rescue their friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不顾自身安危去营救朋友。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The economy is now in grave peril.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济目前处于严重危机中。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a voyage that was fraught with peril full of danger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历尽艰险的旅程

Sense.DEF: a danger or problem in a particular activity or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: the perils posed by mountaineering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登山运动的危险

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the perils of the sea
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大海的凶险

Sense.DEF: used to say that what someone is intending to do is dangerous or could cause them problems
Sense.TRAN: 做某事要自担风险〔用于告诫某人他打算做的事情很危险〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politicians ignore this issue at their peril.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客们无视这个问题就要自担风险。

Sense.DEF: very dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perilous journey across the mountains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿越群山的危险旅程

Sense.DEF: in a way that is dangerous and likely to result in something bad soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karpov, the champion, came perilously close to losing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冠军卡尔波夫险些落败。

Sense.DEF: the border around an enclosed area such as a military camp
Sense.TRAN: 〔军营等地的〕四周﹐周围﹐周边﹐边缘

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the perimeter of the airfield
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场的四周

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A mine blew a hole in the perimeter wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地雷把围墙炸出了一个洞。

Sense.DEF: the whole length of the border around an area or shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Calculate the perimeter of the rectangle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算这个长方形的周长。

Sense.DEF: at or around the time of birth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high rate of perinatal mortality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 围产期的高死亡率

Sense.DEF: a particular length of time with a beginning and an end
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tomorrow’s weather will be dry with sunny periods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天天气干燥﹐间或晴朗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His playing improved in a very short period of time .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演奏技巧在很短时间内就有了提高。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a brief period of silence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 短暂的沉默

Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug was tested over a five-week period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种药品进行了为期五周的试验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They adopted the system for a trial period time in which something is tested to see if it works well .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那套系统他们试用了一段时间。

Sense.DEF: a particular time in someone’s life or in history
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人生活或历史上的〕时期﹔阶段﹔时代
Sense.EXAMPLE: the conflict of the Cold War period
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷战期间的冲突
Sense.EXAMPLE: Van Gogh’s early period
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡·高的早期生涯
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Jurassic period
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侏罗纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: the behaviour of children during the period of adolescence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青春期孩子的行为

Sense.DEF: the flow of blood that comes from a woman’s body each month
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was 12 years old when I started my periods .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我12岁月经初潮。

Sense.DEF:
the mark (.), used in writing to show the end of a sentence or of an
abbreviation
one of the equal parts that the school day is divided into
Sense.EXAMPLE: What class do you have first period?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你第一节上什么课？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a double period of Science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连两节的自然科学课

Sense.DEF:
one of the equal parts that a game is divided into in a sport such as
ice hockey
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Bruins scored twice in the first period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棕熊队在第一局两次得分。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you have made a decision and that you do not want to discuss the subject any more
Sense.TRAN: 就这样定了！〔用于表示已作出决定﹐不想再讨论某话题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going, period!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不去﹐就这样了！

Section.SECHEADING: A PERIOD IN HISTORY 一段历史时期

Exponent.DEF: a particular time in history, especially one studied as a subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the late Victorian period
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚晚期
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the interwar period
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两次世界大战之间的时期
Exponent.EXAMPLE: During that period many people moved from the countryside to the towns.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一时期许多人从乡间搬进了城镇。

Exponent.DEF: a period of years, months, days etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The 1960s were a time of great social change.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪60年代是社会巨变的时期。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the biggest earthquake in modern times
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代史上最强烈的一次地震
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Verdun was an important city in Roman times.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡尔登在罗马时期是一座重要城市。

Exponent.DEF: a long period, especially one that represents a particular stage in the development of civilization or technology
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指文明或技术发展的某个〕时代﹐世代
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the industrial age
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业时代
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We are now in the age of the Internet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正处于因特网时代。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Stone Age when people used tools made of stone
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 石器时代

Exponent.DEF: a long period that has a particular character or that is marked by particular events
Exponent.TRAN: 〔以某些特殊事件为标志的〕时代,时期
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We live in an era of breathtaking change.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们生活在一个日新月异的时代。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the post-war era
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后时期
Exponent.EXAMPLE: De Gaulle’s death marked the end of an era .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴高乐的逝世标志着一个时代的结束。

Exponent.DEF: means the same as era , but sounds more formal and important
Exponent.TRAN: 时代,时期〔意同era﹐但更正式并更具重要性〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We are now entering a new epoch in human history.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正踏入人类历史的新纪元。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the colonial epoch
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 殖民时期
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was the end of an epoch .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一个时代的终结。

Sense.DEF: clothes, furniture etc in the style of a particular time in history
Sense.TRAN: 具有特定历史时期风格的服装/家具等
Sense.EXAMPLE: actors dressed in period costume
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着年代服装的演员

Sense.DEF: happening a number of times, usually at regular times
Sense.EXAMPLE: periodic home visits by nurses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士的定期上门探访

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Teachers meet periodically to discuss progress.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师定期开会讨论进度。

Sense.DEF: a magazine, especially one about a serious or technical subject

a list of
element s simple chemical substances
arranged according to their atomic structure
relating to the part of the mouth at the base of the teeth
Sense.EXAMPLE: periodontal disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牙周疾病

Sense.DEF:
pain that a woman gets when she has her
period
an old piece of furniture or work of art
Sense.TRAN: 古老的东西〔如家具或艺术品〕﹐古董
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house furnished with period pieces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陈设古色古香的房子

Sense.DEF: a film, play, book etc whose story takes place during a particular period in history
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑戏剧﹑书等〕以某特定时代为背景的作品
Sense.EXAMPLE: a period piece based on a book by E.M. Forster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据E.M.福斯特的书改编的年代剧

Sense.DEF: travelling from place to place, especially in order to do your job
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为工作而〕流动的﹐巡回的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peripatetic music teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在多所学校任教的音乐教师

Sense.DEF: not as important as other things or people in a particular activity, idea, or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diplomat who had a peripheral role in the negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在谈判中发挥辅助作用的外交官
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her involvement in the case was peripheral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在这宗案件中是从犯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The romance is peripheral to the main plot of the movie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段恋情是电影主要情节之外的支线。

Sense.DEF: in the outer area of something, or relating to this area
Sense.TRAN: （在…）外围的﹐（在…）周边的﹐（在…）边缘的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the city’s peripheral suburbs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市的市郊
Sense.EXAMPLE: the peripheral nervous system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周围神经系统

Sense.DEF: your ability to see things to the side of you when you look straight ahead
peripheral equipment can be connected to a computer and used with it

a piece of equipment that is connected to a computer and used with it, for example a
printer
the edge of an area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the periphery of the crowd
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群外围

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a residential area on the periphery of the city
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个位于城市边缘的住宅区

Sense.DEF: a person or thing that is on the periphery of something is not one of the main people or things involved in it
Sense.TRAN: （与某事物）稍有牵连的﹐处于（某事物）外围的
Sense.EXAMPLE: extremists on the periphery of the animal rights movement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处于动物权利运动边缘的极端分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Homeopathy is on the periphery of medical practice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺势疗法处于医疗的边缘地带。

Sense.DEF: when someone uses long words or phrases that are not necessary

the use of
auxiliary
words instead of
inflect
ed forms
Sense.TRAN: 迂说法〔用助动词而不用屈折变化的表达法〕

Sense.DEF:
a long tube with mirrors fitted in it, used to look over the top of something, especially to see out of a
submarine
to die, especially in a terrible or sudden way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds perished when the ship went down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮船沉没﹐数百人罹难。

Sense.DEF: if rubber or leather perishes, it decays
used to say that you hope what someone has suggested will never happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we lose, perish the thought, Watford will take first place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们输了﹐但愿这不会成为事实﹐沃特福德就会拿第一了。

Sense.DEF: food that is perishable is likely to decay quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: perishable goods such as butter, milk, fruit and fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄油﹑牛奶﹑水果和鱼等易变质的商品

Sense.DEF: feeling very cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I’d brought a jacket – I’m perished!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真该带件夹克来——我现在冷得要命！

Sense.DEF: a child that behaves badly
very cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was perishing in the tent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帐篷里冷得要命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go indoors. I’m perishing!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进屋吧﹐我好冷啊！

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone or something that is annoying you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell those perishing kids to shut up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫那些该死的孩子闭嘴！

Sense.DEF:
a row of
pillar s
around an open space in a building, or the open space itself
Sense.TRAN: 列柱围廊﹔廊柱园﹐列柱围廊式庭院

Sense.DEF:
a serious condition in which the inside wall of someone’s
abdomen part around and below your stomach
becomes infected and painful
a small plant with light blue or white flowers that grows close to the ground
a small sea animal that lives in a shell and can be eaten
to tell a lie after promising to tell the truth in a court of law
the crime of telling a lie after promising to tell the truth in a court of law, or a lie told in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hall was found guilty of perjury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍尔被判犯有伪证罪。

Sense.DEF: something that you get legally from your work in addition to your wages, such as goods, meals, or a car
Sense.TRAN: 〔工资以外的〕额外收入[待遇]﹐津贴
Sense.EXAMPLE: theatre tickets and other perks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏票以及其他补贴

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the perks of working at a large law firm
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大型律师事务所工作的额外待遇

Sense.EXAMPLE: I only eat here because it’s free – one of the perks of the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这里吃饭只是因为不用花钱——这份工作的额外好处之一。

Sense.DEF:
to
percolate 3
to become more cheerful, active, and interested in what is happening around you, or to make someone feel this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed kind of tired, but she perked up when Helen came over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去有点疲倦﹐不过海伦一来她便精神起来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no doubt coffee perks you up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡无疑可以使人精神振奋。

Sense.DEF: to become more active, more interesting, more attractive etc, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A little chili will perk up the sauce.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加一点辣椒﹐这酱汁就更有味了。

Sense.DEF: confident, happy, and active
Sense.TRAN: 自信而愉快的﹔活泼的﹐生气勃勃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perky salesgirl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精力充沛的女店员

Sense.DEF: a process in which you make straight hair curly by using chemicals, or hair that has been treated in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very curly perm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烫得很卷的头发

Sense.DEF: to make straight hair curly by using chemicals
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to have my hair permed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要去烫头发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her blonde permed hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她烫过的金色鬈发

Sense.DEF:
to choose and combine a number of football games from the list given in the
football pools
in order to try to win money
Sense.TRAN: 〔赌球中〕选定并组合〔球赛选项〕

Sense.DEF: a layer of soil that is always frozen in countries where it is very cold
continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放弃了固定工作﹐为的是当一名自由职业者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a permanent change in your eating habits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食习惯的永久改变
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller soon became a permanent fixture someone or something that is always there on the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: our desire for some sense of permanence
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对某种永恒感的渴望

Exponent.DEF: continuing forever, for a very long time, or for the rest of your life
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has permanent damage to her eyesight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的视力受到了永久性损伤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the search for a permanent solution to the problem
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找永久解决这一问题的办法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’ve offered her the job on a permanent basis.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们提供给她的这份工作是长期的。

Exponent.DEF: continuing for a very long time – used especially when something continues to affect someone orsomething for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The experience left a lasting impression on him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一经历给他留下了不可磨灭的印象。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Things that happen in early childhood can have a lasting effect on your life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴幼时期的经历会对人的一生造成永久的影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shelley was to have a lasting influence on him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢利会对他有深远的影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is there any hope for a lasting peace in the Middle East?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中东是否有望实现持久和平？

Exponent.DEF: continuing so long that you think it will never end – used especially when something needs a lot of effort
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指需要大费气力的事物〕永无止境的﹔没完没了的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Keeping the house clean is a never-ending battle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持屋内清洁是一场永无休止的战斗。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a never-ending task.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一项没有尽头的任务。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The search was never-ending.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜寻工作一直没有停止。

Exponent.DEF: a perpetual state or feeling seems to be there all the time – used especially about something that is very annoying, worrying, or tiring
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指令人讨厌﹑担忧或劳累的事物〕持久的,无休无止的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For many working mothers, balancing the demands of children and job is a perpetual challenge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对许多上班的母亲而言,平衡小孩和工作的需求是一项无休止的挑战。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The people live in a perpetual state of fear.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人生活在无休止的恐惧之中。

Exponent.DEF: continuing forever – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 永久的,永恒的〔尤用于以下短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Gold is the symbol of everlasting love .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 金子象征着永恒的爱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He promised them everlasting life .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他应许他们得永生。

Exponent.DEF: continuing forever – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 永久的,永恒的〔尤用于以下短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you believe in eternal life ?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是否相信永生？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the secret of eternal youth
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 永葆青春的秘诀
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has my eternal gratitude I will always be grateful to her .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远感激她。

Sense.DEF:
a
perm 1
always, or for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident left him permanently disabled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故造成他终身残疾。

Sense.DEF:
a process used to treat cloth so that it does not
wrinkle
easily, or cloth that has been treated in this way
Sense.TRAN: 耐久压烫整理﹔经耐久压烫整理的布料

Sense.DEF:
a
perm 1

a permatanned person is a white person who always has brown skin because they use
sunbed s
or products that colour their skin
Sense.TRAN: 皮肤晒成古铜色的〔指白人用太阳灯浴或其他产品使皮肤呈现古铜色效果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a permatanned chat show host
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个皮肤晒成古铜色的谈话节目主持人

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He has dyed hair and a permatan.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他染了头发﹐皮肤晒成古铜色。

Sense.DEF: material that is permeable allows water, gas etc to pass through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the permeable cell membrane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渗透性的细胞膜

Sense.DEF: if liquid, gas etc permeates something, it enters it and spreads through every part of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔液体﹑气体等〕渗透﹐渗入﹔弥漫（于）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smell of diesel oil permeated the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气里充斥着柴油的气味。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rain permeates through the ground to add to ground water levels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨水渗入地下﹐抬高了地下水水位。

Sense.DEF: if ideas, beliefs, emotions etc permeate something, they are present in every part of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Racism continues to permeate our society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们的社会里﹐种族主义依然无处不在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An emotional intensity permeates every one of O’Connor’s songs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥康纳的每一首歌都饱含着强烈的感情。

Sense.DEF: allowed by law or by the rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔法律或规定〕允许的﹐许可的﹐准许的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the maximum permissible level of radiation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 允许的最大辐射水平

Sense.DEF: when someone is officially allowed to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to get permission from your parents if you want to come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想来的话要得到你父母的同意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Council refused permission for the development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会不同意此项开发。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Permission is an uncountable noun. It is not used with ‘a’, and is not usually used with ‘the’ unless it is followed by ‘of’.
F2NBox.TRAN: permission是不可数名词,前面不加a,通常也不加the,除非后跟of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Permission was granted to televise the ceremony.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 已获许可电视 转播此次典礼 。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Interviews can be taped only with the permission of the interviewee.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有在被采访者同意后才可录下采访过程。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They did not have permission to build on the land.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们未得到在这块土地上建造房屋的许可。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tommy asked for permission to go to the bathroom.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤米询问是否能去厕所。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ask for official written permission
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company has applied for permission to drill for oil.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司已申请石油钻探许可证。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We'll need to get permission to film in the museum.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在博物馆内拍摄是要得到许可的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ask someone for permission

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Doctors need written permission from the patient before they can operate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生在动手术前要得到病人的书面许可。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: official permission to build a new building or change an existing one

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Pages should not be copied without the permission of the publisher.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经出版商同意,不得翻印书页内容。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: With your permission, I'd like to talk to your son alone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如您同意,我想和您的儿子单独谈谈。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used for thanking someone for allowing something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This photograph is reproduced by kind permission of Country Living.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张照片承蒙《乡村生活》杂志允许复制。

Sense.DEF: not strict, and allowing behaviour that many other people would disapprove of
Sense.TRAN: 〔对许多人反对的行为〕纵容的﹐放任的
Sense.EXAMPLE: parents who are too permissive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太过放任的父母
Sense.EXAMPLE: a permissive society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放纵的社会

Sense.DEF: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指根据正式决定﹑规章或法律〕允许﹐准许﹐许可
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As a punishment, she was not permitted to attend any school activities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为惩罚﹐不允许她参加学校的任何活动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dogs are not permitted inside the shop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得携犬进入店内。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bill would permit workers 12 weeks of unpaid leave for family emergencies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项法案将允许工人在家中遭遇紧急事件时享有12周的无薪假期。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Permit is a formal word, which is used especially about someone being officially allowed to do something. In everyday situations, people usually say let sb do sth or allow sb to do sth .
F2NBox.TRAN: permit是比较正式的用词,尤指某人经正式允许做某事。在日常情况下,人们一般说let sb do sth,或allow sb to do sth
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His parents won’t let him watch TV after ten o’clock.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父母不许他十点以后看电视。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The large windows permit a clear view of the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽大的窗户使得湖面风光尽收眼底。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The moon permitted me to see a little way into the distance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光让我能看到距离稍远的地方。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you after the meeting, if time permits if it finishes early enough .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果时间允许﹐会后我来见你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have a picnic at the beach, weather permitting if the weather is good enough .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气允许的话﹐我们将在沙滩上野餐。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verbs let, allow and permit in spoken and written English. 动词let﹑allow和permit在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that let is much more common in spoken English than allow and permit. Allow is more common in written English. Permit is more formal than let and allow, and is used especially when talking about rules or laws. 本图表显示,let在英语口语中的使用频率远远高于allow和permit。allow在书面英语中较常用。permit比let和allow正式,尤用于谈论法律法规。

Sense.DEF: an official written statement giving you the right to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A permit is required for fishing in the canal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在运河中钓鱼要有许可证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hikers need a camping permit for overnight stays in the park.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远足者要在公园过夜必须持野营许可证。

Sense.DEF: one of the different ways in which a number of things can be arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sandwich shop that sells every possible permutation of meat and bread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售各种肉类和面包组合的三明治店

Sense.DEF: very harmful or evil, often in a way that you do not notice easily
Sense.TRAN: 很有害的〔通常不容易察觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pernicious effects of poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫穷的危害性
Sense.EXAMPLE: the media’s pernicious influence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体的有害影响

Sense.DEF:
a severe form of
anaemia too few red blood cells in the blood
worrying too much about small and unimportant things
the last part of a speech, in which the main points are repeated
a long speech that sounds impressive but does not have much meaning
a mineral that contains various types of metals that are used in industry

a liquid chemical used to make hair light in colour or to kill
bacteria
Sense.TRAN: 过氧化氢〔用于漂染头发或杀菌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: her waist-length peroxide blonde hair hair made light yellow using peroxide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那漂染过的及腰金发

Sense.DEF: a person who has committed a particular crime – used especially by police officers
Sense.TRAN: 罪犯﹐犯罪嫌疑人〔尤为警察使用〕

Sense.DEF: not leaning to one side or the other but exactly vertical
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perpendicular line
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垂直线
Sense.EXAMPLE: a perpendicular wall of rock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直立的石壁

Sense.DEF: if one line is perpendicular to another line, they form an angle of 90 degrees
Sense.EXAMPLE: a road perpendicular to the highway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和那条公路垂直的道路

Sense.DEF: in the style of 14th- and 15th-century English churches, which are decorated with straight upright lines
Sense.TRAN: 〔14﹑15 世纪英国教堂〕垂直式装饰风格的

Sense.DEF: an exactly vertical position or line
to do something that is morally wrong or illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who could have perpetrated such a dreadful crime?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁会犯下如此可怕的罪行？

Sense.DEF: someone who does something morally wrong or illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The perpetrators were never caught.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作案者始终逍遥法外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The perpetrators of racially motivated violence must be punished.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族主义暴徒必须受到惩罚。

Sense.DEF: continuing all the time without changing or stopping
Sense.EXAMPLE: the perpetual noise of the machines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器连续不断的噪音
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little girl with a perpetual smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总是带着微笑的小女孩

Sense.DEF: repeated many times in a way that annoys you
Sense.EXAMPLE: my mother’s perpetual nagging
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲没完没了的唠叨

Sense.DEF: permanent
Sense.EXAMPLE: the perpetual snows of the mountaintops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山顶的终年积雪

Sense.DEF: the ability of a machine to always continue moving without getting energy from anywhere else, which is not considered possible
Sense.TRAN: 〔不需外加能量的〕永恒运动〔被认为不可能〕

Sense.DEF: to make a situation, attitude etc, especially a bad one, continue to exist for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 使持续﹐使长久〔尤指不好的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an education system that perpetuates the divisions in our society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使我们的社会持续分化的一种教育制度

Sense.DEF: for all future time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The land had been promised to the Indian tribes in perpetuity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片土地已经被允诺永久归印第安各部落所有。

Sense.DEF: if something perplexes you, it makes you feel confused and worried because it is difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shea’s symptoms perplexed the doctors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢伊的症状令医生们困惑。

Sense.DEF: confused and worried by something that you do not understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: The student looked at him, perplexed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个学生看着他﹐一脸的茫然。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perplexed investors tried to work out what the deal meant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者感到困惑﹐试图搞清这个协议意味着什么。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being confused or worried by something you cannot understand
something that is complicated or difficult to understand
Sense.TRAN: 复杂的事物﹔使人困惑的事物﹔令人费解的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: moral perplexities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道德难题

Sense.DEF:
a
perk 1

an alcoholic drink made from
pear s
used to say that something is being considered alone, not with other connected things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The color of the shell per se does not affect the quality of the egg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋壳本身的颜色并不影响鸡蛋的质量。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone cruelly or unfairly over a period of time, especially because of their religious or political beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因宗教或政治信仰不同〕迫害
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Puritans left England to escape being persecuted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清教徒离开了英国以躲避迫害。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately cause difficulties for someone by annoying them often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Like many celebrities, she complained of being persecuted by the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像许多名人一样﹐她也抱怨受到媒体的骚扰。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the persecution of writers who criticize the government
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对批评政府的作家的迫害

Sense.DEF: a mental illness in which someone believes that other people are trying to harm them
Sense.TRAN: 被害妄想症﹐受迫害妄想症

Sense.DEF: determination to keep trying to achieve something in spite of difficulties – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 不屈不挠﹐坚持不懈〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took perseverance to overcome his reading problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于坚持不懈﹐他才得以克服阅读障碍。

Sense.DEF: to continue trying to do something in a very determined way in spite of difficulties – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 锲而不舍﹐坚持不懈 〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can be tricky at first, but persevere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一开始会有些棘手﹐不过要坚持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He persevered with his task until he had succeeded in collecting an armful of firewood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持不懈地去完成任务﹐最后找来了一抱柴火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had persevered in her claim for compensation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坚持要求赔偿。

Sense.DEF: relating to Iran, its people, or its language, especially in the time when it was called Persia
Sense.TRAN: 波斯的﹔波斯人的﹔波斯语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Persian Empire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波斯帝国
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Persian carpet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波斯地毯

Sense.DEF: someone from Iran, especially in the time when it was called Persia
the language used in Iran
a cat with long silky hair
a soft orange-coloured fruit that grows in hot countries
to continue to do something, although this is difficult, or other people oppose it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He persisted in his refusal to admit responsibility.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持不承认负有责任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She persisted with her studies in spite of financial problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管经济拮据﹐她还是坚持学业。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t think it’s right,’ John persisted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我认为那不对。”约翰坚持说道。

Sense.DEF: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果一直痛﹐你就必须去看医生了。

Sense.DEF: determination to do something even though it is difficult or other people oppose it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her persistence paid off when she was offered the job of manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到了经理的职位﹐不懈坚持终于有了回报。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Why can’t I come?’ repeated Will with dogged persistence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我为什么不能去？”威尔不死心地又问了一遍。

Sense.DEF: when something continues to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the persistence of high unemployment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 居高不下的失业率

Sense.DEF: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable
Sense.EXAMPLE: persistent rumours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持续流传的谣言
Sense.EXAMPLE: persistent headaches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持续头疼
Sense.EXAMPLE: a persistent problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: persistent rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连绵的雨

Sense.DEF: continuing to do something, although this is difficult, or other people warn you not to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she hadn’t been so persistent she might not have gotten the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如不是如此执着﹐她可能得不到这份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: persistent efforts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不懈的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Persistent offenders people who often break the law face a prison sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 惯犯要被判入狱。

Sense.DEF: a condition in which someone’s brain is so damaged that they cannot move or talk, and their condition is unlikely to improve
worrying too much about details that are not important – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 吹毛求疵的﹐爱挑剔的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a human being, especially considered as someone with their own particular character
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a very nice person, always pleasant and friendly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很好的人﹐始终彬彬有礼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only person who really said anything helpful was Jack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一个人真正说了些有用的话﹐就是杰克。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: David was not the sort of person who found it easy to talk about his feelings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维不是那种善于谈论自己感情的人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I like her as a person , but not as a boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢她这个人﹐但作为老板我就不喜欢了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I still know quite a lot of people in the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍然认识村里的很多人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of young people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群年轻人

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who likes a particular kind of thing
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 喜欢城市生活/猫/熬夜等的人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not a morning person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是喜欢早起的人。

Sense.DEF: if you do something in person, you go somewhere and do it yourself, instead of doing something by letter, asking someone else to do it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to sign for it in person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须亲自签收。

Sense.DEF: someone who works in business, who sells things etc
someone who is not known or not named
Sense.TRAN: 〔身份不明或不说出其名的〕人﹔某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police are appealing for any person who was in the area at this time to contact them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方呼吁当时在那个地区的人和他们联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: murder by person or persons unknown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶手不明的谋杀案
Sense.EXAMPLE: All 115 persons on board were killed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机上115人全部丧生。

Sense.DEF: if you have something on or about your person, you have it in your pockets or attached to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customs officers found a gun concealed about his person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海关人员发现他身上藏着一把枪。

Sense.DEF: used before the name of someone who you have just mentioned in a more general way
Sense.TRAN: 名叫某人﹐即某人〔用于具体说明刚才提及的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was met by the police in the person of Sergeant Black.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方派人接我﹐来的是布莱克警官。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: The plural of person is usually people . person
F2NBox.TRAN: 的复数形式一般是 people
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Sixty four people (NOT不说persons) died in the fire. 64
F2NBox.EXPL: Persons is also used, but only in formal notices, documents, and situations . persons
F2NBox.TRAN: 仅用于公告﹑公文和正式场合
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All persons born in the United States are citizens of the United States.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 出生于美国的人均为美国公民。
F2NBox.EXPL: People meaning ‘more than one person’ is already plural and cannot form a plural with ‘s’ .
F2NBox.TRAN: 当people表示“多于一个人”时,已经是复数形式,不能再加 s
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: A lot of British people (NOT不说peoples) are employed by foreign firms.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多英国人为外国公司雇用。
F2NBox.EXPL: People meaning ‘race’ or ‘nation’ is countable and you can add ‘s’ to form a plural in the normal way .
F2NBox.TRAN: 当people表示“种族”或“民族”时,是可数名词,可以加s构成复数
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: African peoples

Sense.DEF: the way you behave when you are with other people or in a particular situation, which gives people a particular idea about your character
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joel has a cheerful public persona but in private he’s different.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔尔在人前显得很开朗﹐但私下里就不一样了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is personable is attractive and pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 和蔼可亲的﹔平易近人的

Sense.DEF: a person, usually someone famous or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: a royal personage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室要人

Sense.DEF: belonging or relating to one particular person, rather than to other people or to people in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到她房间时﹐她所有的私人物品都已不在了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦死后﹐他母亲接收了他的私人物品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据我的亲身经验﹐我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意成功所需要的个人素质
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car is for personal use only.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从个人角度他很同情他们﹐但是他有任务在身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: celebrities with their own personal trainer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有私人健身教练的名流

Sense.DEF: relating to the private areas of your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t answer questions about my personal life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不回答涉及我私生活的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I ask you a personal question ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以问你一个私人问题吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The records will include other personal details such as nationality, date of birth and address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记录将包含其他个人信息﹐如国籍﹑出生日期和地址等。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got a few personal problems at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前他遇到了一些个人问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The envelope was marked ‘Personal and Confidential’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信封上标着“私人密件”的字样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re not allowed to make personal phone calls at work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不可以在工作时间打私人电话。

Sense.DEF: involving rude or upsetting criticism of someone
Sense.TRAN: 人身攻击的﹐针对个人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s unprofessional to make such personal remarks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进行这种人身攻击有违职业道德。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bitter personal attack on the president
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对总统的激烈人身攻击
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to get personal !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要人身攻击！

GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone that you are not criticizing them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s nothing personal, I just have to go home now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无意冒犯﹐只是我现在必须回家了。

Sense.DEF: if you give something your personal care or attention, you deal with it yourself instead of asking someone else to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Small companies can devote more personal attention to each project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小公司可以投入更多精力自己处理每个项目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As you get promoted in a firm you lose that personal contact meeting and dealing with people yourself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在公司升了职便失去了那种和人直接打交道的机会。

Sense.DEF: someone who you know well, especially a famous or important person
Sense.TRAN: 私人朋友〔尤指名人或要人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Apparently the director is a personal friend of hers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事似乎是她的私人朋友。

Sense.DEF: relating to your body or the way you look
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grant was always fussy about his personal appearance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格兰特对自己的仪表总是过于讲究。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the importance of personal hygiene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 个人卫生的重要性

Sense.DEF: something you do to make something special, or that makes someone feel special
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s those extra personal touches that make our service better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正是那些附加的个性化特色为我们的服务锦上添花。

Sense.DEF:
the fastest time, most points etc that a
sportsman
or
sportswoman
has ever achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ran 20.51 seconds for a personal best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跑出了20.51秒的个人最好成绩。

Sense.DEF: improvements in your character and skills

a short advertisement put in a newspaper or magazine by someone who wants a friend or
lover

the amount of money that you can earn each year before you must pay
income tax
someone who works for one person and helps them do their job
someone who works as a secretary for one person
a part of a newspaper in which people can have private or personal messages printed
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸上的〕个人启事栏﹐私人广告栏

Sense.DEF:
a small computer that you can carry with you and use to send, store, and receive
fax es
,or spoken or written messages
Sense.TRAN: 个人通信器〔可随身携带﹐用于收发﹑储存传真﹑语音及文字消息的小型计算机〕

Sense.DEF:
a
pc

a
pda
Sense.TRAN: 个人数字助理﹐掌上电脑

Sense.DEF:
a
pda
Sense.TRAN: 个人数字助理﹐掌上电脑

Sense.DEF:
a piece of electronic equipment, such as a
laptop
computer or a
mobile phone
, that is small and easy to carry

the amount of money that you can earn each year before you must pay
income tax

a
pin
Sense.TRAN: 个人身份识别号码﹐私人密码

Sense.DEF: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管个性不同﹐他们还是成了最好的朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的是﹐这种病会导致性格变化。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very famous and often appears in the newspapers, on television etc, especially an entertainer or sports person
Sense.TRAN: 名人〔尤指艺人或运动员〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of the most well-liked TV personalities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最受欢迎的电视名人之一

Sense.DEF: the qualities of character that make someone in-teresting or enjoyable to be with
Sense.TRAN: 〔使某人有趣﹑招人喜爱的〕品质﹐个性
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s honest but he lacks personality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很老实﹐但是缺乏个性。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a very strong character and is very different from other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a dynamic personality in the business world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在生意场上是个充满活力的人。

Sense.DEF: the qualities which make a place or thing different and interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s partly the architecture which gives the town its personality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城镇的特色部分在于它的建筑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mercer has a strong personality and always tells you his opinion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 默瑟个性极强,总是会表达自己的观点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The architect’s forceful personality ensured that the work progressed rapidly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位建筑师的强势个性保证了工作进展迅速。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: controlling other people
friendly and kind to people
liking to talk to people
a part of your personality
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She shares many of her mother’s personality traits.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有许多个性特点和她母亲相同。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a mental illness affecting someone’s personality
when people cannot work together because they are so different

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people are encouraged to admire and praise a famous person, especially a political leader – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政治上的〕个人崇拜〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
to put your name or
initial s
on something, or to decorate it in your own way, to show that it belongs to you
Sense.TRAN: 在…上标出个人的姓名[姓名的首字母]﹔使个性化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why not do something to personalize your office?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不做点什么使你的办公室有些个性呢？

Sense.DEF: to design or change something so that it is suitable for a particular person
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕符合某人的特定需求
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the products can be personalized to the client’s exact requirements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有产品都可以根据客户的具体要求来设计。

Sense.DEF: to discuss a subject by talking about or criticizing the people who are involved in it, rather than talking about it in a more general way
Sense.TRAN: 〔讨论某问题时〕使针对个人﹐使个人化
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mass media’s tendency to personalize politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大众传媒使政治个人化的倾向

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are only giving your own opinion about something
Sense.TRAN: 就个人而言﹔就自己的看法而言
Sense.EXAMPLE: Personally, I don’t think much of the idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就个人而言﹐我认为这个主意不怎么样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I personally think it’s too cold to go out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我个人认为太冷了不能出去。

Sense.DEF: if you do something personally, you do it yourself rather than getting someone else to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The managing director wrote personally to thank me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总经理亲自写信向我表示感谢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All important work is personally approved by him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有重要的工作都由他亲自批准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see to it personally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事我要亲自处理。

Sense.DEF: used to show that one particular person is involved, rather than a group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m holding you personally responsible for this mess!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出了这样的乱子﹐都是你的责任！
Sense.EXAMPLE: She clearly blamed me personally for the difficulties she’d been having.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于她遇到的困难﹐她显然只责怪我一个人。

Sense.DEF: to get upset by the things other people say or do, because you think that their remarks or behaviour are directed at you in particular
Sense.TRAN: 因认为某人的言行针对自己而不快
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t take it personally; she’s rude to everyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要生气﹐这不是针对你﹐她对谁都很无礼。

Sense.DEF: as a friend, or as someone you have met
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know her personally , but I like her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不认识她本人﹐但我喜欢她的作品。

Sense.DEF: in a way that criticizes someone’s character or appearance
Sense.TRAN: 人身攻击地﹐针对个人地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Members of the Senate rarely attack each other personally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员彼此间很少进行人身攻击。

Sense.DEF: in relation to someone’s private life, rather than to their work, business, or official duties
Sense.TRAN: 私人地〔与工作﹑公务等相对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a lasting impact on his life both personally and professionally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论是对他的私人生活还是职业生涯﹐她都有持久的影响力。

Sense.DEF: a small book with loose sheets of paper, or a very small computer, for recording information, addresses, meetings etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔记录资料﹑地址﹑会议内容等的〕活页记事本﹔〔记事用的〕掌上电脑

Sense.DEF:
a
pronoun
such as ‘I’, ‘you’, or ‘they’
the part of a newspaper in which people can have private or personal messages printed
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸上的〕个人启事栏﹐私人广告栏

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to help people decide what to buy, or to go shopping for them
the distance that you like to keep between you and other people in order to feel comfortable, for example when you are talking to someone or travelling on a bus or train
Sense.TRAN: 个人空间〔谈话﹑乘公共汽车等时希望与人保持的距离〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She objected to this invasion of her personal space .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她反对这种侵犯她个人空间的行为。

Sense.DEF:
a small
cassette player
,
cd player
, or radio which you carry around with you and listen to through small
headphones
Sense.TRAN: 〔可随身携带并使用耳机的〕个人音响﹐随身听

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to help people decide what type of exercise is best for them and show them how to do it
to be not welcome in a particular place because of something that you have done – used especially when a foreign government orders you to go home
Sense.TRAN: 是/成为/被宣布为不受欢迎的人〔尤用在一国政府命令某人返回自己国家时〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is a perfect example of a quality because they have a lot of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became the personification of the financial excess of the 1980s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他成了20世纪80年代金融过热时期的一个典型。

Sense.DEF: the representation of a thing or a quality as a person, in literature or art
Sense.TRAN: 〔文学或艺术中的〕拟人化﹐人格化

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the personification of rivers in fifth-century art
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五世纪艺术中对河流的拟人化

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of a particular quality or be a typical example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carter personifies the values of self-reliance and hard work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特身上体现了自立和勤劳的价值。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bertha was kindness personified.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯莎是仁慈的化身。

Sense.DEF: to think of or represent a quality or thing as a person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Time is often personified as an old man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间经常被比拟为一位老人。

Sense.DEF: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑组织或军队中的〕人员﹔员工﹐职员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: senior military personnel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级军事人员
GramExa.EXAMPLE: doctors and other medical personnel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生和其他医务人员

Sense.EXAMPLE: All personnel are to receive security badges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

Sense.DEF: the department in a company that chooses people for jobs and deals with their complaints, problems etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: A copy should then be sent to Personnel for our files.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后必须送一份到人事部供我们存档。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the personnel department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人事部

Sense.DEF: a vehicle for carrying soldiers
involving communication between people
Sense.EXAMPLE: E-mail provides a way of sending person-to-person messages almost instantaneously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子邮件提供了几乎是即时的人际信息传递方式。

Sense.DEF: a way of thinking about something, especially one which is influenced by the type of person you are or by your experiences

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His father’s death gave him a whole new perspective on life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲的死使他对生活有了全新的看法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The novel is written from a child’s perspective.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部小说是以一个孩子的视角写的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have to look at everything from an international perspective.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须以国际视角来看待一切问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a much-needed historical perspective
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常必要的历史角度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our work in Uganda and Romania adds a wider perspective.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在乌干达和罗马尼亚的工作经历更加开阔了我们的视角。

Sense.DEF: a sensible way of judging and comparing situations so that you do not imagine that something is more serious than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 〔对事物的〕合理判断﹐正确认识
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think Viv’s lost all sense of perspective .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为维夫已不能明察事理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The figures have to be put into perspective .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须正确认识这些数字。

GramExa.GLOSS: judge the importance of something correctly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 正确判断某事物的重要性

Sense.DEF: a method of drawing a picture that makes objects look solid and shows distance and depth, or the effect this method produces in a picture
Sense.TRAN: 透视（画）法﹔透视效果﹐透视感
Sense.EXAMPLE: the artist’s use of perspective
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位画家对透视法的运用

Sense.DEF: a view, especially one in which you can see a long way into the distance
a strong type of plastic that can be used instead of glass
good at judging and understanding people and situations
Sense.TRAN: 判断力强的﹐敏锐的﹐有洞察力的

Sense.DEF: liquid that appears on your skin when you are hot or nervous
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wiped the beads of perspiration drops from his brow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他擦去了额头的汗珠。

Sense.DEF: if you perspire, parts of your body become wet, especially because you are hot or have been doing hard work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Willie was perspiring heavily .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威利大汗淋漓。

Sense.DEF: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I finally managed to persuade her to go out for a drink with me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于说服她跟我出去喝一杯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let yourself be persuaded into buying things you don’t want.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别禁不住别人的劝说﹐买些不想要的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to persuade your dad to buy some shares.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在尽力说服你爸爸买些股票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leo wouldn’t agree, despite our efforts to persuade him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我们努力想说服利奥﹐但他还是不同意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took a lot of persuading to come out of retirement it was hard to persuade him .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好说歹说才劝得他同意复出。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fairly easily persuaded .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很轻易就被说服了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone believe something or feel sure about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am not persuaded by these arguments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不相信这些论点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’ll only take me back if I can persuade her that I’ve changed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有让她相信我已经改变﹐她才会跟我重归于好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: McFadden must persuade the jury of her innocence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克法登必须让陪审团相信她是无辜的。

Exponent.DEF: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I persuaded her to change her mind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说服她改变了主意。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you think you can persuade him to lend us the money?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得你能够说服他把钱借给我们吗？

Exponent.DEF: to persuade someone to do something, especially something they do not really want to do
Exponent.TRAN: 说服某人做某事〔尤指不愿意做的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why did I let you talk me into this?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为什么会被你说动了做这件事？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He finally talked her into going on a date with him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最终说服了她和他约会。

Exponent.DEF: to make someone do something by persuading or asking them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If we can’t get a taxi I’ll get Joe to pick us up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们拦不到出租车,我就让乔来接我们。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I know how to get you to kiss me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道怎样让你吻我。

Exponent.DEF: to persuade someone that they should do something, because it is the best or the right thing to do. Some British speakers think this use is incorrect, and prefer to use persuade .
Exponent.TRAN: 说服,劝说〔部分英国人认为这种用法不正确,他们倾向于用persuade〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It would be difficult to convince him to move.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 劝他搬家很难。

Exponent.DEF: to try to persuade someone to do something, especially because you think it will be good for them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Children should be encouraged to read all kinds of books.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 应鼓励儿童阅读各种各样的书籍。

Exponent.DEF: to have an effect on what someone decides to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What influences you to buy clothes?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会受什么影响去买衣服？

Exponent.DEF: to persuade someone to do something by talking gently and kindly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tried to coax him to eat a little.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试着哄他吃一点东西。

Exponent.DEF: to persuade someone to do something by praising them or making promises to them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He hoped to cajole her into selling her house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望能哄得她把房子卖了。

Exponent.DEF: to persuade or encourage someone to do something wrong or stupid
Exponent.TRAN: 鼓动某人做某事〔指错事或傻事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Who put you up to this?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 是谁怂恿你这么做的？

Exponent.DEF: to persuade someone not to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How do you dissuade young people from experimenting with drugs?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用什么办法劝阻年轻人不要尝试吸毒？

Sense.DEF: the act of persuading someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a little gentle persuasion , Debbie agreed to let us in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好言劝说了几句后﹐黛比就同意让我们进去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It had taken a great deal of persuasion to get him to accept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费尽了口舌才让他接受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She used all her powers of persuasion skill at persuading people to convince Tilly that it was the right thing to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她使尽浑身解数﹐才劝服蒂莉应该那么做。

Sense.DEF: a particular type of belief, especially a political or religious one
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政治或宗教的〕信仰﹐信念

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need people with talent, whatever their political persuasions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要有才华的人﹐无论他们的政治信仰如何。

Sense.EXAMPLE: politicians of all persuasions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信仰各异的政治家

Sense.DEF: of a particular type – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: …种类的﹐…派别的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ancient bed of the iron persuasion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古旧的铁床

Sense.DEF: able to make other people believe something or do what you ask
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trevor can be very persuasive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特雷弗有时很会说服人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a persuasive argument against capital punishment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对死刑的有力论据

Sense.DEF: a girl or woman who is pert is amusing, but slightly disrespectful
Sense.TRAN: 〔女性〕俏皮的﹐有点无礼但有趣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angie gave him one of her pert little glances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安吉俏皮地瞥了他一眼。

Sense.DEF: a pert part of the body is small, firm, and attractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体部位〕小巧结实而诱人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pert bottom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小巧性感的臀部

Sense.DEF: to relate directly to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: legislation pertaining to employment rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与就业权利有关的立法

Sense.DEF: continuing to believe something or to do something in a very determined way
directly relating to something that is being considered
Sense.EXAMPLE: He asked me a lot of very pertinent questions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他问了我许多直接相关的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The last point is particularly pertinent to today’s discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一点和今天的讨论关系尤为密切。

Sense.DEF: a small change in the movement, quality, or behaviour of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: climatic perturbations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候的些微变化

Sense.DEF: worry about something that has happened or will happen
worried about something that has happened or will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: William looked a little perturbed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉看上去有些不安。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t seem perturbed by the noises outside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看上去他并未受到外面吵闹声的干扰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was perturbed that she didn’t look happy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去不高兴﹐他很担心。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: My unexpected arrival didn’t perturb him in the least.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的意外到来一点都没令他感到不安。

Sense.DEF: to read something, especially in a careful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She leant forward to peruse the document more closely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她俯身向前﹐更仔细地读那份文件。

Sense.DEF:
a
pervert
Sense.TRAN: 性行为反常者﹐性变态者

Sense.DEF: if a feeling, idea, or smell pervades a place, it is present in every part of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔感觉﹑想法或气味〕弥漫于﹐遍及﹐充满
Sense.EXAMPLE: A spirit of hopelessness pervaded the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种无望的情绪笼罩着该国。

Sense.DEF: existing everywhere
Sense.TRAN: 到处存在的﹐到处弥漫着的﹐遍布的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pervasive influence of television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视无所不在的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: the all-pervasive mood of apathy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到处弥漫的冷漠情绪

Sense.DEF: behaving in an unreasonable way, especially by deliberately doing the opposite of what people want you to do
Sense.TRAN: 任性的﹐一意孤行的﹐不合情理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gets perverse satisfaction from embarrassing people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他通过使人难堪获得变态的满足感。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Perversely, she was irritated by his kindness.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的好意反倒激怒了她。

Sense.DEF: a type of sexual behaviour that is considered unnatural and unacceptable
the process of changing something that is natural and good into something that is unnatural and wrong, or the result of such a change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a perversion of the true meaning of democracy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对民主真正含义的歪曲

Sense.DEF: the quality of being perverse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Max refused the money out of sheer perversity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯拒收那些钱纯粹是出于任性。

Sense.DEF: to change something in an unnatural and often harmful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Genetic scientists are often accused of perverting nature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗传学家经常被指责违背了自然。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone so that they begin to think or behave in an immoral way
Sense.TRAN: 使走上邪路﹐使堕落﹐使变坏﹐腐蚀
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV violence perverts the minds of young children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视暴力腐蚀了孩子们的心灵。

Sense.DEF: law to deliberately prevent a fair examination of the facts about a crime
someone whose sexual behaviour is considered unnatural and unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 性行为反常者﹐性变态者

Sense.DEF: morally wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: He derives a perverted pleasure from hurting other people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从伤害别人中获得一种病态的快感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the perverted logic of terrorism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖主义的反常逻辑

Sense.DEF: sexually unacceptable or unnatural

the standard unit of money used in Spain before the
euro
Sense.TRAN: 比塞塔〔西班牙使用欧元前的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those pesky kids!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些讨厌的孩子！

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in the Philippines and in various Latin American countries including Mexico, Cuba, and Colombia
Sense.TRAN: 比索〔菲律宾及墨西哥﹑古巴和哥伦比亚等拉美国家的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF:
a small block of medicine which a woman puts into her
vagina
in order to cure an infection or to stop herself becoming
pregnant
Sense.TRAN: 〔治疗感染或避孕的〕阴道栓（剂）

Sense.DEF:
an instrument put into a woman’s
vagina
to support her
womb
a tendency to believe that bad things will happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is deep pessimism about the future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对未来存在着极度悲观的情绪。

Sense.DEF: someone who always expects that bad things will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a pessimist!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么悲观！

Sense.DEF: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pessimistic view of life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对人生的悲观看法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He remains deeply pessimistic about the peace process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对和平进程仍然十分悲观。

Sense.DEF: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies
Sense.TRAN: 〔毁坏庄稼或食物的〕有害小动物﹔害虫
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chemical used in pest control
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于防治虫害的一种化学品

Sense.DEF: an annoying person, especially a child
Sense.TRAN: 令人讨厌的人〔尤指孩子〕

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone, especially by asking them many times to do something
Sense.TRAN: 不断烦扰﹐纠缠〔尤指不断要求某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d been pestered by reporters for days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几天来她一直受到记者们的纠缠。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t even walk down the street without being continually pestered for money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要我上街﹐就有人不断地缠着我要钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids have been pestering me to buy them new trainers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们一直缠着我﹐要我给他们买新运动鞋。

Sense.DEF: the ability that children have to make their parents buy things or do things for them by asking them again and again
a chemical substance used to kill insects and small animals that destroy crops
a disease that spreads quickly and kills a lot of people
extremely unpleasant and annoying
Sense.TRAN: 令人非常讨厌的﹐令人极其不快的

Sense.DEF: causing disease

a short stick with a heavy round end, used for crushing things in a
mortar a special bowl

a sauce made from
basil
,
garlic
,
pine nut s
,
olive oil
, and cheese
Sense.TRAN: 罗勒香蒜酱〔把罗勒﹑大蒜﹑松子﹑橄榄油﹑干酪等研磨搅拌而成〕

Sense.DEF: an animal such as a cat or a dog which you keep and care for at home
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have two pets – a cat and a dog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有两只宠物﹐一只猫和一只狗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We weren’t allowed to keep pets at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校里不许我们养宠物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rabbits make good pets .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兔子是很好的宠物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got bitten by his pet rabbit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被自己的宠物兔咬了。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宠物粮食
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pet shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宠物商店

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to someone you like or love
Sense.TRAN: 宝贝儿〔用于称呼喜欢或所爱的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t cry, pet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别哭﹐宝贝儿。

Sense.DEF: to touch and move your hand gently over someone, especially an animal or a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our cat loves being petted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的猫喜欢被人抚摸。

Sense.DEF: a plan, idea, or subject that you particularly like or are interested in
Sense.TRAN: 特别喜爱[感兴趣]的计划/理论/话题

Sense.DEF: something that you strongly dislike because it always annoys you
Sense.TRAN: 特别讨厌的事物﹔极可恶的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV game shows are one of my pet hates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视游戏节目是我最讨厌的节目之一。

Sense.DEF:
a unit that measures how fast a computer works. One petaflop is one million
billion
operations every second.
Sense.TRAN: 每秒千万亿次浮点运算〔衡量计算机处理速度的单位〕

Sense.DEF: one of the coloured parts of a flower that are shaped like leaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: rose petals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玫瑰花瓣
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flower has seven petals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种花有七片花瓣。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be hoist with/by your own petard

Sense.DEF:
a
catflap
to gradually become smaller, less, weaker etc and then come to an end
Sense.TRAN: 逐渐变小﹔逐渐减少﹔逐渐消失
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road became narrower and eventually petered out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条路越来越窄﹐最后消失了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Public interest in the environment is in danger of petering out.

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望埃米别再打电话了。

Sense.DEF: the part of a telephone into which you speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put the phone down on me ended the call before I had finished speaking .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没说完他就挂了电话。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you mind if I use your phone?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用一下你的电话可以吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Around three o’clock, the phone rang.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约三点钟时电话铃响了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My dad answered the phone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸接的电话。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I only remembered his name after I had put the phone down.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挂上电话后只记得他的名字。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We talk on the phone every day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每天都通电话。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, she can’t come to the phone right now.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉,她现在不能来听电话。

Collocate.COLLOC: be on the phone to sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be talking to someone on the phone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was on the phone to my mother all morning.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个上午我都在和妈妈通电话。

Collocate.COLLOC: get on the phone to sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: call them

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can I have your phone number?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 能把你的电话号码给我吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a telephone wire or connection
a bill for phone calls
one that provides a telephone service
the person you are calling is already speaking to someone else
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I tried you earlier, but your phone was engaged.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我早些时候打过你的电话,但是占线。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the phone line stops working or is not working
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 电话断线了,电话打不通

Collocate.COLLOC: the phone is off the hook
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it cannot be used because it is not connected or is already being used
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 电话无法接通﹐电话占线

Sense.DEF: to speak to someone by telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll phone you this evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我会给你打电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why didn’t they phone the police?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为什么没给警察打电话？
