Sense.EXAMPLE: For information phone 8279-3772.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲知详情请拨打8279-3772。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stevie phoned to say that he was going to be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂维打来电话说他要迟到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept phoning her up, asking to meet her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不断给她打电话﹐要求见她一面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell him to phone back telephone again at a later time tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫他明天再打电话来。
Sense.HINTTRAN: You do not ‘phone to’ someone or ‘phone to’ a number. Phone is followed immediately by a noun.phone后面不要用 to 接某人或某号码﹐而是直接跟名词: She phoned her friend Judy. 她给朋友朱迪打了电话。 | Phone 01279-623772 and ask to speak to Elaine. 拨打01279-623772﹐找伊莱恩。

Exponent.DEF: to speak to someone by telephone. Phone is more common in British English than American English.
Exponent.TRAN: 打电话〔英国英语比美国英语更常用此词〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll phone you tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天给你打电话。

Exponent.DEF: to phone someone. Call is used in both British and American English.
Exponent.TRAN: 打电话〔英国英语和美国英语中都用此词〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of the neighbors called the police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个邻居打电话报了警。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Call me later.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍后打给我。

Exponent.DEF: to phone someone. Ring is more informal than phone or call .
Exponent.TRAN: 打电话〔与phone或 call相比较不正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can ring her at the office tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天可以从办公室给她打电话。

Exponent.DEF: to phone someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you ever come to Seattle, give me a call.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你来西雅图,就给我打个电话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll give the hospital a ring and see how he is.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要给医院打个电话,问问他情况如何。

Exponent.DEF: to phone someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Angry listeners telephoned the BBC to complain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 气愤的听众给英国广播公司打电话投诉。

Exponent.DEF: to make a telephone call using special software that allows you to make calls over the Internet
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I Skyped her last night and we spoke for hours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我和她打了Skype网络电话,聊了好几个小时。

Sense.DEF: to telephone the place where you work, especially in order to report something
Sense.TRAN: 打电话到自己的工作处〔尤指为报告某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll phone in and let them know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会打电话给单位﹐让他们了解情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll phone the report in tomorrow morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天早晨我会打电话到公司汇报情况。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She phoned in sick telephoned to say that she was ill and could not come to work .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打了电话请病假。

Sense.DEF: to telephone a radio or television show to give your opinion or ask a question
Sense.TRAN: 〔给电台或电视节目〕打进电话〔发表意见或提问〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s still time to phone in before the end of the programme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节目结束前还有时间可以打进电话。

Sense.DEF: an instrument or machine relating to sound or hearing, especially a musical instrument
Sense.TRAN: 与声音[听力]有关的装置[机器] 尤指〕乐器
Sense.EXAMPLE: earphones for listening to a radio etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耳机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a saxophone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨克斯管

Sense.DEF: someone who speaks a particular language
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Francophone someone who speaks French
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲法语的人

Sense.DEF: speaking a particular language
Sense.EXAMPLE: Francophone nations nations where French is spoken
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法语国家

Sense.DEF: a book that contains an alphabetical list of the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of all the people who have a telephone in a particular area
a small structure that is partly or completely enclosed, containing a public telephone
a small structure that is partly or completely enclosed, containing a public telephone
when you speak to someone on the telephone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to make a quick phone call .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要迅速通个电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a phone call from someone called Mike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我接到一个叫迈克的人打来的电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: obscene phone calls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色情骚扰电话

Sense.DEF: a plastic card that can be used in some public telephones instead of money
Sense.TRAN: 〔在公用电话上使用的〕电话卡

Sense.DEF: a radio or television programme in which you hear ordinary people expressing opinions or asking questions over the telephone
Sense.TRAN: 〔电台或电视的〕电话热线节目

Sense.DEF: the smallest unit of speech that can be used to make one word different from another word, such as the ‘b’ and the ‘p’ in ‘big’ and ‘pig’
the study and description of the phonemes of languages
the activity of talking with someone on the telephone about sex in order to become sexually excited
the activity of listening secretly to other people’s telephone conversations using special electronic equipment
relating to the sounds of human speech
using special signs, often different from ordinary letters, to represent the sounds of speech
Sense.EXAMPLE: a phonetic alphabet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音标
Sense.EXAMPLE: phonetic symbols
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音标符号

Sense.DEF: the science and study of speech sounds
a list of all the telephone numbers of the people in an organization, showing who should call who if there is important information that everyone should know
Sense.TRAN: 电话树﹐通讯录〔表明机构内通知重要信息顺序的电话号码清单〕

Sense.DEF: false or not real, and intended to deceive someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a phoney American accent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装出来的美国口音

Sense.DEF: someone who is phoney is insincere and pretends to be something they are not
a period during which a state of war officially exists but there is no actual fighting
Sense.TRAN: 假战争〔处于战争状态但并未实际交战的时期〕

Sense.DEF: relating to sound
relating to speech sounds
a method of teaching people to read in which they are taught to recognize the sounds that letters represent
Sense.TRAN: 语音教学法﹐自然拼读法

Sense.DEF: relating to the voice or speech
Sense.EXAMPLE: phonetics the science of speech sounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语音学

Sense.DEF: relating to sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: a phonoreceptor a hearing organ
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感声器

Sense.DEF:
a
record player
the study of the system of speech sounds in a language, or the system of sounds itself

the usual American spelling of
phoney
used to express strong disbelief or disappointment
Sense.TRAN: 呸﹐啐〔用于表示强烈的怀疑或失望〕

Sense.DEF: a poisonous gas used in war and in industry
Sense.TRAN: 光气〔一种有毒气体﹐用于战争或工业〕

Sense.DEF:
one of the various forms of a
salt
of
phosphorus
, often used in industry
a substance containing a phosphate used for making plants grow better
a slight steady light that can only be noticed in the dark
shining slightly in the dark but producing little or no heat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strange phosphorescent light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇异的磷光

Sense.DEF: a poisonous yellowish chemical substance that starts to burn when it is in the air, and shines in the dark. It is a chemical element: symbol P
Sense.TRAN: 磷〔一种化学元素﹐符号为P〕

Sense.DEF: a photograph

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll send Mom a photo of Sammy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要寄一张萨米的照片给妈妈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you take a photo of me and Rachel?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能给我和雷切尔拍张照吗？

Sense.DEF: relating to light
Sense.EXAMPLE: photosensitive paper paper that changes when light touches it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感光纸

Sense.DEF: relating to photography
Sense.EXAMPLE: photojournalism the use of photographs in reporting news
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影新闻（工作）

Sense.DEF: a small structure in which you can sit to have photographs taken by a machine
an occasion during which a professional photographer takes pictures of a famous person or group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔名人等与摄影师约定的〕拍照时间

Sense.DEF: a machine that makes photographic copies of documents
a photographic copy, especially of something printed, written, or drawn
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent him the original document, not a photocopy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我寄给他的是原件﹐不是复印件。

Sense.DEF: to make a photographic copy of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave the papers with me and I’ll get them photocopied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把文件留给我﹐我来复印。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Could you do some photocopying for me tomorrow?
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天你能给我复印一些东西吗？

Sense.DEF: using an electrical current that is controlled by light
an electronic instrument that changes light into electricity

an electronic instrument that uses light to start an electrical effect, often used in
burglar alarm s
Sense.TRAN: 光电感应器〔把光信号转换成电信号﹐常用于防盗警报器〕

Sense.DEF: the end of a race in which the leading runners finish so close together that a photograph of it has to be examined to decide which is the winner
Sense.TRAN: 摄影定胜负〔参赛者到达终点时非常接近﹐需借助照片确定胜负〕

Sense.DEF: a way of making a picture of a face using photographs of parts of different faces, used to help the police catch a criminal
Sense.TRAN: 【商标﹐英】照片拼像（法）〔由多张照片拼成人脸图像﹐用于帮助警方捉拿罪犯〕

Sense.DEF: always looking attractive in photographs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen is very photogenic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦非常上镜。

Sense.DEF: a picture obtained by using a camera and film that is sensitive to light
Sense.EXAMPLE: a colour photograph
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩色照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: a black and white photograph
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑白照片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish I had a photograph of Thomas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望自己有一张托马斯的照片。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took a photograph of the hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拍了一张那家酒店的照片。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim was looking through an old photograph album book in which you put photographs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆在翻看一本旧相册。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you see Leo’s photograph a photograph of Leo in the newspaper?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到报纸上利奥的照片了吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say photo or picture rather than photo graph .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说photo或picture,而不说photograph
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This is my dad in this photo .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张照片里这是我爸爸。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Who took the picture ?

Sense.DEF: to take a photograph of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate agreed to let me photograph her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特同意让我为她拍照。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood by the tree to be photographed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在树旁准备让人拍照。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say take a photo or take a picture of someone or something rather than photograph someone or something .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说take a photo或take a picture of someone or something,而不说photograph someone or something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She agreed to let me take her photo .
He stood there waiting to have his picture taken .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在那里等着别人给他拍照。

Sense.DEF: to look attractive in photographs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Celia does not photograph well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西莉亚不上相。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes photographs, especially as a professional or as an artist
Sense.TRAN: 摄影者〔尤指专业摄影师或艺术家〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fashion photographer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时装摄影师

Sense.DEF: relating to photographs, using photographs, or used in producing photographs
Sense.EXAMPLE: photographic film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影胶片
Sense.EXAMPLE: photographic equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影器材
Sense.EXAMPLE: The software allows you to scan photographic images on your personal computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个软件让你可以在个人电脑上浏览拍摄的图像。

Sense.DEF: if you have a photographic memory, you can remember exactly every detail of something you have seen
the art, profession, or method of producing photographs or the scenes in films
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did fashion photography for ‘Vogue’ magazine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为《时尚》杂志拍过时装照片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the National Museum of Photography
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家摄影博物馆

Sense.DEF: the job or activity of reporting news stories in newspapers and magazines using mainly photographs instead of words
Sense.TRAN: 图片新闻报道﹐摄影新闻（工作）

Sense.DEF:
a unit of
energy
that carries light and has
zero mass
a chance for someone such as a politician to be photographed for a newspaper in a way that will make them look good
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治家等为宣传而〕接受媒体拍照的机会

Sense.DEF: reacting to light, for example by changing colour or producing an electrical current
Sense.EXAMPLE: photosensitive paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感光纸

Sense.DEF: to make something photosensitive
an occasion during which a professional photographer takes pictures of a fashion model or an actor for advertisements
Sense.TRAN: 〔职业摄影师为时装模特或演员拍广告的〕拍摄时间

Sense.DEF: a photographic copy of a document, or a type of machine used for making one
Sense.TRAN: 直接影印件﹔福图斯泰直接影印机

Sense.DEF:
the production by a green plant of special substances like sugar that it uses as food, caused by the action of sunlight on
chlorophyll the green substance in leaves

a
solar panel
consisting of or relating to a phrase or phrases

a group of words that is used like a verb and consists of a verb with an adverb or
preposition
after it, for example ‘set off’ or ‘look after’. In this dictionary, phrasal verbs are marked ‘phr v’.
Sense.TRAN: 短语动词〔在本词典中以phr v表示〕

Sense.DEF: a group of words that have a particular meaning when used together, or which someone uses on a particular occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who first used the phrase ‘survival of the fittest’?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “适者生存”这一说法最早是谁说的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shakespeare’s plays are full of well-known phrases .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚的戏剧中写满了众所周知的名言警句。

Sense.DEF:
a group of words without a
finite
verb, especially when they are used to form part of a sentence, such as ‘walking along the road’ and ‘a bar of soap’
a short group of musical notes that is part of a longer piece

Exponent.DEF: a group of words that have a particular meaning when used together, or which someone uses on a particular occasion
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What was the phrase he used to describe her?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是用哪个短语形容她的？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve never heard of the phrase before.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未听说过这个习语。

Exponent.DEF: a fixed phrase which is used in a language and has a particular meaning
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a colloquial expression an informal expression used in everyday spoken language
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 俗语,口语用语
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The old-fashioned expression ‘in the family way’ means pregnant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧习语 in the family way 意为“怀孕了”。

Exponent.DEF: a group of words that has a special meaning which you cannot guess from the meanings of each separate word
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Under the weather’ is an idiom which means ‘ill’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: under the weather是习语,意思是“病了”。

Exponent.DEF: a phrase that is boring and no longer original because people use it a lot
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The phrase ‘at the end of the day’ has become a real cliché.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 短语 at the end of the day 已经完全用滥了。

Exponent.DEF: a well-known phrase that gives advice about life
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you know the saying ‘A problem shared is a problem halved’?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道“问题两人担,困难减一半”这句格言吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is an old Chinese proverb which states ‘A journey of a thousand miles starts with a single step’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国有句老话﹕“千里之行,始于足下。”

Exponent.DEF: a short phrase that is easy to remember, especially one that is used in advertising
Exponent.EXAMPLE: advertising slogans
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告语
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Protesters were shouting anti-government slogans.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者高呼反政府口号。

Exponent.DEF: a phrase that expresses a person’s or organization’s beliefs and aims
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school motto was ‘Truth and Honour’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校的校训是“真理与荣誉”。

Sense.DEF: to express something in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某种方式〕表达﹐〔以某种措辞〕表述
Sense.EXAMPLE: Polly tried to think how to phrase the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波莉在思索这个问题怎么提。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I phrased that badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我表述得不好。

Sense.DEF: to perform music in order to produce the full effect of separate musical phrases
Sense.TRAN: 〔演奏﹑歌唱时〕分句﹐划分乐句〔以充分表现每一乐句的效果〕

Sense.DEF: a book that explains phrases of a foreign language, for people to use when they travel to other countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔供游客到国外旅行时用的〕（外语）常用语手册

Sense.DEF: the way that words and phrases are chosen and used in a particular language or subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种语言或学科的〕用词﹔措辞

Sense.DEF: the way that something is said
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t remember her exact phrasing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不记得她原话是怎么说的了。

Sense.DEF: a way of playing music, reading poetry etc that separates the notes, words, or lines into phrases
Sense.TRAN: 〔演奏音乐时的〕乐句划分﹔〔朗诵诗歌时的〕分句法

Sense.DEF: the study of the shape of people’s heads as a way of finding out what their characters and abilities are, which was popular in the 19th century
Sense.TRAN: 颅相学〔通过研究头颅形状来判断一个人的性格和能力﹐流行于19世纪〕

Sense.DEF: if a machine goes phut, it stops working completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The microwave’s gone phut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微波炉坏了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you think someone is sexually attractive
Sense.TRAN: 哇〔用于觉得别人很性感时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phwoar! Look at her!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哇﹐看看她！

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
filo
one of the large groups into which scientists divide plants, animals, and languages
Sense.TRAN: 〔动植物分类的〕门﹔〔语言的〕语群

Sense.DEF:
another form of
physio-
related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in constant physical pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直感到身上疼痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青年人的身心需求
Sense.EXAMPLE: people with severe physical disabilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体重度残疾的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对健身着了迷。

Sense.DEF: a physical relationship involves sex rather than just friendship
Sense.EXAMPLE: My attraction to him was totally physical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他的迷恋只是肉体上的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their physical relationship had never been very good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的性关系始终都不是那么和谐。

Sense.DEF: someone who is physical likes touching people a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕喜欢触摸人的﹐喜欢动手动脚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a very physical person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总爱动手动脚的。

Sense.DEF: involving touching someone in a rough or violent way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Football can be a very physical game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球有时候是一项很粗野的运动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was a bit worried that the argument might become physical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点担心争论可能变成肢体冲突。

Sense.DEF: relating to real objects that you can touch, see, or feel
Sense.EXAMPLE: the physical world around us
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们周遭的物质世界
Sense.EXAMPLE: the physical environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客观环境
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were kept in appalling physical conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被关押的环境极其恶劣。

Sense.DEF: relating to or following natural laws
Sense.TRAN: 自然的﹔按照自然规律的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a physical explanation for this phenomenon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这一现象合乎自然规律的解释

Sense.DEF:
a physical science is an area of scientific study that is related to
physics
Sense.EXAMPLE: physical chemistry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物理化学

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育运动的物理学特征

Sense.DEF: a thorough examination of someone’s body by a doctor, in order to discover whether they are healthy or have any illnesses or medical problems
sport and physical exercise that are taught as a school subject
the study of the Earth’s surface and of its rivers, mountains etc
in relation to your body rather than your mind or emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is young and physically fit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她年轻而且身体健康。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you find him physically attractive?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得他长得帅吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt physically sick at the thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到那个我就觉得身体不舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: children who have been physically abused
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体受到虐待的儿童

Sense.DEF: possible or not possible according to the laws of nature
Sense.TRAN: 〔根据自然法则〕可能的/不可能的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be physically impossible to carry everything at once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根本不可能一次把所有东西都带上。

Sense.DEF: someone who is physically challenged has a problem with their body that makes it difficult for them to do things that other people can do easily

the sciences, for example
chemistry
and
physics
, that are concerned with studying things that are not living
Sense.TRAN: 物理科学〔化学﹑物理等非生命科学〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to give physical therapy
a treatment that uses special exercises, rubbing, heat etc to treat medical conditions and problems with muscles
a doctor

a scientist who has special knowledge and training in
physics
the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

a
physiotherapist
relating to nature and living things
Sense.EXAMPLE: physiology study of how the body works
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生理学

Sense.DEF: physical
Sense.EXAMPLE: physiotherapy treatment using exercises etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物理治疗法

Sense.DEF: the general appearance of a person’s face
the science that studies the way in which the bodies of living things work
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book on biochemistry and physiology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本关于生物化学和生理学的书

Sense.DEF: the way the body of a person or an animal works
Sense.EXAMPLE: the physiology of the brain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑部的生理机能

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to give physiotherapy
a treatment that uses special exercises, rubbing, heat etc to treat medical conditions and problems with muscles
the size and appearance of someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t have the physique to be a dancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有当舞蹈演员的体形。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had good health and a strong physique.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体健康﹐体格健壮。

Sense.DEF: a number that is represented by the Greek letter (π) and is equal to the distance around a circle, divided by its width
played or sung very quietly
someone who plays the piano

PIC.HEADING: PIANOS 钢琴
PIC.PICCONTENT: strings 琴弦；keys 琴键；piano stool 琴凳；pedals 踏板；grand piano 三角钢琴；upright piano 立式钢琴

Sense.DEF:
a large musical instrument that has a long row of black and white
key s
. You play the piano by sitting in front of it and pressing the keys.
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jean accompanied her on the piano .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼为她钢琴伴奏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wonderful piano player
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出色的钢琴演奏者

Sense.DEF: played or sung quietly

an
accordion
a bar where someone plays the piano for entertainment
a piano

a piano that is played by machinery inside it. A long roll of paper with holes cut in it gradually turns and works the machinery, pressing down the
key s
on the piano to produce music.
a small seat that you sit on while you play the piano
a large square open area between the houses in a town or city, where people often meet or sit together
a picture or film

a man in a
bullfight
who rides a horse, and annoys and weakens the
bull
by sticking a long spear into it
Sense.TRAN: 〔斗牛中用长矛刺牛使之发怒并变虚弱的〕骑马斗牛士﹐长矛手

Sense.DEF: a picaresque story tells the amusing and unlikely adventures of a character who travels to a lot of different places
small and unimportant
Sense.TRAN: 微不足道的﹐无关紧要的﹐琐细的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few cuts and bruises are picayune compared to what might have happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和可能发生的事情相比﹐几处割伤和瘀伤算不了什么。

Sense.DEF:
a round open area in central London, where several streets join together, famous for being very busy, for its advertising signs made of
neon light s
, and for the statue of Eros in its centre. People sometimes say that a place is like Piccadilly Circus to mean that it is very busy.
Sense.TRAN: 皮卡迪利广场〔伦敦市中心一露天广场﹔有时用来喻指繁忙热闹的地方〕

Sense.DEF: a hot-tasting sauce that is made with small pieces of vegetables and eaten with cold meat

a musical instrument that looks like a small
flute
to choose a person or thing, for example because they are the best or most suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students have to pick three courses from a list of 15.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生必须从15门课中选修3门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know which colour to pick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道要选哪个颜色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s going to pick the team for the match on Saturday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁将为星期六的比赛挑选队员？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t picked for the hockey team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没被选进曲棍球队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel was picked as the best small hotel in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家宾馆被选为那个地区的最佳小型宾馆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was picked to run in the 100 metres.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被选中参加100米赛跑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Russell spoke slowly, picking his words choosing what to say very carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗素讲得很慢﹐措辞谨慎。

Sense.DEF: to remove a flower, fruit, nut etc from a plant or tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: We picked some blackberries to eat on the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 途中我们采了一些黑莓吃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amy picked a small bunch of wild flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米采了一小把野花。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dish of freshly picked peas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盘新摘的豌豆

Sense.DEF: to remove something carefully from a place, especially something small

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ahmed picked the melon pips from his teeth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾哈迈德剔去牙缝里的瓜籽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was nervously picking bits of fluff off her sweater.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧张地择着毛衣上的小绒毛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper spent a lot of his time picking the ball out of the back of the net.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员很多时间都花在从网窝里捡球上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: pick your way through/across/among etc sth
Sense.DEF: to walk in a slow careful way, choosing exactly where to put your feet down
Sense.EXAMPLE: She picked her way between the puddles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心翼翼地绕过一个个水坑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He picked his way down the narrow staircase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心翼翼地走下狭窄的楼梯。

Sense.DEF:
to remove
mucus
from your nose with your finger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t pick your nose!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别抠鼻子！

Sense.DEF: to remove bits of food from between your teeth with your finger or a small pointed object
to ask someone who knows a lot about something for information and advice about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got a minute? I need to pick your brains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您有时间吗？我要向您请教一下。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately start a quarrel or fight with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see he was trying to pick a fight with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看得出来他是想找碴跟我打架。

Sense.DEF: to choose only the best people or things, or only the ones that you really like
Sense.TRAN: 仔细挑选〔最好的或真正喜欢的人或物〕﹐挑挑拣拣
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, you haven’t got time to pick and choose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐没时间挑挑拣拣了。

Sense.DEF: to use something that is not a key to unlock a door, drawer etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用钥匙之外的东西〕打开[撬开]锁
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s quite easy to pick the lock on a car door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撬开汽车门锁轻而易举。

Sense.DEF: to make a hole in something by pulling it with your fingers
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had picked a hole in his jumper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把自己的毛衣扯出了一个洞。

Sense.DEF: to criticize an idea or a plan by saying what its weak points are
Sense.TRAN: 批评某事物﹔挑某事物的毛病﹔找某事物的漏洞
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s easy to pick holes in her argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的论据漏洞百出。

Sense.DEF: to remove all the meat from a bone when you are eating
to quietly steal something from someone’s pocket
to choose someone or something very good
to criticize something very severely and in a very detailed way
Sense.TRAN: 把某事物驳得体无完肤
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m fed up with having my work picked to pieces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作被贬得一无是处﹐我受够了。

Sense.DEF: to play a musical instrument by pulling at its strings with your fingers

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a bone to pick with sb

Sense.DEF: to eat only small amounts of food because you do not feel hungry or do not like the food
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不饿或不喜欢而〕一点一点地吃﹐挑挑拣拣地吃
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paige could only pick at her meal, forcing down a mouthful or two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩奇只能勉为其难地吃着饭﹐强迫自己咽下一两口。

Sense.DEF: to touch something many times with your fingers, pulling it slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was picking at her skirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不停地拉扯自己的裙子。

Sense.DEF: to point a weapon carefully at one person or animal in a group, and then shoot them
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were gunmen in some of the buildings who picked off our men as they went past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一些大楼里有枪手﹐我们的人经过时他们就开枪射击。

Sense.DEF: to behave in an unfair way to someone, for example by blaming them or criticizing them unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 故意刁难 〔某人〕﹐跟〔某人〕找别扭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you pick on someone else for a change?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不换个人刁难刁难？

Sense.DEF: to choose a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just pick on one job and try to get that finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只管选一项工作﹐并设法完成。

Sense.DEF: to choose someone or something from a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: She picked out a navy blue dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挑中一条海军蓝的连衣裙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His story was picked out as the best by the judges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的小说被评委们评为第一名。

Sense.DEF: to recognize someone or something in a group of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was able to pick out her father at the other side of the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现父亲就在房间另一头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I picked out Valerie’s voice from among the general conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从众人的说话声中听出了瓦莱丽的声音。

Sense.DEF: if you can pick something out, you can see it but not very clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could just pick out some letters carved into the stone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只能依稀辨认出石头上刻的一些字母。

Sense.DEF: if something is picked out, it is in a different colour or material from the background, so that it can be clearly seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name was picked out in gold lettering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字用了金色字母﹐很是醒目。

Sense.DEF: to play a tune on a musical instrument slowly or with difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat at the piano and picked out a simple tune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在钢琴前﹐慢慢弹出一支简单的曲子。

Sense.DEF: to examine a group of things very carefully in order to choose the ones you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was sitting at the kitchen table picking over a pile of mushrooms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在餐桌边﹐仔细挑拣着一堆蘑菇。

Sense.DEF: to search through a pile of things to find things that you want
Sense.TRAN: 在…里搜寻〔以发现想要的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are still picking through the rubble looking for clues to the cause of the explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察还在瓦砾中搜寻有关爆炸原因的线索。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 捡起[拿起,拾起]某物﹔举起某人
Sense.DEF: to lift something or someone up
Sense.EXAMPLE: He picked up the letter and read it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿起信看了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The phone rang and I picked it up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话响了﹐我接了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mummy, can you pick me up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈﹐把我抱起来好吗？

Sense.DEF: to get up from the ground after you have fallen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carol picked herself up and brushed the dirt off her coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗尔站起身﹐拍去外套上的灰尘。

Sense.DEF: to make a room or building tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pick up your room before you go to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收拾一下房间再上床。

Subsense.DEF: to get or win something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s already picked up three major prizes this year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年他已经拿了三项大奖。

Subsense.DEF: to buy something or get it from a shop etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I picked up an evening paper on the way home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在回家的路上买了一份晚报。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For more details, pick up a leaflet in your local post office.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲知更多详情﹐请到当地邮局取阅宣传单。

Subsense.DEF: to get an illness
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I picked up a virus while I was in America.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在美国的时候感染了病毒。

Sense.DEF: to collect something from a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll pick my things up later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过一会儿来取我的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She just dropped by to pick up her mail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是顺便过来取她的邮件。

Sense.DEF: to let someone get into your car, boat etc and take them somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll pick you up at the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会到车站接你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The survivors were picked up by fishing boats from nearby villages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸存者被附近村庄的渔船救了起来。

Sense.DEF: to learn something by watching or listening to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I picked up a few words of Greek when I was there last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年在希腊的时候我学会了一些希腊语单词。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary watched the other dancers to see if she could pick up any tips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽观察其他跳舞的人﹐看能否学到什么窍门。

Sense.DEF: to notice something that is not easy to notice, such as a slight smell or a sign of something
Sense.TRAN: 注意到〔不容易注意的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I picked up a faint smell of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我闻到淡淡的咖啡味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dogs picked up the scent and raced off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些狗闻到了气味﹐一下子跑开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We picked up their tracks again on the other side of the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在河对岸又发现了他们的足迹。

Sense.DEF: if a machine picks up a sound, movement, or signal, it is able to notice it or receive it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sensors pick up faint vibrations in the Earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传感器探测到地球内部微弱的颤动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to pick up an American news broadcast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我设法收听到一档美国的新闻广播节目。

Sense.DEF: to become friendly with someone you have just met because you want to have sex with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: young women sitting around in bars waiting to be picked up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闲坐在酒吧等人来搭讪的年轻女子

Subsense.DEF: if you pick up where you stopped or were interrupted, you start again from that point
Subsense.TRAN: 〔从谈话﹑会议停顿的地方〕继续
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ll meet again in the morning and we can pick up where we left off .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们上午会再次碰面﹐到时候接着继续。

Subsense.DEF: if you pick up an idea that has been mentioned, you return to it and develop it further
Subsense.TRAN: 回过头来进一步阐述〔某观点〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to pick up what you said earlier.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想再谈谈先前你说过的问题。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This same theme is picked up in his later works.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相同的主题又出现在他后来的作品中。

Subsense.DEF: if a situation picks up, it improves
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her social life was picking up at last.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的社交生活终于有了起色。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The economy is finally beginning to pick up again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济终于开始有所好转。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been through a bit of a bad patch, but things are picking up again now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们度过了一段困难时期﹐不过目前情况又开始好转了。

Subsense.DEF: if a medicine or drink picks you up, it makes you feel better
Subsense.TRAN: 〔药物或饮料〕使某人感觉好些﹐使振作精神

Sense.DEF: if you pick up a road, you go onto it and start driving along it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We take the A14 to Birmingham and then pick up the M5.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿14号干线公路到伯明翰﹐然后上5号高速公路。

Sense.DEF: if you pick up a train, bus etc, you get onto it and travel on it
to go faster
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train was gradually picking up speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车正在逐渐加速。

Sense.DEF: to pay for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why should the taxpayer pick up the tab for mistakes made by a private company?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么纳税人要为一家私人公司的过错所造成的损失买单呢？

Sense.DEF: if the wind picks up, it increases or grows stronger
if one thing picks up a colour in something else, it has an amount of the same colour in it so that the two things look nice together
Sense.TRAN: 含有…的颜色〔因而搭配得好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like the way the curtains pick up the red in the rug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘带点地毯中的红色﹐我喜欢这种搭配。

Sense.DEF: if the police pick someone up, they take them somewhere to answer questions or to be locked up
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was picked up by police as he was trying to leave the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他企图出境时被警察拘捕。

Sense.DEF: to try to make your life normal again after something very bad has happened to you
Sense.TRAN: （使某事物）重整旗鼓﹐恢复正常
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of victims of the earthquake are now faced with the task of picking up the pieces of their lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数以千计的地震灾民现在面临着重建生活的重担。

Sense.DEF: if you pick up the threads of something that you were doing, you try to return to it and start doing it again after it stopped or was changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now that the war was over they could pick up the threads of their lives again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争已经结束﹐他们可以重新开始生活了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to walk properly or more quickly
to tidy things that someone else has left untidy
Sense.TRAN: 跟在〔某人〕后面收拾[整理]东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m tired of picking up after you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我烦透了总是跟在你屁股后面收拾！

Sense.DEF: to notice something about the way someone is behaving or feeling, even though they are trying not to show it
Sense.TRAN: 注意到〔别人试图隐藏的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children pick up on our worries and anxieties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们觉察到了我们的不安和焦虑。

Sense.DEF: to return to a point or an idea that has been mentioned and discuss it more
Sense.TRAN: 回过头来进一步讨论〔已被提到的论点或观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to pick up on a point that Steven made earlier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想再提一提史蒂文先前说过的一点。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone slightly for something they have said
Sense.TRAN: 批评[指责]某人说过的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew he was lying and I should have picked him up on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他在撒谎﹐我应该说他两句的。

Sense.DEF: if you can have your pick or take your pick of different things, you can choose which one you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have a look at the menu and take your pick .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看菜单再作选择吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew he could take his pick of any of the girls in the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道自己可以挑办公室里任何一个姑娘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah could have her pick of any university in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉可以选择国内任何一所大学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She always gets first pick of the videos.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是第一个挑录像带。

Sense.DEF: the best things in a group
Sense.TRAN: 某物中的精华[最好的东西]
Sense.EXAMPLE: In tonight’s programme we’ll be discussing the pick of this month’s new movies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在今晚的节目中我们将讨论本月的最佳新片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were fifteen candidates for the job, and he was the pick of the bunch the best one .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个职位有15名候选人﹐他是其中的最佳人选。

Sense.DEF: your pick is the person or thing that you have chosen from a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are a lot of good horses in the race, but Archimedes would be my pick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛中有很多好马﹐不过我最看好阿基米德。

Sense.DEF:
a
pickaxe

a small flat object that you use for pulling at the strings of a musical instrument such as a
guitar
Sense.TRAN: 〔拨吉他等弦乐器用的〕拨片﹐拨子

Sense.DEF: if something is pick-and-mix, you are free to choose the things or parts that you want and not choose the rest
Sense.TRAN: 随意组合的﹔综合的﹔拼合的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students can select parts of the course on a pick-and-mix basis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们可以以组合的方式选修这门课程的各个部分。

Sense.DEF: a large tool that you use for breaking up the ground. It consists of a curved iron bar with a sharp point on each end and a long handle.
picked people have been specially chosen because they are very suitable for a particular job
a person or machine that picks fruit or vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 摘棉工[机]/摘水果工[机]等

Subsense.DEF:
when a group of people stand or march in front of a shop, factory, government building etc to protest about something or to stop people from going in during a
strike
Subsense.TRAN: 〔罢工时设置的〕纠察队﹔纠察线
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There was a mass picket one involving a lot of people by students outside the main office of the university.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所大学的主办公楼外有一支庞大的学生纠察队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They organized a picket of the power station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们组织了一支电厂罢工纠察队。

Subsense.DEF: a person or the group of people involved in a picket
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The pickets persuaded some drivers not to enter the factory.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纠察队员劝阻一些司机不要进入工厂。

Sense.DEF: a soldier or a group of soldiers with the special duty of guarding a military camp
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s on picket duty tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚他站岗放哨。

Sense.DEF:
to stand or march in front of a shop, factory, government building etc to protest about something or to stop people from going in during a
strike
Sense.TRAN: （在…前）抗议﹔（在…外）担任纠察队员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Protesters are still picketing outside the White House gates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者仍围在白宫大门外抗议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of picketing miners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群进行罢工纠察的矿工

Sense.DEF: to place soldiers around or near a place as guards

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The new law will still allow peaceful picketing.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 新法令将仍然允许进行和平的罢工纠察。

Sense.DEF: a fence made up of a line of strong pointed sticks that are fixed in the ground

a group of people who stand outside a factory and try to prevent people from going in or coming out during a
strike

GramExa.EXAMPLE: So far, there has been very little violence on the picket line.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐纠察线上几乎没有发生暴力行为。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Very few workers were willing to cross the picket line .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很少有工人愿意越过罢工纠察线。

Sense.DEF: money or profits that you can get easily from a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were rich pickings a lot of money to be had from the stock market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股市里大有赚头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are easy pickings for thieves at these big outdoor concerts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这些大型户外音乐会上窃贼很容易得手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Companies are put off investing in poor areas because of the meagre pickings to be had.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为无利可图﹐各公司都推迟了在贫困地区的投资。

Sense.DEF:
a thick cold sauce that is made from pieces of vegetables preserved in
vinegar
. It is usually eaten with cold meat or cheese
Sense.EXAMPLE: cheese and pickle sandwiches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干酪腌菜三明治
Sense.EXAMPLE: a selection of cold meats and pickles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精选的冷肉和腌菜

Sense.DEF:
a
cucumber
preserved in
vinegar
or salt water, or a piece of this
to be in a very difficult situation and not know what to do

to preserve food in
vinegar
or salt water

pickled vegetables or fruits have been preserved in
vinegar
or salt water
Sense.EXAMPLE: pickled onions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腌渍洋葱

Sense.DEF: drunk
a drink or medicine that makes you feel happier and gives you more energy
Sense.TRAN: 提神的饮料[药品]﹔兴奋剂

Sense.DEF: someone who steals things from people’s pockets, especially in a crowd
a small truck with low sides that is used for carrying goods
an improvement in something which will be good for economic success

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are signs of a pick-up in high street spending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业区消费出现好转迹象。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone or something is collected from a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price includes travel from your local pick-up point in the UK to your hotel in Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个价格包括从英国当地的上车点到巴黎酒店之间的旅费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: trash pick-up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾收集

Sense.DEF: a stranger that you meet in a bar, at a party etc and have sex with
Sense.TRAN: 〔在酒吧﹑聚会等中为发生性关系而〕偶然结识的人﹐勾搭到的人

Sense.DEF:
an electronic part on a musical instrument, especially an electric
guitar
, that makes the sound louder
the rate at which a vehicle can increase its speed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a small car, but it had good pick-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车虽小﹐可加速能力很强。

Sense.DEF:
a game of
basketball
, baseball, etc that is played by anyone who wants to play when the game is starting
Sense.TRAN: 临时拼凑的球赛﹐即兴球赛

Sense.DEF:
a
pick-up 1
someone who is picky only likes particular things and not others, and so is not easy to please
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a very picky eater .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很挑食。

Sense.DEF: if you have a picnic, you take food and eat it outdoors, especially in the country
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to have a picnic down by the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定在湖边野餐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could go on a picnic today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今天可以去野餐。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a picnic table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野餐桌
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is free parking for visitors, as well as a restaurant and picnic area a special area with tables where people can have a picnic .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了餐厅和野餐区﹐我们还为游客提供免费停车位。

GramExa.GLOSS: a place that is suitable or pleasant for a picnic
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We found a lovely picnic spot by the river.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发现河边有一处很好的野餐地点。

GramExa.GLOSS: a container in which you can carry food for a picnic

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说‘do a picnic’ or 或‘make a picnic’. Say而要说have a picnic.

Sense.DEF: the food that you take to eat outdoors on a picnic
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll take a picnic with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会带野餐食物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We ate our picnic lunch by the river.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们午饭在河边野餐。

Sense.DEF: if something is no picnic, it is very difficult and needs a lot of effort or hard work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bringing up six children is no picnic!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带大六个孩子真不是件轻松的事！

Sense.DEF: to have a picnic
Sense.EXAMPLE: We picnicked on the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在海滩上野餐。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The area is very popular with picnickers.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个地区很受野餐者的欢迎。

Sense.DEF: a picture that represents a word or phrase
a mathematical drawing that shows numbers or amounts in the form of pictures
using or relating to paintings, drawings, or photographs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pictorial record of their journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们旅程的照片记录

Sense.DEF: shapes, lines etc painted or drawn on a surface, showing what someone or something looks like
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room had several pictures on the walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个房间墙上有几幅画。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book with pictures in it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带插图的书

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I like that picture of the two horses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢那张有那两匹马的画。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Draw a picture of your house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 画一张你家的画吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He asked her permission to paint her picture paint a picture of her .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他请求她允许为她画像。

Sense.DEF: a photograph

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s a great picture of you, Dad!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的那张照片拍得真好﹐爸爸！

GramExa.PROPFORM: take sb’s picture/take a picture of sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I asked the waiter if he’d mind taking our picture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问那个侍者是否能为我们拍张照。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like to see the wedding pictures?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要不要看看婚礼的照片？

Sense.DEF: an image that appears on a television or cinema screen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: upsetting pictures of the famine in Africa
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人揪心的非洲饥荒画面

Sense.EXAMPLE: satellite pictures from space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从太空拍摄的卫星图像

Sense.DEF: a description or idea of what something is like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book gives you a good picture of what life was like in Japan in the early 19th century.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书生动地描绘了19世纪初叶日本人的生活。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The article paints a rather bleak picture of the future of our planet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本文将我们地球的未来描绘成一幅暗淡的画面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Detectives are trying to build up a picture of the kidnapper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警探试图勾勒出绑匪的模样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The description in the guidebook showed rather a rosy picture one that makes you think that something is better than it really is .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指南中的描绘相当美好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I now have a vivid picture very clear picture in my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我脑海里有一幅清晰的画面了。

Sense.DEF: the general situation in a place, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The worldwide picture for tribal people remains grim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球各地部落民众的情况仍不容乐观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wider political picture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更广阔的政治局面
Sense.EXAMPLE: Checks throughout the region revealed a similar picture everywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个区域范围内的检查显示各地情况都差不多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were so caught up with the details, we lost sight of the big picture the situation considered as a whole .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们过分专注于细节﹐因而忽视了全局。

Sense.DEF: an image or memory that you have in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah had a mental picture of Lisbon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉对里斯本有印象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a vivid picture in his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脑中有清晰的印象。

Sense.DEF: to give someone all the information they need to understand a situation, especially one that is changing quickly
Sense.TRAN: 使某人明白[了解]实情〔尤指迅速变化的情形〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just going now, but Keith will put you in the picture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在要走了﹐不过基思会给你解释的。

Sense.DEF: to understand a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve said enough. I get the picture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说得够多了﹐我明白了。

Sense.DEF: if someone is out of the picture, they are no longer involved in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Injury has effectively put Woods out of the picture as far as international matches are concerned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤势实际上已经迫使伍兹退出了国际比赛。

Subsense.DEF: a film
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was voted the year’s best picture.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它被选为年度最佳影片。

Subsense.DEF: the cinema
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Would you like to go to the pictures?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想去看电影吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the picture of health/innocence/despair etc
Sense.DEF: to look very healthy etc
Sense.TRAN: 显得非常健康/天真/绝望等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Head bowed and sobbing, she was the picture of misery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她低头啜泣﹐显得非常痛苦。

Sense.DEF: to look beautiful
to imagine something by making an image in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom, picturing the scene, smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆想到那一幕﹐不由笑了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rob had pictured her as serious, but she wasn’t like that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布原本想象她是个严肃的人﹐但其实不是。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t picture him skiing. He’s so clumsy!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想象不出他滑雪的样子﹐他那么笨手笨脚的！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Picture what it would be like after a nuclear attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 设想一下﹐要是发生一场核攻击后果会怎样。

Sense.DEF: to show someone or something in a photograph, painting, or drawing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is pictured with her mum Christine and sister Kelly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片里她和妈妈克里斯蒂娜还有妹妹凯莉在一起。

Sense.DEF: to describe something in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been pictured as a difficult, demanding woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被描绘成一个难以相处的苛刻女人。

Sense.DEF: a book for children with many pictures in it

a
court card

the activity of sending a photo from one
mobile telephone
to another
Sense.TRAN: 发手机图片短信﹐发彩信

Sense.DEF: exactly right in appearance or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bride looked picture-perfect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新娘看上去漂亮极了。

Sense.DEF:
a
postcard
with a photograph or picture on it
a picture-postcard place is very pretty
Sense.EXAMPLE: picture-postcard villages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风景如画的村庄

Sense.DEF: a long narrow piece of wood fixed high on a wall, used for hanging pictures from
a picturesque place is pretty and interesting in an old-fashioned way
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕美丽的﹐古雅的﹐风景如画的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quiet fishing village with a picturesque harbour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有一座美丽港口的宁静渔村

Sense.DEF: picturesque language uses unusual, interesting, or sometimes rude words to describe something
Sense.TRAN: 〔语言〕生动的﹐形象化的﹐绘声绘色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a picturesque account of his trip to New York
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他纽约之行绘声绘色的描述

Sense.DEF: a large window made of a single piece of glass

to
urinate
to waste time doing things that are not important
Sense.TRAN: 〔做无关紧要的事情〕浪费时间﹐混日子

Sense.DEF: small and unimpor-tant
Sense.TRAN: 无关紧要的﹐微不足道的﹐琐碎的

Sense.DEF: a language that is a mixture of two other languages, which people who do not speak each other’s languages well use to talk to each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种语言混合在一起的〕混杂语言﹐洋泾浜语

Sense.DEF: English, French etc that is mixed with the words or grammar of another language

fruit baked inside a
pastry
covering

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like another piece of apple pie?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想再来一块苹果派吗？

Sense.DEF:
meat or vegetables baked inside a
pastry
or potato covering
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a steak and kidney pie with chips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃了一份牛肉腰子馅饼加薯条。

Sense.DEF: a share of something such as money, profits etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smaller companies want a bigger share of the pie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些较小的公司想多分一杯羹。

Sense.DEF: something good that someone says will happen, but which you think is impossible or unlikely
Sense.TRAN: 空中楼阁﹐不大可能实现的允诺[建议]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hope of a cure is just pie in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找到治疗方法的希望太过渺茫了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a finger in every pie

Sense.DEF: a piebald animal has black and white areas on its body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piebald horse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹有黑白花斑的马

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that has been separated from the main part

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He broke off a piece of bread and gave it her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他掰下一块面包递给她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut off a piece of wood 5 cm in length.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 截下一段五厘米长的木头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His trousers were held up with a piece of string.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的裤子靠一根细绳系着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a small or a large piece?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想要一小块还是一大块？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She cut the cake into four equal pieces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把蛋糕切成大小相等的四块。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Chop the potato into bite-sized pieces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把马铃薯切成小块。

PIC.HEADING: PIECE 片；块
PIC.PICCONTENT: a piece of meat 一块肉；a chunk of bread 一大块面包；fragments of glass 玻璃碎片；a slice of pizza一块比萨；a slab of concrete 一块混凝土板；a block of wood 一大块木头；specks of dust 灰尘微粒；a lump of coal 一块煤；a scrap of paper 一张纸片；a sheet of paper 一张纸；grains of salt 盐粒；a bar of soap 一块肥皂

Sense.DEF: one of the parts that something divides or breaks into

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a piece of broken glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片碎玻璃

Sense.EXAMPLE: Individual pieces of text can be cut and pasted to their correct position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文字的每一段都可以剪贴到正确位置上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The china dish lay in pieces on the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓷盘碎片散落在地上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: jigsaw pieces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拼图的拼片
Sense.EXAMPLE: His father had taught him how to take a gun to pieces .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲教过他怎么拆枪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shelving comes to pieces divides into separate parts for easy transport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 架子可以拆卸﹐以便运输。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shower head just came to pieces broke into separate parts in my hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花洒就在我手中裂开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fireplace was carefully dismantled piece by piece one part at a time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 壁炉被小心地逐块拆下。

Sense.DEF: a single thing of a particular type, or something that is one of several similar things
Sense.TRAN: 一个﹔一片﹔一块﹔一件﹔一张

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pass me another piece of paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再给我一张纸。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should eat three pieces of fruit a day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该每天吃三个水果。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a single piece of jewellery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只戴了一件首饰。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You need to examine every piece of evidence first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你首先要检查每一件证据。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an excellent piece of work
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件出色的作品
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a major piece of legislation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项主要立法
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a piece of equipment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台设备

GramExa.GLOSS: consisting of four, 60 etc separate parts
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a five-piece band
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五人乐队
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a three-piece suite two chairs and a sofa
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三件套沙发

Sense.DEF: a small amount of something that is interesting, useful, or unusual in some way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let me give you a piece of advice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我给你一点忠告吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re witnessing a piece of history in the making.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在见证一段新的历史。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It really was an extraordinary piece of luck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那真是特别幸运。

Sense.DEF: an area of land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a piece of waste ground
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片荒地
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dispute about a piece of land
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块土地引起的纠纷

Subsense.DEF: to become old and in bad condition
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All my clothes are falling to pieces.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我所有的衣服都破旧不堪。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They’ve let that lovely old house fall to pieces around them.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们任由那所漂亮的老房子在他们身边日渐衰败。

Subsense.DEF: to no longer be successful or working well
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The economy is falling to pieces.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济日渐凋零。

Sense.DEF: if a person or what they do goes to pieces, they are so upset or nervous that they cannot live, work, or perform as they should
Sense.TRAN: 〔因伤心﹑紧张不安而〕崩溃﹐垮掉
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just went to pieces after his wife died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子去世后他完全垮了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her performance goes to pieces when her father is watching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸观看她演出的时候﹐她紧张得完全乱了套。

Sense.DEF: to damage something badly by breaking it into many parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: His arm was ripped to pieces by a shark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一只胳膊被鲨鱼撕碎了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wear thick gloves, otherwise you’ll tear your fingers to pieces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴上厚手套﹐否则会弄破手指的。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or their ideas very severely
Sense.TRAN: 严厉批评某人[某人的观点]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donna could tear your work to pieces, and frequently did.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐娜能把你的工作批评得一无是处﹐她经常这样。

Sense.DEF: something that has been produced by an artist, musician, or writer
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术家﹑音乐家或作家的〕作品

GramExa.EXAMPLE: some unusual pieces of sculpture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些独特的雕塑作品

Sense.EXAMPLE: The LSO will perform a much-loved concert piece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦交响乐团将演奏一首深受欢迎的音乐会曲目。

Sense.DEF:
a short
article
in a newspaper or magazine or part of a television or radio programme that is about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸﹑杂志的〕文章﹐短文﹔〔电视﹑电台的〕报道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you read that piece in ‘The Observer’ about censorship?《
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观察家报》上那篇有关审查制度的文章你看了吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Robert wrote a short piece on the earthquake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特写了一篇关于地震的短文。

Sense.DEF: if you arrive somewhere in one piece, you are not injured
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cheer up. At least you’re still in one piece .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 振作一点﹐至少你还是平平安安的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ring mum and let her know we got here in one piece .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给妈妈打电话﹐告诉她我们平安到达了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb a piece of your mind
Sense.DEF: to tell someone that you are very angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 告诉某人你很生他的气
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the game he gave the players a piece of his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛后他对队员大发脾气。

Sense.DEF: to be very easy to do
Sense.TRAN: 很容易做﹐是轻而易举的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Landing this type of aircraft is a piece of cake for an experienced pilot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于经验丰富的飞行员来说﹐驾驶这种飞机着陆轻而易举。

Sense.DEF: to be very easy to do
Sense.TRAN: 是小菜一碟﹐是不费吹灰之力的事

Sense.DEF: a share of the money from a business activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔商业活动中获得的〕一份收益
Sense.EXAMPLE: And will foreign firms get a piece of the action ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么外国公司能从中得到什么好处吗？

Subsense.DEF: if the things someone says or does are all of a piece, they are part of the typical behaviour of that person
Subsense.TRAN: 总是说同样的话[做同样的事]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sexist language is all of a piece with the way some men treat women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些男性对女性总是使用有性别歧视的语言。

Subsense.DEF: to be the same or similar in all parts
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The architecture here is all of a piece.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的建筑千篇一律。

Subsense.DEF: a coin of a particular value

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you change for a 50-cent piece?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有50分硬币的零钱？

Subsense.DEF: a coin
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Robert slipped two gold pieces into the man’s hand.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特往那男人手里塞了两枚金币。

Sense.DEF:
a small object used in a game such as
chess
a small gun
to be someone who does nasty things or deceives people in order to get what they want
used to show that you do not respect someone or something they say
Sense.TRAN: 是废话/是个废物〔用于表示不尊敬他人所说的人或事物〕

Sense.DEF: an offensive expression for a woman. Do not use this expression.

Crossrefto.REFLEX: how long is a piece of string?

Sense.DEF: to use all the information you have about a situation in order to discover the truth about it
Sense.TRAN: 把〔所有事实或信息〕拼凑起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are trying to piece together his movements before the murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方试图梳理出他在凶案发生前的行踪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her early life has been pieced together from several different sources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据几个不同的资料来源整理出来了她的早期生活状况。

Sense.DEF: to put all the separate parts of an object into the correct order or position
Sense.TRAN: 把 〔物体的部分〕拼合起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slowly pieced together the torn fragments of a letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把撕碎的信慢慢拼起来。

Exponent.DEF: an amount of something that has been cut or separated from the main part
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Could I have another piece of cake?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以再吃一块蛋糕吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a piece of broken glass
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块碎玻璃

Exponent.DEF: a piece. Bit is more informal than piece and is often used about smaller pieces.
Exponent.TRAN: 小片﹔小块〔与piece相比,bit 更为不正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The notes were written on bits of paper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 笔记都写在小纸片上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He threw a bit of wood onto the fire.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把一小截木头丢进火里。

Exponent.DEF: a small piece of something solid or firm that does not have a regular shape
Exponent.TRAN: 块〔指形状不规则的固体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: two lumps of sugar
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两块糖
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a lump of coal
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块煤
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a lump of clay
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块黏土

Exponent.DEF: a small piece of paper, cloth etc that is no longer needed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wrote the phone number on a scrap of paper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我将电话号码写在一张废纸片上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dog was eating scraps of food off the floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗在吃地上的食物碎屑。

Exponent.DEF: a long narrow piece of cloth, paper etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a strip of cloth
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一截布条
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The leather had been cut into strips.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张皮被切成一条条的。

Exponent.DEF: a thin flat piece of something such as paper, glass, or metal
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a blank sheet of paper
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张空白纸
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sheet of aluminium
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块铝片

Exponent.DEF: a thin flat piece of bread, cake, meat etc cut from a larger piece
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a slice of pizza
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片比萨饼
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Cut the tomatoes into thin slices.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 将西红柿切成薄片。

Exponent.DEF: a piece of something solid that does not have a regular shape – used especially about food, rock, or metal
Exponent.TRAN: 厚块,大块,厚片〔指形状不规则的固体,尤指食物﹑石头或金属〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fruit was cut into large chunks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这水果被切成大块。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a chunk of bread
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大块面包

Exponent.DEF: a large piece with rough edges, which has been cut or has broken off a bigger piece of food, rock etc
Exponent.TRAN: 大块，大片〔指切下或掰下的食物﹑石头等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a big hunk of cheese
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大块干酪
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hunks of concrete
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 水泥块

Exponent.DEF: a piece of something solid, which has straight sides
Exponent.EXAMPLE: concrete blocks
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大块水泥
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a block of cheese
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大块干酪
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a block of ice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大块冰

Exponent.DEF: a thick flat piece of stone, or of cake, meat etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The floor had been made from stone slabs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面用石板铺成。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a slab of beef
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚厚一块牛肉

Exponent.DEF: a piece that has six square sides – used especially about food
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cube of sugar
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块方糖
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ice cubes
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰块

Exponent.DEF: a block of soap, chocolate, candy, or metal, which has straight sides
Exponent.TRAN: 〔肥皂﹑巧克力﹑糖果﹑金属等平整的〕条,块
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a chocolate bar
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块巧克力
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a bar of soap
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块肥皂
Exponent.EXAMPLE: gold bars worth more than £26 million
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 价值2﹐600多万英镑的金条

Exponent.DEF: a slice of bacon
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I usually have two rashers of bacon for breakfast.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常早餐吃两片薄薄的熏猪肉。

Section.SECHEADING: A SMALL PIECE 小片,小块

Exponent.DEF: a small piece that has broken off something, especially something hard
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The window shattered, covering them with fragments of glass.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户碎了,玻璃碴子落了他们一身。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They found fragments of bone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们找到了碎骨。

Exponent.DEF: a very small piece of bread, cake etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were just a few crumbs left on the plate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 盘里只剩了一些碎屑。

Exponent.DEF: a piece of something such as dirt or dust which is so small you almost cannot see it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She brushed the specks of dust from the table.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她掸去桌上的灰尘。

Exponent.DEF: a very small amount of a liquid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were drops of blood on the floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地上有血滴。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt a drop of rain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉到有雨滴落下。

Sense.DEF: the best or most important thing in a series, which comes after everything else
Sense.TRAN: 〔一连串事物的〕顶峰﹔最重要的事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pièce de résistance was a stunning goal in the last minute of the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场比赛的高潮就是最后一分钟那个绝妙进球。

Sense.DEF: a process that is piecemeal happens slowly and in stages that are not regular or planned properly
Sense.TRAN: 零碎的﹐缺乏通盘计划的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The buildings have been adapted in a piecemeal fashion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些大楼的改造是零星进行的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piecemeal approach to the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种头痛医头﹑脚痛医脚的解决问题方式

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The new fire regulations have been introduced piecemeal.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的防火条例零零星星地推行开来。

Sense.DEF: work for which you are paid according to the number of things you produce rather than the number of hours that you spend working
Sense.TRAN: 按件计酬的工作﹐计件工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: bargaining over piecework rates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就计件工作报酬进行商讨

Sense.DEF: a circle divided into parts by lines coming from the centre to show how big the different parts of a total amount are
used in the names of birds that are black and white
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pied wagtail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑白鸰

Sense.DEF: a small apartment or house, often in the centre of a city or town, that is not your main home but which you own and stay in sometimes
Sense.EXAMPLE: They kept a pied-à-terre in London for theatre evenings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在伦敦还有一间小公寓﹐晚上看戏后可以住。

Sense.DEF: very drunk
a structure that is built over and into the water so that boats can stop next to it or people can walk along it
Sense.TRAN: 〔伸向海中的〕突堤码头﹐凸式码头
Sense.EXAMPLE: a yacht moored at a pier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停在码头的一艘游艇
Sense.EXAMPLE: strolling along Brighton Pier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在布赖顿码头散步

Sense.DEF: a thick stone, wooden, or metal post that is used to support something
to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steam the corn until it can easily be pierced with a fork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把玉米蒸到用叉子可以轻易扎透。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rose underwent emergency surgery after a bullet pierced her lung.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗丝被子弹射穿肺部﹐接受了紧急手术。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pierce small holes in the base of the pot with a hot needle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用一根烧红的针在盆底扎几个小洞。

Sense.DEF: to have a small hole made in your ears, nose etc so that you can wear jewellery through the hole
Sense.TRAN: 让人给耳朵/鼻子等穿孔
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had my belly-button pierced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在肚脐上穿了洞眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: pierced ears
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扎了耳洞的耳朵

Sense.DEF: if sound or light pierces something, you suddenly hear or see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The darkness was pierced by the beam from the lighthouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯塔射出的光束穿透了黑暗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sudden scream pierced the silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突如其来的一声尖叫划破了寂静。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men’s lanterns pierced through the dense mist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人们手中灯笼的光线穿透了浓雾。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel a strong emotion such as pain, sadness, or love
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her memories sometimes pierced her heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回忆有时让她心如刀割。

Sense.DEF: to force a way through something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leicester rarely threatened to pierce the Manchester United defence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱斯特城队很少能威胁到曼彻斯特联队的防线。

Sense.DEF: someone with piercing eyes is looking at you and seems to know what you are thinking
Sense.TRAN: 敏锐的﹐锐利的﹐有洞察力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was mockery now in those piercing blue eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那双敏锐的蓝眼睛里流露出讥讽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt foolish and unsure under his piercing gaze .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他洞悉一切的注视下﹐她觉得自己很愚昧﹐没有自信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a piercing look .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向她投去锐利的目光。

Sense.DEF: a sound that is piercing is high, sharp, and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grinned and let out a piercing whistle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他咧嘴一笑﹐吹出一声刺耳的口哨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piercing scream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺耳的尖叫

Sense.DEF: a piercing wind is very cold
causing a lot of pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt a piercing sensation in her arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到手臂上一阵钻心的疼痛。

Sense.DEF: affecting your feelings very deeply in a sad way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piercing moment of regret
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感到后悔万分的时刻

Sense.DEF: a hole made through part of your body so that you can put jewellery there, or the process of making these holes
when you behave in a way that shows respect for your religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: an act of Christian piety
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表达基督徒虔诚的行为

Sense.DEF: nonsense
piffling amounts are very small and therefore useless

a farm animal with short legs, a fat body and a curved tail. Pigs are kept for their meat, which includes
pork
,
bacon
and
ham
.
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kept pigs and poultry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他养过猪和家禽。

Subsense.DEF: someone who eats too much or eats more than their share
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You greedy pig, you ate all the candy!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这只馋猫﹐把糖果都吃光了！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I made a bit of a pig of myself ate too much at dinner.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我晚饭大吃特吃。

Subsense.DEF: someone who is unpleasant in some way, for example unkind or very untidy
Subsense.TRAN: 令人讨厌的人﹔肮脏的人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They live like pigs in that house over the road.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在马路那头猪圈似的房子里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can tell him from me he’s an ignorant pig.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以转告他﹐我说他是个无知的家伙。

GramExa.GLOSS: a man who thinks women are not equal to men

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a police officer. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 警察猪猡〔对警察的侮辱性称呼〕

Sense.DEF: something that is very difficult or unpleasant to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re improving, and they’re a pig of a team to beat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在进步﹐要打败这支队伍可不容易。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a pig’s ear of sth
Sense.DEF: to do something very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s made a right pig’s ear of these repairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把这些修理活干得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you do not believe what someone is saying
something you bought without seeing it first and that is not as good or valuable as you expected
Sense.TRAN: 〔购买前未曾看过的〕盲目买来的劣质东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: What if the car you buy turns out to be a pig in a poke ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你随便买来的车结果并不怎么样﹐该怎么办？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not think something will happen
Sense.TRAN: 太阳从西边出来〔表示不相信某事会发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Someone might have handed in your pass.’ ‘Yes, and pigs might fly.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可能已经有人把你的通行证上交了呢。”“是啊﹐太阳还能从西边出来呢。”

Sense.DEF: to eat a lot of food all at once

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found Sam in front of the TV, pigging out on pizza and fries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现萨姆在电视机前狼吞虎咽地吃着比萨饼和薯条。

Sense.DEF: a grey bird with short legs that is common in cities
someone who is pigeon-chested has a very narrow chest that sticks out
one of a set of small open boxes fixed to a wall. You leave letters, messages etc for particular people in the boxes.
Sense.TRAN: 〔墙上的〕鸽笼式分类架﹐信件格﹐文件格

Sense.DEF: to unfairly consider a person, activity etc as belonging to a particular type or group
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人或某活动等〕妄加分类﹐把…片面归档

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Patsy was pigeonholed as a Country and Western singer, but that’s too simple.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕齐被归类为乡村和西部音乐歌手﹐但这有点太片面了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is pigeon-toed has feet that turn towards each other as they walk
a pig farm, or the place on a farm where pigs are kept
a pig – used by children or when you are talking to children

Subsense.DEF: someone who is involved in an argument between two opposing sides, but does not know who they should support
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在对立双方之间却不知道支持哪一方的〕夹在中间的人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What have I got myself into? I’m piggy in the middle between Guido and Silvia!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这是怎么了？我夹在吉多和西尔维娅之间真是两难！

Subsense.DEF: a game in which two people throw a ball backwards and forwards between them, while a third person in the middle tries to catch it
Subsense.TRAN: 掷球游戏〔两个人互相掷球﹐尽量不让中间的第三人接到球〕

Sense.DEF: small unattractive eyes
Sense.TRAN: 〔人的眼睛〕像猪一样小而难看的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His little piggy eyes were red with hatred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那双难看的小眼睛恨得通红。

Sense.DEF: if you give someone, especially a child, a piggyback, you carry them high on your shoulders, supporting them with your hands under their legs
to use something that is bigger, better, or more successful in order to help another product or project succeed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: videos that piggyback onto the success of proven TV programs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 借助已经成功 的电视节目推出的录影带

Sense.DEF: to use someone else’s wi-fi connection to the Internet, without their knowledge or permission

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can I prevent other people from piggybacking onto my connection?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么才能阻止其他人盗用我的网络连接？

Sense.DEF: a small container, usually in the shape of a pig, in which children can save coins
determined to do things the way you want and refusing to change your mind, even when there are good reasons to do so
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never have I met a woman so obstinate, so pigheaded!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没有碰到过如此执拗﹑如此顽固的女人！

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It was just sheer pigheadedness on his part.

Sense.DEF: a form of iron that is not pure
a young pig
a natural substance that makes skin, hair, plants etc a particular colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melanin is the dark brown pigment of the hair, skin and eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑色素是头发﹑皮肤以及眼睛中的深棕色色素。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The artist Sandy Lee uses natural pigments in her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画家桑迪·李在她的作品中使用天然颜料。

Sense.DEF: the natural colour of living things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dark pigmentation gives protection from the sun’s rays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种天然的深色可避免阳光伤害。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
pygmy
a building where pigs are kept
a very dirty or untidy place
leather made from the skin of a pig
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pigskin suitcase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪皮手提箱

Sense.DEF: the ball used in American football
Sense.EXAMPLE: We started tossing the pigskin around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开始把橄榄球抛来抛去。

Sense.DEF: a building where pigs are kept
a very dirty or untidy place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was a pigsty, as usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那房子和平时一样﹐脏得像个猪窝。

Sense.DEF: waste food that is fed to pigs

lengths of hair that have been twisted together into a
plait

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wore her hair in pigtails.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梳着辫子。

Sense.DEF: a large fish that eats other fish and lives in rivers and lakes
a long-handled weapon with a sharp blade, used in the past
to happen or become known
Sense.EXAMPLE: The world is being turned upside down by the string of multimedia technologies coming down the pike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串多媒体技术的问世令整个世界发生了天翻地覆的变化。

Sense.DEF:
a
turnpike
someone who avoids difficult situations, especially ones involving money
very clear and easy to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: None of us worked it out, though it was as plain as a pikestaff when you thought about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想想是一清二楚﹐可是我们谁也理不出个头绪来。

Sense.DEF: a pilau

a flat square
column
attached to the wall of a building for decoration

a type of exercise based on
yoga
and dance that you do with special equipment which makes you push, pull, and stretch, so that your body moves more easily and becomes stronger
Sense.TRAN: 普拉提〔一种基于瑜伽和舞蹈的健身运动〕

Sense.DEF: a dish made of rice, vegetables, and sometimes meat
Sense.EXAMPLE: mushroom pilau
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蘑菇饭

Sense.DEF: a small fish that lives in the sea and that can be eaten
a group of several things of the same type that are put on top of each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His mother came in carrying a pile of ironing in her arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲手里抱着一叠熨好的衣物进来了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flora shuffled through a pile of magazines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗洛拉胡乱地翻看一摞杂志。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tidied up the books and put them in neat piles .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把书本整理好﹐并一摞摞地码放整齐。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He balanced the plate on the top of a pile of books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把盘子在一摞书上放稳。

PIC.HEADING: PILE 堆﹔叠﹔摞
PIC.PICCONTENT: a heap of clothes 一堆衣服；a stack of magazines 一叠杂志；a wad of notes BrE【英】/bills AmE【美】一沓钞票；a mound of soil 一堆土；a pile of books 一摞书

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something arranged in a shape that looks like a small hill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: piles of melting snow
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆堆正在融化的雪

Sense.EXAMPLE: All that remained of the old house was a pile of rubble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所老房子只剩下一堆瓦砾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sophie stooped to throw another branch on the pile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索菲弯腰往柴火堆上又扔了一根树枝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began to sweep the pieces of glass into a pile .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他动手把碎玻璃片扫成一堆。

Sense.DEF: a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had piles of letters from viewers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到了大量的观众来信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: another pile of directives from the EU
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又一堆来自欧盟的指示

Sense.DEF: the weakest or least important position in a society or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: I soon discovered I was at the bottom of the pile in the office hierarchy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快发现自己在办公室里处于最底层。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always puts her own needs to the bottom of the pile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是最后考虑自己的需求。

Sense.DEF: the best or highest position in a society or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been 20 years since a British tennis player was at the top of the pile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的网球运动员已经有20年没有位居榜首了。

Sense.DEF: a very large old house
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve just bought an 18th-century pile in Surrey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们刚刚在萨里郡买了一座建于18世纪的大宅。

Sense.DEF:
the soft surface of short threads on a
carpet
or some types of cloth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her feet sank into the thick pile of the rug.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双脚陷进厚厚的绒毯里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep pile carpet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚绒地毯

Sense.DEF: a heavy wooden, stone, or metal post, used to support something heavy
to make a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had made his pile in the wholesale business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做批发生意赚了大钱。

Sense.DEF:
painfully swollen
blood vessel s
near a person’s
anus
to fill a place or container or cover a surface with a large amount of things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He piled bread and milk into his basket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把面包和牛奶往篮子里堆。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Melissa piled spaghetti onto her plate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅利莎一个劲地往盘子里堆意大利面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a chair piled with velvet cushions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 堆满了天鹅绒靠垫的椅子

Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was piled high with boxes filled with a lot of boxes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里高高地堆着一些箱子。

Sense.DEF: to arrange things in a pile
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ma stacked the cups and piled the plates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈把杯盘堆叠起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She brushed her hair and piled it carefully on top of her head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梳好头发﹐仔细地盘在头顶。

Sense.DEF: if people pile in, they get into a vehicle very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pierre came to pick them up, and they all piled in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮埃尔开车来接他们﹐他们一拥而上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: pile it on/pile on the drama
Sense.DEF: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem much worse than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know I’m piling it on a bit, but there is a serious point to be made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我有点夸张了﹐不过有一点很重要﹐我要提一提。

Sense.DEF: to show that you are much better than your opponent in a game
Sense.TRAN: 施加强大的压力/盛气凌人
Sense.EXAMPLE: England piled on the pressure from the start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队从一开始就显得咄咄逼人。

Sense.DEF: to gain a lot of body weight
Sense.EXAMPLE: She slimmed down a couple of years ago but has piled on the pounds again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几年前她瘦下来过﹐不过现在体重又增加了不少。

Sense.DEF: if people pile out, they leave a place or get out of a vehicle quickly and in a disorganized way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edward parked by the river and we all piled out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华把车停在河边﹐我们一哄而下。

Sense.DEF: to increase in quantity or amount, in a way that is difficult to manage
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t long before the debts were piling up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没多久就债台高筑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The traffic starts piling up around this time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 差不多这个时候交通就开始拥堵了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work has a tendency to pile up if I’m not careful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一不注意工作就会积压起来。

Sense.DEF: to arrange things in a pile
Sense.EXAMPLE: tiny doughnuts piled up in a dish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 堆放在盘子里的几个小甜甜圈

Sense.DEF: a machine for pushing heavy posts into the ground
a very hard hit
a traffic accident involving many vehicles
Sense.EXAMPLE: a motorway pile-up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一宗高速公路连环撞车事故

Sense.DEF: to steal things that are not worth much, especially from the place where you work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指从工作的地方〕偷窃〔不很值钱的东西〕﹐小偷小摸

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was sacked after being caught pilfering from the till.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被撞见在单位行窃﹐丢了饭碗。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里小偷小摸的人

Sense.DEF: a religious person who travels a long way to a holy place
Sense.EXAMPLE: pilgrims visiting a holy shrine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祭拜圣庙的朝圣者

Sense.DEF: a journey to a holy place for religious reasons

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the chance to go on pilgrimage to Lourdes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 前往卢尔德朝圣的机会

Sense.DEF: a journey to a place connected with someone or something famous
Sense.TRAN: 〔去与名人或有名之物有关的地方〕旅行
Sense.EXAMPLE: Presley’s home has become a place of pilgrimage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “猫王”的家乡已成为旅游胜地。
