Sense.DEF: a small solid piece of medicine that you swallow whole
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has to take pills to control his blood pressure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他必须服药控制血压。
安眠药
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bottle of vitamin pills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶维生素片

Sense.DEF: a pill taken regularly by some women in order to prevent them having babies

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My doctor advised me to go on the pill start taking it regularly .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的医生建议我口服避孕药。

Sense.DEF: to do something to make an unpleasant job or situation less unpleasant for the person who has to accept it
Sense.TRAN: 给药丸加糖衣﹐把苦差事变得更容易接受

Sense.DEF: if someone, especially a child, is a pill, they are annoying
Sense.TRAN: 是令人讨厌的人〔尤指小孩〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luke can be a real pill sometimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢克有时候真是个讨厌鬼。

Sense.DEF:
if a piece of clothing pills, especially a
sweater
, it forms little balls on the surface of the cloth after it has been worn or washed
if soldiers pillage a place in a war, they steal a lot of things and do a lot of damage

Subsense.DEF: a tall upright round post used as a support for a roof or bridge
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Eight massive stone pillars supported the roof.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八根巨大的石柱支撑起房顶。

Subsense.DEF: a tall upright round post, usually made of stone, put up to remind people of an important person or event

Sense.LEXUNIT: pillar of society/the community/the church etc
Sense.DEF: somebody who is an important and respected member of a group, and is involved in many public activities
Sense.TRAN: 社会/社区/教会等的栋梁[中坚分子]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Fitzwilliam had been seen as a pillar of the community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲茨威廉先生已被视为社区的骨干。

Sense.DEF: a very important part of a system of beliefs or ideas

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the pillars of a civilized society must be that everyone has equal access to the legal system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文明社会的基础之一就是法律面前人人平等。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be driven/pushed from pillar to post
Sense.DEF: to have to go from one person or situation to another without achieving much or being able to settle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poor kid has been pushed from pillar to post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个可怜的孩子被逼得走投无路。

Sense.DEF: if someone is a pillar of strength, they are there to give you help and support at a difficult time
Sense.TRAN: 是（…的）精神支柱［坚强后盾］
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christine’s been a pillar of strength to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯蒂娜一直是我的精神支柱。

Sense.DEF: a tall upright mass of dust, smoke, flame etc
a large red tube-shaped box for posting letters that stands on streets in Britain
a very bright red colour

a small round box for holding
pill s
a small strong usually circular shelter with a gun inside it, built as a defence
a small round hat for a woman

the seat behind the driver of a
motorcycle
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pillion passenger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩托车后座乘客

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Tom had never ridden pillion before.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆以前从未坐过摩托车后座。

Sense.DEF: a very stupid person
if someone is pilloried, they are publicly criticized by a lot of people, especially in newspapers etc
Sense.TRAN: 使受公众批评〔尤在报纸等上面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The education secretary was pilloried by the press for his latest proposals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育部长因其最近的提案而受到新闻界批评。

Sense.DEF: a wooden frame with holes for someone’s head and hands to be locked into, used in the past as a way of publicly punishing someone
a cloth bag filled with soft material that you put your head on when you are sleeping
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be asleep as soon as my head hits the pillow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我头一碰到枕头就会睡着。

Sense.DEF: a game in which children hit each other with pillows
Sense.TRAN: 枕头战〔小孩用枕头打闹〕

Sense.DEF: conversation between lovers in bed
to rest your head somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: His head was pillowed on his arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头枕在胳膊上。

Sense.DEF: a cloth cover for a pillow
someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机或宇宙飞船上的〕驾驶员﹐飞行员
Sense.EXAMPLE: an airline pilot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空公司飞行员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fighter pilot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗机驾驶员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error a mistake by the pilot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

Sense.DEF: someone with a special knowledge of a particular area of water, who is employed to guide ships across it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a harbour pilot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海港领航员

Sense.DEF: a small study, project etc which is carried out as a test to see if an idea, product etc will be successful
Sense.TRAN: 试验性研究/试点项目/试验性[先导]计划等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pilot scheme which could be extended to other areas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以扩展到其他领域的试验性计划

Sense.DEF: a television programme that is made in order to test whether people like it and would watch it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pilot for a new sitcom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一出新情景喜剧的试播

Sense.DEF: to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot
Sense.TRAN: 驾驶〔飞机或宇宙飞船〕﹔给〔船舶〕领航

Sense.DEF: to test a new idea, product etc on people to find out whether it will be successful
Sense.TRAN: 试用〔新想法﹑新产品等〕﹐试行
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new exams are currently being piloted in a number of areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的考试目前正在一些地区试行。

Sense.DEF: to help someone to go to a place
to be responsible for making sure that a new law or plan is officially approved
Sense.TRAN: 使〔新的法律﹑计划〕顺利通过

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Bill was piloted through Parliament by the health Minister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在卫生部长的推动下﹐该法案在议会顺利通过。

Sense.DEF: a small gas flame that burns all the time and is used for lighting larger gas burners
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于点燃大型煤气炉的〕常燃火苗﹐引火火苗

Sense.DEF: a middle rank in the Royal Air Force, or someone who has this rank

a small
whale
with black skin

a small red
pepper
which does not have a very strong taste

a man who makes money by controlling
prostitute s

to find customers for a
prostitute
to improve something or make it more attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can pimp your car with these stickers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以用这些贴纸装饰你的车。

Sense.DEF: a small wild plant with flowers in varius colours, especially red
Sense.TRAN: 琉璃繁缕﹐海绿〔矮小野生植物﹐开各色的花﹐尤其是红花〕

Sense.DEF: a small raised red spot on your skin, especially on your face
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指长在脸上的〕丘疹﹐小脓包﹐粉刺

Subsense.DEF: a short thin piece of metal with a sharp point at one end, used especially for fastening together pieces of cloth while making clothes
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤在做衣服时固定布料用的〕别针﹐大头针

Subsense.DEF: a thin piece of metal used to fasten things together, especially broken bones

Sense.DEF: a piece of metal, sometimes containing jewels, that you fasten to your clothes to wear as a decoration

one of the pieces of metal that sticks out of an electric
plug
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-pin plug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三脚插头

Sense.DEF:
one of the bottle-shaped objects that you try to knock down in a game of
bowling

Sense.LEXUNIT: you could hear a pin drop
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is very quiet and no one is speaking
Sense.TRAN: 静得可以听到针掉下来的声音〔用于表示非常安静〕

Sense.DEF:
a short piece of metal which you pull out of a
hand grenade
to make it explode a short time later

a metal stick with a flag at the top which marks the holes on a
golf course
used to say that you would like to do something to someone because they have annoyed you
Sense.TRAN: 恨不得﹐巴不得〔用于表示你想要对惹恼你的人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For two pins, I’d just send them all home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我恨不得把他们都送回家。

Sense.DEF: legs
to fasten something somewhere, or to join two things together, using a pin

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you pin this to the notice board?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把这个钉在布告板上吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pinned the name tag on his jacket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把姓名牌别在自己的短外套上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had photos of her kids pinned up next to her desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把孩子们的照片钉在了她的书桌旁。

Sense.DEF: to make someone unable to move by putting a lot of pressure or weight on them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pinned her arms to her sides.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她的胳膊摁在身体两侧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Albert got him pinned against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伯特把他按在墙上不能动弹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They managed to pin him down until the police arrived.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们按住他﹐直到警察赶来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her body was pinned under the weight of the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的身体被压在汽车下面。

Sense.DEF: to make someone give clear details or make a definite decision about something
Sense.TRAN: 让〔某人〕详细说明﹐让〔某人〕明确表态

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you manage to pin him down to a definite date?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有设法让他定个具体日期？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s impossible to pin down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让他明确表态是不可能的。

Sense.DEF: to understand something clearly or be able to describe it exactly
Sense.TRAN: 清楚地知道﹐确切地描述﹐确定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The flavour was hard to pin down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那味道很难确切描述。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers etc involved in fighting are pinned down, they cannot move from their position because someone is shooting at them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels have been pinned down in a camp to the south of the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子已被火力压制在河南岸的营区。

Sense.DEF: to blame someone for something, often unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t try to pin the blame on me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别想把责任往我身上推！
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re trying to pin the murder on the boyfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们企图把谋杀的罪名推在那个男朋友身上。

Sense.DEF: to hope that something will happen or someone will help you, because all your plans depend on this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris is pinning his hopes on getting into Yale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯寄希望于考进耶鲁大学。

Sense.DEF: a number that you use when you get money from a machine using a plastic card
Sense.TRAN: 个人身份识别号码﹐私人密码〔用银行卡在自动取款机上取款时的密码〕

Sense.DEF:
an alcoholic drink made from
coconut
juice,
pineapple
juice, and
rum
Sense.TRAN: 椰子菠萝鸡尾酒〔用椰子汁﹑菠萝汁和朗姆酒调制而成〕

Sense.DEF:
a dress that does not cover your arms and under which you wear a shirt or
blouse
a loose piece of clothing that does not cover your arms, worn over your clothes to keep them clean
a game played on a machine with a sloping board which a ball rolls down while the player tries to prevent it reaching the bottom
glasses worn in the past that were held in position on the nose by a spring, instead of by pieces fitting round the ears

one of the pair of
claw s
that some
shellfish
and insects have, used for holding and cutting food, and for fighting
a tool made of two crossed pieces of metal used for holding things tightly
a military attack in which two groups of soldiers come from opposite directions in order to trap the enemy between them
Sense.TRAN: 〔军事进攻中的〕钳形攻势[运动]

Sense.DEF: to press a part of someone’s skin very tightly between your finger and thumb, especially so that it hurts
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to stop her pinching her baby brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能让她再掐她小弟弟了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pinched her cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他捏了一下她的脸颊。

Sense.DEF: to steal something, especially something small or not very valuable
Sense.TRAN: 偷窃〔尤指小物品或不很值钱的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s pinched my coat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人偷了我的外套！

Sense.DEF: to press something between your finger and thumb
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pinch the edges of the pastry together to seal it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把馅饼的边缘捏紧封口。

Sense.DEF: if something you are wearing pinches you, it presses painfully on part of your body, because it is too tight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her new shoes were pinching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的新鞋挤脚。

Sense.DEF: used when a situation is so surprising that the person involved needs to make sure that they are not imagining it
Sense.TRAN: 某人得掐自己一下〔以证实某情况是真实的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes she had to pinch herself to make sure it was not all a dream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候她得掐自己一下﹐以证明这一切不是在做梦。

Sense.DEF:
to
arrest
someone
to remove a small part of a plant with your fingers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pinch out any side shoots to make the plant grow upwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把边上的芽都掐掉﹐让这株植物往上长。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of salt, pepper etc that you can hold between your finger and thumb
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add a pinch of salt to taste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加一撮盐来调味。

Sense.DEF: when you press someone’s skin between your finger and thumb
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a playful pinch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开玩笑地捏了他一把。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you could do something if necessary in a difficult or urgent situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s space for three people. Four at a pinch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三个人的空间﹐必要时可以挤四个人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re in a pinch, I’m sure they’d look after Jenny for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有急事﹐我确信他们会照顾珍妮一段时间。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take sth with a pinch of salt
Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not always completely believe what a particular person says
Sense.TRAN: 对某事半信半疑﹐对某事不完全相信
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to take what he says with a pinch of salt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话你可不能全信。

Sense.DEF: to have financial difficulties, especially because you are not making as much money as you used to make
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因赚钱不如以前多而〕感到拮据
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local stores and businesses are beginning to feel the pinch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的商店和公司开始感到手头有点紧。

Sense.DEF: a pinched face looks thin and unhealthy, for example because the person is ill, cold, or tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a small pinched face with sad eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她瘦小的脸庞面容憔悴﹐眼神悲伤。

Sense.DEF: to do something for someone else because they are suddenly not able to do it

to
hit
for someone else in baseball
a soft filled bag for sticking pins in until you need to use them
a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ancient pine forest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片古老的松树林

Sense.DEF: the pale wood of pine trees, used to make furniture, floors etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pine table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松木桌子

Sense.DEF: to become sad and not continue your life as normal because someone has died or gone away
Sense.TRAN: 〔因某人去世或离开而〕悲伤﹐难过
Sense.EXAMPLE: Six months after he left, she was still pining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开六个月了﹐她还是很悲伤。

Sense.DEF: to become less active, weaker and often ill, especially because you miss someone who has died or gone away
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因思念去世或离开的人而〕萎靡不振﹐憔悴虚弱

Sense.DEF: if you pine for a place or for something, you miss it a lot and wish you could be there or have it again
Sense.EXAMPLE: After two months in France I was pining for home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在法国待了两个月后﹐我盼望着回家。

Sense.DEF: if you pine for someone, you feel very unhappy because they are not with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karen had been pining for her friends back home in Colorado.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦一直都在思念家乡科罗拉多的朋友们。

Sense.DEF: a large yellow-brown tropical fruit or its sweet juicy yellow flesh
Sense.EXAMPLE: pineapple chunks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菠萝块
Sense.EXAMPLE: pineapple juice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菠萝汁

Sense.DEF: a small thin furry animal that lives in forests in Europe

a leaf of the
pine
tree, which is thin and sharp like a needle

a small seed that grows on some
pine
trees and is eaten as food
a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter
a forest of pine trees
the wood from a pine tree
a short high ringing sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The microwave goes ping when the food’s ready.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物煮好以后﹐微波炉会发出叮的一声。

Sense.DEF: to make a short high ringing sound
to send an email to someone, telephone them etc
Sense.TRAN: 给某人发邮件/打电话等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll ping you with confirmation of your booking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会发电子邮件确认您的订单。

Sense.DEF: to send a message to a computer, usually in order to find out if a connection is working
Sense.TRAN: 向计算机发送指令〔以检测网络连接〕

Sense.DEF:
an indoor game played on a table by two people with a small plastic ball and two
bat s
the small round part at one end of a pin
a very small hole in something, especially one made by a pin
to hold or tie someone’s arms or legs very tightly, so that they cannot move freely
Sense.EXAMPLE: My arms were pinioned behind me by the policemen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被警察反剪了双臂。

Sense.DEF: a small wheel, with teeth on its outer edge, that fits into a larger wheel and turns it or is turned by it
pale red

GramExa.EXAMPLE: lipstick
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亮粉色的口红

Sense.EXAMPLE: Hannah’s face went pink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜的脸上泛起了红晕。

Sense.DEF:
relating to people who are
homosexual
a pale red colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her room was decorated in bright pinks and purples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的房间装饰成明亮的粉红色和紫色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had arrived dressed in pink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着粉色的衣服来了。

Sense.DEF: a garden plant with pink, white, or red flowers
in very good health
low-paid jobs done mainly by women, for example in offices and restaurants, or the women who do these jobs
Sense.TRAN: 粉领工作/工人/行业等〔指主要由妇女做的低薪工作﹐如办公室和餐馆工作〕

Sense.DEF:
a pink alcoholic drink made of
gin
and a strong bitter liquid
your smallest finger
a special type of scissors with blades that have V-shaped teeth, used for cutting cloth
Sense.TRAN: 锯齿剪刀﹐齿边布样剪刀

Sense.DEF: slightly pink
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pinkish glow of the fire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 略呈粉红的火焰

Sense.DEF:
an insulting word for a
socialist
or
communist
Sense.TRAN: 赤色分子〔称呼社会主义者或共产主义者的侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who has slightly
left-wing
ideas, but is not a strong believer in
socialism
Sense.TRAN: 准左倾分子﹐略带左倾色彩的人

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 观点偏左的自由主义者

Sense.DEF:
the money that people who are
homosexual
have available to spend
Sense.TRAN: 同性恋者（可供消费）的钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Companies are trying to attract the pink pound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 众多公司正试图吸引同性恋消费。

Sense.DEF: an official document that proves that you own a particular car
a written warning you get when your job is going to end because there is not enough work

a
pinkie
a small amount of extra money which someone earns to spend on things which they want but do not really need
Sense.EXAMPLE: She helped her uncle out sometimes just to earn a bit of pin money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有时候帮叔叔的忙﹐赚一些零用钱。

Sense.DEF: the most successful, powerful, exciting etc part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pinnacle of academic achievement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学术成就的顶峰

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had reached the pinnacle of her political career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经达到政治生涯的顶峰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bank was then at the pinnacle of England’s financial system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时那家银行在英国金融系统中实力最为雄厚。

Sense.DEF: a high mountain top
a pointed stone decoration, like a small tower, on a building such as a church or castle
Sense.TRAN: 〔教堂或城堡等上作装饰用的〕尖顶﹐小尖塔

Sense.DEF:
a
pinafore 2
an American card game
Sense.TRAN: 皮纳克尔纸牌戏〔美国的一种纸牌游戏〕

Sense.DEF: to discover or explain exactly the real facts about something or the cause of a problem
Sense.TRAN: 查明﹐准确地说出﹐描述〔事实真相〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to pinpoint the cause of the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故原因很难查明。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They need to pinpoint exactly what skills are necessary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该准确指出何种技能是必需的。

Sense.DEF: to find or show the exact position of something
Sense.TRAN: 准确地找出〔某物的位置〕﹔为…准确定位
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rescue teams have now pinpointed the location of the ship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援队现在已经找出那艘船的准确位置。

Sense.DEF:
a very small area or
dot
of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tiny pinpoints of light
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 点点亮光

Sense.DEF: very exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The missiles can hit targets with pinpoint accuracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种导弹可以精确击中目标。

Sense.DEF:
a very small area or
dot
of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pinprick of light
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点亮光

Sense.DEF: a very small hole in something, similar to one made by a pin
something that slightly annoys you
Sense.EXAMPLE: These problems were pinpricks compared with what was to come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题和即将到来的事相比只是小烦恼。

Sense.DEF: an uncomfortable feeling, often in your foot or your leg, which you get especially when you have not moved part of your body for a long time, and the supply of blood has stopped flowing properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have to move because I’m starting to get pins and needles in my foot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得动一下﹐因为我的脚开始发麻了。

Sense.DEF: to be very nervous and unable to relax, especially because you are waiting for something important
Sense.TRAN: 如坐针毡﹐坐立不安〔尤因等待重要事情〕

Sense.DEF: one of the thin pale lines that form a pattern on cloth against a darker background
a suit made from cloth with a pinstripe pattern, worn especially by business people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商界人士穿的〕细条纹西装
Sense.EXAMPLE: a navy-blue pinstripe suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套深蓝色细条纹西装

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring an amount of liquid, especially beer or milk. In Britain a pint is equal to 0.568 litres, and in the US it is equal to 0.473 litres.
Sense.TRAN: 品脱〔液量单位﹐尤用于啤酒或牛奶。在英国一品脱合0.568升﹐而在美国一品脱合0.473升〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add two pints of water to the mixture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在混合物中加入两品脱的水。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: half a pint of milk
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 半品脱牛奶
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pint glass a glass which will hold a pint of liquid
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一品脱容量的玻璃杯

Sense.DEF: a pint of beer, especially one that you drink in a bar
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在酒吧喝的〕一品脱啤酒
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s gone down the pub for a quick pint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去小酒馆匆匆喝上一品脱啤酒。

Sense.DEF: a horse with irregular patterns of two or more colours
a small light-brown bean
small – usually used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 微小的〔一般为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pint-sized child star
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小童星

Sense.DEF: a picture of an attractive person, often not wearing many clothes, that is put up on a wall to be looked at and admired
Sense.TRAN: 〔挂在墙上供欣赏的〕半裸美女像﹔美男[美女]海报
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pin-up of her favourite boy band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张她最喜爱的男孩乐队的海报

Sense.DEF: someone who appears in pin-up pictures or who is considered attractive by a particular group of people
Sense.TRAN: 海报中的模特﹔〔部分人眼中的〕美男﹐美女
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s becoming the thinking woman’s pin-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正成为有思想的女性的偶像。

Sense.DEF: a toy consisting of a stick with curved pieces of plastic at the end which turn around when they are blown
someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John Whitney was a pioneer of computer animation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰·惠特尼是电脑动画的先驱。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was a pioneer in the field of biotechnology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是生物技术领域的带头人。

Sense.DEF: one of the first people to travel to a new country or area and begin living there, farming etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

Sense.DEF: to be the first person to do, invent or use something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new cancer treatment was pioneered in the early eighties by Dr Sylvia Bannerjee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新的癌症治疗方法是由西尔维娅·班纳基医生在80年代初期开创的。

Sense.DEF: introducing new and better methods or ideas for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 开创性的﹔先驱的﹔探索性的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pioneering work of NASA scientists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国航空航天局的科学家们的探索性工作
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She played a pioneering role in opening higher education to women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在向妇女开放高等教育方面起了开创作用。

Sense.DEF: having strong religious beliefs, and showing this in the way you behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a quiet, pious man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个文静、虔诚的人。

Sense.DEF: if you describe what someone says as pious talk, words etc, you mean that they are trying to sound good or moral but you do not believe that they are sincere or will really do what they say
Sense.TRAN: 假虔诚的﹐虚伪的﹐伪善的
Sense.EXAMPLE: pious speeches by politicians about ‘family values’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政客们关于所谓“家庭价值观”的虚伪演讲

Sense.DEF: something that you want to be true or to happen, but that is very unlikely
Sense.TRAN: 不大可能实现的希望/愿望
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these agreements and ideas remain little more than pious hopes in the present climate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些协议和想法在目前的环境下都是不可能实现的愿望。

Sense.DEF: a small seed from a fruit such as an apple or orange
Sense.TRAN: 〔苹果﹑柑橘等水果的〕果核﹐种子﹐籽
Sense.EXAMPLE: an apple pip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果籽
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have these oranges got pips in?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些橙子有核吗？

Sense.DEF: a high note that is part of a series of short sounds, used for example on the radio to show the time, or on a public telephone line to show that your money has almost finished
Sense.TRAN: 哔哔声﹔〔电台的〕报时信号﹔〔提示电话里的钱快用完的〕提示音
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pips are going so I’d better say goodbye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 余额不足的提示音响了﹐我得说再见了。

Sense.DEF: one of the stars on the shoulders of the coats of army officers that shows their rank
to beat someone at the last moment in a race, competition etc, when they were expecting to win
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Maclaren team were narrowly pipped at the post by Ferrari.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克拉伦车队在最后一刻被法拉利车队以微弱优势击败。

Sense.DEF: to beat someone in a race, competition etc, by only a small amount
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛﹑竞争等中〕险胜﹐以微弱优势击败

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jackson just pipped him for the gold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊仅以微弱优势击败他获得了金牌。

Sense.DEF: a tube through which a liquid or gas flows
Sense.EXAMPLE: a water pipe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水管
Sense.EXAMPLE: a frozen waste pipe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冻住的污水管
Sense.EXAMPLE: copper pipes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铜管
Sense.EXAMPLE: A pipe had burst in the kitchen and flooded the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房的一根管道爆裂﹐弄得满地都是水。

Sense.DEF: a thing used for smoking tobacco, consisting of a small tube with a container shaped like a bowl at one end
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad was there, smoking his pipe .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸在那里吸着烟斗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: pipe tobacco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟斗丝

Subsense.DEF: a simple musical instrument like a tube, that you play by blowing

one of the metal tubes that air passes through when you play an
organ

Sense.DEF: a hope, idea, plan etc that is impossible or will probably never happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: In many parts of the country, democratic elections are simply a pipe dream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那个国家的很多地区﹐民主选举只是一个幻想。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put/stick that in your pipe and smoke it
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone must accept what you have just said, even though they do not like it
Sense.TRAN: 不管喜欢不喜欢﹐你都得接受我所说的

Sense.DEF: to send a liquid or gas through a pipe to another place
Sense.TRAN: 用管道输送〔液体或气体〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: pipe sth into/from/out of etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eighty per cent of sewage is piped directly into the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 80%的污水被直接排入海中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of oil is piped in from Alaska.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量石油是从阿拉斯加输送来的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: villages with no piped water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有管道供水的乡村

Sense.DEF: to make a musical sound, using a pipe

to decorate food, especially a cake, with lines of
icing
or cream
to speak or sing something in a high voice
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Morning!’ he piped with a cheery voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “早上好！”他声音愉快地高声说道。

Sense.DEF: to stop talking or making a noise, and become calmer and less excited
Sense.TRAN: 停止讲话[吵闹]﹔安静下来
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everybody pipe down. There’s no need to shout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都请安静下来﹐没有必要嚷嚷。

Sense.DEF: to send radio signals or recorded music into a room or building
Sense.TRAN: 传输﹐传送〔无线电信号或录制的音乐到某地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: tunes piped in over an acoustic system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过音响系统传送出来的旋律

Sense.DEF: to suddenly say something, especially when you have been quiet until then
Sense.TRAN: 突然说话〔尤指之前一直很安静〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum suddenly piped up ‘No!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈突然说：“不行！”

Sense.DEF: a length of wire covered with soft material, used to clean the inside of a tobacco pipe
quiet recorded music played continuously in shops, hotels, restaurants etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店﹑旅店﹑餐馆等场所连续播放的〕背景音乐

Sense.DEF: someone who puts in and repairs pipes for water, gas etc
a line of connecting pipes, often under the ground, used for sending gas, oil etc over long distances
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于长距离输送气体﹑石油等的地下〕管道﹐管线

Sense.DEF: if a plan, idea, or event is in the pipeline, it is being prepared and it will happen or be completed soon
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑观点或事件〕在准备中﹔在进行中
Sense.EXAMPLE: More job losses are in the pipeline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将会有更多人被裁。

Sense.DEF:
a
peace pipe

an
organ

someone who plays a
pipe
or the
bagpipes
a thin glass tube for sucking up exact amounts of liquid, used especially in chemistry
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指化学实验用的〕吸量管﹐移液管

Sense.DEF: the pipes that are part of a building, machine, or structure
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑机器等的〕管道﹔管道系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: The houses all have lead pipework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些房屋都有铅质管道系统。

Sense.DEF: a thin tube of cloth, usually with string inside, sewn onto clothing, furniture etc as decoration
several pipes, or a system of pipes, used to send liquid or gas in or out of a building
piping hot liquid or food is very hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: piping hot coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚烫的咖啡

Sense.DEF: a small brown or grey singing bird
Sense.TRAN: 鹨〔一种棕色或灰色的鸣禽〕

Sense.DEF: a small sweet apple
Sense.TRAN: 斑皮苹果〔一种小而甜的苹果〕

Sense.DEF: someone that you think is not worth respecting or paying attention to, especially because they are small or young
having a pleasantly spicy taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piquant wild mushroom sauce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开胃的野蘑菇酱

Sense.DEF: interesting and exciting

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The production retains its original piquancy.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏保留了原作的趣味。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being annoyed or upset, especially because someone has ignored you or insulted you
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因被人忽视或侮辱而〕不悦﹐生气
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stormed out in a fit of pique .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他气呼呼地冲了出去。

Sense.DEF:
a type of material made of cotton, silk, or
rayon
Sense.TRAN: 凹凸织物〔一种用棉纱﹑丝或人造丝制成的织物〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel annoyed or upset, especially by ignoring them or making them look stupid
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指忽视或愚弄某人而〕使生气﹐激怒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Privately, Zarich was piqued that his offer was rejected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提议遭到拒绝﹐扎里克私下里很气愤。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel interested in something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was hostile to him, which piqued his curiosity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他有敌意﹐这激起了他的好奇心。

Sense.DEF: the crime of illegally copying and selling books, tapes, videos, computer programs etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: software piracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软件盗版

Sense.DEF: the crime of attacking and stealing from ships at sea
the crime of making illegal television or radio broadcasts
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或广播节目的〕非法播出

Sense.DEF: a South American fish with sharp teeth that lives in rivers and eats flesh
Sense.TRAN: 锯脂鲤﹐水虎鱼〔南美一种有尖利牙齿的食肉河鱼〕

Sense.DEF: someone who sails on the seas, attacking other boats and stealing things from them
someone who dishonestly copies and sells another person’s work
Sense.TRAN: 盗版者﹐侵犯版权者﹐非法翻印者﹔侵犯专利权者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer game pirates cost the industry twenty million pounds a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑游戏盗版者每年要给该行业带来两千万英镑的损失。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 盗版录像带/光碟/软件等

Sense.DEF: illegal radio or television broadcasts, or the station sending them out
Sense.TRAN: 非法无线电广播[台]/非法电视（台）

Sense.DEF: to illegally copy and sell another person’s work such as a book, video, or computer program
Sense.TRAN: 剽窃﹐盗版﹔非法翻印﹔非法仿制
Sense.EXAMPLE: pirated video tapes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法翻录的录像带

Sense.DEF: a dance movement in which the dancer turns very quickly, standing on one toe or the front part of one foot
Sense.TRAN: 〔舞蹈演员的〕足尖旋转﹐单足旋转

Sense.DEF: relating to fishing or people who go fishing

the 12th sign of the
zodiac
, represented by two fish, which some people believe affects the character and life of people born between February 20 and March
someone who was born between February 20 and March
Sense.TRAN: 20 属双鱼座的人〔即2月20日至3月20日之间出生的人〕

Sense.DEF:
to
urinate
to waste time or effort trying to do something that is impossible
Sense.TRAN: 费时间[精力]做不可能的事

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is raining very heavily
to laugh a lot, especially when you cannot stop laughing
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were all copying my accent and pissing themselves laughing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都在模仿我的口音﹐肚皮都笑破了。

Sense.DEF: to thoroughly defeat a person or a team

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have a pot to piss in
Sense.DEF: to be extremely poor
used to tell someone to go away
to waste time doing stupid things with no purpose or plan
Sense.TRAN: 胡闹﹐浪费时间﹐游手好闲
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop pissing about and get some work done!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再瞎混了﹐干点正事吧！

Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly by not doing what you have promised to do, or by not being honest with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish he’d say yes or no – he’s been pissing me around for weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他能给个明确的答复——他折腾我好几个星期了。

Sense.DEF: to waste something in a very stupid way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was earning quite a lot but I pissed it all away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挣到很多钱﹐但都挥霍掉了。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way she treats me really pisses me off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那样对待我让我非常生气。

Sense.DEF: to go away – used especially to tell someone to go away
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now piss off and leave me alone!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚开﹐别来烦我！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pissed off before we got there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还没到那儿﹐他就已经滚蛋了。

Sense.DEF: used to say no or to refuse to do something

an act of
urinating

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to have a piss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得去撒尿。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone by laughing at them or making them seem stupid
Sense.TRAN: 〔嘲笑或愚弄某人而〕令（某人）生气
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids always take the piss out of some teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们总是拿某些老师寻开心。

Sense.DEF:
to be at a
pub
or club, drinking a lot of alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where’s Jo?’ ‘Out on the piss somewhere.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “乔在哪里？”“在外面某个地方大喝呢。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: be full of piss and vinegar
Sense.DEF: to be full of energy
an offensive word for an annoying person with a weak character
Sense.TRAN: 性格软弱而令人讨厌的人﹐熊包

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone who drinks a lot of alcohol
drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: They rolled in pissed at three in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们凌晨三点摇摇晃晃地进来﹐喝得醉醺醺的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: pissed as a newt/pissed out of your head
GramExa.GLOSS: extremely drunk

Sense.DEF: annoyed, disappointed, or unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: You get really pissed off applying for jobs all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不停地找工作会让人很烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was pissed off with the way some people were behaving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人的行为令我非常反感。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Judy’s pissed at Carol.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱迪烦透了卡罗尔。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a difficult job or activity, or a bad or annoying situation
Sense.TRAN: 难事﹐苦差事﹔糟糕的情况﹐令人讨厌的局面
Sense.EXAMPLE: The real pisser was investing so much time and effort for zero return.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最糟的就是投入那么多时间和精力却一点回报也没有。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone who drinks a lot of alcohol
very bad in quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the local beers were piss-poor imitations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地生产的啤酒都是低劣的仿制品。

Sense.DEF: something you do to make people laugh at someone, especially by copying them in a funny way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The record is a piss-take of people who have a high opinion of themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张唱片嘲讽了那些自以为了不起的人。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: take the piss out of sb/sth

Sense.DEF: an occasion when people drink a lot of alcohol together
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a good piss-up on my birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生日那天我们痛饮了一番。

Sense.DEF: angry or annoyed and treating people badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stacey gets pissy if we tease her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要是拿斯泰茜寻开心﹐她就会生气。

Sense.DEF: small or unimportant and annoying
Sense.TRAN: 微小的﹐琐碎的﹔令人讨厌的

Sense.DEF: a small green nut
Sense.EXAMPLE: pistachio ice cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开心果冰激凌

Sense.DEF:
a snow-covered slope which has been prepared for people to
ski
down
the female part of a flower that produces seeds
a small gun you can use with one hand
to hit someone many times with a pistol
Sense.TRAN: 用手枪柄多次击打 〔某人〕

Sense.DEF: a part of an engine consisting of a short solid piece of metal inside a tube, which moves up and down to make the other parts of the engine move
a circular metal spring used to stop gas or liquid escaping from between a piston and the tube that it moves in

Subsense.DEF: a hole in the ground, especially one made by digging
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The female digs a pit in which to lay the eggs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雌性挖坑产卵。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a five-foot deep pit
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五英尺深的坑

Subsense.DEF: a large hole in the ground from which stones or minerals are obtained by digging

Sense.DEF: a coal mine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad first went down the pit worked in a coal mine when he was 15 years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸第一次下煤矿井时才15岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a national strike against pit closures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议关闭煤矿井的全国性罢工

Sense.DEF: a small hollow mark in the surface of something, especially on your skin as the result of a disease
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物表面的〕微小凹痕﹔〔尤因疾病而在皮肤上产生的〕麻点﹐痘痕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the deep pits left by smallpox
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天花遗留下的深深的痘痕

Sense.DEF: a house or room that is dirty, untidy, or in bad condition
Sense.TRAN: 肮脏的房屋[房间]﹔条件很差的房屋[房间]

Sense.DEF: to be extremely bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company refused to pay - I think it’s the pits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司拒绝付款﹐我认为这太恶劣了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in/at the pit of your stomach
Sense.DEF: if you have a feeling in the pit of your stomach, you have a sick or tight feeling in your stomach, usually because you are nervous or afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a feeling in the pit of my stomach that something terrible was going to happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我内心深处觉得有什么可怕的事就要发生了。

Sense.DEF: the place beside the track in a car race where cars can come in for petrol, new tyres etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛车时设在赛道边的〕维修站

Sense.DEF:
an
orchestra pit
a hole in the floor of a garage that lets you get under a car to repair it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inspection pit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车检修坑

Sense.DEF: a situation which makes you feel very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just thinking about the future plunged her into a pit of despair .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到将来﹐她就陷入了极其绝望的境地。

Sense.DEF: the single large hard seed in some fruits
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peach pit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桃核

Sense.DEF:
an
armpit

the area of a
stock exchange
where people buy and sell shares
to put small marks or holes in the surface of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole street was pitted with potholes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整条街道都坑坑洼洼的。

Sense.DEF: to take out the single hard seed inside some fruits
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peel and pit two avocados.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把两个鳄梨削皮去核。

Sense.DEF: to stop in a car race to get petrol or have your car repaired
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛车中途〕停车加油﹐停车检修

Sense.DEF: to test someone’s strength, ability, power etc in a competition or fight against someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be pitting our team against the champions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们队将和冠军队一争高下。

GramExa.GLOSS: compete against someone using your intelligence or knowledge
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pit your wits against family or friends!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和家人或朋友斗智去吧！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men had to pit themselves against the forces of nature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些男人不得不对抗大自然的力量。

Sense.DEF:
to
sweat
so much that your clothes become wet under your arms

the American spelling of
pitta bread
a small but extremely strong and sometimes violent fighting dog
Sense.TRAN: 斗牛㹴〔一种极其强壮﹑有时凶猛的小型斗犬〕

Sense.DEF: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the world-famous Wembley football pitch
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 闻名世界的温布利足球场

Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran the length of the pitch and scored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跑过全场﹐得分了。

GramExa.GLOSS: playing a sport
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack was on the pitch for his school in the Senior Cup Final.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克代表学校参加了高级杯决赛。

Sense.DEF: a strong level of feeling about something or a high level of an activity or a quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: The controversy reached such a pitch become so strong that the paper devoted a whole page to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争论非常激烈﹐故而报纸用了整版来报道。

GramExa.GLOSS: a high level of excitement etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 非常激动/极为优秀/十全十美等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He screamed at her in a pitch of fury.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生气极了﹐对着她大喊大叫。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The goal roused the crowd to fever pitch a very excited level .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个进球让观众激动万分。

Subsense.DEF: how high or low a note or other sound is
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ultrasonic waves are at a higher pitch than the human ear can hear.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超声波的音高超出了人耳可以听见的范围。

Subsense.DEF: the ability of a musician to play or sing a note at exactly the correct level
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s got perfect pitch .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有绝对音感。

Sense.DEF: the things someone says to persuade people to buy something, do something, or accept an idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: an aggressive salesman with a fast-talking sales pitch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推销时说话像连珠炮一般咄咄逼人的推销员

GramExa.GLOSS: try to persuade people to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made his strongest pitch yet for standardized testing in schools.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前所未有的力度鼓吹学校应推行标准化考试。

Sense.DEF: a throw of the ball, or a way in which it can be thrown
Sense.EXAMPLE: His first pitch was high and wide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第一投又高又偏。

Sense.DEF: a black, sticky substance that is used on roofs, the bottoms of ships etc to stop water coming through
Sense.EXAMPLE: The night was as black as pitch very dark .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜晚一片漆黑。

Sense.DEF: an up and down movement of a ship or an aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pitch and roll of the ship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船只的颠簸

Sense.DEF: the degree to which a roof slopes or the sloping part of a roof
Sense.TRAN: 〔屋顶的〕斜度﹐坡度﹔屋顶的倾斜处
Sense.EXAMPLE: the steep pitch of the roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡斜的房顶

Sense.DEF: a place in a public area where someone goes to sell things or where an entertainer goes to sell things or perform
Sense.TRAN: 〔街道小商贩的〕摆摊处﹔〔街头艺人的〕表演场地
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found the boy at his usual pitch at the bottom of the Acropolis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在那个男孩的老地方——雅典卫城的底下——找到了他。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: queer sb’s pitch/queer the pitch for sb

Sense.DEF: to throw something with a lot of force, often aiming carefully
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常仔细瞄准后〕用力投[扔﹐抛﹐掷]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She crumpled up the page and pitched it into the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把那页纸揉成团﹐扔进了火里。

Subsense.DEF: to aim and throw a ball in baseball

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stanton pitched to two batters in the ninth inning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦顿在第九局投球给两个击球员。

Subsense.DEF:
if a ball pitches in
cricket
or golf, it hits the ground
to hit the ball in a high curve in golf

to make the ball hit the ground when you are
bowl ing
in
cricket
Subsense.TRAN: 〔板球中投球手〕使球击地[触地]

Sense.DEF: to fall or be moved suddenly in a particular direction, or to make someone or something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She slipped and pitched forward onto the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脚下一滑﹐重重栽倒在地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Without a seat belt, you can easily be pitched right through the windscreen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不系安全带的话﹐很可能会撞破挡风玻璃摔出去。

Sense.DEF: if a ship or an aircraft pitches, it moves up and down in an uncontrolled way with the movement of the water or air

Subsense.DEF: to set a speech, examination, explanation etc at a particular level of difficulty
Subsense.TRAN: 把〔演说﹑考试﹑解释等〕定于〔某一特定难度〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: pitch sth at a high level/the right level etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The projects were pitched at a number of different levels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些方案被定为几个不同的层次。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Some questions were pitched too high for intermediate students.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些题目对于中级水平的学生来说出得太难了。

Subsense.DEF: to set prices at a particular level

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Room rates are pitched at £69 for a single.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 单人房的房价定为69英镑。

Sense.DEF: to aim a product at a particular type of organization, group of people etc, or to describe it in a particular way, in order to sell it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new machine will be pitched at users in the hotel and air reservation business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新机器将以酒店及机票预订行业的用户为目标消费群体。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is pitched as a cheaper alternative to other workstations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它被定为可替代其他工作站的一个造价更为低廉的选择。

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade someone to do business with you, buy something etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Booksellers are keen to pitch for school business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书商热衷于去学校推销。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For many companies, pitching to investors has become almost a full-time job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于许多公司来说﹐向投资者推销几乎已经成为工作的全部内容了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: sales reps pitching new gadgets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推销新玩意的销售代表

Sense.DEF: if you pitch your voice or another sound at a particular level, the sound is produced at that level

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her voice is pitched a little too high.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嗓音有点太高了。

Sense.DEF: to set up a tent or a camp for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try and pitch your tent on level ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试试在平地上搭帐篷。

Sense.DEF: to slope down

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The roof pitches sharply to the rear of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶向房子后部大幅度倾斜。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone a story or give them an excuse that is difficult to believe
Sense.TRAN: 给某人编造荒诞无稽的故事[令人难以相信的借口]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pitched me some line about a bomb scare on the metro.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跟我胡诌﹐说什么地铁里发生了炸弹恐吓事件。

Sense.DEF: to join others and help with an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we all pitch in, we’ll have it finished in no time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家一起帮忙的话﹐很快就可以完成。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone pitched in with efforts to entertain the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有人都来想方设法逗孩子们开心。

Sense.DEF: to join others and pay part of the money towards something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They all pitched in and the money was collected within a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都出了钱﹐几天内就筹集到了这笔钱。

Sense.DEF: to start to eat hungrily
Sense.TRAN: 开始狼吞虎咽﹐开始大吃特吃
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pitch in – there’s plenty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放开肚子吃吧——多着呢。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start criticizing someone or hitting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pitched into me as soon as I started to speak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚一开始讲话﹐她就劈头盖脸地批评起我来。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something, especially quickly and eagerly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rick pitched into decorating the house at once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克立即动手装修房屋。

Sense.DEF: to arrive somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait a bit longer – Bill hasn’t pitched up yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再等一等﹐比尔还没到呢。

Sense.DEF: a game of golf played on a very small course
completely black or dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lights were off and it was pitch-black.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯灭了﹐一片漆黑。

Sense.DEF:
a dark shiny substance dug from the earth, from which
uranium
and
radium
are obtained
completely dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside it was pitch-dark and pouring with rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面漆黑一片﹐大雨如注。

Sense.DEF: a pitched roof is sloping rather than flat
a big battle between armies or large groups of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pitched battle between the rival groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌对方之间的阵地战

Sense.DEF: an angry and usually long argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to avoid another pitched battle with her son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想避免和儿子再次激烈争论。

Sense.DEF: the player in baseball who throws the ball
a container for holding and pouring a liquid, with a handle and a shaped part to help the liquid flow out
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pitcher of water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一罐水

Sense.DEF: a large clay container with two handles, used in the past for holding and pouring a liquid

a farm tool with a long handle and two long curved metal points, used especially for lifting
hay dried grass
to put someone suddenly into a situation for which they are not properly prepared

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was pitchforked into power by the early death of her husband James V.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丈夫詹姆士五世的早逝将她推上权位。

Sense.DEF:
a ball in baseball that the
pitcher
deliberately throws too far to the side for it to be hit

a type of
pine
tree that grows in North America, or the wood from this tree
expressing suffering and sadness in a way that makes you feel pity
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a long piteous cry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发出了一声长长的哀号。

Sense.DEF: a problem or difficulty that is likely to happen in a particular job, course of action, or activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔可能出现的〕问题﹐困难﹔隐患﹔陷阱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave me advice on how to avoid the pitfalls of the legal process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给了我一些建议﹐教我如何避免诉讼过程中的隐患。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the pitfalls associated with the purchase of a used car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买旧车时可能遇到的圈套

Sense.DEF: a white substance just under the outside skin of oranges and similar fruit
Sense.TRAN: 中果皮﹐衬皮〔橙等水果表皮下的白皮〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peel the oranges with a sharp knife to remove all pith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用锋利的刀削去这些橘子的表皮和所有衬皮。

Sense.DEF: a soft white substance that fills the stems of some plants
the entrance to a coal mine and the buildings around it
a large light hat worn especially in the past in hot countries, to protect your head from the sun
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指旧时在热带地区戴的〕遮阳帽

Sense.DEF: if something that is said or written is pithy, it is intelligent and strongly stated, without wasting any words
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press releases must be short and pithy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻稿务必言简意赅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of pithy quotations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列精练引述

Sense.DEF: making you feel pity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pitiable victims of war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的战争受害者

Sense.DEF: someone who is pitiful looks or sounds so sad and unfortunate that you feel very sorry for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The refugees were a pitiful sight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民们看上去真可怜。

Sense.DEF: a pitiful amount is very small
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fee was pitiful – only about £60.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费用相当少——只有60英镑左右。

Sense.DEF: very bad in quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: His performance was pitiful – five goals flew past him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的表现很差劲﹐丢了五个球。

Sense.DEF: showing no pity and not caring if people suffer
Sense.TRAN: 没有怜悯心的﹐冷酷的﹐无情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pitiless tyrant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷酷无情的暴君
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pitiless bombing of Guernica
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对格尔尼卡镇的残酷轰炸

Sense.DEF: pitiless wind, rain, or sun is very severe and shows no sign of changing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a night of pitiless rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一夜苦雨

Sense.DEF:
a piece of metal used in
rock climbing
that you attach onto a rock to hold the rope
a small horse that was used in the past for moving coal in a mine in Britain

a time when a driver in a car race stops in the
pit s
to get more petrol or have repairs done
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛车在比赛中加油或维修的〕进站时间

Sense.DEF: to stop when driving on a long journey, for food, petrol, or to go to the toilet
Sense.TRAN: 〔长途旅程中用餐﹑加油﹑上厕所等的〕中途停车

Sense.DEF: a type of bread which is flat and hollow. It can be cut open and filled with food.
Sense.TRAN: 〔扁平且中空的〕填馅面包﹐口袋面包

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of money, especially wages, that is less than someone needs or deserves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The musicians earn a pittance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些乐师收入微薄。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crop was sold for a pittance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些庄稼只卖得一小笔钱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She raised three children on a pittance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她靠微薄的收入抚养三个孩子。

Sense.DEF: covered with small marks or holes on the surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔表面〕有麻点的﹐有凹陷的﹐有坑洼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a red-faced man with pitted cheeks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脸上有麻点的红脸膛男人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The desert roads are pitted with potholes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠中的路坑坑洼洼。

Sense.DEF: a pitted fruit has had the single hard seed removed from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: pitted olives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去核橄榄

Sense.DEF: with quick light beats or steps
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anna’s heart went pitter-patter as she opened the letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜打开信时心怦怦直跳。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the pitter-patter of small feet running up the stairs
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 小脚丫奔上楼梯的噼啪声

Sense.DEF:
the small organ at the base of your brain which produces
hormone s
that control the growth and development of your body
used to show that you are disappointed about something and you wish things could happen differently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a pity that he didn’t accept the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有接受那份工作真可惜。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a great pity Joyce wasn’t invited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔伊斯没有受到邀请太遗憾了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like Charlie. Pity he had to marry that awful woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢查利﹐遗憾的是他得和那个糟糕的女人结婚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A pity we can’t find the guy who did it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真遗憾我们找不到那个干了这件事的家伙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you married?’ ‘No.’ ‘What a pity.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你结婚了吗？”“没有。”“真遗憾。”

GramExa.PROPFORM: it’s a pity to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be a pity to give up now – you’ve nearly finished.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在放弃太可惜﹐你差不多就要完成了。

Sense.DEF: sympathy for a person or animal who is suffering or unhappy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He looked exhausted, but Marie felt no pity for him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去疲惫不堪﹐但玛丽一点也不同情他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I listened to Jason’s story with pity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我同情地听贾森讲述他的故事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hated the thought of being an object of pity someone who other people feel sorry for .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢被人怜悯。

GramExa.GLOSS: feel sorry for someone and treat them with sympathy
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sounded so upset that Leah started to take pity on him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听上去非常难过﹐利娅开始同情他了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are very annoyed and impatient
Sense.TRAN: 请发发慈悲吧﹐请可怜可怜吧〔用于表示非常烦恼和不耐烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: For pity’s sake just shut up and let me drive!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请发发慈悲﹐闭上嘴让我开车吧！

Sense.DEF: used after describing a situation, to show that you wish it was not true
Sense.TRAN: 太不幸了﹐太可惜了〔用于描述某个情况之后﹐希望那不是真的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue’s not coming, more’s the pity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休不来了﹐太可惜了。

Sense.DEF: to feel sorry for someone because they are in a very bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I pity anyone who has to feed a family on such a low income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我同情那些得依靠如此微薄的收入养活全家的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam pitied his grandmother there alone, never going out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆很同情独自生活﹑从不出门的祖母。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pity the poor teachers who have to deal with these kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同情一下那几位可怜的老师吧﹐他们不得不和这些孩子打交道。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that they feelsorry for
someone rather than pity them.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 feel sorry for someone,而不说 pity
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I feel sorry for his wife.

Sense.DEF: a look or smile that shows you feel pity for someone
Sense.TRAN: 怜悯[同情]的眼神/微笑/一瞥
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellen gave me a pitying look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦同情地看了我一眼。

Sense.DEF: a central point or pin on which something balances or turns
the most important thing in a situation, system etc, which other things depend on or are based on

GramExa.PROPFORM: the pivot on/around which sth turns/revolves
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Iago’s lie is the pivot on which the play turns.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧情围绕着雅各的谎言展开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: West Africa was the pivot of the chocolate trade.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西非是巧克力贸易的中心。

Sense.DEF: to turn or balance on a central point, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The table-top pivots on two metal pins.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个桌面以两个金属钉为枢轴旋转。

Sense.DEF: to turn quickly on your feet so that you face in the opposite direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Magee pivoted and threw the ball to first base.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马吉转身把球投到了一垒。

Sense.DEF: to depend on or be based on one important thing, event, or idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: His argument will pivot on the growing cost of legal fees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的论点将以律师费用上涨为中心展开。

Sense.DEF: more important than anything else in a situation, system etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Bank of England has a pivotal role in the London money market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰银行在伦敦货币市场中起着关键性的作用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The talks are pivotal to the success of the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些会谈是该国兴衰的关键。

Sense.DEF: pictures or photographs
the smallest unit of an image on a computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 像素〔计算机屏幕上图像最小的单元〕

Sense.DEF: consisting of pixels, especially large pixels that produce an unclear image
Sense.TRAN: 像素化的﹔〔尤指〕图像模糊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: pixelated photographs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图像模糊的照片

Sense.DEF: an imaginary creature that looks like a very small human being, has magical powers, and likes to play tricks on people
Sense.TRAN: 小妖精﹐小精灵〔一种虚构的生物﹐身材矮小﹑有法术且喜爱捉弄人〕

Sense.DEF: a food made of thin flat round bread, baked with tomato, cheese, and sometimes vegetables or meat on top
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slice of pizza
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片比萨

Sense.DEF: a restaurant that serves pizza
Sense.TRAN: 比萨饼餐厅﹐意大利薄饼店

Sense.DEF: something that has pizzazz is exciting and has a strong interesting style
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their new album has plenty of pizzazz.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的新专辑充满了活力。

Sense.DEF: a restaurant that serves pizza
Sense.TRAN: 比萨饼餐厅﹐意大利薄饼店

Sense.DEF: musical notes played by pulling on the strings of an instrument

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=pyjamas﹝一套﹞睡衣裤
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=park公园
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=package包裹
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=packet小包﹔﹝扁平﹞小包裹
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=plural复数
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=Place, used in addresses 街﹐广场〔用于地址〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: 3 Palmerston Pl., Edinburgh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱丁堡帕默斯顿街3号

Sense.DEF: a large notice or advertisement on a piece of card, which is put up or carried in a public place
Sense.TRAN: 广告﹔广告牌﹔布告﹔标语牌﹔招贴
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge placard saying ‘Welcome to Derbyville’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印有“欢迎来到德比维尔”的巨幅标语牌

Sense.DEF: to make someone stop feeling angry
Sense.TRAN: 使息怒﹐使平静﹔安抚﹐抚慰
Sense.EXAMPLE: These changes did little to placate the unions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些变革对于工会没有起到多少安抚作用。

Sense.DEF: a space or area, for example a particular point on a surface or in a room, building, town, city etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you keep the key in a safe place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要把钥匙放在安全的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve spent the day dashing about from place to place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这一天尽是在东奔西跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The place was full of screaming children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那地方全是大叫大嚷的孩子们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was threatening to burn the place down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扬言要把那地方烧毁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had never been back to the place where the accident happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她再也没回过事故发生的地点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The theatre bar was our usual meeting place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个剧院酒吧是我们见面的老地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were living then in a place called Alberiga.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候我们住在一个叫阿尔伯里格的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wall was quite damp in places in some places .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上有几处很潮湿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is a great place for a holiday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个度假的好地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t find a place to park.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到一个停车的地方。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Did the accident happen at your place of work the place where you work ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故是在你的工作地点发生的吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Great Mosque has been a place of worship for Muslims for centuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多世纪以来大清真寺是穆斯林朝拜的地方。

Sense.DEF: a house or apartment where someone lives
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve got quite a big place on the outskirts of Leeds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在利兹郊外有一座大房子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you want to come back to my place for coffee?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想回我家喝咖啡吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: It took us ages to find a place to live .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们花了好长时间才找到一个住处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s staying with us until he can find a place of his own .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在找到自己的住处以前一直和我们同住。

Sense.DEF: to happen, especially after being planned or arranged
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过计划或安排后〕发生﹐进行
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next meeting will take place on Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下次会议将在星期四举行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talks between the two sides are still taking place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方的会谈仍在进行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Major changes are taking place in society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会正发生着重大变革。

Sense.SIGNPOST: SPACE TO SIT OR PUT STH
Sense.DEF: a space where someone can sit, or a space where you can put something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I might arrive a bit late, so could you save me a place?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可能会晚来一会儿﹐你能给我留个位置吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are still a few places left on the coach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长途公共汽车上还有几个空位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you put everything back in its proper place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 务必把每样东西都放回原位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you find a good place for this vase?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能找个好位置放这个花瓶吗？

Sense.DEF: a point that you have reached in a book or a speech
Sense.EXAMPLE: This would be a good place to stop and answer any questions that people have.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲到这里可以稍停一下﹐回答听众的提问。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I used a bookmark so that I wouldn’t lose my place forget the point that I had reached .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用了书签﹐这样就不会忘记看到哪里了。

Sense.DEF: if someone has a place somewhere, they have the opportunity to go there or join in an activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you don’t come to training you might lose your place in the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不来参加训练﹐就有可能失去球队中的位置。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been trying to find her a place in a residential home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直在努力让她进养老院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was offered a place on the management committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人给他提供了一个在管理委员会工作的机会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are still a couple of places left on the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程还有一些剩余的名额。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been offered a place at York University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已被约克大学录取。

Sense.DEF:
the
role
or important position that someone or something has in a situation or in society

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the old idea that a woman’s place is in the home
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女就该在家待着的老观念

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He finally reached the summit of Qomolangma and secured his place in history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于登上了珠穆朗玛峰﹐因而青史留名。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Working has a very important place in all our lives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作在我们的生命中占据重要位置。

Subsense.DEF: in the correct position
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The chairs for the concert were nearly all in place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会要用的椅子差不多都摆好了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The glass was held in place by a few pieces of sellotape.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃用几段透明胶带固定住了。

Subsense.DEF: existing and ready to be used
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Funding arrangements are already in place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资金安排已经到位。

Sense.DEF: instead of someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: In place of our advertised programme, we will have live coverage of the special memorial service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将对这次特别纪念仪式进行现场报道﹐原本预告要播出的节目则被取消。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company flag had been taken down and in its place hung the Union Jack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司旗帜已被撤下﹐取而代之的是英国国旗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I refused to go, they would send someone else in my place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我不去﹐他们会派其他人代替。

Sense.DEF: to exist or be used instead of someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Natural methods of pest control are now taking the place of chemicals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正以自然方法取代化学品来控制虫害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to find someone to take Jenny’s place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须找个人来替珍妮。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about what you would do if you were in someone else’s situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: What would you do in my place?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是处于我的境地会怎么做？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to put yourself in my place and think how you would feel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试试站在我的位置上﹐想想你会有什么感觉。

Sense.DEF: to be a completely unsuitable place for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is no place for a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可不是小孩该来的地方。

Sense.DEF: first, second etc position in a race or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took second place in the long jump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在跳远比赛中获得了第二名。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I finished in third place .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得了第三名。

Subsense.DEF: used to introduce a series of points in an argument, discussion etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In the first place, I’m too busy, and in the second I don’t really want to go.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐我太忙﹔其次﹐我也不太想去。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about what someone did or should have done at the start of a situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I wish I’d never got involved in the first place!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真希望我从一开始就没卷进去！

Sense.DEF: to be less important than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 处于（次于某人/某事物的）次要地位
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t prepared to take second place in his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不愿意在他的生活中扮演次要角色。

Sense.DEF: used to tell people to go to the correct place or position that they need to be in for an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you would like to take your places, the food will be served shortly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请大家入席﹐菜很快就上。

Subsense.DEF: everywhere
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There was blood all over the place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到处是血。

Subsense.DEF: in a very untidy state
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She came in with her hair all over the place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她进来了﹐头发乱糟糟的。

Sense.DEF: to show someone that they are not as clever or important as they think they are
Sense.TRAN: 使某人明白自己的地位﹔杀某人的气焰
Sense.EXAMPLE: I soon put him in his place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快就杀掉了他的气焰。

Subsense.DEF: not suitable for a particular situation or occasion
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He never seemed to feel out of place at social functions.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社交聚会时他似乎从不觉得自己格格不入。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The paintings looked strangely out of place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些画看上去古里古怪的﹐显得很不协调。

Subsense.DEF: not in the correct or usual position
Subsense.TRAN: 不在适当[通常]的位置上
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The kitchen was spotlessly clean, with nothing out of place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房一尘不染﹐井井有条。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it is not sb’s place (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: if it is not your place to do something, you do not have the duty or right to do it
Sense.TRAN: 某人没有责任[无权]（做某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not your place to criticize me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮不到你来教训我！

Sense.DEF: to be completely unacceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Racial discrimination has no place in a modern society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代社会不容有种族歧视。

Subsense.DEF: if things fall into place in your mind, you suddenly realize and understand what is really happening
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Things were beginning to fall into place in my mind.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情开始在我脑海中清晰起来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Everything suddenly fell into place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切突然豁然开朗。

Subsense.DEF: if plans or events fall into place, they start to happen in the way that you hoped they would
Subsense.TRAN: 〔计划或事件〕按所希望的方式发生﹐上轨道
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Eventually I got a job, and my life began to fall into place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我得到了一份工作﹐生活开始步入正轨。

Sense.DEF: to start becoming successful in your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: William is a young man who is definitely going places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉绝对是个前途无量的年轻人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in a good/bad etc place
Sense.DEF: to be in a good, bad etc situation

Exponent.DEF: a point or area, especially one that you visit or use for a particular purpose
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s been to lots of places.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到过许多地方。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a good meeting place
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 碰头的好地方

Exponent.DEF: the exact place where someone or something is, in relation to other things
Exponent.TRAN: 〔与周围事物相对的〕位置,方位
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She showed me the position of the village on the map.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指给我看地图上那座村庄的位置。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I changed the position of the mirror slightly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我稍稍移动了镜子的位置。

Exponent.DEF: a particular place on a line or surface
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At this point the path gets narrower.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路在这里开始变窄了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: No cars are allowed beyond this point.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何汽车不许越过这个位置。

Exponent.DEF: a place, especially a particular kind of place, or a place where something happens. Spot sounds rather informal.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔特定类型或某事发生的〕地点,场所〔听起来相当不正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She chose a sunny spot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她选了个阳光充沛的地方。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The area is a favourite spot for windsurfers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地区是进行帆板运动的理想场所。

Exponent.DEF: a place where someone or something is, or where something happens. Location sounds more formal than place .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某人、某物所在或某事发生的〕地方,地点,位置〔比place正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: your exact location
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的确切位置
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The prisoners were taken to an undisclosed location.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 俘虏被带到一处秘密地点。

Exponent.DEF: a place, especially one that will be used for a particular purpose, or where something important happened
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指用于某一目的或重要事情发生的〕地点,位置
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the site of a great battle
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场伟大战役的发生地
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are plans to develop the site for housing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 已有计划开发该地块建造住宅。

Exponent.DEF: a place where something such as a meeting, concert, game etc takes place
Exponent.TRAN: 〔会议﹑音乐会﹑比赛等的〕地点,场所
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the venue for the next Olympic Games
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一届奥运会的赛场
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel is a popular wedding venue.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店是广受欢迎的婚礼场所。

Exponent.DEF: the place where something bad such as an accident or crime happened
Exponent.TRAN: 〔事故﹑罪案等不良事件发生的〕现场,地点
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the scene of the crime
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪现场
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ambulance crews were at the scene within minutes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几分钟之后救护人员便赶到了现场。

Exponent.DEF: the place and the area around it, where something is or where something happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel is in a beautiful setting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店环境很不错。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the setting for the film ‘A Room With a View’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影《看得见风景的房间》的背景

Exponent.DEF: the place where someone or something is – used especially when you do not know this or do not want to tell people
Exponent.TRAN: 所在地〔尤用于不知道该地方或不想告诉别人时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The whereabouts of the painting is unknown.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画下落不明。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He refused to disclose his whereabouts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝透露自己的行踪。

Sense.DEF: to put something somewhere, especially with care
Sense.EXAMPLE: She poured the doctor a cup of tea and placed it on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给医生倒了杯茶﹐放在桌上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He carefully placed the folder back in his desk drawer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心地把文件夹放回书桌抽屉里。

Sense.DEF: to put someone or something in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is being placed under pressure to give financial help to farmers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府正面对为农民提供经济援助的压力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children must not be placed at risk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝对不能让孩子们处于危险之地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some areas of the city have been placed under curfew.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市的一些区域已经实行宵禁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This places me in a very difficult position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这让我很为难。

Sense.DEF: to find a suitable job or home for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some unemployed people can be very difficult to place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些失业人员很难安置。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was later placed with a foster family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来他被安置在一户寄养家庭里。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for something to be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: He placed an advertisement in the local paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在当地报纸上登了一则广告。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can place orders by telephone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您可以通过电话订购。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had no idea which horse I should place a bet on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道该把赌注下在哪匹马上。

Sense.DEF: to say how good or important you think someone or something is
Sense.TRAN: 评价﹐判断〔好坏或重要性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would place health quite high on my list of priorities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会非常重视健康。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some museums seem to place profit above education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些博物馆似乎置赢利目的于教育目的之上。

Sense.DEF: to decide that something is important
Sense.TRAN: 看重/重视/注重等某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people place too much value on money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人太看重金钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company places a lot of emphasis on training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司很注重培训。

Sense.DEF: to recognize someone, but be unable to remember where you have met them before
Sense.TRAN: 想不起来与某人在哪里见过
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve seen her somewhere before, but I can’t quite place her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前在哪里见过她﹐不过我想不起来了。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a good situation where you have the ability or opportunity to do something

GramExa.PROPFORM: be well/ideally placed to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is now well placed to compete in Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司目前完全有优势在欧洲参与竞争。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a good place or position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel is well placed for most of London’s theatres.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家宾馆地理位置优越﹐去伦敦大多数剧院都很便利。

Sense.DEF: to be first, second etc in a race or competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔在赛跑或竞赛中〕得第一/第二名等

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Place is slightly formal in most of its meanings. In everyday English, people usually use put instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: 大多数情况下,place 的词义都较为正式。在日常英语中,人们一般用 put
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She put the cup on the table.
Innocent people were put at risk.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 无辜的民众被置于危险之中。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They put an ad in the paper.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在报上登了一则广告。

Sense.DEF: a harmless substance given to a sick person instead of medicine, without telling them it is not real. Placebos are often used in tests in which some people take real medicine and others take a placebo, so that doctors can compare the results to see if the real medicine works properly.
Sense.TRAN: 安慰剂﹔无效对照剂〔无害物质﹐无药理成分﹐病人在不知情的情况下服用﹐常用于测试新药〕

Sense.DEF: when someone feels better after taking a placebo, even though it has not had any effect on their body
a small card with someone’s name on it, which is put on a table to show where they are going to sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔放在桌子上﹑写明名字的〕座位卡[牌]

Sense.DEF:
in
rugby
or
american football
, an occasion when the ball is kicked after it has been placed or held on the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式或美式橄榄球中的〕定踢

Sense.DEF: a board or piece of cloth that you put on a table for each person who is eating there, so that the table is protected from the plates, knives etc
the act of finding a place for someone to live or work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The centre provides a job placement service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该中心提供就业安排服务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the placement of children in foster homes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将儿童安置到寄养家庭

Sense.EXAMPLE: They lived on campus, but this was just a temporary placement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住校﹐不过这只是临时安排。

Sense.DEF: a job, usually as part of a course of study, which gives you experience of a particular type of work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students are sent out on placement for training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们被派出去实习。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a forty-five day placement in a factory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为期45天的工厂实习

Sense.DEF: when something is placed somewhere or when you decide where something should go

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the placement of fire hydrants along the city’s streets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿城市街道设置消防栓

Sense.DEF: the name of a particular place, such as a town, mountain etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the place names are Scottish in origin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多地名源于苏格兰语。

Sense.DEF:
an organ that forms inside a woman’s
uterus
to feed an unborn baby
an arrangement on a table of knives, forks, glasses etc to be used by one person
a placid person does not often get angry or upset and does not usually mind doing what other people want them to
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large, placid baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个胖胖的﹑安静的婴儿
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat still, placid and waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她安安静静坐着等候。

Sense.DEF: calm and peaceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake was placid and still under the moonlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月光下﹐湖面水平如镜。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Dobbs stood at the entrance, placidly smoking his pipe.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 多布斯站在入口处﹐静静地抽着烟斗。

Sense.DEF: the position of someone or something in a competition or ordered list
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hancock and Smith took the top two placings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉考克和史密斯排名前两位。

Sense.DEF: when someone uses another person’s words, ideas, or work and pretends they are their own
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journal accused the professor of plagiarism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那份刊物指控该教授剽窃。

Sense.DEF: an idea, phrase, or story that has been copied from another person’s work, without stating where it came from
Sense.EXAMPLE: claims that there are plagiarisms in the new software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 声称新软件有剽窃之处

Sense.DEF: to take words or ideas from another person’s work and use them in your work, without stating that they are not your own
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused other scientists of plagiarizing his research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指控其他科学家剽窃他的研究成果。

Sense.DEF: a disease that causes death and spreads quickly to a large number of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: drops in population levels due to plagues and famines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘟疫和饥荒造成的人口水平下降

Sense.DEF:
a very infectious disease that produces high fever and swollen places on the body, and often leads to death, especially
bubonic plague
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plague caused 100,000 deaths in London alone in the 1600s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17 世纪﹐鼠疫仅在伦敦一地就造成了10万人死亡。

Sense.DEF: an uncontrolled and harmful increase in the numbers of a particular animal or insect
Sense.EXAMPLE: A plague of squirrels is threatening our forests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松鼠灾害正在威胁我们的森林。

Sense.DEF: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was plagued by eye troubles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他饱受眼疾困扰。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone, especially by asking for something many times or asking them many questions
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过不断索要或提问来〕使烦恼[生气]﹐打搅

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids have been plaguing me with questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们一直缠着我问问题。

Sense.DEF: a flat sea fish that is eaten
a pattern of crossed lines and squares, used especially on cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plaid shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格子衬衫

Sense.DEF:
a piece of plaid cloth worn over the shoulder and across the chest by people from Scotland as part of their
national costume
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为苏格兰民族服装一部分的〕彩格呢披肩

Sense.DEF: very clear, and easy to understand or recognize
Sense.TRAN: 清楚的﹐明白的﹐显而易见的﹐明显的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was plain that Giles was not going to agree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然贾尔斯是不会同意的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The advantages were plain to see.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优势显而易见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have made your feelings plain enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经明确表示了你的感受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me make it plain state it clearly . We do not want you here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我明说吧﹐我们不想你待在这儿。

GramExa.GLOSS: make what you are saying clear
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 把自己的话说得很明白
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you do that again you will be severely punished. Do I make myself plain?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果再那么干﹐你就会受到严厉惩罚﹐我说清楚了吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: as plain as day/the nose on your face
GramExa.GLOSS: very clear
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 极为明显的﹐非常清楚的

Sense.DEF: in clear and simple words, without using technical language
Sense.EXAMPLE: The document, written in plain English, tells you about your new policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份文件用简明的英语写成﹐解释了你们的新政策。

Sense.DEF: without anything added or without decoration
Sense.TRAN: 无装饰的﹐简单的﹐朴素的﹐单纯的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plain white blouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件朴素的白衬衫
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plain wooden table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张朴素的木桌
Sense.EXAMPLE: plain yoghurt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原味酸奶
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plain gold wedding ring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚式样简单的黄金婚戒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your essay should be written on plain paper paper with no lines on it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的文章应该写在无格白纸上。

Sense.DEF: showing clearly and honestly what is true or what you think about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s have some plain, truthful answers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们听听坦率而真实的回答吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know, and that’s the plain truth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道﹐真的不知道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plain fact is people still buy books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实很明显﹐人们还在购买书籍。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a particular type of behaviour, attitude etc is involved, usually a bad one
Sense.TRAN: 完全的﹐十足的〔一般用于强调不好的行为或态度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His motive was plain greed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的动机纯粹是贪婪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you told him his house was too cold that was just plain bad manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你跟他说他的屋子里太冷﹐这很不礼貌。

Sense.DEF: not beautiful or attractive – often used because you want to avoid saying this directly
Sense.TRAN: 不好看的﹐不漂亮的﹐相貌平平的〔委婉说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Cookson was a rather plain woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 库克森夫人是个相貌平平的女人。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to talk about a woman who is not beautiful
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 没有姿色的女人﹐外表平凡的女子

Sense.DEF: police officers in plain clothes are not wearing uniform
used to show that someone does not have or use a special title
Sense.TRAN: （仅仅是）不带头衔[称号]的先生/夫人等〔用来表示某人没有或不使用特殊头衔等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t call him Uncle – just plain Bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不叫他叔叔﹐就叫他比尔。

Sense.DEF: to be very easy to do or achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you can answer the first question, the rest of the test should be plain sailing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能答出测验的第一题﹐其余的题目就都是小菜一碟了。

Sense.DEF: if something is in plain sight, it is easy to see or notice, especially when it should be hidden
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t leave your valuables in plain sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要把你的贵重物品放在显眼的地方。

Sense.DEF: a large area of flat dry land
Sense.EXAMPLE: The grassy plain gave way to an extensive swamp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青草覆盖的平原被广阔的沼泽地所取代。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the vast plains of central China
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华中地区的广阔平原

Sense.DEF:
