the ordinary stitch in
knitting
used to emphasize an adjective, usually one referring to a bad quality
Sense.TRAN: 简直﹔完全〔用于强调﹐一般指不好的素质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just plain crazy to spend all your pay as soon as you get it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薪水一拿到手就花光﹐你简直是疯了。

Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时教堂中齐唱而无伴奏的〕素歌﹐单旋律圣歌

Sense.DEF: chocolate made without milk and with very little sugar
plain-clothes police are police who wear ordinary clothes so that they can work without being recognized

flour that contains no
baking powder
in a way that is easy to understand or recognize
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Gorman was plainly delighted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈尔曼夫人喜形于色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first part of that argument is plainly true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 论证的第一部分显然是成立的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could hear Tom’s voice plainly over the noise of the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在人群的喧闹声中﹐我们可以清楚地听到汤姆的声音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plainly the laws are not effective.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然那些法规没有效力。

Sense.DEF: speaking honestly, and without trying to hide the truth
Sense.EXAMPLE: She told him plainly that she had no intention of marrying him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坦率地告诉他自己不打算嫁给他。

Sense.DEF: simply or without decoration
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plainly dressed young girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个穿着简朴的年轻女孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was very plainly furnished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间陈设很简单。

Sense.DEF: a type of old Christian church music in which people sing a simple tune without musical instruments
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时教堂中齐唱而无伴奏的〕素歌﹐单旋律圣歌

Sense.DEF: saying exactly what you think, especially in a way that people think is honest rather than rude
Sense.EXAMPLE: a straightforward, plainspoken man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个性格坦率﹑有话直说的男人

Sense.DEF: someone who brings a legal action against another person in a court of law
a plaintive sound is high, like someone crying, and sounds sad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the plaintive cry of the seagull
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海鸥凄厉的叫声

Sense.DEF: to twist three long pieces of hair or rope over and under each other to make one long piece
Sense.EXAMPLE: She plaited her hair hurriedly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她匆匆地把头发编成辫子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plaited leather belt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 编成辫状的皮带

Sense.DEF: a length of something, usually hair, that has been plaited

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenni wore her hair in plaits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮梳着辫子。

Sense.DEF: something you have decided to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: His plan is to get a degree in economics and then work abroad for a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他计划先取得经济学学位﹐然后去国外工作一年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any plans for the weekend?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你周末有什么打算？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s been a change of plan – we’re not going to Ibiza after all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划有变﹐我们终究还是不去伊维萨岛了。

GramExa.GLOSS: the best course of action
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your best plan would be to catch a taxi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好的办法还是叫一辆出租车。

Sense.DEF: a set of actions for achieving something in the future, especially a set of actions that has been considered carefully and in detail
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过仔细考虑的〕规划﹐计划﹐方案

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairman outlined the company’s plans for achieving a 10% growth in sales.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事长概述了公司要实现销售额增长10%的计划。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are plans to turn the site of the factory into a park.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划把该工厂所在地改建成公园。

Sense.DEF: a drawing similar to a map, showing roads, towns, and buildings
Sense.TRAN: 〔显示道路﹑城镇和建筑物的〕详图

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a street plan of London
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦街道图

Subsense.DEF: a drawing of a building, room, or machine as it would be seen from above, showing the shape, size, and position of the walls, windows, and doors
Subsense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑房间等的〕平面图﹔〔机器的〕图样﹐图纸

Subsense.DEF: a drawing that shows exactly how something will be arranged
Subsense.TRAN: 〔显示如何安排某物的〕示意图
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I have to organise a seating plan for the dinner.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得为这次宴会设计一个座位示意图。

Sense.DEF: your first plan, which you will use if things happen the way you expect
Sense.TRAN: 第一方案〔指情况符合预期时用的计划〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to find a restaurant and buy a meal. That’s Plan A.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要找一家餐馆吃饭﹐这是第一方案。

Sense.DEF: your second plan, which you can use if things do not happen the way you expect
Sense.TRAN: 第二方案﹐备用方案〔指情况超出预期时用的计划〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time to put Plan B into action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该采用第二方案了。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry – I have a plan.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心,我有计划的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: prepare for sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mary has been busy making plans for her wedding.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽一直在忙着筹划她的婚礼。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think of a plan
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The chairman must come up with a plan to get the club back on its feet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席必须提出一个重振俱乐部的计划。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what has been planned
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The bombers were arrested by the security forces before they could carry out their plans.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 放炸弹的人在实施计划之前就被安全部队逮捕了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’re sticking to our original plan.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们恪守原计划。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: decide not to continue with it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The plan was scrapped because it was too expensive.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划因费用过高而被撤销。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially tell people about it
describe it in a general way
to do what has been agreed as part of an official plan

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The plan was very ambitious, but it worked.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项计划相当浩大,但很有效。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The generals drew up detailed plans for the invasion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军们拟订了详细的入侵方案。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They devised a cunning plan to get back their money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想出了一个诡诈的计划把钱弄回来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Unesco has a 25-year plan to provide basic education to all.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国教科文组织有一个为期25年的计划﹐旨在让所有人都接受基础教育。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a plan that involves doing a lot of things in order to achieve something big
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Marrying the countess was all part of his grand plan.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 娶到女伯爵是他整个宏大计划的一部分。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a detailed plan for dealing with a complicated situation
a plan for saving a company, economy etc
happen in the way that was arranged
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If everything goes according to plan, we’ll finish in January.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果一切都按计划进行,我们将在一月份完成。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ministers are discussing a plan of action to deal with the crisis.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长们在商讨应对这次危机的行动计划。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a plan to attack or achieve something
a plan to achieve something

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 'do a plan'. Say 而要说 make a plan .

ThesBox.HEADING: THESAURUS 词语辨析 – MEANING 义项 2

Exponent.DEF: a set of actions for achieving something in the future, especially a set of actions that has been considered carefully and in detail
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指考虑周详的〕计划,规划,方案
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Leaders outlined a plan to end the fighting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导人略述了结束战事的计划。

Exponent.DEF: a secret plan to do something bad or illegal, made by a group of people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a plot to assassinate the President.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人密谋刺杀总统。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a terrorist conspiracy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子的阴谋

Exponent.DEF: an official plan that is intended to help people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔旨在提供帮助的正式的〕方案,计划
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government has introduced a new scheme to help young people find work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府开始推行一项帮助青年人就业的新计划。

Exponent.DEF: a carefully designed plan which is intended to achieve a particular purpose over a long period of time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔精心设计的长期〕策略,战略,行动计划
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the company’s business strategy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的经营战略
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government’s economic strategy has been criticized by many experts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的经济计划受到许多专家的批评。

Exponent.DEF: a new plan for dealing with a particular problem or for achieving a particular aim
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a peace initiative
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平倡议
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a major new initiative to tackle street crime
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 为应对街头犯罪而新推出的一项重大方案

Exponent.DEF: a plan that members of a government, political party, company etc agree on, that states how they intend to deal with a particular subject or problem
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the government’s immigration policy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的移民政策
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s company policy to allow people to work from home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 允许员工在家办公是公司的政策。

Exponent.DEF: a series of activities that a government or organization organizes, which aims to achieve something important and will continue for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔有重要目标且需长期执行的〕计划,规划
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a five-year programme which will create 2,000 new jobs
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项能创造2,000个工作机会的五年计划
Exponent.EXAMPLE: federal programs for low-income housing
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决低收入家庭住房问题的联邦政府规划

Sense.DEF: to think carefully about something you want to do, and decide how and when you will do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He immediately began planning his escape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他立即开始计划逃跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talks are planned for next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈计划于下周进行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wedding was fine and everything went as planned happened the way it had been planned .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼很顺利﹐一切都是按计划进行的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maria didn’t plan to kill Fiona. It was an accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚并非蓄意杀害菲奥娜﹐那是个意外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now that you’re pregnant you’ll have to plan ahead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你既然怀孕了﹐就必须提前把事情都安排妥当。

Sense.DEF: to intend to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He said he planned to write his essay tonight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说打算今晚写文章。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When do you plan on going to Geneva?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算何时去日内瓦？

Sense.EXAMPLE: The former president is planning a return to politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前总统打算重返政坛。

Sense.DEF: to think about something you are going to make, and decide what it will be like
Sense.EXAMPLE: Planning a small garden is often difficult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计一个小花园往往很困难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system needs to be planned carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统得精心设计。

Sense.DEF: to plan something carefully, considering all the possible problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll get the maps so we can plan out our route.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去拿地图﹐我们来设计一下路线。

Sense.DEF: a vehicle that flies in the air and has wings and at least one engine
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is a big airline with a large fleet of planes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一家大航空公司﹐拥有庞大的机群。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s much quicker to go by plane .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘飞机去会快很多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She slept on the plane .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在飞机上睡着了。

PIC.HEADING: PLANE 飞机
PIC.PICCONTENT: tail 尾部；fuselage 机身；rudder 方向舵；stabilizer 安定面；undercarriage/landing gear 起落架；jet engine 喷气发动机；cockpit 驾驶舱；wing 机翼

Sense.DEF: a level or standard of thought, conversation etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑谈话等的〕水平﹐程度﹔标准
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two newspapers are on completely different intellectual planes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两份报纸的文化层次完全不同。

Sense.DEF: a tool that has a flat bottom with a sharp blade in it, used for making wooden surfaces smooth

a
plane tree

a completely flat surface in
geometry

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She caught the first plane back to New York.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她赶上了回纽约的第一班飞机。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We got on the plane and found our seats.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们登上飞机,找到了自己的座位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: goes into the air
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The flight attendants served drinks shortly after the plane took off.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机起飞后不久,客机乘务员开始向旅客提供饮料。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: moves safely down onto the ground
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Because of the fog, our plane had to land at Luton.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为有雾,我们的飞机只好降落卢顿机场。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: lands safely on the ground
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As soon as the plane touched down on the runway, I felt better.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机一降落到跑道上,我就感觉好些了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: lands in a sudden and dangerous way because of a problem
bring it safely down onto the ground
land it

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He flew to Vegas in his private plane.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他乘坐自己的私人飞机去拉斯维加斯。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for carrying goods
for carrying military equipment and soldiers
a small fast military plane

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Over 200 people died in the plane crash.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两百多人在飞机失事中丧生。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 'fly by plane'. Say 而要说 go by plane or just 或只说 fly .

Sense.DEF: if you plane a piece of wood, you make it smoother or smaller, using a plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: He planed the edge of the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将门的边缘刨平整。

Sense.DEF: completely flat and smooth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plane surface
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平面

Sense.DEF:
the study of lines, shapes etc that are
two-dimensional with measurements in only two directions, not three
the number of people or amount of something that an aircraft will hold
Sense.EXAMPLE: planeloads of food aid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装满一架架飞机的救援食品

Sense.DEF: an electric tool with a flat bottom and a sharp blade, used for making wooden surfaces smooth
a very large round object in space that moves around the Sun or another star
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mercury is the smallest of all the planets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水星是行星中最小的一颗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there life on other planets?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他行星上有生命吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the future of planet Earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球的未来
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘in a planet’. Say 而要说 on a planet.

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb is (living) on another planet/what planet is sb on?
Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that someone’s ideas are not at all practical or sensible
Sense.TRAN: 某人是外星人〔幽默用法﹐表示某人的想法完全不切实际或不明智〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thinks motherhood is glamorous – what planet is he on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得当母亲令人向往——他是外星人吧？

Sense.DEF: the world – used especially when talking about the environment
Sense.EXAMPLE: a safer future for the planet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球更安全的将来

Sense.DEF: a building where lights on a curved ceiling show the movements of planets and stars
a large tree with broad leaves that is often planted along streets
a plangent sound is loud and deep and sounds sad
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音〕凄切的﹐悲戚的﹐如泣如诉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the plangent sound of the violin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如泣如诉的小提琴声

Sense.DEF: a long narrow piece of wooden board, used especially for making structures to walk on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long plank of wood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一长条厚木板
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bridge made of planks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用厚木板搭成的桥

Sense.DEF: one of the main features or principles of an argument etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the main plank of their argument
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们论点的核心

Sense.EXAMPLE: a central plank of our policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们政策的要点
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-plank campaign including raising the minimum wage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包括提高最低工资等五项核心内容的运动

Crossrefto.REFLEX: as thick as two short planks

Sense.DEF: wood that has been cut into planks, especially when it is used to make a floor, bridge, or fence
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用作地板﹑桥梁﹑围栏的〕板材

Sense.DEF: the very small forms of plant and animal life that live in water, especially the sea, and are eaten by fish
when a product is deliberately made so that it will soon be replaced by something more fashionable or more technically advanced. This is done so that people will want to buy new things more often.
Sense.TRAN: 计划报废〔指生产很快就会过时或落后的产品﹐以使人们经常购买新的产品〕

Sense.DEF: someone who plans and makes important decisions about something, especially someone whose job is to plan the way towns grow and develop
Sense.TRAN: 策划者﹐设计者﹔〔尤指城市发展的〕规划者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: City planners are looking for ways to ease traffic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市规划者正在寻求缓解交通堵塞的方法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Many financial planners will help you shop for insurance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多理财规划师会帮助你选购保险。

Sense.DEF: the process of thinking about and deciding on a plan for achieving or making something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A little careful planning is important in gardening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 园艺工作中仔细规划很重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How did you manage to be so late?’ ‘Just bad planning.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你怎么会这么晚？” “事情没有安排好。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: A little forward planning thinking about how to do something before doing it can save you a lot of expense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事先稍加计划就能省去很多开销。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good financial planning is vital to business success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的财务规划对于企业成功至关重要。

Sense.DEF: official permission to build a new building or change an existing one
Sense.TRAN: 〔兴建或改造建筑物的〕建筑许可

Sense.DEF: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to water the plants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘记给植物浇水。

Sense.DEF: a factory or building where an industrial process happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge chemical plant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座大型化工厂

Sense.DEF: heavy machinery that is used in industrial processes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plant hire business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家重型机械出租公司

Sense.DEF: something illegal or stolen that is hidden in someone’s clothes or possessions to make them seem guilty of a crime
someone who is put somewhere or sent somewhere secretly to find out information

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many rare plants were collected from India and China.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多稀有植物是从印度和中国收集到的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: These plants are common in British gardens.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物在英国的花园中很常见。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many wild plants are in danger of dying out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多野生植物正濒临灭绝。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: plants that are grown in gardens
plants that can be used in medicine
a plant that is grown in a container
one that grows up things

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The plant grows to a height of about 20 inches.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物可长到约20英寸的高度。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: grows well
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of plants thrive in partial shade.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多植物在半阴凉处长得很茁壮。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The plants are flowering earlier this year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年这些植物花开得早。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is not an easy plant to grow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物不容易种植。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: plants
Collocate.EXAMPLE: All but the dirtiest of rivers support some plant life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非极为肮脏,所有河流都能为某些植物提供生存环境。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They feed on decaying plant material.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们以腐烂的植物为食。

Sense.DEF: to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: Residents have helped us plant trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居民们帮助我们种了树。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve planted tomatoes and carrots in the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在菜园里种了番茄和胡萝卜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hillside planted with fir trees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 种着杉树的山坡

Sense.DEF: to put something firmly in or on something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He came up to her and planted a kiss on her cheek.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走上前去﹐在她脸颊上深深一吻。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She planted her feet firmly to the spot and refused to move.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双脚钉在那里﹐不肯移步。

Sense.DEF: to hide stolen or illegal goods in someone’s clothes, bags, room etc in order to make them seem guilty of a crime

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She claims that the police planted the drugs on her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她声称这些毒品是警察给她栽的赃。

Sense.DEF: to put a bomb somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two men are accused of planting a bomb on the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子被控在飞机上放置炸弹。

Sense.DEF: to put or send someone somewhere, especially secretly, so that they can find out information
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police had planted undercover detectives at every entrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在每个入口处都布了密探。

Sense.DEF: to make someone begin to have an idea, especially so that they do not realize that you gave them the idea
Sense.TRAN: 使想法/怀疑/猜疑植根于（某人的头脑）﹐（给某人）灌输想法/怀疑/猜疑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone must have planted the idea of suicide in his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定是有人在他的脑子里灌输了自杀的念头。

Sense.DEF: to put a young plant into the soil outdoors, so that it has enough room to grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: The seedlings should be planted out in May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼苗应该在五月份移植到户外。

Sense.DEF:
a kind of
banana
that is cooked before it is eaten, or the plant on which it grows
a common wild plant with small green flowers and wide leaves
a large area of land in a hot country, where crops such as tea, cotton, and sugar are grown
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rubber plantation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡胶园

Sense.DEF: a large group of trees grown to produce wood
an attractive, usually large, container for growing plants in
someone who owns or is in charge of a plantation
Sense.TRAN: 种植园主﹔种植园管理者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tea planter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茶园园主

Sense.DEF: a machine used for planting
a piece of flat metal, wood, or stone with writing on it, used as a prize in a competition or attached to a building to remind people of an event or person
Sense.TRAN: 匾牌﹐匾额〔用于奖励或纪念〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team’s coach was given a plaque.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个队的教练得到一块匾牌。

GramExa.GLOSS: a plaque to help people remember something important

Sense.DEF:
a harmful substance which forms on your teeth, which
bacteria
can live and breed in
the yellowish liquid part of blood that contains the blood cells
the living substance inside a cell

a gas that contains about the same numbers of positive and negative electric
charge s
and is found in the sun and most stars

a type of television or computer screen that is wider and taller than most regular screens, but that shows pictures using a different type of technology which makes it possible for the screen to be thinner than other types of screens

a substance used to cover walls and ceilings with a smooth even surface. It consists of
lime
, water, and sand.
Sense.TRAN: 〔涂抹墙壁和天花板用的〕灰泥

Sense.DEF: a piece of thin material that is stuck on to the skin to cover a small wound

if you have a leg or arm in plaster, you have a
plaster cast
around it because a bone is broken and needs to be kept in place while it mends
to put a wet usually sticky substance all over a surface so that it is thickly covered

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her face was plastered with make-up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上浓妆艳抹。

Sense.DEF: to completely cover a surface with something, especially large pieces of paper, pictures etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指以大张的纸﹑图片等〕覆盖

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The windows were plastered with notices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户上贴满了告示。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The news of the wedding was plastered all over the papers was the main story in the newspapers .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关这场婚礼的新闻占满了各家报纸的版面。

Sense.DEF: to put wet plaster on a wall or ceiling
Sense.TRAN: 在〔墙或天花板〕上抹灰泥

Sense.DEF: to make your hair lie flat or stick to your head
Sense.TRAN: 把〔头发〕梳平﹔使〔头发〕贴在〔头上〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His hair was plastered to his forehead with sweat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他汗湿的头发紧贴在前额上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rain had plastered her hair down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发被雨水打湿﹐紧贴在脑袋上。

Sense.DEF: to cover a hole or an old surface by spreading plaster over it
Sense.TRAN: 〔抹灰泥〕覆盖〔洞孔或旧的表面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The original brickwork has been plastered over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原来的砖面被灰泥盖住了。

Sense.DEF: board made of large sheets of thick paper held together with plaster, used to cover walls and ceilings inside a house

a cover made from
plaster of paris
, put around an arm, leg etc to keep a broken bone in place while it mends
Sense.TRAN: 〔固定骨折部位的〕石膏绷带﹐石膏夹

Sense.DEF:
a copy of something that is made of
plaster of paris
very drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris was plastered after five beers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五瓶啤酒下肚﹐克里斯就烂醉如泥了。

Sense.DEF:
someone whose job is to cover walls and ceilings with
plaster
a mixture of a white powder and water that dries fairly quickly and is used for making plaster casts and to decorate buildings
a light strong material that is produced by a chemical process, and which can be made into different shapes when it is soft
Sense.EXAMPLE: children’s toys made of plastic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料儿童玩具
Sense.EXAMPLE: the plastics industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料工业

Sense.DEF: small plastic cards that are used to pay for things instead of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I haven’t got any cash.’ ‘Don’t worry, I’ll stick it on the plastic pay for it using a credit card .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我没带现金。” “别担心﹐我来刷卡。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do they take plastic? can you pay using a credit card?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们接受信用卡支付吗？

Sense.DEF: made of plastic
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plastic spoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料汤匙
Sense.EXAMPLE: plastic bags
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料袋

Sense.DEF: a plastic substance can be formed into many different shapes and keeps the shape it is formed into until someone changes it
something that is plastic looks or tastes artificial or not natural
Sense.EXAMPLE: plastic food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造食品
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate that plastic smile of hers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌她那种做作的笑容。

Sense.DEF: a large bullet made of hard plastic that is intended to injure but not kill
an explosive substance that can be shaped using your hands, or a small bomb made from this
Sense.TRAN: 可塑炸药﹔〔由可塑炸药制成的〕可塑炸弹

Sense.DEF: a soft substance like clay, that comes in many different colours and is used by children for making models
the quality of being easily made into any shape, and of staying in that shape until someone changes it
the medical practice of changing the appearance of people’s faces or bodies, either to improve their appearance or to repair injuries
thin transparent plastic used to cover food to keep it fresh
BrE a dish that a restaurant prepares specially on a particular day in addition to its usual food
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐厅的〕当日特制菜﹐当日推荐菜

Subsense.DEF: a flat and usually round dish that you eat from or serve food on
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The plates were piled high with rice.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盘子里都堆满了米饭。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a dinner plate
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐碟

Subsense.DEF: the amount of food that is on a plate

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s eaten a whole plate of french fries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吃了整整一盘炸薯条。

Subsense.HINTTRAN: Do not use plate when you mean ‘food cooked in a particular way as a meal’. Use dish. 当表示菜肴时﹐不要用plate﹐而要用dish: the chef who created this dish (NOT 不说 this plate) 首创这道菜肴的厨师

Sense.DEF: a flat piece of metal with words or numbers on it, for example on a door or a car
Sense.TRAN: 〔印有文字或数字的〕金属牌﹔门牌﹔车牌
Sense.EXAMPLE: The brass plate on the door said ‘Dr Rackman’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄铜门牌上写着“雷克曼博士”。

GramExa.GLOSS: on a car
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did anyone see the car’s license plate?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有谁看到那辆汽车的车牌了吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a lot/enough on your plate
Sense.DEF: to have a lot of problems to deal with or problems to worry about
Sense.TRAN: 要应付的问题很多﹐要操心的事情很多

Subsense.DEF: one of the thin sheets of bone, horn etc that covers and protects the outside of some animals
a thin sheet of metal used to protect something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The shoes had metal plates attached to the heels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那双鞋后跟钉有金属片。

Sense.DEF: one of the very large sheets of rock that form the surface of the Earth

Subsense.DEF: ordinary metal with a thin covering of gold or silver
things such as plates, cups, forks, or knives made of gold or silver

Sense.LEXUNIT: hand/give/offer sb sth on a plate
Sense.DEF: to let someone get or achieve something easily, without much effort from them
Sense.TRAN: 把某事物拱手送给某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I worked hard for what I’ve got. It wasn’t handed to me on a plate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在拥有的一切都是辛苦挣来的﹐并不是人家白送的。

Subsense.DEF: a sheet of metal that has been cut or treated in a special way so that words or pictures can be printed from its surface
Subsense.EXAMPLE: copper printing plates
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铜印版

Subsense.DEF: a picture in a book, printed on good-quality paper and usually coloured
a thin sheet of glass used especially in the past in photography, with chemicals on it that are sensitive to light
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指过去摄影用的〕感光板[片]

Sense.DEF: the place where the person hitting the ball stands
used in the names of sports competitions or races in which the winner gets a silver plate …
Sense.TRAN: 银碟赛〔用于奖品为银碟的竞赛名称中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This horse won the Galway Plate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这匹马在戈尔韦银碟赛中获胜了。

Subsense.DEF:
a thin piece of plastic shaped to fit inside a person’s mouth, into which
false teeth
are fixed
a thin piece of plastic with wires fixed to it, that some people wear in their mouth to make their teeth straight
to be covered with a thin covering of gold or silver
Subsense.TRAN: 用〔金或银〕覆镀﹐镀上〔金或银〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful necklace, plated with 22-carat gold
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条漂亮的22开镀金项链

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gold-plated watch
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镀金手表

Subsense.DEF: to be covered in sheets of a hard material such as metal
Subsense.TRAN: 用〔金属板等坚硬材料〕覆盖
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ship had been heavily plated with protective sheets.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船加装了厚厚的护板。

Sense.DEF: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it
a period during which the level of something does not change, especially after a period when it was increasing
Sense.TRAN: 平稳时期﹐〔尤指某物增长后的〕稳定期
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

Sense.DEF: if something plateaus, it reaches and then stays at a particular level
Sense.TRAN: 达到稳定时期[阶段]﹔达到并保持稳定水平
Sense.EXAMPLE: The athletic footwear market has not yet plat-eaued.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动鞋市场还未达到饱和。

Sense.DEF: all the food that is on a plate

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a plateful of toast
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盘烤面包片

Sense.DEF: big pieces of glass made in large thick sheets, used especially in shop windows
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于商店橱窗的〕平板玻璃

Sense.DEF: one of the very small flat round cells in your blood that help it become solid when you bleed, so that you stop bleeding
the study of the forming and movement of the large sheets of rock that form the surface of the Earth
the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Edinburgh train will depart from platform six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开往爱丁堡的火车将从六号站台发车。

Sense.DEF: a stage for people to stand on when they are making a speech, performing etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small raised platform at one end of the room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间一端凸起的小讲台

Subsense.DEF: the main ideas and aims of a political party, especially the ones that they state just before an election
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指竞选之前发表的〕政纲﹐纲领
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a strong women’s rights platform
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强硬的妇女权利政纲
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Labour party platform
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党纲领

Subsense.DEF: a chance for someone to express their opinions, especially their political opinions
Subsense.TRAN: 〔发表观点的〕机会﹐讲坛〔尤指政治讲坛〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The conference provides a platform for people on the left wing of the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议给该党的左翼人士提供了发表意见的机会。

Sense.DEF: a tall structure built so that people can stand or work above the surrounding area
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oil exploration platform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油勘探平台

Sense.DEF: the type of computer system or software that someone uses
Sense.TRAN: 平台〔指使用中的计算机系统或软件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UNIX platform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: UNIX平台
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multimedia platform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多媒体平台

Sense.DEF: an opportunity to express your ideas to a large number of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We mustn’t give these groups a platform for their propaganda.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能给这些团体宣传机会。

Sense.DEF:
the open part at the back of some
double-decker
buses, where passengers get on and off
Sense.TRAN: 〔双层公共汽车后部的〕出入口

Sense.DEF: shoes that have a thick layer of wood, leather etc under the front part and the heel
a computer game in which the action happens against a background that does not move
Sense.TRAN: 平台游戏〔背景不动的电脑游戏〕

Sense.DEF: a thin layer of metal that covers another metal surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: gold plating
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镀金层

Sense.DEF: a silver-grey metal that does not change colour or lose its brightness, and is used in making expensive jewellery and in indus-try. It is a chemical element: symbol Pt
Sense.TRAN: 铂〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Pt〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a platinum ring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白金戒指

Sense.DEF: if a music recording goes platinum, at least a million copies of it have been sold
Sense.TRAN: 白金销量〔唱片销量至少达一百万张〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eight of Denver’s albums went platinum .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹佛有八张专辑达到了白金销量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a platinum disc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张白金唱片

Sense.DEF: a woman whose hair is a silver-white colour, especially because it has been coloured with chemicals
a statement that has been made many times before and is not interesting or clever – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 老生常谈﹐陈词滥调〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His excuse was the platitude ‘boys will be boys.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还是那一套理由:“男孩总归是男孩。”

Sense.DEF: a relationship that is platonic is just friendly and is not a sexual relationship
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系〕柏拉图式的﹐亲密而无性爱的﹐纯精神恋爱的﹐纯友谊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a platonic friendship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柏拉图式的友谊

Sense.DEF:
a small group of soldiers which is part of a
company
and is led by a
lieutenant
a large plate from which food is served
Sense.EXAMPLE: a serving platter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛菜的大盘

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a platter of turkey and vegetables
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大盘火鸡肉和蔬菜

Sense.DEF: chicken, fish etc with vegetables or other foods on a large plate, served in a restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐馆里的〕一盘鸡肉/海鲜等套餐

Sense.DEF: a small furry Australian animal that has a beak and feet like a duck, lays eggs, and produces milk for its young
praise and admiration

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her performance won plaudits from the critics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的表演赢得了评论者的赞扬。

Sense.DEF: reasonable and likely to be true or successful
Sense.TRAN: 貌似有理的﹔似乎是真的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His story certainly sounds plausible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plausible explanation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说得过去的解释

Sense.DEF: someone who is plausible is good at talking in a way that sounds reasonable and truthful, although they may in fact be lying
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕花言巧语的﹔能言善辩的﹐能说会道的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plausible liar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个能说会道的撒谎者

Sense.DEF: when children play, they do things that they enjoy, often with other people or with toys
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids were playing and chasing each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在互相追逐嬉闹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Outside, the children were playing cowboys and Indians.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在外面玩牛仔和印第安人的游戏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you like to play with dolls when you were little?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你小时候喜不喜欢玩洋娃娃？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents need to spend time just playing with their children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母应该花时间和自己的孩子一起玩耍。

Subsense.DEF: to take part or compete in a game or sport
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Karen began playing basketball when she was six.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦六岁时开始打篮球。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you feel any pain, you shouldn’t play.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你觉得疼﹐就不该参赛。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Men were sitting in the park, playing cards.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人们坐在公园里打牌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bristol will play against Coventry next week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周布里斯托尔队将迎战考文垂队。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s playing Helen Evans in the semi-final playing against her .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半决赛中她将迎战海伦·埃文斯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Moxon played for England in ten test matches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫克森代表英格兰队参加过十场国际板球对抗赛决赛阶段比赛。

Subsense.DEF: to use a particular piece, card, person etc in a game or sport
Subsense.TRAN: 〔比赛中〕走〔子〕﹔出〔牌〕﹔派〔某人〕出场
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Harrison played a ten of spades.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里森出了一张黑桃十。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Regents played Eddie at center used him as a player in that position in the game against Arizona.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在和亚利桑那州立大学队的比赛中﹐理真大学队派埃迪上场担任中锋。

Subsense.DEF: to take a particular position on a team
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Garvey played first basefor the Dodgers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加维在道奇队中打一垒。

Subsense.DEF: to hit a ball in a particular way or to a particular place in a game or sport
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She played the ball low, just over the net.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把球打得很低﹐刚刚过网。

Sense.DEF: to perform a piece of music on a musical instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s learning to play the piano.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在学习弹钢琴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She played a Bach prelude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她演奏了一首巴赫的前奏曲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Haden has played with many jazz greats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑登和许多著名的爵士乐手合作过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small orchestra was playing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支小型管弦乐队在演奏。

Sense.DEF: if a radio, CD etc plays, or if you play it, it produces sound, especially music
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bedside radio played softly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 床边的收音机播放着轻柔的乐曲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: DJs playing the latest house and techno tracks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 播放着最新豪斯音乐和泰克诺音乐的音乐节目主持人们

Subsense.DEF: to perform the actions and say the words of a particular character in a theatre performance, film etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Streep plays a shy, nervous woman.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特里普扮演一个腼腆﹑神经质的女人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Playing a character so different from herself was a challenge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 扮演一个和她本人如此不同的角色是个挑战。

Subsense.DEF: if a play or film is playing at a particular theatre, it is being performed or shown there
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Macbeth’ is playing at the Theatre Royal in York.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《麦克白》正在约克的皇家剧院上演。

Subsense.DEF: if actors play a theatre, they perform there in a play

Sense.DEF: to have an effect or influence on something
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某事中〕起作用﹔〔在某事中〕有影响

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good diet and fitness play a large part in helping people live longer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 合理的饮食和良好的健康状况在对人们寿命的延长起着重要作用。

Subsense.DEF: to throw, kick, hit, or catch a ball as a game or activity
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jim and Karl were playing ball in the backyard.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆和卡尔在后院玩球。

Subsense.DEF: to do what someone wants you to do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: So far, the company has refused to play ball, preferring to remain independent.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司至今不愿当傀儡﹐更希望保持独立。

Sense.DEF: to behave as if you are a particular kind of person or have a particular feeling or quality, even though it is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: the accusation that scientists are playing God
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对科学家扮演上帝的指责
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some snakes fool predators by playing dead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些蛇会以装死来蒙骗猎食者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you mean?’ ‘Don’t play dumb pretend you do not know something .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你什么意思？”“别装糊涂了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t play the innocent pretend you do not know something with me – we both know what happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别跟我装无辜﹐你我都知道出了什么事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Susan felt she had to play the good wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊觉得自己必须扮成好妻子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He played the fool behaved in a silly way at school instead of working.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在学校瞎混而不用功学习。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a particular way in a situation, in order to achieve the result or effect that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you want to play this meeting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想怎么开这次会议？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Play it safe avoid risks and make sure the eggs are thoroughly cooked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险一点﹐一定要把这些蛋煮透。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you like him, play it cool, or you might scare him off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是喜欢他﹐就别露声色﹐否则可能会把他吓跑。

Sense.DEF: to hide your real feelings or wishes in order to achieve something in a clever or secret way – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop playing games, Luke, and tell me what you want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别耍花招了﹐卢克﹐告诉我你想要什么。

Subsense.DEF: to decide what to do according to the way a situation develops, without making plans before that time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ll see what the weather’s like and play it by ear .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将根据天气情况随机应变。

Subsense.DEF: if someone can play a musical instrument by ear, they can play a tune without looking at written music

Sense.DEF: to do something to someone as a joke or trick
Sense.TRAN: 跟某人开玩笑﹐捉弄某人

Subsense.DEF: to do things in the way you are expected to do them or in a way that is usual in a particular situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you want a promotion, you’ve got to play the game.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想得到晋升﹐就要规规矩矩的。

Subsense.DEF: to behave in a fair and honest way

Sense.DEF: to use a particular subject in politics in order to gain an advantage
Sense.TRAN: 打种族/民族主义/环保主义等的牌〔指使用某个政治话题来赢得优势〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a leader who is skillfully playing the nationalist card to keep power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老练地打出民族主义牌以保持权力的一名领导人

Sense.DEF: to say or do things in a situation in such a way that you gain as much as possible from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who knows? If you play your cards right , maybe he’ll marry you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁知道呢？如果你精明些﹐说不定他会娶你呢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: play your cards close to your chest
Sense.DEF: to keep secret what you are doing in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 对自己的行为秘而不宣

Sense.DEF: to do what someone you are competing with wants you to do, without realizing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因做对手所希望的事〕正中对手下怀
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we respond with violence, we’ll be playing into their hands, giving them an excuse for a fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们以暴力回应﹐就正中他们下怀﹐给了他们挑起争斗的借口。

Sense.DEF: to try to delay something so that you have more time to prepare for it or prevent it from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels may be playing for time while they try to get more weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子可能在拖延时间﹐想搞到更多的武器。

Sense.DEF: if your mind, memory, sight etc plays tricks on you, you feel confused and not sure about what is happening
Sense.TRAN: 〔头脑﹑记忆﹑视力等〕使（某人）产生错觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: It happened a long time ago, and my memory might be playing tricks on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是很久以前的事了﹐我记不清了。

Sense.DEF:
to risk money on the
stock market
as a way of trying to earn more money
to use the rules of a system in a clever way, to gain advantage for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 钻制度的空子〔使自己得益〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Accountants know how to play the tax system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会计师知道如何钻税收制度的空子。

Sense.DEF: to be in a lower position or rank than someone else
Sense.TRAN: （给某人）当第二把手[副手]﹐居次要地位

Sense.DEF: to pretend that you are not sexually interested in someone so that they will become more interested in you
Sense.TRAN: 〔对异性〕欲擒故纵〔故意装出对某人不感兴趣的样子以吸引对方〕

Sense.DEF: if a smile plays about someone’s lips, they smile slightly

Sense.TRAN: to stay away from school without permission 逃学﹐旷课

Sense.DEF: to do something that could have a very dangerous or harmful result
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dating the boss’s daughter is playing with fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和老板的女儿约会是在玩火。

Sense.DEF: to do what you are able to do well, rather than trying to do other things
Sense.TRAN: 发挥自己的长处﹐拿出自己的优势
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is up to us to play to our strengths and try to control the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要靠我们发挥自己的优势﹐尽力控制比赛。

Sense.DEF: if light plays on something, it shines on it and moves on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sunlight playing on the water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在水面闪烁的阳光

Sense.DEF:
if a
fountain
plays, water comes from it

to point a
hose
or light towards something so that water or light goes onto it
to have sexual relationships with a lot of different people

Sense.LEXUNIT: play fast and loose with sth
Sense.DEF: to not be careful about what you do, especially by not obeying the law or a rule
Sense.TRAN: 不负责任地利用某物〔尤指不遵守法律或规定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They played fast and loose with investors’ money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们滥用了投资者的资金。

Sense.DEF: to spend time with your family, doing normal things, especially so that your family appears to be happy when it is not
to have a sexual relationship with someone who is not your usual partner

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wasn’t she playing around with another man?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她当时不是在和另一个男人鬼混吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was years before I realized he’d been playing around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年以后我才察觉到他一直在拈花惹草。

Sense.DEF: to try doing something in different ways, to see what would be best, especially when this is fun

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Play around with the ingredients if you like.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你喜欢﹐可以随意搭配各种原料。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a silly way or waste time, when you should be doing something more serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the teacher wasn’t looking, we used to play about a lot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师不看着我们时﹐我们经常会瞎胡闹。

Sense.DEF: to keep moving or making changes to something in your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you stop playing around with the remote control!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能别再摆弄遥控器了！

Sense.DEF: to pretend to agree to do what someone wants, in order to avoid annoying them or to get an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt she had to play along or risk losing her job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己必须假装顺从﹐否则就有失业的危险。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something that is not true because you need their help in some way
Sense.TRAN: 〔因为需要某人的帮助而〕对某人撒谎﹐欺骗某人

Sense.DEF: used when you do not understand what someone is doing or why they are doing it, and you are surprised or annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you think you’re playing at?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到底在搞什么名堂？

Sense.DEF: if you play at doing something, you do not do it properly or seriously
Sense.TRAN: 不认真地干﹐对…敷衍了事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s still playing at being an artist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对于当艺术家仍然三心二意。

Sense.DEF: if children play at doctors, soldiers etc, they pretend to be doctors, soldiers etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 14-year-old playing at being a grown woman
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假扮成年女性的14岁少女

Sense.DEF: to play something that has been recorded on a machine so that you can listen to it or watch it
Sense.TRAN: 回放〔已录制的录音带﹑录像带等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He played back his answering machine messages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他回放了电话答录机中的留言。

Sense.DEF: to try to make something seem less important or less likely than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 使…看起来不那么重要﹐贬低﹐对…轻描淡写
Sense.EXAMPLE: Management has been playing down the possibility of job losses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层一直淡化职位减少的可能性。

GramExa.PROPFORM: play down the importance/seriousness/significance of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The White House spokeswoman sought to play down the significance of the event.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫女发言人试图淡化该事件的重要性。

Sense.DEF: if people or teams play off, they play the last game in a sports competition, in order to decide who is the winner
Sense.EXAMPLE: The top two teams will play off at Twickenham for the county title.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成绩最好的两支球队将在维克汉姆体育场为争夺郡冠军一决雌雄。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately use a fact, action, idea etc in order to make what you are doing better or to get an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two musicians played off each other in a piece of inspired improvisation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位乐师在表演一首精彩的即兴曲时争强斗胜。

Sense.DEF: to encourage one person or group to compete or argue with another, in order to get some advantage for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 〔为渔利而〕挑拨离间﹐使…相斗[对立﹐争吵]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house seller may try to play one buyer off against another, to raise the price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子的卖家可能会在两位买主之间挑拨﹐目的是为了抬高房价。

Sense.DEF: to use a feeling, fact, or idea in order to get what you want, often in an unfair way
Sense.TRAN: 利用〔某一感情﹑事实或观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ad plays on our emotions, showing a doctor holding a newborn baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告中一名医生抱着一个新生婴儿﹐那是在利用我们的情感。

Sense.DEF: if an event or situation is played out or plays itself out, it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will be interesting to see how the election plays itself out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观看选举如何进行会很有意思。

Sense.DEF: if people play out their dreams, feelings etc, they express them by pretending that a particular situation is really happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weekend gives you a chance to play out your fantasies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末让你有机会去想入非非。

Sense.DEF: to emphasize something, sometimes making it seem more important than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 强调某事的重要性﹔夸大某事﹔大肆渲染某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Play up your strongest arguments in the opening paragraph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一段中就要突出最强有力的论据。

Sense.DEF: if children play up, they behave badly
Sense.TRAN: 〔孩子〕捣蛋﹔使（某人）恼火﹐给（某人）制造麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jordan’s been playing up in school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔丹在学校里老是惹麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope the kids don’t play you up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望孩子们不会给你添麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to hurt you or cause problems for you
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕感到痛苦﹔给〔某人〕造成麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: My knee’s been playing me up this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这星期我的膝盖一直不舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s playing up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车子又出问题了。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a very polite or kind way to someone because you want something from them
Sense.TRAN: 投〔某人〕所好﹐逢迎﹐讨好﹐巴结
Sense.EXAMPLE: Connie always plays up to her parents when she wants money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康妮缺钱的时候总会去讨好父母。

Sense.DEF: to keep touching something or moving it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop playing with the light switch!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再乱动电灯开关了！

Sense.DEF: to try doing something in different ways to decide what works best
Sense.TRAN: 试验〔以找出解决问题的最佳方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Play with the design onscreen, moving text and pictures until you get a pleasing arrangement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试着在屏幕上进行设计﹐移动文字和图片﹐直到排列令人满意为止。

Sense.DEF: to consider an idea or possibility, but not always very seriously
Sense.EXAMPLE: After university, I played with the idea of teaching English in China.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学毕业以后﹐我想过去中国教英语。

Sense.DEF: money, time etc that is available to be used
Sense.TRAN: 可用的金钱/时间/空间等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The budget is very tight, so there isn’t much money to play with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经费很紧﹐没有很多钱可用。

Sense.DEF: to touch your own sex organs for pleasure
to use words in a clever or amusing way
Sense.TRAN: 玩文字游戏﹔用字遣词机智[幽默]

Sense.DEF: a story that is written to be performed by actors, especially in a theatre
Sense.EXAMPLE: a play by Chekhov
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一出契诃夫的戏剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a major theme of Miller’s plays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是米勒剧作中的首要主题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Edward Bond’s play about class war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华·邦德关于阶级斗争的戏剧

Sense.DEF: things that people, especially children, do for amusement rather than as work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Play is very important to a child’s development.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏对孩子的成长十分重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a play area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏区

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The program aims to teach road safety through play.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个节目旨在通过游戏进行道路交通安全的教育。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the happy shouts of children at play
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子玩耍时快乐的叫嚷声

Sense.DEF: the effect or influence of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the free play of competition in the building industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑业竞争的自由调节作用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are a number of factors at play having an effect in the current recession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前的不景气是由多重因素引发的。

GramExa.GLOSS: use something or make it have an effect
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 使用某事物﹔使某事物发挥作用
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A complex system of muscles is brought into play for each body movement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体的每一个动作都需要复杂的肌肉系统运动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Political considerations do come into play have an effect when making policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制定政策时﹐政治因素确有影响。

Sense.SIGNPOST: ACTION IN A GAME OR SPORT
Sense.SIGNTRAN: 比赛或体育活动中的动作

Subsense.DEF: the actions of the people who are playing a game or sport
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Rain stopped play after only an hour.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛才进行了一小时就因雨告停。

Subsense.DEF: one particular action or set of actions during a game
Subsense.EXAMPLE: On the next play, Johnson ran 15 yards for a touchdown.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的一次进攻﹐约翰逊跑了15码持球触地得分。

Sense.DEF: if a ball is in play or out of play, it is inside or outside the area in which the rules of the game allow you to hit, kick, catch etc the ball
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kicked the ball out of play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把球踢出界外。

Sense.DEF: a use of a word that is interesting or amusing because it can be understood as having two very diffe-rent meanings
patterns made by light as it moves over a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: the play of light on the water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波光粼粼

Sense.DEF: to make an attempt to gain something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a play for the leadership last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去年曾角逐领导权。

Sense.DEF: to try to begin a romantic or sexual relationship with someone
Sense.TRAN: 想和某人恋爱[发生性关系]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s obvious he was making a play for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然他在追求她。

Sense.DEF: if there is some play in something, it is loose and can be moved
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s too much play in the rope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那根绳子太松了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: So far, he has written three plays.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 迄今他已写了三个剧本。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: While we were in New York, we went to a play.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在纽约时去看了一出戏。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve never seen the play.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未看过这出戏。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of the audience were talking instead of watching the play.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些观众在讲话,而不在观剧。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The play was performed by Brighton Youth Theatre.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧由布赖顿青年剧团出演。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be performing in a play
arrange for it to be performed
tell the actors what to do
arrange its performance
practise it
a play in a theatre
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I occasionally write reviews of local stage plays.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我偶尔会写文章评论本地的舞台剧。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a play written to be performed on TV/radio

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 'give a play'. Say 而要说 put on a play.

Sense.DEF: a man who is good at meeting women and persuading them to have sex with him
a piece of ground used for sports that is playable is in good condition and suitable for playing on
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动场〕适于使用的﹐可用于比赛的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite the frost, the pitch was playable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管有霜﹐赛场还是可以用。

Sense.DEF: something that is playable can be played

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The disks are playable on home computers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些光碟可以在家用电脑上播放。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an old guitar that is still playable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还能弹奏的旧吉他

Sense.DEF: behaviour in which someone pretends to be serious or sincere, but is not
the playback of a tape that you have recorded is when you play it on a machine in order to watch or listen to it
Sense.TRAN: 〔录音带﹑录像带等的〕重放﹐回放
Sense.EXAMPLE: the playback button on an answering machine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话答录机上的回放键

Sense.DEF: an action in a sports game that is shown again, so that people can see exactly what happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛中动作的〕重放﹐重播

Sense.DEF: a singer who records songs which are later used in films, especially Bollywood films. The actors in the films pretend that they are singing the songs themselves.
Sense.TRAN: 歌曲配音歌手〔为电影角色所唱歌曲录音的歌手﹐尤指为宝莱坞电影歌曲录音的歌手〕

Sense.DEF: a printed piece of paper advertising a play
a rich man who does not work and who spends his time enjoying himself with beautiful women, fast cars etc
Sense.TRAN: 花花公子﹐只会吃喝玩乐的有钱男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a middle-aged playboy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个中年花花公子

Sense.DEF: a report on what is happening in a sports game, given at the same time as the game is being played
a time that is arranged for children to meet together to play
Sense.TRAN: 〔为孩子们安排的〕一起玩耍的日子

Sense.DEF:
a type of
play dough
a soft coloured substance similar to clay, that children use for making models or shapes
an idea, a situation etc that is played out is finished or no longer has influence
Sense.TRAN: 过时的﹐陈旧的﹔没有影响力的

Sense.DEF: someone who takes part in a game or sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: a basketball player
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 篮球运动员

Sense.DEF: one of the important people, companies, countries etc that is involved in and influences a situation, especially one involving competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a firm that is a dominant player on Wall Street
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 华尔街上一家举足轻重的公司

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a key player in world affairs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球事务的重要参与者

Sense.DEF: a machine that is used to play CDs, videos etc
Sense.TRAN: CD/唱片/录像带等的播放机

Sense.DEF: someone who plays a musical instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: a guitar player
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名吉他手

Sense.DEF: a man who has sexual relationships with many different women
an actor

a piano that is played by machinery inside it. A long roll of paper with holes cut in it gradually turns and works the machinery, pressing down the
key s
on the piano to produce music.
very active, happy, and wanting to have fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: a playful little dog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 活泼的小狗
Sense.EXAMPLE: Babies are playful and alert when they first wake up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝们刚醒来的时候很好动﹐而且反应敏捷。

Sense.DEF: intended to be fun rather than serious, or showing that you are having fun
Sense.TRAN: 闹着玩的﹐开玩笑的﹐不认真的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a playful kiss on the cheek
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在面颊上开玩笑的一吻

Sense.DEF: someone who often goes to see plays
an area for children to play, especially at a school or in a park, that often has special equipment for climbing on, riding on etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校的〕操场﹐运动场﹔〔公园的〕游乐场
Sense.EXAMPLE: children shouting and running in the playground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在操场上叫嚷奔跑的孩子们

Sense.DEF: a place where a particular group of people go to enjoy themselves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the playground of the rich
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有钱人享乐的地方

Sense.DEF: a type of school where children between two and four years old meet to learn and play
Sense.TRAN: 〔两岁到四岁孩子的〕幼儿游戏班﹐幼儿园
Sense.EXAMPLE: a playgroup at the community centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区中心的幼儿园

Sense.DEF: a group of children, usually between two and four years old, whose parents meet each week so that the children can play together
a theatre – used in the name of theatres
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Oxford Playhouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛津戏院

Sense.DEF: a small structure like a little house for children to play in

a
card 1 7a

a large piece of ground with areas marked out for playing football,
cricket
etc
the list of songs that a radio station plays
Sense.TRAN: 〔广播电台的〕歌曲播放列表﹐播放清单

Sense.DEF: a friend that a child plays with
a game played to decide who will win after a previous game has ended with two teams or players having equal points
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不分胜负而进行的〕附加赛

Sense.DEF: a game, usually one of a series of games, played by the best teams or players in a competition in order to decide the final winner
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Lakers will meet the Bulls in the playoffs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖人队将和公牛队在季后赛中一决胜负。

Sense.DEF: an enclosed area in which a very small child can play safely, that is like an open box with sides made of bars or a net
Sense.TRAN: 〔让幼儿在其中安全玩耍的〕游戏围栏

Sense.DEF: a room for children to play in

a
playgroup
a toy
someone that you use for your own amusement or advantage, without caring about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: men who treat women as playthings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把女人当玩物的男人

Sense.DEF: a period of time during which a child can play
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let TV take up too much of your child’s playtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让电视占据你孩子太多的游戏时间。

Sense.DEF: a period of time at a school when children can go outside and play
someone who writes plays
a public square or market place surrounded by buildings, especially in towns in Spanish-speaking countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指讲西班牙语国家城市中的〕广场

Sense.DEF: a group of shops and other business buildings in a town, usually with outdoor areas between them
Sense.TRAN: 〔城市的〕购物区﹐购物中心﹔商业区

Sense.DEF: a large company in Britain which has shares that the public can buy
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕公开有限公司﹐股份有限公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marks & Spencer plc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莎百货公开有限公司

Sense.DEF: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a plea for help
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恳请帮助

Sense.EXAMPLE: Caldwell made a plea for donations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考德威尔恳求捐款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The parents made an emotional plea to their child’s kidnappers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长情绪激动地恳求绑架他们孩子的人。

Sense.DEF: a statement by someone in a court of law saying whether they are guilty or not
Sense.TRAN: 〔法庭上所作的〕有罪[无罪]陈述
Sense.EXAMPLE: a guilty plea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 承认有罪

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Adams entered a plea of ‘not guilty’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当斯不承认有罪。

Sense.DEF: an excuse for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused the appointment on a plea of illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他称病拒绝了那次约会。

Sense.DEF: when someone agrees to admit in court that they are guilty of one crime, in exchange for not being charged with a more serious crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔为避免受重罚而在法庭上承认罪名的〕控辩交易

Sense.DEF: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Civil rights groups pleaded for government help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民权团体恳请政府帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Moira pleaded with him to stay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫伊拉恳求他留下。

Sense.DEF: to state in a court of law whether or not you are guilty of a crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔在法庭上〕承认[否认]有罪﹐认〔罪〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henderson pled guilty to burglary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨德森承认犯有入室盗窃罪。

Sense.DEF: to give a particular excuse for your actions
Sense.TRAN: 以不知情/生病/精神错乱等为理由[借口]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stayed home from work, pleading illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她告病在家不去上班。

Sense.DEF: to give reasons why you think something is true or why something should be done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Managers pleaded that there was not enough time to make the changes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理们辩解说没有足够时间作出调整。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Residents successfully pleaded their case at a council meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居民们成功地在市政会会议上陈述了他们的情况。

Sense.DEF: in an emotional way that shows you very much want someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kathleen looked at him pleadingly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳用乞求的目光看着他。

Sense.DEF: enjoyable or attractive and making you feel happy
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉快的﹐惬意的﹐舒适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It had been a pleasant evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个愉快的夜晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pleasant climate of Southern California
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南加利福尼亚的宜人气候
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant was large and pleasant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家餐厅宽敞舒适。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate! What a pleasant surprise !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特！真是让人惊喜！

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is pleasant to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was pleasant to sit in a sidewalk cafe and watch people pass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐在路边咖啡馆看着人来人往真是惬意。

Sense.DEF: friendly, polite, and easy to talk to
Sense.TRAN: 礼貌而友善的﹐和蔼可亲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick seemed very pleasant on the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克在电话里好像非常友善。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pleasant-looking woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和颜悦色的女人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always been very pleasant to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我一直很友好。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say something or someone is nice rather than pleasant .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说某事物或某人nice,而不说pleasant
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It was a really nice day.
They were all very nice to me.

Sense.DEF: things that you say to someone in order to be polite, but which are not very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen and Mr Illing exchanged pleasantries .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬和伊林先生寒暄了一番。

Sense.DEF: used to be polite when asking someone to do something
Sense.TRAN: 请﹐好吗〔用于礼貌地请求某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you please clean up the living room?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把起居室打扫一下好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit down, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please be quiet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请安静！

Sense.DEF: used to be polite when asking for something
Sense.TRAN: 好吗﹐请〔用于礼貌地要求某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like a cup of coffee, please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给我一杯咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please can I go to Rebecca’s house?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问﹐我能去丽贝卡家吗？

Sense.DEF: said in order to politely accept something that someone offers you
Sense.TRAN: 好﹐行﹐谢谢〔用于接受别人的好意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘More wine?’ ‘Yes, please.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “还要酒吗？”“好的﹐谢谢。”

Subsense.DEF: said when you think what someone has just said or asked is not possible or reasonable
Subsense.TRAN: 得了吧！〔用于表示认为某人的话或要求不可能或没有道理〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Oh, please, he’d never do that.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哦﹐得了吧﹐他绝不会那么做的。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone to stop behaving badly
Subsense.TRAN: 够了！别闹了！〔用于要求别人停止做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Alison! Please!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾莉森！够了！

Sense.DEF: used by children to get an adult’s attention
Sense.TRAN: 请听我说﹐先生/托尔斯太太等〔儿语﹐用于引起成人的注意〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone happy or satisfied
Sense.TRAN: 使高兴﹐使欢喜﹔使满意﹐讨好
Sense.EXAMPLE: a business that wants to please its customers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望让顾客满意的一家公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did everything she could to please him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她千方百计讨好他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most children are eager to please .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数孩子都渴望取悦别人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s hard to please. Everything has to be perfect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让她满意很难﹐一切都要做到完美才行。

Sense.DEF: used in some phrases to show that someone can do or have what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: She does what she pleases .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她我行我素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can spend the money however you please.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些钱你想怎么花就怎么花。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: With the Explorer pass, you can get on and off the bus as you please .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了“探索者”通票﹐你可以随意上下公共汽车。

Sense.DEF: used when telling someone to do whatever they like, even though really you think they are making the wrong choice
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t think I’ll go.’ ‘Okay, please yourself.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想我不会去。”“好吧﹐随你的便。”

Subsense.DEF: used to politely ask someone to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 请﹐劳驾〔用于礼貌地提出请求〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Close the door, if you please.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请关上门。

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are surprised, angry, or annoyed about something
Subsense.TRAN: 真奇怪﹔真是有此理﹔真令人难以置信〔用于表示惊讶或气愤〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He asked me, in my own house if you please, to leave the room!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真是岂有此理﹐竟然在我的家里叫我离开房间！

Sense.DEF:
very
bold
, calm etc, in a way that is surprising
Sense.TRAN: 竟然如此大胆/冷静/镇静等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just walked in and sat down, as bold as you please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他径直走进来坐下﹐竟然如此大胆。

Sense.DEF: used to express a very strong hope or wish
Sense.TRAN: 但愿﹐希望〔用于表示非常强烈的愿望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything will be all right, please God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿一切都平安无事。

Sense.DEF: happy or satisfied
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your Dad will be so pleased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你爸爸会非常高兴的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed pleased by the compliment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她受了赞扬﹐显得很高兴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could tell she was pleased about something.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以感觉得出她因为什么事很开心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gwinn was pleased with the results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格温对结果很满意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s wonderful! I’m really pleased for you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太好了！我真的为你高兴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her mother was pleased that she chose a college close to home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妈妈很高兴她选了一所离家不远的大学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m pleased to tell you that you’ve got the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高兴通知你——你得到这份工作了。

Sense.DEF: used as a polite greeting when you meet someone for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 幸会﹐很高兴见到[认识]你〔初次会面时的礼貌说法〕

Sense.DEF: very willing or happy to help
Sense.EXAMPLE: If there’s anything we can do, we’d be pleased to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们可以做些什么﹐我们会非常乐意帮忙。

Sense.DEF: feeling proud or satisfied because you think you have done something clever, often in a way that annoys other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miranda, pleased with herself for getting it right, sat down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米兰达坐了下来﹐因为办妥了那件事而沾沾自喜。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that people like a lot
Sense.TRAN: 令人高兴的人[事物]﹔讨人喜欢的人[事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: A chocolate dessert is a sure crowd-pleaser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧克力甜点大家肯定都喜欢吃。

Sense.DEF: giving pleasure, enjoyment, or satisfaction
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pleasing sound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悦耳的声音

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a design that is pleasing to the eye
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 悦目的设计

Sense.DEF: enjoyable
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉快的﹐令人快乐的﹐舒适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pleasurable experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愉快的经历

Sense.DEF: the feeling of happiness, enjoyment, or satisfaction that you get from an experience

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sipped her drink with obvious pleasure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小口抿着喝饮料﹐显然很高兴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you taking the trip for business or pleasure?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这次出门是出差还是去玩？

Sense.DEF: an activity or experience that you enjoy very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: the simple pleasures of life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活中的简单乐趣

GramExa.PROPFORM: be a pleasure to read/work with/watch etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carol was a pleasure to work with.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和卡罗尔共事很愉快。

Sense.DEF: used when someone has thanked you for doing something and you want to say that you were glad to do it
Sense.TRAN: 别客气﹐不用谢〔表示乐意做某事〕

Sense.DEF: used to be polite when you are meeting someone, asking for something, agreeing to do something etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: May I have the pleasure of seeing you again?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能否有幸再次和您见面？

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been a pleasure to meet you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见到您很高兴。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to respond to a request
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 荣幸之至〔用于回答请求〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Give the kids a hug for me.’ ‘With pleasure.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “代我拥抱一下孩子们。”“荣幸之至。”

Sense.DEF: if you can do something at your pleasure, you can do it when you want to and in the way you want to
if someone is put in prison at His or Her Majesty’s pleasure, there is no fixed limit to the time they have to spend there
Sense.TRAN: 〔在押犯人〕没有固定的监禁期限﹔随国王/女王发落﹐随意在押

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He takes great pleasure in boasting about his big salary.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很喜欢吹嘘自己的高薪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Young children get a lot of pleasure from dressing up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子装扮成别人玩耍时就兴高采烈。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I find great pleasure in reading.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在阅读中得到很大的快乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Over the years, painting has given me a lot of pleasure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来,绘画带给我极大的乐趣。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give someone pleasure
get pleasure from it

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Steinbeck’s books have brought enormous pleasure to many people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦贝克的作品给许多人带来了巨大的快乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her garden was a constant source of pleasure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的花园是无尽的快乐源泉。

Exponent.DEF: the feeling you have when you are doing something you enjoy or when something very nice has happened to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most craftsmen get a lot of pleasure out of making things.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多工匠从制作器物的过程中尽享快乐。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His music has brought pleasure to people all over the world.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音乐给世界各地的人们带来欢乐。

Exponent.DEF: the feeling you have when you are happy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Happiness is more important than money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸福比金钱更重要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pauline was willing to do anything for her children’s happiness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了子女的幸福,保利娜愿意做任何事。

Exponent.DEF: a deep feeling of great happiness, because something good has happened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to describe the joy we felt, seeing each other again after so many years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么多年后重相见,很难描述我们的欢喜之情。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They danced with joy when they heard the news.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们听到消息后,乐得跳起舞来。

Exponent.DEF: great happiness and excitement, because something good that has happened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: To the audience ’s delight , she agreed to play another song.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 让听众高兴的是,她同意再演奏一首歌。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Imagine my delight when I found out that the house was for sale.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当我知道那幢房子要出售时,想想我有多高兴吧。

Exponent.DEF: a quietly happy and satisfied feeling, especially because you are happy with your work, your life etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He moved to the country and found contentment for the first time in his life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他搬到了乡下,平生第一次感到了满足。

Exponent.DEF: an extremely strong feeling of happiness and excitement that continues for a short time
Exponent.TRAN: 兴高采烈,〔强烈而短暂的〕幸福感
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The whole country experienced a period of euphoria after the war ended.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争结束后,一时间举国欢腾。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the euphoria that parents feel after the birth of a child
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝出生后父母感受到的兴奋

Exponent.DEF: a strong feeling of happiness and excitement, especially because you have achieved something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After she had made her first landing, she experienced a great sense of elation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 首次降落成功后,她得意非常。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The troops’ sense of elation at the victory was not to last.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队得胜后没能高兴多久。

Sense.DEF: a boat that someone uses for fun rather than for business
someone who does things just for enjoyment without considering other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔不考虑他人的〕寻欢作乐者﹐玩乐的人

Sense.DEF: a flat narrow fold in a skirt, a pair of trousers, a dress etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔半截裙﹑裤子﹑连衣裙等上的〕褶

Sense.DEF: a pleated skirt, dress etc has a lot of flat narrow folds
an artificial material that looks like leather and is used to make clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pleather jean jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造皮革牛仔夹克

Sense.DEF: an insulting word meaning someone who is from a low social class – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 下层平民〔侮辱性用语﹐常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plebs like me could never have such perfect manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像我这样的草民永远不会如此礼貌周全。

Sense.DEF: a student in their first year at a military college
relating to ordinary people and what they like, rather than to people from a high social class – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 平民的﹔百姓的﹔下层社会的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man with plebeian tastes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 趣味庸俗的男人

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for someone who is from a low social class
an ordinary person who had no special rank in ancient Rome
a system by which everyone in a country or area votes on an important decision that affects the whole country or area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a plebiscite on independence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于独立问题的公民投票

Sense.DEF:
a small thin piece of plastic, metal, or wood that you use for playing some musical instruments with strings, such as a
guitar
Sense.TRAN: 〔吉他等弦乐器用的〕拨片﹐拨子

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
plead
a serious promise or agree-ment, especially one made publicly or officially
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指公开或正式作出的〕誓言﹐誓约﹔保证

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pledge of support for the plan
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持该计划的誓约

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the government’s pledge to make no deals with terrorists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府不向恐怖分子妥协的保证

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents make a pledge to take their children to rehearsals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长作了保证答应带孩子去参加排练。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eisenhower fulfilled his election pledge to end the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾森豪威尔结束了战争﹐履行了他的竞选承诺。

Sense.DEF: a promise to give money to an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donors have made pledges totaling nearly $4 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 捐款人承诺提供总额近400万美元的捐助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pledge of $200 to the public TV station
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向公共电视台捐款200美元的承诺

Sense.DEF: something valuable that you leave with someone else as proof that you will do what you have agreed to do

someone who has promised to become a member of a
fraternity
or
sorority
at an American university
Sense.TRAN: 宣誓加入男生[女生]联谊会的人

Sense.DEF: to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Moore pledged $100,000 to the orchestra at the fund-raising dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在筹款晚宴上穆尔承诺向那支管弦乐队提供10万美元资助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new governor pledged to reduce crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新任州长承诺降低犯罪率。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Herrera pledged that his company will give aid to schools.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫雷拉承诺他的公司将向学校提供援助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pledged his cooperation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他保证合作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Trade unions pledged themselves to resist the government plans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会发誓要抵制政府的计划。

Sense.DEF: to make someone formally promise something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employees were pledged to secrecy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工被要求保证严守秘密。

Sense.DEF:
to leave something with someone as a
pledge 1 3

to promise to become a member of a
fraternity
or
sorority
at an American university
Sense.TRAN: 〔在美国的大学〕宣誓加入男生[女生]联谊会

Sense.DEF: belonging to the period in the Earth’s history that started about two million years ago and ended about 10,000 years ago, when much of the Earth was covered with ice
Sense.TRAN: 更新世的〔约两百万年前至一万年前﹐其时地球表面多被冰层覆盖〕

Sense.DEF: involving all the members of a committee, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conference ended with a plenary debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议以一场全体辩论结束。

Sense.DEF: plenary powers are complete powers with no limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was given plenary powers to negotiate with the rebels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被授予全权同反叛者谈判。

Sense.DEF: someone who has full power to take action or make decisions, especially as a representative of their government in a foreign country
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在外国代表本国政府的〕全权大使﹐全权代表

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 大量的某物﹐丰富的某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plenitude of wealth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的财富

Sense.DEF: completeness or fullness
plentiful
more than enough in quantity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plentiful supply of food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物的大量供应

Sense.DEF: a large quantity that is enough or more than enough

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure she gets plenty of fresh air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保她多呼吸新鲜空气。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: No need to hurry – you’ve got plenty of time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没必要急匆匆的﹐你有充足的时间。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s plenty to do and see in New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在纽约有很多事可做﹐很多东西可看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are plenty more chairs in the next room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔壁房间还有很多椅子。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Plenty of can be used before an uncountable noun or a plural noun. Do not say ‘a plenty of’.
F2NBox.TRAN: plenty of可用在不可数名词或复数名词前,不要说 a plenty of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There is plenty of evidence of poverty (NOT不说 a plenty of evidence).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有大量证据证明贫困状况 。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You will have plenty of opportunities to improve your skills.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有很多提高技能的机会。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say不要说 ‘there is plenty of things/places etc’. Say 而要说 there are plenty of things/places etc
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There are plenty of restaurants nearby.
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say that不要说 a place or thing ‘is plenty of something’. Say that 而要说 it is full of something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The garden is full of interesting shrubs and trees.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园里到处是有趣的灌木和树木。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people sometimes prefer to use ample rather than plenty of , as it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们有时更倾向于使用ample,而不用 plenty of,因为前者听上去更正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They were given ample time to complete the work.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 给了他们足够的时间完成此项工作。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is more than big enough, fast enough etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: This apartment’s plenty big enough for two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套公寓够宽敞﹐可以住两个人。

Sense.DEF: a lot or very
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d practiced plenty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经练得够多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was plenty nervous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很紧张。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is a lot of food and goods available for people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a land of plenty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片富饶的土地

Sense.DEF: in large supply or more than enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was food and wine in plenty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物和葡萄酒都很充足。

Sense.DEF: a very large number of something, usually more than you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plethora of suggestions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大堆建议

Sense.DEF: a serious illness which affects your lungs, causing severe pain in your chest
a strong clear type of plastic that can be used instead of glass
able to bend without breaking or cracking
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shoe made of soft pliable leather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔韧的皮革做成的鞋子

Sense.DEF: easily influenced and controlled by other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Senior officials would have preferred a more pliable government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高官们都喜欢较软弱的政府。

Sense.DEF: soft and moving easily in the way that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Isabel was pliant in his arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莎贝尔温顺地依偎在他怀中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her pliant lips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她温软的嘴唇

Sense.DEF: easily influenced and controlled by other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pliant judges have been a problem in the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官没有主见﹐这在过去一直是个问题。

Sense.DEF: a small tool made of two crossed pieces of metal, used to hold small things or to bend and cut wire
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of pliers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把老虎钳

Sense.DEF: a very bad situation that someone is in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the desperate plight of the flood victims
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水灾民的绝境

Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s economic plight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的经济困境

Sense.DEF: to promise someone that you will marry them

a cotton shoe with a flat rubber
sole
Sense.TRAN: 橡胶底帆布鞋﹐胶底运动鞋

Sense.DEF: a line painted on the outside of a ship, showing how low in the water it can safely be when it is loaded
Sense.TRAN: 〔船的〕载重线标志﹐载重吃水线

Sense.DEF:
a square block, usually made of stone, that is used as the base for a
pillar
or
statue
belonging to the period in the Earth’s history that started about five million years ago and continued until about three million years ago
Sense.TRAN: 上新世的〔约五百万年前至三百万年前〕

Sense.DEF: to walk along slowly, especially when this is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 沉重缓慢地走﹐步履艰难地走

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The horse plodded up the hill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那匹马吃力地往山上走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jake kept plodding on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克继续艰难跋涉。
