Sense.DEF: to work slowly or make slow progress, especially in a way that is boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: For years he had plodded along in a series of boring office jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来他一直埋头干着各种枯燥乏味的办公室工作。

Sense.DEF: someone who works slowly and is not very clever
Sense.TRAN: 工作很慢且不太聪明的人

Sense.DEF: someone who walks or does something slowly
slow or thorough and not exciting
Sense.TRAN: 缓慢乏味的﹔单调枯燥的
Sense.EXAMPLE: plodding research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单调乏味的研究

Sense.DEF: to put something down somewhere, especially in a noisy and careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can plonk those bags down anywhere in my room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那几个包你就随便扔在我房间里吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He plonked a couple of glasses on the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把几个玻璃杯重重地放在桌子上。

Sense.DEF: to sit down heavily and then relax
Sense.EXAMPLE: We plonked ourselves down in front of the telly and opened a couple of beers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一屁股坐在电视机前﹐打开了几瓶啤酒。

Sense.DEF: cheap wine
an offensive word for a stupid person
the sound made by something when it falls or is dropped into liquid
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体掉入液体中的〕扑通声﹐啪嗒声

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The soap fell into the bath with a loud plop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肥皂掉进了浴缸里﹐发出很响的扑通声。

Sense.DEF: to fall somewhere, making a sound like something dropping into water

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The frog plopped back into the pond.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 青蛙扑通一声跳回了池塘。

Sense.DEF: to drop something, especially into a liquid, so that it makes a sound
Sense.TRAN: 把…扑通[啪嗒]一声放入〔液体里〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I plopped a couple of ice cubes into the drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把几块冰啪嗒啪嗒放入饮料之中。

Sense.DEF: to sit down or lie down heavily
Sense.EXAMPLE: She plopped down on the sofa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她重重地坐在了沙发上。

Sense.DEF:
a
consonant
sound that is made by completely stopping the flow of air out of your mouth and then suddenly letting it out, as when saying /b/ or /t/
a secret plan by a group of people to do something harmful or illegal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a plot to bomb the UN headquarters
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸毁联合国总部的阴谋

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a plot against the king
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 推翻国王的阴谋

Sense.EXAMPLE: The court heard how she and her lover hatched a plot planned a plot to kill her husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭听取了她和情人密谋杀害她丈夫的案情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plot to overthrow the military government was foiled prevented from being successful .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推翻军政府的秘密计划被挫败了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an assassination plot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一宗暗杀阴谋

Sense.DEF: the events that form the main story of a book, film, or play
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plot was a little confusing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情节有些费解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We discover that Jack isn’t as innocent as he seems, as the plot unfolds gradually becomes clearer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着情节的展开﹐我们发现杰克并不像表面上看起来那么清白。

Sense.DEF: used to say that events seem to be becoming more complicated – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 情况开始复杂起来﹐事情越来越纠缠不清了〔常为幽默用法〕

Subsense.DEF: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
Subsense.TRAN: 〔建筑或种植用的〕小块土地[地皮]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a two-acre plot of land
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块两英亩的土地
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a vegetable plot
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块菜地

Subsense.DEF:
a piece of land that a particular family owns in a
cemetery
, in which members of the family are buried when they die
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a burial plot
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块墓地

Sense.DEF: a drawing that shows the plan of a building at ground level
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had plotted to blow up the White House.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们曾密谋炸毁白宫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suspected that the military were secretly plotting against him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怀疑军方正在密谋推翻他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister was found guilty of plotting the downfall of the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名部长被判犯有阴谋颠覆政府罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the story of a woman who plots revenge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个女人策划报复的故事

Sense.DEF: to draw marks or a line to represent facts, numbers etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We plotted a graph to show the increase in sales figures this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们绘制了一个图表来显示今年销售额的增长情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can plot all these numbers on one diagram for comparison.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在图表上标出所有这些数字以供对比。

Sense.DEF: to mark, calculate, or follow the path of an aircraft or ship, for example on a map
Sense.TRAN: 标绘[计算﹐追踪]〔飞机或船只〕的移动路线
Sense.EXAMPLE: We plotted a course across the Pacific.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们绘制出一条穿越太平洋的航线。

Sense.DEF: someone who makes a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plotters were caught and executed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些密谋者被逮捕并处决了。

Sense.DEF:
a computer program that turns facts, numbers etc into a
graph
or
chart
a piece of farm equipment used to turn over the earth so that seeds can be planted
land that is under the plough is used for growing crops
to turn over the earth using a plough so that seeds can be planted
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days the land was plowed by oxen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那个年代是用公牛来犁地的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ploughed field
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犁过的地

Sense.DEF: to move with a lot of effort or force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We ploughed through the thick mud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在厚厚的淤泥中奋力前行。

Sense.DEF: to do a job or activity that is different from those done by other people, or to do it alone
to continue to do something in spite of opposition or difficulties
Sense.TRAN: 〔指不顾反对或困难〕我行我素 奋力从事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government will plough ahead with tests this year, despite a boycott from teachers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管受到教师的抵制﹐政府今年仍将执意推行这些考试。

Sense.DEF: to use money that you have earned from a business to make the business bigger and more successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Companies can plough back their profits into new equipment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司可以把利润再投资到新设备中。

Sense.DEF: to crash into something or someone, especially while driving, because you are unable to stop quickly enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: I plowed into the car in front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刹车不及﹐撞上了前面的车。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something that is difficult or boring
Sense.TRAN: 继续做〔困难或枯燥的事情〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Julia ploughed on with the endless exam papers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅继续批改那些没完没了的考卷。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked displeased but she ploughed on regardless .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去不高兴了﹐不过她不加理会继续干她的。

Sense.DEF: to read all of something, even though it is boring and takes a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most staff will never want to plough through the manuals that come with the software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数员工根本不愿意坚持读完软件的使用手册。

Sense.DEF: to break up the surface of the ground by travelling over it many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: Horses plough up the paths and make them muddy for walkers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路被马匹踩坏了﹐行路者走起来泥泞不堪。

Sense.DEF: a boy who led a horse that pulled a plough
a man whose job was to guide a plough that was being pulled by a horse
Sense.TRAN: 把[扶]犁人﹐驾马拉犁的人

Sense.DEF:
a simple meal that people eat especially in
pub s
, consisting of bread, cheese,
salad
and
pickle
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在小酒馆吃的〕农夫午餐〔包含面包﹑奶酪﹑色拉和泡菜〕

Sense.DEF:
the broad curved metal blade of a
plough
, which turns over the soil
to stop fighting and start living in peace
a small bird that lives near the sea
Sense.TRAN: 鸻〔一种栖于海边的小鸟〕

Sense.DEF:
the usual American spelling of
plough
a clever and dishonest way of tricking someone so that you can get an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: His usual ploy is to pretend he’s ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他惯用的花招是装病。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a smart ploy to win votes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赢取选票的精明手段

Sense.TRAN:
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= please , used in email or
text message s
请〔用于电子邮件或手机短信〕

Sense.DEF: to pull something quickly in order to remove it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He plucked a couple of plastic bags from the roll.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从那一卷塑料袋里扯下几个。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reaching up, she plucked an apple off the tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往上够了够﹐从树上摘下一个苹果。

Sense.DEF:
to make your
eyebrow s
the shape you want, by pulling out some of the hairs
to take someone away from a place or situation that is dangerous or unpleasant in a quick and unexpected way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some refugee children were plucked out of the country in a number of mercy missions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在数次救助行动中有些儿童难民被拯救出那个国家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was plucked from obscurity made suddenly famous by a Hollywood film producer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被一位好莱坞电影制片人发掘而一举成名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three survivors were plucked to safety after being in the sea for 7 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在海上漂浮了七小时后﹐三名幸存者获救。

Sense.DEF: to pull the feathers off a dead chicken or other bird before cooking it
Sense.TRAN: 拔[退]去〔死鸡或其他禽类〕的毛〔准备烹调〕

Sense.DEF: to force yourself to be brave and do something you are afraid of doing
Sense.TRAN: 鼓起勇气（做某事）﹐振作精神（做某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: He finally plucked up enough courage to ask her out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于鼓起勇气约她出去。

Sense.DEF: to pull the strings of a musical instrument

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone was plucking at the strings of an old guitar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在拨弄一把旧吉他的琴弦。

Sense.LEXUNIT: pluck sth out of the air

Variant.LEXVAR: pluck something out of thin air

Sense.DEF: to say or suggest a number, name etc that you have just thought of, without thinking about it carefully
Sense.TRAN: 随口说出〔一个数字﹑名字等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m plucking a figure out of the air here, but let’s say it’ll cost about $15,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里我随口说一个数字﹐比如说这要大约15,000美元。

Sense.DEF: to pull something quickly several times with your fingers, especially because you are nervous or to attract attention
Sense.TRAN: 〔用手指快速地多次〕揪[拉﹐扯]〔尤指因紧张或要引起注意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kitty’s hands plucked at her black cotton skirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 姬蒂扯了扯自己的黑色棉布裙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The little boy plucked at her sleeve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小男孩拉了拉她的袖子。

Sense.DEF: courage and determination
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes a lot of pluck to stand up to a bully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不向恃强凌弱者屈服需要很大勇气。

Sense.DEF: brave and determined – often used in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 勇敢的﹐果敢的〔常用于报纸上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plucky Denise saved her younger sister’s life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇敢的丹尼丝救了妹妹的命。

Subsense.DEF: a small object at the end of a wire that is used for connecting a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The plug on my iron needs changing.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我熨斗上的插头需要更换了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an electric plug
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电源插头

Subsense.DEF: a place on a wall where electrical equipment can be connected to the main electricity supply

Sense.DEF:
a round flat piece of rubber used for stopping the water flowing out of a bath or
sink
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bath plug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴缸塞子

PIC.HEADING: PLUG 插头；塞子
PIC.PICCONTENT: plug 插头；pin 插脚；chain 链子；plug 塞子；plughole BrE 【英】/drain AmE 【美】排水孔；extension lead BrE 【英】/extension cord AmE 【美】电线延长线；socket/outlet AmE 【美】插座；adapter 适配器；switch 开关

Sense.DEF: a way of advertising a book, film etc by mentioning it publicly, especially on television or radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指电视上或广播中的〕推销﹐宣传

GramExa.EXAMPLE: During the show she managed to put in a plug for her new book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在节目中她设法将自己的新书推销了一番。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a petrol engine that makes a
spark
, which makes the petrol start burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Change the plugs every 10,000 miles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每10,000英里要更换火花塞。

Sense.DEF: to prevent a plan, business etc from being able to continue, especially by deciding not to give it any more money
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过不再提供资金〕使（某事物）不能继续﹐中断﹐停止
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Swiss entrepreneur has pulled the plug on any further investment in the firm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位瑞士企业家不再向这家公司投资。

Sense.DEF: an object or substance that is used to fill or block a hole, tube etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can fill any holes with plugs of matching wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何洞孔都可以用相配的木头塞子堵住。

Sense.DEF: a small plastic tube put in a hole to hold a screw tightly
Sense.TRAN: 〔置于孔内使螺钉固定的〕塑料螺钉衬套﹐螺钉楔子

Sense.DEF: a piece of something pressed tightly together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plug of tobacco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟草块

Sense.DEF: to fill or block a small hole
Sense.EXAMPLE: We used mud to plug up the holes in the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用泥堵住了房顶上的漏洞。

Sense.DEF: to advertise a book, film etc by mentioning it on television or radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔在电视或广播上〕为…做广告﹐宣传﹐推销
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arnie was on the show to plug his new movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿尼参加这个节目以宣传自己的新电影。

Sense.DEF: to provide something that is needed, because there is not enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: With so few trained doctors, paramedics were brought in to plug the gap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 训练有素的医生很少﹐所以引进了医务辅助人员来填补空缺。

Sense.DEF: to shoot someone
to keep working hard at something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you keep plugging away at it, your English will improve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果坚持用功学习﹐你的英语水平会提高的。

Sense.DEF: to connect a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity, or to another piece of electrical equipment
Sense.TRAN: 给〔电器〕接通电源﹔与〔另一电器〕接上﹐插上
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is your printer working?’ ‘Wait a minute – it’s not plugged in.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你的打印机工作正常吗？”“等一下﹐还没插上电源呢。”

Sense.DEF: to connect one piece of electrical equipment to another, or to be connected
Sense.TRAN: 把〔一台电器〕与〔另一电器〕连接起来﹐接通
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your phone can be plugged into the cigarette lighter socket in your car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的电话可以插到车里的点烟器插座上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Games consoles plug into the back of the TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏机可插在电视机的背后。

Sense.DEF: to realize that something is available to be used and use it
Sense.TRAN: 意识到可用后加以利用
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of students don’t plug into all the research facilities we have.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学生都不知道可以利用我们所拥有的全部研究设施。

Sense.DEF: the ability of a computer and a new piece of equipment to be used together as soon as they are connected

the hole in a bath or
sink
that the water flows out of, and which you can put a plug into

Subsense.DEF: if work or effort goes down the plughole, it is completely wasted
Subsense.TRAN: 〔工作或努力〕完全白费﹐付诸东流
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Two years of hard work went right down the plughole.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两年来的辛勤工作全都白费了。

Subsense.DEF: if a business goes down the plughole, it fails and has to close

Sense.DEF: able to be connected to the electricity supply, or to another piece of electrical equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plug-in microphone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有线麦克风

Sense.DEF: a piece of computer software that can be used in addition to existing software in order to make particular programs work properly
a small round juicy fruit which is dark red, purple, or yellow and has a single hard seed, or the tree that produces this fruit
Sense.EXAMPLE: juicy ripe plums
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多汁的成熟李子

Sense.DEF: a dark purple-red colour
something very good that other people wish they had, such as a good job or a part in a play
Sense.TRAN: 令人垂涎的事物〔如称心如意的工作﹑戏剧角色等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first job I had was a real plum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的第一份工作非常称心。

Sense.DEF: a good job etc that other people wish they had
Sense.TRAN: 令人垂涎的工作/角色/差事等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He landed a plum role in a TV mini-series.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一部电视短剧中得到一个人人都向往的角色。

Sense.DEF: having a dark purple-red colour
the feathers covering a bird’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: the parrot’s brilliant blue plumage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只鹦鹉亮丽的蓝色羽毛

Sense.LEXUNIT: plumb the depths (of despair/misery/bad taste etc)
Sense.DEF: to feel an unpleasant emotion in a very extreme way, or to behave in a way that is extremely unpleasant or morally bad
Sense.TRAN: 陷入（绝望/痛苦等的）深渊﹔（品位等）低级至极
Sense.EXAMPLE: When his wife left him, Matt plumbed the very depths of despair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子离他而去﹐马特陷入了绝望的深渊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That night they plumbed the depths of treachery and horror, and murdered the king as he slept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天夜晚他们彻底背叛﹐采用极端恐怖的手段﹐趁国王熟睡之际杀害了他。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in understanding something completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Psychologists try to plumb the deepest mysteries of the human psyche.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理学家试图探究人类心理最深层的奥秘。

Sense.DEF: to connect a piece of equipment such as a washing machine to the water supply
Sense.TRAN: 将〔洗衣机等电器〕与水管接通

Sense.DEF: exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bullet hit him plumb between the eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹正中他的眉心。

Sense.DEF: completely – often used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole idea sounds plumb crazy to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个想法在我听来简直是疯了。

Sense.DEF: exactly upright or level
not exactly upright or level
someone whose job is to repair water pipes, baths, toilets etc
the pipes that water flows through in a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: We keep having problems with the plumbing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的管道老是出问题。

Sense.DEF: the work of fitting and repairing water pipes, baths, toilets etc
a piece of string with a small heavy object tied to one end, used for measuring the depth of water, or for checking whether something such as a wall is built exactly upright
a cloud of smoke, dust etc which rises up into the air
Sense.TRAN: 飘升的烟状物〔如烟﹑尘等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A black plume of smoke rose above the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团黑烟在城市上空升腾。

Sense.DEF: a large feather or bunch of feathers, especially one that is used as a decoration on a hat
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用于装饰帽子的〕羽毛﹐大羽﹔羽饰

Sense.DEF: to rise or come out in a cloud
Sense.EXAMPLE: No smoke plumed out of the factory’s great chimneys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有烟从工厂的大烟囱里飘出来。

Sense.DEF: decorated with feathers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knight with a plumed helmet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴着羽饰头盔的骑士

Sense.DEF: to suddenly and quickly decrease in value or amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Profits plummeted from £49 million to £11 million.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润从4,900万英镑下跌到1,100万英镑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: House prices have plummeted down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价已经暴跌。

Sense.DEF: to fall suddenly and quickly from a very high place
Sense.TRAN: 〔从高处突然而快速地〕坠落﹐掉下
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane plummeted towards the Earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那架飞机直坠向地面。

Sense.DEF:
a plummy voice sounds very
upper-class

like a
plum
in taste, colour etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plummy wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李子香味的葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: slightly fat in a fairly pleasant way – used especially about women or children, often to avoid saying the word ‘fat’
Sense.TRAN: 丰满的﹐胖乎乎的〔尤指女性和儿童﹐常为避免说出fat一词〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse was a cheerful plump woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那护士是个性格开朗﹑体形丰满的女人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby’s nice and plump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个婴儿很可爱﹐胖嘟嘟的。

Sense.DEF: round and full in a way that looks attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: plump soft pillows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓬松柔软的枕头
Sense.EXAMPLE: plump juicy tomatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饱满多汁的番茄

Sense.DEF:
to gently hit
cushion s
or
pillow s
in order to make them rounder and softer
Sense.TRAN: 〔轻拍垫子或枕头〕使更圆﹐使更软

Sense.DEF: to sit down suddenly and heavily
to put something down suddenly and carelessly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plump the bags down anywhere you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些包随便找个地方撂下吧。

Sense.DEF: if dried fruit plumps up, or if you plump it up, it becomes fatter and softer when in liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soak the apricots and raisins until the fruit plumps up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把杏子和葡萄干浸泡到膨胀柔软为止。

Sense.DEF: to choose something or someone after thinking carefully about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally we plumped for a bottle of champagne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我们选了一瓶香槟酒。

Sense.DEF:
a type of tomato shaped like a
plum
, often used in cooking
to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere, especially while fighting in a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指战时〕窃取﹔侵占﹔掠夺﹐抢劫
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rich provinces of Asia Minor were plundered by the invaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小亚细亚的富饶地区遭到侵略者的劫掠。

Sense.DEF: to use up all or most of the supplies of something in a careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unlicensed fishermen have plundered tuna stocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无证渔民滥捕金枪鱼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the egotism of man as he plunders our planet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类挥霍地球资源的自私行为

Sense.DEF: things that have been stolen during a violent attack, especially during a war
Sense.TRAN: 赃物﹔〔尤指〕战利品﹐掠夺物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry’s army returned loaded down with plunder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利的部队满载战利品而归。

Sense.DEF: the act of plundering
Sense.EXAMPLE: fear of invasion and plunder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对侵略和掠夺的恐惧

Sense.DEF: to move, fall, or be thrown suddenly forwards or downwards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her car swerved and plunged off the cliff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的车突然转向﹐冲下了悬崖。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both the climbers had plunged to their deaths .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位攀登者都坠落身亡。

Sense.DEF: if a price, rate etc plunges, it suddenly decreases by a large amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The unemployment rate plunged sharply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率骤降。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oil prices have plunged to a new low .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油价格创了新低。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In the recession, the company’s profits plunged 60%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萧条时期﹐那家公司的利润骤跌了60%。

Sense.DEF: if a ship plunges, it moves violently up and down because of big waves
to start talking or doing something quickly and confidently, especially without thinking about it first
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a difficult situation. You can’t just plunge in and put everything right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况棘手﹐不是贸然行动就解决得了的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t agree,’ she said, plunging into the conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不同意。”她突然加入了谈话。

Sense.DEF:
to jump or
dive
into water
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stripped off and plunged into the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱光衣服跳入海中。

Sense.DEF: to push something firmly and deeply into something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He opened the bag and plunged his hand in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开包﹐把手伸了进去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plunge the pasta into boiling water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把意大利面倒入沸水中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Repeatedly she plunged the knife into his chest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在他的胸膛连刺数刀。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly experience a difficult or unpleasant situation, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.TRAN: （使某人/某物）陷入[遭受]〔某种困难或不利局面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A strike would plunge the country into chaos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工会让国家陷入混乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was suddenly plunged into darkness .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子一下子陷入黑暗之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war, the family plunged into debt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后﹐这家人债台高筑。

Sense.DEF: to decide to do something important or risky, especially after thinking about it for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过长时间思考之后〕决定奋力一搏﹐决定冒险一试
Sense.EXAMPLE: We took the plunge and set up our own business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们毅然决定自己创业。

Sense.DEF: a sudden large decrease in the price, value etc of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dramatic plunge in house prices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价的暴跌

Sense.DEF: a sudden movement down or forwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane began a headlong plunge towards the Earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机开始栽向地面。

Sense.DEF: when someone suddenly becomes involved in something new

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his sudden plunge into marriage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的闪婚

Sense.DEF:
a jump or
dive
into water, or a quick swim

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a quick plunge in the lake
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在湖中游一小会儿泳

Sense.DEF: a tool for clearing waste that is blocking a kitchen or bathroom pipe. It consists of a straight handle with a rubber cup on the end.
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于疏通厨房或浴室水管的〕搋子﹐水拔子﹐橡胶吸盘

Sense.DEF: a part of a machine that moves up and down
if a woman’s dress or shirt has a plunging neckline, the top part at the front is very low
to put or place something somewhere, especially in a noisy, sudden, or careless way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: plans to plunk a theme park on the island
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在岛上建造一座主题公园的草率计划

Sense.DEF: to sit down suddenly or heavily and then relax
Sense.TRAN: 突然[重重]地坐下放松（自己）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you plunk yourself down with a good book?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不拿本好书坐下来放松一下呢？

Sense.DEF: to spend an amount of money on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She plunked down $250 for a silver necklace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她花250美元买了一根银项链。

Sense.DEF:
the
past perfect
tense of a verb
a form of a word that shows you are talking about more than one thing, person etc. For example, ‘dogs’ is the plural of ‘dog’

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Sheep’ remains the same in the plural.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: sheep的复数形式还是sheep。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the plural of ‘mouse’?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: mouse的复数形式是什么？

Sense.DEF:
a plural word or form shows you are talking about more than one thing, person etc. For example, ‘we’ is a plural
pronoun
.
a plural society, system, or culture is one with people from many different religions, races etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain has developed into a plural society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国已发展成一个多元社会。

Sense.DEF: when people of many different races, religions, and political beliefs live together in the same society, or the belief that this can happen successfully
Sense.TRAN: 多元化﹐多元文化﹔多元主义
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nation characterized by cultural pluralism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以多元文化为特色的国家

Sense.DEF: a large number of different things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the plurality of factors affecting the election
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 影响选举的众多因素

Sense.DEF: if one person or party receives a plurality in an election, they receive more votes than any of the other people or parties, but fewer votes than the total number of votes that all the others receive together
Sense.TRAN: 〔选举中未超过半数的〕相对多数票
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Democrats won only a plurality of the votes cast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党人只赢得了相对多数票。

Sense.DEF: when a noun is plural
used to show that one number or amount is added to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three plus six equals nine (3+6=9).
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3 加6等于9。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The total cost was $10,000, plus 14% interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全部费用是1万美元﹐外加14%的利息。

Sense.DEF: and also
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are numerous clubs, plus a casino.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多俱乐部﹐还有一个赌场。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a number may be more or less by a certain amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: There may be a variation of plus or minus 5% in the prices that are quoted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报价可能会有5%上下的变动。

Sense.DEF: something that is an advantage

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some knowledge of Spanish is a definite plus in this job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这份工作懂一些西班牙语绝对占优势。

Sense.DEF:
a
plus sign
used to talk about an advantage or good feature of a thing or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another of the Beach Club’s plus points is that it’s right in the middle of town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滩俱乐部的另一个优点是它就位于城中心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is not an exciting car to drive, but on the plus side it is extremely reliable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车开起来不刺激﹐不过从好的方面来说它非常可靠。

Sense.DEF: used after a number to mean an amount which is more than that number
Sense.EXAMPLE: an income of $50,000 plus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五万多美元的收入
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most children start school when they’re five plus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数孩子五岁多开始上学。

Sense.DEF: more than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures
Sense.TRAN: 在零以上的﹐正的〔尤用于表示温度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daytime temperatures barely reached plus 5˚.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白天的气温仅零上5度。

Sense.DEF: a mark used in a system of judging students’ work. An ‘A plus’ is slightly higher than an ‘A’.
used to add more information
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been studying hard for exams. Plus he’s been working in a bar at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最近在用功复习迎考﹐而且晚上还在一家酒吧里工作。

Sense.DEF: short loose trousers that are fastened just below the knee. Men wore them in the past, especially when playing golf.
Sense.TRAN: 灯笼裤〔旧时男式裤装﹐仅长及膝下﹐尤在打高尔夫球时穿〕

Sense.DEF: very comfortable, expensive, and of good quality
Sense.TRAN: 昂贵而舒适的﹔高级的﹔豪华的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plush hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家豪华酒店
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their casino is the plushest in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的赌场是城里最豪华的。

Sense.DEF: a silk or cotton material with a thick soft surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: plush curtains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长毛绒窗帘

Sense.DEF: the sign (+), showing that you should add two or more numbers together, or that a number is more than zero

an object that goes around the Sun, usually beyond Neptune, which was called a
planet
until
Sense.EXAMPLE: the discovery of Pluto in 1930
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1930年冥王星的发现

Sense.DEF: a ruling class or government that consists of rich people, or a country that is governed by rich people
Sense.TRAN: 富豪[财阀]统治阶层﹔由财阀组成的政府﹔由财阀统治的国家

Sense.DEF: someone who has power because they are rich – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 有钱有势的人﹐财阀﹐富豪〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: champagne-drinking plutocrats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝香槟的富豪们

Sense.DEF:
a
radioactive
metal that is used in the production of
nuclear
power, and in nuclear weapons. It is a chemical element: symbol Pu
Sense.TRAN: 钚〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Pu〕

Sense.DEF: to work at your business, especially buying and selling things on the street
Sense.TRAN: 从事工作﹔〔尤指在街头〕经营生意
Sense.EXAMPLE: In some areas, drug dealers openly ply their trade on street corners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些地区﹐毒贩公然在街角进行交易。

Sense.DEF: if a ship, bus etc plies between two places or across a place, it does that journey regularly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two ferries ply between Tripoli and Malta every day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天有两艘渡船往返于的黎波里和马耳他。

Sense.DEF: to try to get customers or passengers, in order to do business
Sense.EXAMPLE: Continental airlines ply for trade in the UK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲大陆的航空公司希望在英国开展业务。

Sense.DEF: to use a tool skilfully
to keep giving someone large quantities of food or drink
Sense.TRAN: 不断地给〔某人大量食物和饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The local people plied me with beer, until I could barely move.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人一个劲地灌我啤酒﹐最后我几乎动弹不了了。

Sense.DEF: to keep asking someone questions
a unit for measuring the thickness of thread, rope, plywood etc, based on the number of threads or layers that it has
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweater in four-ply yarn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四股毛线织成的毛衣

Sense.DEF: a material made of several thin layers of wood that are stuck together to form a strong board

used after numbers expressing the time, to show that it is between
noon
and
midnight
Sense.TRAN: 下午〔用于表示钟点的数字之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting starts at 2.30 pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议下午两点半开始。

Sense.DEF:
the
prime minister
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meeting with the PM
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与首相的会面

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=portable media player便携式媒体播放器

Sense.DEF:
the unpleasant physical and emotional feelings that many women have before their
period
starts

the unpleasant physical and emotional feelings that many women have before their
period
starts
filled with air
Sense.EXAMPLE: pneumatic tyres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充气轮胎

Sense.DEF: worked by air pressure
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pneumatic pump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气动泵

Sense.DEF: a large powerful tool worked by air pressure and used for breaking up hard materials, especially road surfaces
a serious illness that affects your lungs and makes it difficult for you to breathe
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was taken to hospital, suffering from pneumonia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得了肺炎﹐被送往医院。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=post office邮政局
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=postal order邮政汇票

Subsense.DEF: to cook an egg in or over gently boiling water, without its shell
Subsense.EXAMPLE: poached eggs on toast
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤面包片加水煮荷包蛋

Subsense.DEF: to gently cook food, especially fish, in a small amount of boiling water, milk etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Poach the salmon in white wine and water.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把三文鱼放在白葡萄酒和水里煨。

Sense.DEF: to illegally catch or shoot animals, birds, or fish, especially on private land without permission
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指未经允许在私人土地上〕偷猎﹐偷捕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Deer have been poached here for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来这里一直有人偷偷地猎鹿。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone who belongs to another organization, team etc to leave it and join yours, especially in a secret or dishonest way
Sense.TRAN: 挖走〔公司﹑球队等的成员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That company’s always poaching our staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司老是挖我们的员工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several of their reporters were poached from other papers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有几个记者是从其他报社挖过去的。

Sense.DEF: to take and use someone else’s ideas unfairly or illegally

GramExa.EXAMPLE: characters poached from Shakespeare
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从莎士比亚作品中剽窃的人物

Sense.DEF: to do something that is someone else’s responsibility, especially when they do not want you to do it

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the poaching of elephants for their ivory tusks
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 为获取象牙偷猎大象的行为

Sense.DEF: someone who illegally catches or shoots animals, birds, or fish, especially on private land without permission
someone who used to do illegal things or have a bad attitude to authority, and who has now changed completely – used especially of someone who is now in a position of authority
Sense.TRAN: 改邪归正的人﹔〔尤指〕当年造反现在掌权的人

Sense.DEF: a pan with small containers shaped like cups used for poaching eggs
used before a number as an address at a post office where letters to you can be sent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Write to P.O. Box 714, Key Largo, Florida.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来信请寄往佛罗里达州基拉戈岛714号邮政信箱。

Sense.DEF: covered with small holes or marks
Sense.TRAN: 布满小洞的﹔满是麻点的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His face was pocked with scars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上坑坑洼洼全是疤痕。

Sense.DEF: a type of small bag in or on a coat, trousers etc that you can put money, keys etc in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luke came in with his hands in his pockets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢克走了进来﹐双手插在口袋里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The keys are in my trouser pocket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钥匙在我的裤子口袋里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the inside pocket of his jacket
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他夹克的内袋

Sense.EXAMPLE: The policeman told me to turn out my pockets take everything out of them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察让我把口袋里的东西都掏出来。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that you have to spend
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are eight hotels, with a price range to suit every pocket .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有八家宾馆﹐房价适合各种程度的消费者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dan had to pay for the repairs out of his own pocket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹必须自己掏腰包支付修理费用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of diverting some of the firm’s money into his own pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控将公司的部分钱款据为己有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deepening recession has hit people’s pockets .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日益加剧的经济衰退影响到了人们的消费水平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For investors with deep pockets a lot of money , the Berlin property market is attractive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对资金雄厚的投资者来说﹐柏林房地产市场很有吸引力。

Sense.DEF: a small bag or piece of material fastened to something so that you can put things into it
Sense.TRAN: 〔固定于某物上用于装东西的〕小袋
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please read the air safety card in the pocket of the seat in front.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请阅读您前面座椅口袋中的飞行安全卡。

Sense.DEF: a small area or amount of something that is different from what surrounds it
Sense.TRAN: 〔与周围区域不同的〕一小片﹐少量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In some parts, there are still pockets of violence and unrest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在某些地区﹐仍然存在零星的暴力事件和骚乱。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: pockets of air inside the hull of the ship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船体内部的少量空气

Sense.DEF: to be controlled or strongly influenced by someone in authority, and willing to do whatever they want
Sense.TRAN: 受某人的控制[巨大影响]〔因而对其百依百顺〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge was in the defense lawyer’s pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位法官对辩护律师言听计从。

Sense.DEF: to be certain to win something such as a competition or an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Democrats had the election in their pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党在选举中稳操胜券。

Sense.DEF: if you are out of pocket, you have less money than you should have, especially as a result of making a mistake or being unlucky
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he loses the deal, he’ll be badly out of pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果丢掉这笔生意﹐他就会大受损失。

Sense.DEF: if two people are in each other’s pockets, they are together too much

a small net on a
pool
,
snooker
, or
billiard
table, which you try to hit balls into

Crossrefto.REFLEX: burn a hole in your pocket

Sense.DEF: to put something into your pocket
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie locked the door and pocketed the keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉锁上门﹐把钥匙放进口袋里。

Sense.DEF: to steal money, especially money that you are responsible for
Sense.EXAMPLE: One inspector had pocketed up to $500,000 in bribes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名视察员收受了高达50万美元的贿赂。

Sense.DEF: to get a large amount of money, win a prize etc, especially in a way that seems very easy or slightly dishonest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnston pocketed $2,500 in prize money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰斯顿得到了2,500美元的奖金。

Sense.DEF:
to hit a ball into a pocket in the game of
pool
,
snooker
or
billiards
small enough to be carried in your pocket
Sense.TRAN: 可放在衣袋内的﹐袖珍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pocket dictionary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袖珍词典

Sense.DEF: a fairly small fighting ship
the amount of money that you have, or your ability to pay for things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aim was to provide a car for every age and pocketbook .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目标是为每个年龄层和收入层的人士提供汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Older voters are most concerned about pocketbook issues that concern money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年纪较大的选民最关心钱的问题。

Sense.DEF:
a
handbag

a
wallet

a
notebook
a small piece of electronic equipment that you use to do calculations
a small or unimportant amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money is nothing – pocket change to them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那点钱不算什么﹐对他们来说微不足道。

Sense.DEF: coins that you carry in your pocket
the amount that can fit in a pocket

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pocketful of coins
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一口袋硬币

Sense.DEF:
a
handkerchief
a pocket-handkerchief garden or area of land is very small and usually square
a small knife with one or more blades that fold into the handle
a small amount of money that parents give regularly to their children, usually every week or month
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much pocket money do you get?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你拿多少零花钱？

Sense.DEF: a small amount of extra money that you earn in order to spend it on things you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: I give a few private lessons too, for pocket money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也做些家教﹐赚点零用钱。

Sense.DEF: small enough to fit into your pocket or be carried easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: pocket-sized dictionaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袖珍词典

Sense.DEF:
a method used by the US President to stop a
bill proposal for a new law
. The President keeps the proposal without signing it until Congress is not working any more.
Sense.TRAN: 袋中否决﹐搁置否决〔指美国总统将国会通过的法案搁置起来不予签署﹐直到国会休会﹐从而阻止其生效〕

Sense.DEF: a hollow mark on someone’s skin or on the surface of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮肤上的〕痘痕﹐麻点﹔〔物体表面的〕凹坑

Sense.DEF: covered with hollow marks or holes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pockmarked skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有痘痕的皮肤

Sense.DEF:
a long narrow seed container that grows on various plants, especially
pea s
and beans
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pea pod
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豌豆荚

Crossrefto.REFLEX: like two peas in a pod

Sense.DEF: a part of a space vehicle that can be separated from the main part
Sense.EXAMPLE: a space pod
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞船分离舱

Sense.DEF: a long narrow container for petrol or other substances, especially one carried under an aircraft wing

a group of sea animals, such as
whale s
or
dolphin s
, that swim together
a container which holds the eggs of some types of insects
very annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was really p.o.’d when she didn’t get the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有得到那份工作﹐气得火冒三丈。

Sense.DEF:
a radio programme that can be
download ed
from the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 播客〔可从因特网上下载的一种广播节目〕

Sense.DEF:
to make a radio programme available to be
download ed
from the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show is to be podcast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该节目将提供播客下载。

Sense.DEF:
another form of
pudgy
a doctor who takes care of people’s feet and treats foot diseases

a small raised area for a performer, speaker, or musical
conductor
to stand on
Sense.TRAN: 表演台﹔讲台﹔乐队指挥台

Sense.DEF: a high sloping surface for putting an open book or notes on while you are giving a speech to a lot of people – some people think that this use is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于放置打开的书﹑演讲笔记等的〕斜面高桌〔有人认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several speakers took the podium spoke from it that night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天晚上有几个人发表了演讲。

Sense.DEF: a podunk place is small and unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob’s from some podunk town in Iowa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃来自艾奥瓦州的一个无名小镇。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of writing that expresses emotions, experiences, and ideas, especially in short lines using words that
rhyme end with the same sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I decided to write a poem about how I felt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定把我的感受写成一首诗。

Sense.DEF: someone who writes poems
a female poet
relating to poetry, or typical of poetry
Sense.EXAMPLE: poetic expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诗歌的表达方式

Sense.DEF: having qualities of deep feeling or graceful expression
Sense.TRAN: 富有诗意的﹔表达优雅的﹔诗一般的
Sense.EXAMPLE: poetic language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有诗意的语言

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone suffers, and you think they deserve it because they did something bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the way she treated Sam, it’s only poetic justice that Dave left her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那样对待萨姆﹐戴夫离开她真是她的报应。

Sense.DEF: the freedom that poets and other artists have to change facts, ignore grammar rules etc, because what they are making is poetry or art
a poet who is chosen by a king, queen, president etc to write poems on important national occasions
poems in general, or the art of writing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He reads a lot of poetry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大量阅读诗歌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a poetry magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诗歌杂志

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a selection of religious poetry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教诗歌选

Sense.DEF: a quality of beauty, gracefulness, and deep feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The way she moves on the court is sheer poetry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在球场上的动作简直太优美了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His golf swing is poetry in motion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打高尔夫球的挥杆动作透出行云流水般的优雅。

Sense.DEF: having an unfriendly disapproving expression on your face
Sense.TRAN: 板起面孔的﹐表情严峻的

Sense.DEF: a toy used for jumping, that consists of a pole with a spring near the bottom, a bar across the pole that you stand on, and a handle at the top
a planned killing of large numbers of people, usually done for reasons of race or religion
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常出于种族或宗教原因的〕屠杀

Sense.DEF: making you feel sad or full of pity
Sense.TRAN: 令人伤心的﹐令人充满同情[惋惜]的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a poignant reminder of our nation’s great sacrifices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人心酸地回忆起我们国家曾作出巨大牺牲的一个事物

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a poignantly expressed tribute to his father
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 献给他父亲的语气悲恸的悼词

Sense.DEF: a tropical plant with groups of large red or white leaves that look like flowers
Sense.TRAN: 一品红﹐猩猩木〔一种热带植物〕

Sense.DEF: a single fact, idea, or opinion that is part of an argument or discussion
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a very interesting point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个观点很有趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made some extremely good points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她提出了一些很不错的观点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三个要点我们必须记住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This brings me to my next point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样我就要讲到下一点了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I agree with John’s point about keeping the costs down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我同意约翰关于维持低成本的观点。

Sense.DEF: the most important fact or idea
Sense.TRAN: 要点﹐重点﹔中心意思﹐主要含义﹔核心问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: The point is, at least we’re all safely back home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要的是﹐至少我们都安全回家了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody knows exactly how it works. That’s the whole point .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人知道它到底是怎么工作的﹐这才是问题所在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He may not have stolen the money himself, but that’s not the point .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他本人也许没偷那笔钱﹐不过那不是关键。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d get to the point talk about the most important thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你能切入正题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll come straight to the point talk about the most important thing first .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就直奔主题了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to find out who killed Alf, and more to the point what is more important I need to do it before anyone else gets killed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得查出是谁杀了阿尔夫﹐更重要的是﹐得在其他人被害之前查出凶手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all like him, but that’s beside the point not the most important thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都喜欢他﹐不过这并不是最重要的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you’ve missed the point you have not understood the most important thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你没听懂重点。

Sense.DEF: the purpose or aim of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suppose we could save one or two of the trees, but what’s the point ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们可以拯救一两棵树﹐不过那有什么意义呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the point of this meeting anyway?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么这次会议到底有什么意义？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole point of this legislation is to protect children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项立法旨在保护儿童。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no point in worrying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 担心是没有用的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to lose anyway, so I can’t see the point of playing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管怎么说我们都会输﹐我不明白去比赛还有什么意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t see the point in moving to London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白为什么要搬到伦敦去。

Sense.DEF: a particular place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident happened at the point where the A15 joins the M1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故发生在A15公路和M1公路的交会处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No cars are allowed beyond this point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车辆不得越过此处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a border crossing point
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过境站
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cairo is a convenient departure point for tours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开罗是外出旅游便捷的出发地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dover is a point of entry into Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多佛尔是到英国的一个入境口。

Sense.DEF: an exact moment, time, or stage in the development of something
Sense.TRAN: 时候﹐时刻﹔〔发展的〕阶段﹔程度﹔地步
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had reached a point in my career where I needed to decide which way to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的事业到了需要决定何去何从的阶段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had got to the point where she felt that she could not take any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经到了忍无可忍的地步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their win over old rivals Manchester United was the high point best part in their season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 击败老对手曼彻斯特联队是他们赛季中最精彩的时刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales reached a low point in 1996.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1996 年销量跌入低谷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will take last week’s riots as a starting point for our discussion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将从上星期的骚乱开始讨论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At one point, I thought he was going to burst into tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一度认为他要哭出来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe at this point we should move onto some of the practical experiments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许现在我们应该开始做一些应用实验了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that point, I was still living at home and had no job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候﹐我仍和父母亲一起住﹐没有工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will probably sell the car at some point in the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将来某个时候你很可能会卖掉这辆车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is impossible to give a definite answer at this point in time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在不可能作出明确答复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some children are bullied to the point of suicide until they reach this stage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些孩子被欺负到要自杀的地步。

Sense.DEF: a particular quality or feature that something or someone has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes she had to remind herself of his good points.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候她不得不提醒自己﹐他有一些优点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They would spend hours discussing the finer points small details about qualities and features of various cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们会花上几小时讨论各种汽车的细节问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The low price is one of its main selling points features that will help to sell it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低价是其主要卖点之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Driving was not one of Baxter’s strong points .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾车不是巴克斯特的强项。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the club’s plus points is that it is central.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家俱乐部的一大优点是位于市中心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were some weak points in his argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的论据有一些不足之处。

Sense.DEF: one of the marks or numbers that shows your score in a game or sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is three points behind the leader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他落后领先者三分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leeds United are now six points clear at the top of the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹联队现在以六分的优势排名榜首。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had to win this point .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她必须拿下这一分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You get three point s for a win and one point for a draw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赢了得三分﹐打平得一分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You lose a point if you do not complete the puzzle on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不能按时解出字谜就失一分 。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fight went the full fifteen rounds, and in the end the American won on points .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛进行了整整15个回合﹐最后美国选手以点数取胜。

Sense.DEF: a sharp end of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sharp point of a spear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矛的尖头

Sense.DEF: the temperature at which something boils, freezes, melts etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heat the water until it reaches boiling point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把水煮开。

Sense.DEF: a stage in a process or activity when it becomes impossible to stop it or do something different
Sense.TRAN: 有进无退[欲罢不能]的地步

GramExa.PROPFORM: reach/pass the point of no return
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was aware that we had passed the point of no return.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我意识到我们没有退路了。

Sense.DEF: an idea which you use to start a discussion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He takes the idea of personal freedom as his point of departure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将人身自由这一观点作为他的出发点。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on the point of (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: to be going to do something very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was on the point of giving up the search when something caught my eye in the bushes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正要放弃搜索时突然注意到灌木丛中有什么东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country’s economy is on the point of collapse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国经济处于崩溃的边缘。

Sense.DEF: partly, but not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I agree with you up to a point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在某种程度上同意你的看法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That is true, but only up to a point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说得有道理﹐不过只限于某种程度。

Sense.DEF: dealing only with the important subject or idea, and not including any unnecessary discussions
Sense.TRAN: 简明恰当的﹔简洁中肯的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her comments were brief and to the point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的评论简短扼要。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a point of doing sth
Sense.DEF: to do something deliberately, even when it involves making a special effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a point of spending Saturdays with his children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六他必定要和自己的孩子在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always make a point of being early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是特意提前到。

Sense.LEXUNIT: when/if it comes to the point
Sense.DEF: used to talk about what happens when someone is in a difficult situation and has to make a difficult decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure that if it came to the point, he would do what is expected of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定﹐如果到了必要的时刻﹐他会做人们期盼他做的事情的。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that something is true, although it may seem unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were assured that the prisoners were being well treated, when in point of fact they were living in terrible conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得到保证﹐犯人们的待遇不错﹐但实际上他们的生活条件非常恶劣。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not to put too fine a point on it
Sense.DEF: used when you are saying something in a very direct way
Sense.TRAN: 直言不讳地说﹐实话实说﹐说句老实话
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s lying, not to put too fine a point on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说句老实话﹐她在撒谎。

Sense.DEF:
a sign (.) used to separate a whole number from any
decimal s
that follow it
a mark or measure on a scale
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stock market has fallen by over 200 points in the last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去的一周内股市已经下跌两百多点。

Sense.DEF: a very small spot of light or colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stars shone like points of light in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜空繁星闪烁﹐犹如一个个光点。

Sense.DEF:
one of the marks on a
compass
that shows direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soldiers were advancing on us from all points of the compass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们从四面八方向我们逼近。

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of land that stretches out into the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sailed round the point into a small, sheltered bay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们驾船绕过岬角驶入一个小小的避风港。

Sense.DEF: a piece of plastic with holes in it which is attached to a wall and to which electrical equipment can be connected
Sense.EXAMPLE: a telephone point
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话插座
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electrical point
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电源插座

Sense.DEF: a piece of railway track that can be moved to allow a train to cross over from one track to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train rattled over the points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车轰隆隆地驶过道岔。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think that’s a very good point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这个观点很不错。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has made an interesting point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提出了一个有意思的观点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: That’s an important point to bear in mind.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一点很重要,得记住。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s making a joke but there is a serious point there as well.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在开玩笑,但其中也不无严肃的观点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She raised a number of valid points.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她提出了一些合理的意见。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’d like to make one further general point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想再大致讲一点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He makes the point that predicting behaviour is not easy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提出,对行为作出预测并不容易。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make people understand it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think we got our point across.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我们已经阐明了观点。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: mention it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was going to raise that point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打算提出那一点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A simple example will illustrate the point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 举个简单的例子就能说明这个观点。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: prove that what you say is right
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was determined to prove his point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决心要证明自己的观点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I don’t understand your point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉,我不明白你的意思。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: understand or agree with it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: OK, I take your point. But it’s not that easy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯,我懂你的意思,但这没那么容易。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have made a good point
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Maybe she has a point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许她的意见有道理。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: keep saying something
used to say to someone that you accept what they say
Collocate.EXAMPLE: All right, point taken – I should have asked you first.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧,同意你的看法,我是应该先征求你的意见。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the small details

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the noun point in spoken and written English.名词point在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to show something to someone by holding up one of your fingers or a thin object towards it
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Look!’ she said and pointed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “看呀！”她用手指着说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could see him pointing at me and telling the other guests what I had said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他指着我并告诉其他客人我说了些什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was pointing to a small boat that was approaching the shore.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指着驶近岸边的一艘小船。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The driver pointed with his whip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾车人用他的鞭子指了指。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She pointed in the direction of the car park.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指着停车场的方向。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood up and pointed his finger at me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起来﹐用手指指着我。

Sense.DEF: to hold something so that it is aimed towards a person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 用〔某物〕对准〔某人或某物〕﹐使指向

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stood up and pointed his gun at the prisoner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起身﹐举枪对准了那个犯人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She produced a camera and pointed it at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿出相机对准了我。

Sense.DEF: to face or be aimed in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arrow always points north.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 箭头始终指向北方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were flashlights all around us, pointing in all directions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们周围都是手电筒﹐对着各个方向照射。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were TV cameras pointing at us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视摄像机正对着我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hands of the clock pointed to a quarter past one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 时钟的指针指向一点一刻。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We found footprints pointing towards the back door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发现了走向后门的脚印。

Sense.DEF: to show someone which direction they should go in
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pointed me towards an armchair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指着一把扶手椅叫我过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you point me in the direction of the bathroom, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问洗手间怎么走？

Sense.DEF: to suggest what someone should do
Sense.EXAMPLE: My teachers were all pointing me towards university.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的老师都建议我上大学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A financial adviser should be able to point you in the right direction .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理财顾问应该能给你指点迷津。

Sense.DEF: to suggest that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything seemed to point in one direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切似乎都指向一个方向。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the evidence pointed towards Blake as the murderer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有证据都表明布莱克是凶手。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everything points to her having died from a drugs overdose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每项证据都表明她死于药物过量。

Sense.DEF:
to put new
cement
between the bricks of a wall
to stretch the ends of your feet downwards
to blame someone or say that they have done something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew that they would point the finger at me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他们会责怪我的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to point a finger of blame at anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想指责任何人。

Subsense.DEF: to show the direction that something is in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An old-fashioned signpost pointed the way to the restaurant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个老式的路标指向去那家餐厅的路。

Subsense.DEF: to show how something could change or develop successfully
Subsense.TRAN: 指出〔变化或发展的〕方向

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This report points the way forward for the water industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告指出水利工业的发展方向。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a government paper which points the way towards reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 指出改革方向的政府文件

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something that they did not already know or had not thought about
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was always very keen to point out my mistakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是急不可待地指出我的错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The murder was obviously well planned, as the inspector had pointed out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如督察指出的那样﹐这桩凶案显然是经过周密策划的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some economists have pointed out that low inflation is not necessarily a good thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些经济学家指出﹐低通货膨胀率不一定是好事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thank you for pointing this out to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你向我指出这一点。

Sense.DEF: to show something to someone by pointing at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luke pointed out two large birds by the water’s edge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢克指出水边有两只大鸟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll point him out to you if we see him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是看到他﹐我会指给你看。

Sense.DEF: to mention something because you think it is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many politicians have pointed to the need for a written constitution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多政治家都提出需要一部成文宪法。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem more important or more noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: These cases point up the complete incompetence of some government departments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事例凸显了某些政府部门十分无能。

Sense.DEF: if you say or refuse something point-blank, you do it directly and without trying to explain your reasons
Sense.TRAN: 直截了当地﹐干脆地﹐断然地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused point-blank to identify his accomplices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他断然拒绝指认他的同谋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I told him point-blank that I didn’t want to get involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我直截了当地告诉他我不想参与。

Sense.DEF: a gun fired point-blank is fired very close to the person or thing it is aimed at
Sense.EXAMPLE: The victim was shot point-blank in the chest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害者被近距离射中胸部。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The bullet was fired at point-blank range .

Sense.DEF:
if
ballet
dancers are on pointe, they are dancing on the ends of their toes with their feet in a vertical position
having a point at the end
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pointed beard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把山羊胡

Sense.DEF: a direct question, look etc that deliberately shows that you are annoyed, bored, or disapprove of something
Sense.TRAN: 尖锐的问题/犀利的目光/刻薄的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pointed remark about my being late
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对我迟到说的一句尖刻的话

Sense.DEF: in a way that is deliberately meant to show that you are annoyed, bored, or disapprove of something
Sense.TRAN: 明确地﹔尖锐地﹔直言不讳地
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked pointedly at the clock on the kitchen wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刻意看了看厨房墙上的钟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I thought you were leaving,’ she said pointedly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我以为你要走了呢。”她毫不掩饰地说道。

Sense.DEF: a useful piece of advice or information that helps you to do or understand something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ralph gave me some pointers on my golf swing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫就我打高尔夫球的挥杆姿势提出了一些建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a few useful pointers about using the technique
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于该技能运用的一些有用建议

Sense.DEF: something that shows how a situation is developing, or is a sign of what might happen in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an encouraging pointer to an improvement in the economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 表明经济有起色的一个令人鼓舞的迹象
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The local elections were seen as a pointer to the general elections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方选举被视为大选的风向标。

Sense.DEF:
the small symbol, usually an
arrow
, that you move using a computer’s
mouse
to point to the place on the screen where you want to work, start a program etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Position the mouse pointer and click.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把光标对准位置并点击。

Sense.DEF: a long stick used to point at things on a map, board etc
a thin piece of metal that points to a number or direction on a piece of equipment, for example on a measuring instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pointer was between 35 and 40 pounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指针位于35和40磅之间。

Sense.DEF: a hunting dog that stands very still and points with its nose to where birds or animals are hiding
Sense.TRAN: 〔能站着不动用鼻子指示猎物隐藏处的〕指示猎犬

Sense.DEF: a style of painting popular in the late 19th century that uses small spots of colour all over the painting, rather than brush strokes
Sense.TRAN: 点彩派﹐点彩画法〔19世纪晚期流行的一种绘画风格〕

Sense.DEF: the substance that is put in the spaces between the bricks or stones in a wall, or the way that this substance is put in the spaces
worthless or not likely to have any useful result
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life just seemed pointless to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活对我来说简直没什么意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pointless quarrel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无谓的争吵

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s pointless telling her to clean her room – she’ll never do it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫她打扫自己的房间没有用﹐她绝对不会去干的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is pointless to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think it would be pointless to discuss this issue again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为再讨论这个问题毫无意义。

Sense.DEF: someone with a very important job or a lot of responsibility for a particular subject in a company or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或组织中〕担任重要工作的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the administration’s point man on health care
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在医疗保健领域的特派员

Sense.DEF: a soldier who goes ahead of a group to see if there is any danger
a rule used to organize an official meeting

GramExa.GLOSS: according to a rule
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One MP raised an objection on a point of order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名下议院议员按议事规则提出了反对。

Sense.DEF: something you already know about that helps you understand a situation
the place or shop where a product is sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under the new law, cigarette advertising will only be allowed at the point of sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据这条新的法律﹐香烟广告只允许出现在销售点。

Sense.DEF: a particular way of thinking about or judging a situation

GramExa.PROPFORM: scientific/technical/business etc point of view From
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an economic point of view , the new development will benefit the town greatly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从经济的角度来看﹐新的开发项目会给该镇带来极大好处。

Sense.DEF: someone’s own personal opinion or attitude about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I respect your point of view, but I’m not sure I agree with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尊重你的观点﹐但我还是不敢苟同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From my point of view, there is no way they can win.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为﹐他们不可能赢。

Sense.DEF: a calm confident way of behaving, combined with an ability to control your feelings or reactions in difficult situations
Sense.TRAN: 镇定﹐自信﹐泰然自若﹐沉着
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louisa seems to have much more poise and confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易莎似乎更加沉着自信了。

Sense.DEF: a graceful way of moving or standing, so that your body seems balanced and not awkward
Sense.EXAMPLE: the poise of a dancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞者的端庄体态
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s pretty, but lacks poise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她虽漂亮﹐但缺乏优雅的举止。

Sense.DEF: to put or hold something in a carefully balanced position, especially above something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He poised the bottle over her glass. ‘More wine?’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把酒瓶凑到她杯子上面:“还要酒吗？”

Sense.DEF: not moving, but ready to move or do something at any moment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She waited by the door like a small animal poised for flight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她等在门边﹐就像一只随时准备逃走的小动物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His finger was poised on the camera’s shutter release.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手指按在相机的快门上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stood on the edge of the roof, poised to jump.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在屋顶的边缘﹐准备往下跳。

Sense.DEF: completely ready to do something or for something to happen, when it is likely to happen soon
Sense.TRAN: 准备好〔做某事〕﹔蓄势待发

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spain was poised to become the dominant power in Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙已准备好成为欧洲的霸主。

GramExa.PROPFORM: poised on the brink/edge of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The economy is poised on the edge of collapse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济处于崩溃边缘。

Sense.DEF: to be in a position or situation in which two things have an equally strong influence
Sense.TRAN: 介于某事物和某事物之间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The world stood poised between peace and war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界处在和平和战争之间。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a calm confident way, and able to control your feelings and reactions
Sense.TRAN: 镇定的﹐自信的﹐泰然自若的﹐沉着的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abigail walked to the microphone, poised and confident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿比盖尔镇定而自信地走向麦克风。

Sense.DEF: a substance that can cause death or serious illness if you eat it, drink it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Belladonna and red arsenic are deadly poisons .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颠茄和雄黄都是致命的毒物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a box of rat poison poison to kill rats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盒鼠药
Sense.EXAMPLE: He swallowed some type of poison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吞下了某种毒药。

Sense.DEF: something such as an emotion or idea that makes you behave badly or become very unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 使人不愉快的情绪﹐有害的思想
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hatred is a poison that will destroy your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仇恨是一种毒药﹐它会毁掉你的生活。

Sense.DEF: a humorous way of asking which alcoholic drink someone would like
Sense.TRAN: 你想喝什么穿肠毒物？〔指酒﹐幽默用法〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: one man’s meat is another man’s poison

Sense.DEF: to give someone poison, especially by adding it to their food or drink, in order to harm or kill them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was accused in 1974 of poisoning her second husband, Charles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1974 年她被控毒死了她的第二任丈夫查尔斯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He killed several people by poisoning their tea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在茶里下毒杀死了几个人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Helms attempted to poison his whole family with strychnine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫尔姆斯企图用马钱子碱毒死全家人。

Sense.DEF: if a substance poisons someone, it makes them sick or kills them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of children were poisoned by radiation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数千名儿童遭受辐射的毒害。

Sense.DEF: to make land, rivers, air etc dirty and dangerous, especially by the use of harmful chemicals
Sense.TRAN: 尤指有害化学物〕污染〔土地﹑河流﹑空气等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pesticides are poisoning our rivers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀虫剂正在污染我们的河流。

Sense.DEF: to have very harmful and unpleasant effects on someone’s mind, emotions, or a situation
Sense.TRAN: 毒害〔思想﹑情绪等〕﹐对…有不良的影响﹐危害
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her childhood had been poisoned by an abusive stepfather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的童年被粗暴的继父毁掉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law will only serve to poison relations between the US and Mexico.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法律只会危害美国和墨西哥的关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Television violence is poisoning the minds of young people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视暴力毒害着年轻人的思想。

Sense.DEF: an important job that someone is given, which is likely to cause them a lot of trouble
Sense.TRAN: 金杯毒酒〔喻指可能给接受者带来很多麻烦的重要工作〕

Sense.DEF: gas that causes death or serious injury, used especially against an enemy in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are reports that poison gas is being used against the rebels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有报道称正在使用毒气对付叛乱者。

Sense.DEF: illness caused by swallowing, touching, or breathing in a poisonous substance

GramExa.GLOSS: caused by a particular substance
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a case of alcohol poisoning
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精中毒的病例

Sense.DEF: the act of giving poison to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: An autopsy revealed no evidence of poisoning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸检没有发现下毒迹象。

Sense.DEF:
a North American plant that has an oily substance on its leaves that makes your skin hurt and
itch
if you touch it
Sense.TRAN: 毒常春藤﹐气根毒藤〔北美的一种植物﹐皮肤与之接触会感到痛痒〕

Sense.DEF:
a North American plant with leaves similar to an
oak
tree’s, that makes your skin hurt and
itch
if you touch it
Sense.TRAN: 毒栎﹔栎叶漆〔北美的一种植物﹐皮肤与之接触会感到痛痒〕

Sense.DEF: containing poison or producing poison
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some mushrooms are extremely poisonous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些蘑菇有剧毒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: poisonous gases such as hydrogen sulfide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硫化氢等有毒气体
Sense.EXAMPLE: poisonous substances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒物质
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was bitten on the ankle by a poisonous snake .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被毒蛇咬了脚踝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The berries are poisonous to birds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些浆果鸟儿吃了会中毒。

Sense.DEF: full of bad and unfriendly feelings
Sense.TRAN: 充满敌意的﹐令人很不愉快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the poisonous atmosphere of the office
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里的敌对气氛

Sense.DEF: someone who is poisonous seems to get pleasure from causing arguments, unhappiness etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕以挑拨是非为乐的﹔恶毒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: That poisonous bastard Lucett told Morris I was seeing his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个搬弄是非的混蛋卢塞特告诉莫里斯我在和他的妻子约会。

Sense.DEF: a letter that is not signed and that says bad things about the person it has been sent to
something in a company’s financial or legal structure that is intended to make it difficult for another company to take control of it
Sense.TRAN: 毒丸计划〔指公司在财务或法律结构上反收购的一个策略〕

Sense.DEF: to quickly push your finger or some other pointed object into something or someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Andy poked the fish with his finger to see if it was still alive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪用手指戳了戳那条鱼﹐看它是否还活着。

GramExa.PROPFORM: poke sb in the eye/arm/ribs etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be careful with that umbrella or you’ll poke someone in the eye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心你的伞﹐别戳到别人的眼睛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was poking at the dust with a stick, making little patterns.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用一根棍子在尘土上拨来划去﹐弄出各种小图案。

Sense.DEF: to move or push something through a space or opening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He poked a hand into one of his pockets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把一只手插进口袋。

Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the nurses poked her head around the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一名护士从门里探出头来。

Sense.DEF: if something is poking through or out of something else, you can see part of it but not all of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ella looked at the tiny face poking out of the blanket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉看着那张露在毛毯外面的小脸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Weeds had started poking through the cracks in the patio.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露台上已经有杂草开始从缝隙里钻出来。

Sense.DEF: to make a hole or hollow area in something by pushing something pointed into or through it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Poke a hole in the dough, and then form it into a rounded shape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在面团上戳个洞﹐把它揉成环形。

Sense.DEF: to find mistakes or problems in a plan or in what someone has said
Sense.TRAN: 在某事物中挑毛病[找漏洞]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Defense attorneys tried to poke holes in Rodger’s story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辩护律师试图找出罗杰陈述中的漏洞。

Sense.DEF: to make fun of someone in an unkind way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the kids were poking fun at Judy because of the way she was dressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中有些孩子在嘲笑朱迪的穿着。

Sense.DEF: to take an interest or get involved in someone else’s private affairs, in a way that annoys them
Sense.TRAN: 过问某事﹐插手某事〔指令人恼火地干预别人的私事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sick of your mother poking her nose into our marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很厌烦你妈妈插手我们的婚姻。

Sense.DEF: to move coal or wood in a fire with a stick to make it burn better

to show someone on a
social networking site
that you want to communicate with them
Sense.TRAN: “捅”﹐“戳”〔在社交网站上表示想与某人交谈〕

Sense.DEF: not polite to have sex with a woman
to move very slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kept the car in the slow lane, poking along at about 40 miles an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把车开在慢车道上﹐以大约40英里的时速缓缓行驶。

Sense.DEF: to look for something, especially by moving a lot of things around

GramExa.EXAMPLE: James began poking about in the cupboard, looking for the sugar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯开始在柜子里乱翻着找糖。

Sense.DEF: to try to find out information about other people’s private lives, business etc, in a way that annoys them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop poking around in my business!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再打听我的事了！

Sense.DEF: to spend time in shops, markets etc looking at nothing in particular
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent Sunday afternoon poking around an old bookshop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天下午我在一家老书店打发时间。

Sense.DEF: to try to find out information about other people’s private lives, business etc, in a way that annoys them
to quickly push your fingers, a stick etc into something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vanessa gave me a playful poke in the ribs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦妮莎开玩笑地戳了一下我的肋骨。

Sense.DEF: a criticism of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bennett took a poke at the President’s refusal to sign the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本内特批评总统拒绝签署议案。

Sense.DEF:
the act of showing someone on a
social networking site
that you want to communicate with them
Sense.TRAN: “捅”﹐“戳”〔在社交网站上表示想与某人交谈〕

Sense.DEF: a card game that people usually play for money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you play poker ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会玩扑克吗？

Sense.DEF: a metal stick used to move coal or wood in a fire to make it burn better
showing no expression on your face
Sense.TRAN: 面无表情的﹐不动声色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a poker-faced officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面无表情的警官

Sense.DEF: pictures or patterns burned onto the surface of wood or leather with hot tools, or the art of making these pictures
Sense.TRAN: 〔在木头或皮革上的〕烙画（艺术）

Sense.DEF: a prison
too small and not very pleasant or comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole family was crammed into two poky little rooms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全家人挤在两间狭小的房间里。

Sense.DEF: doing things very slowly, especially in a way that is annoying
Sense.TRAN: 慢吞吞的﹐缓慢的﹐磨磨蹭蹭的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got behind some poky driver on the freeway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在高速公路上﹐我跟在一个慢吞吞的司机后面。

Sense.DEF: a politician – used in newspapers
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s just another Washington pol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不过是华盛顿的另一个政客。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone from Poland. Do not use this word.
close to or relating to the North Pole or the South Pole
Sense.TRAN: 地极的﹔近地极的﹔极地的
Sense.EXAMPLE: As our climate warms up, the polar ice caps will begin to melt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着地球气候逐渐变暖﹐极地的冰冠将开始融化。

Sense.DEF: something that is the complete or exact opposite of something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ortega’s cheerful landscapes are the polar opposites of Miller’s dark, troubled portraits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥尔特加明快的风景画同米勒阴郁的肖像画截然相反。

Sense.DEF:
relating to one of the
pole s
of a
magnet
a large white bear that lives near the North Pole

a British spelling of
polarize
a state in which people, opinions, or ideas are completely different or opposite to each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑意见或观念的〕截然相反﹐截然对立

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the polarity between the intellect and the emotions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理智与情感的对立

Sense.DEF: the state of having either a positive or negative electric charge
to divide into clearly separate groups with opposite beliefs, ideas, or opinions, or to make people do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The issue has polarized the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题使整个国家变得两极化。

Sense.DEF: in the past, a camera that used a special film to produce a photograph very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 宝丽来照相机﹐拍立得照相机

Sense.DEF: a photograph taken with a Polaroid camera
Sense.TRAN: 宝丽来一次成像照片﹐拍立得相片

Sense.DEF: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a telephone pole
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话线杆

Sense.DEF:
the most northern or most southern point on a
planet
, especially the Earth
Sense.TRAN: 〔行星的〕地极﹔〔尤指地球的〕北[南]极
Sense.EXAMPLE: the distance from pole to equator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地极到赤道的距离

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Amundsen’s expedition was the first to reach the South Pole.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿蒙森的探险队是最早到达南极的队伍。

Sense.DEF: two people or things that are poles apart are as different from each other as it is possible to be
Sense.TRAN: 〔两人或两事物〕截然相反﹐大相径庭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both are brilliant pianists, though they’re poles apart in style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们两位都是卓越的钢琴家﹐然而在风格上却大相径庭。

Sense.DEF: one of two situations, ideas, or opinions that are the complete opposite of each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种情况﹑观念或意见〕截然相反的两极之一﹔极端

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have enormous wealth at one pole, and poverty and misery at the other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一方面有着巨大的财富﹐另一方面又存在着贫穷和困苦。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Washington and Beijing are at opposite poles think in two completely different ways on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上﹐华盛顿和北京看法完全不同。

Subsense.DEF:
one of two points at the ends of a
magnet
where its power is the strongest

one of the two points at which wires can be attached to a
battery
in order to use its electricity

Sense.DEF: to push a boat along in the water using a pole
someone from Poland
very surprised and shocked
Sense.TRAN: 非常惊讶的﹐目瞪口呆的﹐震惊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was poleaxed when I heard I’d passed the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说自己通过了考试﹐简直惊呆了。

Sense.DEF: unable to stand because something has hit you very hard
Sense.TRAN: 〔因受重击而〕不能站立的﹐被击倒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He staggered and collapsed as if poleaxed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摇摇晃晃﹐然后像是被猛击了一下似的瘫倒在地。

Sense.DEF: a small dark brown wild animal that lives in northern Europe and can defend itself by producing a bad smell

a
skunk
the activity of dancing around a long upright metal post in a sexually exciting way, done by women wearing few or no clothes, in order to entertain people in some clubs or bars
a written or spoken statement that strongly criticizes or defends a particular idea, opinion, or person
Sense.TRAN: 猛烈的抨击﹔激烈的争论﹔论战
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before long, the dispute degenerated into fierce polemics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久争论就演变为激烈的论战。

Sense.DEF: the practice or skill of making written or spoken statements that strongly criticize or defend a particular idea, opinion, or person
using strong arguments to criticize or defend a particular idea, opinion, or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reforms were attacked in a highly polemical piece in the ‘New Yorker’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《纽约客》一篇措辞强硬的文章猛烈抨击了这些改革。

Sense.DEF: the front position at the beginning of a car or bicycle race
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车或自行车赛开始时的〕杆位﹐首发位置

Sense.DEF: a star that is almost directly over the North Pole and that can be seen from the northern part of the world
the sport of jumping over a high bar using a long pole
the people who work for an official organization whose job is to catch criminals and make sure that people obey the law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police surrounded the courthouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察围在法院大楼四周。

Sense.DEF: the official organization whose job is to catch criminals and make sure that people obey the law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quick! Call the police!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快报警！
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time the police arrived the man had fled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等警察到达时﹐那人已逃走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was arrested by the police for dangerous driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因危险驾驶被警察逮捕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plans to join the police when he leaves school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打算毕业后去当警察。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Police and the police are plural. police
F2NBox.TRAN: 和 the police 是复数名词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Police are still searching for the murder weapon.
The police were called.
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say 不要说 ‘a police’. Say 而要说 a police officer, a policeman, or 或 a policewoman.

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Staff called the police when they noticed a broken window.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工注意到一块窗玻璃被打碎便报了警。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think we should tell the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们应该告诉警察。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Why are so many crimes not reported to the police?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么有这么多罪案未报警？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sussex Police are investigating a break-in at the club.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨塞克斯警方正在调查一宗俱乐部盗窃案。

Collocate.COLLOC: the police arrest sb/make an arrest

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially say that someone will be judged in a court for committing a crime
keep them at a police station

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Armed police surrounded the house.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装警察包围了这幢房子。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Uniformed police and plainclothes detectives were present in large numbers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现场有大批穿制服的警察和便衣警探。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Despite a police investigation, no arrests were made.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管警方进行了调查,但没有人被逮捕。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a surprise visit made by the police to search for something illegal
