Collocate.EXAMPLE: Six people were arrested in a police raid on the bar.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 六人在警方突击搜查酒吧时被逮捕。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a police officer or officers that go with someone to guard or protect them
building where the police work

Sense.DEF: to keep control over a particular area in order to make sure that laws are obeyed and that people and property are protected, using a police or military force
Sense.TRAN: 〔动用警察或军队〕对…实施管制﹐维持…的治安
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army was brought in to police the city centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调来军队维持市中心的治安。

Sense.DEF: to control a particular activity or industry by making sure that people follow the correct rules for what they do
Sense.TRAN: 控制﹐监督〔某活动或行业〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The agency was set up to police the nuclear power industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设立这个机构是为了监督核电工业。

Sense.DEF:
a
community support officer
Sense.TRAN: 社区服务警察﹐社区警务支援员

Sense.DEF: a police officer of the lowest rank
the official police organization in a particular area or city
Sense.TRAN: 〔某地区或城市的〕警察局﹐警察部门

Sense.DEF: a dog trained by the police to find hidden drugs or catch criminals
the official police organization in a country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones joined the police force in 1983.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯于1983年加入警察部队。

Sense.DEF: a male police officer
a member of the police
a country where the government strictly controls people’s freedom to meet, write, or speak about politics, travel etc
the local office of the police in a town, part of a city etc
a female police officer
the way that the police are used to keep control over a particular area and to protect people and property
Sense.EXAMPLE: The community is demanding a less aggressive style of policing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区民众要求警察执勤时凶巴巴的态度有所收敛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the policing of the city
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城的警务工作

Sense.DEF: the way that an industry or activity etc is controlled in order to make sure that people obey the rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔对行业﹑活动等的〕监督﹐管理﹐检查
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the last twenty years the industry has had no oversight or policing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去的20年里﹐该行业无人监管。

Sense.DEF: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a foreign policy adviser
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交政策顾问
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has adopted a strict no-smoking policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司实行了严格的禁烟制度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: government policy on higher education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的高等教育政策
GramExa.EXAMPLE: US policy towards China
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的对华政策

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is (sb’s) policy to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is hospital policy to screen all mothers with certain risk factors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有母亲都须接受某些风险因素的筛查﹐这是医院的规定。

Sense.DEF: a contract with an insurance company, or an official written statement giving all the details of such a contract
Sense.EXAMPLE: an insurance policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险单
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a clause in the policy that I’d like to discuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险单中有一个条款我想商讨一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just renewed the policy arranged for it to continue .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚刚续保。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does the policy cover theft and fire?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份保险承保失窃和火灾吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can take out a policy buy one for as little as $11.00 a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你每月只需花费区区11美元就可买一份保险。

Sense.DEF: a particular principle that you believe in and that influences the way you behave

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is sb’s policy to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s always been my policy not to gossip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不说三道四是我一贯的处事原则。

Sense.DEF: someone who has bought insurance for something
someone who decides what an organization’s or government’s policies will be

a serious infectious disease of the nerves in the
spine
, that often results in someone being permanently unable to move particular muscles
Sense.TRAN: 脊髓灰质炎﹐小儿麻痹症
the abbreviation of 缩写=political science政治学

Sense.DEF: to make something smooth, bright, and shiny by rubbing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent all afternoon polishing the silver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整个下午都在擦拭银器。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Polish the lenses with a piece of tissue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用纸巾揩拭镜片。

Sense.DEF: to improve a piece of writing, a speech etc by making slight changes to it before it is completely finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your essay is good, you just need to polish it a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的文章不错﹐只要稍加润色就可以了。

Subsense.DEF: to finish food, work etc quickly or easily
Subsense.TRAN: 很快吃完﹔迅速[轻松]做完
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sam polished off the rest of the pizza.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆把剩下的比萨饼一扫而光。

Subsense.DEF: to kill or defeat a person or animal when they are weak or wounded
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was polished off with a shotgun blast to the face.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被猎枪击中面部身亡。

Sense.DEF: to improve a skill or an ability by practising it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should polish up your Spanish before you go to Chile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去智利以前你应该提高一下西班牙语。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem better or more attractive to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company needs to polish up its image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司需要改善一下形象。

Sense.DEF: to polish something
a liquid, powder, or other substance that you rub into a surface to make it smooth and shiny
Sense.TRAN: 上光剂﹔擦光剂﹔上光蜡﹔亮漆

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 家具上光剂/鞋油/地板蜡等

Sense.DEF: an act of polishing a surface to make it smooth and shiny
Sense.EXAMPLE: An occasional polish will keep wall tiles looking good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔擦拭一下能使墙砖保持美观。

Sense.DEF: a high level of skill or style in the way someone performs, writes, or behaves
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carla’s writing has potential, but it lacks polish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡拉在写作方面很有潜力﹐但技巧还不够纯熟。

Sense.DEF: the smooth shiny appearance of something produced by polishing
relating to Poland, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 波兰的﹔波兰人的﹔波兰语的

Sense.DEF: people from Poland
the language used in Poland
shiny because of being rubbed, usually with polish
Sense.EXAMPLE: highly polished boots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 擦得很亮的靴子

Sense.DEF: done with great skill and style
Sense.TRAN: 精湛的﹔完美的﹔优雅的﹔精致的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a polished performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精彩的演出
Sense.EXAMPLE: a polished piece of writing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的文章

Sense.DEF: polite, confident, and graceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a polished and confident man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优雅自信的男人

Sense.DEF: a machine used to polish something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric floor polisher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电动地板打蜡机

Sense.DEF: the most important decision-making committee of a Communist party or Communist government
Sense.TRAN: 〔共产党或共产党政府的〕政治局

Sense.DEF: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always very polite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是很有礼貌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: polite, well-behaved children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 懂礼貌﹑守规矩的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a clear but polite request
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明确但客气的请求

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is polite (of sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We left the party as soon as it was polite to do so.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在不失礼节的情况下尽早离开了聚会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not polite to talk with your mouth full.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满嘴食物时讲话是不礼貌的。

Sense.DEF: you make polite conversation, remarks etc because it is considered socially correct to do this, but not necessarily because you believe what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 礼节性的﹐客套的﹐应酬的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: While they ate, they made polite conversation about the weather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃饭的时候﹐他们礼貌地谈论天气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan expressed polite interest in Edward’s stamp collection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简对爱德华的邮票收藏礼貌地表示兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know Ian said he liked her singing, but he was only being polite .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道伊恩说过喜欢听她唱歌﹐不过那仅仅是客套话而已。

Sense.DEF: among people who are considered to have a good education and correct social behaviour – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 在文雅人中间〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t use words like that in polite company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在文雅人面前你不能使用那样的词语。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I help you?’ she asked politely.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “有什么可以帮您？”她礼貌地问道。

Exponent.DEF: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was too polite to ask how old she was.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很有礼貌,不会问她的年龄。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Excuse me, sir,’ she said in a polite voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “先生,对不起打扰一下。”她客气地说道。

Exponent.DEF: having good manners and knowing the correct way to behave in social situations
Exponent.TRAN: 有礼貌的,文雅的,端庄的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was beautifully dressed and very well-mannered.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着优雅,举止很文雅。

Exponent.DEF: polite and not causing any trouble – used about children or animals
Exponent.TRAN: 〔孩子〕彬彬有礼的﹐规规矩矩的﹔〔动物〕安分的﹐听话的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children were very well-behaved.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些孩子很规矩。

Exponent.DEF: polite and respectful, and behaving rather formally
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel staff were very courteous and helpful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾馆的员工非常有礼貌,也很愿意帮忙。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a courteous reply
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 礼貌的回答

Exponent.DEF: polite and treating someone with respect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was very respectful towards all my relatives.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我所有的亲戚都很礼貌。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Thank you,’ he said with a respectful bow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “谢谢！”他礼貌地鞠躬说道。

Exponent.DEF: polite in a formal way, especially when you do not feel very friendly towards someone
Exponent.TRAN: 有礼貌的﹐客气的〔尤用于感觉对某人不太友好时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’d never liked her father-in-law, but she forced herself to be civil to him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直不喜欢自己的公公,但对他强装客气。

Exponent.DEF: polite towards someone, especially because they are in a more important social position
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对社会地位较高者〕恭敬的,顺从的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In those days women were expected to be deferential to men.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那个年代女人被要求顺从男人。

Sense.DEF: sensible and likely to gain you an advantage
Sense.TRAN: 明智的﹐精明的﹔考虑周到的﹔慎重的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is politic to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would not be politic to ignore the reporters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无视记者可不是上策。

Sense.DEF: relating to the government, politics, and public affairs of a country
Sense.TRAN: 政府的﹔政治（上）的﹔政权的﹔有关行政的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Education is now a major political issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育目前是个主要的政治议题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a time of political and social change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治与社会变革的时期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The U.S. has two main political parties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国有两大政党。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN is seeking a political solution rather than a military one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国正在寻求政治上而非军事上的解决方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: political jokes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治笑话
Sense.EXAMPLE: the workers’ struggle for political power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人争取政治权力的斗争

Sense.DEF: relating to the ways that different people have power within a group, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a purely political decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯粹从权位利益上考虑的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: The appointment was given to Wellington, mainly for political reasons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任命威灵顿主要是出于权力关系上的考虑。

Sense.DEF: interested in or active in politics
Sense.TRAN: 对政治感兴趣的﹐政治上活跃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most students aren’t very political.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数学生对政治都不怎么感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: a difficult problem which opposing politicians argue about or which each side deals with in a way that will bring them advantage
Sense.TRAN: 政治足球〔指对立的政客争论的难题或双方都以有利于自己的方式来处理的问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Funding of the health service has become a political football.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共医疗保健服务的资金问题已成了被踢来踢去的政治足球。

Sense.DEF:
an organization formed by a business,
union
, or
interest group
to help raise money for politicians who support their ideas
Sense.TRAN: 政治行动委员会〔由某个企业﹑工会或利益集团成立的组织﹐旨在为支持自己主张的政客筹集资金〕

Sense.DEF: the right to stay in another country if you cannot live safely in your own country because of the political situation there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Refugees were seeking political asylum in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民在英国寻求政治庇护。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No country would grant give him political asylum .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有一个国家愿意为他提供政治避难。

Sense.DEF: language, behaviour, and attitudes that are carefully chosen so that they do not offend or insult anyone – used especially when you think someone is too careful in what they say or how they behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Political correctness has had an impact on the language people use to describe women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治正确性影响着人们说到女性时所用的语言。

Sense.DEF: the study of the way nations organize the production and use of wealth
the study of the way the Earth’s surface is divided up into different countries, rather than the way it is marked by rivers, mountains etc
in a political way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women were becoming more politically active.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女在政治上变得越来越活跃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politically sensitive issue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治上敏感的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politically, raising the minimum wage is good for the Democrats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从政治上来说﹐提高最低工资对民主党有好处。

Sense.DEF: language, behaviour, and attitudes that are politically correct are carefully chosen so that they do not offend or insult anyone
Sense.TRAN: 〔语言﹑行为﹑态度〕政治上正确的﹐政治得体的
Sense.EXAMPLE: politically correct textbooks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治上正确的课本

Sense.DEF: language, behaviour, or attitudes that are politically incorrect might offend or insult someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔语言﹑行为﹑态度〕政治上不正确的﹐政治不得体的
Sense.EXAMPLE: politically incorrect jokes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治上不正确的玩笑

Sense.DEF: the system used by people with the same political interests to make sure that political decisions give advantages to themselves or to their group
Sense.TRAN: 政治机器〔指政治利益相同的人为确保政治决策给自身或所在团体带来好处而采用的体制〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Chicago mayor’s political machine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥市长的政治机器

Sense.DEF: someone who is in prison because they have opposed or criticized the government of their own country
the study of politics and government
someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: politicians who are trying to get the minority vote
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 努力争取少数族群选票的政治家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a British Labour politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国工党政治家

Sense.DEF: someone who is skilled at dealing with people or using the situation within an organization to gain an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: the office politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 善于搞办公室政治的人

Sense.DEF: to make a subject or a situation more political
Sense.TRAN: 使政治化﹐使具有政治性
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Olympic Games should not be politicized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运会不应该政治化。

Sense.DEF: to make someone become more involved in political activities
Sense.TRAN: 使参与政治﹔使对政治敏感
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became politicised during his years in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐牢的那些年开始关心政治。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Abortion is a highly politicized issue.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 堕胎是一个被高度政治化的问题。

Sense.DEF: political activity, usually done to gain support for yourself or your political group
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常为了自身利益或自己的政治团体而进行的〕政治活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: the politicking at the party conference
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政党大会上的政治活动

Sense.DEF: a politician or someone who is active in politics – usually used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 政客﹐政治上活跃的人〔通常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slick politico
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油滑的政客

Sense.DEF: relating to both politics and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: politico-economic factors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治和经济的因素

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: ideas and activities relating to gaining and using power in a country, city etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a good understanding of politics in China
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对中国政治很好的了解
Sense.EXAMPLE: modern American politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代美国政治
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politics have always interested Anita.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿妮塔一直对政治感兴趣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brooke’s been involved in city politics since college.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁克从读大学时起就参与所在城市的政治活动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president should stand above party politics working only for your political party .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统应当置身于党派政治之外。

Sense.DEF: the profession of being a politician
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flynn retired from politics in 1986.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗林于1986年退出政坛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father’s trying to enter politics .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲正试图踏入政坛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith went into politics in his early twenties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯二十出头就从政了。

Sense.DEF: the activities of people who are concerned with gaining personal advantage within a group, organization etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某团体﹑组织等内的〕争权活动﹔权术﹔派别之争
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m tired of dealing with all of the office politics .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对付那些办公室政治让我烦透了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her art examines sexual politics how power is shared between men and women .

Sense.DEF: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

Sense.DEF: the study of political power and systems of government

Sense.DEF: a particular form of political or government organization, or a condition of society in which political organization exists
Sense.TRAN: 政体﹐政权形态﹐政治制度

Sense.DEF: a very quick simple dance for people dancing in pairs, or a piece of music for this dance

Sense.DEF: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result
Sense.TRAN: 民意调查﹐民意测验﹔民意调查结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: A recent poll found that 80% of Californians support the governor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的一项民意调查发现80%的加利福尼亚人支持州长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Polls indicate that education is the top issue with voters.

Sense.EXAMPLE: Labour is ahead in the polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党在民意调查中处于领先地位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The latest public opinion poll showed that 25% of us consider ourselves superstitious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新的民意调查显示我们中有25%的人认为自己迷信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a poll conducted by ‘USA Today’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由《今日美国》进行的一次民意测验

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a poll on eating habits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于饮食习惯的一项民意测验

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a poll of 1,000 people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 千人民意调查

Sense.DEF: to vote in an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ten million voters went to the polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1,000 万选民参加了投票。

Sense.DEF: the process of voting in an election, or the number of votes recorded
Sense.EXAMPLE: Labour won the election with 40% of the poll.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党以40%的选票赢得选举。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The result of the poll won’t be known until around midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举结果要到午夜前后才公布。

Sense.DEF: the place where you can go to vote in an election

Sense.DEF: to ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们调查的妇女当中有18%的人说丈夫有酗酒问题。

Sense.DEF: to get a particular number of votes in an election

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党只得到4%的选票。

Sense.DEF: to cut the top off a tree in order to make the lower branches grow more thickly

the day on which people vote in an election
the place where people go to vote in an election

Sense.DEF: a person or organization that causes pollution

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a list of Canada’s worst polluters

Sense.DEF: the process of making air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use, or the state of being dangerously dirty

GramExa.EXAMPLE: air pollution from traffic fumes

Sense.TRAN: 〔由于劳累﹑厌烦等而〕停止〔做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan pooped out about halfway through the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹体力不济﹐中途退出了比赛。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to do something you have already said you would do, because you are tired or not interested
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于劳累或不感兴趣而〕变卦

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Is Bill coming along?’ ‘Nah, he’s pooping out on us.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “比尔一起去吗？”“不去﹐他变卦了。”

Sense.DEF: if a machine or piece of equipment poops out, it stops working
Sense.EXAMPLE: The laptop’s battery pooped out after only two hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笔记本电脑的电池才两小时就用完了。

Sense.DEF: the floor on the raised part at the back of an old sailing ship
very tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was really pooped by the end of the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天下来我真的是筋疲力尽。

Sense.DEF:
a small
spade
and a container, used by dog owners for removing their dogs’ solid waste from the streets
written official instructions or information

Subsense.DEF: having very little money and not many possessions
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her family were so poor they couldn’t afford to buy her new clothes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她家穷得甚至买不起新衣服给她。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an area where poor people lived
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穷人居住区
Subsense.EXAMPLE: one of the poorest countries in the world
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上最贫穷的国家之一
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a poor part of Chicago where a lot of poor people live
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥的一个贫民区
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My grandparents grew up dirt poor very poor .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖父母在赤贫的环境里长大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of the families are desperately poor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中许多家庭极度贫困。

Subsense.DEF: people who are poor
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s the government’s responsibility to help the poor.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接济穷人是政府的责任。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tax relief for the working poor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对贫困打工族的减税

Sense.DEF: not as good as it could be or should be
Sense.TRAN: 不佳的﹐差的﹐次等的﹐低劣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soil in this area is very poor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一地区土壤很贫瘠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: poor rates of pay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很低的薪酬
Sense.EXAMPLE: He blames himself for the team’s poor performance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因球队的不佳表现而自责。

GramExa.GLOSS: not made well or not made of good materials
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The jacket was of very poor quality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件夹克质量非常差。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her hearing is poor, so speak fairly loudly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的听力不好﹐所以你要说得很大声才行。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make/do a poor job of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The builders did a really poor job of fixing our roof.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些建筑工人为我们修房顶﹐活儿干得很糟糕。

Sense.DEF: used to show sympathy for someone because they are so unlucky, unhappy etc
Sense.TRAN: 可怜的﹔不幸的﹔令人同情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor kid, he’s had a rough day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的孩子﹐今天他真倒霉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You poor thing , you’ve had a hard time of it, haven’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的东西﹐你过得很苦﹐是不是？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor old Ted was sick for weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的老特德病了几个星期。

Sense.DEF: not good at doing something
Sense.TRAN: 不善于…的﹐对…不熟练的﹐差的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a poor public speaker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拙于演讲的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s poor at sports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不擅长体育运动。

Sense.DEF: someone whose health is poor is ill or weak for a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents are both in rather poor health .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母的身体都很不好。

Sense.DEF: lacking something that is needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country is poor in natural resources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国自然资源匮乏。

Sense.DEF: the act of finishing a race, competition etc a long way behind the person ahead of you
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛中〕被远远抛在后面的第二名/第三名等
Sense.EXAMPLE: McLean won easily, and Benson was a poor second.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克莱恩轻松获胜﹐本森取得第二名﹐但成绩落后一大截。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Socialists came a poor second with 26.5% of the vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会党位居第二﹐但票数远远落后﹐只得到26.5%的选票。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is like a very famous performer, writer etc but is not as good as they are
Sense.TRAN: 蹩脚的某人〔表示某人像某著名艺人﹑作家等﹐但相形见绌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the poor man’s Elvis Presley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个蹩脚的埃尔维斯 · 普雷斯利。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something can be used for the same purpose as something else, and is much cheaper
Sense.EXAMPLE: Herring is the poor man’s salmon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲱鱼算是穷人的三文鱼。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is not treated as well as other members of a group or is much less successful than they are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Theatre musicians tend to be the poor relations of the musical profession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧院乐师在音乐界中往往低人一等。

Exponent.DEF: having very little money and not many possessions – used about people or places
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many families were too poor to pay for education.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多家庭穷得付不起学费。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: poor countries
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困国家

Exponent.DEF: having very little money, especially for a short period of time. Skint is more informal than the other words.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指短期内〕拮据的,手头紧的〔skint 与其他词相比更不正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m a bit hard up at the moment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我手头有点紧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We were so broke we couldn’t afford to go out to the cinema.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们穷得没钱去看电影。

Exponent.DEF: much poorer than other people in a country, and not having the things that are necessary for a comfortable or happy life – used about people and areas
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The charity works with deprived children in the inner city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一慈善机构专门帮助贫民区的贫困儿童。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: one of the most deprived areas of London
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦最穷的地区之一

Exponent.DEF: used about groups of people in society who have much less chance of being successful because they are poor
Exponent.TRAN: 〔社会群体〕贫困的〔指因贫穷而缺乏成功的机会〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: An increase in the minimum wage would help the most disadvantaged Americans.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高最低工资能帮助最贫困的美国人。

Exponent.DEF: having very little money, and so needing help – used about groups of people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: More help should be given to needy families.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该对贫困家庭提供更多的帮助。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We offer scholarships for needy students.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向贫困学生提供奖学金。

Exponent.DEF: having no money or possessions and nowhere to live – used when someone is in a very bad situation
Exponent.TRAN: 贫困的〔尤用于某人陷于困境时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her family was left destitute after her father died.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲去世后全家人的生活就陷入了贫困。

Exponent.DEF: impoverished people and places are very poor
Exponent.EXAMPLE: out-of-work miners and their impoverished families
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业的矿工及其贫困的家庭
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children come from impoverished neighbourhoods.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些儿童来自贫穷街区。

Exponent.DEF: extremely poor
Exponent.EXAMPLE: poverty-stricken areas
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 赤贫地区
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were left poverty-stricken.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一贫如洗。

Exponent.DEF: having no money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She died penniless.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她死时身无分文。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a penniless student
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困学生

Sense.DEF: a sandwich made with a long bread roll – used especially in the southern US
Sense.TRAN: 长面包卷﹐大型三明治〔尤在美国南方使用〕

Sense.DEF: the state of not having any money
Sense.EXAMPLE: If Jimmy keeps spending like this, he’s going to end up in the poorhouse .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米要是一直这样花钱﹐到头来会身无分文。

Sense.DEF: a building where very poor people in the past could live and be fed, which was paid for with public money
badly
Sense.TRAN: 糟糕地﹐不好地﹐拙劣地﹐蹩脚地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jana’s doing poorly in school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让娜的学习成绩不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: poorly educated workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文化程度低的工人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article was poorly written.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章写得很差。

Sense.DEF: ill
Sense.TRAN: 身体不舒服的﹐健康状况不佳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matt’s wife’s been very poorly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特的妻子身体一直不好。

Sense.DEF: someone who is poorly off does not have very much money

the main character in the humorous book The Diary of a Nobody (1892) by George Grossmith. Mr Pooter is a very ordinary man, and he describes his daily life in the book. He is sometimes not sure about the socially-correct way to behave, and he often makes mistakes that make him feel very embarrassed. The word ‘Pooterish’ can be used to describe someone who takes themselves too seriously.
Sense.TRAN: 普特尔先生〔格罗史密斯的幽默作品《小人物日记》（1892）中的主角。 Pooterish 一词可用来描写某个过于把自己当回事的人〕

Sense.DEF: to spend time pleasantly, doing things that are not very important
to come suddenly or unexpectedly out of or away from something
Sense.TRAN: 突然[出人意料]地从〔某物〕中出来﹐蹦出﹐离开﹐脱落

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The top button popped off my shirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我衬衫最上面的那颗纽扣突然掉了下来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ball popped out of Smith’s hands and onto the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球突然从史密斯的手中弹到了地上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The egg cracked open and out popped a tiny head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋裂开了﹐里面冒出一个小脑袋来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The lid popped open and juice spilled all over the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖子噗的一声弹开﹐果汁溅了一地。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere quickly, suddenly, or in a way that you did not expect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you pop by the next time you’re in town?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你下次到城里来时顺便过来一下吧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to pop into the drugstore for a second.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要去一下药店。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you pop round to the shop for some bread?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能跑一趟商店买些面包回来？

Sense.DEF: to quickly put something somewhere, usually for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll just pop these cakes into the oven.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把这些蛋糕放进烤箱就好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Barry popped his head round the door to say hello.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴里从门后探出头来问好。

Sense.DEF: to make a short sound like a small explosion, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wood sizzled and popped in the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木头在火中咝咝作响﹐发出噼啪声。

Sense.DEF: to burst, or to make something burst, with a short explosive sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: A balloon popped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个气球啪的一声爆了。

Sense.DEF: if your ears pop, you feel the pressure in them suddenly change, for example when you go up or down quickly in a plane
Sense.TRAN: 〔在飞机等中迅速升降时〕耳压突然变化

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s eyes popped (out of their head)
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone looked extremely surprised or excited
Sense.TRAN: 某人眼珠子都快掉出来了〔指极度惊讶或兴奋〕

Sense.DEF: to suddenly think of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: All at once an idea popped into her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脑子里突然冒出一个念头。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to marry you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hasn’t Bill popped the question yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔还没有求婚吗？

Sense.DEF:
to take
pill s
too often, or to take too many at one time
to hit someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you say that again, I’ll pop you one .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你再说我就揍你。

Sense.DEF:
to cook
popcorn
until it swells and bursts open, or to be cooked in this way
humorous to die
Sense.TRAN: 翘辫子﹐上西天﹐一命呜呼

Sense.DEF: to die suddenly
to quickly put on a piece of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here, pop on your pyjamas and then we’ll read a story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐快穿上睡衣﹐然后我们来读故事。

Sense.DEF: to quickly turn on a piece of electrical equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pop the kettle on, would you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把水壶开关打开﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: if words pop out, you suddenly say them without thinking first
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to say it like that – it just popped out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不是有意要那样说的﹐只是冲口而出。

Sense.DEF: to appear, sometimes unexpectedly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Click here, and a list of files will pop up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点击此处﹐文件列表就会弹出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her name keeps popping up in the newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字不断出现在报纸上。

Sense.DEF: modern music that is popular, especially with young people, and usually consists of simple tunes with a strong beat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new pop record
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的流行音乐唱片
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pop star
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流行音乐歌星
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pop festival
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流行音乐节

Sense.DEF: a sudden short sound like a small explosion
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pop of a champagne cork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香槟酒瓶塞砰的一声
Sense.EXAMPLE: The balloon went pop made a sudden short sound .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气球啪的一声破了。

Sense.DEF: a sweet drink with bubbles but no alcohol, or a glass or can of this drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bottle of pop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶汽水
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you get me a pop while you’re up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你起来的时候给我拿一瓶汽水好吗？

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone in public
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you’re a professional footballer, you expect people to take a pop at you now and again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当一名职业足球运动员﹐时不时遭人批评是正常的。

Sense.DEF: used when each of something costs a particular amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tickets for the show are a hundred bucks a pop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演出门票100美元一张。

Sense.DEF: father – used especially when you are talking to your father

classical
music that most people know, especially people who do not usually like this type of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pops concert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通俗古典音乐会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Boston Pops Orchestra
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波士顿通俗管弦乐团

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=population人口

Sense.DEF: a type of art that was popular in the 1960s, which shows ordinary objects, such as advertisements, or things you see in people’s homes
Sense.TRAN: 波普艺术﹐通俗艺术﹐大众艺术〔表现普通事物的一种艺术﹐流行于20世纪60年代〕

Sense.DEF:
a kind of corn that swells and bursts open when heated, and is usually eaten warm with salt or sugar as a
snack
music, films, products etc in a particular society that are familiar to and popular with most ordinary people in that society
the leader of the Roman Catholic Church
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Pope will visit El Salvador this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教皇今年将访问萨尔瓦多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pope John XXIII
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教皇约翰二十三世

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is clearly true or certain – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 教皇是天主教徒吗？ 这还用问？〔幽默用法﹐用于表示某事毫无疑问是真实的或确定的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you think they’ll win?’ ‘Is the Pope Catholic?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你认为他们会赢吗？”“这还用问？”

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for the Roman Catholic religion. Do not use this word.
having your eyes wide open, because you are surprised, excited, or angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于惊讶﹑兴奋或愤怒而〕目瞪口呆的﹐瞪大眼睛的

Sense.DEF: having eyes that stick out slightly
a type of hit in baseball in which the ball is hit straight up into the air

a group of people who sing and perform
pop music
Sense.TRAN: 流行乐队﹐流行音乐组合

Sense.DEF:
a toy gun that fires small objects, such as
cork s
, with a loud noise
an offensive word for something that is related to the Roman Catholic religion. Do not use this word.
a very tall straight thin tree that grows very fast
a strong shiny cotton cloth
modern music that is popular, especially with young people, and usually consists of simple tunes with a strong beat

a light hollow
muffin small cake
made with eggs, milk, and flour
Sense.TRAN: 空心酥脆饼﹐膨松饼〔用鸡蛋﹑牛奶和面粉制成〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
papa
a large circular piece of very thin flat Indian bread cooked in oil
a small metal thing that is used to fasten clothes, which works when you press its two parts together
an illegal drug in the form of a liquid, which people take for pleasure by breathing it in
Sense.TRAN: 亚硝酸异戊酯〔一种液状违禁药物﹐吸入后能令人产生快感〕

Sense.DEF: used to talk to or about a child or animal you like very much
Sense.TRAN: 宝宝﹐宝贝﹐乖乖〔指宠爱的小孩或动物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come here, poppet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到这儿来﹐宝贝。

Sense.DEF: ways of dealing with personal problems that are made popular on television or in books, but are not considered scientific
Sense.TRAN: 大众心理学﹐通俗心理学

Sense.DEF: a plant that has brightly coloured, usually red, flowers and small black seeds
nonsense
the small black seeds of the poppy plant, used in cakes, bread etc
a short test that a teacher gives without any warning, in order to check whether students have been studying
a food made of juice that is frozen onto sticks

a famous and successful entertainer who plays or sings
pop music

Head.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词

Sense.DEF: the people who live in a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: the effects of the war on the local populace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争对当地百姓的影响

Sense.DEF: liked by a lot of people
Sense.TRAN: 受大众喜爱的﹐受欢迎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hilary was popular at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a popular holiday resort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们喜欢的度假胜地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Guerrero’s music is hugely popular in Latin America.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷罗的音乐在拉丁美洲极受欢迎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President is very popular with Jewish voters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统很受犹太选民欢迎。

Sense.DEF: done by a lot of people in a society, group etc
Sense.TRAN: 由〔社会﹑团体等中〕多数人做的﹐公众的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the closest popular vote in U.S. presidential history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国总统选举史上票数最接近的一次普选
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has little popular support among women voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性选民普遍不支持这届政府。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kaplan’s latest recording has received considerable popular acclaim it is liked by a lot of people .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡普兰的最新唱片获得了普遍的赞誉。

GramExa.GLOSS: a belief, opinion etc that a lot of people have
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 普遍的观念/民意/大众的看法
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a survey of Hispanic-American popular opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对西班牙裔美国人作的民意调查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: in spite of what many people believe , gorillas are basically shy, gentle creatures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与普遍的看法相反﹐大猩猩其实是一种羞怯﹑温和的动物。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a popular movement for democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取民主的全民运动

Sense.DEF: relating to ordinary people, or intended for ordinary people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wintour’s writing is full of references to American popular culture .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温特的作品多次提及美国的通俗文化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steele was ridiculed by the popular press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂尔受到通俗报刊的嘲笑。

Sense.DEF: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The popularity of the Internet has soared.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网的普及程度急剧上升。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

GramExa.GLOSS: start to be liked by many people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Country music is growing in popularity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村音乐越来越流行了。

Sense.DEF: to make something well known and liked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob Marley popularized reggae music in the 1970s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃·马利在20世纪70年代让雷鬼音乐流行了起来。

Sense.DEF: to make a difficult subject or idea able to be easily understood by ordinary people who have no special knowledge about it
Sense.TRAN: 使通俗化﹐使大众化﹐使易懂﹐使普及
Sense.EXAMPLE: Skinner was the psychologist who popularized behavior modification.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯金纳就是那位使行为矫正概念得到普及的心理学家。

Sense.DEF: by most or many people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President of the Republic of Korea is popularly elected every five years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韩国总统每五年普选一次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Vitamin C is popularly believed to prevent colds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍认为维生素
GramExa.EXAMPLE: C
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有预防感冒的作用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints is popularly known as the Mormon Church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣基督后期圣徒教会一般称摩门教。

Sense.DEF: if an area is populated by a particular group of people, they live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The highlands are populated mainly by peasant farmers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高原人口主要是农民。

GramExa.GLOSS: with a lot of people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of the most densely populated areas in the world
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上人口最密集的地区之一

GramExa.GLOSS: with very few people

Sense.DEF: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: India has a population of more than one billion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度有超过10亿人口。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

Sense.DEF: all of the people who live in a particular area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

GramExa.GLOSS: part of the group of people who live in a particular area who are white, French etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 白人/法国/城市等的人口
GramExa.EXAMPLE: South Florida has a large Jewish population.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南佛罗里达有很多犹太人。

Sense.DEF: a city, town etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cromer is the main centre of population in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克罗默是该地区主要的人口集中区域。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The entire population will be celebrating.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 全民将共同欢庆。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sixty percent of the world’s population live in areas that are at risk from sea-level rises.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界人口的60%居住在受到海平面上升威胁的地区。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ethnic minorities suffer more than the general population.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 与大部分居民相比,少数民族受难更甚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The local population gave them a warm welcome.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人热情地欢迎他们。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: black or white people who live in a place
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Unemployment is greater among the black population.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑人的失业率更高。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the people of a particular nationality or religion who live in a place
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 犹太人/穆斯林/亚洲等的人口
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the city’s 4,000 strong Asian population
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市多达4,000的亚裔人口

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the people who have always lived in a place
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His new book assesses the impact of Spanish culture of the indigenous population of Mexico.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新书评价了墨西哥本土人口中西班牙文化的影响。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the people who live in towns or cities
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The region’s urban population will more than double in the next two decades.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今后20年内该地区的城镇人口将增加一倍以上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the people who live in the countryside
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Agricultural reforms must address the needs of the rural population.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业改革必须满足农村人口的需求。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A third of the adult population pay no tax at all.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 成年人口中有三分之一根本就不缴税。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Should the entire elderly population be regularly screened for this disease?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 是否应在全体老年人中对该病进行定期筛查呢？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: gradually becoming older on average
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rapidly ageing population will put a strain on the country’s health care system.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 快速老龄化的人口将对国家的医疗保健制度形成压力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: California is a big state with a large population.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 加州是一个人口众多的大州。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the number of people in prisons in a country or area
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A quarter of the prison population is under 21.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些囚犯中有四分之一不足21岁。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The university has a student population of almost 5,000.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所大学有近5,000名学生。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Between these years the population grew by 40%.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些年来人口增长了40﹪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The population in many rural areas has continued to fall.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多乡村地区的人口已持续减少。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Nigeria’s population will reach 532 million in the middle of this century.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼日利亚的人口到本世纪中期将达5.32亿。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rapid population growth intensifies competition for land.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口的快速增长加剧了对土地的争夺。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The population increase in the region is a cause for concern.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的人口增长令人担忧。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when the population increases quickly and by a large amount
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What will be the long-term effects of this population explosion?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种人口爆炸将有怎样的长期影响？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the degree to which an area is filled with people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Australia has a low population density.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚人口密度低。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: controlling how many children people have
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is argued that population control is essential to limit the depletion of natural resources.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人辩称控制人口对限制自然资源消耗至关重要。

Sense.DEF: relating to or representing ordinary people, rather than rich or very highly educated people
Sense.TRAN: 代表人民的﹐平民主义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a populist campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平民主义运动

Sense.DEF: a populous area has a large population in relation to its size
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hong Kong is one of the most populous areas in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香港是世界上人口最稠密的地区之一。

Sense.DEF:
a
window
containing an advertisement, that suddenly appears under another window on a computer screen when you are looking at a website
Sense.TRAN: 〔出现在所浏览网页背后的〕弹出式广告

Sense.DEF: a book, card etc with a picture that stands up when you open the pages

a
menu
or
window
that can appear suddenly on a computer screen while you are using it

a
window
, often containing an advertisement, that suddenly appears on a computer screen, especially when you are looking at a website
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕上出现的〕弹出式窗口

Sense.DEF: a hard shiny white substance that is used for making expensive plates, cups etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a porcelain vase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓷花瓶

Sense.DEF: plates, cups etc made of this
an entrance covered by a roof outside the front door of a house or church
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子或教堂前门外有顶的〕入口处﹐门廊

Sense.DEF: a structure built onto the front or back entrance of a house, with a floor and a roof but no walls
looking like or relating to pigs
an animal with long sharp parts growing all over its back and sides

one of the small holes in your skin that liquid, especially
sweat
, can pass through, or a similar hole in the surface of a plant
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮肤的〕毛孔﹔〔植物表面的〕气孔﹐细孔

Sense.DEF: to read or look at something very carefully for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was poring over a book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在专心阅读一本书。

Sense.DEF: the meat from pigs
Sense.EXAMPLE: pork chops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪排

Sense.DEF: government money spent in a particular area in order to get political advantages –used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 政治恩惠〔为获得政治利益而拨给某一地区的政府资金﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bill filled with pork projects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充斥着政治恩惠项目的议案

Sense.DEF: a government plan to increase the amount of money spent in a particular area, done in order to gain a political advantage – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 猪肉桶政治﹐政治分肥〔指政府为取得政治利益而增加对某一地区的拨款﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: pork-barrel spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治分肥支出

Sense.DEF: a young pig that is made fat before being killed for food
a fat person – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 肥猪﹐胖猪〔指胖人﹔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF:
a small round
pie
which contains pieces of cooked pork

small pieces of pig fat that have been cooked in hot oil and are eaten as a
snack
fat – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 肥的﹐肥胖的〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a lie
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was he telling porkies again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是不是又在撒谎？

Sense.DEF: pornography
Sense.EXAMPLE: the porn industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色情业
Sense.EXAMPLE: a porno movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色情电影

Sense.DEF: magazines, films etc that show sexual acts and images in a way that is intended to make people feel sexually excited
allowing liquid, air etc to pass slowly through many very small holes
Sense.EXAMPLE: porous material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渗透性材料

Sense.DEF: easy to pass through or get into something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the porous border between Haiti and the Dominican Republic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海地和多米尼加共和国之间防备松懈的边界线

Sense.DEF:
a sea animal that looks similar to a
dolphin
and breathes air

oats
that are cooked with milk or water and served hot for breakfast
a period of time spent in prison

GramExa.GLOSS: spend time in prison
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐牢﹐服刑

Sense.DEF: a place where ships can be loaded and unloaded

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have two days ashore while the ship is in port.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮船靠港时﹐我们能在岸上待两天。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ferry was about to leave port.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 渡船正要离港。

Sense.DEF:
a town or city with a
harbour
or
dock s
where ships can be loaded or unloaded
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s largest port
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国最大的港口城市

Sense.DEF:
a part of a computer where you can connect another piece of equipment, such as a
printer
strong sweet Portuguese wine that is usually drunk after a meal
Sense.TRAN: 波尔图葡萄酒〔葡萄牙产的一种葡萄酒﹐通常在餐后饮用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of port
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯波尔图葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: the left side of a ship or aircraft when you are looking towards the front
Sense.EXAMPLE: on the port side
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在左舷

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane tilted to port.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机向左侧倾斜。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should take whatever help you can when you are in trouble, even if it has some disadvantages
Sense.TRAN: 〔即使有不利之处也应接受的〕摆脱困境的任何帮助﹐穷途之策

Sense.DEF: to move software from one computer system to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can Windows applications be ported to Unix?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 视窗系统的应用软件能否移植到Unix系统中使用？

Sense.DEF: able to be carried or moved easily
Sense.TRAN: 手提式的﹐便携式的﹐轻便的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a portable radio
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 便携式收音机

Sense.DEF: a portable computer program can be used on different computer systems

health insurance,
pension plan s
etc that workers can keep when they move from one job to another
Sense.TRAN: 可转移的福利﹐可随带的福利

Sense.DEF: a piece of electronic equipment that can be easily carried or moved
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get a portable, not a big TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 买个便携式电视机﹐不要大的。

Sense.DEF:
a small machine that can store and play
digital
music and videos and show digital photographs
when people carry small boats over land from one river to another

a very small building that can be used as a temporary office,
classroom
etc, and can be moved by truck
Sense.TRAN: 波特卡宾活动房屋〔一种可装上大卡车搬运的临时房屋﹐可用作临时办公室﹑教室等〕

Sense.DEF: a website that helps you find other websites
a tall and impressive gate or entrance to a building
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物高大壮观的〕大门﹐正门

Sense.DEF: a toilet that is in a small plastic building that can be moved
a toilet that is in a small plastic building that can be moved
a strong iron gate that can be lowered over the entrance of a castle
to be a sign that something is going to happen, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 预示〔尤指不祥之事〕﹐为…的凶兆
Sense.EXAMPLE: strange events that portend disaster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预示着灾难的奇怪事件

Sense.DEF: a sign or warning that something is going to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people believe the raven is a portent of death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为渡鸦是死亡的征兆。

Sense.DEF: showing that something important is going to happen, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 预示未来的﹔凶兆的﹐征兆不祥的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent developments are as portentous as the collapse of the Berlin Wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的事态发展犹如柏林墙的倒塌﹐让人有一种山雨欲来风满楼的感觉。

Sense.DEF: trying to appear important and serious
Sense.TRAN: 自命不凡的﹐摆架子的﹐自大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a portentous film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装腔作势的电影

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to carry people’s bags at railway stations, airports etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔火车站﹑机场等的〕行李员﹐搬运工﹐脚夫

Sense.DEF: someone in charge of the entrance to a hotel, hospital etc
someone whose job is to carry heavy goods at markets
someone whose job is to look after the part of a train where people sleep
someone whose job is to look after a building by cleaning it, repairing things etc
a dark brown bitter beer

a thick flat piece of high-quality
beef
a large flat case used especially for carrying pictures, documents etc
a set of pictures or other pieces of work that an artist, photographer etc has done
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术家﹑摄影师等的〕作品选集
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll need to prepare a portfolio of your work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要准备一套作品选集。

Sense.DEF:
a group of
stock s
owned by a particular person or company
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人或某公司持有的〕有价证券组合﹐投资组合
Sense.EXAMPLE: an investment portfolio
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资组合

Sense.DEF: the work that a particular government official is responsible for
Sense.EXAMPLE: the foreign affairs portfolio
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交部长职责

Sense.DEF: a small round window on the side of a ship or plane

a covered entrance to a building, consisting of a roof supported by
pillar s
a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火箭的前部脱落了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rent on his portion of the apartment was $500 a month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要分担的那部分公寓租金是每月500美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The main character’s childhood takes up a good portion of the film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主人公的童年生活占据了电影的很大一部分。

Sense.DEF: an amount of food for one person, especially when served in a restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指餐馆中食物的〕一份﹐一客
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any children’s portions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们有儿童餐吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a huge portion of roast beef
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大份烤牛肉

Sense.EXAMPLE: He served generous portions large portions of soup from a black pot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从一口黑锅里盛出大份大份的汤。

Sense.DEF: a share of something, such as responsibility, blame, or a duty, that is divided between a small number of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔责任﹑过失﹑职责等的〕一份﹐一部分

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The other driver must bear a portion of the blame for the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一名司机必须对这次事故承担部分责任。

Sense.DEF: to divide something into parts and give it to several people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money was portioned out among them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那笔钱被他们分了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is portly, especially an old man, is fat and round
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指年长男子〕肥胖的﹐发福的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a portly old gentleman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位发福的老先生

Sense.DEF:
a very large
suitcase
that opens into two parts
a portmanteau word is made by combining the sound and meaning of two other words, for example ‘edutainment’ combines ‘education’ and ‘entertainment’
Sense.TRAN: 缩合词﹐合并词〔由两个词的读音和意义合成〕

Sense.DEF: one of a series of places that you visit
Sense.TRAN: 目的地之一﹐中途的落脚点
Sense.EXAMPLE: My first port of call will be the post office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一个要去的地方是邮局。

Sense.DEF: a port where a ship stops on a journey from one place to another
a place, such as a port or airport, where people or goods can enter a country
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或货物的〕入口港﹐进口港﹐入境地点

Sense.DEF:
a place in the south of England where there is a government
laboratory
used for studying chemical weapons and
biological
weapons weapons that use bacteria to kill people by giving them diseases
Sense.TRAN: 波顿唐〔英格兰南部一地区﹐一个研究化学武器和生物武器的政府实验室坐落于此〕

Sense.DEF: a painting, drawing, or photograph of a person
Sense.TRAN: 人物画像﹔人物照片﹔肖像
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family portrait
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全家福

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the artist’s portrait of his mother
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 画家给他母亲画的肖像

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been commissioned to paint Jackson’s portrait .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已受托为杰克逊画肖像。

Sense.DEF: a description or representation of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a portrait of working life in America
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对美国工作生活的描述

Sense.DEF: if a piece of paper, a page, a photograph etc is in a portrait position, it is placed on a surface or hung on a wall with its longer edges at the sides
Sense.TRAN: 〔纸张﹑页面﹑照片等〕竖式的﹐纵向的

dictionary.Entry:
·
portraiture por‧trai‧ture
'pɔːtrɪtʃə 'pɔːtrətʃə ˋpɔrtrɪtʃɚ
n U formal
the art of painting or drawing pictures of people 【正式】 肖像画技法

Sense.DEF: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them
Sense.TRAN: 把某人/某物描写成某种样子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Romantic artists portrayed nature as wild and powerful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President likes to portray himself as a friend of working people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统喜欢以工薪阶层的朋友自居。

Sense.DEF: to describe or represent something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: His most famous painting portrayed the death of Nelson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最著名的画作描绘的是纳尔逊之死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Religion was portrayed in a negative way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对宗教的描写是负面的。

Sense.DEF: to act the part of a character in a play, film, or television programme
Sense.EXAMPLE: She portrays a dancer in the hit film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在这部卖座的影片里扮演一位舞者。

Sense.DEF: the way someone or something is described or shown in a book, film, play etc
Sense.TRAN: 描绘﹐描写﹐描述﹔扮演﹔表现

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the newspapers’ portrayal of Islamic culture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上对伊斯兰文化的描绘

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film is not an accurate portrayal correct portrayal of his life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片没有如实描述他的生活。

Sense.DEF: relating to Portugal, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 葡萄牙的﹔葡萄牙人的﹔葡萄牙语的

Sense.DEF: people from Portugal
the language used in Portugal, Brazil, and some other countries

a very large poisonous
jellyfish
Sense.TRAN: 僧帽水母﹐葡萄牙军舰水母

Sense.DEF: to exist in a way that may cause a problem, danger, difficulty etc
Sense.TRAN: 造成﹐引起﹐产生 〔问题﹑危险﹑困难等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Officials claim the chemical poses no real threat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们称这种化学物质不会构成实际的威胁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The events pose a challenge to the church’s leadership.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事件对教会的领导地位构成了威胁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Rising unemployment is posing serious problems for the administration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率上升正在给政府造成严重的问题。

Sense.DEF: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔为照相或画像而〕（使）摆好姿势

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We posed for photographs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

Sense.DEF: to ask a question, especially one that needs to be carefully thought about
Sense.TRAN: 提出问题〔尤指需要仔细考虑的问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In her book she poses the question ‘How much do we need to be happy?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在书里提出了这样一个问题﹕“我们要拥有多少才能快乐？”

Sense.DEF: to pretend to be someone else, in order to deceive people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bryce was caught posing as a lawyer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖斯冒充律师被人识破。

Sense.DEF: to dress or behave like a rich and fashionable person in order to make other people notice you or admire you
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为画像﹑拍照等而摆的〕姿势﹐姿态

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a painting of the Duchess in a dramatic pose
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公爵夫人姿势夸张的画像

Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann struck a pose stood or sat in a particular position and smiled for the camera.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

Sense.DEF: behaviour in which someone pretends to have a quality or social position they do not really have, usually in order to make other people notice them or admire them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her confidence was merely a pose to hide her uncertainty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的自信完全是装出来的﹐为了掩饰她没有把握。

Sense.DEF: someone who pretends to have a quality or social position they do not really have, usually in order to make people notice or admire them
Sense.TRAN: 装腔作势的人﹔装模作样的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: You meet a lot of posers in this job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这份工作你会遇到很多装腔作势的人。

Sense.DEF: a difficult question
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a real poser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那真是个难题。

Sense.DEF: a posh restaurant, hotel, car etc is expensive and looks as if it is used or owned by rich people
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐馆﹑酒店﹑汽车等〕高档的﹐豪华的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a posh private school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昂贵的私立学校

Sense.DEF: upper class
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her parents are terribly posh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母是十足的上流社会做派。

Sense.DEF: to talk in an upper-class way

an informal name for the British
pop
singer Victoria Beckham, used especially in newspapers and magazines
Sense.TRAN: 辣妹〔英国流行乐歌手维多利亚·贝克汉姆的别称﹐尤用于报纸杂志〕

Sense.DEF: to suggest that a particular idea should be accepted as a fact

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He posited that each planet moved in a perfect circle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他假设每颗行星都沿正圆轨道运行。

Sense.DEF: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lie in a comfortable position .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frankie shifted his position so that his knees would not become cramped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗基换了个姿势﹐这样他的膝盖就不会老蜷着动弹不得。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I struggled up into a sitting position.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挣扎着坐了起来。

Sense.DEF: the situation that someone is in, especially when this affects what they can and cannot do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure what I would do if I were in your position .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道如果我身在你的处境会怎么办。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in a position to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Next week we will be in a much better position to comment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下星期发表评论会合适得多。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in the position of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is in the enviable position of having three job offers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她手头有三个工作机会﹐真让人羡慕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re putting me in rather a difficult position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你让我很难办。

Sense.DEF: the place where someone or something is, especially in relation to other objects and places

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the position of the sun in the sky
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳在天空中的位置

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置﹐在圣马克广场附近。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the strategic position useful or important position of Egypt in relation to the Arabian peninsula
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃及相对于阿拉伯半岛的战略位置

Sense.DEF: the place where someone or something is needed or supposed to be

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pulled the ladder into position.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把梯子挪到位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All parking signs have now been placed in position.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有停车标记都已安放就位。

Sense.DEF: the direction in which an object is pointing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure the container remains in an upright position.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保那个容器保持直立。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned the switch to the ‘on’ position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把开关拧到“开”的位置。

Sense.DEF: an opinion or judgment on a particular subject, especially the official opinion of a government, a political party, or someone in authority
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政府﹑政党﹑当权者的〕立场﹐态度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the party’s position on tax reform?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党对于税制改革持什么态度？

Sense.EXAMPLE: The principal took the position that the students didn’t need music classes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位校长认为学生不需要上音乐课。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you’ll reconsider your position .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你能重新考虑你的立场。

Sense.DEF: a job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill took up his new position as Works Director in October.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 10 月份比尔上任当了厂长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has held the position of Chief Financial Officer since 1992.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自1992年起担任财务主管一职。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, the position has been filled someone has been found to do the job .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐该职位已经有人递补了。

Sense.DEF: someone’s or something’s level, authority, or importance in a society or organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the position of women in society
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女在社会中的地位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of his supporters used their positions of power for personal advantage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的许多支持者都利用手中的权位谋取私利。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As a priest, he was in a position of trust .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他作为牧师身负重托。

GramExa.GLOSS: use your authority wrongly

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in a position to do sth
Sense.DEF: to be able to do something because you have the ability, money, or power to do it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因为有能力﹑金钱或权力而〕能够做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I know all the facts, I’ll be in a position to advise you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我了解所有的事实之后﹐我就可以给你出主意了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in no position to do sth
Sense.DEF: to be unable to do something because you do not have the ability, money, or power to do it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因为没有能力﹑金钱或权力而〕不能够做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re unemployed and in no position to support a family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没有工作﹐没有能力养家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ned says I’m always late? He’s in no position to talk should not criticize because he does the same thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内德说我总是迟到？他哪有资格说我啊。

Sense.DEF: the place of someone or something in a race or competition in relation to the other people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alesi finished in third position .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿莱西得了第三名。

Sense.DEF: the area where someone plays in a sport, or the type of actions they are responsible for doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: What position do you play ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打什么位置？

Sense.DEF: to try to get an advantage over other people who are all trying to succeed in doing the same thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firms adopt different strategies as they jockey for position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各公司在抢占有利地位时采用的策略各不相同。

Sense.DEF: a place where an army has put soldiers, guns etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attack on the enemy positions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向敌方阵地发起的一次进攻

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of people are in the same position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人处于相同的境地。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can ask to be put in contact with others in a similar position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以要求与处境相似的其他人联系。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a situation in which you have an advantage
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A victory tonight will put them in a very strong position to win the cup.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的胜利将对他们赢得奖杯非常有利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a situation that no one else is in
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their close knowledge of the area places them in a unique position to advise on social policy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对该地区的深入了解使他们在对社会政策提供建议方面处于特殊地位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a situation that other people would like to be in
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is in the enviable position of not needing to work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不需要去工作,真令人羡慕。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was in the difficult position of having to choose between them.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我处境尴尬,必须在他们中间作出选择。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very difficult situation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was furious with Guy for putting her in such an impossible position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖伊让她处于这样一个难办的境地﹐她对此极为恼火。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a situation in which you have a disadvantage
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Someone who is desperate to sell their house is in a weak position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 急于出售自己房子的人处于不利的地位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a situation in which you might be harmed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Today we are in the vulnerable position of producing barely half our own food.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今我们的粮食产量勉强达到我们需求量的一半,情况不妙。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The following statistics indicate the present position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 以下数据表明了当前的状况。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the situation from a legal point of view
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The legal position is far from clear.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律状况尚不清楚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Has your financial position changed recently?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来你的经济状况有变化吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone’s ability to bargain/negotiate
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 讨价还价/谈判时的地位
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The new law has strengthened workers’ bargaining position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项新法律提高了劳方的谈判地位。

Collocate.COLLOC: be in a strong/weak etc position
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are in a good position to help.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们完全有能力提供帮助。

Collocate.COLLOC: find yourself in a similar/awkward etc position
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 发现自己处于相似/尴尬等的境地
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The refugee organizations now found themselves in a difficult position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民组织现在发现自己处境艰难。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It has taken two years to reach the position we are now in.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们费了两年时间才取得现在的地位。

Collocate.COLLOC: put/place sb in a good/awkward etc position
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 使某人处于有利/尴尬等的境地
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry if I put you in an awkward position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我让你处境尴尬,那真是抱歉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give someone a bigger advantage
Collocate.EXAMPLE: People said that he used the conflict to strengthen his own position.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都说他是利用了这一冲突来巩固自己的地位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give someone a bigger disadvantage
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister’s position had been weakened by allegations of financial mismanagement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相被指财政管理不当,地位遭到削弱。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By March, the Democrats’ position had improved.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 到3月份,民主党的地位得到了提升。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a strong position
Collocate.EXAMPLE: By now they were negotiating from a position of strength.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 至此,他们在谈判桌上占据着优势。

Sense.DEF: to carefully put something in a particular position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Position the cursor before the letter you want to delete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把光标放在你想删去的字母之前。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I positioned myself where I could see the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我让自己站到可以看见门的地方。

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation in which you will be able to do something successfully
Sense.TRAN: 已准备好﹐境况很理想〔可以做成某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are ideally positioned to take advantage of the growth in demand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已准备好利用需求增加这一良机。

Sense.DEF: relating to the position or job of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 位置上的﹔地位上的﹔职位上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: positional power or authority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职务上的权力

Sense.DEF: a written statement that shows how a department, organization etc intends to deal with something
Sense.TRAN: 〔部门﹑组织等关于处理某事的〕立场声明

Sense.DEF: if you are positive about things, you are hopeful and confident, and think about what is good in a situation rather than what is bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to be more positive about your work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须更积极地对待自己的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s got a really positive attitude to life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对生活抱有非常乐观的态度。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the power of positive thinking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正向思考的力量
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘ Think positive !’ she advised herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “往好的方面想！”她劝自己。

Sense.DEF: good or useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Write down all the positive things about your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记下生活中所有好的事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。
Sense.EXAMPLE: TV can be a positive influence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视也会有好的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日子过得不容易﹐不过从好的方面看﹐我的身体状况还不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

Sense.DEF: if you take positive action, you do something definite in order to try and achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to take positive steps to improve the situation of families in poverty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要采取积极措施来改善贫困家庭的状况。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Positive action was required.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求采取积极行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a relief to know that something positive is being done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道正在采取积极的措施让人宽心。

Sense.DEF: expressing support, agreement, or approval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The response we’ve had from the public has been very positive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从民众那里得到的回应是非常积极的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had a lot of positive feedback from the people of this city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从这个城市的市民那里获得了很多积极的反馈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most people have been very positive about the show.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人对那个节目予以充分的肯定。

Sense.DEF: very sure, with no doubt at all that something is right or true
Sense.TRAN: 确信的﹐肯定的﹐有把握的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you absolutely positive you locked the door?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能完全肯定锁门了吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you sure about that?’ ‘Positive.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那事你能肯定吗？”“能。”

Sense.DEF: showing that something is likely to succeed or improve
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact that he’s breathing on his own again is a positive sign .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又能自主呼吸了﹐这是个好迹象。

Sense.DEF: proof etc that shows that there is no doubt that something is true
Sense.TRAN: 确切的证明/确凿的证据/明确的鉴定等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The witness made a positive identification.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目击者作了确认。

Sense.DEF: showing signs of the medical condition or chemical that is being looked for
Sense.EXAMPLE: The test results came back positive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化验结果呈阳性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: athletes who had tested positive for banned substances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁用药品检测呈阳性的运动员
Sense.EXAMPLE: children who are HIV positive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how good or bad something is
Sense.TRAN: 绝对的〔强调某事物好或坏的程度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey was a positive nightmare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次旅程简直是个噩梦。

Sense.DEF: a positive number is more than zero

having the type of electrical charge that is carried by
proton s
Sense.EXAMPLE: a positive charge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正电荷

Sense.DEF: a quality or feature that is good or useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can find positives in any situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何情况都有好的一面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always emphasise the positive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 始终要突出优势。

Sense.DEF: the practice of giving a particular number of jobs, places at university etc to people who are often treated unfairly because of their race, sex etc
Sense.TRAN: 积极区别对待〔指向某些因种族﹑性别等经常受到歧视的人提供一定的工作机会﹑大学录取名额等〕

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is true, especially when this seems surprising
Sense.TRAN: 真的﹐确实〔用于强调某事物的真实性﹐尤在其看上去令人吃惊时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some holiday destinations are positively dangerous .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些度假地真的很危险。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you agree with something or want it to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is hoped that the industry will respond positively to this new initiative.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望该行业会对这一新方案作出积极回应。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you are thinking about what is good in a situation rather than what is bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re encouraged to think positively about themselves and their future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们受到鼓励﹐对自己和未来要保持乐观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Change should be accepted and be viewed positively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该接受并积极看待改变。

Sense.DEF: in a way that leaves no doubt
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You certainly won’t!’ Katherine said positively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你当然不会的！”凯瑟琳肯定地说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blood was never positively identified as the victim’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直没有确定这血就是被害人的。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you really mean what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is positively the last time you’ll hear me say this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这绝对是你们最后一次听我说这事。

Sense.DEF:
having the type of electrical charge that is carried by
proton s

a type of
philosophy
based only on facts which can be scientifically proved, rather than on ideas

a very small piece of matter that has the same mass as an
electron
but has a positive electrical
charge
if possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please send a photo if poss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果可能的话请寄张照片来。

Sense.DEF: as soon as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need them back as soon as poss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要他们尽快回来。

Sense.DEF: a group of the same kind of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was surrounded by a posse of photographers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被一群摄影师围住了。

Sense.DEF:
a group of men gathered together by a
sheriff local law officer
in the US in past times to help catch a criminal
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国旧时由县治安官召集的帮助抓捕罪犯的〕民防团

Subsense.DEF: someone’s group of friends – used especially by young people
Subsense.TRAN: 〔某人的〕一群朋友〔尤为年轻人使用〕

Subsense.DEF:
a group of friends from a particular place who share an interest in
rap
,
hip﹣hop
, or
house
music
Subsense.TRAN: 〔对说唱乐﹑嘻哈乐或豪斯音乐感兴趣的〕一群朋友

Sense.DEF: to have a particular quality or ability
Sense.TRAN: 拥有﹐具有〔某品质或能力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Different workers possess different skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他再也吓不倒她了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone has or has got something rather than possesses it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们表示某人有某事物一般说has或has got,而不说possesses
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They all have different skills.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都拥有不同的技能。

Sense.DEF: to have or own something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither of them possessed a credit card.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们两人都没有信用卡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Campbell was found guilty of possessing heroin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎贝尔被判持有海洛因罪名成立。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot understand why someone did something stupid
Sense.TRAN: 是什么驱使某人（做某事）？〔表示不明白某人为何做傻事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What on earth possessed her to do it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到底是什么让她干出这种事的？

Sense.DEF: if a feeling possesses you, you suddenly feel it very strongly and it affects your behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: A mad rage possessed her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然狂怒起来。

Sense.DEF: if someone is possessed, their mind is controlled by something evil
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was convinced he was possessed by the devil .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她确信他被魔鬼附身了。

GramExa.GLOSS: with a lot of energy or violence
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 猛烈地﹐拼命地﹐着了魔似的

Sense.DEF: to have a particular quality, ability etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was possessed of a fine and original mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她具有细腻而独到的思维方式。

Sense.DEF: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house has been in the family’s possession since the 1500s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所房子自16世纪以来一直为这个家族所有。

Sense.EXAMPLE: That information is not in our possession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那则信息不归我们所有。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was found in possession of stolen goods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被发现窝赃。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How did the painting come into your possession how did you get it ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The finance company now has possession of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t take possession of get and start using the car until a few days after the auction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

Sense.DEF: something that you own or have with you at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had sold all his possessions and left the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他变卖所有财产后离境了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I packed my remaining possessions into the trunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把剩下的物品装进行李箱里。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that is very important to you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This old violin had been her father’s most treasured possession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这把旧小提琴一直都是她父亲最珍贵的财产。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Prisoners were allowed no personal possessions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人们不得持有私人物品。

Sense.DEF: the crime of having illegal drugs or weapons with you or in your home
Sense.TRAN: 〔毒品或非法武器的〕私藏﹐持有

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was arrested and charged with possession of cocaine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被逮捕并被控持有可卡因。

Sense.DEF: when a person or team has control of the ball in some sports

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pittsburgh got possession and scored.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 匹兹堡队控球并得分。

Sense.DEF: a country controlled or governed by another country
Sense.EXAMPLE: France’s former colonial possessions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国过去的殖民地

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone’s mind is being controlled by something evil
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was it a case of demonic possession?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那算不算鬼魂附体？

Sense.DEF: able to think in a clear and intelligent way, and not crazy or affected by old age

Sense.LEXUNIT: possession is nine-tenths of the law
Sense.DEF: used to say that if you have something, you are likely to be able to keep it, even if it is not yours
Sense.TRAN: 现实占有﹐败一胜九〔指现实占有者总占上风〕

Sense.DEF: wanting someone to have feelings of love or friendship for you and no one else
Sense.TRAN: 〔爱情或友情上〕占有欲强的﹐自私的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was terribly possessive of our eldest son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对我们的长子占有欲非常强。

Sense.DEF: unwilling to let other people use something you own
Sense.TRAN: 不愿与别人分享的﹐占有欲强的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s so possessive about his new car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新车谁也碰不得。

Sense.DEF: used in grammar to show that something belongs to someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the possessive pronouns ‘ours’ and ‘mine’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有格代词ours和mine

Sense.DEF:
an adjective,
pronoun
, or form of a word that shows that something belongs to someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 所有格形容词［代词］﹐物主形容词［代词］﹔所有格形式

Sense.DEF: someone who owns or has something – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 拥有者﹐持有者〔常为幽默用法〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s now the proud possessor of two satellite dishes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为现在拥有两个卫星电视天线而自豪。

Sense.DEF: if there is a possibility that something is true or that something will happen, it might be true or it might happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s always a possibility that he might go back to Seattle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也许会回到西雅图去﹐这种可能性一直存在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the possibility of an enemy attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌人进攻的可能性
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no possibility of changing the voting procedure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改变投票程序是不可能的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A peace settlement now looks like a real possibility .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成和平协议现在看来有很大的可能性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tomorrow, there’s a remote possibility of snow on high ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天高原地区下雪的可能性甚微。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They might get married – it’s not beyond the bounds of possibility .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们也许会结婚——这并非不可能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The study raises the possibility that dieting is bad for your health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项研究指出节食有可能损害健康。

Sense.DEF: an opportunity to do something, or something that can be done or tried

GramExa.EXAMPLE: exciting possibilities for reducing costs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人振奋的降低成本的可能方法
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Archer began to explore the possibilities of opening a club in the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿彻开始想办法在城里开设一家俱乐部。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The US has not yet exhausted all diplomatic possibilities tried everything possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国还没有使尽外交手段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the range of possibilities offered to students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供给学生的各种选择

Sense.DEF: if something has possibilities, it could be made into something much better
