Sense.TRAN: 有潜力﹐有发展的可能性
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house has great possibilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子有很大的潜在价值。

Sense.DEF: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved
Sense.TRAN: 可能的﹐可能做到的﹐可能实现的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it possible toget tickets for the game?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有可能弄到比赛的门票？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It might be possible for the documents to be sent over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文件也许可以发送过去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer technology makes it possible for many people to work from home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机技术让很多人可以在家里工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to avoid the rush hour traffic if possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有可能我想避开交通高峰时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I walk or use public transport whenever possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要有可能我就步行或者乘坐公共交通工具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are doing everything possible to track down the killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正竭尽全力追捕杀人凶手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our staff will help you in every way possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的员工会尽力帮助你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even if it were technically possible , we do not have the money to do it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使技术上可行﹐我们也没有钱去做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She decided to stay as far away from him as was humanly possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定尽可能离他远点。

Sense.DEF: as soon, quickly etc as you can
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need the money as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要尽快拿到这笔钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sharon always does as little work as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎伦总是尽可能少做事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The original features of the house have been preserved as far as possible as much as possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所房子原有的特色被尽可能地保留了下来。

Sense.DEF: a possible answer, cause etc might be true
Sense.TRAN: 可能的﹐合乎事实的﹐合理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seem to be only two possible explanations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎只有两种合理的解释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the possible causes of a child’s learning difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 造成孩子学习困难的可能原因

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s possible that the letter got lost in the post.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有可能那封信在邮寄过程中弄丢了。

Sense.DEF: a possible event or thing might happen or exist
Sense.TRAN: 可能发生的﹔可能存在的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heavy rain is possible later in the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天晚些时候可能会有大雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the possible effect on the health of local people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对当地人的健康可能造成的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to look at the possible consequences of your actions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要想一想你的行为可能造成的后果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Hollywood, anything is possible anything can happen, even though it may seem very unlikely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在好莱坞万事皆有可能。

Sense.DEF: the best etc that can exist or be achieved
Sense.TRAN: 最好的/最大的/最快的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to get the best possible price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量要拿到最好的价格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What is the worst possible thing that could happen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最坏的情况会是什么呢？

Sense.LEXUNIT: would it be possible (for sb) to do sth?
Sense.DEF: used when asking politely if you can do or have something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would it be possible to speak to Oliver?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可不可以和奥利弗说说？

Exponent.DEF: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think it’s possible that we could win the race.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们有可能赢那场比赛。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I want to get back by 5 o’clock if possible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能的话我想5点钟前回来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Please let me know your answer as soon as possible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请尽快给我答复。

Exponent.DEF: if an idea or plan is feasible, it is possible and you can find a practical way of doing it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need to find out first if the idea is technically feasible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们首先要弄清楚这一想法在技术上是否可行。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is not feasible to have security cameras in every part of the building.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大楼的每一个地方都安上监控摄像头是行不通的。

Exponent.DEF: possible and likely to be successful, and therefore worth doing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nuclear energy is the only viable alternative to coal or gas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 核能是唯一可能替代煤或汽油的能源。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The product needs to be commercially viable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该产品得是在商业上可行的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company was no longer financially viable (=it could not make enough money to be able to continue).
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司财务上已难以维持了。

Exponent.DEF: a workable plan, system, or solution is one that can be done or used
Exponent.EXAMPLE: By early morning, they had arrived at a workable and safe solution.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 到凌晨时他们找到了一个可行且安全的解决办法。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company would have a tough job convincing people that the deal was workable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司要让大家相信这宗交易是可行的,这会很困难。

Exponent.DEF: if something is doable, you have enough money, energy, or skill to do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This exercise programme is doable for most people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一锻炼计划对大多数人都是可行的。

Exponent.DEF: able to be achieved
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A 15% cut in carbon emissions is achievable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 碳排放量减少15%是能做到的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Perfect democracy is not attainable, nor is perfect freedom or perfect justice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全的民主是达不到的,完全的自由或公正也是做不到的。

Exponent.DEF: if something is realistic, it seems sensible to think that it can be done or achieved
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a realistic target
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际的目标
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their expectations didn’t seem very realistic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的期望似乎不太现实。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that might be suitable or acceptable for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frank’s a possible for the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克是那份工作的一个可能人选。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that something may be true or likely, although you are not completely certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: This last task is possibly the most difficult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这最后一项任务也许是最难的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will take three weeks, possibly longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要花三个星期﹐也许更久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will you be here tomorrow?’ ‘Possibly.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你明天到这儿来吗？”“也许吧。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Was it murder?’ ‘ Quite possibly it is very likely .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “是谋杀吗？”“很可能是。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are very surprised or shocked by something, or you cannot understand it
Sense.TRAN: 竟然〔用于强调惊讶﹑震惊或不能理解〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could anyone possibly do such a thing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么竟会有人做出这样的事？

Sense.DEF: used when making a polite request
Sense.TRAN: 请你…可以吗？〔用于礼貌地请求〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you possibly close that window?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您能把那扇窗关上吗？

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone will do or has done everything they can to help or to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We shall be contributing as much as we possibly can to the campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将尽最大努力为这场运动做出贡献。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors did everything they possibly could to save his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们竭尽所能挽救他的生命。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you cannot do something, or that something cannot or could not happen or be done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t possibly allow you to go home in this weather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不可能让你在这种天气回家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t possibly have heard what was said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不可能听见说了什么。

Sense.DEF: one of various types of small furry animals that climb trees and live in America or Australia
Sense.TRAN: 负鼠﹐袋貂〔产于美洲或澳大利亚〕

Sense.DEF: to pretend to be asleep or dead so that someone will not annoy or hurt you
a job, especially an important one in a large organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指大型机构内重要的〕工作﹐职位
Sense.EXAMPLE: I applied for the post and was asked to attend an interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我申请了那个职位﹐被要求参加面试。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was offered the post of ambassador to India.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被委任为驻印度大使。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He will take up his post as Head of Modern Languages in September.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将于9月份就任当代语言系系主任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goddard has held the post since 1998.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈达德自1998年起一直担任该职务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately they were unable to find a suitable person to fill the post .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗憾的是他们找不到一个合适的人选填补空缺。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Thomson resigned his £50,000 a year post in April.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4 月﹐汤姆森先生辞去了他年收入5万英镑的职位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She now holds a senior post in the Department of Education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她目前在教育部担任高级职务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the creation of 4,000 new teaching posts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 创造4,000个新的教学职位

Sense.DEF: the official system for carrying letters, packages etc from one place to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The winners will be notified by post.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将以邮件形式通知获奖者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your letter must have got lost in the post .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的信一定是寄丢了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll put a copy of the book in the post send it .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会寄一本书过来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A parcel arrived through the post.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个包裹寄到了。

Sense.DEF: letters, packages etc that are sent and delivered
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was there any post for me today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天有我的邮件吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emma was opening her post .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛正在拆邮件。

Sense.DEF: when letters are collected or delivered
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time does the post go get collected ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么时候来取邮件？

GramExa.GLOSS: the first, second etc collection or delivery of letters each day
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔每天的〕第一次/第二次/最后一次收取[投递]信件
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Applications must arrive by first post on September 23.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请书必须在9月23日第一次邮件投递时间前寄到。

GramExa.GLOSS: post your letter in time for it to be collected, or not in time

Sense.DEF: a strong upright piece of wood, metal etc that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fence post
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 篱笆桩

Sense.DEF:
one of the two upright pieces of wood between which players try to kick or hit the ball in football,
hockey
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ball hit the post and bounced off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球击中门柱﹐弹了出去。

Sense.DEF: used in the names of some newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 邮报〔用于某些报纸名称中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ‘Washington Post’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《华盛顿邮报》

Sense.DEF: the place where a soldier, guard etc is expected to be in order to do their job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By 5 am the soldiers were already at their posts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 清晨5点士兵们已经在哨位上站岗了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: No one was allowed to leave their post .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何人都不得离开岗位。

Sense.DEF: a place, especially one on a border, where soldiers or police are guarding, checking etc something
Sense.TRAN: 边境哨所/军事哨所/海关关卡/警察岗亭

Sense.LEXUNIT: the post(also 又作the finishing post
Sense.DEF: the place where a race finishes, especially a horse race
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Magic was first past the post .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “魔术先生”一马当先冲过终点。

Sense.DEF: a message sent to an Internet discussion group so that all members of the group can read it
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was post after post criticizing the Minister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评部长的帖子一个接一个。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be driven/pushed from pillar to post

Sense.DEF: to send a letter, package etc by post
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just gone to post a letter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚出去寄信了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you remember to post the card to my parents?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你记得给我父母寄那张卡片了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I posted Barry the cheque last Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上星期五我把支票寄给巴里了。

Sense.DEF:
to push something through someone’s
letterbox
Sense.TRAN: 把某物塞进某人的门缝里/信箱里
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll post the key through your letterbox when I leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走的时候会把钥匙塞进你的信箱里。

Sense.DEF: if you are posted somewhere, your employer sends you to work there, usually for several years

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He joined the British Army and was posted to Germany.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参加了英国陆军﹐被派驻德国。
把某人派到国外/海外

Sense.DEF: to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exam results were posted on the bulletin board yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试成绩昨天在布告板上贴出来了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone be in a particular place in order to guard a building, check who enters or leaves a place, watch something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guards were to be posted around nuclear power stations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核电站周围要设置卫兵。

Sense.DEF: to regularly tell someone the most recent news about something
Sense.TRAN: 经常向某人报告最新的情况

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll keep you posted on his progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我将随时向你通报他的进展。

Sense.DEF: to officially record and announce information about a company’s financial situation or a country’s economic situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cisco Systems posted record profits and sales for the third fiscal quarter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 思科系统公司公布了第三个财政季度创纪录的利润和销售情况。

Sense.DEF: to put a message or computer document on the Internet so that other people can see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you post those new flyers on David’s website?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把那些新的小广告贴到戴维的网站上吗？

Sense.DEF: if a soldier is posted missing, it is announced officially that they have disappeared

to pay a specific amount of money in order to be allowed to leave prison before your
trial
later than or after something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the post-war years the years after a particular war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后的年月
Sense.EXAMPLE: the post-1979 Conservative government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1979年以后的保守党政府

Sense.DEF: the money charged for sending a letter, package etc by post
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much is the postage for a postcard?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寄一张明信片的邮资是多少？

GramExa.GLOSS: the charge for packing and sending something you have bought
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s yours for £13.99, including postage and packing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 花13.99英镑﹐它就是你的了﹐含邮资和包装费。

Sense.DEF: a machine used by businesses which puts a mark on letters and packages to show that postage has been paid
Sense.TRAN: 邮资机〔商业机构在信封或包裹上盖印以示邮资已付的机器〕

Sense.DEF: a stamp
relating to the official system which takes letters from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: the U.S. postal service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国邮政
Sense.EXAMPLE: an increase in postal charges
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮资的上涨

Sense.DEF: relating to sending things by post
Sense.EXAMPLE: Candidates are chosen by a postal ballot of all party members.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 候选人由所有党员通过邮寄方式投票选出。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Housebound voters should register early for a postal vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能出门的选民应该尽早登记以邮寄选票。

Sense.DEF: to become very angry and behave in a violent way
an official document that you buy in a post office and send to someone so that they can then exchange it for money
all the letters received by an important person, television programme etc on a particular occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔重要人物﹑电视节目等收到的〕一批信函
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had an enormous postbag on the recent programme changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到了大批关于最近节目变更的来信。

Sense.DEF: a bag for carrying letters, used by the person who delivers them

PIC.HEADING: POSTBOX 邮筒
PIC.PICCONTENT: UK postbox 英国邮筒；US mailbox 美国邮筒

Sense.DEF: a box in a public place, into which you put letters that you want to send
a card that can be sent in the post without an envelope, especially one with a picture on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to send us a postcard!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了给我们寄张明信片！

Sense.DEF: a group of numbers and letters that you write at the end of an address on an envelope, package etc. The postcode shows the exact area where someone lives and helps the post office deliver the post more quickly.
a situation in which different things or services are provided by the health service, local government etc in different parts of the country – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 邮编幸运医疗﹐（医疗）服务的地域差异〔指不同地区的医疗服务或地方政府等提供的物品或服务有所不同﹔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some sufferers are denied treatment because of the postcode lottery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些患者由于地域差异的原因而被拒绝治疗。

Sense.DEF: happening or done after having sex
if you postdate a cheque, you write it with a date that is later than the actual date, so that it will not become effective until that time
to happen, live, or be made later in history than something else
Sense.TRAN: 发生于…之后﹔生活在…之后﹔晚于…
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the mosaics postdate this period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些镶嵌画中有些要晚于这段时期。

Sense.DEF:
relating to study done after a
phd
Sense.EXAMPLE: post doctoral research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博士后研究

Sense.DEF: a large printed notice, picture, or photograph, used to advertise something or as a decoration
Sense.EXAMPLE: A team of volunteers were putting up posters .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一队志愿者正在张贴海报。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a poster campaign for the election
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举的海报宣传

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the poster for the exhibition
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 展览的大幅广告

GramExa.EXAMPLE: posters of old movie stars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老电影明星的海报

Sense.DEF: a child with a particular illness or physical problem whose picture appears on a poster advertising the work of an organization that helps children with that problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔公益广告中的〕海报儿童﹐代言儿童

Sense.DEF: someone or something that represents a particular quality, idea etc – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 典型人物﹐典型事物〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dillon is the poster child for wasted talent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狄龙是典型的被埋没的人才。

Sense.DEF: a post office department which keeps letters for people who are travelling, until they arrive to collect them
near or at the back of something
Sense.TRAN: （靠近）后部的﹐后端的﹔后面的﹐背部的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the posterior part of the brain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑后部

Sense.DEF: the part of the body you sit on – used humorously
all the people in the future who will be alive after you are dead

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a priceless work of art that must be kept for posterity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须保存好留给后人的一件无价艺术品

Sense.DEF: brightly coloured paint that contains no oil, used especially by children to paint pictures
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指儿童画画用的〕广告颜料

Sense.DEF: happening after a sports game
Sense.EXAMPLE: postgame celebrations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛后的庆祝活动

Sense.DEF: a postgraduate

someone who is studying at a university to get a
master’s degree
or a
phd
relating to studies done at a university after completing a first degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: postgraduate degrees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究生学位

Sense.DEF:
relating to studies done after completing a
phd
very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He departed post-haste for Verdun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他急忙动身赶往凡尔登。

Sense.DEF: happening, printed etc after someone’s death
Sense.TRAN: 死后发生的﹔死后获得的﹔死后出版的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a posthumous collection of his articles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身后出版的文集

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was posthumously awarded the Military Cross.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被追授军功十字勋章。

Sense.DEF:
a
postman
relating to the period in the late 20th century when the older types of industry became less important, and computers became more important
Sense.TRAN: 后工业化的﹐工业化之后的〔指20世纪晚期旧有的工业类型重要性下降﹐而计算机产业的重要性则增加〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the post-industrial information-based society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后工业化信息社会

Sense.DEF: if a soldier, a representative of a country etc gets a posting somewhere, they are sent there to do their job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: shortly before his posting to South Africa
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他被派往南非前不久

Sense.EXAMPLE: a diplomatic posting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交任命

Sense.DEF: a message sent to an Internet discussion group so that all members of the group can read it
a public notice, especially one advertising a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: job postings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 招聘广告

Sense.DEF: a small piece of coloured paper that sticks to things, used for leaving notes for people
someone whose job is to collect and deliver letters
an official mark made on a letter, package etc to show when and where it was posted

Tail.EXAMPLETRAN: 这封信上盖着艾奥瓦州的邮戳。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a post office

a postmenopausal woman has gone through the
menopause when she stops having her monthly flow of blood
a woman who is in charge of a post office
relating to or influenced by postmodernism
Sense.TRAN: 后现代主义的﹔受后现代主义影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: postmodern architecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后现代主义建筑

Sense.DEF: used to describe styles, attitudes etc that are typical of the social life that is found in many western countries now, in which television, video, the buying of goods and services etc are very important
Sense.TRAN: 后现代的〔用于形容当今许多西方国家的社会生活﹐其中电视﹑录像﹑消费等占重要地位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: postmodern culture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后现代文化

Sense.DEF:
a style of building, painting, writing etc, developed in the late 20th century, that uses a mixture of old and new styles as a reaction against
modernism
Sense.TRAN: 后现代主义〔发展于20世纪晚期的建筑﹑绘画﹑写作等风格﹐融合新旧风格﹐是对现代主义的反动〕

Sense.DEF: an examination of a dead body to discover why the person died

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A post-mortem on the body revealed that the victim had been strangled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸检表明被害人是被掐死的。

Sense.DEF: an examination of a plan or event that failed, done to discover why it failed
Sense.TRAN: 〔对失败的计划或事件进行的〕事后剖析﹐事后检讨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a post-mortem on the company’s poor results
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对公司业绩不佳进行的反思

Sense.DEF: relating to the time after a baby is born
Sense.EXAMPLE: postnatal care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产后护理

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: an illness in which a woman feels very unhappy and tired after her baby is born

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产后抑郁症

Sense.DEF: a place where you can buy stamps, send letters and packages etc
the national organization which is responsible for collecting and delivering letters

a
po box
relating to the time after someone has had a medical operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: post-operative care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 术后护理

Sense.DEF: costing nothing to send because the amount has already been paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kit costs $33.95 postpaid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套用具是33.95美元﹐含邮费。

Sense.DEF: relating to the time immediately after a woman has a baby
to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one
Sense.TRAN: 使〔事件﹑行动等〕延期﹐延迟﹐推迟
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match had to be postponed until next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve decided to postpone having a family for a while.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定推迟一段时间要孩子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His trial has been postponed indefinitely no one knows when it will happen .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

Sense.DEF: happening immediately after a meal – often used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: a postprandial nap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭后小睡

Sense.DEF: a message written at the end of a letter after you have signed your name
Sense.TRAN: 〔信末署名后的〕附笔﹐附言﹐又及

Sense.DEF: extra details or information that you add after a story or an account
Sense.TRAN: 〔加在故事﹑叙述等末尾的〕附言﹐补充说明

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s an interesting postscript to this tale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事后面有一段有趣的附记。

Sense.DEF: relating to the time after the usual sports season is over
Sense.EXAMPLE: a postseason game
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 季后赛

Sense.DEF:
relating to schools or education after you have finished
high school
Sense.TRAN: 中学后的﹔后中等教育的

Sense.DEF: a mental illness which can develop after a very bad experience such as a plane crash
Sense.TRAN: 创伤后应激障碍〔遭遇飞机失事等创伤性事件后患上的精神疾病〕

Sense.DEF: to suggest that something might have happened or be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It has been postulated that the condition is inherited.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人认为这种疾病可能是遗传的。

Sense.DEF: something believed to be true, on which an argument or scientific discussion is based
Sense.TRAN: 假定﹐假设﹐公理〔被认为理所当然的事实﹐是推论的基础〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the basic postulates of Marxism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思主义的基本假设

Sense.DEF: relating to the way you sit or stand
Sense.EXAMPLE: postural problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐立姿势问题

Sense.DEF: the way you position your body when sitting or standing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Poor posture can lead to muscular problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不良的姿势可能会导致肌肉问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: her upright posture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她笔挺的姿势

Sense.DEF: the way you behave or think in a particular situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tends to adopt a defensive posture towards new ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于新思想他往往采取戒备的态度。

Sense.DEF: when someone pretends to have a particular opinion or attitude
Sense.TRAN: 〔指观点或态度上〕假装的姿态﹐装腔作势
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dismissed the Senator’s comments as ‘ political posturing ’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为参议员的这番话只是一种“政治姿态”而不予考虑。

Sense.DEF: when someone stands or moves in a way that they hope will make other people notice and admire them
happening or existing after a war, especially the Second World War
Sense.TRAN: 战后的﹔〔尤指〕第二次世界大战之后的
Sense.EXAMPLE: post-war Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二战后的英国

GramExa.EXAMPLE: food rationing in the immediate post-war years
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后头几年的食物配给政策

Sense.DEF:
a small
bunch
of flowers

Sense.DEF: a container used for cooking which is round, deep, and usually made of metal
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常为金属制成的圆而深的〕锅

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a big pot of soup on the stove.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉子上有一大锅汤。

Sense.DEF: a container for a plant, usually made of plastic or baked clay
Sense.EXAMPLE: herbs growing in pots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长在花盆里的草本植物

Sense.DEF: a container with a handle and a small tube for pouring, used to make tea or coffee
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there any tea left in the pot?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 壶里还有茶吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll make a pot of coffee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要煮壶咖啡。

Sense.DEF:
a round container for storing foods such as
jam
that are slightly liquid, or for substances such as glue or paint

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pot of blue paint

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 果酱瓶/油漆罐/酸奶瓶等

Sense.DEF: a dish, bowl, plate, or another container that is made by shaping clay and then baking it
Sense.TRAN: 陶碟﹔陶碗﹔陶盆﹔陶制容器
Sense.EXAMPLE: an earthenware pot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陶罐

Sense.DEF: if something such as a place or an organization goes to pot, it becomes much worse or fails because no one is taking care of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has let the whole country go to pot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个政府已令整个国家败落了。

Sense.DEF: a lot of money

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s hoping to make pots of money from the deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望能从那笔交易中赚一大笔钱。

Subsense.DEF: money that is available to do something, especially money that people have collected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: So far we’ve got £150 in the pot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们目前凑了150英镑。

Subsense.DEF: all the money that people have risked in a card game, and which can be won
Subsense.TRAN: 〔纸牌游戏的〕全部赌注﹐赌注总额

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赌注总额是1,000美元。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael was smoking pot with some friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔和一些朋友在吸大麻。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (a case of) the pot calling the kettle black
Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that you should not criticize someone for something, because you have done the same thing or have the same fault
Sense.TRAN: 锅笑壶黑﹐五十步笑百步

a

to hit a ball into one of the
pocket s holes at the edge of the table
in games such as

,
spool
, and

potable water is safe to drink

a common soft silver-white metal that usually exists in combination with other substances, used for example in farming. It is a chemical element: symbol K

Sense.DEF: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or pale yellow skin, that grows under the ground

Sense.DEF: a large round unattractive stomach that sticks out
a book or film that is produced quickly to make money and which is not of very high quality, especially one that is exciting or romantic
Sense.TRAN: 〔为赚钱而〕粗制滥造的书[影片]

Sense.DEF: a plant that is potbound cannot grow any more because its roots have grown to fill the pot it is in

Irish
whisky
made secretly and illegally to avoid paying tax
Sense.TRAN: 〔为逃税而〕私酿的爱尔兰威士忌酒

Sense.DEF: the power that something has to influence people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the potency of his arguments
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的论据的说服力

Sense.EXAMPLE: The myth of male superiority was losing its potency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性优越的错误观念在逐渐失去影响力。

Sense.DEF: the strength of something, especially a drug, on your mind or body

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the potency of the drug
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该药的药力

Sense.DEF: the ability of a man to have sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: loss of potency after age 40
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 40岁以后性功能的减弱

Sense.DEF: having a very powerful effect or influence on your body or mind
Sense.TRAN: 有效力的﹐效力大的﹔有影响力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: potent drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强效药物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a potent symbol of oppression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压迫的有力象征
Sense.EXAMPLE: Advertising is a potent force in showing smoking as a socially acceptable habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告的力量很大﹐把吸烟说成为社会所接受的习惯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good company pension scheme remains a potent weapon for attracting staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的公司养老金计划依然是吸引员工的有效武器。

Sense.DEF: powerful and effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treaty requires them to get rid of their most potent weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条约要求他们销毁威力最强大的武器。

Sense.DEF:
a man who is potent is able to have sex or able to make a woman
pregnant
a ruler in the past, who had great power over his people
likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: new ways of attracting potential customers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸引潜在客户的新方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the potential benefits of the new system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新体制的潜在好处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the potential risks to health associated with the drug
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药物对健康的潜在危害

Sense.DEF: the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company certainly has the potential for growth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司肯定有发展潜力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the potential of the Internet to create jobs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网创造就业机会的潜力

Sense.DEF: if people or things have potential, they have a natural ability or quality that could develop to make them very good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has the potential to become a champion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有潜力成为冠军。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a young player with great potential
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名很有潜力的年轻球员

GramExa.GLOSS: succeed as well as you possibly can

Sense.DEF:
the difference in
voltage
between two points on an electrical
circuit
the energy that something has because of its position or state, rather than because it is moving
an ability or quality that could develop in the future
something that is potentially dangerous, useful etc is not dangerous etc now, but may become so in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: a potentially dangerous situation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有潜在危险的局势

Sense.DEF: the amount a pot can contain
a piece of thick material that you use to protect your hands when you pick up a hot cooking pan
a large hole in the surface of a road, caused by traffic and bad weather, which makes driving difficult or dangerous
a long hole that goes deep under the ground, formed by natural processes

the sport of climbing down
pothole s
and underground
cave s
a drink intended to have a special or magical effect on the person who drinks it, or which is intended to poison them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magic potion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 魔法药水
Sense.EXAMPLE: a love potion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春药饮剂

Sense.DEF: a medicine, especially one that seems strange or old-fashioned
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指看上去奇怪或旧时的〕药物

Subsense.DEF: to choose something without knowing very much about it, and hope that it will be what you want
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We hadn’t booked a hotel so we had to take pot luck.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有预订酒店﹐所以只能碰运气。

Subsense.DEF: to have a meal at someone’s home in which you eat whatever they have available, rather than food which has been specially bought for the occasion
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure what there is in the fridge – you’ll have to take pot luck.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不清楚冰箱里有什么——你只能有什么吃什么。

Sense.DEF: a meal in which everyone who is invited brings something to eat
Sense.TRAN: 〔参加者各带食物拼成的〕百乐餐
Sense.EXAMPLE: a potluck supper at the church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在教堂举办的百乐晚餐

Sense.DEF:
meat and vegetables covered with
pastry
and baked in a deep dish
a plant that is grown indoors in a pot
a mixture of pieces of dried flowers and leaves kept in a bowl to make a room smell pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 百花香〔放在碗里的干花和叶子﹐能使室内空气芳香〕

Sense.DEF: a mixture of things that are not usually put together, for example different pieces of music or writing
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐或文学作品等的〕集锦﹔杂集

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a potpourri of literary styles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多种文学风格的集锦

Sense.DEF: a dish that consists of a piece of meat cooked slowly in a pan with potatoes and other vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 罐炖肉菜〔用一块肉和马铃薯以及其他蔬菜一起炖成〕

Subsense.LEXUNIT: take a pot shot at sb/sth
Subsense.DEF: to shoot at someone or something without aiming very carefully
Subsense.TRAN: 对某人/某物任意射击[盲目射击﹐乱射]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The boy took a pot shot at a pigeon with his air gun.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩用他的气枪对着一只鸽子胡乱开了一枪。

Subsense.DEF: to criticize someone or something unfairly without thinking carefully about it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He enjoys taking pot shots at the government whenever the opportunity arises.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一有机会他就对政府大肆批评。

Sense.DEF: growing indoors in a pot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a potted plant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盆栽植物

Sense.DEF: a short and simple explanation or description that gives only the most important facts about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book gives a potted history of the origins of modern science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书简述了现代科学起源的历史。

Sense.DEF:
potted meat or fish has been cooked and stored in a container, usually in the form of a
paste
for spreading on bread
Sense.TRAN: 〔肉﹑鱼〕罐装的〔一般为酱状﹐涂面包用〕

Sense.DEF: someone who makes pots, dishes etc out of clay
to spend time doing pleasant things that are not important without hurrying
Sense.TRAN: 悠然地做些轻松的工作[琐碎的事情]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the morning pottering about in the garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一上午在花园里随便干了些轻松的活儿。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that turns around, onto which wet clay is placed so that it can be shaped by hand into a pot
objects made out of baked clay
Sense.EXAMPLE: Native American pottery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美洲印第安人的陶器

Sense.DEF: clay that has been shaped and baked in order to make pots, dishes etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pottery bowl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陶碗

Sense.DEF: the activity of making pots, dishes etc out of clay
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pottery class
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陶艺班

Sense.DEF: a factory where pottery objects are made
Sense.TRAN: 陶瓷厂 ﹔陶器工厂 ﹔制陶作坊

Sense.DEF: a small building, usually made of wood, where garden tools, seeds etc are kept
Sense.TRAN: 〔存放园艺工具﹑种子等的〕小木屋﹐园圃棚

Sense.DEF: crazy or silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a potty idea!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么愚蠢的主意！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must be potty!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定是疯了！

Sense.DEF: if something or someone is driving you potty, they are annoying you, especially if they are making it difficult for you to continue what you are doing
to like someone very much, or be very interested in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s potty about riding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很爱骑马。

Sense.DEF: a container used by very young children as a toilet
to use the toilet – used by young children or when speaking to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you need to go potty?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不要上厕所？

Sense.DEF: someone who has or is a potty mouth uses offensive words
a time when you stop what you are doing, especially when driving a car, so that you can use the toilet – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 解手的时间〔尤指开车途中停下解手的间隙﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: using a lot of rude or offensive words
the process of teaching a very young child to use a potty or toilet
a small leather, cloth, or plastic bag that you can keep things in, and which is sometimes attached to a belt

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a leather pouch of tobacco
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 装烟丝的小皮袋

Sense.EXAMPLE: a money pouch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个钱袋

Sense.DEF: a large bag for carrying letters or papers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mail pouch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个邮件袋

Sense.DEF:
a pocket in the side of a bag such as a
rucksack

a pocket of skin on the stomach which
marsupial s
such as
kangaroo s
use for carrying their babies

a fold of skin like a bag which animals such as
hamster s
or
squirrel s
have inside each cheek to carry and store food

a soft piece of furniture like a large
cushion
, which you can sit on or rest your feet on
something that is put on someone’s skin to make it less swollen or painful, often made of a wet cloth with milk, herbs, or clay on it
birds such as chickens and ducks that are kept on farms in order to produce eggs and meat
meat from birds such as chickens and ducks
to suddenly move forward and attack someone or something, after waiting to attack them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat was hiding in the bushes, ready to pounce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫躲在灌木丛中﹐准备扑上去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kevin pounced on Liam and started hitting him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文猛然扑向利亚姆并动手打他。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone’s mistakes or ideas very quickly and eagerly
Sense.TRAN: 急于批评〔某人的错误或想法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers are quick to pounce on students’ grammatical errors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师一眼就能看出学生的语法错误﹐并立即指正。

Sense.DEF: to eagerly take an opportunity as soon as it becomes available
Sense.EXAMPLE: When they offered O’Leary the chance to become manager, he pounced on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给奥利里一个机会让他当经理﹐他马上就接受了。

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring weight, equal to 16
ounce s
or 0.454 kilograms
Sense.TRAN: 磅〔重量单位﹐相当于16盎司或0.454公斤〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pound of apples
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一磅苹果

Sense.EXAMPLE: Moira weighs about 130 pounds .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫伊拉的体重约为130磅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The grapes cost $2 a pound .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葡萄的价格是2美元一磅。

Subsense.DEF: the standard unit of money in Britain, which is divided into 100 pence
Subsense.TRAN: 英镑〔英国标准货币单位﹐等于100便士〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They spent over a thousand pounds.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们花了一千多英镑。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a multi-million pound business
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一笔几百万英镑的生意
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a five pound note
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五英镑的纸币

Subsense.DEF: the value of British money compared with the value of the money of other countries
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The pound was up against the dollar.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑兑美元的汇率有所上升。

Subsense.DEF: the standard unit of money in various other countries, such as Egypt and the Sudan
Subsense.TRAN: 镑〔埃及﹑苏丹等国的标准货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: a place where dogs and cats that have been found on the street are kept until their owners come to get them
a place where cars that have been illegally parked are kept until their owners pay money to get them back
Sense.TRAN: 〔违规停放车辆的〕临时扣押场

Sense.LEXUNIT: get/take/demand etc your pound of flesh
Sense.DEF: to get the full amount of work, money etc that someone owes you, even though it makes them suffer and you do not really need it. The phrase comes from Shylock, a character in the play The Merchant of Venice by William Shakespeare. He is a Jewish money-lender who lends money to Antonio. When Antonio is unable to pay the money back, Shylock says he has the right to cut a pound of flesh from Antonio’s body.
Sense.TRAN: 无情地要回所欠之物〔此短语源自莎士比亚的戏剧《威尼斯商人》中放高利贷的犹太商人夏洛克一角〕

Sense.DEF:
the
pound key
to hit something very hard several times and make a lot of noise, damage it, break it into smaller pieces etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began pounding the keyboard of his computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始猛敲电脑键盘。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thomas pounded on the door with his fist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托马斯用拳头捶门。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Waves pounded against the pier.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浪涛猛烈地拍击着码头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Green pounded his fist on the counter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林用拳头猛敲柜台。

Sense.DEF: if your heart or blood is pounding, your heart is beating very hard and quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Patrick rushed to the door, his heart pounding with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克冲到门口﹐他的心激动得怦怦直跳。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She ran, her heart pounding in her chest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跑着﹐心在胸口狂跳。

Sense.DEF: if your head is pounding, it feels painful, especially because you have a headache or you have been using a lot of effort
to walk or run quickly with heavy loud steps

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could hear him pounding up the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到他咚咚咚地上楼来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a policeman pounding his beat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 徒步巡逻的警察
Sense.EXAMPLE: Runners will be pounding the pavement this weekend during the London Marathon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周末伦敦马拉松比赛期间选手们将跑上街头。

Sense.DEF: to attack a place continuously for a long time with bombs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enemy forces have been pounding the city for over two months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌军两个多月来一直在猛攻那个城市。

Sense.DEF: to play music loudly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Rolling Stones were pounding out one of their old numbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚石乐队正高唱他们的一首老歌。

Sense.DEF: an amount charged for every pound in weight, or for every British £1 in value
Sense.TRAN: 按每磅重量的收费﹔按每英镑价值计算的收费

Sense.DEF: weight
a heavy cake made from flour, sugar, and butter
Sense.TRAN: 磅蛋糕﹐重糖重黄油蛋糕

Subsense.DEF: an animal, fish, or person that weighs 3 pounds, 24 pounds etc
Subsense.TRAN: 重3磅/24磅/185磅等的动物[鱼﹐人等]

Subsense.DEF:
a gun that fires a
shell
that weighs 3 pounds, 24 pounds etc
Subsense.TRAN: 炮弹重为3磅/24磅/185磅等的大炮

Sense.DEF: the action or the sound of something hitting a surface very hard many times

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pounding of the waves on the rocks below
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 底下波涛拍击岩石的声音

Sense.DEF: the action or sound of your heart beating

Subsense.DEF: to be completely defeated
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Manchester United took a real pounding.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼联队遭遇惨败。

Subsense.DEF: to be hit or attacked many times and often badly damaged
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ship had taken a pounding on the rocks.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条船触礁了﹐船体严重受损。

Sense.DEF:
the button on a telephone that has the
symbol
(#) on it

the
symbol
(£), used for a pound in British money

the
symbol
(#), used especially on a telephone
the standard unit of money in Britain, which is divided into 100 pence
Sense.TRAN: 英镑〔英国标准货币单位﹐等于100便士〕

Sense.DEF: to make a liquid or other substance flow out of or into a container by holding it at an angle
Sense.EXAMPLE: She poured coffee for everyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为每个人都倒了咖啡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pour the oil into a frying pan and heat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把油倒入煎锅内加热。

GramExa.GLOSS: get rid of something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wine was so bad I just poured it away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那酒太糟糕﹐我索性把它倒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you pour yourself another drink ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么不给自己再倒杯酒呢？

Sense.DEF: if a lot of liquid or smoke pours out, it comes out from somewhere in very large amounts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smoke was pouring out of the upstairs windows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟从楼上的窗户里滚滚冒出。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blood was pouring from his nose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 血从他的鼻子里涌出来。

Sense.DEF: to rain heavily without stopping
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s pouring now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在下着瓢泼大雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It poured all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倾盆大雨下了一整夜。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it’s pouring with rain/it poured with rain
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was pouring down with rain at three o’clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 3 点钟的时候下着滂沱大雨。

Sense.DEF: if a lot of people or things pour into or out of a place, a lot of them arrive or leave at the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crowds began pouring out of the stadium.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群开始从体育场里不断涌出。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Offers of help poured in from all over the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国各地纷纷伸出援助之手。

Sense.DEF: if light is pouring into or out of a place, a lot of light is coming in or out

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Light was pouring into the courtyard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 光洒进庭院。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone’s plan, idea, or desire to do something so much that they no longer feel excited about it
to say that something or someone is stupid and not worth considering
Sense.TRAN: 鄙夷地谈论某人/某事物﹐对某人/某事物嗤之以鼻

Sense.DEF: to try to stop a quarrel, for example by talking to people and making them calmer
Sense.TRAN: 平息风波﹐调解争端﹐息事宁人

Subsense.DEF: to behave or talk in a particular way in order to make people like you or feel sorry for you
Subsense.TRAN: 〔为获得好感或同情而〕装腔作势﹐极力渲染

Subsense.DEF: to try very hard in order to do something, especially in order to win a game
Subsense.TRAN: 全力以赴〔尤为了打赢比赛〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Raiders really poured it on in the second quarter.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突袭者队在第二节中打得非常卖力。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a very nice and polite way, in order to make someone like you
if people pour money into something, they provide a lot of money for it over a period of time, in order to make it successful
Sense.TRAN: 大量投入〔金钱〕于〔某事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve poured thousands of pounds into developing the business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经投入几千英镑开发这项业务。

Sense.DEF: if you pour out your thoughts, feelings etc, you tell someone all about them, especially because you feel very unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: She poured out all her troubles to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向他倾诉自己所有的烦恼。

GramExa.GLOSS: tell someone all your feelings, including your most secret ones

Sense.DEF: pouring rain is very heavy rain
to push out your lower lip because you are annoyed or unhappy, or in order to look sexually attractive
Sense.TRAN: 噘起（嘴唇）﹐噘嘴〔因不高兴或为显得性感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sounded like a pouting child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听上去像个生气噘嘴的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her full lips pouted slightly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丰满的双唇微微噘起。

Sense.DEF: the situation or experience of being poor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。
Sense.EXAMPLE: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: scenes of abject poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极度贫困的情景
Sense.EXAMPLE: the causes of urban poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 造成城市贫困的原因

Sense.DEF: the income below which a person or a family is officially considered to be very poor and in need of help
Sense.EXAMPLE: 20% of the population now live below the poverty line .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在有20%的人口生活在贫困线以下。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a poor person without a job cannot afford to take a low paying job because they would lose the money they receive from the government
Sense.TRAN: 贫困陷阱〔指贫困者干低收入工作会得不偿失﹐因为会失去政府补贴〕

Sense.DEF: a lack of a particular quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The novel shows a surprising poverty of imagination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部小说惊人地缺乏想象力。

Sense.DEF: extremely poor
Sense.EXAMPLE: poverty-stricken families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赤贫的家庭

Sense.DEF:
used to represent the sound of a gun firing, an explosion, or someone hitting another person hard, especially in children’s
comic s
Sense.TRAN: 啪﹐砰〔表示枪声﹑爆炸声或打人的声音﹐尤用于儿童漫画中〕

Sense.DEF:
a
prisoner of war
a dry substance in the form of very small grains
Sense.EXAMPLE: curry powder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖喱粉
Sense.EXAMPLE: talcum powder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑石[爽身]粉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grind the sugar into a powder .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把糖碾成粉末。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paint is supplied in powder form .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种涂料以粉末状供应。

GramExa.GLOSS: a powder that you add water to in order to change it into a liquid

Sense.DEF: a type of powder that you put on your face in order to make it look smoother and to give it more colour
a dangerous situation or place where violence or trouble could suddenly start
Sense.TRAN: 火药桶〔比喻暴力或麻烦随时可能发生的危险局面或地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since the riot, the city has been a powder keg waiting to explode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自那次骚乱以来﹐这座城市就是一个随时可能爆炸的火药桶。

Sense.DEF: dry light snow
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a foot of powder on the slopes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斜坡上积有一英尺厚的干雪。

Sense.DEF: to wait calmly until you see how a situation develops before deciding what to do
Sense.TRAN: 静观其变再相机行事﹐按兵不动但随时准备出击

Sense.DEF: to put powder on something, especially your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was powdering her face .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在往脸上搽粉。

Sense.DEF:
an expression meaning to go to the
toilet
, used by women to avoid saying this directly
Sense.TRAN: 补妆〔女士上厕所的委婉说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just gone to powder her nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚去补妆了。

Sense.DEF: a pale blue colour
produced or sold in the form of a powder
Sense.EXAMPLE: powdered milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶粉

Sense.DEF: covered with powder
sugar in a powder form

a small round piece of soft material used by women to spread
powder
on their face or body
a room with a toilet for women, especially in a pubic place – used to avoid saying this directly
Sense.TRAN: 补妆室〔女厕所的委婉说法〕

Sense.DEF: like powder or easily broken into powder
Sense.TRAN: 粉末状的﹔易碎成粉末的
Sense.EXAMPLE: powdery snow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粉状雪

Sense.DEF: covered with powder
the ability or right to control people or events

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People should have more power over the decisions that affect their lives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们应该对影响自己生活的决定拥有更多主宰权。

GramExa.GLOSS: wanting too much power
GramExa.EXAMPLE: power-hungry politicians
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 渴望权力的政客们

Sense.DEF: the position of having political control of a country or government

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The voters have once again shown their support for the party in power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民再一次对执政党表示支持。

GramExa.GLOSS: start having political control
GramExa.EXAMPLE: De Gaulle came to power in 1958.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴高乐于1958年开始执政。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They seized power in a military coup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在一场军事政变中夺取了政权。

Sense.DEF: the ability to influence people or give them strong feelings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the power of his writing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他文章的感染力
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the immense power of television
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视的巨大影响力

Sense.EXAMPLE: the pulling power ability to attract people or attention of major celebrities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大名人的吸引力

GramExa.GLOSS: the political or social influence a particular group has
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 学生/黑人/消费者等的影响力

Sense.DEF: the right or authority to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have been given special powers to help them in the fight against terrorism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方被赋予特殊权力以便打击恐怖主义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee has the power to order an enquiry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会有权要求进行调查。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairman has the power of veto on all decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席对所有决定都拥有否决权。

Sense.DEF: a natural or special ability to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the accident she lost the power of speech ability to speak .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次事故之后﹐她丧失了语言能力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a writer’s powers of observation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作家的观察力

Sense.EXAMPLE: your mental powers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的智力
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stone with magical powers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有魔力的石头

Sense.DEF: energy that can be used to make a machine work or to make electricity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people are opposed to the use of nuclear power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人反对使用核能。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the search for renewable sources of power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对可再生能源的寻找

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship was able to leave port under its own power without help from another machine, ship etc .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘船得以靠自身动力离开了港口。

Sense.DEF: the ability to earn money, buy things etc
Sense.TRAN: 赚钱能力/购买力/讨价还价的能力等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Property in the city is beyond the purchasing power of most people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市的房地产超出了大多数人的购买力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: your bargaining power in pay negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在工资谈判中讨价还价的能力

Sense.DEF: the physical strength or effect of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the power of a cheetah’s long legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猎豹长腿的威力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The power of the explosion smashed windows across the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸的冲击力震碎了对面街上的窗户。

Sense.DEF: electricity that is used in houses, factories etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure the power is switched off first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要先关闭电源。

GramExa.GLOSS: a short time when the electricity supply is not working
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parts of the country have had power cuts because of the storms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的部分地区由于暴风雨而停电了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The power came back on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电力恢复了。

Sense.DEF: the number of planes or ships that a country has available to use in a war
a country that is strong and important and can influence events, or that has a lot of military strength
Sense.EXAMPLE: Egypt is still a major power in the Middle East.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃及仍然是中东大国。

GramExa.GLOSS: a country that can influence events in different parts of the world

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in/within sb’s power (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: if it is in someone’s power to do something, they have the authority or ability to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish it was within my power to change the decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿我有权力改变这个决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ambassador promised to do everything in his power to get the hostages released.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大使承诺尽其所能让人质获释。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be beyond sb’s power (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: if it is beyond someone’s power to do something, they do not have the authority or ability to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s beyond the power of the court to make such a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭无权作出这样的决定。

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation in which someone has complete control over you

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sb a power of good
Sense.DEF: to make someone feel more healthy, happy, and hopeful about the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks as if your holiday has done you a power of good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来休假对你大有好处。

Sense.DEF: if a number is increased to the power of three, four, five etc, it is multiplied by itself three, four, five etc times
the unknown people who have important positions of authority and power, and whose decisions affect your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: The powers that be don’t want the media to get hold of the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当权者不希望媒体知道那件事。

Sense.DEF:
the ability of a
len s
, for example in a pair of
glass es
or a
microscope
, to make things look bigger
unknown or magical forces that people believe can influence events in a good or evil way
someone who has a lot of power and influence in a country
someone who secretly controls and influences decisions made by the leader or government of a country, but who does not have an official government position
if you are on a power trip, you are enjoying your power or authority in a way that other people think is unpleasant

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People who have power never seem to use it to help others.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 掌权者似乎从来不用手中的权力来帮助别人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Women were trying to gain power in a male-dominated world.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性在尝试从男子主宰的世界里获得权力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The party will use all its power and influence to raise the issue in the Senate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党将动用其全部力量和影响,以在参议院提出这一议题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use power – used when someone has a lot of power
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Church still wields enormous power in the country.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会在这个国家仍握有巨大的权力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The central banks have huge power.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 中央银行拥有极大的权力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The king’s power was limited.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王的权力有限。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 政治的/经济的/军事的实力
Collocate.EXAMPLE: countries with little economic power
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没什么经济实力的国家

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: total power, with no limits
a situation in which groups or leaders try to get control
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country is locked in a power struggle between forces favouring and opposing change.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家陷入了支持与反对改革的权力斗争中。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There has been a shift in the balance of power between the two countries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国之间的权力平衡发生了变化。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a job or role that gives someone power
a wrong or unfair use of power

Sense.DEF: to supply power to a vehicle or machine
Sense.TRAN: 给〔车辆或机器〕提供动力﹐以动力驱动
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s powered by a Ferrari V12 engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它由法拉利V12发动机驱动。

Sense.DEF: to move with a lot of force and speed
Sense.EXAMPLE: His strong body powered through the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体矫健﹐在水里游得飞快。

Sense.DEF: to make a machine start working
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never move a computer while it is powered up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑开着时千万不要搬动。

Sense.DEF: driven by an electric motor
Sense.EXAMPLE: power tools
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电动工具
Sense.EXAMPLE: power shower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电淋浴器

Sense.DEF: a meal at which people meet to discuss business
Sense.TRAN: 洽谈商务的早餐/午餐等

Sense.DEF: clothes which you wear at work to make you look important or confident
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作时穿着以显示权威或自信的〕权力套装

Sense.DEF: an area or group of people whose support makes a politician or leader powerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: the party’s traditional power base
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党的传统权力基础

Sense.DEF:
a powerful
motorboat
that is used for racing
someone who controls or influences which people get political power in an area
Sense.TRAN: 〔操纵某地区政治势力的〕权力经纪人﹐权力掮客

Sense.DEF: a period of time when there is no electricity supply
when you wear a particular style of clothes in order to emphasize how important or powerful you are, especially at work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在工作时穿着以突显权威的〕权力装束﹐权威着装

Sense.DEF: a tool for making holes that works by electricity
working or moving using a means of power such as electricity, a motor etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powered wheelchair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电动轮椅

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nuclearpowered submarine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 核动力潜艇

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a high-powered engine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大功率发动机

Sense.DEF: a period of time when there is no electricity supply
a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was one of the most powerful men in Bohemia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是波希米亚最有权势的人物之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very influential and powerful family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很有权势的家庭
Sense.EXAMPLE: rich and powerful nations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富强的国家

Sense.DEF: having a strong effect on someone’s feelings or opinions
Sense.TRAN: 强有力的﹐有影响[感染]力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有感染力的演讲

GramExa.GLOSS: reasons that make you think that something must be true

Sense.EXAMPLE: Good teamwork is a powerful tool very effective method for effective management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的团队合作是有效管理的利器。

Sense.DEF: a powerful feeling or effect is very strong or great
Sense.EXAMPLE: Immigrants have had a powerful influence on the local culture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外来移民对当地文化产生了巨大的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful sense of tradition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的传统意识

Sense.DEF: a powerful machine, engine, weapon etc is very effective and can do a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑引擎﹑武器等〕功率大的﹐效能高的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new generation of more powerful PCs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 功能更强大的新一代个人电脑
Sense.EXAMPLE: a machine that is immensely powerful
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 功率巨大的机器
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful 24-valve engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 24阀的大功率引擎
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful telescope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高倍望远镜

Sense.DEF: physically strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jed was a powerful, well-built man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰德是个强壮结实的男人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The females are smaller and less powerful than the males.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雌性体型比雄性小﹐力气也没有雄性大。

Sense.DEF: a powerful blow, explosion etc has a lot of force
Sense.EXAMPLE: an explosion ten times more powerful than the Hiroshima bomb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比广岛原子弹威力大十倍的爆炸
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful right-foot shot on goal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有力的右脚射门
Sense.EXAMPLE: winds powerful enough to uproot trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足以把树木连根拔起的狂风

Sense.DEF: a powerful medicine or drug has a very strong effect on your body
a powerful team, army etc is very strong and can easily defeat other teams or armies
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful fighting force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强大的作战部队

Sense.DEF: very strong, bright, loud etc
Sense.TRAN: 浓烈的﹐强烈的﹔明亮的﹔响亮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerful singing voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘹亮的歌喉
Sense.EXAMPLE: the powerful headlights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前灯射出的强烈光束

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯蒂体格非常健壮。

Exponent.DEF: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the world’s most powerful nation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界第一强国
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Parliament had become more powerful than the King.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会的权力已经大于国王。

Exponent.DEF: having a lot of power to influence what happens, because people pay attention to what you say
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a highly influential fashion designer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位极具影响力的时装设计师
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s one of the most influential figures in international politics.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是国际政坛最具影响力的人物之一。

Exponent.DEF: powerful – used about people or groups in politics who have a lot of supporters
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The communists were particularly strong in the big industrial cities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 共产党人在大型工业城市特别有影响力。

Exponent.DEF: more powerful than other people, groups, countries etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was the dominant force in women’s tennis for many years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来,她在女子网坛占据绝对地位。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company has a dominant position in the market.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司在市场上占主导地位。

Sense.DEF: an organization or place where there is a lot of activity or where a lot of things are produced
Sense.TRAN: 强大的组织﹐重要的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europe’s industrial powerhouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的工业重地

Sense.DEF: someone who is very strong or has a lot of energy
Sense.TRAN: 身强力壮的人﹐精力充沛的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a powerhouse of a man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精力充沛的男人

Sense.DEF: unable to stop or control something because you do not have the power, strength, or legal right to do so
Sense.TRAN: 无权力［利］的﹔无力量的﹔无能为力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt so powerless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到如此无助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local police were powerless to stop them doing it again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地警方无力阻止他们再次行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The villagers were powerless against the rising flood water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 村民们对上涨的洪水无能为力。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a sense of frustration and powerlessness

Sense.DEF: a large wire carrying electricity above or under the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: overhead power lines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 架空输电线

Sense.DEF: a short sleep in the middle of the day that helps you to have more energy, do your job better, and make better decisions
the legal right to make financial decisions, sign documents etc for another person
a period of time when there is no electricity supply

something that is easily carried from which a piece of electrical equipment can get power, for example a
battery
a building where electricity is produced to supply a large area
the machine or engine that supplies power to a factory, plane, car etc
a place on a wall where electrical equipment can be connected to the electricity supply
when a country or person attempts to get power and influence by using or threatening to use force or other actions, especially against another country
an arrangement in which different groups, such as political parties, share the power to make decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: proposals for power-sharing between Catholics and Protestants in Northern Ireland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在北爱尔兰的天主教徒和新教徒之间实行权力分享的提议

Sense.DEF: a building where electricity is produced to supply a large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chernobyl nuclear power station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切尔诺贝利核电站

Sense.DEF:
a system for
steer ing
a vehicle which uses power from the vehicle’s engine and so needs less effort from the driver
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most new cars now have power steering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在大多数新汽车都有动力转向装置。

Sense.DEF: the way in which the group of people who control a country, society, or organization are organized
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家﹑社会或组织的〕权力结构
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been significant changes in the power structure of the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司的权力结构发生了重大变化。

Sense.DEF: a tool that works by electricity
a meeting or discussion – used humorously
a meeting or council of Native Americans
Sense.TRAN: 北美印第安人的议事会

Subsense.DEF:
the disease
syphilis

the disease
smallpox

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are angry or annoyed with someone
Sense.TRAN: 让某人倒大霉﹐叫某人见鬼去〔表示对某人生气或厌烦〕

Sense.DEF: used to show that you do not like something, or do not think it is big or important
Sense.TRAN: 令人讨厌的﹔微不足道的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had such poxy weather lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的天气真烦人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a poxy little room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不起眼的小房间

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=pages页
Sense.EXAMPLE: See pp 15-17.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见第15至17页。

Sense.DEF: written before the name of another person when you are signing a letter instead of them
Sense.TRAN: 代表…〔代别人签署信件时写在其名字前〕

Sense.DEF: a flat white square with a green letter P on it, that is attached to the car of someone in Britain who has passed their driving test but who is not very experienced
Sense.TRAN: P牌〔指英国通过驾驶考试但经验不足的驾驶员挂在汽车上的标志〕

Sense.DEF:
a system of providing money for transport systems, hospitals, schools etc where the government pays some money and private
investor s
provide the rest of it

a note added after a
ps
in a letter or message
a member of the British parliament whose job is to help a minister
Sense.TRAN: 议会私人秘书〔英国议会里协助大臣工作的议员〕

Sense.DEF: the work of explaining to the public what an organization does, so that they will understand it and approve of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a large PR firm
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家大型公关公司

Sense.EXAMPLE: The band have been getting a lot of good PR recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近该乐队做了不少很好的公关活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many say it was no more than a PR exercise something done to make people think something is good .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人都说那只是一次公关活动而已。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=proportional representation比例代表制

Sense.DEF: a practicable way of doing something is possible in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only practicable course of action is to sell the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一可行的做法是把公司卖掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is their duty to ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, that the equipment is safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在力所能及的情况下确保设备安全是他们的职责。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is practicable (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It may not always be practicable to follow exactly the recommendations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全按照建议行事并非总能行得通。

Sense.DEF: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the practical problems of old age
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年的实际问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a combination of theoretical and practical training
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理论培训和实践培训的结合
Sense.EXAMPLE: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具体地说﹐这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

Sense.DEF: practical plans, methods etc are likely to succeed or be effective in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑方法等〕有效的﹐切实可行的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It doesn’t sound like a very practical solution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这听上去不是一个十分可行的解决方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a practical way of achieving greater efficiency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达到更高效率的切实有效的方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, there’s no practical alternative to driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗憾的是﹐除了开车没有其他可行的方案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a practical guide to buying and selling a house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房屋买卖的实用指南

Sense.DEF: a practical person is good at dealing with problems and making decisions based on what is possible and what will really work
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a very practical person .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个很务实的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was very shocked, but tried to be practical and think what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常震惊﹐但我尽力让自己实际一点﹐想想该怎么办。

Sense.DEF: useful or suitable for a particular purpose or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Skirts aren’t very practical in my kind of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干我这种工作穿短裙不合适。

Sense.DEF: good at repairing or making things
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not very practical - I can’t even change a light bulb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我动手能力不强﹐连灯泡都不会换。

Sense.DEF: used to say what the real effect of a situation is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The time you spend on it doesn’t, for all practical purposes, affect the final result.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你花在那上面的时间实际上对最终的结果并不起作用。

Sense.DEF:
something that is almost certain, almost a
disaster
etc
Sense.TRAN: 几乎确定无疑/是灾难/满座等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sampras looks a practical certainty to win Wimbledon this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑普拉斯打赢今年的温布尔登网球锦标赛看来是十拿九稳的。

Sense.DEF: a lesson or examination in science, cooking etc in which you have to do or make something yourself rather than write or read about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔科学﹑烹饪等的〕实验［实践］课﹔实验［实践］考试
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chemistry practical
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学实验课

Sense.DEF: the real facts of a situation rather than ideas about how it might be

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the practicalities of everyday life for someone in a wheelchair
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐轮椅者日常生活中的实际问题

Sense.DEF: how suitable something is, or whether it will work
Sense.EXAMPLE: doubts about the practicality of your suggestion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于你所提建议的可行性的怀疑
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to think about comfort and practicality when choosing walking shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选购步行鞋时需要考虑舒适性和实用性。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being sensible and basing your plans on what you know will work
a trick that is intended to give someone a surprise or shock, or to make them look stupid
almost
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve read practically all of his books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我差不多读过他所有的书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sees him practically every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几乎天天见到他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s practically impossible to predict what will happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将会发生什么﹐几乎不能预料。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two designs were practically identical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个设计几乎一模一样。

Sense.DEF: in a sensible way which takes account of problems
Sense.TRAN: 讲究实际地﹔从实际出发
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But how can we pay for it?’ said John practically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “但是我们怎么付得起钱呢？”约翰很实际地问道。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has been trained and is allowed to do some of the same work as a nurse, but who has less training than a
registered nurse
Sense.TRAN: 经验护士〔所受训练少于注册护士﹐职责范围也较小〕

Sense.DEF: when you do a particular thing, often regularly, in order to improve your skill at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes hours of practice to learn to play the guitar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习弹吉他需要长时间的练习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a little more practice you should be able to pass your test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍微再练一练﹐你应该能通过考试了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have choir practice on Tuesday evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期二晚上我们要练习合唱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Schumacher crashed out in practice for the Australian grand prix.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 舒马赫在澳大利亚大奖赛练习赛中因撞车退出比赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John’s at baseball practice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰正在进行棒球训练。

Sense.HINTTRAN: In British English, the verb is always spelled practise (see separate entry). In American English, both noun and verb are spelled practice. 在英国英语中﹐动词始终拼写为practise（见单独词条）。 在美国英语中﹐名词和动词都拼写为practice。

Sense.DEF: used when saying what really happens rather than what should happen or what people think happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: In practice women receive much lower wages than their male colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际上女性所得的工资比她们的男同事低得多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey should only take about 30 minutes, but in practice it usually takes more like an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段路程应该只需约30分钟﹐不过实际上常常要1小时左右。

Sense.DEF: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious beliefs and practices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教信仰和习俗
Sense.EXAMPLE: dangerous working practices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的工作方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the practice of dumping waste into the sea
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 倾倒废弃物入海的做法

Sense.DEF: the work of a doctor or lawyer, or the place where they work
Sense.TRAN: 〔医生或律师的〕业务﹔诊所﹔律师事务所

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mary Beth had a busy legal practice in Los Angeles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽·贝丝在洛杉矶有一家业务繁忙的律师事务所。

Sense.DEF: to be the usual and accepted way of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 是普遍/例行/正常的做法
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s common practice in many countries for pupils to repeat a year if their grades are low.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生如果成绩不好就重读一年﹐这是许多国家的普遍做法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s standard practice to seek parents’ permission wherever possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 例行的做法是凡事都要尽可能征求父母的同意。

Sense.DEF: an example of a good or bad way of doing something, especially in a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某一工作中〕良好的/最好的/不好的做法
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not considered good practice to reveal clients’ names.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泄露客户姓名被认为是不好的做法。

Sense.DEF: if you put an idea, plan etc into practice, you start to use it and see if it is effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: It gave him the chance to put his ideas into practice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这使他有机会把自己的想法付诸实施。

Sense.DEF: to have not done something for a long time, so that you are not able to do it well
used to say that if you do an activity regularly, you will become very good at it
to do an activity, often regularly, in order to improve your skill or to prepare for a test
Sense.EXAMPLE: They moved the furniture back to practise their dance routine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把家具往后挪以便练习舞蹈动作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It gives students the opportunity to practice their speaking skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这给学生提供了锻炼口才的机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today we’re going to practise parking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我们要练习停车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s practicing for her piano recital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在为自己的钢琴演奏会进行练习。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everybody wants to practise their English on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大伙儿都想跟我练习英语。

Sense.DEF: to use a particular method or custom
Sense.EXAMPLE: a technique not widely practised in Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在欧洲没有被广泛应用的一项技术

Sense.DEF: to work as a doctor or lawyer
Sense.EXAMPLE: graduates who intend to practise in the UK
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打算在英国从业的医科毕业生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gemma is now practising as a dentist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰玛现在在做牙医。

Sense.DEF: if you practise a religion, system of ideas etc, you live your life according to its rules
Sense.TRAN: 信奉﹐遵循﹐奉行〔宗教信仰等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are free to practice their religion openly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们可以自由地公开信奉自己的宗教。

Sense.DEF: to do the things that you advise other people to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t always practise what she preached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并非总是言行一致。

Exponent.DEF: to do an activity many times in order to improve your skill or to prepare for a test
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The course will give you a chance to practise your language skills.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程会为你提供练习语言技巧的机会。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was practising his golf swing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在练习高尔夫球挥杆。

Exponent.DEF: to practise physical movements or activities in preparation for a race or game
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s training for the Olympics.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在为参加奥运会而训练。

Exponent.DEF: to practise a play, speech, or music in preparation for a public performance
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s in New York where she’s rehearsing her new play.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在纽约排练她的新剧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The band are currently rehearsing for their world tour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队目前正在为世界巡演进行排练。

Exponent.DEF: to practise a particular skill so that your general performance improves
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You need to work on your listening comprehension.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得多多练习听力理解。

Exponent.DEF: to practise something such as a speech, play, or piece of music by reading or playing it from the beginning to the end
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll just run through the speech one more time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这就再练习一遍演讲。

Sense.DEF: someone who is practised in a particular job or skill is good at it because they have done it many times before
Sense.TRAN: 老练的﹐有经验的﹐熟练的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a practised performer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位老练的艺人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was already well practiced in giving acceptance speeches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对发表获奖感言已经驾轻就熟了。

GramExa.GLOSS: to someone who has seen something many times and knows a lot about it
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对于眼光老练的人﹐对于行家里手

Sense.DEF: a practised action has been done so often that it now seems very easy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He faced the television cameras with practised ease .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老到自如地面对电视摄像机。

Sense.DEF: someone who follows the rules and customs of a particular religion
Sense.TRAN: 虔诚的天主教徒/穆斯林/犹太教徒等

Sense.DEF: someone who is working as a doctor, lawyer etc
Sense.TRAN: 执业医生/执业律师/从业教师等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few practicing teachers have time for such research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事教学工作的老师很少有时间做这样的研究。

Sense.DEF: someone who works as a doctor or a lawyer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a practitioner of alternative medicine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常规医学的执业医生

Sense.DEF: someone who regularly does a particular activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of golf’s most experienced practitioners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最有经验的高尔夫球员之一

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a practitioner of Taoist philosophy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道家哲学的实践者

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
presidium
dealing with problems in a sensible practical way instead of strictly following a set of ideas
Sense.TRAN: 讲求实际的﹐务实的﹐重实效的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Williams took a more pragmatic approach to management problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯在管理问题上采用的是一种更务实的做法。

Sense.DEF: the study of how words and phrases are used with special meanings in particular situations
a way of dealing with problems in a sensible practical way instead of following a set of ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politician known for his pragmatism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以务实闻名的政治家

Sense.DEF: a wide open area of fairly flat land in North America which is covered in grass or wheat
a small animal with a short tail, which lives in holes on the prairies
to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane was praised by her teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简受到了老师的表扬。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Mayor praised the rescue teams for their courage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长称赞了救援队的勇气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly praised novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到高度赞扬的小说

GramExa.GLOSS: praise someone or something very much
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对某人/某事赞叹不已﹐把某人/某事捧上天

Sense.DEF: to give thanks to God and show your respect to Him, especially by singing in a church
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在教堂唱赞美诗〕赞美〔上帝〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are pleased something has happened and thank God for it
Sense.TRAN: 谢天谢地﹐感谢上帝﹐赞美主

Exponent.DEF: to say that you admire and approve of someone or something, especially publicly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film was praised by the critics when it first came out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片首映后受到了影评人士的称赞。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report praises staff in both schools.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报告表扬了这两所学校的教职员工。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone that you think it is good that they have achieved something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I congratulated him on his success.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他的成功表示祝贺。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government should be congratulated for what they have achieved.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该对政府取得的成就表示祝贺。

Exponent.DEF: to say to someone that you like how they look, or you like something they have done
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She complimented me on my new hairstyle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她称赞我的新发型。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He complimented my cooking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他夸我厨艺好。

Exponent.DEF: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had persuaded her to buy it by flattering her and being charming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她又是奉承又是施展魅力,劝她买了下来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’re just flattering me!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只是在奉承我！

Exponent.DEF: to talk about something you enjoy or admire in an excited way, and say that it is very good. Rave is rather informal, whereas enthuse is much more formal and is used mainly in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 极力夸奖某事物,对某事物赞不绝口〔rave不太正式,enthuse则要正式得多,主要用于书面语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone is raving about the movie.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都对这部影片赞不绝口。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She enthused about the joys of motherhood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她滔滔不绝地诉说着为人母的喜悦。

Exponent.DEF: to publicly praise a decision, action, idea etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Business leaders applauded the decision.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 商界领袖对这一决定拍手叫好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A spokesperson applauded the way the festival had been run.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位发言人对这次节庆活动的组织安排大加称赞。

Exponent.DEF: to praise someone or something, especially officially
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After the battle, Andrew Jackson commended him for ‘his courage and fidelity’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗结束后,安德鲁·杰克逊对他的“勇气和忠诚”大加赞誉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The officers should be commended for their prompt action.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些警察行动迅速,应该受到表彰。

Exponent.DEF: to describe someone or something in a way that shows you have a very good opinion of them, especially in newspapers, on television reports etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指报纸、电视报道等中〕称赞[赞誉]某人/某事物为某事物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book was hailed as a masterpiece.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书被誉为杰作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Journalists and music writers hailed the band as ‘the next big thing’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻记者和音乐评论家称这支乐队是“下一个巨星”。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is being hailed as the new James Dean.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被称赞为新一代的詹姆斯·迪恩。

Sense.DEF: words that you say or write in order to praise someone or something
