Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to give children plenty of praise and encouragement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对小孩子多加表扬和鼓励是很重要的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her teacher was full of praise for her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师对她的作业赞不绝口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His first novel received high praise .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第一部小说受到了高度赞扬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gregory was singled out he was chosen in particular for special praise .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷戈里被单独给予特别表扬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film has won praise from audiences and critics alike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影赢得了观众和评论家的一致赞誉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wrote a poem in praise of his hero.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写了一首诗赞美他心目中的英雄。

Sense.DEF: the expression of respect and thanks to God
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let us give praise unto the Lord.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们来赞美上帝吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: songs of praise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞美诗

Sense.DEF: used when you are very pleased about something that has happened
Sense.TRAN: 谢天谢地！ 感谢上帝！

Sense.DEF: something that is praiseworthy deserves praise, even though it may not have been completely successful
Sense.TRAN: 值得赞扬的﹐精神可嘉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the council’s praiseworthy attempts to improve efficiency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会为提高效率而作出的值得称颂的努力

Sense.DEF: a sweet food made of nuts cooked in boiling sugar
a small vehicle with four wheels in which a baby can lie down while it is being pushed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young woman pushing a pram
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推着婴儿车的年轻女子

Sense.DEF: to walk or dance with high steps or large movements, especially in a confident way
Sense.TRAN: 趾高气扬地走﹐昂首阔步

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We used to prance around our bedroom pretending to be pop stars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以前常常在卧室里神气地走来走去﹐假装自己是流行歌星。

Sense.DEF: if a horse prances, it moves with high steps
to damage a vehicle in an accident
a trick, especially one which is played on someone to make them look silly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指使人难堪的〕玩笑﹐恶作剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: a childish prank
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子气的恶作剧

Sense.DEF: someone who plays tricks on people to make them look silly
to talk in a meaningless boring way about something
an embarrassing accident or mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: another one of the Vice-President’s pratfalls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 副总统的又一个洋相

Sense.DEF: an act of falling down, especially when this is funny or embarrassing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指滑稽或尴尬的〕摔倒﹐跌倒

Sense.DEF: to talk continuously about silly and unimportant things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s Sarah prattling on about ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉在喋喋不休地讲什么？

Sense.DEF:
a small pink
shellfish
that can be eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prawn sandwich
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明虾三明治
Sense.EXAMPLE: prawn cocktail a small dish of prawns in a sauce with some salad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大虾冷盘

Sense.DEF: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks
Sense.EXAMPLE: They went to the mosque to pray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去清真寺祷告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let us pray for peace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们为和平祈祷吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Martha prayed to God for help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莎向上帝祈求帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He prayed that his sight might be restored.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他祈祷自己的视力能恢复。

Sense.DEF: to wish or hope very strongly that something will happen or is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul was praying that no one had noticed his absence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗但愿没有人注意到他的缺席。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope and pray that this is a misunderstanding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常希望这是个误会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re praying for good weather tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们企盼明天会是好天气。

Sense.DEF: used when politely asking a question or telling someone to do something
Sense.TRAN: 请﹐恳请〔用于礼貌地提问或叫某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pray be seated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: And who, pray tell , is this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问﹐这位是谁？

Sense.DEF: words that you say when praying to God or gods
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our thoughts and prayers are with you at this difficult time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这艰难时期我们时刻思念你﹐为你祈祷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children said their prayers and got into bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们做完祷告后上床睡觉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: God has answered your prayer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上帝应许了你的祷告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a prayer for the dead
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为死者的祈祷

Sense.DEF: when someone prays, or the regular habit of praying
Sense.EXAMPLE: the power of prayer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祈祷的力量
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prayer meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祈祷会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The congregation knelt in prayer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会众跪下祈祷。

Sense.DEF: a wish or hope that something will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her prayer was that she would pass her exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的愿望是自己能通过考试。

Sense.DEF: a regular religious meeting in a church, school etc, at which people pray together
Sense.TRAN: 〔教堂﹑学校等的〕祷告会﹐祈祷式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prayers are at eight o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 祈祷式8点钟举行。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have a prayer (of doing sth)
Sense.DEF: to have no chance of succeeding
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried hard, but he didn’t have a prayer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拼命努力了 不过不可能成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They don’t have a prayer of winning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不可能赢。

Sense.DEF: something that someone wants or needs very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job was an answer to my prayers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作是我梦寐以求的。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: on a wing and a prayer

Sense.DEF: a book containing prayers that is used in some Christian church services
a small cloth on which Muslims kneel when praying
Sense.TRAN: 〔穆斯林祈祷时用的〕跪垫﹐跪毯

Sense.DEF: a drum-shaped object with prayers on it or inside it, which Tibetan Buddhists turn on a pole as a way of praying
Sense.TRAN: 〔藏传佛教徒所用的刻有祈祷文的〕转经筒﹐祈祷轮

Sense.DEF: a large insect that eats other insects
before someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: pre-war before a war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战前的

Sense.DEF: in preparation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prearranged signal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预先约定的信号
Sense.EXAMPLE: Preset the video.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要预先设置好录像机。

Sense.DEF: to talk about a religious subject in a public place, especially in a church during a service

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Christ began preaching to large crowds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督开始向众人布道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The vicar preached a sermon about the prodigal son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教区牧师布道讲了浪子回头的故事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He traveled the southern states, preaching the gospel .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他游历南方各州宣讲福音。

Sense.DEF: to talk about how good or important something is and try to persuade other people about this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alexander has been preaching patience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历山大一直宣扬要坚忍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a politician preaching the virtues of a free market
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣扬自由市场优点的政治家

Sense.DEF: to give someone advice, especially about their behaviour, in a way that they think is boring or annoying
Sense.TRAN: 唠叨地劝诫﹐令人烦厌地说教

GramExa.EXAMPLE: grown-ups preaching about the evils of drugs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断说教毒品害处的成年人

Sense.DEF: to talk about what you think is right or important to people who already have the same opinions as you
Sense.TRAN: 向教徒传道/向唱诗班传教〔表示向已有同样观点的人作宣传〕

Sense.DEF: someone who talks about a religious subject in a public place, especially at a church
trying too much to persuade people to accept a particular opinion – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a preachy TV show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说教的电视节目

Sense.DEF: a statement at the beginning of a book, document, or talk, explaining what it is about
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑文件﹑讲话的〕前言﹐序言﹔开场白

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the preamble to the American Constitution
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《美国宪法》序言

Sense.EXAMPLE: Harding gave him the news without preamble without saying anything else before it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈丁开门见山把消息告诉了他。

Sense.DEF: planned or decided before
Sense.EXAMPLE: At a prearranged signal, everyone stood up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一见到事先约定的信号﹐大家都站了起来。

Sense.DEF: a statement that a politician makes saying that a criticism of them is false or unfair, before the criticism has been made
Sense.TRAN: 〔对政坛对手的批评作出的〕预先驳斥
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wiggins issued a prebuttal against his opponent’s speech, even before the text was delivered to reporters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对手的讲稿还没有到记者手中﹐威金斯就先作了驳斥。

Sense.DEF: belonging or relating to the period of time in the Earth’s history from about 4,600 million years ago, when the hard outer surface of the Earth first formed, until about 570 million years ago, when simple forms of life first appeared on the Earth
Sense.TRAN: 前寒武纪的〔从约46亿年前地球外层硬地表最初形成﹐至约5.7亿年前地球上最早出现简单形式生命的那段时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Precambrian rocks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前寒武纪岩石

Sense.DEF: a precarious situation or state is one which may very easily or quickly become worse
Sense.TRAN: 〔局势或状态〕不稳定的﹐不安全的﹐危险的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her health remained precarious, despite the treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽管接受了治疗﹐但健康状况还是不稳定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s precarious financial position
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司岌岌可危的财务状况

Sense.DEF: likely to fall, or likely to cause someone to fall
Sense.TRAN: 可能倒的﹐不稳的﹐不牢靠的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a precarious mountain trail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的山间小路

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a cup of tea balanced precariously on her knee
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她膝盖上晃晃悠悠放着的一杯茶

Sense.DEF:
precast
concrete
is already formed into the shapes needed to build something
something you do in order to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fire precautions were neglected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防火措施被忽视了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The traffic barriers were put there as a safety precaution .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了安全起见﹐那里设置了交通路障。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Save your work often as a precaution against computer failure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常保存所做的工作以防电脑发生故障。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The trails are well marked, but carrying a map is a wise precaution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然路上有清楚的标志﹐不过带上地图仍不失为预防万一的明智做法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Vets took precautions to prevent the spread of the disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兽医们为防止疾病蔓延采取了预防措施。

GramExa.PROPFORM: take the precaution of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I took the precaution of insuring my camera.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的照相机投了保以防万一。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say just in case rather than as a precaution .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 just in case,而不说 as a precaution
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’m going to take my umbrella just in case .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要带上雨伞以防万一。

Sense.DEF: done in order to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: More troops were sent to the area as a precautionary measure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为谨慎起见﹐更多的军队被派往该地区。

Sense.DEF: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: a type of cloud that precedes rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下雨前出现的一种云
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere before someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

Sense.DEF: when someone or something is considered to be more impor-tant than someone or something else, and therefore comes first or must be dealt with first

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do we want a society where appearance takes precedence over skill or virtue?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是想要一个外表重于才干和品德的社会吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Guests were seated in order of precedence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾客们按席次就座。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Safety must be given precedence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全必须放在第一位。

Sense.DEF: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a legal precedent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 判例

GramExa.EXAMPLE: UN involvement in the country’s affairs would set a dangerous precedent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国介入该国事务将成为一个危险的先例。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: precedents for what courts will accept as ‘fair’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院认为可以称得上“公平”的判例

Sense.DEF: something of the same type that has happened or existed before
Sense.TRAN: 以前有过的事例﹐先例﹐前例

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s not much precedent for men taking leave when their baby is born.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性因孩子出生而休假的先例不多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An epidemic on this scale is without precedent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如此规模的流行病是史无前例的。

Sense.DEF: the way that things have always been done

GramExa.GLOSS: do something in a new way

Sense.DEF: happening or coming before the time, place, or part mentioned

GramExa.EXAMPLE: income tax paid in preceding years
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 前几年缴付的所得税

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the diagram in the preceding chapter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上一章的图表

Sense.DEF: a rule on which a way of thinking or behaving is based
Sense.EXAMPLE: basic moral precepts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基本的道德准则

Sense.DEF: an area of a town where people can walk and shop, and where cars are not allowed
one of the areas that a town or city is divided into, so that elections or police work can be organized more easily
the main police station in a particular area of a town or city
the area that surrounds an important building
Sense.EXAMPLE: the precincts of the cathedral
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大教堂周围区域

Sense.DEF: something that is precious is valuable and important and should not be wasted or used without care

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We cannot afford to waste precious time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们浪费不起宝贵的时间。

Sense.EXAMPLE: planes delivering precious supplies of medicine and food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运送药品﹑食品等宝贵物资的飞机
Sense.EXAMPLE: our planet’s precious resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星球上的宝贵资源

Sense.DEF: rare and worth a lot of money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a statue covered with precious jewels
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嵌满贵重宝石的雕塑

Sense.DEF: precious memories or possessions are important to you because they remind you of people you like or events in your life
Sense.TRAN: 〔记忆或拥有物〕珍贵的﹐宝贵的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The doll is cracked and worn, but it’s precious to me because it was my mother’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个娃娃又破又旧﹐可对我来说很宝贵﹐因为它是我妈妈用过的。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are annoyed that someone seems to care too much about something
Sense.TRAN: 宝贝似的〔用于对某人似乎太过注重某事物表示反感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never touched your precious car!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我根本没碰过你的宝贝汽车！

Sense.DEF: used to speak to someone you love, especially a baby or small child
Sense.TRAN: 宝贝〔对所爱之人﹐尤指对婴儿或小孩的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come sit by me, precious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐到我旁边来﹐宝贝。

Sense.DEF: used in order to describe someone or something that is small and pretty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids gave me that ornament. Isn’t it precious?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件装饰品是孩子们送我的﹐是不是很可爱？

Sense.DEF: too concerned about style or detail in your writing or speech, so that it does not seem natural
Sense.EXAMPLE: His early work is rather precious and juvenile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的早期作品相当做作而且幼稚。

Sense.DEF: very little or very few
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had precious little time for reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很少有时间看书。

Sense.DEF: a rare and valuable metal such as gold or silver

a rare and valuable jewel such as a
diamond
or an
emerald
a very steep side of a high rock, mountain, or cliff
Sense.EXAMPLE: A loose rock tumbled over the precipice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块松动的岩石从悬崖上滚落下来。

Sense.DEF: a dangerous situation in which something very bad could happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stock market is on the edge of a precipice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股市岌岌可危。

Sense.DEF: to make something serious happen suddenly or more quickly than was expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

Sense.DEF: to separate a solid substance from a liquid by chemical action, or to be separated in this way
to force someone or something into a particular state or condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug treatment precipitated him into a depression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 药物治疗使他陷入抑郁。

Sense.DEF: a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid
happening or done too quickly, and not thought about carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: a precipitate decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草率的决定

Sense.DEF: rain, snow etc that falls on the ground, or the amount of rain, snow etc that falls
a chemical process in which a solid substance is separated from a liquid
the act of doing something too quickly in a way that is not sensible
very sudden
Sense.EXAMPLE: a precipitous decline in stock prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股价的骤跌

Sense.DEF: dangerously high or steep
Sense.EXAMPLE: a precipitous path
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陡峭的小路

Sense.DEF: happening or done too quickly, and not thought about carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: a precipitous marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草率的婚姻

Sense.DEF: a statement which gives the main idea of a piece of writing, speech etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章﹑演说等的〕摘要﹐梗概﹐概要
Sense.EXAMPLE: a précis of the report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告的摘要

Sense.DEF: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: precise sales figures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准确的销售数据
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was difficult to get precise information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难得到确切的消息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She’s a lot older than you, isn’t she?’ ‘Fifteen years, to be precise .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她比你大很多﹐是不是？”“准确地说﹐大了15岁。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are referring to an exact thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that precise moment, her husband walked in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那一刻﹐她丈夫走了进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The precise cause of the disease is unknown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 造成这种疾病的确切原因尚不清楚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the precise location of the ship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船的确切位置
Sense.EXAMPLE: the precise nature of their agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们协议的确切性质

Sense.DEF: someone who is precise is very careful about small details or about the way they behave
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕周密的﹐细心的﹐一丝不苟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a precise careful woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认真细心的女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: with precise movements of his hands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以他双手精准的动作

Sense.DEF: exactly and correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Temperature can be measured precisely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度可以精确地测量出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He arrived at precisely four o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是4点整到的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to know precisely how much impact the changes will have.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难准确了解这些变化会造成多大影响。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What, precisely, does that mean?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那究竟是什么意思？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lathes make wheels, or, more precisely , they make cylindrical objects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车床可以车削轮子﹐更确切地说﹐可以车削圆柱形物体。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a particular thing is completely true or correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women in these jobs are paid less precisely because most of the jobs are held by women rather than men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事这些工作的女性报酬之所以较低正是因为做这些工作的人大部分是女性而不是男性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s precisely the kind of person we’re looking for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正是我们要找的那种人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you agree completely with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It needs to be dealt with now.’ ‘Precisely, before it gets any worse.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “现在应该处理这件事了。”“确实如此﹐趁它还没有变得更糟。”

Sense.DEF: the quality of being very exact or correct

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The work was carried out with military precision the work was done in a carefully planned and exact way .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作做得严谨细致﹐有如军事行动。

Sense.DEF: made or done in a very exact way
Sense.EXAMPLE: precision engineering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精密工程
Sense.EXAMPLE: precision bombing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精确轰炸

Sense.DEF: a precision tool or instrument is used for making or measuring something in a very exact way
to prevent something or make something impossible
Sense.TRAN: 阻止﹐ 防止﹐使不可能﹔排除﹐消除
Sense.EXAMPLE: rules that preclude experimentation in teaching methods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止进行教学方法试验的规定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Age alone will not preclude him from standing as a candidate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 单是年龄问题不会妨碍他参选。

Sense.DEF: a precocious child shows intelligence or skill at a very young age, or behaves in an adult way – sometimes used to show disapproval in British English
Sense.TRAN: 早熟的﹐智慧超前的〔英国英语中有时含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a precocious child who walked and talked early
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走路和说话都早的早熟儿童

Sense.DEF: the knowledge that something will happen before it actually does
preconceived ideas, opinions etc are formed before you really have enough knowledge or experience
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑观点等〕预先形成的﹐先入为主的
Sense.EXAMPLE: preconceived notions about art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于艺术的先入之见
Sense.EXAMPLE: We started from scratch with no preconceived ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是毫无成见从零开始的。

Sense.DEF: a belief or opinion that you have already formed before you know the actual facts, and that may be wrong
Sense.TRAN: 事先形成的看法[想法]﹔先入之见﹐成见

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had the same preconceptions about life in South Africa that many people have.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对南非的生活抱有和许多人一样的成见。

Sense.DEF: something that must happen or exist before something else can happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A ceasefire is a precondition for talks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 停火是对话的先决条件。

Sense.DEF: precooked food has been partly or completely cooked before it is sold so that it can be quickly heated up later
something that happened or existed before something else and influenced its development

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a precursor of modern jazz
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代爵士乐的先驱

Sense.DEF: to happen or exist earlier in history than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kingdom predates other African cultures by over 3,000 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个王国比其他非洲文明早3,000年以上。

Sense.DEF: when an animal kills and eats another animal
an animal that kills and eats other animals
someone who tries to use another person’s weakness to get advantages
Sense.TRAN: 利用别人的弱点谋取利益的人﹐损人利己的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sexual predator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性侵犯者

Sense.DEF: a predatory animal kills and eats other animals for food
Sense.TRAN: 掠食的﹐捕食其他动物为生的

Sense.DEF: trying to use someone’s weakness to get advantages for yourself – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 利用别人的弱点谋取利益的﹐损人利己的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: predatory pricing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 掠夺性定价

Sense.DEF: someone who had your job before you started doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kennedy’s predecessor as President was the war hero Dwight Eisenhower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

Sense.DEF: a machine, system etc that existed before another one in a process of development
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new BMW has a more powerful engine than its predecessor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新款宝马的发动机比其前身动力更强劲。

Sense.DEF: the belief that God has decided everything that will happen and that people cannot change this

something that is predestined is certain to happen because it has been decided by God or
fate

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They believed that kings were predestined to rule.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们相信君权神授。

Sense.DEF: decided or arranged before something happens, so that it does not happen by chance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a predetermined level of spending
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预先确定的开支水平

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The colour of your eyes is predetermined by the colours of your parents’ eyes.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼睛的颜色是由父母眼睛的颜色决定的。

Sense.DEF:
a word that is used before a
determiner a word such as ‘the’, ‘that’, ‘his’ etc
. In the phrases ‘all the boys’ and ‘both his parents’, the words ‘all’ and ‘both’ are predeterminers.
a difficult or unpleasant situation in which you do not know what to do, or in which you have to make a difficult choice
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s economic predicament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的经济困境
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went to the office to explain her predicament .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她到办事处去说明她的难处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Other married couples are in a similar predicament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他夫妻也面临相似的困境。

Sense.DEF: the part of a sentence that makes a statement about the subject, such as ‘swim’ in ‘Fish swim’ and ‘is an artist’ in ‘She is an artist’
if an action or event is predicated on a belief or situation, it is based on it or depends on it
Sense.TRAN: 基于某事物﹐取决于某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s expansion was predicated on the assumption that sales would rise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的扩张是基于销售额会增长的假设。

Sense.DEF: a predicative adjective or phrase comes after a verb, for example ‘happy’ in the sentence ‘She is happy’
to say that something will happen, before it happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售额比预期低5%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Newspapers predicted that Davis would be re-elected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸预测戴维斯将再次当选。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to predict what the long-term effects of the accident will be.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难预料这次事故将产生什么长远影响。

Sense.EXAMPLE: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如利兹所预料的﹐流言很快就被淡忘了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unemployment is predicted to increase to 700,000 by the end of the year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计到年底失业人数将增至70万。

Exponent.DEF: to say that something will happen, before it happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the future, it may be possible to predict earthquakes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 将来有可能预测地震。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Scientists are trying to predict what the Amazon will look like in 20 years’ time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家们正试图预测20年后亚马孙河的面貌。

Exponent.DEF: to say what is likely to happen in the future, especially in relation to the weather or the economic or political situation
Exponent.TRAN: 预报,预测〔尤用于天气﹑经济情况或政治局势〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’re forecasting a hard winter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们预报说将出现寒冬。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Economists forecast that there would be a recession.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济学家预言将出现经济衰退。

Exponent.DEF: to say what the amount, size, cost etc of something is likely to be in the future, using the information you have now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The world’s population is projected to rise by 45%.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界人口预计将增加45%。

Exponent.DEF: to be able to know what will happen in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: No one can say what the next fifty years will bring.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人能预言今后50年会发生什么。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t say exactly how much it will cost.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说不准那要花多少钱。

Exponent.DEF: to say correctly what will happen in the future, using special religious or magical powers
Exponent.TRAN: 〔运用宗教力量或魔法〕预言,预示
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The woman claimed that she had the gift of foretelling the future.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人声称自己有预测未来的天赋。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It all happened as the prophet had foretold.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所发生的一切正如先知所预言的那样。

Exponent.DEF: to say that something will happen because you feel that it will, or by using special religious or magical powers
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因感知或运用宗教力量或魔法〕预言,预示
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s one of those people who are always prophesying disaster.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是那种老是预言灾难的人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The coming of a great Messiah is prophesied in the Bible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《圣经》中预言将出现一位伟大的弥赛亚。

Exponent.DEF: to know that something is going to happen before it happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They should have foreseen these problems.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们理应预见到这些问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: No one foresaw the outcome of the war.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人预知会爆发这场战争。

Exponent.DEF: to have a strange feeling that something is about to happen, especially something bad, usually just before it happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Suddenly I had a strange premonition of danger ahead.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然有一种奇怪的预感,觉得前面有危险。

Sense.DEF: if something or someone is predictable, you know what will happen or what they will do – sometimes used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 可预料的﹐可预见的〔有时含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The snow had a predictable effect on traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场雪对交通造成的影响可以预见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an entertaining but predictable film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部有趣但老套的电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: Logan’s reaction was predictable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛根的反应可想而知。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Predictably, no one was home when I called.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如所料﹐我打电话去﹐果然没人在家。

Sense.DEF: a statement about what you think is going to happen, or the act of making this statement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: predictions of a Republican victory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于共和党获胜的预测

Sense.EXAMPLE: The data can be used to make useful economic predictions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据可用于进行有用的经济预测。

Sense.DEF: relating to the ability to show what is going to happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dreams, even vivid ones, have little predictive value.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梦境即使逼真﹐也没什么预言作用。

Sense.DEF: something that shows what will happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 预测器﹔预示物﹐预报性的事物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: High blood pressure is a strong predictor of heart attacks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高血压是心脏病的一个有力预警。

Sense.DEF: if you have a predilection for something, especially something unusual, you like it very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Lane’s predilection for gossip
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱恩太太说长道短的癖好

Sense.DEF: to make someone more likely to suffer from a particular health problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Diabetes predisposes patients to infections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖尿病患者容易受感染。

Sense.DEF: to make someone more likely to behave or think in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 使倾向于﹐使较可能〔有某种行为或思想〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents who smoke predispose children to smoking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母吸烟的话﹐孩子也很可能会吸烟。

Sense.DEF: a tendency to behave in a particular way or suffer from a particular illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为方式的〕倾向﹔易患某疾病的倾向[体质]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a predisposition towards alcoholism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒倾向

Sense.DEF: if there is a predominance of one type of person or thing in a group, there are more of that type than of any other type

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a predominance of boys in the class
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 班上男生居多的现象

Sense.DEF: someone or something that has predominance has the most power or importance in a particular group or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s naval predominance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的海上霸主地位

Sense.DEF: more powerful, more common, or more easily noticed than others
Sense.TRAN: 占优势的﹔占主导地位的﹔最普遍的﹔最显著［突出］的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the predominant group in society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会中的主导群体
Sense.EXAMPLE: In this painting, the predominant colour is black.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画的主色调是黑色。

Sense.DEF: mostly or mainly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city’s population is predominantly Irish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城市的人口绝大多数是爱尔兰人。

Sense.DEF: if one type of person or thing predominates in a group or area, there are more of this type than any other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pine trees predominate in this area of forest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片林区以松树居多。

Sense.DEF: to have the most importance or influence, or to be most easily noticed
Sense.TRAN: 占主导地位﹐占支配地位﹔最突出
Sense.EXAMPLE: In this type of case, the rights of the parent predominate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像这样的案例﹐要首先考虑父母的权利。

Sense.DEF:
a
premature
baby
much more important, more powerful, or better than any others of its kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: his pre-eminent position in society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在社会上的显要地位

Sense.DEF: to make what someone has planned to do or say unnecessary or ineffective by saying or doing something first
Sense.TRAN: 抢在…之前行动[说话]﹔对…先发制人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deal pre-empted a strike by rail workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个协议避免了一场铁路工人的罢工。

Sense.DEF: to replace a television show with a special programme or report
Sense.EXAMPLE: Regular programming was preempted by a report on the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 固定节目临时换成了战况报道。

Sense.DEF: a pre-emptive action is done to prevent something from happening, especially something that will harm you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a series of pre-emptive strikes on guerrilla bases
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对游击队根据地一系列先发制人的攻击

Sense.DEF: if a bird preens or preens itself, it cleans itself and makes its feathers smooth using its beak
to spend time making yourself look tidier and more attractive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a girl preening herself in the mirror
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对着镜子精心打扮的女孩

Sense.DEF: to look proud and feel pleased because of something you have done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He enjoyed the applause, preening himself like a pop star.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他享受着掌声﹐像流行歌星一样得意扬扬。

Sense.DEF: existing before a particular time or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inform your doctor of any pre-existing medical condition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 既往病史要告知医生。

Sense.DEF: a small prefabricated building
Sense.TRAN: 小型预制装配式房屋﹔活动房屋

Sense.DEF: built from parts which are made in standard sizes so that they can be put together anywhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prefabricated house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预制装配式房屋

Sense.DEF: an introduction at the beginning of a book or speech
Sense.TRAN: 〔书籍的〕序言﹐前言﹐绪言﹔〔演讲的〕开场白

Sense.DEF: to say or do something before the main part of what you are going to say
Sense.TRAN: 作为…的开端﹐作为…的开场白
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is prefaced by a quotation from Faulkner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书引用了福克纳的一段话作为开场白。

Sense.DEF: forming a preface or introduction
Sense.TRAN: 序言的﹐引言的﹔作为开场白的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a few prefatory remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几句开场白

Sense.DEF: an older student in some British schools, who has special duties and helps to control younger students
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国某些学校中帮助管理年幼学生的〕学长﹐级长

Sense.DEF: a public official in some countries etc who is responsible for a particular area
Sense.TRAN: 地方行政长官﹐省长﹐县长

Sense.DEF: a large area which has its own local government in some countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: Saitama prefecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔日本〕埼玉县

Sense.DEF: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could
Sense.EXAMPLE: This type of owl prefers a desert habitat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种猫头鹰更喜欢沙漠的生活环境。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She prefers her coffee black.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她更喜欢喝黑咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s preferred option
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府倾向的选择

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a child that prefers his imaginary world to reality
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜欢自己的幻想世界甚于现实世界的孩子

Sense.EXAMPLE: Employees said they would prefer more flexible working hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工们说他们希望有更具弹性的工作时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I prefer to wear clothes made of natural fibers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我更喜欢穿天然织物做的衣服。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Or, if you prefer , you can email us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 或者﹐你喜欢的话﹐可以给我们发电子邮件。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chantal prefers travelling by train.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尚塔尔更喜欢乘火车旅行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We prefer that our teachers have a degree in early childhood education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望我们的教师拥有儿童早期教育的学位。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say they would rather do something instead of using prefer .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,表示更喜欢做某事,人们常说would rather,而不说prefer
F2NBox.BADEXA: I prefer to travel by train.

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you wish a situation was different
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sales have gone down, and obviously we’d prefer it if that didn’t happen.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售下滑了﹐显然我们是不希望这样的。

Subsense.DEF: used when telling someone politely not to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 我希望〔用于礼貌地告诉别人不要做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d prefer it if you didn’t smoke in front of the children.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你不要在孩子面前抽烟。

Sense.DEF: to make an official statement that someone has done something illegal
better or more suitable
Sense.TRAN: 更好的﹐更合适的﹐更可取的
Sense.EXAMPLE: For this dish, fresh herbs and garlic are preferable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这道菜﹐用新鲜香草和大蒜更好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In warm weather, clothes made of natural fabrics are infinitely preferable much better .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气暖和的时候﹐穿天然织物的衣服要舒适得多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Being taught in a small group is far preferable to being in a large, noisy classroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小班听课比在闹哄哄的大教室里上课要强得多。

Sense.DEF: used in order to show which person, thing, place, or idea you think would be the best choice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students must take two years of a foreign language, preferably Spanish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们必须花两年时间学一门外语﹐最好是西班牙语。

Sense.DEF: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have a colour preference ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有什么颜色上的偏好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a cultural preference for boy babies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜欢生男孩的文化观念

Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents may be able to express a preference as to the school their child will attend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长也许可以表明愿意让孩子就读哪所学校。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The amount of sugar you add will depend on personal preference .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加多少糖取决于个人的喜好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many elderly people expressed a strong preference to live in their own homes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多老年人强烈表示喜欢住在自己的家里。

GramExa.GLOSS: rather than something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Use clear English in preference to technical language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要用简明的英语﹐而不是专业术语。

Sense.DEF: when someone is treated more favourably than other people, often when he or she has been treated unfairly in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Racial preferences are a way to make up for years of discrimination against minorities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族优待政策是对多年来少数族裔所受歧视的一种补偿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In allocating housing, preference is given to families with young children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房屋优先分配给有年幼孩子的家庭。

Sense.DEF: someone’s sexual preference is whether they want to have sex with men or women
preferential treatment, rates etc are deliberately different in order to give an advantage to particular people
Sense.EXAMPLE: preferential credit terms for reliable borrowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向可靠借款人提供的优惠信贷条件

Sense.DEF: when someone is given a more important job
to be a sign that something will happen later
a group of letters that is added to the beginning of a word to change its meaning and make a new word, such as ‘un’ in ‘untie’ or ‘mis’ in ‘misunderstand’
a number or letter that comes before other numbers or letters, especially a group of numbers that comes before a telephone number when you are calling someone in a different area
Sense.TRAN: 〔数字或字母前的〕前置代码〔尤指电话区号〕

Sense.DEF: a title such as ‘Ms’ or ‘Dr’ used before someone’s name
to add a prefix to a word, name, or set of numbers
to say something before the main part of what you have to say
when a woman is pregnant has a baby growing inside her body
Sense.EXAMPLE: This drug should not be taken during pregnancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药妊娠期间不得服用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her third pregnancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的第三次怀孕
Sense.EXAMPLE: teenage pregnancies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少女怀孕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pregnancy test
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妊娠试验﹐验孕

Sense.DEF: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body
Sense.EXAMPLE: care for pregnant women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕妇保健
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我立即明白我怀孕了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己年龄太大﹐已经不能怀孕了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s about five months pregnant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怀孕五个月左右。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maria was pregnant with her second child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚怀着她的第二个孩子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant make her pregnant .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没想让她怀孕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife was heavily pregnant almost ready to give birth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子即将临产。

Sense.DEF: a pause or silence which is full of meaning or emotion
Sense.TRAN: 耐人寻味[意味深长]的停顿/沉默
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stopped, and there was a pregnant pause.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停住了﹐那是个意味深长的停顿。

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of a quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every phrase in this poem is pregnant with meaning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首诗的片言只语都充满深意。

Sense.DEF:
to heat an
oven
to a particular temperature before it is used to cook something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把烤箱预热到375度。

Sense.DEF: a prehensile tail, foot etc can curl around things and hold on to them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尾巴﹑脚等〕能缠绕的﹐能抓握的

Sense.DEF: money or property that you receive from a member of your family while they are still alive rather than after they die, so that you do not have to pay tax on it
relating to the time in history before anything was written down
Sense.TRAN: 史前的﹐有历史记载以前的
Sense.EXAMPLE: prehistoric burial grounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史前墓地
Sense.EXAMPLE: prehistoric animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史前动物

Sense.DEF: very old-fashioned –used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 非常陈旧的﹐老掉牙的〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prehistoric attitude towards women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对待女性的过时看法

Sense.DEF: the time in history before anything was written down
to form an opinion about someone or something before you know or have considered all the facts – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 对〔人或事〕预先判断﹐过早判断〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shepherd’s case was prejudged by the media before her trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在谢泼德案开庭前媒体就已妄下结论。

Sense.DEF: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指基于种族、性别、宗教等的〕偏见﹐成见﹐歧视
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a cultural prejudice against fat people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对胖人的文化歧视

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Asian pupils complained of racial prejudice at the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚裔小学生抱怨在学校里遭遇种族歧视。

Sense.DEF: strong and unreasonable feelings which make you like some things but not others
Sense.EXAMPLE: irrational prejudices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不合理的偏见
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interviewers are often influenced too much by their personal prejudices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试官常常过多受到自身偏见的影响。

Sense.DEF: without harming or affecting something
Sense.TRAN: （对某事物）没有不利﹐无损（于某事物）
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was able to turn down the promotion without prejudice, and applied again several years later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妥当地拒绝了那次升职﹐并于几年之后再次提出申请。

Sense.DEF: in a way that has a harmful effect or influence on something
Sense.TRAN: 对某事物不利﹐有损于某事物

Exponent.DEF: an unreasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指基于种族、性别、宗教等的〕偏见,歧视
Exponent.EXAMPLE: racial prejudice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族歧视
Exponent.EXAMPLE: prejudice against women
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对女性的歧视

Exponent.DEF: the practice of treating one group of people differently from another in an unfair way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is widespread discrimination against older people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对老年人的歧视普遍存在。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the laws on sex discrimination
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对性别歧视的法律

Exponent.DEF: an unreasonable refusal to accept beliefs, customs, and ways of thinking that are different from your own
Exponent.EXAMPLE: religious intolerance
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教偏执
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is an atmosphere of intolerance in the media.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体上容不得有不同的声音。

Exponent.DEF: a completely unreasonable hatred for people of a different race, religion etc, based on strong and fixed opinions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: religious bigotry
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教偏见
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the bigotry directed at Jews and other ethnic groups
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对犹太人和其他少数民族的偏见

Exponent.DEF: unfair treatment of people because they belong to a different race
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many black people have been the victims of racism in Britain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多黑人在英国成为种族歧视的受害者。

Exponent.DEF: the belief that one sex, especially women, is weaker, less intelligent etc than the other, especially when this results in someone being treated unfairly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: sexism in language
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言中的性别歧视
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She accused him of sexism.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指责他性别歧视。

Exponent.DEF: unfair treatment of people because they are old
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The new law aims to stop ageism in the workplace.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项新法律旨在制止职场中的老龄歧视。

Exponent.DEF: prejudice towards or hatred of gay people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: homophobia in the armed forces
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队中对同性恋的歧视

Exponent.DEF: hatred and fear of foreigners
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the xenophobia of the right-wing press
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 右翼报纸的仇外情绪

Exponent.DEF: a strong feeling of hatred toward Jewish people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is anti-Semitism on the increase?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 反犹太主义是否在抬头？

Exponent.DEF: hatred and fear of Muslims
Exponent.TRAN: 伊斯兰恐惧症,恐伊斯兰症
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rise of Islamophobia and right-wing extremism in Europe
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的伊斯兰恐惧症和右翼极端主义的高涨

Exponent.DEF: unfair public criticism of gay people, union members, the American government etc
Exponent.TRAN: 对同性恋/工会/美国等的猛烈抨击
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The minister was accused of union bashing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名部长被指对工会进行不公正的抨击。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My own schooldays prejudiced me against all formal education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己学生时代的经历使我对所有的正规教育产生了偏见。

Sense.DEF: to have a bad effect on the future success or situation of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A criminal record will prejudice your chances of getting a job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪记录会不利于你就业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused to comment, saying he did not wish to prejudice the outcome of the talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝发表评论﹐称不希望影响会谈结果。

Sense.DEF: having an unreasonable dislike of someone or something, especially a dislike of a group of people who belong to a different race, sex, or religion – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 有偏见的﹐有成见的﹐歧视的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some officers were racially prejudiced .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些军官有种族歧视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intolerant and prejudiced man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏狭而有成见的男子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The early Christian church was prejudiced against the Jews.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期的基督教会对犹太人抱有偏见。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmentalists are prejudiced against the dam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护论者对那座水坝怀有成见。

Sense.DEF: seriously affected by a bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The council must provide housing for young people whose welfare is seriously prejudiced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会必须为生活遭遇严重不幸的年轻人提供住房。

Sense.DEF: having a bad effect on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: prejudicial testimony
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不利的证词

Sense.DEF:
a
bishop
,
cardinal
, or other important priest in the Christian church
Sense.TRAN: 〔主教﹑枢机主教等〕高级神职人员﹐高级教士

Sense.DEF: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the preliminary stages of the competition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竞赛的预赛阶段
Sense.EXAMPLE: a preliminary draft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 初稿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The discussions were preliminary to preparing a policy paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些讨论是在为制定政策文件做准备。

Sense.DEF: something that is said or done first, to introduce or prepare for something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pilot studies are a useful preliminary to large research projects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 试验性研究为大型研究项目做有效的初步准备。

Sense.EXAMPLE: After the usual preliminaries , the chairman made his announcement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段例行的开场白之后﹐主席发布了通告。

Sense.DEF: one of the games in the first part of a competition, when it is decided who will go on to the main competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Four teams will be eliminated in the preliminaries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预赛中将有四个队被淘汰。

Sense.DEF: a society that is preliterate has not developed a written language
Sense.TRAN: 无文字的﹐尚未使用文字的

Sense.DEF: a pre-loved house, pet etc has already been owned by someone else – used especially in advertisements to suggest the previous owner cared strongly about the object, animal etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋﹑宠物等〕心爱的〔尤用于广告中﹐表示备受原主人喜爱〕

Sense.DEF: if an event is a prelude to a more important event, it happens just before it and makes people expect it
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的序幕[前奏﹐开端]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Living together as a prelude to marriage is now considered acceptable in many countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚前同居如今在许多国家都已被接受。

Sense.DEF: a short piece of music, especially one played at the beginning of a longer musical piece or before a church ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chopin’s Preludes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖邦的前奏曲
Sense.EXAMPLE: an organ prelude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管风琴前奏曲

Sense.DEF: happening or existing before marriage
Sense.EXAMPLE: premarital sex
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚前性行为

Sense.DEF: happening before the natural or proper time
Sense.EXAMPLE: his premature death due to cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因癌症而早逝
Sense.EXAMPLE: premature ageing of the skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮肤的早衰

Sense.DEF: a premature baby is born before the usual time of birth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a premature birth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早产
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby was six weeks premature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个婴儿早产了六个星期。

Sense.DEF: done too early or too soon
Sense.TRAN: 〔做事〕过早的﹐过快的﹔仓促的﹐草率的﹔不成熟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a premature order to attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仓促的进攻命令
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any talk of a deal is premature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在谈论协议还为时过早。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is premature (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be premature to accuse anyone until the investigation is complete.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查结束之前谴责任何人都为时过早。

Sense.DEF: relating to classes that prepare a student for medical school, or to the students who are taking these classes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a premed student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医学预科学生

Sense.DEF: a premeditated crime or attack is planned in advance and done deliberately
Sense.TRAN: 〔犯罪或袭击〕有预谋的﹐预先策划的
Sense.EXAMPLE: premeditated murder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预谋杀人

Sense.DEF: the act of thinking about something and planning it before you actually do it
Sense.TRAN: 预先考虑﹔预先策划﹐预谋

Sense.DEF:
happening or relating to the time just before a woman’s
period the time each month when blood flows from her body

the tiredness, headache, bad temper etc experienced by some women in the days before their
period

the tiredness, headache, bad temper etc experienced by some women in the days before their
period

a
prime minister
– used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 总理﹐首相〔用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Irish Premier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱尔兰总理

Sense.DEF: best or most important
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of Dublin’s premier hotels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 都柏林最好的酒店之一

Sense.DEF: the first public performance of a film, play, or piece of music
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影的〕首映﹔〔戏剧﹑乐曲等的〕首演
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rossini’s work had its premiere at the Paris Opera.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗西尼的作品在巴黎歌剧院首演。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a movie premiere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影首映式
Sense.EXAMPLE: the play’s world premiere the first performance in the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该戏的全球首次公演

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影首映于1937年12月21日。

Sense.DEF:
the period when someone is
prime minister
the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店﹑餐馆﹑公司等使用的〕房屋及土地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Schools may earn extra money by renting out their premises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校通过出租房屋场地可以获取额外收入。
Sense.EXAMPLE: business premises
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业经营场所

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The manager escorted him off the premises.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理把他送出门外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wonderful desserts are made on the premises.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些美味的甜点是现场制作的。

Sense.DEF: a statement or idea that you accept as true and use as a base for developing other ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea that there is life on other planets is the central premise of the novel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他星球存在生命这一观点是这部小说的核心前提。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the premise that an accused person is innocent until they are proved guilty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在证明有罪之前被告无罪的前提

Sense.DEF: to be based on a particular idea or belief
Sense.EXAMPLE: The program is premised on the idea that drug addiction can be cured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划是以毒瘾可以戒除为前提的。

Sense.DEF: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year
Sense.EXAMPLE: insurance premiums
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险费

Sense.DEF: an additional amount of money, above a standard rate or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Consumers are prepared to pay a premium for organically grown vegetables.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者愿意多花钱购买有机蔬菜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Top quality cigars are being sold at a premium .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质雪茄售价很高。

Sense.DEF: if something is at a premium, people need it or want it, but there is little of it available or it is difficult to get
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the Olympic Games, accommodation will be at a premium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运会期间住宿会很紧张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Foldaway furniture is the answer where space is at a premium.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于空间狭小的地方﹐折叠式家具能解决问题。

Sense.DEF: to consider one quality or type of thing as being much more important than others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Modern economies place a premium on educated workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代经济尤其重视受过良好教育的工人。

Sense.DEF: good quality petrol
of very high quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: premium ice cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质冰激凌
Sense.EXAMPLE: the current consumer trend for premium products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当前消费者喜欢购买优质产品的趋向
Sense.EXAMPLE: premium quality British potatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质英国马铃薯

Sense.DEF: premium prices and rates are higher than usual ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: People are prepared to pay premium prices for quality products.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们愿意出高价购买优质产品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Calls are charged at the premium rate of 60p per minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话费很高﹐每分钟60便士。

Sense.DEF: a document that you buy from the government in Britain, which gives you the chance to win a large amount of money each month
a telephone connection to a particular service or company that costs a lot more than the usual rate when you call it because the company you are calling takes some of the money that you pay
Sense.TRAN: 加费电话号码/线路/服务〔这种电话的费用比正常高得多﹐因为服务提供者收取部分附加的费用〕

Sense.DEF: a strange feeling that something, especially something bad, is going to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a premonition of death
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 死亡的预感

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When Anne didn’t arrive, Paul had a premonition that she was in danger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮没有来﹐保罗就预感到她有危险了。

Sense.DEF: giving a warning that something unpleasant is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: premonitory symptoms of the disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病的先兆

Sense.DEF:
relating to unborn babies and the care of
pregnant
women
Sense.EXAMPLE: prenatal care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产前保健[护理]
Sense.EXAMPLE: prenatal screening
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产前筛查

Sense.DEF:
a legal document that is written before a man and a woman get married, in which they agree things such as how much money each will get if they
divorce
when someone thinks or worries about something a lot, with the result that they do not pay attention to other things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the current preoccupation with sex and scandal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前大家对性和丑闻的高度关注
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The management’s preoccupation with costs and profits resulted in a drop in quality and customer service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层过于追求成本效益和利润﹐导致产品质量和客户服务水平有所下降。

Sense.DEF: something that you give all your attention to
Sense.TRAN: 使人全神贯注的事物﹐使人入神的事物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their main preoccupation was how to feed their families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们主要关心的是如何养家糊口。

Sense.DEF: thinking about something a lot, with the result that you do not pay attention to other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s wrong with Cindy? She seems a little preoccupied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛迪怎么了？她好像有点心事重重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s completely preoccupied with all the wedding preparations at the moment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他此刻心无旁骛地筹备婚礼。

Sense.DEF: if something preoccupies someone, they think or worry about it a lot
Sense.TRAN: 使全神贯注﹐使专心于﹔占据〔某人的思想〕

Sense.DEF: relating to the time before a medical operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: the patient’s preoperative assessment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对病人的术前评估

Sense.DEF:
if something is preordained, it is certain to happen in the future because God or
fate
has decided it
Sense.TRAN: 命中注定的﹐上帝安排的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is everything we do preordained?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们所做的一切都是命中注定的吗？

Sense.DEF: if something that is for sale is pre-owned, it has been owned and used by someone else before – used especially in advertisements to make something not sound old
Sense.TRAN: 他人用过的﹐二手的〔尤用于广告中使听上去不是旧物的感觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: pre-owned cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二手车

Sense.DEF: work that is done by students on their own, after classes have finished – used in private schools
Sense.TRAN: 家庭作业〔私立学校用语〕

Sense.DEF: to prepare someone for an operation or an examination
Sense.TRAN: 为〔患者〕做手术准备﹔使〔学生〕做考试准备

Sense.DEF: to prepare food for cooking in a restaurant
to prepare for something that you are going to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to prep for my afternoon class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得准备下午的课。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=preposition

Sense.DEF: prepackaged foods have already been prepared when you buy them, so that they are ready to eat, or only have to be heated
Sense.EXAMPLE: prepackaged microwave meals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预制微波炉餐

Sense.DEF: prepacked food or other goods are wrapped before they are sent to the shop where they are sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: prepacked vegetables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预先包装好的蔬菜

Sense.DEF: if something is prepaid, it is paid for before it is needed or used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shipping charges are prepaid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运费已付。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prepaid envelope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮资已付的信封

Sense.DEF: the process of preparing something or preparing for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This dish is good for dinner parties because much of the preparation can be done ahead of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这道菜适合宴会﹐因为很多准备工作可以事先做好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Business training is a good preparation for any career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 业务培训对任何职业都是良好的基础。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the preparation of the budget
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 编制预算

GramExa.PROPFORM: do sth in preparation for sth
GramExa.GLOSS: in order to prepare for something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is practising every day, in preparation for the ice-skating championship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为备战滑冰锦标赛﹐他每天都在练习。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Plans for the new school are now in preparation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新学校的设计图正在绘制中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a course in food service and food preparation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐饮服务和备菜课程

Sense.DEF: arrangements for something that is going to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Preparations for the upcoming Olympic Games are nearing completion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 即将举行的奥运会的筹备工作已经临近尾声。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Preparations are being made for the President’s visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在为迎接总统来访做准备工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The festival was a great success, and preparations are underway have started for another one next summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节庆活动举办得很成功﹐现在已经开始筹备明年夏天的下一届活动了。

Sense.DEF: a mixture that has been prepared and that is used for a particular purpose, especially as a medicine or to make your skin more attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new preparation for cleansing the skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种新的洁肤霜

Sense.DEF: done in order to get ready for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: preparatory talks to clear the way for a peace settlement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为缔结和平协议扫清道路的预备性会谈
Sense.EXAMPLE: preparatory drawings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草图
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of preparatory work still needs to be done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有很多准备工作要做。

Sense.DEF: before something else and in order to prepare for it
Sense.TRAN: 作为某事的准备﹔在某事之前
Sense.EXAMPLE: The partners held several meetings preparatory to signing the agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合伙人在签订协议之前举行了几次会议。

Sense.DEF: a private school in Britain for children between the ages of 8 and
Sense.TRAN: 13 〔英国供8至13岁孩子就读的〕私立小学﹐预备学校

Sense.DEF: a private school in the US that prepares students for college
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国的〕私立高中﹐私立预科学校

Subsense.DEF: to make a meal or a substance
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Prepare the sauce while the pasta is cooking.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮面的同时准备调味汁。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When we got home, Stephano was busy preparing dinner.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到家时斯特凡诺正忙着准备晚餐。

Subsense.DEF: to write a document, make a programme etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Health and safety officers will investigate the site and prepare a report.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康和安全官员将调查现场并拟定一份报告。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Green set himself the task of preparing a map of this remote area.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林给自己定下任务: 给这个偏远地区绘制一张地图。

Sense.DEF: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The 45-year-old explorer has been preparing for his latest expedition to the Arctic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位45岁的探险家一直在筹备最近的北极探险之行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her parents were busy preparing to go on holiday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父母正忙于准备度假。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

Sense.DEF: to make something ready to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prepare the soil, then plant the seedlings eight inches apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把土平整好﹐然后每隔八英寸种一棵幼苗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Coulthard’s team were up all night preparing the car for the race.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 库特哈德的团队为了准备比赛用车彻夜未眠。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself mentally or physically ready for something that you expect to happen soon
Sense.TRAN: 使〔自己〕在思想[身体]上做好准备

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The letter arrived, and we prepared ourselves for bad news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信来了﹐我们做好了会有坏消息的心理准备。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you just give me a couple more moments to prepare myself?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能再给我些时间让我做好心理准备？

GramExa.PROPFORM: prepare yourself for a race/fight etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Chicago Bears are busy preparing themselves for the big game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥熊队正忙于备战这场大赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Buy the album, and prepare to be amazed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 买下这个专辑﹐就等着感受惊喜吧。

Sense.DEF: to provide someone with the training, skills, experience etc that they will need to do a job or to deal with a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a course that prepares students for English examinations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助学生准备英语考试的课程

Sense.EXAMPLE: Schools should do more to prepare children for the world of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校应该作出更多努力﹐让学生做好走入职场的准备。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does a coach do to prepare his team for the Superbowl?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教练为让他的球队备战超级杯赛要做些什么？

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for something to be achieved, or for someone to succeed in doing something
Sense.TRAN: 为某人/某事物做好准备条件﹐为某人/某事物打好基础
Sense.EXAMPLE: Curie’s research prepared the way for the work of modern nuclear scientists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居里的研究为现代核科学家的工作打下了基础。

Section.SECHEADING: TO PREPARE FOR AN EVENT 为某事做准备

Exponent.DEF: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future so that you will be ready when it happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He only had a few hours to prepare for the interview.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只有几个小时为面试做准备。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The family are preparing to move to Queensland.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人准备搬到昆士兰去。

Exponent.DEF: to prepare for something. Get ready is less formal than prepare and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 做准备〔不如prepare正式,多用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Smith has been busy getting ready for the race.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯在忙着为比赛做准备。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The army was getting ready to attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队准备发起攻击。

Exponent.DEF: to prepare for an event that needs a lot of planning
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The couple are making preparations for their wedding next year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对情侣在为明年的婚礼做准备。

Exponent.DEF: to prepare for an important event – used about companies, organizations, cities etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔公司﹑机构﹑城市等为重大事件〕做准备
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stores are gearing up for the busy Christmas shopping period.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 商店在为繁忙的圣诞购物期加紧准备。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The city is gearing up for the Olympics.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城市正为奥运会做准备工作。

Section.SECHEADING: TO PREPARE SOMETHING SO IT CAN BE USED 准备好某物以供使用

Exponent.DEF: to make something ready to be used
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you prepared your speech?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的发言准备好了吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Groundsmen were preparing the pitch for tomorrow’s game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球场管理员在为明天的比赛做场地准备。

Exponent.DEF: to prepare something. Get sth ready is less formal than prepare and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 把某事物准备好〔不如prepare正式,多用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were getting the ship ready to sail.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在为船起航做准备。

Exponent.DEF: to prepare equipment so that it is ready to be used
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It will take a few minutes to set the camera up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把相机准备好要花几分钟时间。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The band was setting up on the stage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队在台上做准备。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of prepare, get ready and make preparations in spoken and written English. 英语口语和书面语中prepare,get ready 和make preparations的使用频率。

Make preparations is less general than prepare and get ready, and is usually used to talk about making a large number of arrangements for something important that is going to happen. make preparations 不如prepare和get ready宽泛,一般用于表示为将要发生的重要事情作大量安排。

Sense.DEF: to be willing to do something, especially something difficult or something that you do not usually do
Sense.TRAN: 愿意做某事〔尤指难做或通常不做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to be prepared to take risks in this kind of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这种工作你必须准备好承担风险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much is she prepared to pay?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她愿意出多少钱？

Sense.DEF: ready to do something or deal with a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t prepared for all their questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的这些问题令我措手不及。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Luckily, we were well prepared for the storm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是﹐我们对这次风暴有充分的准备。

GramExa.GLOSS: not ready to deal with a difficult situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The country was ill-prepared to fight another war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国没准备好再打一仗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no news and we were prepared for the worst expected something very bad .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有任何消息﹐我们做好了最坏的打算。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’m not prepared to do sth
Sense.DEF: used when saying strongly that you refuse to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not prepared to sit here and listen to this rubbish!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不愿意坐在这里听这些废话！

Sense.DEF: planned, made, or written at an earlier time, so that it is ready when it is needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President read out a prepared statement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统宣读了一份事先准备好的声明。

Sense.DEF: when someone is ready for something
Sense.TRAN: 有准备（的状态）﹐做好准备
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s lack of military preparedness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国在军事上的准备不足

Sense.DEF: when someone is willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: their preparedness to break the law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们愿意以身试法

Sense.DEF:
pre-pay
mobile phone
systems make you pay before you use the service, rather than sending you a demand for money after you have been using it
to pay for something before you need it or use it
if there is a preponderance of people or things of a particular type in a group, there are more of that type than of any other
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a preponderance of female students in the music department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在音乐系里女学生占大多数。

Sense.DEF:
most of the
evidence
in a law case
main, most important, or most frequent
Sense.TRAN: 主要的﹔最重要的﹔最经常的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the preponderantly female staff at the factory
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂里占多数的女员工

Sense.DEF: to be more important or frequent than something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔重要性或频率上〕占优势﹐胜过

Sense.DEF:
a word that is used before a noun,
pronoun
, or
gerund
to show place, time, direction etc. In the phrase ‘the trees in the park’, ‘in’ is a preposition.
a phrase beginning with a preposition, such as ‘in bed’ or ‘at war’
looking attractive or pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 有吸引力的﹐给人好感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prepossessing smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的微笑

Sense.DEF: completely unreasonable or silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole idea sounds absolutely preposterous!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个想法听起来荒谬透顶！

Sense.DEF: preppy clothes or styles are very neat, in a way that is typical of students who go to expensive private schools in the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔指服饰或风格〕像私立学校学生一样的﹐整洁讲究的

Sense.DEF:
a
preparatory school
Sense.TRAN: 私立小学﹐预备学校﹔私立高中﹐私立预科学校

Sense.DEF:
relating to the time just before a child reaches
puberty
a book, film etc that tells you what happened before the story told in a previous popular book or film

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘The Phantom Menace’ is a prequel to ‘Star Wars’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《魅影危机》是《星球大战》的前传。

Sense.DEF: relating to the members of a group of late 19th-century English painters and artists
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国19世纪晚期〕拉斐尔前派画家[艺术家]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Pre-Raphaelite painting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉斐尔前派风格的绘画

Sense.DEF: used to describe a woman’s hair that is long and curly
to record music, a radio programme etc on a machine so that it can be used later
Sense.TRAN: 将〔音乐﹑电台节目等〕预先录下﹐预先录制
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prerecorded interview
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事先录制的采访

Sense.DEF: something that is necessary before something else can happen or be done
Sense.TRAN: 先决条件﹐前提﹐必备条件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A reasonable proficiency in English is a prerequisite for the course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不错的英语水平是上这门课程的前提。

Sense.DEF: a right that someone has, especially because of their importance or social position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Education was once the prerogative of the elite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受教育曾是上等阶层的特权。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Arriving late is a woman’s prerogative .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟到是女人的特权。

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: the rights of kings and queens

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 君主特权

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=present现在的
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=president总统﹔董事长

Sense.DEF: to be a sign that something is going to happen, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 预示﹐预兆〔尤指不祥的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The large number of moderate earthquakes that have occurred recently could presage a larger quake soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近多次发生中等强度的地震﹐这预示着可能很快就会发生更强烈的地震。

Sense.DEF: a member of a Protestant church, which is one of the largest churches in the US, and is the national church of Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 长老会教徒〔长老会为美国最大的教会之一﹐也是苏格兰的国教〕

Sense.DEF: a local court or council of the Presbyterian church or the area controlled by that church
Sense.TRAN: 〔长老会的〕教务评议会（管辖区）

Sense.DEF: a house in which a Roman Catholic priest lives

the eastern part of a church, behind the area where the
choir singers
sits
Sense.TRAN: 〔教堂内的〕司祭席〔位于教堂东侧唱诗班席之后的神职人员座席〕

Sense.DEF: relating to the time in a child’s life before they are old enough to go to school
Sense.EXAMPLE: preschool children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学龄前儿童

Sense.DEF: a school for children between two and five years of age
a child who does not yet go to school, or who goes to preschool
Sense.TRAN: 学龄前儿童﹔幼儿园学童

Sense.DEF: able to imagine or know what will happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 有预知能力的﹐能预知未来的

Sense.DEF: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If these don’t work I may have to prescribe you something stronger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这些药无效﹐我也许得给你开一些药效更强的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the drugs prescribed for his stomach pains
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开给他治疗胃痛的药物

Sense.DEF: to state officially what should be done in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

Sense.DEF: decided by a rule
Sense.EXAMPLE: All schools must follow the prescribed curriculum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有学校都必须按规定课程上课。

Sense.DEF: an official order or rule

a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a
pharmacist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a prescription for sleeping pills
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安眠药处方

Sense.EXAMPLE: We are trying to cut the price of prescription drugs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正努力降低处方药的价格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a repeat prescription one that you have regularly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重复处方

GramExa.GLOSS: get the drugs a doctor has written that you need
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got the prescription filled on the way home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 回家的路上我买了医生开给我的药。

Sense.DEF: a particular medicine or treatment ordered by a doctor for a sick person
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

Sense.DEF: a drug that you get on prescription can only be obtained with a written order from the doctor
an idea or suggestion about how you should behave, or how to make a situation, activity etc successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party’s main prescription for educational problems was to give schools more money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党解决教育问题的主要方法是给学校提供更多资金。

Sense.DEF: saying how something should or must be done, or what should be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: prescriptive teaching methods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规定的教学方法

Sense.DEF: stating how a language should be used, rather than describing how it is used
Sense.EXAMPLE: prescriptive grammar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规定语法

Sense.DEF: a right that has existed for so long that it is as effective as a law

preseason matches, training etc happen in the time immediately before a sport’s normal
season
Sense.EXAMPLE: preseason training
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛季前的训练

Sense.DEF: when someone or something is present in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敬请出席于周五举行的俱乐部会议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tests revealed the presence of poison in the blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 化验显示血液中含有毒素。

Sense.DEF: with someone or in the same place as them
Sense.TRAN: 在某人面前﹐当着某人的面
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was determined not to complain in the presence of the nurse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定不当着那位护士的面抱怨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked you not to smoke in my presence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叫你不要在我面前抽烟的。

Sense.DEF: the ability to appear impressive to people because of your appearance or the way you behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man of great presence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风度翩翩的男子

Sense.DEF: a group of people, especially soldiers, who are in a place to control what is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will increase police presence in local communities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在当地社区增加警力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soldiers still maintain a military presence in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们仍然驻守在该地区。

Sense.DEF: the ability to gain sales because your business is strong or noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company with a strong presence in all major world markets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在世界各大市场都很有势力的公司

Sense.DEF: a spirit or influence that cannot be seen but is felt to be near
Sense.EXAMPLE: They felt a strange presence in the deserted house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们感到那所废弃的房子里有异灵。

Sense.DEF: to have a strong and noticeable effect on the people around you or the situation you are in
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a very pretty girl and made her presence felt almost at once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个很漂亮的姑娘﹐她一出现几乎马上就能吸引别人的注意。

Sense.DEF: the ability to deal with a dangerous situation calmly and quickly

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the presence of mind to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m glad she had the presence of mind to take down the car’s registration number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴她能镇定地记下车牌号码。

Sense.DEF: in a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Foreign observers were present at the elections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国观察员出席了选举。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the gases present in the Earth’s atmosphere
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球大气中存在的气体

Sense.DEF: to be felt strongly or remembered for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 强烈感觉到的﹔历历在目的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The memory of her brother’s death is still present in her mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哥哥去世时的情景她仍记忆犹新。

Sense.DEF: happening or existing now
Sense.EXAMPLE: the present situation of the millions of people who are suffering poverty and disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭受贫困和疾病折磨的数百万人民的现状
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the present time we have no explanation for this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前我们还无法解释这件事。

Sense.DEF: in the time now, or modern times
Sense.EXAMPLE: The practice has continued from medieval times to the present day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种做法从中世纪时期一直延续至今。

Sense.DEF: used to say that everyone who is supposed to be in a place, at a meeting etc is now here
Sense.TRAN: 该到的都到了﹐如数到齐

Sense.DEF: used when you are criticizing a group of people and you want to tell the people you are with that they are not included in the criticism
Sense.TRAN: 〔批评他人时用语〕在座各位除外
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women are never satisfied with anything! Present company excepted, of course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人从来不会满足！ 当然在座的各位除外。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔在正式场合等〕颁发﹐授予﹐赠送﹔呈献﹔呈递

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was presented with a bottle of champagne.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人送他一瓶香槟。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was presented with an award .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被授予一个奖项。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The computer centre presented a cheque for £500 to cancer research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家计算机中心捐赠了一张500英镑的支票用于癌症研究。

Sense.DEF: to cause something to happen or exist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I knew I had presented her with an impossible task.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我给了她一项不可能完成的任务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Large classes present great problems to many teachers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大班教学给许多老师造成很大困难。

Sense.DEF: to talk and behave in a particular way when you meet people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He presents himself well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很善于展示自己。

Sense.DEF: to show or describe someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The artist was determined to present an accurate picture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位画家决心要展现一幅精准的画面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll present the information using a chart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将用图表来展示这些信息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shakespeare presents the hero as a noble man doomed to make mistakes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚把主人公表现成一位道德高尚却注定要犯错的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government presents itself as being sensitive to environmental issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府表现出一副对环境问题很敏感的样子。

Sense.DEF: to give a speech in which you offer an idea, plan etc to be considered or accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our manager is due to present the report at the end of the month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的经理将于月底作汇报。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On January 3 the company will present its plans to the bank.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1 月3日该公司将向银行提交计划。

Sense.DEF: to show something such as an official document or ticket to someone in an official position
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must present your passport to the customs officer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须向海关人员出示护照。

Sense.DEF: to give a performance in a theatre, cinema etc, or broadcast a programme on television or radio
Sense.TRAN: 上演﹔演出﹔上映﹔播出〔广播或电视节目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edinburgh Theatre Company presents ‘The Wind in the Willows’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱丁堡剧团上演《柳林风声》。

Sense.DEF: if you present a television or radio programme, you introduce its different parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thursday’s ‘The Late Show’ was presented by Cynthia Rose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期四的《深夜秀》是由辛茜娅·罗丝主持的。

Sense.DEF: to give something or someone a particular appearance or style
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant likes to present food with style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家餐馆的食物总是色香味俱全。

Sense.DEF: if a situation, opportunity etc presents itself, it suddenly happens or exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll tell her as soon as the opportunity presents itself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一有机会我就告诉她。

Sense.DEF: to formally introduce someone to another person, especially to someone of a very high rank
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式地〕介绍﹐引见〔尤指向地位极高者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was presented to the Queen in 1964.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我于1964年被引见给女王。

Sense.DEF: used to greet someone, say sorry to them etc very politely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs. Gottlieb presents her apologies and regrets she will not be able to attend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈特利布夫人因为不能出席而感到抱歉和遗憾。

Sense.DEF:
to show an illness by having a particular
symptom sign of an illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor asked whether any of the children had been presenting any unusual symptoms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生询问是否有孩子表现出什么特别的症状。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three of the five patients presented with fever and severe headaches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五位病人中有三位出现了发烧和剧烈头痛的症状。

Sense.DEF: when soldiers present arms, they hold their guns straight up in front of them while an officer or other important person walks past
something you give someone on a special occasion or to thank them for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m looking for a present for Mark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在找一份礼物送给马克。

Subsense.DEF: the time that is happening now
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Stop worrying about the past and live in the present.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再为过去烦恼﹐好好地过眼前的日子。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The film is set sometime between 1995 and the present.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影的背景设在1995年到现在的某个时间。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘When do you want to start?’ ‘Well, there’s no time like the present used to say that if you are going to do something at all, you should do it now .’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想什么时候开始？”“嗯﹐没有比现在更合适的时候了。”

Subsense.DEF: the form of the verb that shows what exists or is happening now

Sense.DEF: at this time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The item you want is not available at present.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您想要的那件商品目前没货。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At present, the airport handles 110 flights a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前﹐该机场每天有110个航班起落。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say at the moment rather than at present .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 at the moment ,而不说 at present
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’m looking for a new job at the moment .

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of at present, now and at the moment in spoken and written English.英语口语和书面语中at present,now 和at the moment的使用频率。
At present is more formal than now and at the moment. at present 比now和at the moment 正式。
