Sense.DEF: something that exists or will be done for the present exists now and will continue for a while, though it may change in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is still in business, at least for the present.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司仍在运营﹐至少目前如此。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say for now , rather than for the present .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 for now ,而不说 for the present
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: That’s all we have time for for now .

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He gave everyone a present.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给每人一件礼物。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was given this book as a present.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书是作为礼物给我的。

Collocate.COLLOC: Did you get Bill a birthday present?
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 你给比尔准备好生日礼物了吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: receive a present
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Children soon learn to enjoy giving presents as well as getting them.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子们很快体会到了收礼物和送礼物的快乐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She spent the afternoon wrapping Christmas presents.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她花了一个下午包装圣诞礼物。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can we open our presents now?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在可以打开礼物了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Thanks for the birthday present.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢给我生日礼物。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What would Dad like as a Christmas present?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸会喜欢什么圣诞礼物？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His wedding present to her had been a diamond necklace.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他送她的结婚礼物是一条钻石项链。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘unpack a present’. Say 而要说 open a present .

Sense.DEF: tidy and attractive enough to be seen or shown to someone
Sense.TRAN: 拿得出手的﹔像样的﹔体面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a presentable young woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是位优雅大方的年轻女子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s tidy up and make the house a bit more presentable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们来把房子收拾得更像样一点吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must go and make myself presentable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得去打扮一下。

Sense.DEF: the act of giving someone a prize or present at a formal ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: the presentation ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颁奖仪式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr Evans thanked him for coming to make the presentations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯博士感谢他来颁奖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the presentation of prizes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奖品的颁发

Sense.DEF: an event at which you describe or explain a new product or idea
Sense.TRAN: 报告﹔〔新产品的〕介绍﹔〔观点的〕陈述﹐说明
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will begin a series of presentations to help the public fully understand our system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将进行一系列的说明﹐帮助公众充分了解我们的制度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m going to ask each of you to make a short presentation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要请你们每一位作一个简短的介绍。

Sense.DEF: the way in which something is said, offered, shown, or explained to others
Sense.TRAN: 讲述﹐描绘﹔显示﹔呈现﹔表现

GramExa.EXAMPLE: desktop devices for the presentation of information
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 显示信息用的桌面设备
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the presentation of evidence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 证据的提交

Sense.DEF: when you show something to someone so that it can be checked or considered

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the presentation of the identity documents
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出示身份证明

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Club members will be admitted on presentation of their membership cards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部会员出示会员卡方可进入。

Sense.DEF: the act of performing a play

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went to see the National Theatre’s presentation of Arthur Miller’s ‘The Last Yankee’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去观看了国家剧院上演的阿瑟·米勒的《最后的美国佬》。

Sense.DEF: the position in which a baby is lying in its mother’s body just before it is born
Sense.EXAMPLE: a breech presentation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臀位

Sense.DEF:
a book that is given to someone, especially by the writer or
publisher
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指作者或出版商提供的〕赠（阅）本

Sense.DEF: modern or existing now
Sense.EXAMPLE: present-day Sicily
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今日西西里

Sense.DEF: a situation when people spend a lot of time at work, even if they are ill or could take a holiday, because they want their employers to see that they are working very hard
Sense.TRAN: 全勤主义〔指为讨好老板不请病假﹑不休假的行为〕

Sense.DEF: someone who introduces the different parts of a television or radio show
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或广播节目的〕主持人﹐主播
Sense.EXAMPLE: the presenter of BBC 2’s ‘Newsnight’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国广播公司第二台《新闻之夜》的主播

Sense.DEF: a strange feeling that something is going to happen, especially something bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a presentiment of disaster
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要发生灾难的预感

Sense.DEF: in a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor will be here presently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生一会儿就到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Presently, I fell asleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一会儿我就睡着了。

Sense.DEF: at the present time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The range of courses presently available has grown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前可选择的课程范围已经扩大了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your case is presently being investigated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的案子目前正在调查中。

Sense.DEF:
a
participle
that is formed in English by adding ‘ing’ to the verb, as in ‘sleeping’. It can be used in
compound
forms of the verb to show
continuous
tenses, as in ‘she’s sleeping’, or as an adjective, as in ‘the sleeping child’.

the form of a verb that shows what happened during a period of time up to and including the present, formed in English with the present tense of the verb ‘have’ and a
past participle
, as in ‘he has gone’
the form of the verb that shows what exists or is happening now
when something is kept in its original state or in good condition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eliot campaigned for the preservation of London’s churches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃利奥特发起了保护伦敦各教堂的运动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are working for the preservation of the environment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正致力于环境保护工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the preservation of our cultural heritage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我们文化遗产的保护

Sense.EXAMPLE: methods of food preservation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保存食物的各种方法

Sense.DEF: the act of making sure that a situation continues without changing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the preservation of peace in the region
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维护该地区的和平

Sense.DEF: the degree to which something has remained unchanged or unharmed by weather, age etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arena is in an exceptionally fine state of preservation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座竞技场保存得非常完好。

Sense.DEF: someone who works to prevent historical places, buildings etc from being destroyed
in Britain, an official order that something, especially an area of countryside or an old building, must be preserved and not damaged
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕文物保护令﹐自然保护令
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tree preservation order
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木保护令

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance that is used to prevent things from decaying, for example food or wood
Sense.EXAMPLE: food that contains no artificial preservatives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不含人造防腐剂的食品

Sense.DEF: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 维护﹐保护﹐保存〔使免受破坏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木﹐同时也要保护现有的林地。

Sense.DEF: to make something continue without changing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the responsibility of the police to preserve the peace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察维护和平的职责
Sense.EXAMPLE: Norma tried to preserve a normal family life in difficult circumstances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺尔玛努力在艰苦的条件下维持正常的家庭生活。

Sense.DEF: to store food for a long time after treating it so that it will not decay
Sense.EXAMPLE: black olives preserved in brine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盐水黑橄榄

Sense.DEF:
a substance made from boiling fruit or vegetables with sugar, salt, or
vinegar
Sense.EXAMPLE: homemade fruit preserves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自制果酱

Sense.DEF: an activity that is only suitable or allowed for a particular group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Banking used to be a male preserve .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行业一度是男人的天下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The civil service became the preserve of the educated middle class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府文职机构成了受过良好教育的中产阶级人士的专属领地。

Sense.DEF: an area of land or water that is kept for private hunting or fishing
decided or set at an earlier time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heating automatically switches on and off at pre-set temperatures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖气根据预设温度自动开关。

Sense.DEF: pre-shrunk clothes are sold after they have been made smaller by being washed
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服在出售之前〕已预缩的﹐缩过水的
Sense.EXAMPLE: pre-shrunk jeans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预先经过缩水处理的牛仔裤

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of a formal event, organization, ceremony etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shall be pleased to preside at your meetings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴主持你们的会议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Justice Waller, presiding judge for the northeast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃勒法官﹐东北地区的首席法官

Sense.DEF: to be in a position of authority at a time when important things are happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has presided over a massive increase in unemployment during the last few years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府过去几年里面临大规模的失业问题。

Sense.DEF: to be the head of a company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finch presided over the company for 30 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芬奇掌管这家公司30年。

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of a meeting or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman will preside over an audience of architects and developers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席将主持一个由建筑设计师和开发商共同参加的会议。

Sense.DEF: the position of being the president of a country or organization, or the period of time during which someone is president
Sense.TRAN: 总统[主席﹐总裁]的职位[任期]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roosevelt was elected four times to the presidency of the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗斯福四次当选美国总统。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were few real improvements during his presidency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他的总统任期内几乎没有什么真正的改善。

Sense.DEF: the official leader of a country that does not have a king or queen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the President of France
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国总统

Sense.EXAMPLE: President Bush
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布什总统

Sense.DEF: the person who has the highest position in a company or organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the president of General Motors
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通用汽车公司总裁

Sense.DEF: someone who has been elected as a new president, but who has not yet started the job
relating to a president
Sense.EXAMPLE: a presidential election
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统大选
Sense.EXAMPLE: the party’s presidential candidate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党的总统候选人

Sense.DEF:
a committee chosen to represent a large political organization, especially in a
communist
country
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指共产主义国家的〕常务委员会﹐主席团

Subsense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Subsense.DEF: people who write reports for newspapers, radio, or television
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the freedom of the press
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻自由
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The press have been very nasty about him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻界对他很不客气。

Subsense.DEF: reports in newspapers and on radio and television
Subsense.EXAMPLE: To judge from the press, the concert was a great success.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从新闻报道来看﹐这次音乐会非常成功。
新闻报道
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The band has received good press coverage the reports written about something in newspapers .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该乐队获得了报界的好评。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The story was widely covered in the national press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事在全国性报纸上广为报道。

Sense.DEF: to be criticized in the newspapers or on radio or television
Sense.TRAN: 受到新闻界[舆论界]的批评
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government’s policy on mental health care is getting an increasingly bad press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在心理保健方面的政策受到舆论界越来越强烈的批评。

Sense.DEF: to be praised in the newspapers or on radio or television
Sense.TRAN: 受到新闻界[舆论界]的好评
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our recycling policy is getting a good press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的回收利用政策逐渐获得新闻界的好评。

Subsense.DEF: a business that prints and sometimes also sells books
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Clarendon Press
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉伦登出版社

Subsense.DEF: a machine that prints books, newspapers, or magazines

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used to put weight on something in order to make it flat or to force liquid out of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trouser press
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熨裤机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flower press
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压花器

Sense.DEF: a light steady push against something small
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give the button another press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再按一下这个按钮。

Sense.DEF: if a newspaper, magazine, or book goes to press, it begins to be printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: All information was correct at the time we went to press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们准备付印时所有信息都正确无误。

Sense.DEF: a crowd of people pushing against each other
to push something firmly against a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manville kept his back pressed flat against the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼维尔后背紧紧地贴在墙上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pressed the gas pedal and the car leapt forwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她踩下油门﹐汽车向前冲了出去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pressed a card into her hand before leaving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开之前他往她手里塞了一张卡片。

Sense.DEF: to push a button, switch etc to make a machine start, a bell ring etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lily pressed the switch and plunged the room into darkness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉莉按下开关﹐房间里顿时漆黑一片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press control, alt, delete to log on to the computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按control ＋ alt ＋ delete键登录电脑。

Sense.DEF: to make clothes smooth using a hot iron
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll need to press my suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要熨一下我的西装。

Sense.DEF: to move in a particular direction by pushing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car rocked as the crowd pressed hard against it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群拼命地挤靠着汽车﹐车身晃动了起来。

Sense.DEF: to try hard to persuade someone to do something, especially by asking them many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt that if I had pressed him he would have lent me the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得如果当时我逼着他要﹐他会把钱借给我的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police pressed her to remember all the details.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方催促她回忆所有的细节。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The manufacturers are pressing the government for action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产商正在敦促政府采取行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must continue to press for full equality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须继续诉求﹐争取实现完全平等。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I was pressing my claim for custody of the child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在极力争取孩子的监护权。

Sense.DEF: to put pressure or a weight on something to make it flat, crush it etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: pressed flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压花
Sense.EXAMPLE: At this stage the grapes have to be pressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个阶段得压榨葡萄。

Sense.DEF: to hold someone or something close to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He reached out and pressed her to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸出手来紧紧抱着她。

Sense.DEF: to hold someone’s hand or arm tightly for a short time, to show friendship, sympathy etc
Sense.TRAN: 紧握某人的手/手臂〔表示友好﹑同情等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes he was too ill to speak, and just pressed my hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时他病得太厉害不能说话﹐就用力握握我的手。

Sense.DEF: to say officially that someone has done something illegal and must go to court
to not have enough time, money etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government department that is pressed for both time and money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 既缺时间又缺资金的政府部门

Sense.DEF: to offer something to someone and try to make them take it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I pressed money on him, but he refused to take it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我硬塞钱给他﹐但他就是不肯要。

Sense.DEF: to push a weight up from your chest using only your arms, without moving your legs or feet
to persuade someone to help you, or to use something to help you do something because of an unexpected problem or need
Sense.TRAN: 〔因意外问题或需求而〕将就使用[暂用]某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army was pressed into service to fight the fires.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队被临时调来灭火。

Sense.DEF: to shake hands with a lot of people – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 与许多人握手〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President reached into the crowd to press the flesh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统走入人群和大家握手。

Subsense.DEF: to push something into its place
Subsense.TRAN: 把某物推入[压入﹐按入﹐塞入]适当的位置
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jane slammed the door and pressed the bolt home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简砰的一声把门关上并插上了插销。

Subsense.DEF: to repeat or emphasize something, so that people remember it
Subsense.TRAN: 重复[强调]某事物〔以使人们记住它〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He decided it was the time to press his point home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他断定该是强调他观点的时候了。

Sense.DEF: to try to succeed completely, using an advantage that you have gained
Sense.TRAN: 用足自己的优势﹔尽量利用时机

Sense.DEF:
to make a copy of a record,
cd
etc

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be hard pressed to do sth

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something, especially working, in a determined way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll talk about your suggestion later – now let’s just press on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们回头再来讨论你的建议﹐现在我们先继续吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shall we press ahead with the minutes of the last meeting?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是否继续宣读上次会议的纪要？

Sense.DEF: an organization that gets news from a country and supplies it to newspapers, television news etc all over the world
someone whose job is to supply photographs or information about a particular actor, musician etc to newspapers, radio, or television
Sense.TRAN: 〔为演员﹑音乐家等作宣传的〕宣传员﹐公关人员

Sense.DEF: someone who owns and controls one or more important national newspapers

an area at a sports
stadium
where people from newspapers, radio, or television sit
a meeting held by a person or group at which they answer questions from people who write or present news reports
Sense.TRAN: 记者招待会﹐新闻发布会
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Green Party held a press conference the next day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天绿党举行了新闻发布会。

Sense.DEF:
a group of news
reporter s
working at the place where something important is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: the White House press corps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫记者团

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing or a picture, cut out from a newspaper or magazine
to not have enough time, money etc

an area above or at the back of a hall, used by news
reporter s
to force someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to press-gang you into doing something you’re not happy with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想强迫你去做自己不乐意做的事情。

Sense.DEF: to force men to work on a ship, by taking them from the streets - done in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时〕强制征募﹐抓〔壮丁去船上干活〕

Sense.DEF: a group of people in the past who took young men away using force in order to make them come to work on a ship
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去为海军强抓壮丁的〕征兵队

Sense.DEF: a present
needing to be discussed or dealt with very soon

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Poverty is a more pressing problem than pollution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫穷是比污染更紧迫的问题。

Sense.DEF: a thing or group of things, especially records or CDs, that have been made by pressing plastic or metal into shape
Sense.TRAN: 压制品﹔一批压制品〔尤指唱片或光盘〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The CD, released in October, sold out a first pressing of 1,500 in just four months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张光盘发行于10月份﹐第一批压制的1,500张仅仅四个月就销售一空。

Sense.DEF: the act of pressing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The olives are heat treated during the second pressing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橄榄在第二次压榨时经过加热处理。

Sense.DEF: someone who writes news reports
the office of an organization or government department which gives information to the newspapers, radio, or television
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织或政府部门的〕新闻办公室

Sense.DEF: an official statement giving information to the newspapers, radio, or television
a secretary to an important organization or person, who gives information about them to the newspapers, radio, or television
a type of exercise in which you lie facing the ground, and push your body up with your arms
an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats
Sense.TRAN: 〔利用影响﹑辩论或威胁施加的〕压力
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在向民众施加压力﹐要求他们投赞成票。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be/come under pressure to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minister was under presssure to resign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长面临被迫辞职的压力。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be/come under pressure from sb (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was under pressure from my parents to become a teacher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母逼着我当老师。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Labour government came under pressure from the trade unions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党政府受到了来自工会的压力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pressure for change has become urgent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革的呼声越来越迫切。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pressure on all of us to keep slim
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求我们个个都保持苗条的压力
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He exerts pressure on his kids to get them to do as he wants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给孩子们施加压力﹐让他们按照他的想法去做。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You must never give in to pressure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你绝不能屈从压力。

Sense.DEF: a way of working or living that causes you a lot of anxiety, especially because you feel you have too many things to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I feel I’m not able to cope well with the pressures of life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己无法妥善应付生活压力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pressure on doctors is increasing steadily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生的压力越来越大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m under constant pressure at work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我工作上一直有压力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The pressures of work can make you ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作压力可能会导致生病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high pressure job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力大的工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: athletes who show grace under pressure who behave well when they are anxious
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力下仍表现出良好风度的运动员

Sense.DEF:
events or conditions that cause changes and affect the way a situation develops, especially in
economics
or politics
Sense.EXAMPLE: inflationary pressures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀的压力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Analysts expect the pound to come under pressure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分析家预期英镑将面临压力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Slowing the arms race relieved pressure on the Soviet economic system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 放慢军备竞赛速度减轻了苏联经济体制所面临的压力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The 1990s brought increased economic pressure to bear on all business activities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪90年代所有的商业活动都面临更大的经济压力。

Sense.DEF: the force or weight that is being put on to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pressure of the water turns the wheel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水的压力使轮子转动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the pressure of his hand on my arm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手压在我胳膊上的力量

Sense.DEF: the force produced by the quantity of gas or liquid in a place or container
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gas containers burst at high pressure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些瓦斯容器遇到高压就会爆炸。

Sense.DEF:
a condition of the air in the Earth’s
atmosphere
, which affects the weather

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A ridge of high pressure is building up strongly over the Atlantic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个强大的高压脊正在大西洋上空形成。

Sense.DEF: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You want to enjoy food, not to be pressured into eating the right things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们希望享受食物﹐而不是被迫去吃那些该吃的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t feel we are pressuring you to give what you can’t afford.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别勉强﹐我们不会强人所难的。

Sense.DEF: a tightly covered cooking pot in which food is cooked very quickly by the pressure of hot steam
a situation or place that causes anxiety or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pressure cooker of soccer management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球经营管理的巨大压力

Sense.DEF: feeling worried, or making you feel worried, because of the number of things you have to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly pressured job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力很大的工作

Sense.DEF: a group or organization that tries to influence the opinions of ordinary people and persuade the government to do something
Sense.TRAN: 压力集团〔试图影响舆论和政府行为的团体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: environmental pressure groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护压力集团

Sense.DEF: a place or situation where there may be trouble
Sense.TRAN: 有麻烦的地方﹔危险局面
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pressure point for racial tension
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族关系紧张的地方

Sense.DEF: a place on the body that can be pressed, either to stop bleeding or to help make you feel better
Sense.TRAN: 加压止血点﹔压（觉）点﹐穴位

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that forces water or another liquid out of a container very quickly, used to clean things such as cars, engines, machines etc
Sense.TRAN: 高压清洗机[器]〔用于清洗汽车﹑发动机﹑机器等〕

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is not a good idea to pressurize children into playing a musical instrument.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强迫孩子学习乐器不好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone is being pressurized to vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都被迫投票。

Sense.DEF: if a container or space is pressurized, the air, gas, or liquid inside it is kept at a controlled pressure
Sense.TRAN: 气压[压力]受控的﹐气压[压力]调节的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pressurized aircraft cabin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有气压调节的机舱
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pressurized water reactor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压水反应堆

Sense.DEF: feeling worried, or making you feel worried, because of the number of things you have to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I feel very pressurized at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在感觉压力非常大。

Sense.DEF: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the prestige of having your work shown at a top London gallery
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有作品在伦敦顶级美术馆展览的荣誉

Sense.EXAMPLE: The king wanted to enhance his prestige through war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王想通过战争来提高自己的威信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This little-known British firm has now gained considerable prestige .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家名不见经传的英国公司如今已经声名鹊起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the personal prestige attached to owning a large property
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有大房子所带来的体面

Sense.DEF: a prestige project, product etc is one of high quality that people respect you for having or being involved in
Sense.EXAMPLE: tiny roles in prestige firms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大公司里的小职位
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prestige car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名车

Sense.DEF: admired as one of the best and most important
Sense.TRAN: 有威望的﹐有声望的﹐有威信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prestigious literary award
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 享有盛名的文学奖
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly prestigious university
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫赫有名的大学

Sense.DEF: played or sung very quickly
a piece of music, or part of one, that is played or sung very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 急板﹔急板乐段[乐章﹐乐曲]

Sense.DEF: said when something happens suddenly in a way that seems unbelievable or magical
Sense.TRAN: 嘿〔用于表示某事突然发生﹐令人难以置信或让人觉得很神奇〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You just press a button and presto! A drink appears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只要摁一下按钮﹐嘿！一罐饮料就来了。

Sense.DEF:
pre-stressed
concrete
has been made stronger by having wires put inside it
Sense.TRAN: 〔混凝土〕预加应力的﹐加了钢筋的

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think something is probably true
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s raining, which presumably means that your football match will be cancelled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下雨了﹐这可能意味着你们的足球比赛要取消。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s dead now, presumably?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许他已经死了呢？

Sense.DEF: to think that something is true, although you are not certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each of you will make a speech, I presume?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你们每个人都会发言﹐是吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are his parents still alive?’ ‘ I presume so .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他的父母都还健在吗？”“我想是吧。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I presume we’ll be there by six o’clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们会在6点之前到。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From the way he talked, I presumed him to be your boss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从他谈话的样子看﹐我想他是你们的老板。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The temple is presumed to date from the first century BC.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据推测这座寺庙建于公元前1世纪。

Sense.DEF: to accept something as true until it is shown to not be true, especially in law
Sense.TRAN: 认定﹐认为﹐推定〔尤在法律上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must presume innocence until we have evidence of guilt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在掌握有罪证据之前应作无罪推定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their nephew was missing, presumed dead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的侄子失踪了﹐被认定为死亡。

Sense.DEF: to behave without respect or politeness by doing something that you have no right to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would never presume to tell you what to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我岂敢对你指手画脚。

Sense.DEF: to accept something as being true and base something else on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Ancient History course presumes some knowledge of Greek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古代史课程要求略懂希腊语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I presume that someone will be there to meet us when we arrive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们到的时候应该会有人在那里接我们。

Sense.DEF: to unfairly ask someone for more than you should, because they are your friend, are generous etc
Sense.TRAN: 利用某人的友谊/慷慨等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be presuming on his generosity to ask him for money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向他要钱等于是在利用他的慷慨占他的便宜。

Sense.DEF: something that you think is true because it is very likely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the presumption that their wealth is the result of crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为他们的财富是不义之财的猜测

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the presumption that the doctor knows best, I took the medicine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想医生是最清楚的﹐所以就把这药吃了。

Sense.DEF: the act of thinking something is true, bad, or good until it is shown to not be true, bad, or good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the presumption of innocence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无罪的假定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strong presumption against development in national parks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈反对在国家公园里进行开发

Sense.DEF: behaviour that seems rude and too confident
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was enraged by his presumption.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被他的放肆激怒了。

Sense.DEF: based on a reasonable belief about what is likely to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: a presumptive diagnosis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推定诊断

Sense.DEF: doing something that you have no right to do and that seems rude

GramExa.PROPFORM: is it presumptuous (of sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would it be presumptuous of me to ask why you are so miserable?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是否可以冒昧地问一下你为什么如此痛苦呢？

Sense.DEF: to depend on something that is believed to exist or to be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea of heaven presupposes the existence of God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天堂的说法首先认定了上帝的存在。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your argument presupposes that Dickens was a social reformer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个论点的前提是: 狄更斯是一位社会改革者。

Sense.DEF: to have to happen if something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without struggle there can be no progress, and struggle presupposes winners and losers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有斗争就没有进步﹐而有斗争就必有胜负。

Sense.DEF: something that you think is true, although you have no proof

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hick’s presupposition is that all religions believe in the same God.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希克的假设是所有宗教都信奉同一个神。

Sense.DEF: when you think something is true even though you have no proof
pre-tax profits or losses are the profits or losses of a company before tax has been taken away
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pre-tax profits fell 26.6% to £3.1 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税前利润310万英镑﹐下降了26.6%。

Sense.DEF: relating to or made for children who are 11 or 12 years old
Sense.TRAN: 十一二岁儿童的﹔为十一二岁儿童制作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: preteen clothing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十一二岁儿童穿的服装

Sense.DEF: a way of behaving which is intended to make people believe something that is not true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pretence that the old system could be made to work
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假装旧体制还能运行起来

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pretence at seriousness
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假装严肃
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tollitt made no pretense of being surprised.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托利特没有装出吃惊的样子来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How long are you going to keep up the pretence of being ill?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你装病还要装多久呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Abandoning any pretense at politeness, they ran for the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们抛下虚伪的礼节﹐直奔门口。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John waited for her under the pretence of tying his shoelaces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰假装系鞋带等着她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was all an elaborate pretence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切都是精心的伪装。

Sense.DEF: without telling the truth about yourself or your intentions
Sense.TRAN: 以欺诈手段﹐以虚假的借口
Sense.EXAMPLE: You brought me here under false pretences!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用借口把我骗到了这里！

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb pretend are. 本图表所示为动词pretend构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to behave as if something is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can’t go on pretending that everything is OK.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能继续佯装一切都没问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s pretend we’re on the moon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们假装自己是在月球上吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pretended not to notice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她假装没有注意到。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not asleep – he’s just pretending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他并没睡着﹐不过是装睡而已。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To pretend ignorance of the situation would be irresponsible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装作不知情是不负责任的做法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t marry her and to pretend otherwise would be wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不可以娶她﹐装作娶她无妨是不对的。

Sense.DEF: to claim that something is true, when it is not
Sense.TRAN: 声称〔不真实的事为真实〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t pretend I understand these technical terms. I admit I do not understand them
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能妄称懂得这些专业术语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book doesn’t pretend to be for beginners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书没说是给初学者看的。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately behave as though something is true when it is not, either for fun or to deceive someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mark closed his eyes and pretended to be asleep.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克闭上眼睛假装睡着。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She shouted but he pretended that he hadn’t heard her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大声叫喊,但他假装没听见。

Exponent.DEF: to pretend that something is true, in order to avoid doing something or to deceive someone
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为避免做某事或骗人〕假装,假称
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to go, so I made out I was busy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想去,所以就装作很忙的样子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She always makes out that she doesn’t have any money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是假装身无分文。

Exponent.DEF: to be pretending to be ill, hurt etc, especially in order to avoid doing something, or to make other people feel sympathy for you
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤为避免做某事或博取他人同情〕假装〔生病﹑疼痛等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s not really upset, she’s just putting it on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并非真的不开心,只是装样子而已。

Exponent.DEF: to pretend that you are interested, surprised etc
Exponent.TRAN: 装成有兴趣/吃惊/无知/生病等
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh really!’ he said, trying to feign interest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “哦,真的吗？”他努力假装感兴趣地说。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sometimes it’s best just to feign ignorance pretend that you do not know.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候最好是装不懂。

Exponent.DEF: to pretend that your life is happy and successful, especially when you have suffered some kind of trouble or loss
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤在遭遇困难或损失时〕装门面,撑场面
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Although we were poor, our family always tried to keep up appearances.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们家虽穷,但总是想要装门面。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She did her best to keep up appearances after her husband left her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫弃她而去后她拼命撑着面子不说。

Sense.DEF: imaginary or not real - used especially by children
Sense.TRAN: 假装的﹐想象的﹐假想的〔尤为儿语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sang songs around a pretend campfire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们围在假想的营火旁唱歌。

Sense.DEF: something that is pretended appears to be real but is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes widened in pretended astonishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼睛瞪得大大的﹐假装很吃惊。

Sense.DEF: someone who claims to have a right to be king, leader etc, when this is not accepted by many people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pretender to the English throne
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 觊觎英国王位者

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
pretence
an attempt to seem more important, more intelligent, or of a higher class than you really are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lilith resented Adam’s pretensions to superiority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利莉思十分厌恶亚当自命不凡的架势。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the humbleness and lack of pretension of Jordan’s cafe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔丹的咖啡馆的朴实和低调

Sense.DEF: a claim to be or do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group don’t have any pretensions to be pop stars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个组合从未标榜自己是流行乐坛的明星。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a large village with pretensions to the status of a small town
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以小镇自诩的大村庄

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is pretentious, they try to seem more important, intelligent, or high class than they really are in order to be impressive
Sense.TRAN: 自以为是的﹐自我炫耀的﹐矫饰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pretentious film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矫饰的电影

Sense.DEF: the tense or verb form that expresses a past action or condition
beyond what is usual or normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt possessed of a preternatural strength and fearlessness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到自己拥有异乎寻常的力量和勇气。

Sense.DEF: strange, mysterious, and unnatural
Sense.TRAN: 奇特的﹔神秘的﹔超自然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the preternatural green light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神秘的绿光

Sense.DEF: a false reason given for an action, in order to hide the real reason

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The incident provided the pretext for war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个事件成了战争的借口。

GramExa.PROPFORM: on/under the pretext of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom called at her apartment on the pretext of asking for a book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆借口要一本书去了她的公寓。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He left immediately on the pretext that he had a train to catch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他借口要赶火车马上就离开了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll phone on some pretext or other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他会以这样或那样的理由打电话的。

Sense.DEF: to change something with the intention of making it more attractive, but often with the effect of spoiling it
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to prettify the harbour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美化港口的努力

Sense.DEF: fairly or more than a little
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m pretty sure he’ll say yes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相当肯定他会同意的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She still looks pretty miserable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去还是非常痛苦。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually avoid pretty and use fairly instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们一般避免使用 pretty ,而是用 fairly
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The consequences of this are fairly obvious.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事的后果显而易见。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinner at Luigi’s sounds pretty good to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到路易吉餐厅吃饭我看很不错嘛。

Sense.DEF: almost completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hit the ball pretty well exactly where he wanted it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他击球很棒﹐差不多指哪儿打哪儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guard left us pretty much alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看守几乎没来打扰我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re all pretty much the same.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们全都差不多。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The shock of Pat’s death pretty near killed Roy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特去世的打击让罗伊几乎痛不欲生。

Sense.DEF: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pretty little girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的小姑娘
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria looks much prettier with her hair cut short.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚把头发剪短好看多了。

Sense.DEF: something that is pretty is pleasant to look at or listen to but is not impressive
Sense.TRAN: 好看的﹐好听的﹐悦目的﹐悦耳的〔但未达到令人心动的程度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pretty dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的裙子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tune is pretty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曲调很好听。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a pretty little garden!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多漂亮的小花园！

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant to look at - sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 不堪入目〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a night’s drinking, Al was not a pretty sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝了一晚上的酒﹐阿尔已经不成人样了。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that someone is intelligent, when people think this is surprising
Sense.TRAN: 不仅相貌好﹐不只脸蛋漂亮〔幽默用法﹐用于表示某人聪明〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not just a pretty face, you know!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要知道﹐我可不光是脸蛋漂亮！

Sense.DEF: used to say that a very bad situation has developed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things have come to a pretty pass, if you can’t say what you think without causing a fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有话直说就一定会引起争吵﹐那就不妙了。

Sense.DEF: to cost a lot of money
very pretty
a hard salty type of bread baked in the shape of a stick or a loose knot
if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I admired the creativity which prevailed among the young writers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我钦佩青年作家普遍具有的那种创造力。

Sense.DEF: if a person, idea, or principle prevails in a fight, argument etc, they are successful in the end
Sense.EXAMPLE: Justice will prevail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正义终将获胜。

GramExa.GLOSS: a sensible decision is made
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He considered lying, but then common sense prevailed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想过要说谎﹐不过后来理智还是占了上风。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your inner strength will enable you to prevail over life’s obstacles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内心的力量将促使你战胜生活中的困难。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone

GramExa.PROPFORM: prevail on/upon sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She prevailed upon her father to say nothing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说服父亲保持缄默。

Sense.DEF: existing or accepted in a particular place or at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prevailing mood of public opinion remained hostile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众仍普遍持敌对情绪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prevailing economic conditions in Northern Ireland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北爱尔兰普遍的经济状况

Sense.DEF: a wind that blows over a particular area most of the time
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某一地区大部分时间常刮的〕盛行风

Sense.DEF: common at a particular time, in a particular place, or among a particular group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Solvent abuse is especially prevalent among younger teenagers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸胶毒在十三四岁的少年中尤其普遍。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the prevalent belief in astrology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对占星术的普遍相信

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the prevalence of deafness in older age groups
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人普遍耳聋的现象

Sense.DEF: to try to hide the truth by not answering questions directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m not sure,’ he prevaricated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不肯定。”他支支吾吾道。

Sense.DEF: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His back injury may prevent him from playing in tomorrow’s game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 背伤可能让他明天不能参赛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We were prevented from entering the site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被阻止进入现场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Every one of these deaths is preventable.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些死亡事件中﹐每一宗都是可以预防的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say stop sb/sth (from) doing sth rather than prevent sb/sth (from) doing sth .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 stop sb/sth (from) doing sth ,而不说 prevent sb/sth (from) doing sth
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This barrier is to stop people from coming in without a ticket.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这道栅栏是用来防止无票的人进入。

Sense.EXAMPLE: preventative measures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预防措施

Sense.DEF: when something bad is stopped from happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Educating new drivers is important for the prevention of accidents .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育新司机对于预防事故很重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Effective crime prevention must be our main goal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有效预防犯罪必须是我们的主要目标。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a fire prevention officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防官员
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know what they say, prevention is better than cure it is better to stop something bad from happening than to remove the problem once it has happened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正所谓预防胜于治疗。

Sense.DEF: intended to stop something you do not want to happen, such as illness, from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: preventive health programs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预防性的保健计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: While travelling abroad, take preventive measures to avoid illness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在国外旅行时﹐要采取预防措施以免患病。

Sense.DEF: a system in which people who are guilty of many crimes are kept in prison for a long time
treatment, advice, and health education that is designed to prevent disease happening rather than cure it
happening before a child has learned to speak
Sense.TRAN: 〔幼儿〕获得语言能力前的﹐开口说话前的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pre-verbal stages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开口说话前的阶段

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you can see a film, play, painting etc before it is shown to the public

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sneak preview of the new fashions for autumn
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 秋季新时装的内部预展

Sense.EXAMPLE: the press preview of the show when people who write for newspapers, television etc could see it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该节目的媒体试映

Sense.DEF: a description of a film, television programme, show etc that people will be able to see soon
to see or describe something before it is shown to the public
Sense.TRAN: 预看﹔为〔影视节目〕写预评
Sense.EXAMPLE: Journalists will be able to preview the exhibition tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻记者明天将可以参观预展。

Sense.DEF: to show or perform something before it is shown to the public
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band will preview their new album on 2nd March.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该乐队将于3月2日预演他们新专辑中的曲目。

Sense.DEF: having happened or existed before the event, time, or thing that you are talking about now
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve met him before on two previous occasions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前见过他两次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has two children from a previous marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在前一次婚姻中生了两个孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any previous experience of this type of work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你以前有过此类工作的经验吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lawyer told the judge that Kennedy had no previous convictions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师告诉法官肯尼迪没有犯罪前科。

Sense.DEF: the one that came immediately before the one you are talking about now
Sense.TRAN: 前一天/前一章/前一个主人等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had met them the previous day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前一天我和他们见过面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: as we said in the previous chapter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如我们在前一章所说
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees had been planted by the previous owner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些树是前一位主人栽种的。

Sense.DEF: before a particular time or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were almost no women MPs previous to 1945.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1945 年以前几乎没有女议员。

Sense.DEF: before now or before a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Almost half the group had previously been heavy smokers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该群体中近一半人以前烟瘾都很大。

GramExa.GLOSS: two days, three years etc before
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Six months previously he had smashed up his car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六个月以前他撞毁了自己的汽车。

Sense.DEF: happening or existing before a war, especially the Second World War
Sense.TRAN: 战前的〔尤指第二次世界大战之前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: pre-war Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战前的英国

Sense.DEF: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
Sense.TRAN: 被〔其他动物〕捕食的动物﹐猎物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiger stalking its prey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

Sense.DEF: a bird or animal which lives by killing and eating other animals
if someone falls prey to someone or something bad, they are harmed or affected by them
Sense.TRAN: 受某人/某事物所伤害［影响］
Sense.EXAMPLE: Street children in this part of the world often fall prey to drug dealers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地方的街头流浪儿童常常落入毒贩的魔掌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are prey to nameless fears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们陷入莫名的恐惧中。

Subsense.DEF: someone who can easily be deceived or harmed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was easy prey for the two conmen who called at his house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻易地上了两个登门骗子的当。

Subsense.DEF: an animal which is easily caught by another
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fish at the surface of the water are easy prey for eagles.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游在水面的鱼很容易成为老鹰的猎物。

Sense.DEF: if an animal or bird preys on another animal or bird, it hunts and eats it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cats prey on birds and mice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

Sense.DEF: to try to deceive or harm weaker people
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious cults that specialize in preying on young people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专门以年轻人为目标的邪教

Sense.DEF: to make someone worry continuously
Sense.TRAN: 使某人苦恼不已﹐折磨某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident has been preying on my mind all week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次事故把我折磨得整个星期都惴惴不安。

Sense.DEF: a present
the amount of money you have to pay for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The price of fuel keeps going up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃料价格持续上涨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We agreed on a price for the bike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谈妥了那辆自行车的价格。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Supermarkets often offer you two products for the price of one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 超市经常买一送一。

Crossrefto.REFHWD: asking price , cost price , list price , market price thesaurus cost

Sense.DEF: something unpleasant that you must suffer in order to be successful, free etc, or that you suffer because of a mistake or bad action
Sense.TRAN: 〔成功﹑自由﹑错误﹑不良行为等的〕代价

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s never at home, but that’s the price of success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从不在家﹐但那就是成功的代价。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The awful boat journey was a small price to pay for freedom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在小船上的这段行程可谓胆战心惊﹐但这是为换取自由而付出的小小代价。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They may pay a high price for their few years of glory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了短短几年的辉煌﹐他们也许要付出高昂的代价。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country will pay a heavy price for the government’s failure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家将为政府的这一失败付出沉重的代价。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was finally made senior executive, but at what price !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于爬上了高层主管的位置﹐不过代价何等惨烈啊！

Sense.DEF: used to talk about half the usual price of something, or the actual usual price
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bought these jeans at half price in the sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在特卖的时候以半价买了这条牛仔裤。

Sense.DEF: for a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can get goat’s cheese at the local delicatessen – at a price!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在当地的熟食店买到山羊干酪——不过价格很高！

Sense.DEF: whatever the cost and difficulties may be
Sense.TRAN: 不惜任何代价﹐无论如何
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was determined to have a child at any price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决心不惜任何代价都要生一个孩子。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you would not do something, even for a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 无论多少钱也不干﹔无论如何不
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, that painting’s not for sale at any price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐那幅画无论多少钱都不卖。

Sense.DEF: to give something a financial value
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t put a price on what a mother does for her children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能用金钱来衡量母亲为自己孩子的付出。

Sense.DEF: used to suggest that something was not worth achieving because too many bad things have happened as a result
Sense.TRAN: 名声/荣耀等又有什么用？〔指代价太大〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What price progress?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进步了又如何？

Sense.DEF: to be extremely valuable or important
Sense.TRAN: 是无价之宝﹔极其珍贵﹔极其重要

Sense.DEF: a reward for catching or killing someone
Sense.TRAN: 悬赏缉拿[杀死]某人的赏金

Sense.DEF: used to say that you can persuade people to do anything if you give them what they want
Sense.TRAN: 人各有其价〔指人都是可以收买的〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: House prices in the UK are very high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的房价很高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: With such low prices, there are lots of eager buyers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格这么低,许多人踊跃购买。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not too high
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The price was reasonable for such good food.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么好的食物,价格很公道。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I am sure we can agree on a fair price.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信我们可以达成一个公平的价格。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely high
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many fans paid astronomical prices for their tickets.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多粉丝花高价购买门票。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: much too high
Collocate.EXAMPLE: £10,000 seemed an exorbitant price for the rug.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块小地毯要价一万英镑也太离谱了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A poor harvest led to higher food prices.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 歉收导致食品价格上涨。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quite high
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you get a good price for your car?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那车拿到好价钱了吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: much lower than usual
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We sell quality cars at bargain prices.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们特价出售优质汽车。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the price of something on a market at a particular time
the amount of money that someone is asking for when they are selling something, especially a house
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 要价,开价,报价〔尤指房屋〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the price that someone pays when they buy something, especially a house
the price that the public pays for something in a shop
the price that a business such as a shop pays to buy something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When supplies go down, prices tend to go up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 供货减少时,价格往往就会上涨。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In real terms, the price of clothes has fallen over the last ten years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际上,服装价格在过去10年里下降了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: increases quickly by a large amount
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The price of oil soared in the 1970s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪70年代石油价格急剧上涨。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: keep going up and down
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Gas prices have continued to fluctuate in recent months.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 近几个月来油价持续波动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Manufacturers have had to put their prices up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造商只得抬高价格。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company recently cut the price of its best-selling car.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司最近降低了最畅销款汽车的价格。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: reduce it by a very large amount
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many carpet stores have slashed prices to bring in customers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多地毯商店大幅削价以吸引顾客。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: decide on it, sometimes illegally with others
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Publishers are not permitted to fix prices with one another.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 出版商不得串通定价。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be paid a particular amount for something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 得到好的/合理的等价格

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be sold for a particular amount of money

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Consumers are facing more fuel price rises.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者面临燃料价格的进一步上涨。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Holiday sales were down, even with drastic price cuts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然大幅减价,节日销量还是有所下降。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when prices are kept at the same level by a company or by the government

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Poor demand led to a sharp drop in prices.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 需求疲软导致价格急剧下跌。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sharp rise in wholesale food prices will have to be passed onto customers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品批发价的急剧上涨将不得不被转嫁给顾客。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when saying that someone can/cannot afford to pay for something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 价格在／超出某人的承受范围
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, there was nothing in our price range.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 可惜的是﹐没有一样是我们买得起的。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a convenient price’. Say 而要说 a reasonable price or 或 a fair price .

Sense.DEF: to decide the price of something that is for sale
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reasonably priced apartment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定价合理的公寓

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tickets are priced at £75 each.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门票价格定为每张75英镑。

Sense.DEF: to put the price on goods to show how much they cost
to compare the prices of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent Saturday morning pricing microwaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六上午我们比较了各种微波炉的价钱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: price yourself out of the market
Sense.DEF: to demand too much money for the services or goods that you are selling
a system in which the government decides the prices of things
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府实行的〕价格管制﹐物价控制

Sense.DEF: a system in which the government decides the prices of things
an agreement between producers and sellers of a product to set its price at a high level
a list of particular goods and services and how much their prices change each month
extremely valuable
Sense.EXAMPLE: priceless antiques
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其贵重的古董

Sense.DEF: a quality or skill that is priceless is extremely important or useful
Sense.TRAN: 〔品质或技能〕极其重要的﹐极其有用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ability to motivate people is a priceless asset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够激励人们是难能可贵的优点。

Sense.DEF: extremely funny or silly
Sense.TRAN: 极其可笑的﹔极其愚蠢的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The look on his face was priceless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上的表情极为可笑。

Sense.DEF: a list of prices for things being sold
a system in which the government keeps the price of a product at a particular level by giving the producer money or buying the product itself
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府以给制造商补贴﹑收购等形式给予的〕价格支持﹐物价补贴

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper with a price on it that is attached to something in a shop
the amount that something costs
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to put a price tag on such a project say how much it costs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难确定这样的项目耗资多少。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which several companies reduce the prices of what they sell, because they are all trying to get the most customers
expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clothes are beautiful but very pricey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些衣服很漂亮﹐不过价格很贵。

Sense.DEF: the act of deciding the price of something that you sell
Sense.EXAMPLE: a competitive pricing policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有竞争力的定价策略

Sense.DEF: to make a small hole in something using something sharp
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prick the sausages before you grill them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤之前把香肠戳孔。

GramExa.GLOSS: accidentally make a hole in your skin
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had pricked her finger on a rose thorn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被玫瑰花刺扎破了手指。

Sense.DEF: if something pricks a part of your body, or if it pricks, you feel small sharp pains
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔身体的某个部位〕感到刺痛
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angry tears pricked her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒的泪水刺痛了她的双眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a curious pricking sensation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种不寻常的刺痛感

Sense.DEF: if something pricks someone’s conscience or their conscience pricks them, they feel guilty or ashamed
Sense.TRAN: 使某人的良心受到谴责﹐使某人的良心不安
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her conscience pricked her as she told the lie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她撒谎的时候良心很不安。

Sense.DEF: if an animal pricks up its ears, it raises them to listen to a sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rabbit stopped suddenly, pricking up its ears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只兔子突然停下来﹐竖起耳朵听。

Sense.DEF: if you prick up your ears or your ears prick up, you listen carefully because you have heard something interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jay pricked up his ears when I mentioned a vacation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提到假期时﹐杰伊竖起耳朵来仔细倾听。

Sense.DEF: to place young plants in soil after you have grown them from seed
a very offensive word for a stupid unpleasant man

a
penis

Subsense.DEF: a slight pain you get when something sharp goes into your skin
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t feel the prick of the needle.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉不到针的刺痛。

Subsense.DEF: an act of pricking something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Give the sausages a prick.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在香肠上扎孔。

Sense.DEF: a sudden slight feeling you get when you are unhappy about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a prick of resentment when she saw them together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他们在一起﹐她心里一阵愤愤不平。

Sense.DEF: an uncomfortable feeling that you have done something wrong
a long thin sharp point on the skin of some animals or the surface of some plants
if you feel a prickle of fear, anger, or excitement, you feel slightly afraid, angry, or excited in a way that makes your skin feel slightly cold and uncomfortable
Sense.TRAN: 〔因恐惧﹑愤怒或兴奋带来的〕发麻感﹐刺痛感

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt a prickle of fear as she realized that she was alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她意识到自己是孤单一人﹐吓得她头皮发麻。

Sense.DEF: if something prickles your skin, it makes it sting slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cold breeze prickled his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵冷风刺痛了他的脸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His hair prickled my neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头发扎疼了我的脖子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He felt sweat prickle on his forehead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得汗水刺痛了自己的额头。

Sense.DEF: if your skin prickles, it begins to sting slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her skin was prickling uncomfortably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得皮肤有刺痛感﹐很不舒服。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes prickle, they sting slightly because you are going to cry
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt her eyes prickle. ‘It was awful,’ she whispered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得眼里一阵难受。“太糟糕了。”她低声说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My eyes prickled with tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泪水刺痛了我的眼睛。

Sense.DEF: if you prickle, you feel slightly angry, excited, or afraid
Sense.TRAN: 感到有点生气[兴奋﹐恐惧]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The thought of meeting him made her prickle with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要和他见面﹐她有点兴奋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt herself prickle become angry at his tone of voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己有些讨厌他的语调。

Sense.DEF: covered with thin sharp points
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plant with prickly leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长有多刺叶子的植物

Sense.DEF: if your skin feels prickly, it stings slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: His skin felt painful and prickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的皮肤有刺痛感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The base of my neck was prickly with sweat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的脖子根出了汗﹐觉得刺痛。

Sense.DEF: something that is prickly makes your skin sting slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prickly woollen sweater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扎人的毛衣

Sense.DEF: someone who is prickly gets annoyed or offended easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was prickly and sharp with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爱生气﹐对我又尖刻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As she got older, she became more prickly and forgetful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着年龄的增长﹐她变得越来越容易动怒﹐也越来越健忘。

Sense.DEF: a prickly subject causes a lot of disagreements and difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: We finally turned to the prickly question of who was going to pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我们谈到了这个棘手的问题——谁来付钱。

Sense.DEF: a skin condition in which you get uncomfortable red spots on your skin. Prickly heat is caused by too much strong sun on your skin.

a type of
cactus
that has yellow flowers and red fruit. The fruit is also called a prickly pear.

another spelling of
pricey
a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wore his medals with pride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自豪地戴着奖章。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He takes great pride in his children’s achievements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为儿女的成就感到非常骄傲。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The people have a sense of pride in their community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对自己的社区有一种自豪感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His heart swelled with pride when his daughter came in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女儿进来时他的内心充满了自豪感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt a glow of pride when her name was announced for the prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣布她获奖时她感到非常自豪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Success in sport is a source of national pride .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育方面的成就可以激发民族自豪感。

Sense.DEF: a feeling that you like and respect yourself and that you deserve to be respected by other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It hurt his pride when his wife left him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子离开了他﹐这伤害了他的自尊。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I think that getting a job would give him his pride back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为找份工作可以让他重拾自尊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t try to hide her anger and injured pride .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并没有试图掩饰自己的愤怒和受伤的自尊心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a matter of pride for some men that their wives don’t have to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对某些男人来说妻子无需工作是关乎自尊的事。

Sense.DEF: a belief that you are better than other people and do not need their help or support

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His pride wouldn’t allow him to ask for help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的自尊心不允许他向别人求助。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She ought to swallow her pride ignore or forget her feelings of pride and call him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她应该放下架子给他打电话。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take pride in your work/appearance etc
Sense.DEF: to do something very carefully and well, in a way that gives you a lot of satisfaction
Sense.TRAN: 对工作/外貌等感到自豪
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should take more pride in your work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该对工作多一点自豪感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took great pride in her appearance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的外貌引以为傲。

Sense.DEF: a person or thing that someone is very proud of
Sense.TRAN: 某人引以为傲的人[事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: His garden is his pride and joy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园是他的骄傲。

Subsense.DEF: the thing or person that the people in a particular place are most proud of
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wigan’s rugby team was the pride of the town.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威根的橄榄球队是该镇的骄傲。

Subsense.DEF: the best thing in a group
Subsense.TRAN: 某类事物中最令人骄傲之物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful Japanese sword that is the pride of our collection
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把漂亮的日本刀 —— 我们最引以为豪的藏品

Sense.DEF: if something has or takes pride of place, it is put in the best place for people to see because it is the thing you are most proud of
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large photograph of the children had pride of place on the sitting room wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起居室墙上最显眼的位置挂着一张孩子们的大幅照片。

Sense.DEF: a group of lions
Sense.EXAMPLE: A young lion had strayed some distance from the pride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一只幼狮走散﹐离开狮群有一段距离。

Sense.DEF: to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have
Sense.TRAN: 以（做）某事而自豪﹐对某事物感到得意
Sense.EXAMPLE: a restaurant that prides itself on speed of service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以服务速度为骄傲的餐馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: She prides herself on being a good listener.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为自己善于倾听而感到自豪。

Sense.DEF: someone who is specially trained to perform religious duties and ceremonies in the Christian church
a man with religious duties and responsibilities in some non-Christian religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教之外一些宗教的〕教士﹐祭司﹐神职人员

Sense.DEF: a woman with religious duties and responsibilities in some non-Christian religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教之外一些宗教的〕女教士﹐女祭司﹐女神职人员

Sense.DEF: if someone is in the priesthood, they are a Christian priest
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教〕牧师[神父]的职位[工作]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is celebrating 30 years in the priesthood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在庆祝自己从事神职工作30年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been a decline in the number of people joining the priesthood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投身为神职人员的人数减少了。

Sense.DEF: all the priests of a particular religion or country
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一宗教或国家的〕全体神职人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to reduce the influence of the priesthood in the country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 削弱国内神职人员影响力的努力

Sense.DEF: like a priest, or relating to a priest
Sense.EXAMPLE: priestly robes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师袍

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a morally good way and shows that they disapprove of the way other people behave - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 一本正经的人﹐道学先生〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a prig! It’s only a bit of harmless fun!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么一本正经！只是无伤大雅的玩笑而已！

Sense.DEF: very formal and careful in the way you speak and behave, and easily shocked by anything rude
Sense.TRAN: 一本正经的﹐拘谨的﹐古板的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked prim and nervous in her best hat and coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她戴着最好的帽子并穿着最好的外套﹐显得拘谨不安。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very prim and proper young lady
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相当古板正经的年轻女子

Sense.DEF: prim clothes are neat and formal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prim suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套正装

Sense.DEF:
the main woman dancer in a group of
ballet
dancers
Sense.TRAN: 〔芭蕾舞团的〕主要[首席]女演员

Sense.DEF: if someone or something has primacy, they are the best or most important person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the primacy of the family
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭至上

Sense.EXAMPLE: We must give primacy to education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须以教育为本。

Sense.DEF:
the most important woman singer in an
opera
company
someone who thinks that they are very good at what they do, and demands a lot of attention and praise from other people
Sense.TRAN: 自以为了不起的人﹐妄自尊大的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: In my view, football players are a bunch of over-paid prima donnas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我看来﹐足球运动员是一帮收入过高﹑妄自尊大的家伙。

Sense.DEF:
a British spelling of
primeval
based on what seems to be true when you first consider a situation, even though it may later be proved to be untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: prima facie evidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表面证据
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prima facie case of professional misconduct
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 初步认定的玩忽职守案件

Sense.DEF: primal feelings or actions seem to belong to a part of people’s character that is ancient and animal-like
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primal fear of the unknown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对未知事物的本能恐惧

Sense.DEF: mainly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

Sense.DEF: most important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their primary objective is to make money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的主要目标是赚钱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Personal safety is of primary importance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人身安全至关重要。

Sense.DEF: relating to the education of children between 5 and 11 years old
Sense.TRAN: 小学教育的﹐初级教育的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primary teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名小学老师
Sense.EXAMPLE: primary education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学教育
Sense.EXAMPLE: teaching at primary level
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学程度教学

Sense.DEF: happening or developing before other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primary tumour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期肿瘤
Sense.EXAMPLE: Counselling was given as a primary therapy for depression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理咨询是抑郁症的初步疗法。

Sense.DEF: a primary election
a primary school

basic medical treatment that you receive from a doctor who is not a
specialist
Sense.TRAN: 〔非专科医生的〕初级保健护理﹐初诊治疗﹐初级治疗
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primary care physician a doctor who provides primary care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 初级保健医生

Sense.DEF: one of the three colours red, yellow, and blue, which you can mix together to make any of the other colours
Sense.TRAN: 原色﹐基色〔指红﹑黄﹑蓝三色〕

Sense.DEF:
an election in the US at which people vote to decide who will be a party’s
candidate
for a political position in the main election
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国政党内推举候选人的〕初选

Sense.DEF: the medical care that someone receives first when they become ill or have an accident
a school for children between 5 and 11 years old in England and Wales
Sense.TRAN: 〔英格兰和威尔士5至11岁儿童上的〕小学

Sense.DEF: a document, book etc that contains information that has been obtained from people’s experiences and not taken from other documents, books etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过实验﹑访谈等获得的〕第一手材料﹐直接资料

Sense.DEF: the strongest force that is put on a part of a long word when you say it, like the force given to ‘pri’ in ‘primary’. It is shown in this dictionary by the mark (').
a member of the group of animals that includes humans and monkeys
Sense.TRAN: 灵长目动物〔包括人﹑猴子等〕

Sense.DEF: the most important priest in a country, especially in the Church of England
most important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is the prime cause of lung disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽烟是引发肺部疾病的首要原因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our prime concern is providing jobs for all young school leavers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的头等大事是为所有的年轻毕业生提供工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was named as the prime suspect in the murder investigation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那宗谋杀案的调查中他被定为主要嫌疑人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good management is of prime importance in business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的经营管理在商业领域尤为重要。

Sense.DEF: of the very best quality or kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: prime rib of beef
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上等牛肋排
Sense.EXAMPLE: prime agricultural land
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肥沃的农田
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is in a prime location overlooking the valley.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家宾馆位置极佳﹐可以俯瞰山谷。

Sense.DEF: to be the person or thing that is most suitable or most likely to be chosen for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 是（某事物的）首选／头号目标
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school is a prime candidate for closure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校最有可能关闭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Old people are a prime target for thieves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人是窃贼的首选目标。

Sense.DEF: a very typical example of something
Sense.TRAN: 非常典型的例子﹐有代表性的例证
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blakey Hall is a prime example of a 19th-century building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布莱基庄园是19世纪建筑的典型。

Sense.DEF: the time in your life when you are strongest and most active

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s now 40 and still in her prime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前她年已四十﹐依然风华正茂。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He is now past his prime .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在已过壮年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man in the prime of life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个正当盛年的男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young singer who was tragically cut off in her prime died while she was in her prime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸英年早逝的女歌手

Sense.DEF: to prepare someone for a situation so that they know what to do
Sense.TRAN: 使准备好〔应付某一情况〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you prime her with what to say?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你事先提醒她要说些什么了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had a shower and primed himself for action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冲了个淋浴﹐准备行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had been primed to say nothing about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人事先关照过他﹐叫他什么也别说。

Sense.DEF: to prepare a gun or bomb so that it can fire or explode
Sense.TRAN: 为〔枪炮〕装火药﹔为〔炸弹等〕装雷管

Sense.DEF: to put a special layer of paint on a surface, in order to prepare it for the next layer
Sense.EXAMPLE: All metal surfaces will have to be primed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有金属表面都必须打上底漆。

Sense.DEF: to encourage a business, industry, or activity to develop by putting money or effort into it
Sense.TRAN: 投资[投入人力]以促进某企业[行业等]的发展

Sense.DEF: to pour water into a water pump in order to make it ready to work
the most important minister and leader of the government in some countries which have a parliament
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British Prime Minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国首相
Sense.EXAMPLE: He first became prime minister in 1982.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他于1982年首次担任首相。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Prime Minister of Turkey
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 土耳其总理

Sense.DEF: someone who helps to make something happen and has great influence in the way it develops

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was a prime mover in the bid to get better pay for West Indian cricketers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是为西印度板球运动员争取更高报酬的倡导者。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was a prime mover of social change in the 19th century.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是19世纪社会变革的中坚分子。

Sense.DEF: a way of referring to God
Sense.TRAN: 造物主〔对上帝的一种称呼〕

Sense.DEF: a number that can be divided only by itself and the number one. For example, three and seven are prime numbers.
paint that you put on the surface of wood, metal etc before you put on the main layer of paint
a tube that contains explosive and is used to fire a gun or explode a bomb
a book that contains basic information about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a primer on Italian wines
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利葡萄酒入门指南
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a primer of good management techniques
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理良策浅谈

Sense.DEF: a school book that contains very basic facts about a subject
the lowest rate of interest at which companies can borrow money from a bank
Sense.TRAN: 〔银行给公司提供的〕优惠贷款利率﹐最低贷款利率

Sense.DEF: the time in the evening when the largest number of people are watching television
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视的〕黄金时间﹐收视高峰时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prime time entertainment programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄金时间播放的娱乐节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: prime time television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄金时段的电视
Sense.EXAMPLE: prime time audiences
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高峰时段的电视观众
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speech that was broadcast live during prime time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄金收视时间直播的演讲

Sense.DEF: belonging to the earliest time in the existence of the universe or the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Primeval clouds of gas formed themselves into stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原生气团形成了恒星。

Sense.DEF: very ancient
Sense.EXAMPLE: primeval forests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始森林

Sense.DEF: primeval feelings are very strong and seem to come from a part of people’s character that is ancient and animal-like
Sense.EXAMPLE: the primeval urge to reproduce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁殖的本能欲望

Sense.DEF: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primitive society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始社会
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primitive nomadic tribe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始的游牧部落
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tools used by primitive man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始人所用的工具
Sense.EXAMPLE: primitive art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始艺术

Sense.DEF: something that is primitive is very simple and does not have the extra modern parts that would make it faster, better, more comfortable etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The local hospital care is primitive and unreliable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地医院的治疗水平落后﹐靠不住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Conditions at the camp are very primitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营地条件非常简陋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primitive steam engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老式蒸汽发动机

Sense.DEF: a primitive animal or plant has a simple structure or body
Sense.EXAMPLE: primitive life-forms that live deep in the ocean
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在大洋深处的低等生物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a primitive single-celled creature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始的单细胞生物

Sense.DEF: primitive feelings are not based on reason, and seem to come from a part of people’s character that is ancient and animal-like
Sense.EXAMPLE: the primitive instinct of survival
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 求生本能
Sense.EXAMPLE: primitive desires
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始的欲望

Sense.DEF: an artist who paints simple pictures like those of a child
the system by which property that is owned by a man goes to his oldest son after his death
existing at the beginning of time or the beginning of the Earth
Sense.TRAN: 原始的﹐原始时代存在的﹔太古的﹐太初的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the primordial seas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始海洋

Sense.DEF: primordial feelings are very strong and seem to come from the part of people’s character that is ancient and animal-like
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was driven on by a primordial terror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被本能的恐惧所驱使。

Sense.DEF: the mixture of gases and other substances that people believe existed before the beginning of life on Earth
Sense.TRAN: 原生浆液〔据信地球上生命开始之前存在的气体和其他物质的混合物〕

Sense.DEF:
to make yourself look attractive by arranging your hair, putting on
make-up
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spends hours primping in front of the mirror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是花很长时间在镜子前梳妆打扮。

Sense.DEF: a small wild plant with pale yellow flowers, or the flower from this plant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of primroses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一束报春花

Sense.DEF: a pale yellow colour
a way of life that is full of pleasure but causes you harm after a period of time
a small wild or garden plant with brightly coloured flowers

a small
stove a piece of equipment for cooking
that burns oil and can be easily carried around, used especially when camping
Sense.TRAN: 普里默斯炉〔尤用于野营时的便捷式煤油炉〕

Sense.DEF: the son of a king, queen, or prince
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prince William
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉王子

Sense.DEF: a male ruler of a small country or state
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prince Rainier of Monaco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩纳哥的兰尼埃亲王

Sense.LEXUNIT: the prince of sth/a prince among sth
Sense.DEF: the man who is best at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prince of sculptors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雕塑家

Sense.DEF:
a perfect man who a young woman might dream about meeting - often used humorously. The name comes from a character who appears in various
fairy tale s
and rescues a
damsel in distress woman who is in danger
Sense.TRAN: 〔少女理想中的〕完美男子﹐白马王子〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is still waiting to find her Prince Charming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍然在等待白马王子的出现。

Sense.DEF: a title that is sometimes given to the husband of a ruling queen
a princely amount of money is very large - often used humorously to mean a very small amount of money
Sense.TRAN: 〔钱〕一大笔的〔常为幽默用法﹐意指钱很少〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My savings had now reached the princely sum of £30.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的存款现已高达30英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a far from princely salary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远算不上高的薪酬

Sense.DEF: impressive or generous
Sense.TRAN: 精美的﹔壮观的﹔堂皇的﹔慷慨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: princely buildings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宏伟的建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: A princely welcome awaited them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隆重的欢迎场面等待着他们。

Sense.DEF: belonging or relating to a prince
Sense.TRAN: 王子的﹐亲王的﹔属于王子[亲王]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a princely state
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公国[侯国]

Sense.DEF: a close female relation of a king and queen, especially a daughter
Sense.TRAN: 公主﹔国王[女王]的女性近亲
Sense.EXAMPLE: Princess Anne
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮公主

Sense.DEF: the wife of a prince
most important
Sense.TRAN: 最重要的﹐首要的﹔主要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那次旅程的首要目的是探访家人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teaching is her principal source of income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教书是她主要的收入来源。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the principal character in the book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书里的主人公

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a school
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small school with just three teachers and the principal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有三位老师和一位校长的小型学校

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a university or college
the main person in a business or organization, who can make important business decisions and is legally responsible for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The principal of the business has an office in New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的负责人在纽约有一处办公室。

Sense.DEF: the main performer in a play or in a group of musicians, dancers etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑音乐等演出的〕主角﹐主要演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: She later became a principal with the Royal Ballet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她后来成了皇家芭蕾舞团的主要演员。

Sense.DEF:
the original amount of money that is lent to someone, not including any of the
interest

the main male character in a
pantomime
, usually played by a young woman
Sense.TRAN: 〔童话剧中的〕男主角〔通常由年轻女子扮演〕

Sense.DEF: a country that is ruled by a prince
Wales
mainly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money is principally invested in stocks and shares.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱主要投资于股票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was principally a landscape painter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他主要是风景画画家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We met principally to discuss the future of the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开会主要是为了商讨学校的前途。

Sense.DEF: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got no principles at all!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毫无道德准则！
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

Sense.DEF: the basic idea that a plan or system is based on
Sense.EXAMPLE: The general principle is that education should be available to all children up to the age of 16.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的原则是﹐16 岁以下儿童都应该能接受教育。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the basic principles of business management
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 商务管理的基本原则

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the principles of French law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国法律的指导原则

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reflexology is based on the principle that specific areas on the feet correspond to different parts of the body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反射疗法所依据的原理是﹐足部特定区域对应着身体的不同部位。
