GramExa.EXAMPLE: The project worked on the principle that each person’s experience was equally valuable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目的基本原则是﹐每一个人的经验都同样宝贵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the principles behind government policies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府政策背后的原则

Sense.EXAMPLE: He called for a return to first principles the most important ideas of road safety for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呼吁回归儿童道路安全的根本原则。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Similar principles apply in the case of older children the principles are the same as others that have been mentioned .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 类似的原则也适用于年纪大些的儿童。

Subsense.DEF: if something is possible in principle, there is no good reason why it should not happen, but it has not actually happened yet
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In principle, the new software should make the accounting system a lot simpler.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从理论上说﹐这个新的软件应该能使财务系统简单许多。

Subsense.DEF: if you agree to something in principle, you agree about a general plan or idea but have not yet considered the details
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They have accepted the idea in principle.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们基本上已接受了这种观点。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government has agreed in principle to a referendum.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已基本同意进行全民公决。

Sense.DEF: a rule which explains the way something such as a machine works, or which explains a natural force in the universe
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器等或自然界的〕原理﹔定律
Sense.EXAMPLE: Archimedes’ principle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿基米德定律

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the basic principles of physics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 物理学的基本定律

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse the noun principle with the noun and adjective principal. 不要混淆名词principle和既是名词又是形容词的principal: a former principal of the college 大学前任校长 | her principal tasks 她的主要任务

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rosa is a woman of strict moral principles.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗莎是一个恪守道德准则的女人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that someone believes in very strongly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a man of strong principles
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有着坚强信念的男子

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: strong beliefs about right and wrong
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Dunn’s high principles and pleasant manner won him the real affection of his colleagues.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 邓恩高度的道德原则和亲切的举止使他赢得了同事们的真心喜爱。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Criminal law should be used to protect and reinforce moral principles.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 刑法应用来维护和加强道德准则。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Doesn’t working on Sunday conflict with your religious principles?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 难道在星期日工作没有违反你的宗教原则？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I may have no money and no power but I have principles.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我也许没钱也没权,但我有原则。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: act according to them, even when this is difficult
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Throughout this time, he stuck to his principles and spoke out against injustice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段时间里他自始至终坚持原则,公开抨击不公正现象。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do something that is against your principles
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I knew I could lie to help him, but it would be betraying my principles.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我可以撒个谎来帮他忙,可那样做违背了我的原则。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop believing in them or trying to act by them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It has been said that he abandoned his basic political principles while he was in power.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他掌权时放弃了自己基本的政治原则。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s against my principles to eat meat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃肉有违我的原则。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: because of moral beliefs about right and wrong
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As a matter of principle one should never yield to terrorism.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 永远不要向恐怖主义妥协,这是个原则问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone with strong moral ideas
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is the only candidate who has demonstrated that he is a man of principle.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是唯一一个显示出自己有道德准则的候选人。

Sense.DEF: someone who is principled has strong opinions about what is morally right and wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took a principled stand against the legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对这项立法采取坚决反对的立场。

Sense.DEF: based on clear and definite ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to reduce prison sentences in a principled way
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有原则的减刑尝试

Subsense.DEF: to produce words, numbers, or pictures on paper, using a machine which puts ink onto the surface
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I need to make a few changes before I print the document.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打印文件之前我要作些修改。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The company’s name was printed in bold letters across the top of the page.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的名称用黑体字印在页面的顶端。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a printed letter
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一封打印的信
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The printer’s switched on but it won’t print.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打印机开着﹐但是无法打印。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As a newspaper publisher he understood the power of the printed word words that are printed on paper .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为报纸出版商﹐他很清楚印刷文字的力量。

Subsense.DEF: when a computer document prints, a printed copy of it is produced
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Press return, then the document should print.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按回车键﹐文件就会打印出来。

Sense.DEF: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

Sense.DEF: to print a report of something or a letter, speech etc in a newspaper or magazine
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The Express’ was the first paper to print the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《快报》是首家刊登这一事件的报纸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The Telegraph’ has printed numerous articles on this subject over the last three years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去三年里《电讯报》已经多次刊载这个主题的文章。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wrote to the newspaper but my letter wasn’t printed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给报纸写了信﹐不过没有刊登出来。

Sense.DEF: to produce a photograph from a photographic film
Sense.EXAMPLE: It usually takes a couple of hours for the pictures to be developed and printed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冲印照片通常需要几个小时。

Sense.DEF: to decorate cloth with a pattern that is put all over its surface by a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a skirt printed with brightly coloured flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印有鲜艳花朵图案的裙子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a printed silk shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真丝印花衬衫

Sense.DEF: to write words by hand without joining the letters
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please print your name clearly in the top right-hand corner of the page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请在这页右上角用印刷体清楚地写上您的姓名。

Sense.DEF: to make a mark on a surface or in a soft substance by pressing something on to it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mark of the man’s shoe was printed in the mud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泥地上留有那名男子的鞋印。

Sense.DEF: to produce a printed copy of a computer document
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you print a copy off for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能帮我打印一份吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll print the file out and then we can look at it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会把文件打印出来﹐这样我们就可以看了。

Sense.DEF: writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

GramExa.GLOSS: printed in a book, newspaper etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It must be really exciting to see your work in print.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到自己的作品发表一定非常激动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the pleasure of seeing my name in print
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在出版物中看到我名字时的那份喜悦
Sense.EXAMPLE: Very little of his poetry actually got into print was printed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的诗作鲜有付梓。

Sense.DEF: if a book is in print, new copies of it are still being printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: After fifty years, the book is still in print.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 50 年后﹐那本书仍在印行。

Sense.DEF: if a book is out of print, it is no longer being printed and you cannot buy new copies
the letters in which something is printed
Sense.TRAN: 印出的字﹔〔印刷用的〕字体
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is also available in large print .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书也有大字版的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The print quality of the new printer is excellent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台新打印机的打印质量非常好。

Sense.DEF: the details of a legal document, which are often printed in very small writing
Sense.TRAN: 〔法律文书中的〕小字印刷条款
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always read the small print before signing anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 签署任何东西之前要先读一读小字印刷条款。

Sense.DEF: a mark that is made on a surface by something that has been pressed onto it
Sense.EXAMPLE: His feet left deep prints in the soft soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的双脚在松软的泥土上留下了深深的脚印。

Sense.DEF: the marks that are made by the pattern of lines on the ends of your fingers
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police found a set of prints on the car door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在车门上发现了一组指纹。

Sense.DEF: cloth, especially cotton, on which a coloured pattern has been printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lovely selection of floral prints
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可供选择的各种漂亮的花卉图案印花布
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a cotton print dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着一身棉布印花连衣裙。

Sense.DEF: a photograph that has been produced from a film
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you order an extra set of prints ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不多印一套照片？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a colour print
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩色照片

Subsense.DEF: a picture that is made by cutting lines onto a piece of metal or wood and then printing it onto paper
a copy of a painting that is produced by taking a photograph of it and printing it onto paper
Subsense.TRAN: 〔以照相制版制作的〕绘画复制品

Sense.DEF: suitable to be printed and read by everyone
Sense.TRAN: 可以印刷出版的﹔适合大众阅读的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her remarks were scarcely printable were very rude .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的话太粗野﹐简直不适合刊印出来。

Sense.DEF: a set of connections in a piece of electrical equipment consisting of thin lines of metal on a board
printed articles – used especially about advertisements that can be sent by post at a cheap rate
a machine which is connected to a computer and can make a printed record of computer information
Sense.EXAMPLE: a laser printer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光打印机
Sense.EXAMPLE: a colour printer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩色打印机

Sense.DEF: someone who is employed in the trade of printing
Sense.TRAN: 印刷业从业人员﹐印刷工人

Sense.DEF: the act or process of making a book, magazine etc using a machine that puts ink onto paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: the invention of printing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印刷术的发明
Sense.EXAMPLE: the printing industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印刷业
Sense.EXAMPLE: a printing error
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印刷错误

Sense.DEF: an act of printing a number of copies of a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first printing of her book was 10,000 copies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那本书首印一万册。

Sense.DEF: a method of writing when you write each letter separately rather than joining the letters of a word
a type of ink that dries very quickly and is used in printing books and newspapers etc
a machine that prints newspapers, books etc
a sheet or length of paper with printed information on it, produced by a computer
the number of books or magazines that are printed at the same time

a very small piece of
protein
that is thought to cause some brain diseases such as
bse
Sense.TRAN: 普里昂﹐蛋白感染粒﹐朊病毒〔被认为能导致疯牛病等脑病〕

Sense.DEF: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation
Sense.TRAN: 先前的﹔较早的﹔事先安排的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经委员会事先同意﹐不得作出改变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经事先协商可提供素食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

Sense.DEF: a warning or announcement made before something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The society must give customers prior notice before changing the cost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调整费用之前协会必须预先通知客户。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bomb exploded without any prior warning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有任何预先警告﹐炸弹就爆炸了。

Sense.DEF: before
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the arrangements should be completed prior to your departure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你离开之前一切都要安排好。

Sense.DEF: a person’s right to something which is considered more important than another person’s right to the same thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: His own children have a prior claim to the business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自己的孩子可以优先获得这家企业。

Sense.DEF:
the man in charge of a
priory

the priest next in rank to the person in charge of an
abbey
a previous occasion when someone was found guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: two priors for homicide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两次蓄意杀人的前科

Sense.DEF:
the woman in charge of a
priory
to put several things, problems etc in order of importance, so that you can deal with the most important ones first
Sense.TRAN: 按优先顺序列出﹔确定〔事项﹑问题等〕的优先顺序
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to prioritize your tasks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要按照轻重缓急安排自己的工作。

Sense.DEF: to deal with one thing first, because it is the most important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The public wants to see the fight against crime prioritized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众希望能把打击犯罪放在第一位。

Sense.DEF: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else
Sense.TRAN: 优先处理的事﹐当务之急
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club’s priority is to win the League.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该俱乐部首先考虑的是要赢得联赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children are our first priority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子是我们的头等大事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority very important and needing attention soon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区发生了几宗入室盗窃案以后﹐治安成了当务之急。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority not important and not needing attention soon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可用的钱这么少﹐只好暂时放下维修事宜了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The customer is high on our list of priorities .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客在我们的心目中排在第一位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: List your tasks in order of priority most important first .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照轻重缓急列出你的工作。

Sense.DEF: the right to be given attention first and before other people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Buses should have priority over other road users.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 相较于其他路面交通工具﹐公共汽车应享有优先通行权。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A young person who has finished the course will be given priority over one who has not.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 完成课程的年轻人将比没有完成的获得优先考虑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to start work on the garden but the house must take priority .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想开始整修花园﹐不过还是先得打扫屋子。

Sense.DEF: to know what is most important and needs attention first
Sense.TRAN: 分清楚事情的轻重缓急
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to get our priorities right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得分清楚轻重缓急。

Sense.DEF: before other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Members receive priority bookings and reduced ticket prices to all concerts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会员可优先预订所有音乐会的门票﹐并享受优惠票价。

Sense.DEF:
a building where a group of
monk s
or
nun s men or women living a religious life
, live, which is smaller and less important than an
abbey
one of the mental health treatment centres in the UK run by a company called the Priory Group, best known for helping rich and famous people with drug or alcohol problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕普里奥里精神保健中心〔由普里奥里集团公司经营﹐以帮助富人和名人治疗吸毒或酗酒问题而闻名〕

Sense.DEF: to move or lift something by pushing it away from something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried to prise the lid off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图把盖子撬掉。

Head.PHRVBHWD:
prise sth out of sb
also 又作
prise sth from sb

Sense.DEF: to get something such as information or money from someone when they do not want to give it to you
Sense.TRAN: 强迫〔某人〕透露信息﹔向〔某人〕索要钱财
Sense.EXAMPLE: I more or less had to prise it out of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我或多或少得逼他透露些消息。

Sense.DEF: a transparent block of glass that breaks up white light into different colours
a solid object with matching ends and several sides which are the same width all the way up

using or containing a
prism
Sense.TRAN: 使用棱镜的﹔含棱柱体的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prismatic compass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棱镜罗盘

Sense.DEF: a prismatic colour is very clear and bright

a building where people are kept as a punishment for a crime, or while they are waiting to go to court for their
trial
Sense.EXAMPLE: He visits his dad in prison every week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每周都去探望狱中的父亲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ricky has been out of prison for three years now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里基现已出狱三年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ll probably put him in prison for a long time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很可能会让他在监狱里待很长时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen was sent to prison for attacking a man with a knife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦因持刀袭击一名男子而被送入监狱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two men were arrested only a week after they were released from prison .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名男子从监狱获释后仅仅一周就被捕了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three terrorists escaped from Brixton Prison .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三名恐怖分子从布里克斯顿监狱越狱了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an increase in the number of women going to prison
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入狱女性人数的增多
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Gunn received a ten year prison sentence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冈恩先生获刑十年。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘the prison’ unless you are referring to a particular building. 如果不是确指某个监狱的建筑﹐不要说the prison: She was sent to prison. 她被送进了监狱。 | He spent five years in prison. 他坐了五年牢。 |They live opposite the prison. 他们住在监狱对面。

Sense.DEF: the system that deals with keeping people in a prison
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prison service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱管理机构
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does prison deter criminals from offending again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监禁可以制止罪犯再次犯罪吗？

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant place or situation which it is difficult to escape from
Sense.EXAMPLE: The farm felt like a prison for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座农场对她来说犹如牢笼。

Exponent.DEF: a large building where people are kept as a punishment for a crime or while they are waiting to go to court for their trial
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was sentenced to five years in prison.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判五年监禁。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Wandsworth Prison
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旺兹沃思监狱

Exponent.DEF: a prison, or a similar smaller building where prisoners are kept for a short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was taken to a cell in the Los Angeles County Jail.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被关进洛杉矶县监狱的一间牢房。

Exponent.DEF: another way of spelling jail
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He spent the night in gaol.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在拘留所里待了一夜。

Exponent.DEF: a large prison for people who are guilty of serious crimes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Ohio State Penitentiary
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄亥俄州立监狱

Exponent.DEF: an official word for a prison
Exponent.TRAN: 管教所〔监狱的正式说法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: 1,000 prisoners rioted at the North County Correctional Facility.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有1,000名囚犯在北县教养所发生暴乱。

Exponent.DEF: a place where young people who have done something illegal are kept, because they are too young to go to prison. Also used about a place where people who have entered a country illegally are kept.
Exponent.TRAN: 拘留中心,感化中心〔专门关押青少年罪犯,也用于关押非法入境者〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a juvenile detention center
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年感化中心

Exponent.DEF: a prison in which prisoners have more freedom than in an ordinary prison, usually because their crimes were less serious
a small room in a prison or police station, where someone is kept as a punishment
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a prison cell
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱里的牢房

Sense.DEF: a special prison in which prisoners of war are kept

someone who is kept in a prison as a legal punishment for a crime or while they are waiting for their
trial
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relationships between the staff and the prisoners are good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狱警和犯人相处良好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prisoners here only serve short sentences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的犯人只是短期服刑。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who is in prison waiting for their trial

Sense.EXAMPLE: The organization is arguing for the release of political prisoners people in prison because of their political opinions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该组织正在争取释放政治犯。

Sense.DEF: someone who is taken by force and kept somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The guerrillas kept her prisoner for three months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游击队员将她囚禁了三个月。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was being held prisoner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正遭囚禁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our pilot was taken prisoner .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的飞行员被抓起来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army advanced, taking 200,000 prisoners .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队向前推进﹐抓获20万名俘虏。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in a place or situation from which they cannot escape
Sense.TRAN: 难以脱离某地的人﹔无法摆脱某种状况的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is a prisoner of his own past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法摆脱自己的过去。

Sense.DEF: someone who is put in prison because of their political ideas
a soldier, member of the navy etc who is caught by the enemy during a war and kept as a prisoner
someone who visits prisoners in Britain to help them
Sense.TRAN: 〔在英国﹐探望囚犯以帮助他们的〕探监工作者

Sense.DEF: behaving very correctly and easily shocked by anything rude – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 谨小慎微的﹔一本正经的﹔拘谨的﹐刻板的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: extremely fresh or clean
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pristine white shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常干净的白衬衫

Sense.DEF: something that is pristine is in the same condition as when it was first made
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car has been restored to pristine condition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车整修后焕然一新。

Sense.DEF: not spoiled or damaged in any way
Sense.TRAN: 未受损害的﹔处于原始状态的
Sense.EXAMPLE: pristine African rainforest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲原始雨林

Sense.DEF: please
the state of being able to be alone, and not seen or heard by other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: With seven people squashed in one house, you don’t get much privacy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 七个人挤在一间房子里﹐想要独处不大可能。

Sense.DEF: the state of being free from public attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: each individual’s right to privacy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人的隐私权

Sense.DEF: for use by one person or group, not for everyone
Sense.TRAN: 私人（用）的﹔私有的﹐个人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morris has a private jet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made some notes for his private use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They objected to any form of private property .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

Sense.DEF: not related to, owned by, or paid for by the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: a private hospital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私立医院
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is private ownership of property in a market economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场经济中存在财产私有制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: private education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私立教育

GramExa.GLOSS: pay for medical treatment instead of getting it free at a public hospital

Sense.DEF: a private meeting, conversation etc involves only two people or a small number of people, and is not for other people to know about
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to have a private discussion with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得和你私下讨论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you alone? I just wanted a private word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是一个人吗？我只是想和你私下里说几句。

Sense.DEF: private feelings, information, or opinions are personal or secret and not for other people to know about
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情﹑消息或意见〕个人的﹐秘密的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack’s private opinion was that she was selfish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克个人认为她很自私。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t read that - it’s private.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别看那个——那是私人信息。

Sense.DEF: used about someone who is not known to the public or not working for the government or another organization
Sense.TRAN: 不为公众认识的﹔不任职于政府部门的﹔独立的〔相对于为某机构工作的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a private citizen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通公民
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting was sold to a private collector.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画卖给了一位私人收藏家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seven police and three private individuals needed medical attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 七名警察和三名平民需要进行治疗。

Sense.DEF: separate from and not related to your work or your official position
Sense.TRAN: 与公事无关的﹐与官职无关的﹐私人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president is paying a private visit to Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统将对欧洲进行私人访问。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He enjoys everything he does in both his professional and his private life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对工作和个人生活中的一切都感到满意。

Sense.DEF: quiet and without a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we go upstairs where it’s more private?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为什么不到楼上去呢？那里清静些。

Sense.DEF: a private person is one who likes being alone, and does not talk much about their thoughts or feelings
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢独处的﹐内向的﹐内敛的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a very private man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个很内向的人。

Sense.DEF: a joke made between friends, family members etc that other people do not understand
Sense.TRAN: 〔朋友﹑家庭成员等之间才理解的〕私人玩笑

Exponent.DEF: if something is private, you do not want most people to know about it because it concerns your feelings, your relationships etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He didn’t want to discuss his private life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不愿讨论他的私生活。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What happens in the bedroom is strictly private.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 卧室内发生的事是绝对私密的。

Exponent.DEF: relating to your private life – used especially about problems, feelings, and questions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They asked a lot of personal questions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们问了许多私人问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She talked about her own personal feelings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她讲到她的个人感情。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’d rather not talk about it – it’s personal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想谈那个,那是私事。

Exponent.DEF: used about feelings and thoughts that you do not tell anyone about
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Barclay had a secret desire to become an actor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克利私下里希望成为一名演员。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His secret fear was that Jenny would leave him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他暗自担心珍妮会离他而去。

Exponent.DEF: very private – used about things relating to your relationships and sexual feelings
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an intimate conversation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 私房话
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many people share intimate details of their lives on the Internet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人在因特网上交流私生活的细节。

Exponent.DEF: your innermost feelings, thoughts etc are your most private ones
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Counselling often encourages you to reveal your innermost thoughts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理辅导通常会鼓励你坦露自己内心深处的思想。

Exponent.DEF: if something is none of your business, it is private and you should not ask about it
Exponent.TRAN: 与某人无关,不关某人的事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s none of your business how much I earn.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挣多少钱关你什么事。

Sense.DEF: without other people being present
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to speak to you in private.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得和你单独说说。

Sense.DEF: a soldier of the lowest rank
Sense.TRAN: 列兵﹐二等兵〔级别最低的士兵〕

Sense.DEF: someone who can be employed to look for information or missing people, or to follow people and report on what they do
education which parents pay for, rather than free education provided by the government
the economic system in which private businesses are allowed to compete freely with each other, and the government does not control industry
Sense.TRAN: 私营企业制﹐民营企业制

Sense.DEF: an armed ship in the past that was not in the navy but attacked and robbed enemy ships carrying goods
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时攻击并抢夺敌人货船的〕武装民船﹐私掠船

Sense.DEF: someone who sailed on a privateer

a
private detective

a British
satirical
magazine which is known for criticizing and making jokes about famous people, and for printing stories about dishonest or embarrassing behaviour by people in public life
Sense.TRAN: 《侦探》杂志〔英国的一份讽刺性杂志﹐以批评嘲弄名人及刊登某些公众人物的不诚实行为或尴尬事而闻名〕

Sense.DEF:
money that someone gets regularly, not from working but because they own part of a business or have money which earns
interest
Sense.TRAN: 〔来自投资﹑利息等非工资性的〕私人收入

Sense.DEF:
a
private detective
the part of the law relating to ordinary people, private property, and relationships
Sense.TRAN: 〔处理私人关系及私人财产的〕私法

Sense.DEF:
a company whose shares are not bought and sold on the
stock market
and can only pass to another person with the agreement of other
shareholder s
with no one else present
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must talk to you privately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须私下和你谈谈。

Sense.DEF: if you feel or think something privately, you do not tell anyone about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura praised the pictures, though she privately thought they were rather ordinary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉称赞了那些照片﹐虽然她心里觉得它们相当普通。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Privately, Harriet had to agree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈丽雅特私下里不得不同意。

Sense.DEF: not publicly or as part of your work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Privately, senior officials agreed that not many people had voted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高官们私下认为投票的人并不多。

Sense.DEF: using or involving private rather than government institutions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both children are privately educated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个孩子接受的都是私立教育。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a privately-owned company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私营公司

Sense.DEF: the system in which medical treatment and advice is not provided by the government but is paid for by the patient or their insurance company
Sense.TRAN: 自费医疗〔医疗和医疗咨询由个人或其保险公司支付而非政府提供的体制〕

Sense.DEF: a member of parliament who is not a minister in the government
Sense.TRAN: 〔非内阁成员的〕下议院议员﹐普通议员

Sense.DEF: a law introduced to the British parliament by a member of parliament who is not a minister in the government
the sex organs – used when you want to avoid naming them directly
someone who pays for medical treatment or advice, rather than receiving it free through the government’s system
the business of a professional person that is independent of a bigger or government-controlled organization
Sense.TRAN: 职业人士的私人企业[公司]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richard set up in private practice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德设立了私人事务所。

Sense.DEF: the business of a professional person, especially a doctor, who works alone rather than with others
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指医生〕私人开业﹐独立开业

Sense.DEF: a school that is not supported by government money, where education must be paid for by the children’s parents
a secretary who is employed to help one person, especially with personal business

a
civil servant
whose job is to help a government minister
Sense.EXAMPLE: a parliamentary private secretary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会私人助理

Sense.DEF: the industries and services in a country that are owned and run by private companies, and not by the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: pay increases in the private sector
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私营企业的工资增长

Sense.DEF: a soldier of the lowest rank
an occasion when a few people are invited to see a show of paintings before the rest of the public
Sense.TRAN: 〔画展在公开展出前只邀请少数人参观的〕预展

Sense.DEF: a lack or loss of the things that everyone needs, such as food, warmth, and shelter
Sense.EXAMPLE: the privations of wartime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战时生活必需品的匮乏

Sense.DEF: the act of privatizing something
if a government privatizes an organization, industry, or service that it owns or controls, it sells it

a bush with leaves that stay green all year, often grown to form a
hedge
Sense.TRAN: 女贞〔常形成树篱的常青灌木〕

Sense.DEF: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不享受特权﹐待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the privilege of a good education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以享受良好教育的特权

Sense.DEF: something that you are lucky to have the chance to do, and that you enjoy very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today, we have the privilege of listening to two very unusual men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我们有幸聆听两位非常与众不同的男嘉宾讲话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had the great privilege to play for Yorkshire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很荣幸地代表约克郡参赛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is a privilege to hear her play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能听她演奏是一种荣幸。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people who are rich or of a high social class have many more advantages than other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: wealth and privilege
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财富和权势

Sense.DEF:
a situation in which doctors, lawyers etc are allowed to keep information about their discussions with their patients or
client s
secret from other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔医生﹑律师等的〕保密权﹐隐私隐瞒权

Sense.DEF: the right to do or say something unacceptable without being punished, especially in parliament
Sense.TRAN: 言行免责权〔尤指议员的权利〕

GramExa.GLOSS: a breaking of the rules about what a member of parliament can do or say
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 违反议会关于言行免责权的规定

Sense.DEF: to treat some people or things better than others

Subsense.DEF: having advantages because of your wealth, social position etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Students from a privileged background have an advantage at university.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出身于特权阶层的学生在大学里具有优势。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Only the privileged few can afford private education.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有享有特权的少数人才能上得起私立学校。

Subsense.DEF: people who are privileged

Sense.DEF: having a special advantage or a chance to do something that most people cannot do
Sense.TRAN: 有特权的﹔荣幸的﹐幸运的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kylie feels fortunate to be in such a privileged position because of her successful TV career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯莉觉得由于成功的电视生涯而使自己处于这样优越的地位真是幸运。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was privileged to lead the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有幸可以领队。

Sense.DEF: privileged information is private and is not allowed to be made public by law
Sense.TRAN: 不能公开的﹔有权保密的

Sense.DEF: sharing in the knowledge of facts that are secret
Sense.TRAN: 了解某事的内情﹐私下知晓某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colby was privy to the committee’s decisions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科尔比知晓委员会的秘密决定。

Sense.DEF: secret and private
a toilet, especially one outside a house in a small separate building
a group of important people in Britain who advise the king or queen on political affairs
money given by the British government to the king or queen for their personal use
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国政府划拨的〕国王［女王］私用经费

Sense.DEF: a prix fixe meal is a complete meal served for a fixed price
something that is given to someone who is successful in a competition, race, game of chance etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔给予获胜者的〕奖品﹐奖金﹐奖赏
Sense.EXAMPLE: In this month’s competition you could win a prize worth £3,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在本月的竞赛中您可以赢得价值3,000英镑的奖品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first prize has gone to Dr John Gentle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得一等奖的是约翰·金特尔博士。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prize for best photography has been won by a young Dutch photographer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最佳摄影奖由一位年轻的荷兰摄影师夺得。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists from Oxford shared the Nobel Prize for Medicine in 1945.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自牛津大学的科学家们共同获得了1945年的诺贝尔医学奖。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The prizes are awarded given every year to students who have shown original thinking in their work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些奖项每年颁发给在学习中表现出创造性思维的学生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The total prize money was £30,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奖金总额为3万英镑。

Sense.DEF: something that is very valuable to you or that it is very important to have
Sense.TRAN: 有价值的事物﹐宝贵的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fame was the prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名声重于一切。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is very easy to guess something
Sense.EXAMPLE: No prizes for guessing what she was wearing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一猜便知她穿的是什么。

Sense.DEF: good enough to win a prize or having won a prize
Sense.TRAN: 可获奖的﹐优等的﹔已获奖的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has spent months cultivating what he hopes are prize flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他花了几个月培育他认为有望获奖的花卉品种。

Sense.DEF: very good or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Picasso painting is a prize exhibit in the museum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕加索的画是该博物馆的珍品。

Sense.DEF: a complete idiot, fool etc
to think that someone or something is very important or valuable
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is someone who prizes truth and decency above all things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把真理和正派看得高于一切。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s shoes are highly prized by fashion conscious youngsters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的鞋备受时尚年轻人的青睐。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
prise
extremely important or valuable to someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人〕非常重要的﹐非常有价值的﹐极其珍贵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child held the bag as tightly as if it were her most prized possession .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那孩子紧紧抱住那个包﹐似乎那是她最宝贵的财产。

Sense.DEF: an occasion at a school, usually once a year, when prizes are given to children who have done well in particular subjects

a public
boxing
match in which two men fight each other without boxing gloves, in order to win money
Sense.TRAN: 〔以赢钱为目的的〕徒手拳击赛

Sense.DEF:
a professional
boxing
match
a ceremony at which people are given prizes, especially at a school
Sense.EXAMPLE: the annual school prize-giving
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校一年一度的颁奖仪式
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glittering prize-giving ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛大的颁奖典礼

Sense.DEF: a prize-winning thing or person has won a prize
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prize-winning novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prize-winning pianist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖钢琴家

Sense.DEF: someone who is paid to do something, especially play a sport, that other people do for pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 〔相对于业余爱好者而言的〕专业人士﹐职业人员〔尤指职业运动员〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tennis pro
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业网球运动员
Sense.EXAMPLE: the small gap between top amateurs and pros in golf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶级业余高尔夫球手和职业选手之间的微小差距

Sense.DEF: someone who has had a lot of experience with a particular type of situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cathy’s an old pro at organizing raffles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯茜组织抽彩很有经验。

Sense.DEF: the advantages and disadvantages of something

GramExa.PROPFORM: the pros and cons of (doing) sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We discussed the pros and cons of going to university.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们讨论了上大学的利与弊。

Sense.DEF:
a
prostitute
paid to do something, especially play a sport, that other people do for pleasure

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most young talented players are determined to turn pro.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数有天赋的年轻运动员都决心转为职业选手。

Sense.DEF: played or done by people who are paid for what they do
Sense.EXAMPLE: pro basketball
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业篮球

Sense.DEF: if you are pro an idea, suggestion etc, you support it
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a party, they had always been pro family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一个群体﹐他们一向支持家庭观念。

Sense.DEF: supporting or approving of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: pro-American
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pro-choice lobby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞成堕胎合法化的游说团体

Sense.DEF: doing a job instead of someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pro-vice-chancellor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔大学〕校长助理

Sense.DEF: making things happen or change rather than reacting to events
Sense.TRAN: 积极的﹔主动的﹐预先采取行动的﹐先发制人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a proactive approach to staffing requirements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对人事需求的积极处理方法

Sense.DEF:
a competition, especially in golf, for
professional s people who play for money
and
amateur s people who play just for pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 职业选手和业余选手混合赛〔尤指高尔夫球赛〕

Sense.DEF: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The probability of winning the lottery is really very low.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩票的中奖几率是非常低的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a 95% probability that she will not have the disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有95%的概率不会得这种病。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a high probability that the children will follow a different career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们很有可能会从事一项不同的职业。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You must decide whether, on the balance of probabilities , he committed the crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们一定要权衡正反两方面的可能性﹐然后再裁定他是否犯罪。

Sense.DEF: what is likely or something that is likely
Sense.TRAN: 可能发生的事﹔可能存在的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The probability is that smaller businesses will not have to pay the tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 较小的企业可能无需缴这种税。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A peace agreement now seems a probability rather than a possibility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成和平协定现在似乎是十有八九的事﹐而不只是一种可能性。

Sense.DEF: very probably
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mistakes could and, in all probability, would occur.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 错误可能而且也完全有可能发生。

Sense.DEF: likely to exist, happen, or be true
Sense.TRAN: 可能存在的﹐可能发生的﹐很可能的﹐大概的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The probable cause of the fire was faulty wiring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起火的原因很可能是电路故障。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Success is highly probable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的希望相当大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seems probable that the accident has damaged her brain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看起来很可能是那场事故损伤了她的大脑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The probable result of global warming will be a rise in sea levels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球变暖很可能导致海平面升高。

Sense.DEF: someone who is likely to be chosen for a team, to win a race etc
Sense.TRAN: 很有可能入选的人﹔很有可能获胜的人

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is likely to happen, likely to be true etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will probably take about a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很可能需要一星期左右。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This would probably be a good time to take a break.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这很可能会是休息一下的好机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s probably the best movie I have ever seen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这大概是我看过的最好的电影。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you going to be able to do this?’ ‘Yes, probably.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你能干这件事吗？”“是的﹐应该能行。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is she going to send it back?’ ‘ Probably not , no.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她会把它送回来吗？”“大概不会吧﹐不会。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building will be replaced, most probably by a modern sports centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼将拆除重建﹐很可能被一座现代化的体育中心所取代。

Sense.DEF:
the legal process of deciding that someone’s
will
has been properly made

to prove that a
will
is legal
a system that allows some criminals not to go to prison or to leave prison, if they behave well and see a probation officer regularly, for a particular period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge sentenced Jennings to three years’ probation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官判詹宁斯三年缓刑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pleaded guilty and was placed on probation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认了罪﹐被判处缓刑。

Sense.DEF: a period of time, during which an employer can see if a new worker is suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three month probation period
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个月的试用期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people are appointed on probation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些人被安排见习。

Sense.DEF: a period of time in which you must improve your work or behave well so that you will not have to leave your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I have no choice but to put you on probation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我没有别的选择﹐只能让你留任察看。

Sense.DEF: someone who has recently started a job, especially nursing or teaching, and who is being tested to see whether they are suitable for it
Sense.TRAN: 见习人员〔尤指见习护士或见习教师〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has broken the law, and has been put on probation
someone whose job is to watch, advise, and help people who have broken the law and are on probation
Sense.TRAN: 缓刑监督官﹔感化主任﹔观护人

Sense.DEF: to ask questions in order to find things out, especially things that other people do not want you to know

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to probe too deeply into your personal affairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想过分打探你的私事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Police probed claims that he had sold drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方就有人称他贩卖毒品一事进行了调查。

Sense.DEF: to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object
Sense.TRAN: 〔用细长的工具〕寻找﹐探测﹐探查
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jules probed the mud gingerly with a stick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱尔斯小心翼翼地用棍子在淤泥里摸索着。

Sense.DEF: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body

a
space probe
Sense.TRAN: 航天探测器﹐太空探测器

Sense.DEF:
an
investigation
in which many questions are asked to discover the truth about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a police corruption probe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对警察贪污行为的彻底调查

Sense.DEF: designed to find things out, especially things that other people do not want you to know
Sense.EXAMPLE: probing questions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盘根究底的问题

Sense.DEF: watching carefully and intelligently
Sense.TRAN: 〔观察〕专注敏锐的﹔仔细观察的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his probing eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他专注探究的眼神

Sense.DEF:
a food or other substance that contains
bacteria
and is used in a positive way to improve health, or the use of this type of food to improve health
Sense.TRAN: 含益生菌的食品[保健品]﹔益生菌保健法
Sense.EXAMPLE: Probiotics have been reported to enhance digestion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据报道含益生菌的保健品可以帮助消化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: probiotic yoghurt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 益生菌酸奶

Sense.DEF: complete honesty
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have always found Bentner to be a model of probity in our dealings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们的交往中﹐我一贯认为班特纳是诚实的典范。

Sense.DEF: a situation that causes difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was older than me, but that wasn’t really a problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比我年长﹐不过那不算什么问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The problem of street crime is getting worse every year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 街头犯罪的问题一年比一年严重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been having a few problems with my car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的汽车一直有些毛病。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In writing, people sometimes prefer to use the word issue rather than problem , as it sounds more neutral and less negative.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们有时偏向于使用 issue ,而不用 problem ,因为前者显得更为中性,不太负面
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the issue of race relations

Sense.DEF: something wrong with your health or with part of your body

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Does she have any long-term health problems?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有什么慢性病吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you have back problems you should avoid lifting heavy objects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你的背有毛病﹐就应该避免提重物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people with hearing problems try to hide their condition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多有听力障碍的人试图隐瞒自己的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She refuses to admit to herself that she has a weight problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不愿承认自己超重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is this a sign of some kind of deeper psychological problem?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是否意味着有某种更深层次的心理问题？

Sense.DEF: a question for which you have to find the right answer, using mathematics or careful thought
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过计算或仔细思考而解决的〕问题﹐习题
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave us 20 mathematical problems to solve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让我们解20道数学题。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you are happy to do something or for someone else to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I bring a friend?’ ‘Sure, no problem.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我能带个朋友来吗？”“当然﹐没问题。”

Subsense.DEF: used after someone has said thank you or said that they are sorry
Subsense.TRAN: 没什么〔用于回答对方的感谢或道歉〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Thanks for all your help.’ ‘No problem!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “感谢你的所有帮助。”“没什么！”

Sense.DEF: to do something easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had no problem recruiting staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我招聘员工没问题。

Sense.DEF: used before saying what the main difficulty in a situation is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem is, there isn’t enough time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题是没有足够的时间。

Sense.DEF: used to say rudely that someone else is responsible for dealing with a situation, not you
Sense.TRAN: 那是你的/他的等问题〔用于表示应由他人负责处理某情况﹐而非自己〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you miss the train, that’s your problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你赶不上火车﹐那是你自己的问题。

Sense.DEF: used to say rudely that you are not responsible for dealing with a particular problem and are not willing to help
Sense.TRAN: 那不是我的问题 〔用于表示不负责某事而且不愿意提供帮助〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We’ve got a serious staffing shortage.’ ‘That’s not my problem.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们人员严重短缺。”“那不是我的问题。”

Sense.DEF: used when you think that someone is behaving in a way that is unreasonable
Sense.TRAN: 你/他等出什么问题了？〔用于表示认为某人的行为不合常理〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: Do you have a problem with that?
Sense.DEF: used to ask someone why they seem to disagree with you, in a way that shows that you are annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 关于那一点你有问题吗？〔用于询问他人为何有异议﹐表示气恼〕

Sense.DEF: a child etc whose behaviour causes problems for other people

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We saw water rushing in and realised we had a serious problem.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到水涌进来,就知道碰到严重问题了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The building’s lack of parking space could cause problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢大楼缺少停车位会引起问题的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause it or make it have to be considered
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A shortage of trained nurses is posing major problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏训练有素的护士正带来大麻烦。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The state has failed to deal with the problem of violence against women.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家未处理好对妇女施暴的问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: deal with it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is more than one way to tackle this problem.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决这一问题有好几种办法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: mention it, so that people can discuss it
it happens
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Problems may arise when the family wants to move house.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人要搬家的话可能会有问题出现。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The problem lies in the design of the rocket.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题出在火箭的设计上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The school’s biggest problem is a shortage of cash.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校最大的问题是资金短缺。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Old cars often develop minor engine problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧汽车常会产生引擎方面的小问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The main problem for the climbers was lack of sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 登山者的主要问题是缺乏睡眠。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They quickly found that their real problem lay with marketing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很快发现真正的问题在于营销。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: relating to the most basic and important parts of something
one that needs to be dealt with very soon
relating to your private life and relationships

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: It is more usual to say 更常说 a big problem , a major problem or 或 a serious problem , instead of saying 而不说 ‘an important problem’.

Exponent.DEF: a problem that stops you from making progress
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The space program suffered a major setback when the space shuttle, Discovery, exploded.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “发现”号航天飞机爆炸令航天计划遭受了重大挫折。

Exponent.DEF: a problem, especially one that you had not expected
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s a snag – I don’t have his number.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个小麻烦——我没有他的号码。

Exponent.DEF: a small problem that delays or prevents something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There have been a few last-minute hitches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一刻出现了一些小问题。

Exponent.DEF: when something does not work in the way it should
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plane developed engine trouble.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机发生了引擎故障。

Exponent.DEF: a situation that is annoying because it causes problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Just trying to store all this stuff is a hassle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 单是把所有这些玩意储藏起来就是个麻烦事。

Sense.DEF: involving problems and difficult to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 有很多问题的﹐难对付的﹐成问题的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reforms could turn out to be highly problematic .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革最终可能会困难重重。

Sense.DEF: a page in a magazine where letters are printed about people’s personal problems, and answers are suggested
Sense.TRAN: 个人问题解疑专页〔指杂志中刊登反映个人问题的来信及对其建议的专页〕

Sense.DEF: when you find ways of doing things, or answers to problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: tasks that involve problem-solving
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包括解决问题的工作任务
Sense.EXAMPLE: employees with good problem-solving skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具备良好解决问题能力的雇员

Sense.DEF: used to describe work that someone, especially a lawyer, does without getting paid

a long thin tube that forms part of the mouth of some insects and
worm s
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些昆虫或蠕虫的〕吻﹐吻突﹐喙

Sense.DEF:
the long thin nose of some animals such as an
elephant
used to say that you will be able to do something easily and with no problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be ready by six - no probs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6 点前会准备好——一定没问题。

Sense.DEF: connected with a procedure, especially in a law court
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指法庭上〕程序性的﹐手续上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: procedural rules
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 程序性的规定

Sense.DEF: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指正确的或通常的做事〕程序﹐步骤﹐手续

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the procedure for applying for a visa?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请签证需要怎样的手续？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is standard procedure for getting rid of toxic waste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是清除有毒废料的标准步骤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All schools have disciplinary procedures they must follow .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有学校都有纪律问题的处理程序﹐必须遵循。

Sense.EXAMPLE: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在飞机上﹐我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

Sense.DEF: a medical treatment or operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liposuction is a minor surgical procedure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽脂手术是个外科小手术。

Sense.DEF: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government was determined to proceed with the election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府决心继续进行选举。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须先定义术语﹐然后再往下展开。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say go ahead rather than proceed .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 go ahead ,而不说 proceed
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They decided to go ahead with the project.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定继续进行该项目。

Sense.DEF: to continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work is proceeding according to plan .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作正在按计划进行。

Sense.DEF: to do something after doing something else first – used sometimes to express surprise or annoyance
Sense.TRAN: 接着做﹐继而做〔有时用于表示感到意外或恼怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sammy took off his coat and proceeded to undo his boots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨米脱掉了外衣﹐接着又解开靴子。

Sense.DEF: to move in a particular direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Passengers for Miami should proceed to gate 25.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 前往迈阿密的乘客请到25号登机口。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with precede(=happen before or go before). 不要和precede 〔先于…发生﹔走在…之前〕混淆: the period of illness that preceded his death 他去世前的那段生病时期

Sense.DEF: to begin a legal case against someone
Sense.TRAN: 起诉〔某人〕﹐对〔某人〕提起诉讼

Sense.DEF: to happen or exist as a result of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ideas that proceed from a disturbed state of mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心烦意乱时产生的想法

Sense.DEF: if you proceed to the next part of an activity, job etc, you do or take part in the next part of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: players who proceed to the finals of the competition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进入决赛的选手

Sense.DEF: an event or a series of things that happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: We watched the proceedings in the street below.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们留心看下面街道上发生的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At this point in the proceedings, my doctor offered me a choice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗进行到此时﹐医生给了我一个选择。

Sense.DEF: when someone uses a court of law to deal with a legal case

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has begun divorce proceedings .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始了离婚诉讼。

Sense.EXAMPLE: John is taking legal proceedings against his ex-partner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰在对他的前合伙人提起法律诉讼。

Sense.DEF: the official written records of a meeting, society etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the proceedings of the conference
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大会记录

Sense.DEF: the money that is obtained from doing something or selling something
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事或出售某物所获得的〕收入﹐收益
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sold the business and bought a villa in Spain with the proceeds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们卖了公司﹐用所得的钱在西班牙买了一幢别墅。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proceeds of the concert will go to charity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会的收入将捐献给慈善机构。

Sense.DEF: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以－埃和平进程
Sense.EXAMPLE: Repetition can help the learning process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重复对学习过程会有帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the process of economic change
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济改革的进程

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Getting fit again has been a long slow process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恢复健康是个漫长的过程。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the mental processes involved in decision-making
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 决策中包含的思维过程

Sense.DEF: a series of things that happen naturally and result in gradual change

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the natural process of evolution
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然进化的过程
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Coal forms by a slow process of chemical change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤是由缓慢的化学变化形成的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the digestive process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消化过程

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the process of (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: to have started doing something and not yet be finished
Sense.TRAN: 在（做）某事的过程中﹐在进行…中
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is in the process of moving to new offices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司正搬往新的办公室。

Sense.DEF: if something is in process, it is happening now
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an armed revolt in process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场武装叛乱正在进行。

Sense.DEF: while you are doing something or something is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spilt the coffee, burning myself in the process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把咖啡洒出来﹐烫到了自己。

Sense.DEF: a way of finding the right answer, the truth etc by gradually deciding that none of the other answers etc are possible
Sense.TRAN: 排除法﹐淘汰法〔把错误的答案一一排除以找出正确答案〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I solved the problem by a process of elimination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用排除法解出了那道题。

Sense.DEF: a method of making or producing goods
Sense.EXAMPLE: the car production process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车的生产流程
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recycling is an industrial process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

Sense.DEF: to make food, materials, or goods ready to be used or sold, for example by preserving or improving them in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goats’ cheese may be processed in many ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山羊奶干酪可以有多种加工方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two million workers are employed processing goods for electronic firms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 200 万名工人受雇为电子公司加工产品。

Sense.DEF: to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All university applications are processed through this system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

Sense.DEF: to deal with information using a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new network will enable data to be processed more speedily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新网络将使数据处理更迅速。

Sense.DEF: to print a picture from a photographic film
to walk or move along in a very slow and serious way, especially as part of a group
Sense.TRAN: 列队行进﹔缓慢而严肃地行进

Sense.DEF: processed food has substances added to it before it is sold, in order to preserve it, improve its colour etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the artificial colourings and flavourings in processed foods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加工食品中所含的人工色素和调味料

Sense.DEF: a line of people or vehicles moving slowly as part of a ceremony

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 葬礼/婚礼/狂欢节等队伍

Sense.EXAMPLE: They marched in procession to the Capitol building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们列队向国会大厦行进。

Sense.DEF: several people or things of the same type, appearing or happening one after the other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an endless procession of visitors
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 络绎不绝的参观者

Sense.DEF: relating to or used in a procession
Sense.TRAN: 行列的﹐队伍的﹔一排的﹐一串的﹔用于行列[队伍]的

Sense.DEF: the central part of a computer that deals with the commands and information it is given
a machine or person that processes food or other materials before they are sold or used
Sense.EXAMPLE: US tuna processors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的金枪鱼加工厂商

Sense.DEF:
someone who is pro-choice believes that women have a right to have an
abortion
Sense.TRAN: 主张女性有权人工流产的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pro-choice lobby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主张堕胎合法的游说团体

Sense.DEF: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统宣布共和国独立。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Protesters proclaimed that the girl was innocent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抗议者宣称那个女孩是无辜的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His son was immediately proclaimed King.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的儿子立即被宣布为国王。

Sense.DEF: to show something clearly or be a sign of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stripes on her uniform proclaimed her seniority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制服上的条纹表明她的级别很高。

Sense.DEF: an official public statement about something that is important, or when someone makes such a statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The authorities issued a proclamation forbidding public meetings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局发布了公告﹐禁止公开集会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the proclamation of Lithuania’s independence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 立陶宛独立宣言

Sense.DEF: a tendency to behave in a particular way, or to like a particular thing – used especially about something bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The child showed no proclivity towards aggression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这孩子没有表现出攻击性倾向。

Sense.EXAMPLE: his sexual proclivities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的性倾向

Sense.DEF: someone who governed a part of the ancient Roman Empire
the rank of a proconsul, or the time when someone was a proconsul
Sense.TRAN: 〔古罗马帝国〕地方总督的职位[任期]

Sense.DEF: to delay doing something that you ought to do, usually because you do not want to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: People often procrastinate when it comes to paperwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇到文书工作﹐人们常常会拖拖拉拉。

Sense.DEF: to produce children or baby animals
someone who watches students in an examination to make sure that they do not cheat
an official with legal powers, especially in the former Soviet Union, the Roman Catholic Church or the ancient Roman Empire
Sense.TRAN: 〔苏联的〕检察长﹔〔天主教的〕教会官员﹔〔古罗马帝国的〕地方财政长官
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Procurator General of the Ukraine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌克兰的检察长

Sense.DEF:
an official in Scotland who decides whether someone should be sent to court for a
trial
to obtain something, especially something that is difficult to get
Sense.TRAN: 获得﹐取得〔尤指难以得到的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was accused of procuring weapons for terrorists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控为恐怖分子采办武器。

Sense.DEF:
to provide a
prostitute
for someone
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人〕介绍妓女﹐给…拉皮条

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the procurement of raw materials from abroad

Sense.DEF: to quickly push something or someone with your finger or a pointed object
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t go to sleep,’ she said, prodding me in the ribs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别睡着。”她边说边捅我的肋骨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Theo prodded at the dead snake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西奥戳了戳那条死蛇。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do something by persuading or reminding them that it is necessary, especially when they are lazy or unwilling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It had prodded Ben into doing something about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事促使本要做点什么。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The strike may prod the government into action .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场罢工可能会促使政府采取行动。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He’s a bright kid, but he needs prodding.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个聪明孩子﹐但需要督促。

Sense.DEF: a quick pushing movement, using your finger or a pointed object
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Go on,’ he whispered, giving me a prod in the back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “去吧。”他小声说道﹐捅了一下我的背。

Sense.DEF: when you persuade or remind someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you ring the shop and give them a prod ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为何不打电话给商店提醒他们一下？

Sense.DEF: a pointed instrument used for pushing animals, to make them move
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cattle prod
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赶牛刺棒

Sense.DEF: someone who leaves their family and home without the approval of their family, but who is sorry later and returns
Sense.TRAN: 回头的浪子/悔悟回家的女儿

Sense.DEF: spending money, wasting time etc in a careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prodigal lifestyle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奢侈的生活方式

Sense.DEF: someone who spends money carelessly and wastes their time – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 浪费〔时间与金钱〕者﹐挥霍者〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: very large or great in a surprising or impressive way
Sense.TRAN: 巨大的﹐庞大的﹐大得惊人的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some galaxies seem to release prodigious amounts of energy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些星系似乎释放出巨大的能量。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the artist’s prodigious output
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位艺术家惊人的高产

Sense.DEF: a young person who has a great natural ability in a subject or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mozart was a musical prodigy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫扎特是音乐神童。

Sense.DEF: to cause a particular result or effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: New drugs are producing remarkable results .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新药正在产生显著的效果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一项政策﹐它并未产生预期的效果。

Sense.DEF: to make, write etc something to be bought, used, or enjoyed by people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory produces an incredible 100 cars per hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家工厂一小时生产100辆汽车﹐令人难以置信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did you manage to produce a meal so quickly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么这么快就能做出一顿饭来？

Sense.DEF: to grow something or make it naturally
Sense.EXAMPLE: This region produces the grapes used in champagne.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区出产酿造香槟酒用的葡萄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plants produce oxygen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物制造氧气。

Sense.DEF: if you produce an object, you bring it out or present it, so that people can see or consider it
Sense.EXAMPLE: When challenged, he produced a gun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人拦住他盘问﹐他便掏出一把枪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were unable to produce any statistics to verify their claims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拿不出任何统计数据来证明他们的说法。

Sense.DEF: if someone produces a film or play, they find the money for it and control the way it is made
Sense.EXAMPLE: Costner produced and directed the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科斯特纳监制并导演了这部电影。

Sense.DEF: to give birth to a baby or young animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: An adult cat may produce kittens three times a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只成年猫一年可以生三次小猫。

Sense.DEF: food or other things that have been grown or produced on a farm to be sold

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fresh local produce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鲜的本地农产品

GramExa.GLOSS: milk, butter, cheese etc

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to control the preparation of a play, film, or broadcast, but who does not direct the actors
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑电影或广播的〕监制﹐制作人﹐制片人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hollywood producers and movie stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞的制片人和影星

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to organize and direct the recording and production of a record
a person, company, or country that makes or grows goods, foods, or materials
Sense.TRAN: 生产者﹐制造商﹐生产公司[国]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: South Carolina is the fourth largest producer of tobacco.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南卡罗来纳是第四大烟草出产地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: leading oil producers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要的石油生产国

Sense.DEF: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

GramExa.EXAMPLE: consumer products such as VCRs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像机之类的消费品

Sense.EXAMPLE: The London factory assembles the finished product .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦工厂组装成品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He works in marketing and product development.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从事营销和产品开发。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is the product of a particular background or experience, their character is typical of that background or the result of that experience
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

Subsense.DEF: if something is the product of a particular situation, process etc, it is the result of that situation or process
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The report was the product of four years’ hard work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那份报告是四年辛苦工作的成果。

Sense.DEF:
the number you get by multiplying two or more numbers in
mathematics
something that is produced through a natural or chemical process
Sense.TRAN: 〔自然过程或化学反应的〕生成物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hemoglobin is a product of red blood cells.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血红蛋白是红细胞的生成物。

Exponent.DEF: something that is made or produced in large quantities, usually in order to be sold
Exponent.EXAMPLE: consumer products such as mobile phones
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 手机之类的消费品
Exponent.EXAMPLE: dairy products
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乳制品

Exponent.DEF: things that are produced in order to be sold, especially for use in the home
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They sell furniture and other household goods .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出售家具及其他家庭用品。

GramExa.COLLGLOSS: large electrical goods used in the home such as washing machines and refrigerators
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色商品,大型家用电器

Exponent.DEF: a type of product or raw material that can be bought and sold – used especially about basic food products, metals, and fuels
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The decline in prices for agricultural commodities made the economic situation worse.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 农产品价格下跌令经济形势更加严峻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All metal was a valuable commodity and was rarely wasted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的金属制品都是有价值的商品,很少被浪费。

Exponent.DEF: things that are being sold, especially in shops
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Customers are not allowed to handle the merchandise.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客不得触摸商品。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sales of books, videos, and other merchandise have increased.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 书籍﹑录像带和其他商品的销量增加了。

Exponent.DEF: things that are offered for sale, especially in a market or on the street
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指市场中或街上的〕商品,货物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the market, the traders began selling their wares.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场里,商贩开始出售商品。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Merchants brought their wares from all over the world.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 批发商从世界各地采购商品。

Exponent.DEF: a product that is sent to a foreign country in order to be sold
Exponent.EXAMPLE: US exports rose to $11.935 billion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的商品出口增加到119.35亿美元。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At the moment, oil is their biggest export.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前石油是他们最大的出口商品。

Exponent.DEF: goods that are brought from one country into another to be sold there
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The UK clothing industry cannot compete with foreign imports on price.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的服装业无法在价格上和外国进口货竞争。

Sense.DEF: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the production of consumer goods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费品生产

GramExa.EXAMPLE: agricultural production and distribution
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业生产和经销

GramExa.EXAMPLE: high-tech production methods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高科技的生产方法

GramExa.GLOSS: being produced
GramExa.EXAMPLE: By September, the new motors were in production.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到9月份﹐这种新的发动机开始投产。

GramExa.GLOSS: begin to be produced in large numbers, or stop being produced
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new model will go into production next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新型号将于明年投产。

Sense.DEF: the amount of goods that are made or grown

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a drop in oil and gas production
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油和天然气产量的下降
生产水平/目标等

Sense.DEF: when something is produced through a natural process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the skin’s natural production of oil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮肤油脂的自然分泌

Sense.DEF: a play, film, broadcast etc that is produced for the public, or the process of producing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔演出﹑上映﹑制作等的〕戏剧﹐电影﹐广播节目﹔〔戏剧﹑电影﹑广播等的〕制作
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new Shakespeare production at the Arts Theatre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术剧院新排演的莎士比亚戏剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1992, Green moved into video production.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1992 年格林转而从事录像制作。

Sense.DEF: when you show something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Entrance is only permitted on production of a ticket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凭票入场。

Sense.DEF: a line of machines and workers in a factory, each doing one job in the process of making a product before passing it to the next machine or worker

a scene in a
musical
with a lot of people singing and dancing
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐剧中很多演员一起唱歌跳舞的〕高潮片断﹐重点场景

Sense.DEF: producing or achieving a lot
Sense.TRAN: 多产的﹔丰饶的﹔富有成效的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of us are more productive in the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大多数人在早上更有效率。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly productive meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富有成效的会议

Sense.DEF: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth
Sense.TRAN: 生产〔成品﹑作物或财富〕的﹐生产性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the economy’s productive capacity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该经济体的生产能力

Sense.DEF: causing or resulting in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting was productive of several good ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次会议产生了几个好想法。

Sense.DEF: the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, especially in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them
Sense.TRAN: 生产率﹐生产效率﹔生产量﹐生产力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ways of increasing productivity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高生产率的方法

Sense.EXAMPLE: high productivity levels in manufacturing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造业中的高生产率
Sense.EXAMPLE: It cost the country $4 million in lost productivity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它对该国造成了400万美元的生产力损失。

Sense.DEF: a form of advertising in which a company arranges for one or more of its products to appear in a television programme or film
Sense.TRAN: 产品植入﹐植入式广告〔一家公司安排其产品在电视节目或电影中出现的营销方式〕

Sense.DEF:
a
professor

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=professor, used in front of names 教授〔用于称谓〕

Sense.DEF: showing a lack of respect for God or holy things
Sense.TRAN: 渎神的﹐亵渎上帝的﹔不敬圣物的
Sense.EXAMPLE: profane language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亵渎的语言

Sense.DEF: related to ordinary life, not religion or holy things
Sense.EXAMPLE: sacred and profane art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教艺术和世俗艺术

Sense.DEF: to treat something holy with a lack of respect
offensive words or religious words used in a way that shows you do not respect God or holy things
Sense.TRAN: 亵渎的语言﹔脏话﹐下流话

Sense.DEF: behaviour that shows you do not respect God or holy things
to say that you do, are etc something, especially when it is not really true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government professes to care about the poor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府自称关心穷人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He professed to be an expert on Islamic art.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自称是伊斯兰艺术的专家。

Sense.DEF: to say that you did not do something bad, especially a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: In court, the man was still professing his innocence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在法庭上﹐该男子仍称自己是无辜的。

Sense.DEF: to state a personal feeling or belief openly
Sense.TRAN: 声称﹐公开表明〔个人感情或看法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He finally made up his mind to profess his love for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最终下定决心对她表白。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He professed himself satisfied with the results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对结果表示满意。

Sense.DEF: to have a religion or belief
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matt professed no religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特不信教。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a belief that someone has stated openly
Sense.TRAN: 公开表示的﹐公开声称的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a professed atheist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公开声称是无神论者的人

Sense.DEF: used to describe a feeling or attitude that someone says they have, but which may not be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their professed aim is to encourage democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们妄称自己的目标是促进民主。

Sense.DEF: a job that needs a high level of education and training
Sense.TRAN: 〔需要高等教育和训练的〕专业﹐行业

GramExa.EXAMPLE: members of the teaching profession
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事教学职业的人员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some students enter other professions such as arts administration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些学生加入了艺术管理等其他行业。

Sense.EXAMPLE: people who work in the professions doctors, lawyers etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事专业性工作的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Johnson was a barrister by profession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊的职业是讼务律师。

Sense.EXAMPLE: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions ones that involve looking after people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士﹑社工和其他从事护理行业的人

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: all the people who work in a particular profession
Sense.TRAN: 某职业的全体人员﹔同业﹐同行
Sense.EXAMPLE: the medical profession
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医学界

Sense.DEF: a statement of your belief, opinion, or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 〔信念﹑观点或感情的〕公开表示﹐表白

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a profession of faith
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信仰宣言

Sense.DEF:
the job of being a
prostitute
– used humorously

Subsense.DEF: relating to a job that needs special education and training
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What professional qualifications does he have?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有哪些专业资格？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It is essential to get good professional advice .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得有用的专业指导非常重要。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You may need to seek professional help .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

Subsense.DEF: relating to your job or work and not to your private life
Subsense.TRAN: 工作上的〔相对于私人生活而言〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: professional contacts
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作上的人脉

Sense.DEF: showing that someone has been well trained and is good at their work
Sense.EXAMPLE: This business plan looks very professional.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个商业计划看上去很有专业水平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a more professional approach to work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更专业的工作方法

Sense.DEF: doing a job, sport, or activity for money, rather than just for fun
Sense.TRAN: 职业性的﹔专业的﹔非业余的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a professional tennis player
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业网球运动员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a professional army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业军队

GramExa.GLOSS: start to do something as a job
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始以做某事为职业

Sense.DEF: done by or relating to people who are paid to do a sport or activity
Sense.TRAN: 由职业人员参加的﹔职业性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a professional hockey team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业曲棍球队
Sense.EXAMPLE: The golf tournament is a professional event.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项高尔夫锦标赛是职业赛事。

Sense.DEF: someone who works in a profession, or who has an important position in a company or business
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’d prefer to rent the house to a professional couple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们更愿意把房子租给从事专业工作的夫妇。

Sense.DEF: someone who lies or complains too much – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 撒谎/抱怨等的专家〔幽默用法〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the increasing professionalization of childcare services
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童保育服务的日益职业化

Sense.DEF: someone who earns money by doing a job, sport, or activity that many other people do just for fun
Sense.TRAN: 〔相对于业余爱好者的〕职业人士﹐职业选手
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurd signed as a professional in 1998.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫德于1998年签约成为职业选手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: top snooker professionals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顶尖斯诺克职业选手

Sense.DEF:
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or
architect
Sense.TRAN: 专业人士﹐专家〔如医生﹑律师﹑建筑师等〕

GramExa.GLOSS: doctors, nurses etc
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医护专业人员

Sense.DEF: someone who has a lot of experience and does something very skilfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: You sing like a real professional.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你唱起歌来就像个专业歌手。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very good at a sport and is employed by a private club to teach its members
Sense.TRAN: 〔私人俱乐部的〕网球/高尔夫球/游泳等教练

Sense.DEF: in football, if someone commits a professional foul, they deliberately do something that is against the rules in order to prevent another player from scoring
the skill and high standards of behaviour expected of a professional person
Sense.TRAN: 专业水准﹔专业素质﹔职业精神
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dedication and professionalism of our staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们员工的奉献精神和专业素质

Sense.DEF: the practice of using professional players in sports
Sense.TRAN: 〔在体育竞赛中〕雇用职业选手的做法﹐职业化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Professionalism has raised the standard of rugby immensely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业化大大提高了橄榄球运动的水平。

Sense.DEF: as part of your work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you need to use English professionally?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作中你需要使用英语吗？

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows high standards and good training
Sense.EXAMPLE: The magazine wasn’t very professionally designed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志设计得不太专业。

Sense.DEF: as a paid job rather than just for fun
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chance to play football professionally
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加职业足球比赛的机会

Sense.DEF: by someone who has the necessary skills and training
Sense.EXAMPLE: The carpet should be professionally fitted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地毯应由专业人员铺设。

Sense.DEF: a form of entertainment in which people, usually men, fight each other in a way that has been planned before the event
a teacher of the highest rank in a university department
Sense.TRAN: 教授〔大学院系中最高的职称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Professor Barclay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克利教授

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s been named the professor of English.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被任命为英语教授。

Sense.DEF: a teacher at a university or college
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ted’s a college professor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德是大学老师。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who’s your chemistry professor?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁是你的化学老师？

Sense.DEF: relating to the job of a professor, or considered typical of a professor
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new professorial chair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的教授职位
Sense.EXAMPLE: His beard gives him a very professorial look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他留着胡子看上去很像个教授。

Sense.DEF: the job or position of a university or college professor
Sense.EXAMPLE: a professorship in Japanese
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日语教授职位

Sense.DEF: to offer something to someone, especially by holding it out in your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah took the glass proffered by the attendant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉接过服务员递过来的玻璃杯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Poirot proffered him a cigarette.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 普瓦罗递给他一根烟。

Sense.DEF: to give someone advice, an explanation etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the proffered invitation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提出的邀请

Sense.DEF: a good standard of ability and skill

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a high level of proficiency in English
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 精通英语
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nick’s proficiency with computers is well known.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克对电脑很在行是出了名的。

Sense.DEF: able to do something well or skilfully

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Martha’s proficient in Swedish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛莎精通瑞典语。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s only one way to become proficient at anything - practice!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管什么事﹐要想熟练只有一种方法——练习！

Sense.EXAMPLE: a proficient typist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熟练的打字员

Sense.DEF: a side view of someone’s head
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dani has a lovely profile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尼的侧面轮廓很好看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I only saw her face in profile.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只看到她的侧脸。

Sense.DEF: a short description that gives important details about a person, a group of people, or a place
Sense.TRAN: 人物简介﹐传略﹔〔某地方的〕概况
Sense.EXAMPLE: a job profile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作简介

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a short profile of the actor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位演员的简介

Sense.DEF: something that is high profile is noticed by many people or gets a lot of attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack runs a department with a high public profile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克管理着一个受到公众注目的部门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The star has a high profile in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位明星在英国非常引人注目。

Sense.DEF: to behave quietly and avoid doing things that will make people notice you
if a person or an organization raises its profile, it gets more attention from the public
Sense.EXAMPLE: an advertising campaign designed to raise the bank’s profile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场旨在提升这家银行形象的广告宣传活动

Sense.DEF: an edge or a shape of something seen against a background
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sharp profile of the western foothills against the sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西面山麓小丘在天空衬托下的清晰轮廓

Sense.DEF: to write or give a short description of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new Chief Executive was profiled in yesterday’s newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天的报纸刊登了新任总裁的简介。
