Sense.DEF: the process of studying a crime, especially a murder, and making judgments about the character of the person who committed it
Sense.TRAN: 罪犯〔尤指谋杀犯〕特征分析

Sense.DEF: when people who belong to a particular race or group are stopped and searched, for example by the police or at airports, because the police think that they are more likely to commit crimes
Sense.TRAN: 群体定性〔因警察认为某类人较可能会犯罪而截查他们〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: racial profiling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种族定性

Sense.DEF: when companies collect information about people that they wish to sell something to
money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她卖了公司﹐用所得利润买下了一座农场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sold their house at a healthy profit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们卖掉房子﹐赚了一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: an advantage that you gain from doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Drug companies make huge profits.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 制药厂利润巨大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: happening quickly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were only interested in a quick profit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只对暴利感兴趣。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a good profit to be made in selling cars.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售汽车利润很可观。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: big

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are in business to make a profit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们做生意是为了赢利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a profit
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Without the liquor sales, the store could not turn a profit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不卖酒,这家商店就无利可图。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Pre-tax profits were up 21.5%.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 税前利润增加了21.5%。

Exponent.DEF: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our profits are down this year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年我们的利润下降了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The big oil companies have made enormous profits following the rise in oil prices.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价上涨后,大型石油公司获取了巨额利润。

Exponent.DEF: the profit that a company makes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company said it expected fourth-quarter earnings to be lower than last year’s results.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司称预计第四季度盈利将低于去年同期。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pre-tax earnings have grown from $6.3 million to $9.4 million.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 税前利润从630万美元增至940万美元。

Exponent.DEF: the profit that you get from an investment
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You should get a good return on your investment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的投资应该能够获得高回报。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We didn’t get much of a return on our money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的资金收益并不高。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They’re promising high returns on investments of over $100,000.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们承诺十万美元以上的投资有高额回报。

Exponent.DEF: the amount of business done during a particular period
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The illicit drugs industry has an annual turnover of some £200 bn.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法毒品行业每年的营业额约为2,000亿英镑。

Exponent.DEF: the money that a business, shop etc gets from selling its goods in a day, week, month etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He counted the night’s takings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他数了数一晚上的进款。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This week’s takings are up on last week’s.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周的收入比上周有所增加。

Exponent.DEF: money paid to you by a bank or other financial institution when you keep money in an account there
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They are offering a high rate of interest on deposits of over £3﹐000.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对3﹐000英镑以上的存款支付高额利息。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The money is still earning interest in your account.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱仍在你的账户里生息。

Exponent.DEF: a part of a company’s profit that is divided among the people who have shares in the company
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shareholders will receive a dividend of 10p for each share.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 股东将分到每股10便士的股息。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company said it will pay shareholders a final dividend of 700 cents a share.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司说将分给股东每股700分的期末股息。

Sense.DEF: to be useful or helpful to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It might profit you to learn about the company before your interview.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在面试之前对该公司作些了解可能会对你有帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are lessons in these stories that all children can profit by.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的孩子都可以从这些故事中汲取教训。

Sense.DEF: to get money from doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some industries, such as shipbuilding, clearly profited from the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些行业﹐例如造船业﹐显然从这场战争中获利了。

Sense.DEF: when a business or an activity makes a profit, or the amount of profit it makes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decline in company profitability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司利润的下降

Sense.DEF: producing a profit or a useful result
Sense.TRAN: 有利可图的﹔有益的﹐有用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The advertising campaign proved very profitable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实证明﹐这次广告宣传活动卓有成效。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly profitable business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盈利高的企业
Sense.EXAMPLE: a profitable afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有收获的下午

Sense.DEF: a financial statement showing a company’s income, spending, and profit over a particular period
Sense.TRAN: 损益账〔反映公司某一时期收支和利润情况的报表〕

Sense.DEF: the process of making unfairly large profits, especially by selling things that are very difficult to get at very high prices

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑市上牟取暴利的商人

Sense.DEF:
a small round
pastry
with a sweet filling and chocolate on the top
Sense.TRAN: 〔内有甜馅﹑顶部有巧克力的〕泡芙﹐酥球

Sense.DEF: not making a profit, or not useful to do
Sense.TRAN: 无利的﹐无利可图的﹔无益的﹐不值得做的

Sense.DEF: a profit-making organization or business makes a profit
the difference between the cost of producing something and the price at which you sell it
a system by which all the people who work for a company receive part of its profits
Sense.TRAN: 分红制〔公司人员分享利润的制度〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion when a company announces that its profit for a particular period of time will be less than expected
wasting money or other things in a careless way
Sense.TRAN: 恣意挥霍的﹔极其浪费的
Sense.EXAMPLE: profligate spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恣意挥霍
Sense.EXAMPLE: the profligate use of energy resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能源浪费

Sense.DEF: behaving in an immoral way and not caring that your behaviour is bad
if something is approved, accepted etc pro forma, this is part of the usual way of doing things and does not involve any actual choice or decision
Sense.TRAN: 形式上的[地]﹐按惯例的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: pro forma approval
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形式上的同意

Sense.DEF: a document like a bill that is sent to the customer to show what a price would be if he or she made an order
having a strong influence or effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tolstoy’s experiences of war had a profound effect on his work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尔斯泰的战争经历深刻影响了他的作品。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mother’s behaviour has a profound impact on the developing child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲的行为对于正在成长的孩子有极大的影响。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: profound changes in society
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会的巨大变革

Sense.DEF: showing strong serious feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: a profound sense of guilt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的内疚感

Sense.DEF: showing great knowledge and understanding
Sense.TRAN: 知识渊博的﹔见解深刻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a profound question
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深刻的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenner is a profound thinker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

Sense.DEF: deep or far below the surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her work touches something profound in the human psyche.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的作品触及了人类心灵深处的某些东西。

Sense.DEF: complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: profound deafness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全耳聋

Sense.DEF: when someone or something shows great knowledge and understanding, or strong serious feelings
Sense.TRAN: 〔知识〕渊博﹔〔见解〕深刻﹔〔情感〕深切
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cartoon version lacks the profundity of the original text.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡通版缺乏原作的深刻性。

Sense.DEF: something that someone says that shows great knowledge and understanding
Sense.EXAMPLE: the profundities of her speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她演讲的博大精深

Sense.DEF: produced or existing in large quantities
Sense.TRAN: 大量（产生）的﹔丰富的﹔充沛的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made profuse apologies .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不住地道歉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Profuse sweating is one of the symptoms of heat exhaustion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量出汗是中暑虚脱的症状之一。

Sense.DEF: a very large amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was overflowing with a profusion of strange ornaments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子里摆满了奇特的装饰品。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cornflowers grow in profusion in the fields.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 田里长满了矢车菊。

Sense.DEF: someone who first thought of an idea

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a progenitor of cubism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 立体派的创始人

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that lived in the past, to whom someone or something living now is related
the babies of animals or plants
someone’s children – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah with her numerous progeny
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉和她的一大群孩子

Sense.DEF: something that develops from something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Connolly’s book is the progeny of an earlier TV series.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 康诺利的书是早先一部电视连续剧的衍生品。

Sense.DEF:
a female sex
hormone
which prepares the body for having a baby, and which is also used in
contraceptive
drugs
Sense.TRAN: 黄体酮﹐孕酮〔一种女性性激素〕

Sense.DEF: having a jaw that sticks out more than the rest of the face
a doctor’s opinion of how an illness or disease will develop
Sense.TRAN: 预后﹐预断〔医生对于病情如何发展的预测〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doctors said Blake’s long-term prognosis is good.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们说布莱克的远期预后良好。

Sense.DEF: a judgment about the future, based on information or experience
Sense.TRAN: 〔基于资料和经验而作出的〕预测﹐展望

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hopeful prognosis of the country’s future development
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这个国家未来发展的乐观展望

Sense.DEF: a statement about what you think will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: gloomy prognostications
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲观的预言

Sense.DEF: a set of instructions given to a computer to make it perform an operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a word processing program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文字处理程序

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
programme
to give a computer a set of instructions that it can use to perform a particular operation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: attempts to program computers to produce and understand speech
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 编写程序让计算机生成并理解语言的尝试

Sense.EXAMPLE: Any large high-speed computer can be programmed to learn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何大型高速计算机都可以通过编程获得学习能力。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
programme
able to be controlled by a computer or an electronic program
Sense.TRAN: 可计算机控制的﹐可程序控制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a programmable heating system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 程控供暖系统

Sense.DEF: a series of actions which are designed to achieve something important
Sense.EXAMPLE: the US space program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国太空计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a United Nations programme to control the spread of AIDS
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国控制艾滋病传播计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a programme of economic reforms
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济改革计划

Sense.DEF: something that you watch on television or listen to on the radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your favourite television programme ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最喜欢的电视节目是什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: news and current affairs programmes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻时事节目

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a programme about killer whales next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来要播放一个关于虎鲸的节目。

Sense.DEF: a course of study
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stanford University’s MBA program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦福大学的工商管理硕士课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: a research program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究课程

Sense.DEF: actions that have been planned to keep something in good condition or improve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new fitness programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的健身计划

Sense.DEF: a small book or piece of paper that gives information about a play, concert etc and who the performers are
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧、音乐会等演出的〕说明书﹐节目单
Sense.EXAMPLE: a theatre programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧院节目单

Sense.DEF: a series of planned activities or events, or a list showing what order they will come in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the programme for tomorrow?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天安排什么活动？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a programme of exhibitions throughout the year
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全年的展览计划表

Sense.DEF: a series of actions done in a particular order by a machine such as a washing machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: The light goes off when it finishes the programme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作程序结束之后指示灯熄灭。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to pay attention to what needs to be done, and to do it

Exponent.DEF: something that you watch on television, or listen to on the radio
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s your favourite television programme?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最喜欢的电视节目是什么？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I watched an interesting programme about Egypt last night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我看了一档关于埃及的有趣节目。

Exponent.DEF: a programme on television or the radio, especially an informal one in which people talk together, take part in a game etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔电视或电台的,尤指访谈﹑游戏等〕节目
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a late-night talk show
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 午夜访谈节目
Exponent.EXAMPLE: game shows
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏节目
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She hosts a weekly call-in radio show called ‘Got a question?’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她主持一档每周一次的热线广播节目,叫做《你问我答》。

Exponent.DEF: a pro-gramme that gives you facts and information about a serious subject, such as history, science, or social problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a documentary about homeless people
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关无家可归者的纪录片
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a 50-minute television documentary
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 50 分钟的电视纪录片

Exponent.DEF: a television or radio programme that tells an imaginary story about a group of people and their lives, and is often broadcast regularly for many years
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Australian soap opera ‘Neighbours’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚的肥皂剧《邻居》

Exponent.DEF: an amusing programme in which there is a different story each week about the same group of people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the American sitcom ‘Friends’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国情景喜剧《老友记》

Exponent.DEF: television programmes that show real people in funny situations or situations in which they must compete with each other. Often the people are filmed continuously for weeks or months.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the reality TV show ‘Big Brother’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视真人秀《老大哥》

Exponent.DEF: a programme, event etc that is broadcast on the Internet
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Universities may record and broadcast some lectures as webcasts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学可以把一些讲座录下来在网络上播出。

Exponent.DEF: a file of recorded sound and sometimes pictures that you can download from the Internet
Exponent.TRAN: 播客〔可从因特网上下载的广播节目〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The interview is available as a podcast.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 播客上有这次采访。

Sense.DEF: to set a machine to operate in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 预调﹐设置〔机器使之按某种方式运作〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve programmed the video to come on at ten.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经把这台录像机预设为10点钟开机。

Sense.DEF: if a person or an animal is programmed socially or biologically to do something, they do it without thinking
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或动物因社会或生理原因天生〕按某种方式行动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All birds of this species are programmed to build their nests in the same way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种鸟生来都会以同样的方式筑巢。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for something to happen as part of a series of planned events or activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s programmed for this afternoon?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午有什么安排？

Sense.DEF: a method of learning in which the subject to be learned is divided into small parts, and you have to get one part right before you can go on to the next
Sense.TRAN: 程序学习〔一种学习方法﹐要学习的科目被分成小部分﹐学习者必须掌握一部分之后才能进入下一部分〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to write computer programs
the activity of writing programs for computers, or something written by a programmer
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机的〕程序编写﹐程序设计﹔程序
Sense.EXAMPLE: a course in computer programming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机编程的课程

Sense.DEF: television or radio programmes, or the planning of these broadcasts
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或广播〕节目﹔电视[广播]节目策划﹐编排
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Olympics received hundreds of hours of television programming over the summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季奥运会期间有数百个小时的电视节目对其进行报道。

Sense.DEF: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been significant progress in controlling heart disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在控制心脏病方面取得了很大的进展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are making steady progress towards a peaceful settlement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正逐步达成和平协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Little progress has been made on human rights issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在人权问题上没有什么进步。

Sense.DEF: slow or steady movement somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 〔向某地的〕缓慢行进﹔稳步前进
Sense.EXAMPLE: We made good progress despite the snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管下雪﹐我们的行程还是很顺利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They watched the ship’s slow progress through the heavy seas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们看着那艘船在波涛汹涌的海面上缓慢前行。

Sense.DEF: change which is thought to lead to a better society, because of developments in science or fairer methods of social organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mankind is destroying the planet, all in the name of progress because people want progress .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假借发展的名义﹐人类正在毁灭地球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under communism, nothing was allowed to get in the way of the great march of progress .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在共产主义制度下﹐一切阻挡进步洪流的事都是不允许的。

Sense.DEF: happening now, and not yet finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lecture was in progress in the main hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主厅正在进行一场讲座。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They looked in periodically to check the work in progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们时不时地朝里张望﹐以查看正在进行的工作。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Progress is an uncountable noun. Do not say ‘a progress’ or ‘progresses’. progress
F2NBox.TRAN: 是不可数名词。 不要说 a progress 或 progresses
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She is making good progress (NOT不说 a good progress).

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country has made significant economic progress.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国经济取得了很大的进步。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it slower
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Language problems might hinder a child’s progress at school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言问题可能会妨碍儿童的学习进步。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The talks ended with no real progress having been achieved.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判结束了,未能取得实质性的进展。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A social worker calls regularly to check on the children’s progress.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名社会工作者经常打电话来查看孩子们的进步情况。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: keep checking it
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 关注/监测/记录某人的进展

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The task remains difficult and progress has been slow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 任务依然艰难,进展十分缓慢。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Steady progress has been made towards our objectives.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经朝着目标取得了稳步进展。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is out of hospital and making good progress.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出院了,正在迅速恢复健康。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Significant progress has been made in reducing nuclear weapons.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在削减核武器方面已取得了重大进展。

Exponent.DEF: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a test of the students’ progress
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对学生学习进度的一次测验
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We have made good progress towards meeting our objectives.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向着实现目标的方向取得了很大的进展。

Exponent.DEF: a discovery, invention, or change that brings progress
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the technological advances of the twentieth century
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪的科技进步

Exponent.DEF: an important discovery or achievement that makes progress possible, especially one that happens suddenly after a long period of trying
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The breakthrough in the investigation came when police found a stolen car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方找到一辆被盗汽车,调查有了突破。

Exponent.DEF: to make progress towards achieving something – used especially when it is difficult to make progress
Exponent.TRAN: 取得进展〔尤在较难取得进展时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After several months of discussion, the committee had made little headway.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过几个月的讨论,委员会几乎没取得什么进展。

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which no further progress can be made because two groups or organizations cannot find a way to end a disagreement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The negotiations ended in deadlock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判陷入了僵局。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At that point the strike appeared to have reached a stalemate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那个阶段,罢工似乎陷入了僵局。

Exponent.DEF: a situation in which progress has stopped completely, especially because people cannot agree on what to do next
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the continuing impasse over the budget
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 预算案的持续僵局

Exponent.DEF: to slowly stop making any progress
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The economy seems to be grinding to a halt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济似乎逐渐停滞不前。

Sense.DEF: to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She started with a cleaning job, and progressed to running the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从清洁工做起﹐一路晋升到公司的管理层。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must progress towards full integration of Catholic and Protestant pupils in Ireland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须争取使爱尔兰的天主教和新教小学生完全融合在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last year the team didn’t progress beyond the opening round.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年该队首轮即遭淘汰。

Sense.DEF: if an activity such as work or a project progresses, or you progress it, it continues
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work on the ship progressed quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮船的建造进展迅速。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re hoping to progress the Lane project more quickly next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望下星期可以更快地推进莱恩计划。

Sense.DEF: if time or an event progresses, time passes
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the meeting progressed, Nina grew more and more bored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议继续着﹐尼娜越来越不耐烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time is progressing, so I’ll be brief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间在一点点过去﹐我长话短说吧。

Sense.DEF: to move forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our taxi seemed to be progressing very slowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的出租车似乎开得非常慢。

Sense.DEF: a gradual process of change or development

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the natural progression of the disease
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 病情的自然发展

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his career progression through the organization
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这个机构中的职业晋升

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the logical progression from accountant to financial controller
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从会计到财务主管的合理晋升

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Europe’s progression towards economic and monetary union
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲经济和货币统一的进程

Sense.DEF: a number of things coming one after the other
supporting new or modern ideas and methods, especially in politics and education
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在政治和教育方面〕进步的﹐先进的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a progressive administration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进步的政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: progressive and forward-looking policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有前瞻性的进步政策

Sense.DEF: happening or developing gradually over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 逐步发生的﹐逐步发展的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the progressive increase in population
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口的逐步增加
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain’s progressive decline as a world power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国作为世界强国的逐步衰落

Sense.DEF:
the progressive form of a verb is used to show that an action or activity is continuing to happen. In English, it consists of the verb ‘be’ followed by the
present participle
, as in ‘I was waiting for the bus’.

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The economic situation became progressively worse.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济形势变得越来越糟。

Sense.DEF: someone with modern ideas who wants to change things
a tax that takes more money from people with higher incomes than from people with lower incomes
a statement about how something, especially work, is developing
to say that an action is illegal or not allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厂区严禁吸烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are prohibited from revealing details about the candidates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被禁止透露候选人的详情。

Sense.DEF: to make something impossible or prevent it from happening
the act of saying that something is illegal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the prohibition of the sale of firearms
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪支的禁售

Sense.DEF: an order stopping something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a prohibition on Sunday trading
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止星期天营业的法令

Sense.DEF: the period from 1919 to 1933 in the US when the production and sale of alcoholic drinks was illegal
Sense.TRAN: 禁酒时期〔1919至1933年间美国禁止生产和销售酒的时期〕

Sense.DEF: someone who supported Prohibition
Sense.TRAN: 赞成禁酒者﹐禁酒主义者

Sense.DEF: prohibitive costs are so high that they prevent people from buying or doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格〕高得负担不起的﹐贵得使人望而却步的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of land in Tokyo is prohibitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东京地价令人望而却步。

Sense.DEF: a prohibitive rule prevents people from doing things
Sense.TRAN: 〔规定〕禁止性的﹐起阻止作用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: prohibitive regulations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁律

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Moving house would be prohibitively expensive.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬家的费用可能会高得惊人。

Sense.DEF: intended to stop something
a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-year research project
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项为期三年的研究计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project a small trial to test if an idea will be successful .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试行成功后﹐该方案现在将得到推广。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a project to develop a substitute for oil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发一种石油替代品的计划

Sense.EXAMPLE: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目由威康公司资助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a project manager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 项目经理

Sense.DEF: a part of a school or college course that involves careful study of a particular subject over a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re doing a project on pollution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在做一个关于污染的课题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a geography project
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个地理课题

Sense.DEF:
a
housing project
Sense.TRAN: 〔供低收入家庭居住的〕住宅区

Sense.DEF: to calculate what something will be in the future, using the information you have now
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company projected an annual growth rate of 3%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司预计每年的增长率为3%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: projected sales figures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计的销售数字

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Total expenditure is projected to rise by 25%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总开支预计增加25%。

Sense.DEF: to stick out beyond an edge or surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Four towers projected from the main building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从主楼上凸出来四个塔楼。

Sense.EXAMPLE: projecting teeth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 龅牙

Sense.DEF: to make the picture of a film, photograph etc appear in a larger form on a screen or flat surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She projected the slide onto the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将幻灯片投射到墙上。

Sense.DEF: to try to make other people have a particular idea about you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope the team will project a smart professional image .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望该队能树立一种时髦﹑专业的形象。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his attempts to project himself as a potential leader
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图表现出自己作为未来领导的样子

Sense.DEF: to be planned to happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: the projected closure of the hospital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划关闭这所医院

Sense.DEF: to speak clearly and loudly so that you can be heard by everyone in a big room
Sense.TRAN: 放开声音〔使大房间的每个人都能听见〕

Sense.DEF: to make something move up or forwards with great force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plant projects its seeds over a wide area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种植物可以把种子散播到很大的范围。

Sense.DEF: to make someone quickly have success or a much better job
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕迅速成功﹔让〔某人〕迅速获得更好的工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His success projected him onto Channel 4’s comedy series ‘Packet of Three’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的成功让自己跻身于第四频道的系列喜剧《三人帮》中。

Sense.DEF: to imagine that someone else is feeling the same emotions as you
Sense.TRAN: 想象〔他人〕具有〔自己的思想感情〕﹔把〔自己的感情〕投射到他人身上

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re projecting your insecurity onto me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在把自己的不安全感强加到我身上。

Sense.DEF:
an object that is thrown at someone or is fired from a gun or other weapon, such as a bullet, stone, or
shell
Sense.TRAN: 投掷物﹔抛射体﹔发射物〔如子弹﹑石头或炮弹〕

Sense.DEF:
when someone
vomit s
with a lot of force, especially because they have drunk too much alcohol – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 喷射状呕吐〔尤因喝了太多酒﹔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a statement or calculation about what something will be in the future or was in the past, based on information available now
Sense.TRAN: 〔对于未来情况的〕预测﹔〔对过去的〕估算

GramExa.EXAMPLE: projections of declining natural gas production
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对呈下降趋势的天然气产量的预测

GramExa.EXAMPLE: population projections for the next 25 years
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对未来25年的人口预测

Sense.EXAMPLE: He declined to make projections about fourth quarter earnings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝估算第四季度的收入。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Early projections show a three point lead for the Socialists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期的预测表明社会党人领先三个百分点。

Sense.DEF: something that sticks out from a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: small projections of weathered rock on the hillside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山坡上许多凸出的小块风化岩石

Sense.DEF: the act of projecting a film or picture onto a screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔幻灯片的〕投射﹐投影﹔〔电影的〕放映
Sense.EXAMPLE: projection equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投影设备

Sense.DEF: the act of imagining that someone else is feeling the same emotions as you
Sense.TRAN: 投射〔想象别人与自己有同样的感受〕

Sense.DEF: a representation of something solid on a flat surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: a map projection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投影地图

Sense.DEF: something that you imagine to have particular qualities because of your wishes or feelings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Devil is a projection of our fears and insecurities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 魔鬼是我们自身恐惧和不安全感的主观体现。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to show films by operating a projector
a piece of equipment that makes a film or picture appear on a screen or flat surface

the slipping of an inner part of your body, such as the
womb
, from its usual position
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体内部器官﹐如子宫的〕脱垂﹐脱出﹐下垂

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for a working-class person

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 与单数或复数动词连用
Sense.DEF:
the class of workers who own no property and work for wages, especially in factories, building things etc – used in
socialist
writings

someone who is pro-life is opposed to
abortion
and uses this word to describe their opinion
Sense.TRAN: 反对堕胎的﹐反对人工流产的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pro-life activist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反堕胎积极分子

Sense.DEF: if something proliferates, it increases quickly and spreads to many different places
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer courses continue to proliferate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机课程层出不穷。

Sense.DEF: a sudden increase in the amount or number of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the proliferation of global media networks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球媒体网络的激增

Sense.DEF: the very fast growth of new parts of a living thing, such as cells
a prolific artist, writer etc produces many works of art, books etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术家﹑作家等〕多产的﹐作品丰富的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Handel’s prolific output of opera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韩德尔丰富的歌剧作品

Sense.DEF:
a prolific sports player produces a lot of runs,
goal s
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the most prolific goalscorer this decade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这十年来得分最多的射手

Sense.DEF: an animal or plant that is prolific produces many babies or many other plants
existing in large numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prolific bird life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的鸟类

Sense.DEF: a prolix piece of writing has too many words and is boring
the introduction to a play, a long poem etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧等的〕序幕﹐开场白﹔〔长诗等的〕序诗﹐序

Sense.DEF: an act or event that leads to a more important event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a prologue to the final abandonment of trams in London
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦最终弃用有轨电车的开端

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer
Sense.TRAN: 延长﹐拉长﹐拖长〔感觉或活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

Sense.DEF: to make an unpleasant or anxious time last longer, especially when people are waiting for news
Sense.TRAN: 延长痛苦〔尤指拖延告诉某人他很想知道的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no point in prolonging the agony any longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要再拖着不说﹐让人等得这么着急。

Sense.DEF: the act of making something last longer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the prolongation of life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 延长生命

Sense.DEF: something added to another thing which makes it longer
continuing for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: prolonged exposure to the sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间暴露在阳光下
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prolonged period of time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很长一段时间

Sense.DEF:
a formal dance party for
high school
students, often held at the end of a school year
Sense.TRAN: 〔常在学年末举行的〕高中生正式舞会

Sense.DEF:
a
promenade 1

a
promenade concert
a wide road next to the beach, where people can walk for pleasure
a walk for pleasure in a public place
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evening promenade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜晚的散步

Sense.DEF: a concert at which many of the people who are listening stand rather than sit
Sense.TRAN: 漫步音乐会﹐逍遥音乐会〔很多听众站着听的音乐会〕

Sense.DEF: the upper level of a ship, where people can walk for pleasure
the fact of being important and well known

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the prominence of pressure groups as political forces
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力集团作为政治力量的重要性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She first came to prominence as an artist in 1989.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她于1989年在艺术界崭露头角。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sth prominence/give prominence to sth
Sense.DEF: to treat something as specially important
Sense.TRAN: 重视某事物/注重某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every newspaper gave prominence to the success of England’s cricketers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每家报纸都对英格兰板球运动员的成功大加报道。

Sense.DEF: a part or place that is higher than what is around it
important
Sense.TRAN: 重要的﹔著名的﹔卓越的﹐杰出的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prominent Russian scientist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰出的俄罗斯科学家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mandela played a prominent role in the early years of the ANC.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼德拉在非国大创立初期起了重要的作用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The World Cup will have a prominent place on the agenda.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界杯赛将占据议程表的重要位置。

Sense.DEF: something that is in a prominent place is easily seen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The statue was in a prominent position outside the railway station.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座雕像位于火车站外的显著位置。

Sense.DEF: something that is prominent is large and sticks out
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prominent nose
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高鼻子

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Her photo was prominently displayed on his desk.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的照片放在他书桌上显眼的地方。

Sense.DEF: having many sexual partners
Sense.TRAN: 与多人发生性关系的﹐淫乱的﹐滥交的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the risks of promiscuous sexual behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不检点性行为的危险

Sense.DEF: involving a wide range of different things
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s promised to do all she can to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她答应尽力帮忙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hurry up – we promised we wouldn’t be late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐我们保证过不会迟到的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You promised me the car would be ready on Monday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你答应过我车子星期一可以用。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Promise me you won’t do anything stupid.’ ‘I promise.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “答应我你不会做蠢事。” 我答应。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve promised that book to Ian, I’m afraid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经答应把那本书给伊恩了﹐对不起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company promised us a bonus this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司承诺今年给我们发奖金。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll be back by 1.00.’ ‘ Promise ?’ ‘Yes! Don’t worry.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我1点钟前会回来。”“你保证？”“是的！别担心。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: He reappeared two hours later, as promised.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就像他保证过的﹐他两小时后再次露面。

Sense.DEF: to show signs of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tonight’s meeting promises to be a difficult one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的会议有可能不容易对付。

Sense.EXAMPLE: dark clouds promising showers later
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预示着稍后有阵雨的乌云

Sense.DEF: to promise to give someone something that is impossible for you to give
used to tell someone that you will try to do what they want, but may not be able to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll try my best to get tickets, but I can’t promise anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会尽我所能弄到门票﹐但我不能保证什么。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a promise, warning, or statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: I promise you, it does work!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我保你管用！

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone that you will definitely do something, or that something will happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He promised to give the book back.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他答应要归还那本书。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The organisers have promised that this year’s event will take place.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 组织者已承诺本年度的活动将会举行。

Exponent.DEF: to make a very serious and sincere promise, for example in a law court
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had sworn to tell the truth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他宣誓说实话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I would never do that, I swear.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发誓决不会那么做的。

Exponent.DEF: to promise sincerely that you will do something or that something is true – often used when you are trying to persuade someone that they can trust you
Exponent.TRAN: 向某人保证,答应某人 〔常用于劝说某人信任自己〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I give you my word that your money is safe with me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向你保证,你的钱放在我这里很安全。

Exponent.DEF: to make a very serious promise, often to yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She vowed that she would never drink alcohol again.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发誓再也不喝酒了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They vowed to carry on their campaign for justice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发誓要将正义运动继续下去。

Exponent.DEF: to promise someone that something will happen or that something is true, in order to try to make them feel less worried
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police have assured the public that they are doing everything they can to find the killer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方向公众保证他们在尽其所能抓捕凶手。

Exponent.DEF: to promise that you will make sure that something will definitely happen, so that there is no question of it not happening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I guarantee that you will have the documents by tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我保证明天你能拿到文件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How can you guarantee that this won’t happen again?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么能担保这种事不会再次发生？

Exponent.DEF: to promise publicly or officially that you will do something, for example to give help or money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government has pledged to increase overseas aid to $4 billion over the next five years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府承诺未来五年将海外援助增加至40亿美元。

Exponent.DEF: to make an official or legal promise to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 作出〔正式或法律的〕承诺,保证
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government undertook to keep price increases to a minimum.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府许诺把物价上涨控制在最低限度。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two sides undertook to respect each other’s territory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方承诺将相互尊重对方的领土。

Exponent.DEF: to make a firm and definite promise to do something important, which will affect you for a long time and which could result in serious effects if you fail
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bobby felt unready to commit to a romantic relationship.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 博比感觉自己还没有准备好投入一段感情中。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A group of 11 companies has committed to developing a new passenger plane.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 11 家公司共同承诺开发一种新型客机。

Sense.DEF: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We received promises of support from several MPs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数名议员承诺支持我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He would never break his promise to his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决不会违背对父亲的承诺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She made a promise to visit them once a month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她答应每个月去看他们一次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his promise that the job would be mine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他作出的我将得到那份工作的承诺

Sense.DEF: signs that something or someone will be good or successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事或某人将有好结果或成功的〕迹象﹐征兆
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young man full of promise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个大有前途的年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill shows great promise as a goalkeeper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为守门员﹐比尔很有希望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t fulfil her early promise .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并未像小时候表现的那样有出息。

Sense.DEF: a sign that something, usually something good, may happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the promise of spring
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天的迹象
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The letter gave a promise of greater happiness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那封信预示了更大的幸福。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I made a promise to my mother that I’d look after Dad.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我答应母亲我会照看父亲的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do what you promised to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She said she would come back, and she kept her promise.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说过会回来的,她也说到做到了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not do what you promised to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Once again, the government has broken its promises.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府再一次食言了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As governor, I made a solemn promise to defend the laws of the Republic.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为州长,我郑重承诺要捍卫共和国的法律。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: definite
not definite
one that will not be kept
one that has not been kept

Subsense.DEF: the land of Canaan, which was promised by God to Abraham and his people in the Bible
Subsense.TRAN: 迦南﹐应许之地〔《圣经》中上帝赐给亚伯拉罕及其族人的土地〕

Subsense.DEF: a situation or place which people have been wanting to be in because they will be safe and happy there

Sense.DEF: showing signs of being successful or good in the future
Sense.TRAN: 大有希望的﹐很有前途的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a promising career in law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很有前途的法律职业
Sense.EXAMPLE: a promising young actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大有前途的年轻演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a promising start
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的开端

Sense.DEF: a document promising to pay money before a particular date
a short film that advertises an event or product
Sense.EXAMPLE: a promo video
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段广告录像

Sense.DEF: a long narrow piece of land which sticks out into the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rocky promontory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石岬

Sense.DEF: to help something to develop or increase
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meeting to promote trade between China and the UK
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中英两国贸易促进会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fertilizer promotes leaf growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肥料促进叶子的生长。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a better more responsible job in a company

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Helen was promoted to senior manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦被提升为高级经理。

Sense.DEF: to help sell a new product, film etc by offering it at a reduced price or by advertising it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s in London to promote her new book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她来伦敦宣传她的新书。

Sense.DEF: if a sports team is promoted, they play in a better group of teams the next year

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have been promoted to the First Division.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已晋级为甲级队。

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade people to support or use something
Sense.EXAMPLE: John Major promoted the idea of a classless society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰 · 梅杰倡导无阶级社会的观点。

Sense.DEF: to be responsible for arranging a large public event such as a concert or a sports game
Sense.TRAN: 负责筹办﹐主办〔大型活动﹐如音乐会或体育比赛〕

Sense.DEF: someone who arranges and advertises concerts or sports events
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐会或体育比赛的〕主办者﹐承办者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boxing promoter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拳击比赛承办人

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to persuade people to support or use something
Sense.EXAMPLE: promoters of solar energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳能倡导者

Sense.DEF: a move to a more important job or position in a company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want a job with good prospects for promotion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要一份有良好晋升机会的工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your promotion to Senior Editor is now official.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在你被正式提升为高级编辑。

Sense.DEF: an activity intended to help sell a product, or the product that is being promoted
Sense.TRAN: 〔产品的〕促销﹐推销﹔促销[推销]的产品
Sense.EXAMPLE: a winter sales promotion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬季促销活动

Sense.DEF: the activity of persuading people to support something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the promotion of energy conservation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提倡能源节约

Sense.DEF: the activity of helping something to develop or increase

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the promotion of international environmental cooperation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 增进国际间的环境合作

Sense.DEF: when a sports team moves into a better group of teams
promotional films, events etc advertise something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a promotional video
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣传录像

Sense.DEF: to make someone decide to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What prompted you to buy that suit?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么原因让你买下了那套西装？

Sense.DEF: to make people say or do something as a reaction
Sense.TRAN: 引起﹐激起〔某人说或做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision prompted an outcry among prominent US campaigners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项决定激起了美国著名活动家的强烈抗议。

Sense.DEF: to help a speaker who pauses, by suggesting how to continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I can’t decide,’ said Beatrice. ‘Decide what?’ prompted Marlon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我决定不了。”比阿特丽斯说。“决定什么？”马龙追问道。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone to do something on a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: A message will appear which will prompt you for certain information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会有信息显示﹐提醒你输入某些资料。

Sense.DEF: to remind an actor of the next words in a speech
done quickly, immediately, or at the right time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prompt action must be taken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须立即采取行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prompt payment is requested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请立即付款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prompt response
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迅速的答复

Sense.DEF: someone who is prompt arrives or does something at the right time and is not late
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lunch is at two. Try to be prompt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两点钟吃午饭﹐请尽量准时。

Sense.DEF: at the time mentioned and no later
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus will leave at 8 o’clock prompt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车将于8点准时出发。

Sense.DEF: a word or words said to an actor in a play, to help them remember what to say
a sign on a computer screen which shows that the computer has finished one operation and is ready to begin the next
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕上的〕提示符〔显示计算机已完成某项操作﹐准备进入下一项〕

Sense.DEF: someone who tells actors in a play what words to say when they forget
at the right time without being late
Sense.EXAMPLE: She arrived promptly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她准时到了。

Sense.DEF: immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned off the alarm and promptly went back to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她关掉闹钟﹐马上又睡着了。

Sense.DEF: without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: A reply came very promptly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马上就有了答复。

Sense.DEF: to spread an idea or belief to as many people as possible
to make a new law come into effect by announcing it officially

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=pronoun代词

Sense.DEF: likely to do something or suffer from something, especially something bad or harmful
Sense.TRAN: 易于发生某事〔尤指不好或有害的事〕的﹔很可能…的﹔有…倾向的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some plants are very prone to disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些植物很容易得病。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kids are all prone to eat junk food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子往往都会吃垃圾食品。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always been accident-prone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是出事故。

Sense.DEF: lying down with the front of your body facing down
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes shifted to the prone body on the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的视线移向了趴在地上的尸体。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Jack lay prone on his bed.

Sense.DEF: a thin sharp point of something such as a fork that has several points
Sense.EXAMPLE: sticking out like the prongs of a garden fork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像园艺叉的叉齿一样伸出来

Sense.DEF: one of two or three ways of achieving something which are used at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔双管齐下时的〕一个方面﹐〔兵分三路时的〕一路

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the second prong of the attack
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二路进攻

Sense.DEF:
related to or used like a
pronoun
a word that is used instead of a noun or noun phrase, such as ‘he’ instead of ‘Peter’ or ‘the man’
to make the sound of a letter, word etc, especially in the correct way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指正确地〕发〔字母﹑词等〕的音
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you pronounce your name?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的名字怎么念？

Sense.DEF: to officially state that something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The victim was pronounced dead on arrival.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害人送到时被宣布死亡。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I now pronounce you man and wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在宣布你们结为夫妻。

Sense.DEF: to give a judgment or opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scheme was pronounced a failure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该方案宣告失败。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He used to pronounce on matters he knew nothing about.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过去总是对他一窍不通的事情夸夸其谈。

Sense.DEF: to give a legal judgment

GramExa.GLOSS: tell a court of law what punishment a criminal will have

Sense.DEF: a word, name etc that is pronounceable is easy to say
Sense.TRAN: 〔词﹑名字等〕容易念的﹐容易发音的

Sense.DEF: very great or noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pronounced Polish accent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明显的波兰口音
Sense.EXAMPLE: This disability is more pronounced in men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种障碍在男性中表现得更为明显。

Sense.DEF: an official public statement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Pope’s last pronouncement on birth control
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马教皇关于控制生育的最新声明

Sense.DEF: quickly or immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better get back here pronto.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好马上回来。

Sense.DEF: the way in which a language or a particular word is pronounced

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you know the correct pronunciation of these Gaelic names?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道这些盖尔语名字的正确发音吗？

Sense.DEF: a particular person’s way of pronouncing a word or words
facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: proof of the existence of life on other planets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他星球上存在生命的证据
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This latest interview was further proof of how good at her job Cara was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的这次面谈进一步证明了卡拉的工作有多出色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you have any proof that this man stole your bag?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有什么证据证明这个男人偷了你的包吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no proof that the document is authentic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有证据证明这份文件是真的。

Sense.DEF: a copy of a piece of writing or a photograph that is checked carefully before the final printing is done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you check these proofs?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能核对一下这些校样吗？

Subsense.DEF: a test in mathematics of whether a calculation is correct

a list of reasons that shows a
theorem statement
in
geometry
to be true

Sense.LEXUNIT: the proof of the pudding (is in the eating)
Sense.DEF: used to say that you can only know whether something is good or bad after you have tried it
Sense.TRAN: 布丁好不好﹐吃了才知道〔只有通过体验才能判断事物的好坏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proof of pudding will be team’s performance this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好坏还得看本赛季球队的表现。

Sense.DEF:
a measurement of the strength of some types of alcoholic drink, especially
spirit s
Sense.EXAMPLE: 70% proof vodka that contains 70% pure alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精度为70%的伏特加酒
Sense.EXAMPLE: 70 proof vodka that contains 35% pure alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精度为35%的伏特加酒

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The newspaper claimed it had proof that I worked for the CIA.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那份报纸声称有证据证明我为中央情报局工作。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You will be required to provide proof of your identity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 会要求你提供身份证明。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He needed proof to back up those allegations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他需要为那些指控提供证据。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is now proof that giant squid do exist.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在有证据证明巨型鱿鱼确实存在。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: additional proof
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He showed his driving licence as further proof of his identity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出示了驾驶执照作为身份的进一步证明。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They say they have scientific proof that the treatment works.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说有科学证据证明那种疗法有效。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone whose existence or experience proves something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She is living proof that stress need not necessarily be ageing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力不一定会让人变老,她就是活生生的证明。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His indecision is clear proof of his inability to handle the situation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的优柔寡断就是他没有能力处理这种情况的明证。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: definite proof
something that proves who you are
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you have any proof of identity, such as a passport?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有什么身份证明吗,比如说护照之类？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that proves you bought something from a particular place
definite proof that cannot be doubted
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Here is proof positive that she’s wrong.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有表明她错了的确凿证据。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the need to prove that you are right in a legal case
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The burden of proof is on the prosecution.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 举证责任在控方。

Sense.DEF: to be too strong or good to be affected by something bad
Sense.TRAN: 能抵抗某物﹔能对抗某物﹔能防御某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their defences are proof against most weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的防卫工事可以抵挡大多数武器的攻击。

Sense.DEF: to treat a material with a substance in order to protect it against water, oil etc
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某材料〕作防水[油]处理

GramExa.EXAMPLE: climbing gear proofed against water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经防水处理的登山用具

Sense.DEF: to proofread something
used to describe something which a particular thing cannot harm or pass through, or which protects people against that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bulletproof car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防弹汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: a waterproof jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防水上衣
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ovenproof dish that cannot be harmed by heat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耐热盘子

Sense.DEF: used to describe something which cannot easily be affected or damaged by someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a childproof container
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防儿童开启的容器
Sense.EXAMPLE: vandal-proof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防止破坏的

Sense.DEF: to treat or make something so that a particular thing cannot harm it or pass through it, or so that it gives protection against it
Sense.EXAMPLE: soundproof a room so that sound cannot get into or out of it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给房间隔音

Sense.DEF: to read through something that is written or printed in order to correct any mistakes in it
to support something by leaning it against something, or by putting something else under, next to, or behind it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He propped his bike against a tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把自行车靠在一棵树上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we prop the window open with something?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能不能用什么东西撑住窗户让它开着？

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from falling by putting something against it or under it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The builders are trying to prop up the crumbling walls of the church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工人正在设法把快要倒塌的教堂墙壁撑住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: paintings propped up against the wall
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 倚墙放的画

Sense.DEF:
to help an
economy
, industry, or government so that it can continue to exist, especially by giving money
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过提供资金〕支持﹐维持〔某经济体﹑工业或政府〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government introduced measures to prop up the stock market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府推出措施来扶持股市。

Sense.DEF: to hold your body up by leaning against something
Sense.TRAN: 靠着〔某物〕站直[坐直]﹐撑着站起[坐起]﹐撑起身体

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She propped herself up on one elbow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用一边胳膊肘撑起身子。

Sense.DEF: an object placed under or against something to hold it in a particular position
a small object such as a book, weapon etc, used by actors in a play or film
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anna looks after costumes and props.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜管理服装和道具。
Sense.EXAMPLE: stage props
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞台道具

Sense.DEF: something or someone that helps you to feel strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was becoming an emotional prop for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她成了他的感情支柱。

Sense.DEF:
a
propeller

one of the players in a
rugby
team, who is large and strong and holds up the
scrum
information which is false or which emphasizes just one part of a situation, used by a government or political group to make people agree with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府或政党为了影响民意而进行的〕宣传
Sense.EXAMPLE: the spreading of political propaganda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治宣传的开展

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 纳粹/环保主义者等的宣传

GramExa.GLOSS: something done to show one political opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have mounted a propaganda campaign against Western governments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发起了一场反西方政府的宣传运动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the government propaganda machine people who produce propaganda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的宣传机器

Sense.DEF: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people
Sense.TRAN: 传播﹐散播﹐宣传〔观点﹑信仰等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group launched a website to propagate its ideas .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

Sense.DEF: if you propagate plants, or if they propagate, they start to grow from a parent plant to produce new plants
Sense.EXAMPLE: Propagate your plants in fresh soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让你的植物在新鲜土壤中繁殖。

Sense.DEF: if an animal, insect, etc propagates itself or is propagated, it increases in number
someone who spreads ideas, beliefs etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想﹑信仰等的〕传播者﹐宣传者

Sense.DEF: a covered box of soil in which young plants or seeds are placed so that they can grow
Sense.TRAN: 〔供幼苗或种子生长的〕培育箱

Sense.DEF: a colourless gas used for cooking and heating
to move, drive, or push something forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boat propelled by a small motor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由小马达驱动的小船
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of our students was unable to propel her wheelchair up the ramp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有名学生无法把她的轮椅推上坡道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She used the sticks to propel herself along.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拄着棍子往前走。

Sense.DEF: to make someone move in a particular direction, especially by pushing them
Sense.TRAN: 推搡〔某人走向特定方向〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took her arm and propelled her towards the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓着她的手臂﹐推着她向门口走去。

Sense.DEF: to move someone into a new situation or make them do something
Sense.TRAN: 使处于…的境况﹔驱使﹐迫使

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film propelled her to stardom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影让她成了明星。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Company directors were propelled into action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的董事们被迫采取行动。

Sense.DEF:
an explosive for firing a bullet or
rocket
Sense.TRAN: 发射火药﹔推进剂﹔火箭燃料

Sense.DEF:
gas which is used in an
aerosol
to
spray
out a liquid
Sense.TRAN: 〔置于喷雾器中提供压力的〕压缩气体﹔喷射剂

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment consisting of two or more blades that spin around, which makes an aircraft or ship move
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机或轮船的〕螺旋桨﹐推进器

Sense.DEF:
a pencil made of plastic or metal, in which the
lead the part used for making marks
can be pushed out as it is used
a natural tendency to behave in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the male propensity to fight
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性好斗的天性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He seems to have a propensity for breaking things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像老是打碎东西。

Sense.DEF: right, suitable, or correct
Sense.TRAN: 正确的﹔合适的﹐适当的﹔恰当的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything was in its proper place where it should be .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每样东西都放在恰当的位置。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the proper way to clean your teeth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正确的刷牙方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proper name for Matthew’s condition is hyperkinetic syndrome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马修的病的恰当名称是多动症。

Sense.DEF: socially or legally correct and acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 合适的﹔合理的﹔得体的﹔正规的﹔〔法律上〕正确的﹐可接受的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is proper (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t feel that it would be proper for me to give you that information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我把那资料给你不合适。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is only right and proper that an independent inquiry should take place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一正确的做法是进行独立调查。

Sense.DEF: real, or of a good and generally accepted standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: When are you going to settle down and get a proper job ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候才能安定下来找一份正经的工作？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to eat proper meals instead of fast-food takeaways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量吃点像样的饭菜﹐而不是外卖的快餐。

Sense.DEF: the real or main part of something, not other parts before, after, or near to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The friendly chat which comes before the interview proper is intended to relax the candidate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正式面试之前的友好闲聊是为了放松候选人的心情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the city centre proper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心

Subsense.DEF: belonging to one particular type of thing …
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the reasoning abilities proper to our species
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这个物种所特有的推理能力

Subsense.DEF: suitable for something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: dressed in a way that was proper to the occasion
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着适合这种场合

Sense.DEF: complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s made a proper fool of himself this time!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次他真是出尽了丑！

Sense.DEF: very polite, and careful to do what is socially correct
Sense.TRAN: 非常有礼貌的﹔循规蹈矩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was very formal and proper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一本正经﹐循规蹈矩。

Sense.DEF: completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: We beat ’em good and proper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们彻底打败了他们。

Sense.DEF:
used by some people to mean
properly
, although most people think that this is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 正确地﹐适当地〔有些人把此词当作properly用﹐尽管大多数人认为这样用不正确〕

Sense.DEF:
a
fraction
such as 3⁄4, in which the number above the line is smaller than the one below it
correctly, or in a way that is considered right
Sense.EXAMPLE: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刹车似乎不正常。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么他没把分内事做好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: properly trained staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 训练有素的员工

Sense.DEF: completely or fully
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the chicken properly defrosted?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡肉彻底解冻了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The allegations were never properly investigated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些指控从未得到彻底调查。

Sense.DEF: really
Sense.EXAMPLE: Documents properly belonging to the family were taken away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本来属于那家人的文件被拿走了。

GramExa.GLOSS: really
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际上
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It isn’t, properly speaking, a real science.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那实际上不是真正的科学。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is right to do something
Sense.TRAN: 理所当然﹐合情合理〔用于表示某人做某事是正确的〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People are, quite properly, proud of their homes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们为自己的家感到自豪﹐这是应该的。

Sense.DEF:
a noun such as ‘James’, ‘New York’, or ‘China’ that is the name of one particular thing and is written with a
capital
letter
owning a lot of property or land
Sense.TRAN: 有很多财产的﹔有大量地产的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the propertied classes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有产阶级

Sense.DEF: the thing or things that someone owns
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

Sense.DEF: a building, a piece of land, or both together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Property prices have shot up recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近房地产价格暴涨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the property market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房地产市场
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sign saying ‘ Private Property . Keep Out.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写有“私人宅邸﹐非请莫入”的标牌
Sense.EXAMPLE: property taxes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物业税

Sense.DEF: a quality or power that a substance, plant etc has
Sense.EXAMPLE: a herb with healing properties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有治疗功效的药草

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the chemical properties of a substance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种物质的化学特性

Sense.DEF: someone who makes money by buying land and building on it
a statement that something will happen in the future, especially one made by someone with religious or magic powers

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prophecy that David would become King was fulfilled .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大卫将成为国王的预言应验了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the prophecy of Isaiah
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以赛亚的预言

Sense.DEF: the power or act of making statements about what will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had the gift of prophecy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有预言的天赋。

Sense.DEF: to say what will happen in the future, especially using religious or magical knowledge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He prophesied that a flood would cover the earth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他预言洪水将淹没大地。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a great war between the countries, just as the elders had prophesied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正像长者们所预言的﹐那些国家之间爆发了一场大规模战争。

Sense.DEF: a man who people in the Christian, Jewish, or Muslim religion believe has been sent by God to lead them and teach them their religion
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教﹑犹太教或伊斯兰教的〕先知
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prophet Elijah
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先知以利亚

Sense.DEF: Muhammad, who began the Muslim religion
Sense.TRAN: 穆罕默德〔伊斯兰教的创始人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: followers of the Prophet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆罕默德的追随者

Sense.DEF: the Jewish holy men whose writings form part of the Old Testament first part of the Bible , or the writings themselves
Sense.TRAN: 犹太教诸先知〔其著作构成《圣经·旧约》的一部分〕﹔先知书

Sense.DEF: someone who claims that they know what will happen in the future

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who says that bad things will happen
someone whose claims about the future are not true
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 伪先知〔作虚假预言的人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who introduces and spreads a new idea
Sense.TRAN: 〔新观念的〕提倡者﹐首倡者﹐倡导者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gandhi was the prophet of non-violent protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 甘地是非暴力抗议的倡导者。

Sense.DEF: a woman who people believe has been sent by God to lead them
correctly saying what will happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 预言正确的﹐有先见之明的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It turned out to be a prophetic piece of journalism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实证明那则新闻作出了正确的预言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lundgren’s warnings proved prophetic .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实证明伦德格伦的警告是有先见之明的。

Sense.DEF: like a prophet, or related to the things a prophet says or does
intended to prevent disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: prophylactic antibiotics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预防性抗生素

Sense.DEF: something used to prevent disease

a
condom
– often used humorously
a treatment for preventing disease
the fact of being near someone or something, or of being related to someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔空间上的〕接近﹐邻近﹔〔血统上的〕近亲关系

Sense.DEF: to make someone who has been unfriendly or angry with you feel more friendly by doing something to please them
intended to please someone and make them feel less angry and more friendly
Sense.TRAN: 抚慰的﹐劝解的﹔取悦的﹔哄人息怒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a propitiatory gift of flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为和解而送的鲜花

Sense.DEF: good and likely to bring good results
Sense.EXAMPLE: a propitious moment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有利时机

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Conditions after the 1905 revolution were propitious for stable development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1905 年革命之后的形势有利于稳定发展。

Sense.DEF: someone who supports something or persuades people to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steinem has always been a strong proponent of women’s rights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯泰纳姆一向是妇女权利的坚决支持者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dr George is one of the leading proponents of this view.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治博士是这种观点的主要拥护者。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proportion of women graduates has increased in recent years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来女大学毕业生的比例有所上升。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Every parent is asked to contribute a proportion of the total cost.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每位家长都被要求认捐一部分费用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The decision affects a significant proportion of the population.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项决定影响到相当大一部分人口。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Although the majority of offenders are men, a small proportion – about five percent – are women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管罪犯主要是男性﹐但女性也占据了一小部分——大约5%。

Sense.DEF: the relationship between two things in size, amount, importance etc

GramExa.PROPFORM: the proportion of sth to sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rewards you get in this job are in direct proportion to the effort you put in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你做这份工作的报酬与你付出的努力成正比。

Sense.DEF: the correct or most suitable relationship between the size, shape, or position of the different parts of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物各组成部分的〕相称﹔协调﹔均衡﹔匀称
Sense.EXAMPLE: Builders must learn about scale and proportion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑师必须学习比例和均衡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reduce the drawing so that all the elements stay in proportion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缩小这幅画以使各部分保持协调。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: to sth Her feet are small in proportion to her height.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脚相对于她的身高来说很小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The porch is out of proportion with too big or too small when compared with the rest of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门廊与房子的其他部分不成比例。

Subsense.DEF: the size or importance of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Try to reduce your tasks to more manageable proportions .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量把你的工作减少到较易处理的量。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an ecological tragedy of enormous proportions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其严重的生态悲剧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For most of us, Scott was a hero of mythic proportions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我们大多数人来说﹐斯科特是一个神话般的英雄。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The flu outbreak has reached epidemic proportions .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 流感的爆发已到了流行病的程度。

Subsense.DEF: the relative sizes of the different parts of a building, object etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a building of classic proportions
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合乎经典比例的建筑
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the elegant proportions of the living room
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比例雅致的起居室

Sense.DEF: too big, great, or strong in relation to something
Sense.TRAN: （相对某事物来说）超出比例﹔与…不相称

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fear of violent crime has now risen out of all proportion to the actual risk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对暴力犯罪的恐惧大大超出了实际的危险。

GramExa.GLOSS: treat something as more serious than it really is
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Aren’t you getting things rather out of proportion?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不是把事情想得太糟了？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole issue has been blown out of all proportion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整件事被过分夸大了。

Sense.DEF: to react to a situation sensibly, and not think that it is worse or more serious than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 办事情[看问题]恰如其分﹔不把问题看得太糟[太严重]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s keep things in proportion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们别把事情看得太糟。

Sense.DEF: the ability to judge what is most important in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 区别轻重缓急的能力﹔主次观念

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can protest by all means, but keep a sense of proportion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你自然可以抗议﹐但是要分清主次。

Sense.DEF: equality in the mathematical relationship between two sets of numbers, as in the statement ‘8 is to 6 as 32 is to 24’
to put something in a particular relationship with something else according to their relative size, amount, position etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The amount of damages awarded are proportioned to the degree of injury caused.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁定的损害赔偿金额和造成的伤害程度成正比。

Sense.DEF: something that is proportional to something else is in the correct or most suitable relationship to it in size, amount, importance etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The punishment should be proportional to the crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 惩罚应与罪行相当。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The fee charged by the realtor is directly proportional to the price of the property.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房产代理人收取的费用和房产价格是成正比的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a proportional increase in costs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本的相应提高

Sense.DEF: a system of voting in elections by which all political parties are represented in the government according to the number of votes they receive in the whole country
Sense.TRAN: 比例代表制〔各政党按其在全国所得票数而获得议席的一种选举制度〕

Sense.DEF: used to talk about how correct, attractive, suitable etc something is in its size or shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Arnold’s perfectly proportioned body
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿诺德匀称的身材

Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautifully proportioned room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比例协调的房间

Sense.DEF: a plan or suggestion which is made formally to an official person or group, or the act of making it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the government’s proposals for regulation of the industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对监管该行业的提议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee put forward a proposal to reduce the time limit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该委员会提出了一个缩短时限的建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They rejected proposals that the President should be directly elected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拒绝了直接选举总统的提议。

Sense.DEF: when you ask someone to marry you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She politely declined his proposal of marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她礼貌地拒绝了他的求婚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’d like to make a proposal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想提个建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They put forward a proposal for a joint research project.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们提议进行一个合作研究项目。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think of one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sales staff came up with an innovative proposal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售人员想到了一个有创意的建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A committee of experts drew up proposals for a constitution.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家委员会起草了一份宪法提案。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The proposal was approved by the committee.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 提案得到了委员会的批准。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They drew up a detailed proposal and submitted it to the Department of Energy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们起草了一份详细议案并提交给能源部。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The report will make specific proposals for further investigation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告将对进一步调查提出具体的计划。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Applicants should submit a short research proposal on their chosen topic.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请人应该就选中的课题提交一份简短的研究计划。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a budget/tax plan
a plan to achieve peace

Sense.DEF: to suggest something as a plan or course of action
Sense.EXAMPLE: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革
Sense.EXAMPLE: the proposed budget cuts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所提出的预算削减

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In his speech he proposed that the UN should set up an emergency centre for the environment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在演讲中他建议联合国建立一个环境应急中心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report also proposes extending the motorway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那份报告还建议扩建这条高速公路。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘propose someone something’. Say 而要说 propose something: He proposed a compromise (NOT 不说 He proposed me a compromise). 他建议和解。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone puts forward plans, ideas etc, rather than proposes them.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,表示某人提出计划﹑想法等,人们一般说 put forward ,而不说 propose
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The idea was first put forward by a German scientist.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法最早是由一位德国科学家提出的。

Sense.DEF: to formally suggest a course of action at a meeting and ask people to vote on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔在会议上〕正式提议﹐提出…供表决

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The resolution was proposed by the chairman of the International Committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项决议是由国际委员会主席提出的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Leesom proposed Mrs Banks for the position of Treasurer he suggested formally that she should be the treasurer .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利森姆先生提议由班克斯夫人担任财务主管。

Sense.DEF: to suggest an idea, method etc as an answer to a scientific question or as a better way of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A number of theories have been proposed to explain the phenomenon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人提出了一些理论来解释这种现象。

Sense.DEF: to intend to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How does he propose to deal with the situation?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打算如何应对这种局面？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We still don’t know how the company proposes raising the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍然不知道公司准备如何筹集资金。

Subsense.DEF: to ask someone to marry you, especially in a formal way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shaun proposed to me only six months after we met.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相识仅六个月﹐肖恩就向我求婚了。

Subsense.DEF: to ask someone to marry you

Sense.DEF: to formally ask a group of people at a social event to join you in wishing someone success, happiness, etc as they raise and drink a glass of wine
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to propose a toast to the bride and groom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提议为新郎和新娘干杯。

Sense.DEF: a proposed change, plan, development etc is one that has been formally suggested to an official person or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: The document supplies details of the proposed changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那份文件提供了更改提议的细节。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is set to vote on the proposed reforms tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府将于明天对提议的改革事宜进行投票表决。

Sense.DEF: a person who formally suggests a plan, course of action etc at a meeting for people to vote on
a statement that consists of a carefully considered opinion or judgment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most people accept the proposition that we have a duty to protect endangered animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人都认同我们有义务保护濒危动物的观点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The theory is founded on two basic propositions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个理论是建立在两个基本观点之上的。

Sense.DEF: a suggestion, or something that is suggested or considered as a possible thing to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: He telephoned Stuart with a proposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打电话给斯图尔特提了个建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The offer of two tickets for the price of one makes it a very attractive proposition .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门票买一送一的提议很诱人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It doesn’t sound like a very viable proposition to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说那提议听起来似乎不太可行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a proposition to put to you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要向你提个建议。

Sense.DEF: used to say how easy someone or something will be to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 很不容易对付/很好处理等
Sense.EXAMPLE: My new boss is a very different proposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的新老板很不好对付。

Sense.DEF: a suggested change or addition to the law of a state of the US, which citizens vote on
Sense.TRAN: 〔由公民表决的美国某个州提出的〕法律修正案
Sense.EXAMPLE: Proposition147
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第147号修正案

Sense.DEF:
something that must be proved, or a question to which the answer must be found – used in
geometry
to suggest to someone that they have sex with you
Sense.TRAN: 提出与〔某人〕发生性关系﹐向〔某人〕求欢
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here, prostitutes constantly proposition tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里妓女经常勾搭游客。

Sense.DEF: to suggest an idea, explanation etc for other people to consider
Sense.TRAN: 提出〔观点﹑解释等〕供考虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The theory of natural selection was first propounded by Charles Darwin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然选择学说最初由查尔斯·达尔文提出。

Sense.DEF: unable to walk or run well

a proprietary product is one that is sold under a
trade name
Sense.EXAMPLE: a proprietary brand of insecticide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专利品牌杀虫剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: proprietary software products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专利软件产品

Sense.DEF: relating to who owns something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have proprietary rights to the data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拥有那些数据资料的所有权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has no proprietary interest in the farm he does not own any part of it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对这座农场没有所有权。

Sense.DEF: proprietary behaviour makes it seem that you think you own something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕像所有者那样的﹔所有人（似）的

Sense.DEF: an owner of a business

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the proprietor of a small hotel and restaurant
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家小旅馆兼餐馆的老板
报社/汽车修理厂/咖啡馆等老板

Sense.DEF: behaving or feeling as if you own something or someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt proprietorial about the valley.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自认为那座山谷是自己的。

Sense.DEF: a woman who owns a business
correctness of social or moral behaviour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They discussed the propriety of treating ill children against the wishes of the parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们讨论了违背父母意愿治疗患病儿童的做法是否妥当。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They conducted themselves with propriety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们行事规矩得体。

Sense.DEF: the accepted rules of correct social behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: strict in observing the proprieties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格遵守礼节的

Sense.DEF: used when you want to say publicly that someone has done something good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Props to Chris for all of his volunteer work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为克里斯所做的志愿工作向他表示敬意。

Sense.DEF: the force that drives a vehicle forward

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火箭/风/核能/喷气推进力

Sense.EXAMPLE: research into liquid hydrogen as a means of propulsion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对液态氢作为一种动力方式进行的研究

Sense.DEF: a payment or share that is pro rata is calculated according to how much of something is used, how much work is done etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fees are calculated on a pro rata basis .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费用是按照比例计算的。

Sense.DEF: to calculate a charge, price etc according to the actual amount of service received rather than by a standard sum
Sense.TRAN: 按实际接受的服务计算〔价钱等〕

Sense.DEF: boring or ordinary
Sense.TRAN: 乏味的﹐平淡无奇的﹔缺乏想象力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prosaic writing style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乏味的写作风格
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reality, however, is probably more prosaic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然而﹐事实很可能更平淡无奇。

Sense.DEF: the part of a theatre stage that is in front of the curtain
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院〕幕布前的舞台部分﹐前舞台台口
Sense.EXAMPLE: the proscenium arch the arch over the stage where the curtain can be attached
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞台前台口的拱架

Sense.DEF: to officially say that something is not allowed to exist or be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Act proscribes discrimination on the grounds of race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法令禁止种族歧视。

Sense.DEF: language in its usual form, as opposed to poetry
Sense.TRAN: 散文〔与诗歌相对的文体〕

Sense.DEF: to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shoplifters will be prosecuted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在商店行窃者将被起诉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Buxton is being prosecuted for assault.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克斯顿由于袭击罪而被起诉。

GramExa.PROPFORM: prosecute sb under a law/Act etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is to be prosecuted under the Health and Safety Act.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照《卫生安全条例》﹐这家公司将受到起诉。

Sense.DEF: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
