Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控方律师林恩·史密斯夫人称案件发生于1月27日。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We cannot prosecute the investigation further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无法继续调查下去。

Sense.DEF: when a charge is made against someone for a crime, or when someone is judged for a crime in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: a criminal prosecution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刑事诉讼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Walters could face prosecution for his role in the robbery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃尔特斯可能因参与抢劫而面临起诉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the prosecution of war criminals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对战犯的起诉

Sense.EXAMPLE: The evidence is not sufficient to bring a prosecution against him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现有证据不足以对他提出起诉。

Sense.DEF: the lawyers who try to prove in a court of law that someone is guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: the chief witness for the prosecution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控方的主要证人

Sense.DEF: when you do something that is your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prosecution of her duties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 履行她的职责

Sense.DEF: a lawyer who is trying to prove in a court of law that someone is guilty of a crime
to try to persuade someone to join a religious group, political party etc – used especially when you disapprove of this
Sense.TRAN: 极力劝诱〔某人〕入教[加入政党等]〔尤含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
the patterns of sound and
rhythm
in poetry and spoken language, or the rules for arranging these patterns
the possibility that something will happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I see no prospect of things improving here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看这里的情况不可能改善。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is every prospect a strong possibility of the weather remaining dry this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周天气很有可能持续干燥。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are good prospects for growth in the retail sector.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 零售行业有很好的发展前景。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a real prospect that England will not qualify for the World Cup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队很有可能进不了世界杯决赛。

Sense.DEF: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it
Sense.TRAN: 很可能发生的事情﹔必定发生的事情﹔前景〔尤用于谈论对事情的感受〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要结婚﹐艾丽斯害怕极了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greeks face the prospect of new general elections next month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个月希腊人面临新的大选。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He relishes the prospect of a fight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他渴望一场战斗。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 可怕的/激动人心等的前景

GramExa.PROPFORM: be excited/alarmed/concerned etc at the prospect (of sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t exactly overjoyed at the prospect of looking after her niece.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要照看侄女﹐她并不怎么高兴。

Sense.DEF: chances of future success
Sense.TRAN: 将来成功的机会﹐前途﹐前程
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有工作﹐没受过什么教育﹐前途渺茫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Job prospects for graduates don’t look good.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕业生的就业前景看上去不妙。

Sense.DEF: a person, job, plan etc that has a good chance of success in the future
Sense.TRAN: 有前途的人[工作﹐计划等]

Sense.DEF: likely to happen in the near future
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new round of trade talks is in prospect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能即将举行新一轮的贸易会谈。

Sense.DEF: a view of a wide area of land, especially from a high place
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指从高处看到的〕景象﹐开阔的景观﹐景色

Sense.DEF: to examine an area of land or water, in order to find gold, silver, oil etc
Sense.TRAN: 勘探﹐勘察〔以寻找金﹑银﹑石油等矿藏〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is prospecting for gold in Alaska.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司正在阿拉斯加勘探金矿。

Sense.DEF: to look for something, especially business opportunities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: salesmen prospecting for new customers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找新客户的推销员

Sense.DEF: someone who is likely to do a particular thing or achieve a particular position
Sense.TRAN: 可能成为雇员的人/可能成功的候选人/潜在的客户等

Sense.DEF: likely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: the prospective costs of providing pensions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供养老金可能产生的成本

Sense.DEF: someone who looks for gold, minerals, oil etc
a small book that advertises a school, college, new business etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔学院﹑大学﹑新企业等的〕简介﹐广告宣传册子

Sense.DEF: a document produced by a company that wants the public to buy its shares
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司的〕招股说明书﹐招股章程

Sense.DEF: if people or businesses prosper, they grow and develop in a successful way, especially by becoming rich or making a large profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: Businesses across the state are prospering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个州的企业都很景气。

Sense.DEF: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life
Sense.EXAMPLE: a time of economic prosperity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济繁荣时期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the future prosperity of the country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国未来的繁荣昌盛

Sense.DEF: rich and successful
Sense.TRAN: 富裕的﹐繁荣的﹐兴旺的﹐发达的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prosperous landowner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富裕的土地拥有者

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say rich or well-off rather than prosperous .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 rich 或 well-off ,而不说 prosperous
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: well-off neighborhoods such as Lakeview
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 像湖景区这样的富人住宅区

Sense.DEF:
an organ in the body of male
mammal s
that is near the
bladder
and that produces a liquid in which
sperm
are carried
an artificial leg, tooth, or other part of the body which takes the place of a missing part
Sense.TRAN: 义肢﹔假体〔如假肢﹑假牙等〕

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a woman, who earns money by having sex with people
if someone prostitutes a skill, ability, important principle etc, they use it in a way that does not show its true value, usually to earn money
Sense.TRAN: 出卖〔才能﹑原则等〕﹐为钱而滥用〔才能〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Friends from the theater criticized him for prostituting his talent in the movies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏剧界的朋友批评他从事电影业是糟蹋自己的才华。

Sense.DEF: to work as a prostitute
the work of prostitutes
lying on your front with your face towards the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: They found him lying prostrate on the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发现他趴在地板上。

Sense.DEF: too shocked, upset, weak etc to be able to do anything
Sense.TRAN: 被震惊[伤心﹐疲劳]压垮的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Julie was prostrate with grief after her father’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲死后﹐朱莉悲痛不已。

Sense.DEF:
to lie on your front with your face towards the ground, especially as an act of religious
worship
or as a sign of your willingness to obey someone
Sense.TRAN: 拜倒﹐匍匐〔尤表示顺从或宗教崇拜〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone too shocked, upset, or weak to be able to do anything
Sense.TRAN: 压垮﹐使崩溃﹐使筋疲力尽

Sense.DEF: the most important character in a play, film, or story
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧﹑电影或故事的〕主要人物﹐主角

Sense.DEF: one of the most important people taking part in a competition, battle, or struggle
Sense.TRAN: 〔竞赛﹑战役或斗争的〕参加者﹐参与者
Sense.EXAMPLE: the main protagonists in the conflict
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要的冲突方

Sense.DEF: one of the most important supporters of a social or political idea
Sense.TRAN: 〔社会主张﹑政治思想的〕主要支持者﹐主要拥护者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a protagonist of educational reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育改革的积极拥护者

Sense.DEF: able to keep changing or to do many things
to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cover protects the machine from dust.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罩子可以防止灰尘落进机器。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Physical exercise can protect you against heart disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育锻炼可以预防心脏病。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Waxing your car will help protect against rust.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给汽车打蜡能防止生锈。

Sense.DEF: if an insurance company protects your home, car, life etc, it agrees to pay you money if things are stolen or damaged or you are hurt or killed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unemployment insurance means that you are partially protected if you lose your job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业保险意味着你失业的时候可以得到部分保障。

Sense.DEF: to help the industry and trade of your own country by taxing or restricting foreign goods
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过征收关税或限制进口商品〕保护〔国内工商业〕

Exponent.DEF: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, I’ll protect you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心,我会保护你的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government wants to protect the environment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府要保护环境。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Eating healthily helps to protect against many diseases.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康饮食有助于防止许多疾病。

Exponent.DEF: to protect someone from something harmful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Wearing a hat offers some protection from the sun.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴帽子可以遮挡部分日晒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drug can give protection against cancer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药可防癌。

Exponent.DEF: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police officers guarded the entrance to the building.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察守卫着大楼的入口处。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is guarded by armed men.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他由武装人员保护。

Exponent.DEF: to protect someone or something when they are in danger of being harmed or destroyed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Local people are fighting to save the theatre from demolition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人在为挽救这家剧院不被拆除而斗争。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Emergency aid could save millions of people who are threatened with starvation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧急援助可拯救数百万受到饥饿威胁的人。

Exponent.DEF: to keep something, especially buildings or the environment, from being harmed, destroyed, or changed too much
Exponent.TRAN: 保存,保护〔尤指建筑或环境〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The organization works to preserve forests.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体致力于保护森林。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is little money for preserving historic buildings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有经费用于保护历史性建筑。

Exponent.DEF: to protect something important, such as people’s rights, interests, jobs, health etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The deal will safeguard 200 jobs at the factory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔交易会保住工厂里200个工作岗位。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Laws should do more to safeguard the rights of victims.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律应更多地保护受害者的权利。

Exponent.DEF: to put something in front of something else to protect it. Also used to talk about protecting people from unpleasant situations.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lifted his hand to shield his eyes from the light.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抬起手遮挡眼前的光线。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They thought the public should be shielded from the truth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为不该让公众了解真相。

Exponent.DEF: to provide a place where someone or something is protected from the weather or from danger
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The village is sheltered by a belt of trees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 村庄被一片树林掩蔽。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His family had sheltered Jews during the war.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们家在战争期间掩护过犹太人。

Exponent.DEF: to help and protect someone who has done something illegal, and prevent the police from finding them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is accused of harbouring suspected terrorists.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控庇护恐怖嫌犯。

Sense.DEF: a protected animal, plant, area, or building is one that it is illegal to harm or damage
Sense.TRAN: 受保护的〔指法律规定不得予以侵害〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spotted owls are a protected species .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斑点猫头鹰是受保护的物种。

Sense.DEF: when someone or something is protected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the protection of the environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护

GramExa.EXAMPLE: evidence that vitamin C gives protection against cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维生素C可以预防癌症的根据

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This law provides protection for threatened animals and plants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法律保护了濒危动植物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police were issued with body armour for extra protection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察配发了防弹衣以加强保护。

Sense.DEF: something that protects

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Magee pulled up his collar as protection against the breeze.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马吉竖起了衣领来挡风。

Sense.DEF: the promise of payment from an insurance company if something bad happens

Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any protection?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有避孕措施吗？

Sense.DEF: when criminals threaten to damage your property or hurt you unless you pay them money
Sense.EXAMPLE: protection money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护费
Sense.EXAMPLE: a protection racket the illegal activity of demanding money for protection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔非法〕收取保护费

Sense.DEF: when a government tries to help industries in its own country by taxing or restricting foreign goods
used or intended for protection
Sense.EXAMPLE: protective clothing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防护服
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sunscreen provides a protective layer against the sun’s harmful rays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防晒霜提供了一层抵挡阳光中有害光线的防护层。

Sense.DEF: wanting to protect someone from harm or danger

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t help feeling protective towards my kids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总想保护我的孩子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s very protective of his younger brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很护着弟弟。

Sense.DEF: intended to give an advantage to your own country’s industry
Sense.TRAN: 保护本国工业的﹐保护性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: protective tariffs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易保护关税

Sense.DEF: a situation in which the police make you stay somewhere to protect you from people who could harm you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were taken into protective custody .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们受到保护性拘留。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that protects someone or something else
a country that is protected and controlled by a more powerful country
Sense.TRAN: 〔由一个更强大的国家保护并控制的〕受保护国

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a young person, who is taught and helped by someone who has influence, power, or more experience
Sense.TRAN: 受提携的后进﹐门生﹐门徒
Sense.EXAMPLE: She attempted to encourage her young protégé.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽量鼓励自己的年轻门生。

Sense.DEF: one of several natural substances that exist in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, and which your body needs in order to grow and remain strong and healthy
happening or existing now, but only for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the president pro tem of the Senate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议院临时议长

Sense.DEF: something that you do to show publicly that you think that something is wrong and unfair, for example taking part in big public meetings, refusing to work, or refusing to buy a company’s products

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students held a protest march against the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生举行了反战抗议游行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Five thousand employees came out on strike in protest at the poor working conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五千名雇员公开罢工﹐抗议恶劣的工作条件。

Sense.DEF: words or actions that show that you do not want someone to do something or that you dislike something very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I turned off the TV, despite loud protests from the kids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管孩子们大声反对﹐我还是关掉了电视机。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He accepted his punishment without protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一声不吭地接受了惩罚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She ignored his protests and walked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不顾他的反对﹐走开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme caused a storm of protest a lot of angry protest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个计划引起了一片强烈的抗议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The announcement was met with howls of protest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项公告引来了人们的大声抗议。

Sense.DEF: to do something while making it clear that you do not want to do it
Sense.TRAN: 表示不满后勉强做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill was eventually paid under protest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后很不情愿地结了账。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Opponents of the plan have staged several protests.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项计划的反对者举行了好几次抗议活动。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The arrests sparked off violent street protests.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些抓捕引发了激烈的街头抗议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start suddenly

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The announcement led to widespread public protests.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一通告引发了广泛的公众抗议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Lee spent five years in prison for his involvement in political protest.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 李因参加政治抗议活动而入狱五年。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some 5,000 students and others began a peaceful protest.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约有5,000名学生及其他人士开始了和平抗议活动。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one involving a lot of people

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Students at the heart of the protest movement have called for a general strike.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生作为抗议运动的核心人物呼吁举行总罢工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a large outdoor public meeting to protest about something

Sense.DEF: to come together to publicly express disapproval or opposition to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people blocked the street, protesting against the new legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万的人堵住了街道﹐抗议新法规。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students protested the decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们反对那项决定。

Sense.DEF: to say that you strongly disagree with or are angry about something because you think it is wrong or unfair
Sense.TRAN: 表示异议[不满]﹐反对﹐抗议
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不明白为什么我要对此承担责任！”她抗议道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clive protested that he hadn’t been given enough time to do everything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱夫争辩说没有给他足够的时间让他干完一切。

Sense.DEF: to state very firmly that something is true, when other people do not believe you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sarah protested that she wasn’t Mick’s girlfriend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉坚持说自己不是米克的女朋友。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Years later, he is still protesting his innocence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年以后他仍坚称自己无罪。

Sense.DEF: a member of a part of the Christian Church that separated from the Roman Catholic Church in the 16th century
Sense.TRAN: 新教徒〔16世纪脱离天主教的基督教教派成员〕

Sense.DEF: a strong statement saying that something is true or not true, when other people believe the opposite

GramExa.EXAMPLE: protestations of innocence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无罪的断言

Sense.DEF:
someone who takes part in a public activity such as a
demonstration
in order to show their opposition to something
existing or coming before other things of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: a proto-fascist group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最初的法西斯集团
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prototype
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原型

Sense.DEF: a system of rules about the correct way to behave on an official occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: a breach of diplomatic protocol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违反外交礼节

Subsense.DEF: an international agreement between two or more countries
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Montreal Protocol on the protection of the ozone layer
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于保护臭氧层的《蒙特利尔议定书》

Subsense.DEF: a written record of a formal or international agreement, or an early form of an agreement

Sense.DEF: an established method for connecting computers so that they can exchange information

a set of rules that are followed when doing a scientific
experiment
or giving someone medical treatment
Sense.TRAN: 科学实验计划﹔治疗方案

Sense.DEF:
a very small piece of matter with a positive electrical
charge
that is in the central part of an atom
the colourless substance that forms the cells of plants and animals
the first form that a new design of a car, machine etc has, or a model of it used to test the design before it is produced
Sense.TRAN: 〔新型汽车﹑机器等的〕原型﹐雏形

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a working prototype of the new car
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新车的工作原型

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is one of the first and most typical examples of a group or situation
very typical of a group or type
Sense.EXAMPLE: prototypical behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 典型行为

Sense.DEF: a very small living thing that has only one cell
used to describe something that continues for a long time, especially if it takes longer than usual, necessary, or expected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the expense of a protracted legal battle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场持久的官司战的费用

Sense.DEF: a piece of plastic in the shape of a half-circle, which is used for measuring and drawing angles
to stick out from somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The envelope was protruding from her bag.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信封从她的包里露了出来。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say stick out rather than protrude .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 stick out ,而不说 protrude
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The envelope was sticking out of her bag.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 信封从她包里露了出来。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His front teeth stick out .

Sense.DEF: something that sticks out
something that sticks out
Sense.EXAMPLE: This dinosaur is recognizable by the protuberance on the top of its head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种恐龙可以通过头顶的凸起进行识别。

Sense.DEF: feeling pleased about something that you have done or something that you own, or about someone or something you are involved with or related to
Sense.TRAN: 自豪的﹐得意的﹐引以为荣的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her parents are very proud of her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的父母深以她为荣。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should be proud of yourself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该感到自豪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His past record is certainly something to be proud of .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过去的经历当然是值得骄傲的。

GramExa.GLOSS: have good reasons for being proud
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 有理由为某事物感到骄傲
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is justly proud of its achievements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司有理由为自己的成就感到骄傲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Seven-year-old Ian is proud to have earned his red belt in karate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 七岁的伊恩为自己已经取得空手道的红带而感到骄傲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was proud that the magazine had agreed to publish one of her stories.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家杂志同意刊登她的一篇小说﹐她很得意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Seth was the proud owner of a new sports car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛思因为有了新跑车而扬扬得意。

Sense.DEF: the moment etc that makes you feel most proud
Sense.TRAN: 最值得骄傲的时刻/成就/财产
Sense.EXAMPLE: His proudest moment was winning the European Cup final.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打赢欧洲杯决赛是他最值得自豪的时刻。

Sense.DEF: thinking that you are more important, skilful etc than you really are – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 骄傲的﹐傲慢的﹐自负的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a proud man who would not admit his mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自以为是﹑不愿认错的男子

Sense.DEF: having respect for yourself, so that you are embarrassed to ask for help when you are in a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some farmers were too proud to ask for government help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些农民自尊心太重﹐不愿请求政府帮助。

Subsense.DEF: to make people feel proud of you by doing something well
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I tried to do my country proud.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想为国争光。

Subsense.DEF: to treat someone well by providing them with good food or entertainment

Sense.DEF: tall and impressive

Exponent.DEF: very pleased with what you, your family, or your country have achieved, or of something you own
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt so proud when my son graduated from college.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我儿子大学毕业的时候,我真感到自豪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Judith’s very proud of her new Ferrari.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱迪丝为自己的新法拉利得意不己。

Exponent.DEF: feeling pleased because something good has happened, especially because you think you have been very clever, skilful etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was smoking a big cigar and was obviously pleased with himself.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抽着一支大雪茄,显然一副扬扬自得的样子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’d made a big profit and was feeling pretty pleased with myself.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我赚了一大笔钱,感到很得意。

Exponent.DEF: behaving in an unpleasant and annoying way, because you think you are better or know more than other people, and that your opinions are always right
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was arrogant and regarded people who disagreed with him as fools.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很傲慢,认为不同意他看法的人都是傻瓜。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his arrogant attitude to women
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对待女人的傲慢态度

Exponent.DEF: too proud of your appearance, in a way that annoys other people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s so vain he thinks all the girls fancy him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自视甚高,以为所有的女孩子都喜欢他。

Exponent.DEF: proud of yourself because you think you are very intelligent, skilful, beautiful etc, especially without good reason and in a way that annoys people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stewart’s the most arrogant conceited person I’ve ever known.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯图尔特是我遇到过的最傲慢自负的人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was offered a brilliant job and became incredibly big-headed overnight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到了一份很好的工作,一夜之间就傲慢得不得了。

Exponent.DEF: thinking that you are much more important than you really are, and using very long and formal words to try to sound important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The clerk was a pompous little man with glasses.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名文员戴着眼镜,是一个自负的小个子男人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a pompous speech
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 浮夸的演讲

Exponent.DEF: pleased with yourself in a quiet but annoying way because you think you are in a better position than other people
Exponent.TRAN: 自以为是的,沾沾自喜的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Milly was looking very smug about coming top of the class.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 米利因为在班上名列前茅而显得扬扬得意。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a smug expression
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 自鸣得意的表情

Exponent.DEF: pleased with what you have achieved and showing it clearly in an annoying way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She glared angrily into his self-satisfied face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他满脸得意,她气愤地瞪了他一眼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a self-satisfied grin
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 自满的咧嘴一笑

Sense.DEF: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re wrong, and I can prove it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你错了﹐我可以证明。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tests have proved that the system works.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验证实该体系行得通。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I knew he had done it, but there was no way I could prove it to Eddie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他干了那件事﹐不过我没有办法向埃迪证明。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He claims the police destroyed records that could prove the officer’s guilt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称警方毁掉了能证明那名警察有罪的记录。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They say I’m too old, but I’m going to prove them all wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说我太老了﹐不过我要证明他们全都错了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: To prove his point show that he was right , he mentioned several other experiments which had produced similar results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了证明自己的观点﹐他提到了另外几个结果相似的实验。
Sense.HINTTRAN: You prove something to someone. 表示证明某事给某人看要用prove something to someone这个结构: I will prove to you (NOT 不说 prove you) that I’m right. 我要向你证明我是对的。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something proves difficult, helpful, a problem etc, they are difficult, helpful, a problem etc
Sense.TRAN: 证明是﹐被发现是﹐显示出是
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recent revelations may prove embarrassing to the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近披露的事情可能会使总统很尴尬。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The design proved to be a success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个设计后来证明很成功。

Sense.DEF: to show how good you are at doing something
Sense.TRAN: （向某人）展现﹐展示﹐证明〔自己的实力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I first started this job, I felt I had to prove myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚开始干这份工作的时候﹐觉得必须证明一下自己的实力。

Sense.DEF: to show other people that you are a particular type of person
Sense.TRAN: 〔向别人〕证明自己是〔某一类人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s proved herself to be a very reliable worker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她证明了自己在工作上是非常可靠的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what is sb trying to prove?
Sense.DEF: said when you are annoyed by someone’s actions and do not understand them
Sense.TRAN: 某人想证明什么？〔表示对某人的行为感到生气和不理解〕

Sense.DEF: if someone does something to prove a point, they do it to show that they are right or that they can do something
Sense.TRAN: 证明自己〔是对的或能做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to run the marathon just to prove a point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会为了证明点什么就去参加马拉松比赛。

Sense.DEF:
if
dough unbaked bread mixture
proves, it rises and becomes light because of the
yeast
in it

to show that a
will
has been made in the correct way
tested and shown to be true or good, or shown to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: a player of proven ability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确有才华的运动员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a telephone system with a proven track record past performance showing how good it is of reliability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 业已证明可靠的电话系统

Sense.DEF:
a past participle of
prove
the place where something originally came from
Sense.EXAMPLE: The provenance of the paintings is unknown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些画出处不详。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to suggest that something may have been stolen
GramExa.EXAMPLE: artworks of doubtful provenance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来源可疑的艺术作品

Sense.DEF: a short well-known statement that gives advice or expresses something that is generally true. ‘A penny saved is a penny earned’ is an example of a proverb.
used when you describe something using part of a well-known expression
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store had everything including the proverbial kitchen sink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家商店应有尽有﹐包括常说的厨房洗涤池。

Sense.DEF: relating to a proverb
Sense.EXAMPLE: a proverbial expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谚语

Sense.DEF: well known by a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: His modesty is proverbial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的谦虚人人皆知。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有茶水和饼干供应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel provides a shoe-cleaning service for guests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该宾馆为客人提供擦鞋服务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The project is designed to provide young people with work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划旨在为年轻人提供工作。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘provide someone something’. Say 而要说 provide someone with something。

Sense.DEF: to produce something useful as a result
Sense.TRAN: 产生〔有益的结果〕﹔制造﹐提供〔机会〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are hoping the enquiry will provide an explanation for the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望调查可以为事故的原因提供解释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The search provided the police with several vital clues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜查为警方提供了一些重要线索。

Sense.DEF: if a law or rule provides that something must happen, it states that it must happen
to make plans in order to deal with a bad situation that might happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Health insurance will provide against loss of income if you become ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生病的时候﹐健康保险可以避免收入损失。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the things they need to live, such as money, food etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without work, how can I provide for my children?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有工作﹐我如何抚养孩子？

Sense.DEF: if a law, rule, or plan provides for something, it states that something will be done and makes it possible for it to be done
Sense.TRAN: 〔法律﹑规章或计划〕规定﹐使可能
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new constitution provides for a 650-seat legislature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新宪法规定立法机构有650个席位。

Sense.DEF: to make plans in order to deal with something that might happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Commanders failed to provide for an attack by sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指挥官们没能做好海上袭击的防备。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will only be possible if something else happens or is done
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can come with us, provided he pays for his own meals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要他付自己的饭钱﹐就可以跟我们一起来。

Sense.DEF: a force which is believed by some people to control what happens in our lives and to protect us
Sense.EXAMPLE: divine providence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天意

Sense.DEF: careful and sensible in the way you plan things, especially by saving money for the future
Sense.TRAN: 顾及未来的﹐未雨绸缪的﹐深谋远虑的

Sense.DEF: a providential event is a lucky one
a company or person that provides a service
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Internet service provider
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网服务供应商

Sense.DEF: someone who supports a family
Sense.EXAMPLE: A widow, she is the sole provider the only one for her family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为寡妇﹐她是家里唯一养家糊口的人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will only be possible if something else happens or is done
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can borrow the car, providing I can have it back by six o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以借用我的车﹐只要6点钟以前还给我就行。

Sense.DEF: one of the large areas into which some countries are divided, and which usually has its own local government
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Chinese province
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国的一个省

Sense.DEF: the parts of a country that are not near the capital
Sense.TRAN: 外省﹐地方〔指首都以外的地区〕

Sense.DEF: a subject that someone knows a lot about or something that only they are responsible for

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Computers were once the exclusive province of scientists and mathematicians.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机一度为科学家和数学家专用。

Sense.DEF: relating to or coming from a province
Sense.EXAMPLE: a provincial election
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 省级选举
Sense.EXAMPLE: the provincial government of Quebec
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 魁北克省政府

Sense.DEF: relating to or coming from the parts of a country that are not near the capital
Sense.TRAN: 外省的﹐地方的〔指首都以外的地区〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a provincial town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座地方小镇

Sense.DEF: and not interested in anything new or different – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: provincial attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏狭守旧的态度

Sense.DEF: someone who comes from a part of a country that is not near the capital, especially someone who is not interested in anything new or different – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: （来自）首都以外的人﹐地方居民〔尤指偏狭守旧的人﹐常含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: provincial attitudes
a place or situation in which something new is tried or tested

GramExa.EXAMPLE: High-crime areas are proving grounds for new police officers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罪案高发地区是考验新警察的理想场所。

Sense.DEF: an area for scientific testing, especially of vehicles
when you provide something that someone needs now or in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the provision of childcare facilities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托儿设施的提供

GramExa.EXAMPLE: provision for people with disabilities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 满足残疾人士的需要

Sense.EXAMPLE: He made provisions for his wife and his children in his will.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在遗嘱里他为妻子和孩子都做好了安排。

Sense.DEF: food, drink, and other supplies, especially for a journey
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为旅行储备的〕粮食﹐食物
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had enough provisions for two weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的粮食足够应付两星期。

Sense.DEF: a condition in an agreement or law
Sense.TRAN: 〔协议或法律中的〕规定﹐条款﹐条件
Sense.EXAMPLE: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 协议有项规定﹐允许双方互查武器。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该法令规定﹐雇主必须提供安全设备。

Sense.DEF: to provide someone or something with a lot of food and supplies, especially for a journey
likely or able to be changed in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: a provisional government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临时政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: We accept provisional bookings by phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们接受电话临时预约。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The meeting has been provisionally arranged for the end of May.

Sense.DEF: an official document that you must have when you are learning to drive
Sense.TRAN: 〔学习驾驶时需用的〕学员驾驶执照

Sense.DEF: a condition that you ask for before you will agree to something
Sense.TRAN: 〔同意某事的〕（前提）条件﹐（附带）条件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money was given to the museum with the proviso that it is spent on operating costs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那笔钱提供给博物馆﹐前提条件是必须用于博物馆的营运。

Sense.DEF: an action or event that makes someone angry or upset, or is intended to do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She claims that Graham attacked her without any provocation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她声称格雷厄姆无故攻击她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of deliberate provocation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指责故意挑衅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julie has a tendency to burst into tears at the slightest provocation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要稍一招惹朱莉﹐她就会大哭起来。

Sense.DEF: provocative behaviour, remarks etc are intended to make people angry or upset, or to cause a lot of discussion
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑话语等〕使人生气的﹐挑衅的﹐煽动的﹐引起争论的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minister’s provocative remarks were widely reported in the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长的煽动性言论被媒体广为报道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a provocative act by a terrorist group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖团体的挑衅行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was accused of being deliberately provocative .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被指责故意挑衅。

Sense.DEF: provocative clothes, movements, pictures etc are intended to make someone sexually excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: provocative images of young girls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少女们撩人的形象

Sense.DEF: to cause a reaction or feeling, especially a sudden one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proposal provoked widespread criticism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那项提议引起了广泛的批评。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The decision to invade provoked storms of protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 入侵决定激起了抗议的风暴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The novel has provoked fierce debate in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部小说在美国引发了激烈的争论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hopes her editorial will provoke readers into thinking seriously about the issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望她的那篇社论能引发读者认真思考该问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Emma, though still at school, was provoked to help too.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛虽然还是个学生﹐见状也前来帮忙。

Sense.DEF: to make someone angry, especially deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不是被惹恼了﹐那狗原本不会攻击的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

Sense.DEF: the person in charge of a college in some British universities, especially at Oxford or Cambridge
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学﹐尤指牛津或剑桥大学的〕院长

Sense.DEF: an important official at a university in the US
the leader of the council in some Scottish towns and cities
Sense.TRAN: 〔某些苏格兰城镇的〕镇长﹐市长

Sense.DEF: the front part of a ship or boat
great skill at doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: his physical prowess
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他优异的体能
Sense.EXAMPLE: military prowess
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精良的军事技能

Sense.DEF: if an animal prowls, it moves around an area quietly, especially because it is hunting another animal
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指捕猎的动物在某处〕潜行

Sense.DEF: if someone prowls, they move around an area slowly and quietly, especially because they are involved in a criminal activity or because they are looking for something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指罪犯或在寻找某物的人在某处〕秘密[悄悄]来回游走
Sense.EXAMPLE: gangs of teenagers prowling the streets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在大街上鬼鬼祟祟四处游荡的少年团伙

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Irene prowled restlessly around the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾琳不安地在房间里踱来踱去。

Subsense.DEF: if an animal is on the prowl, it is hunting
if someone is on the prowl, they are moving around different places, looking for an opportunity to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 四处搜寻〔干某事的机会〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: local men out on the prowl looking for people to have a sexual relationship with in the city’s bars and nightclubs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在城里的酒吧和夜总会游荡寻欢的当地男子
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s always on the prowl for bargains.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是到处搜寻便宜货。

Sense.DEF: a person who follows someone or hides near their house, especially at night, in order to frighten or harm them or to steal something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指夜间心怀不轨的〕盯梢的人﹐潜伏的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police were called after a prowler was spotted near their home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发现有个人潜伏在家附近后他们就报了警。

Sense.DEF: a proximate cause is a direct one
nearest in time, order, or family relationship
Sense.TRAN: 〔时间﹑顺序或亲属关系〕最近的﹐最接近的

Sense.DEF: nearness in distance or time
Sense.TRAN: 〔距离或时间的〕接近﹐临近﹔邻近

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We chose the house for its proximity to the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们选中这所房子是因为它离学校近。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the proximity of the Bahamas to the States
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴哈马群岛靠近美国

Sense.EXAMPLE: Here the rich and the poor live in close proximity very near to each other .

Sense.DEF: if you do something by proxy, you arrange for someone else to do it for you

Sense.DEF: someone who you choose to represent you, especially to vote for you

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 代表妻子的丈夫

involving the use of a proxy

Sense.DEF: someone who is very easily shocked by anything relating to sex – used to show disapproval

Sense.DEF: a sensible and careful attitude that makes you avoid unnecessary risks

Sense.DEF: very easily shocked by things relating to sex – used to show disapproval

Sense.DEF: to cut off some of the branches of a tree or bush to make it grow better

Sense.DEF: to make something smaller by removing parts that you do not need or want

Sense.DEF:
a dried
plum
, often cooked before it is eaten

Sense.DEF: having or showing too much interest in sex – used to show disapproval

Sense.DEF: a very poisonous acid
to try to find out details about someone else’s private life in an impolite way

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最后设法用螺丝刀把门撬开了。

Sense.DEF: in private, where people cannot see what you are doing
to get money or information from someone with a lot of difficulty

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想知道他的名字﹐就必须想法从她那里打听。

Sense.DEF: a note written at the end of a letter, adding more information

Sense.DEF: a song or poem praising God, especially in the Bible
someone who has written a psalm
a book containing the psalms from the Bible
an ancient musical instrument with strings stretched over a board

Sense.DEF: the study of how people vote in elections
a person who pretends to know a lot about a subject and talks about it in a complicated way in order to make other people admire them – used to show disapproval
false or not real
Sense.EXAMPLE: pseudo-intellectuals people who pretend to be clever

Sense.DEF: an invented name that a writer, artist etc uses instead of their real name

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以“西尔彻斯特”的笔名写作。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是那位使用笔名的作者。

Sense.DEF: a skin disease that causes rough red areas where the skin comes off in small pieces
a sound people make when they want to attract someone’s attention without other people noticing

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=Pacific Standard Time太平洋标准时〔北美洲西部部分地区的标准时〕

Sense.DEF: to do or say things that will make your opponent in a game or competition feel nervous or confused, so that it is easier for you to win
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛或竞赛中〕震慑﹐镇住〔对手〕﹔使〔对手〕心烦意乱

Sense.DEF: if you psych yourself up or if someone psychs you up, you get mentally prepared before doing something so that you feel confident
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕心理上做好准备

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们两人都清楚我们必须做好比赛的心理准备。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=psychology 心理学

Sense.DEF: a short form of
Sense.TRAN:
缩略式=
psychiatrist
精神科医生

Sense.DEF: someone’s mind, or their deepest feelings, which control their attitudes and behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freud’s account of the human psyche
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗洛伊德对人类心理的描述
Sense.EXAMPLE: A characteristic of the feminine psyche is to seek approval from others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性心态的一个特征就是寻求他人的认同。

Sense.DEF:
psychedelic drugs such as
lsd
make you
hallucinate see things that do not exist

having or using bright colours or strange sounds, and representing the experiences people have when they use drugs such as
lsd

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光怪陆离的迷幻灯光表演

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时装设计师以令人眼花缭乱的印花图案回归20世纪 60年代。

Sense.DEF: relating to the study and treatment of mental illness
Sense.TRAN: 精神病学的﹐精神病治疗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a psychiatric hospital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神病医院
Sense.EXAMPLE: a psychiatric nurse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神病院护士
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles was suffering from a psychiatric disorder mental illness .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯彼时精神错乱。

Sense.DEF: a doctor trained in the treatment of mental illness
the study and treatment of mental illnesses
Sense.TRAN: 精神病学﹐精神病治疗学

Sense.DEF: relating to the power of the human mind to do strange or surprising things that cannot be explained by reason
Sense.TRAN: 有超自然力量的﹔通灵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spiritual healer with psychic powers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有超自然力量的精神治疗师

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于超自然现象的纪录片

Sense.DEF: someone who is psychic has the ability to know what other people are thinking or what will happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 能洞察人心的﹔能预知未来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t have to be psychic to know what Maggie is thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不必有什么洞察力也能知道玛吉在想什么。

Sense.DEF: affecting the mind rather than the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: psychic disorders illnesses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神错乱

Sense.DEF: someone who has mysterious powers, especially the ability to receive messages from dead people or to know what will happen in the future
Sense.TRAN: 有神秘能力的人﹔〔尤指〕通灵的人﹐能预知未来的人

Sense.DEF: someone who is mentally ill and who may behave in a violent or strange way
relating to the mind and the mental processes, rather than the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a psychoanalyst
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神分析专家

Sense.DEF: psychoactive drugs have an effect on your mind
Sense.TRAN: 〔药物〕作用于精神的﹐影响心理状态的

Sense.DEF: medical treatment that involves talking to someone about their life, feelings etc in order to find out the hidden causes of their problems
Sense.TRAN: 精神分析（治疗法）﹔心理分析（治疗法）

Sense.DEF: someone who treats patients using psychoanalysis
to treat someone using psychoanalysis
language that sounds scientific but is not really, that some people use when talking about their emotional problems – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 心理学呓语〔含贬义﹐指某些人谈论感情问题时使用的语言﹐听起来像科学术语﹐其实不然〕

Sense.DEF: the study of the body in relation to the mind
Sense.TRAN: 心理生物学﹐精神生物学

Sense.DEF: a way of treating mental illness in which people are asked to act in a situation together to help them understand their emotions
Sense.TRAN: 心理剧疗法﹐心理表演疗法〔一种治疗精神疾病的方法﹐人们被要求在某场景中一起表演从而帮助他们了解自己的情感〕

Sense.DEF: a serious film, play etc that examines the minds and feelings of the characters, rather than what happens
the moving of solid objects using only the power of the mind, which some people believe is possible
relating to the way that your mind works and the way that this affects your behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sleep disorders are a serious psychological problem .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡眠障碍是严重的心理疾病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freud’s psychological theories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗洛伊德的心理学理论
Sense.EXAMPLE: What was the patient’s psychological state ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人的心理状态如何？

Sense.DEF: relating to what is in someone’s mind rather than what is real

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯说他病了﹐但我肯定那是心理作用。

Sense.DEF: behaviour intended to make your opponents lose confidence or feel afraid
the exact time in a situation when you have the best chance to achieve what you want
someone who is trained in psychology
Sense.EXAMPLE: a clinical psychologist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临床心理学家

Sense.DEF: the study of the mind and how it influences people’s behaviour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: experts in the field of developmental psychology
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发展心理学领域的专家

Sense.DEF: the mental processes involved in believing in something or doing a certain activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔相信某事或做某事的〕心理﹐心理过程

GramExa.EXAMPLE: research into the psychology of racism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对种族歧视心理的研究

Sense.DEF: what someone thinks or believes, and how this affects what they do
Sense.TRAN: 心理﹐思想﹐观念〔及其如何影响人的行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the psychology of three-year-olds

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴民的心理
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to use psychology to get people to stop smoking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人戒烟必须利用烟民的心理。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理测试

Sense.DEF: someone who has a serious and permanent mental illness that makes them behave in a violent or criminal way

Sense.DEF: a serious mental illness that can change your character and make you unable to behave in a normal way

the treatment of mental illness, for example
depression
, by talking to someone and discussing their problems rather than giving them drugs
suffering from or caused by psychosis

Sense.DEF: a building in Britain where alcohol can be bought and drunk, and where meals are often served

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧午餐

Sense.DEF: the stage of physical development during which you change from a child to an adult and are able to have children
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fourteen is a fairly normal age for a girl to reach puberty .

Sense.DEF:
pubic
hair hair around the sexual organs
a pubescent boy or girl is going through puberty
related to or near the sexual organs

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴毛

Sense.DEF: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest helpful or useful to ordinary people .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。
Sense.EXAMPLE: full public access to information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众对信息的充分知情权
Sense.EXAMPLE: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a public outcry expression of anger by a lot of people about the shooting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze people’s eyes or attention .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

Sense.DEF: available for anyone to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: a public telephone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公用电话
Sense.EXAMPLE: a public footpath
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共人行小径
Sense.EXAMPLE: proposals to ban smoking in public places
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在公共场所禁止吸烟的提议
Sense.EXAMPLE: a public library
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共图书馆

GramExa.GLOSS: buses, trains etc

Sense.DEF: relating to the government and the services it provides for people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Government’s public spending plans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的公共开支计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: We do not believe he is fit for public office a job in the government .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认为他不适合担任公职。
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to control public expenditure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制公共开支的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: public funding for the arts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共艺术资金

Sense.DEF: known about by most people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Details of the highly sensitive information have not been made public .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高度敏感的详细资料还未公开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although not a public figure famous person , he was a man of great influence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他虽然不是公众人物﹐但拥有巨大的影响力。

Sense.DEF: intended for anyone to know, see, or hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Today the school finds itself in the midst of a very public debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在这所学校发现自己正处于舆论的风口浪尖。

GramExa.GLOSS: showing your emotions so that everyone can see
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was acutely embarrassed by his public display of temper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当众发火让她觉得十分尴尬。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be a public inquiry into the sinking of the oil tanker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将对油船的沉没进行公开调查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fear of public speaking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对当众演讲的恐惧

Sense.SIGNPOST: PLACE WITH A LOT OF PEOPLE
Sense.DEF: a public place usually has a lot of people in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go somewhere less public where we can talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到安静点的地方去吧﹐可以说说话。

Sense.DEF: work that you do, especially for the government, that makes you well known to many people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Howard seems to have retired from public life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍华德似乎已经退出公共事务了。

Sense.DEF: the public image of a famous person or organization is the character or attitudes that most people think they have

GramExa.EXAMPLE: attempts to improve the public image of the police
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 改善警察公众形象的努力

Subsense.DEF: to tell everyone about something that was secret

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The planners are almost ready to go public on the road-building scheme.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 规划者们差不多准备好公布筑路方案了。

Subsense.DEF:
to become a
public company
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Many partnerships went public in the 1980s to secure extra capital.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪80年代许多合伙企业为了获取更多资金而公开发售股票。

Sense.DEF: a visit by a famous person in order to make a speech, advertise something etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某名人为演说﹑作宣传等〕公开露面
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is paid £10,000 for the briefest of public appearances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只要在公开场合稍一露脸就可以拿到一万英镑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in the public eye is seen a lot on television, written about in newspapers etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is a job that brings him constantly into the public eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那份工作让他不断在公众面前曝光。

Subsense.DEF: something that is provided for anyone to use, and is usually owned by the government
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The army was called out to protect public property.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队被调来保护公共财产。

Subsense.DEF: something that everyone has a right to know about
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Our lives seem to have become public property.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的生活好像已经成为人人有权知道的事了。

Sense.DEF: the criminal, problem etc that is considered the most serious threat to people’s safety
Sense.TRAN: 头号公敌〔指被认为是对民众安全构成最严重威胁的罪犯﹑问题等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drugs have become public enemy number one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品已成为头号公敌。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting will be open to the general public .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议将向公众开放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police warned members of the public not to approach the man, who may be armed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方告诫民众不要靠近那名男子﹐他可能持有武器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the whole, the public are conservative about education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说﹐大众在教育问题上是保守的。

Sense.DEF: if you do something in public, you do it where anyone can see
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband was always nice to her in public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫在公开场合总是对她很好。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: the people who like a particular singer, writer etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔喜欢某歌手﹑某作家等的〕大众
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is adored by his public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深受支持者喜爱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The theatre-going public are very demanding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱看戏的人要求很高。

Sense.DEF:
a television
channel
provided by
cable
television companies in the US on which anyone can broadcast a programme
Sense.TRAN: 公共频道〔美国各大有线电视公司提供的电视频道﹐任何人都能用以广播自己的节目〕

Sense.DEF:
a
pa
Sense.TRAN: 有线广播系统﹔扩音系统

Sense.DEF: events and questions, especially political ones, which have an effect on most people
Sense.TRAN: 公众事务〔尤指影响大多数人的政治事件和问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took an active part in public affairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他积极参与公众事务。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is in charge of a
pub
the process of printing a book, magazine etc and offering it for sale

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was in England for the publication of her new book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她到英国是为了出版她的新书。

GramExa.GLOSS: intended to be published
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spent his holiday writing reviews for publication.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假期里他写了几篇评论准备发表。

Sense.DEF: a book, magazine etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the author of 70 major scientific publications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是70种重要科学著作的作者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weekly publication
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份周刊

Sense.DEF: when information is printed in a book, magazine etc so that the public can read it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the publication of the company’s annual results
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司年度业绩的公布

Sense.DEF:
in
pub s
in Britain, a room with plain furniture where you can buy drinks more cheaply than in the other rooms
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国酒馆里陈设较简单﹑收费较便宜的〕公众酒吧﹐大众酒吧

Sense.DEF:
a company that offers its
share s
for sale on the
stock exchange
Sense.TRAN: 公开出售股份的公司﹐股票上市公司

Sense.DEF: a toilet in a public place

a
public company
Sense.TRAN: 公开出售股份的公司﹐股票上市公司

Sense.DEF: a business that is run by the government
Sense.TRAN: 国营企业﹐由政府经营的企业

Sense.DEF: a lawyer who is paid by the government to defend people in court, because they cannot pay for a lawyer themselves
Sense.TRAN: 公设辩护律师〔由政府出钱为付不起律师费的人辩护的律师〕

Sense.DEF: something that is in the public domain is available for anyone to have or use
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information is not currently in the public domain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该资料目前未进入公版领域。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Public domain software is sometimes called shareware.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共软件有时被称为共享软件。

Sense.DEF: in Britain, health care provided by the government, including medical care and public cleaning services
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国由政府提供的〕公共卫生保健〔包括医疗保健和公共卫生服务〕

Sense.DEF: the health of all the people in an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: a danger to public health
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大众健康的一个威胁

Sense.DEF: a special day when people do not go to work and shops do not open

a
pub
in the US, houses or apartments built by the government for poor people
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国政府为贫民所建的〕公共住房

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to make sure that people know about a new product, film, book etc or what a famous person is doing
Sense.TRAN: 广告员﹐宣传员﹔公关人员

Sense.DEF: the attention that someone or something gets from newspapers, television etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸﹑电视等对某人或某物的〕关注﹐报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: Standards in education have received much publicity over the last few years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几年来教育水平受到了很大的关注。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s important to gain good publicity for the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对学校来说﹐获得正面的报道很重要。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The adverse publicity had damaged sales.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负面报道对销售造成了不利影响。

Sense.DEF: the business of making sure that people know about a new product, film etc or what a particular famous person is doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who’s going to do the show’s publicity?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁来做这次演出的宣传工作？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Government has launched a publicity campaign .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府发起了一场宣传运动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is their much-reported romance just a publicity stunt something that is only done to get publicity ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们高度曝光的恋情是否只是宣传的噱头？

Sense.DEF: to give information about something to the public, so that they know about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: television’s failure to publicize the unemployment issue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视未能报道失业问题

GramExa.GLOSS: receiving a lot of attention
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His visit was highly publicized.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的来访受到广泛报道。

Sense.DEF:
a British company owned by at least two people and whose
share s
can be bought by everyone
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕公开有限公司﹐股份有限公司〔至少为两人所有﹐任何人可购其股份〕

Sense.DEF: in a way that is intended for anyone to know, see, or hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: She and her family agreed never to discuss the matter publicly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和家人一致同意﹐绝不公开讨论那件事。

Sense.DEF: done or controlled by the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: a publicly funded health service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由政府出资的医疗保健服务

Sense.DEF:
a company that is publicly owned has sold its
share s
to people who are not part of the company
involving the ordinary people in a country or city
Sense.EXAMPLE: publicly elected bodies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由公众选举产生的机构

Sense.DEF: an action that is harmful to everyone
someone who does things that annoy a lot of people
Sense.TRAN: 妨害公众者﹐做事令大家讨厌的人

Sense.DEF: the opinions or beliefs that ordinary people have about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Public opinion is shifting in favor of the new law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舆论正转而支持新法令。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pressure of public opinion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舆论的压力

Sense.DEF: businesses, property etc in public ownership are owned by the government
Sense.TRAN: 〔企业﹑财产等〕国家所有（制）﹐公有（制）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Opposition intends to bring the industry back into public ownership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党想让该行业回归公有制。

Sense.DEF: a lawyer who works for the government, and tries to prove in a court of law that someone has done something illegal
the work of explaining to the public what an organization does, so that they will understand it and approve of it
Sense.TRAN: 公关工作﹐公共关系（工作）
Sense.EXAMPLE: They ran their own successful public relations business in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在伦敦成功地经营自己的公关公司。

Sense.DEF: the relationship between an organization and the public
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project has been disastrous for the bank in terms of public relations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就公共关系而言﹐该项目对银行来说是非常失败的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a public relations exercise done in order to improve the relationship between the public and an organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项公关活动

Sense.DEF: in Britain, a private school for children aged between 13 and 18, whose parents pay for their education. The children often live at the school while they are studying.
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国私立的〕公学﹐私立寄宿学校

Sense.DEF: a free local school, especially in the US and Scotland, controlled and paid for by the government
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指美国和苏格兰免费的〕公立学校

Sense.DEF: the industries and services in a country that are owned and run by the government

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a job in the public sector
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国营部门的工作

Sense.EXAMPLE: public sector workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在国营部门工作的人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: public sector housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公营住房

Sense.DEF: someone who works for the government, especially someone who is elected
a service, such as transport or health care, that a government provides
Sense.TRAN: 公共服务﹐公用事业〔由政府提供资金的服务﹐如运输﹑卫生保健等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to improve quality in public services
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高公用事业服务质量的努力

Sense.DEF: a service provided to people because it will help them, and not for profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local TV stations ran the ads as a public service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方电视台播放那些广告作公益用途。

Sense.DEF: the government or its departments
Sense.EXAMPLE: staff cuts in the public service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府部门的裁员
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left the public service and embarked on a career in the City.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开政府部门﹐来到伦敦城开始创业。

Sense.DEF: willing to do things that are helpful for everyone in society
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any public-spirited citizen would have done the same.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何热心公益的公民都会那么做。

Sense.DEF: a television service or programme in the US which is paid for by the government, large companies, and the public
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国由政府﹑大型公司和公众出资的〕公众电视

Sense.DEF: buses, trains etc that are available for everyone to use
a private company that is allowed by the government to provide important services such as gas, electricity, water etc
Sense.TRAN: 公用事业公司〔提供煤气﹑电﹑水等设施〕

Sense.DEF:
buildings such as hospitals, roads,
port s
etc that are built and paid for by the government
Sense.TRAN: 公共工程﹐公共建设〔如医院﹑公路﹑港口等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the public works department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共建设部

Sense.DEF: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first edition was published in 1765.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一版于1765年出版。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

Sense.DEF: if a newspaper or magazine publishes a letter, article etc, it prints it for people to read
Sense.EXAMPLE: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信﹐并且会尽量刊登出来。

Sense.DEF: to make official information such as a report available for everyone to read
Sense.EXAMPLE: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

Sense.DEF: if a writer, musician etc publishes their work, they arrange for it to be printed and sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔作家﹑音乐家等〕发表（自己的作品）
Sense.EXAMPLE: University teachers must publish regularly to gain promotion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学老师要获得晋级必须经常发表作品。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should take a risk in saying what you think is true, although the result may be harmful to you
Sense.TRAN: 说出真话并准备承担后果

Sense.DEF: a person or company whose business is to arrange the writing, production, and sale of books, newspapers etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑报纸等的〕出版者﹐出版商﹔出版社

Sense.DEF: the business of producing books and magazines
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony wants to get a job in publishing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼想在出版界找一份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new publishing house publishing company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家新出版社

Sense.DEF: dark brownish purple in colour

a hard flat circular piece of rubber that you hit with the stick in the game of
ice hockey
Sense.TRAN: 冰球〔冰球运动中当球用的橡皮圆盘〕

Sense.DEF: if part of your face puckers, or if you pucker it, it becomes tight or stretched, for example because you are going to cry or kiss someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mouth puckered, and she started to cry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嘴一噘﹐哭了起来。

Sense.DEF: if cloth puckers, it gets lines or folds in it and is no longer flat
showing that you are amused by other people, and like to make jokes about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a puckish grin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调皮的一笑

Sense.DEF:
a
pudding
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s for pud?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甜点是什么？

Sense.DEF: a hot sweet dish, made from cake, rice, bread etc with fruit, milk, or other sweet things added
Sense.TRAN: 布丁〔由蛋糕﹑大米﹑面包等加水果﹑牛奶或其他甜味东西制成的热甜食〕

Sense.DEF: a thick sweet creamy dish, usually made with milk, eggs, sugar, and flour, and served cold
Sense.TRAN: 布丁〔通常用牛奶﹑蛋﹑糖和面粉制成的厚奶油状冷甜食〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: chocolate pudding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧克力布丁

Sense.DEF: a sweet dish served at the end of a meal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s ice cream for pudding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 甜点有冰激凌。

Sense.DEF: a hot dish made of a mixture of flour, fat etc, with meat or vegetables inside
Sense.TRAN: 〔用面粉﹑油等混合﹑内包有肉馅或蔬菜馅的〕不加糖布丁

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the proof of the pudding is in the eating

Sense.DEF: a deep round dish in which puddings are cooked
Sense.TRAN: 〔烹制布丁的圆而深的〕布丁盘

Sense.DEF: a small pool of liquid, especially rainwater
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children splashed through the puddles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们噼噼啪啪地踩过一个个小水坑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had fallen asleep, his head resting in a puddle of beer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他睡着了﹐脑袋耷拉在一摊啤酒中。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Rain trickled down the glass, puddling on the window sills.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨水顺着玻璃窗往下淌﹐在窗台上积起一摊水。

Sense.DEF: the sexual organs on the outside of the body, especially a woman’s
fairly fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: the baby’s pudgy little legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿胖嘟嘟的小腿

Sense.DEF: a small town, especially in the southwest U.S.
silly and stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a puerile joke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼稚的玩笑

Sense.DEF: to breathe quickly and with difficulty after the effort of running, carrying something heavy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: George puffed and panted and he tried to keep up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治喘着粗气想跟上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An old man puffed up to them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位老人气喘吁吁地走向他们。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He caught up with Gary, puffing for breath .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赶上了加里﹐累得直喘粗气。

Sense.DEF:
to breathe in and out while smoking a cigarette or
pipe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kinane sat in silence, puffing thoughtfully at his pipe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基南默默坐着 若有所思地抽着烟斗。

Sense.DEF: if smoke, steam etc puffs from somewhere, or if something puffs it, it comes out in little clouds
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔烟或蒸汽〕一阵阵喷出﹐冒出
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steam puffed out of the chimney.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒸汽从烟囱里一股一股地喷出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boiler was puffing thick black smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锅炉一股股地冒出浓浓的黑烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t puff smoke into my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把烟朝我脸上喷。

Sense.DEF: to move in a particular direction, sending out little clouds of steam or smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train puffed steadily across the bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车喷着蒸汽稳稳地驶过了桥。

Sense.DEF: to make your cheeks or chest bigger by filling them with air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry puffed out his chest proudly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利自豪地挺起胸膛。

Sense.DEF: to become bigger by increasing the amount of air inside, or to make something bigger in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pastry will puff up while it bakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烘烤时油酥面团会鼓起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Birds puff up their feathers to keep warm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟类蓬起羽毛来保暖。

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body puffs up, it swells painfully because of injury or infection
Sense.EXAMPLE: My eye had puffed up because of a mosquito bite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一只眼睛被蚊子叮咬后肿了起来。

Sense.DEF:
the action of taking the smoke from a cigarette,
pipe
etc into your
lung s

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He laughed and took a puff on his cigar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑着吸了一口雪茄。

Sense.DEF: a sudden small movement of wind, air, or smoke
Sense.TRAN: 〔风﹑空气或烟的〕一阵﹐一团﹐一股

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dragon disappeared in a puff of smoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 龙消失在一阵烟雾中。

Sense.DEF:
a piece of light
pastry
with a soft mixture inside
your breath
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was out of puff had difficulty breathing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喘不过气来。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing or a speech that praises someone too much – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 吹捧的文章[讲话]〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of round white
fungus
that bursts to send out its seeds
breathing quickly because you have been using a lot of energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m too puffed to dance any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累得上气不接下气﹐没法再跳舞了。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that shows you are too pleased with yourself and your achievements – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was so puffed up with my own importance in those days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些日子我太妄自尊大了。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of equipment containing medicine which you breathe in through your mouth, to help you breathe more easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Asthma can be made worse by using puffers too often.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过于频繁地使用吸入器可能会加重哮喘。

Sense.DEF: a type of tropical fish that can fill itself with air so that it looks almost round
a North Atlantic seabird with a black and white body and a large brightly coloured beak
Sense.TRAN: 海鹦〔一种北大西洋海鸟﹐体呈黑白色﹐喙大而色彩鲜艳〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of very light
pastry
made of many thin layers
Sense.TRAN: 〔有很多层且非常松软的〕油酥点心

Sense.DEF: if a part of your body is puffy, it is swollen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were puffy from crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双眼哭肿了。

Sense.DEF: soft and full of air
Sense.EXAMPLE: puffy white clouds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朵朵松软的白云

Sense.DEF: a small short-haired dog with a wide flat face, a very short nose, and a curly tail

a
boxer
very eager to argue or fight with people
Sense.TRAN: 爱争吵的﹐易滋事的﹐好斗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The professor had been pugnacious and irritable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位教授好斗而易怒。

Sense.DEF: to bring food back up from your stomach through your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: He puked all over the carpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吐得地毯上到处都是。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: That kind of greed makes me puke!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么贪婪﹐真让我恶心！

Sense.DEF: food brought back up from your stomach through your mouth
very unpleasant or unattractive
Sense.TRAN: 令人不舒服的﹐令人不愉快的﹐令人讨厌的

Sense.DEF: real or properly made and of good quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: pukka food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质食品

Sense.DEF: physical beauty

one of the 21 prizes given every year in the US to people who have produced especially good work in
journalism writing for newspapers
, literature, or music. The prizes were started by the US newspaper owner Joseph Pulitzer (1847–1911), and winning a Pulitzer Prize is regarded as a great honour.
Sense.TRAN: 普利策奖〔每年一次在美国颁发﹐共设21个奖项﹐获奖者为在新闻﹑文学或音乐方面有杰出作品的人〕

Sense.DEF: to use your hands to make something or someone move towards you or in the direction that your hands are moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom! Davey’s pulling my hair!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈! 戴维拽我的头发！

GramExa.PROPFORM: pull sb/sth into/away from/over etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pulled her down into her seat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她拉到座位上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pulled open the door and hurried inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拉开门匆匆走了进去。

Sense.DEF: to use force to take something from the place where it is fixed or held
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has to have two teeth pulled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她必须拔掉两颗牙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Vicky had pulled the arm off her doll.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维基把娃娃的一只胳膊扯掉了。

Sense.DEF: to be attached to something or hold something and make it move behind you in the direction you are going
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tractor pulling a trailer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后挂一辆拖车的拖拉机

Sense.DEF: to take something out of a bag, pocket etc with your hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pulled out his wallet and said ‘let me pay’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他掏出钱包说道:“我来付吧。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben pulled a pen from his pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本从口袋里掏出一支钢笔。

GramExa.GLOSS: take one out, ready to use it

Sense.DEF: to put on or take off a piece of clothing, usually quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pulled off his damp shirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱掉湿衬衫。

Subsense.DEF: to move your body or part of your body away from someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tried to pull her hand free, but it was held fast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想抽出手来﹐但是被牢牢地抓住了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She struggled fiercely, trying to pull her arm out of his grasp.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她使劲挣扎﹐想要抽出被他紧紧抓住的胳膊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pulled away from him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挣脱了他。

Subsense.LEXUNIT: pull yourself up/to your feet etc
Subsense.DEF: to hold onto something and use your strength to move your body towards it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Benny pulled himself up from the floor with difficulty.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本尼费力地从地板上站起来。

Sense.DEF: to injure one of your muscles by stretching it too much during physical activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul pulled a muscle trying to lift the freezer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗想把冰柜抬起来﹐结果拉伤了肌肉。

Sense.DEF: to secretly use your influence with important people in order to get what you want or to help someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了自己的利益或帮助别人而〕托关系﹐走后门
Sense.EXAMPLE: Francis pulled strings to get him out of trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗朗西斯托关系让自己摆脱了麻烦。

Sense.DEF: to control something or someone, especially when you are not the person who is supposed to be controlling them
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was widely believed that Montagu was secretly pulling the strings behind the Prime Minister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍认为蒙塔古在暗中控制首相。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in doing something illegal or dishonest or in playing a trick on someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gang have pulled another bank robbery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个团伙又犯下一桩银行抢劫案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was trying to pull a fast one deceive you when he told you he’d paid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他告诉你他已经付过款﹐其实他是想骗你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t you ever pull a stunt like that again!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再耍那样的花招了！

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something that is not true, as a joke
Sense.TRAN: 开某人的玩笑﹐耍弄某人﹐诓骗某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t won, have I? You’re pulling my leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有赢﹐是吗？你在拿我开玩笑吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: pull the other one (it’s got bells on)
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you think they are joking or not telling the truth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your dad’s a racing driver? Pull the other one!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你爸是赛车手？别逗了！

Sense.DEF:
to move a control such as a switch,
lever
, or
trigger
towards you to make a piece of equipment work
Sense.EXAMPLE: She raised the gun, and pulled the trigger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她举起枪﹐扣动了扳机。

Sense.DEF:
to open or close curtains or
blind s
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was already getting dark so he pulled the curtains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色已暗﹐他拉上了窗帘。

Sense.DEF: if an event, performer etc pulls crowds or a politician pulls a lot of votes, a lot of people come to see them or vote for them
Sense.TRAN: 吸引〔大量选票或人〕﹐招徕〔支持〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Muhammad Ali can still pull the crowds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆罕默德·阿里仍能吸引大批的支持者。

Sense.DEF: to attract or influence someone or their thoughts or feelings
Sense.TRAN: 吸引﹐影响〔他人的思想或感情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city’s reputation for a clean environment has pulled new residents from other states.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市以干净整洁著称﹐吸引了来自其他州的新居民。

Sense.DEF: to attract someone in order to have sex with them or spend the evening with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knew he could pull any girl he wanted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道自己要什么姑娘都能得手。

Sense.DEF: to stop a planned event from taking place
Sense.EXAMPLE: They pulled the concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们取消了音乐会。

Sense.DEF:
to take away someone’s
licence
to do something, especially to drive a car, because they have done something wrong
to drive a vehicle somewhere and stop, or to make a vehicle gradually slow down and stop
Sense.TRAN: 〔把车〕开到某处停下﹔〔把车〕停在某处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pulled the car into a side street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把车开进一条小路停下来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus pulled to a halt .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车停了下来。

Sense.DEF: if a car pulls to the left or right as you are driving, it moves in that direction because of a problem with its machinery
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车由于机械故障不向正前方行驶而〕侧斜

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is very difficult or unpleasant to persuade someone to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔劝某人〕做某事就像拔牙一样困难
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting him to do his homework is like pulling teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让他做家庭作业就像要给他拔牙一样难。

Sense.DEF:
to get beer out of a
barrel
by pulling a handle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The barman laughed and began to pull a couple of pints.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧男招待笑了笑﹐然后从酒桶里放出几品脱啤酒。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately hit someone with less force than you could do, so that it hurts less
Sense.TRAN: 故意不使出全力打某人〔以避免伤害〕

Sense.DEF:
to hit the ball in
cricket
, golf, or baseball so that it does not go straight but moves to one side

to make a boat move by using
oar s

Crossrefto.REFLEX: pull the rug (out) from under sb’s feet
pull the wool over sb’s eyes

Exponent.DEF: to make something or someone move in the direction that your hands are moving
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He pulled her towards him and kissed her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她拉过来吻她。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sam was pulling on his socks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆把袜子往上拉。

Exponent.DEF: to pull something suddenly with a short quick movement, often to get someone’s attention
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Look,’ he said, tugging at his brother’s sleeve.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “看。”他说着拉了拉他弟弟的袖子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I tugged at the drawer but it wouldn’t open.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拉了拉抽屉,但拉不开。

Exponent.DEF: to pull something along the ground, especially because it is heavy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If we can’t lift the piano, we’ll have to drag it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们抬不动钢琴,就只好拖了。

Exponent.DEF: to pull something big and heavy using a lot of effort, especially upwards and using a rope
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They hauled their boats further up the beach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们沿着海滩把船继续往岸上拖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: fishermen hauling in their nets
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉网的渔民

Exponent.DEF: to pull or lift something very heavy, especially with one movement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He heaved the sack of sand onto his shoulder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把沙袋举到肩上。

Exponent.DEF: to pull something or someone gently in a particular direction
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lisa reached for his hand but he drew it away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉萨去拉他的手,但他把手抽开了。

Exponent.DEF: to be attached to a vehicle or piece of machinery and make it move behind you in the direction you are going
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ten dogs were pulling a sledge over the ice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 十条狗在冰上拉雪橇。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tractor pulling a plough
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在拉犁的拖拉机

Exponent.DEF: to pull a vehicle behind – used about a vehicle, a boat, or a horse pulling something using a rope or chain
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The car in front of us was towing a caravan.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们前面的那辆汽车在牵引一辆大篷车。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Horses were used to tow the boats along the canals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 马被用来沿着运河牵引小船。

Exponent.DEF: to pull a vehicle such as a carriage – used especially about horses doing this
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a carriage drawn by four horses
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 四驾马车
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a horse-drawn cart
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 马拉的大车

Sense.DEF: if one vehicle pulls ahead of another, it gets in front of it by moving faster
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆〕加快速度赶到〔…的〕前面﹔加速超越〔车〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Schumacher pulled ahead of Montoya as the two drivers approached the first corner of the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舒马赫在接近比赛第一个弯道时超过了蒙托亚。

Sense.DEF: to separate something into pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pull the meat apart with two forks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用两把叉子把肉分开。

Sense.DEF: to make the relationships between people in a group bad or difficult
Sense.TRAN: 使某些人关系紧张﹐使某些人不和睦
Sense.EXAMPLE: His drinking pulled the family apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他酗酒致使家庭不和睦。

Sense.DEF: to carefully examine or criticize something
Sense.TRAN: 仔细检查某事物﹔细致地批评某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The selection committee pulled each proposal apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选拔委员会仔细斟酌了每个建议。

Sense.DEF: to separate people or animals when they are fighting
Sense.TRAN: 拉开[分开]打架的人/争斗的动物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fight ended only when the referee pulled the two players apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判把两名球员拉开﹐打斗才停止。

Sense.DEF: if something pulls apart, it breaks into pieces when you pull on it
to take hold of something and pull it several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary was pulling nervously at her hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽不安地拉扯着自己的头发。

Sense.DEF: to take smoke from a pipe or cigarette into your lungs
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pulled hard on the cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他狠命地吸烟。

Sense.DEF: to take a long drink from a bottle or glass
Sense.TRAN: 从〔瓶子或玻璃杯〕中大口地喝

Sense.DEF: to start to drive away from a place where you had stopped
Sense.EXAMPLE: He waved as he pulled away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开走的时候挥了挥手。

Sense.DEF: to move ahead of a competitor by going faster or being more successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nkoku is pulling away from the other runners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恩科库把其他赛跑选手都甩在了后面。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to do or become involved in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the end, he pulled back from financing the film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐他决定不给那部电影提供资金。

Sense.DEF: to get out of a bad situation or dangerous place, or to make someone else do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many banks are pulling back from international markets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多银行正在从国际市场撤出。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are preparing to pull back their forces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正准备撤兵。

Sense.DEF:
if a team that is losing pulls back a
goal
or some points, it succeeds in scoring a goal or some points
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our play improved and we pulled back two goals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的表现有所好转﹐扳回两球。

Sense.DEF: to destroy something or make it stop existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: My old school was pulled down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的母校被拆除了。

Sense.DEF: to earn a particular amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Real estate stocks pulled down total returns of 35.7 percent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房地产股票总回报率达35.7%。

Sense.DEF: to make someone less successful, happy, or healthy
Sense.TRAN: 使某人受挫﹐使某人虚弱
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her problems have really pulled her down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她遇到了麻烦﹐非常沮丧。

Sense.DEF: to make a computer program show you a list of the things it can do
to encourage a person or team to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd were pulling for me to do well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群在为我加油。

Sense.DEF: if a driver pulls in, they move to the side of the road and stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pulled in to let the ambulance pass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把车开到路边停下﹐好让救护车过去。

Sense.DEF: if a train pulls in, it arrives at a station
