to attract business, money, people etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a publicity stunt to pull in the crowds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个吸引人群的宣传噱头

Sense.DEF: if you pull in a lot of money, you earn it
if a police officer pulls someone in, they take them to a police station because they think that person may have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔警察〕把〔嫌疑犯〕带回警察局﹐逮捕

Sense.DEF: to succeed in doing something difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper pulled off six terrific saves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位守门员奋力扑救了六个险球。

Sense.DEF: to drive a car off a road in order to stop, or to turn into a smaller road
Sense.TRAN: 驶离（道路）〔停下或进入小路〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We pulled off the road to get some food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们驶离大路去找点食物。

Sense.DEF:
to
pull at
something

Subsense.DEF: to drive onto a road from another road or from where you have stopped
Subsense.TRAN: 〔从另一条路或停靠的地方〕开上路
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t pull out! There’s something coming.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别开出去！有车过来。

Subsense.DEF: to drive over to a different part of the road in order to get past a vehicle in front of you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I pulled out to overtake a bus.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我借道一边想超过一辆公共汽车。

Sense.DEF: if a train pulls out, it leaves a station
to stop doing or being involved in something, or to make someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: McDermott pulled out with an injury at the last minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克德莫特在最后时刻因伤退出。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are trying to pull out of the agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图退出协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He threatened to pull his son out of the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扬言说要让他的儿子离队。

Sense.DEF: to get out of a bad situation or dangerous place, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.TRAN: （使）摆脱〔不好的局面〕﹐（使）撤离〔危险的地方〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim saw that the firm was going to be ruined, so he pulled out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆看到公司即将破产﹐于是退出了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the troops have been pulled out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分军队已撤离。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: when the country was still pulling out of a recession
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家仍处在摆脱经济衰退困境的时候

Sense.DEF: to drive to the side of the road and stop your car, or to make someone else do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The policeman signalled to him to pull over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察示意他把车停到路边。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pulled the car over.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把车开到路边停下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A cop pulled him over and gave him a speeding ticket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名警察让他把车开到路边停下﹐并给了他一张超速罚款单。

Sense.DEF: to stay alive after you have been very ill or badly injured, or to help someone do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔从重病或重伤中〕恢复健康﹔帮助〔某人〕康复
Sense.EXAMPLE: His injuries are severe but he’s expected to pull through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的伤势很重﹐但有望康复。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in doing something very difficult, or to help someone to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: He relied on his experience to pull him through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他依赖他的经验来渡过难关。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people pull together, they all work hard to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we all pull together, we’ll finish on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们大家同心协力﹐就能按时完成。

Sense.DEF: to force yourself to stop behaving in a nervous, frightened, or uncontrolled way
Sense.TRAN: 控制自己的情绪﹐让自己冷静
Sense.EXAMPLE: With an effort Mary pulled herself together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽费了一番功夫﹐控制住自己的情绪。

Sense.DEF: to improve something by organizing it more effectively
Sense.TRAN: 整顿某事物﹐把某事物重新组织好
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need an experienced manager to pull the department together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一位有经验的经理来重整这个部门。

Sense.DEF: to stop the vehicle that you are driving
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pulled up in front of the gates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把车停在了门前。

Sense.DEF: to get a chair etc and sit down next to someone who is already sitting
Sense.TRAN: 拿把椅子/凳子等〔坐在某人旁边〕

Sense.DEF: to stop someone who is doing something wrong and tell them you do not approve

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt I had to pull her up on her lateness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得﹐对于她迟到我必须提出批评。

Sense.DEF: an act of using force to move something towards you or in the same direction that you are moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her a sharp pull forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地把她往前一拉。

Sense.DEF: a strong physical force that makes things move in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gravitational pull of the moon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球的引力

Sense.DEF: the ability to attract someone or have a powerful effect on them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After about a year I gave in to the pull of fatherhood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约一年以后﹐我再也抗拒不了做父亲的诱惑。

Sense.DEF: special influence or power over other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: His family’s name gives him a lot of pull in this town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他家族的名望使他在镇上具有很大的影响力。

Sense.DEF: a difficult climb up a steep road
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a long pull up the hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登山的路又长又陡。

Sense.DEF: an injury to one of your muscles, caused by stretching it too much during exercise
Sense.EXAMPLE: a groin pull
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腹股沟拉伤

Sense.DEF:
an act of taking the smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc into your
lung s
or of taking a long drink of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She took a long pull on her cigarette.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她深深地吸了一口烟。

Sense.DEF: a rope or handle that you use to pull something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He popped the ring pull on another can of lager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又拉开一罐淡啤酒的拉环。

Sense.DEF:
a way of hitting the ball in
cricket
, golf, or baseball so that it does not go straight, but moves to one side
trying to find someone who will take part in sexual activity with you
the act of moving soldiers away from the area where they were fighting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pullback of troops from the occupied territories
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从占领地撤军

Sense.DEF: a reduction in the value, amount, or level of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a significant pullback in the stock market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股市的急剧下跌

Sense.DEF:
the action of a plane moving backwards, away from an airport
terminal building where people wait to get on the plane
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机的〕退离航站楼〔准备起飞〕

Sense.DEF:
a list of things a computer program can do. You make a pull-down menu appear on the computer screen by
click ing
on a special word with a
mouse
.
a young chicken that is in its first year of laying eggs
a piece of equipment consisting of a wheel over which a rope or chain is pulled to lift heavy things
the ability of someone or something to attract people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Madonna’s pulling power filled the Arena for 10 nights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连十个晚上﹐剧场里充满了麦当娜的魅力。

Sense.DEF: a very comfortable train carriage, or a train made up of these carriages
Sense.TRAN: 〔特别舒适的〕普尔曼式卧铺车厢﹔普尔曼式卧铺列车

Sense.DEF:
pull-on clothes or shoes do not have any buttons,
zip s
etc, so you just pull them on to wear them
Sense.TRAN: 〔无扣﹑无拉链等的衣服或鞋〕套穿的﹐套头的

Sense.DEF: the act of an army, business etc leaving a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pull-out of troops will begin soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马上要开始撤军了。

Sense.DEF: part of a book or magazine that is designed to be removed and read separately
Sense.TRAN: 〔书刊中可单独取出的〕插页﹐活页
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pull-out on home PCs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于家用个人电脑的插页

Sense.DEF:
a piece of
woollen
clothing without buttons that you wear on the top half of your body
a small piece of metal attached to a can of food, drink etc that you pull in order to open it
an exercise in which you use your arms to pull yourself up towards a bar above your head
relating to the lungs, or having an effect on the lungs
a very soft substance that is almost liquid, made by crushing plants, wood, vegetables etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mash the bananas to a pulp .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把香蕉捣成糊状。
Sense.EXAMPLE: timber grown for wood pulp used for making paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种植以制造纸浆的树木
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soft pulp of leaves and mud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树叶和泥巴混成的浆液

Sense.DEF: the soft inside part of a fruit or vegetable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Halve the melon and scoop out the pulp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把瓜切成两半﹐挖出瓜瓤。

Sense.DEF: books, magazines, films etc that are badly written and that contain lots of sex, violence etc
Sense.TRAN: 劣质书刊﹐低级书刊﹔庸俗电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ad in a pulp magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低俗杂志中的一则广告
低俗小说

Sense.DEF: to seriously injure someone by hitting them many times
Sense.TRAN: 狠揍[痛打]某人﹐把某人打得血肉模糊

Sense.DEF: part of the inside of a tooth

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Cook slowly until soft and pulpy.

Sense.DEF: to beat or crush something until it becomes very soft and almost liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: pulped apples
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果泥

Sense.DEF: to beat or hit someone’s face or body very badly
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人的脸或身体〕打得血肉模糊
Sense.EXAMPLE: His body was pulped by the impact of the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的身体被火车撞得血肉模糊。

Sense.DEF: to make wood or old books and newspapers into paper
Sense.TRAN: 把〔木头或旧书报〕化成纸浆
Sense.EXAMPLE: wood pulping techniques
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木材制浆工艺
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unsold novels are sent to be pulped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未售出的小说被送去化成纸浆。

Sense.DEF: a raised structure inside a church that a priest or minister stands on when they speak to the people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rev. Dawson addressed the congregation from the pulpit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道森牧师在讲坛上向会众讲话。

Sense.DEF:
an object like a star that is far away in space and produces
radiation
and
radio wave s
to make sounds or movements that are strong and regular like a heart beating
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see the veins in his neck pulsating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他颈部的血管在跳动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: pulsating music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 律动的音乐

Sense.DEF: to be strongly affected by a powerful emotion or feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole city seemed to pulsate with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎整个城市都激动不已。

Sense.DEF: a beat of the heart or any regular movement that can be measured
Sense.TRAN: 〔心脏或其他有规律﹑能测量的〕搏动﹐跳动﹔脉动
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pulsations of the baby’s heart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿心脏的搏动
Sense.EXAMPLE: muscular pulsation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肌肉的跳动

Sense.DEF: the regular beat that can be felt, for example at your wrist, as your heart pumps blood around your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: His breathing was shallow and his pulse was weak .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呼吸很浅﹐脉搏微弱。

GramExa.GLOSS: count the beats of their pulse, usually by feeling their wrist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The doctor listened to his breathing and checked his pulse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生听他的呼吸并检查了他的脉搏。

GramExa.GLOSS: be able to feel a pulse, which shows that someone is alive
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I held his wrist, trying to find a pulse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抓住他的手腕﹐想找到脉搏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt his neck. There was no pulse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摸了摸他的颈部﹐没有脉搏。

GramExa.GLOSS: the number of beats that can be felt in a minute
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If your pulse rate is between 90 and 100, it is likely that you are unfit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你的脉率在90至100之间﹐那么你的身体状况可能有问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her pulse raced beat very quickly with excitement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她激动得脉搏急速跳动。

Sense.DEF: a strong regular beat in music
Sense.EXAMPLE: the distant pulse of a steel band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处钢鼓乐队传来的鼓点声

Sense.DEF: an amount of sound, light, or electricity that continues for a very short time
the ideas, feelings, or opinions that are most important to a particular group of people or have the greatest influence on them at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clinton had an uncanny ability to sense the pulse of the nation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克林顿拥有洞察民众心态的神奇本领。

Sense.DEF:
seeds such as beans,
pea s
, and
lentil s
that you can eat

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have/keep your finger on the pulse

Sense.DEF: to move or flow with a steady quickbeat or sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt the blood pulsing through her veins .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得血液冲击着自己的血管。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colored lights pulsed in time to the music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩灯随着音乐节拍闪动。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or emotion pulses through someone, they feel it very strongly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Excitement pulsed through the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 兴奋情绪传遍了人群。

Sense.DEF:
to push a button on a
food processor
to make the machine go on and off regularly, rather than work continuously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pulse several times until the mixture looks like oatmeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点动数次﹐直到混合物看上去和燕麦粉差不多。

Sense.DEF: to crush something into a powder
Sense.EXAMPLE: The seeds can be used whole or pulverized into flour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些籽可以完整使用﹐或者磨成粉末。

Sense.DEF: to completely defeat someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stewart completely pulverized the opposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯图尔特彻底击败了对手。

Sense.DEF:
a
cougar

very light grey rock from a
volcano
that is crushed to a powder and used for cleaning
a piece of pumice stone that you rub on your skin to clean it or make it soft
Sense.TRAN: 〔一块〕浮石〔用于清洁皮肤或磨擦皮肤使其柔滑〕

Sense.DEF:
to hit someone or something many times quickly, especially using your
fist s closed hands
Sense.TRAN: 反复猛击﹐〔尤指〕用双拳接连地捶打
Sense.EXAMPLE: Diane leaned over and pummeled the pillows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜俯下身不断捶打枕头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She flew at him, pummelling his chest with her fists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向他冲过去﹐用拳头连连捶打他的胸膛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cook pummelled at the dough.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨师反复捶打面团。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The platoon was pummeled by heavy machine-gun fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个排遭到了机枪火力猛烈的连续攻击。

Sense.DEF: to completely defeat someone at a sport
a machine for forcing liquid or gas into or out of something

GramExa.GLOSS: for moving water, air etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 抽水机/抽气机/啤酒泵等

GramExa.GLOSS: operated by your hand or foot
for putting petrol into cars
for removing the contents of someone’s stomach

Subsense.DEF: a flat light shoe for dancing, exercise, sport etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔跳舞﹑锻炼﹑运动等用的〕平底轻便鞋

Subsense.DEF:
a woman’s plain shoe with no
lace s
,
buckle s
etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a pair of leather pumps
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双无带女皮鞋

Sense.DEF: an act of pumping
to make liquid or gas move in a particular direction, using a pump

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fire department is still pumping floodwater out of the cellars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防人员仍在用水泵从地下室里往外抽积水。

Sense.DEF: to bring a supply of water, oil etc to the surface from under the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were able to pump clean water from several of the wells.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能从几口井里抽出干净的水来。

GramExa.GLOSS: put gasoline into a car
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got a job pumping gas for the hotel guests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得到一份为宾馆客人的汽车加油的工作。

Sense.DEF: to move very quickly in and out or up and down
Sense.EXAMPLE: My heart was pumping fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的心怦怦直跳。

Sense.DEF: to operate a pump

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The furnace man’s job was to pump away furiously at the bellows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火炉工的工作就是用力推拉风箱。

Sense.DEF: if a liquid pumps from somewhere, it comes out suddenly in small amounts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blood pumped from the wound.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 血从伤口汩汩涌出。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone a lot of questions in order to get information from them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried to pump him for information about their other contacts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图从他嘴里套出有关其他联系人的情况。

Sense.DEF: to put a lot of drugs into someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: athletes pumped full of steroids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量使用类固醇的运动员

Sense.DEF: to do exercises by lifting heavy weights
to have a medical treatment to remove things you have swallowed, using a pump
to shoot someone several times
Sense.TRAN: 将多发子弹射入某人身体/某物

Sense.DEF:
to put a lot of money into a pro-ject,
investment
etc
Sense.TRAN: 在某事物上注入大量资金

Sense.DEF: if something such as music, information, or a supply of products pumps out, or if someone pumps it out, a lot of it is produced
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐〕连续播放﹔〔信息或产品〕大量提供﹐大量供应
Sense.EXAMPLE: Music pumped out from the loudspeakers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喇叭里一直播放着音乐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: propaganda pumped out by the food industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品行业的大量宣传

Sense.DEF: to remove liquid from something, using a pump
Sense.TRAN: 用泵抽出〔某物中的液体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to pump the boat out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得用泵把船里的水抽出来。

Sense.DEF:
to fill a tyre,
airbed
etc with air until it is full
Sense.TRAN: 给〔轮胎﹑充气床垫等〕充满气

Sense.DEF: to increase the value, amount, or level of something
Sense.TRAN: 增加〔某物〕的价值[数量﹐水平]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US was able to pump up exports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国有能力增加出口量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, pump up the volume play music louder !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐把音量开大！

Sense.DEF: to increase someone’s excitement, interest etc
Sense.TRAN: 使兴奋﹐使更感兴趣﹔给〔某人〕打气

Sense.DEF: a pump-action piece of equipment is operated by pulling or pressing a part in or out so that the contents come out in short bursts
Sense.TRAN: 推拉式的﹐滑杆式的﹐压出式的

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 滑杆式猎枪/推拉式来复枪

Sense.DEF: very excited about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m really pumped about this opportunity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机会让我兴奋不已。

Sense.DEF: a heavy dark brown bread
a very large orange fruit that grows on the ground, or the inside of this fruit
Sense.EXAMPLE: pumpkin pie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南瓜饼

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to someone you love
Sense.TRAN: 小南瓜〔一种称呼所爱之人的方式〕

Sense.DEF: the process of trying to help a business, industry, or country to develop by giving it money
Sense.TRAN: 刺激经济[援助某企业﹑行业﹑国家]的投资

Sense.DEF: an amusing use of a word or phrase that has two meanings, or of words that have the same sound but different meanings
Sense.TRAN: 双关语﹐语义双关的俏皮话

GramExa.GLOSS: used to show you know you are making a pun
used to show you do not mean to make a joke about something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The clergy prey (no pun intended) on bereaved families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些家庭痛失亲人﹐神职人员乘机牟利——prey并非语带双关。

Sense.DEF: to make a pun

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In this line, Hamlet puns on the meaning of ‘saw’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这句台词里﹐哈姆雷特说saw时语意双关。

Sense.DEF:
to hit someone or something hard with your
fist closed hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: He punched me and knocked my teeth out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝我一拳﹐打落了我的牙齿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He punched Jack in the face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一拳打在杰克的脸上。

Sense.DEF: to make a hole in something, using a metal tool or other sharp object
Sense.TRAN: 〔用金属工具或其他尖物〕在〔某物〕上打孔
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guard punched my ticket and I got on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守卫在我的票上打孔后﹐我就上去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These bullets can punch a hole through 20 mm steel plate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些子弹可以穿透20毫米厚的钢板。

Sense.DEF: to push a button or key on a machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just punch the button to select a track.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只需按下按钮即可选择曲目。

Sense.LEXUNIT: punch holes in sb’s argument/idea/plans etc
Sense.DEF: to criticize someone’s views, idea, plans etc by showing why they are wrong
Sense.TRAN: 批评某人的论点/观点/计划等并指出其毛病

Sense.DEF: to make a movement like a punch towards the sky, to show that you are very pleased
Sense.EXAMPLE: He punched the air in triumph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挥拳以示胜利。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone hard in the face
to record the time that you start or finish work by putting a card into a special machine
to move cattle from one place to another

if businesses, organizations, teams etc punch above their weight, they are successful in an activity or task which usually needs more money, power, skill etc than they seem to have – used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 完成超出自己能力的事〔尤用于报纸中〕

Sense.DEF: to record the time that you arrive at work, by putting a card into a special machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔在特制机器中〕打卡记录上班时间﹐上班打卡

Sense.DEF: to put information into a computer by pressing buttons or keys
Sense.TRAN: 〔按下按钮或键〕往计算机里输入信息

Sense.DEF: to record the time that you leave work, by putting a card into a special machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔在特制机器中〕打卡记录下班时间﹐下班打卡

Sense.DEF: to hit someone so hard that they become unconscious

a quick strong hit made with your
fist closed hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a punch in the kidneys
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打在后腰的一拳
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to land a punch on his chin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一拳击中他的下巴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The two men started throwing punches trying to hit each other .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两个男人动起了拳头。

Sense.DEF: a strong effective way of expressing things that makes people interested
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thirty years after it was written, Orton’s ‘Entertaining Mr Sloane’ still packs a punch .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写成30年以后﹐奥顿的《款待斯罗恩先生》依然很有感染力。

Sense.DEF: a drink made from fruit juice, sugar, water, and usually some alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 宾治﹐潘趣酒〔用果汁﹑糖和水制成﹐一般含酒精〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of hot punch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯热宾治

Sense.DEF: a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole
two bad events that happen close together
Sense.EXAMPLE: A meteorite collided with Earth at the same time, delivering a one-two punch to the magnetic field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同时﹐一颗陨石撞上地球﹐给磁场造成了双重打击。

Sense.DEF: to express disapproval or criticism clearly, without trying to hide anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: The inquiry report doesn’t pull any punches in apportioning blame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查报告在追究责任方面毫不留情。

Sense.DEF: to do or get something before anyone else does
Sense.TRAN: 先发制人﹐抢先做某事[得到某物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hitachi has beaten its competitors to the punch with its new palmtop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日立公司抢在其竞争者之前推出了新款掌上电脑。

Sense.DEF: very happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s as pleased as punch about the baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝让他感到十分开心。

Sense.DEF:
a traditional type of entertainment for children, especially at British
seaside
towns, that uses
puppet s
Sense.TRAN: 庞奇和朱迪木偶戏〔一种使用木偶的传统儿童娱乐形式﹐尤在英国海滨城市中流行〕

Sense.DEF: a heavy leather bag hung from a rope, that is punched for exercise or training
Sense.TRAN: 〔锻炼或训练用的〕皮吊袋﹐沙袋

Sense.DEF: a person who is hit, criticized strongly, or blamed, even though they have done nothing wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young wife whose husband used her as a punching bag
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被丈夫当作出气筒的年轻妻子

Sense.DEF: a large bowl in which punch a mixed drink is served
very confused, especially because you have had a lot of bad luck or have been treated badly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因连遭不幸或受虐待而〕神志恍惚的

Sense.DEF:
a
boxer
who is punch-drunk is suffering brain damage from being hit on the head
a card with a pattern of holes in it that was used in the past for putting information into a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔过去用于往计算机中输入信息的〕穿孔卡片

Sense.DEF: the last few words of a joke or story, that make it funny or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 〔笑话或故事中最后点题或抛出笑料等的〕妙语﹐画龙点睛的结尾语

Sense.DEF: a fight
a punchy piece of writing or speech is short but very clear and effective
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章或演讲〕简短有力的﹐简练的﹐精简的

Sense.DEF: very careful to behave correctly and follow rules

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe was always punctilious about repaying loans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔一向按时足额偿还贷款。

Sense.DEF: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一向准时赴约。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the punctual payment of invoices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 准时结清费用清单

Sense.DEF:
to divide written work into sentences, phrases etc using
comma s
,
full stop s
etc
to be interrupted by something, especially when this is repeated
Sense.EXAMPLE: The silence was occasionally punctuated by laughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寂静间或被笑声打破。

Sense.DEF: the marks used to divide a piece of writing into sentences, phrases etc

a sign, such as a
comma
or
question mark
, used to divide a piece of writing into sentences, phrases etc
Sense.TRAN: 标点符号〔如逗号或问号等〕

Sense.DEF: a small hole made accidentally in a tyre
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was cycling home when she had a puncture .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她骑车回家途中轮胎被扎破了。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that lets air out very slowly

Sense.DEF: a small hole made by a sharp point, especially in someone’s body
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指身体上由尖物刺穿的〕小孔
Sense.EXAMPLE: puncture wounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺伤

Sense.DEF: if a tyre punctures, or if you puncture it, a small hole appears in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A piece of glass punctured the back tyre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块玻璃把后轮胎戳破了。

Sense.DEF: to make a small hole in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: One bullet punctured his lung.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗子弹打穿了他的肺部。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pressurized container - do not puncture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力容器﹐切勿刺戳。

Sense.DEF: to interrupt a period of silence by making a noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a stunned silence, punctured by shrill laughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片诧异的沉默过后爆发出刺耳的笑声。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly destroy someone’s hopes or beliefs, making them feel unhappy, embarrassed, or confused
Sense.TRAN: 突然破坏〔某人〕的希望[信念]﹐突然使〔某人〕感到不快[难堪﹐迷惑]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t hurt, but his dignity was punctured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有受伤﹐不过自尊受到了伤害。

Sense.DEF: someone who is often asked to give their opinion publicly of a situation or subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you believe the fashion pundits, we’ll all be wearing pink this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你相信时尚权威们的话﹐今年我们就都要穿粉红色衣服了。

Sense.DEF: having a strong taste or smell
Sense.TRAN: 〔味道或气味〕强烈的﹐刺激性的﹐刺鼻的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pungent odour of garlic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大蒜的刺鼻气味

Sense.DEF: pungent speech or writing is clever and direct, and usually criticizes someone or something strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He expressed some fairly pungent criticisms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提出了一针见血的批评。

Sense.DEF: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law
Sense.TRAN: 处罚﹐惩罚〔做错事或犯法的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smacking is not an acceptable way of punishing a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要惩罚孩子﹐不应该用打的方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He promised to punish severely any officials found guilty of electoral fraud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承诺要严惩任何在选举中有欺诈行为的官员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s unfair to punish a whole class for the actions of one or two students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为个别同学的行为而惩罚全班是不公平的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They deserve to be punished for putting passengers at risk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们置乘客于危险之中﹐理应受到惩罚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt I was being punished for what my mother had done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己在为妈妈的所作所为接受惩罚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents decided to punish me by withdrawing financial support.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的父母决定对我停止经济资助以示惩戒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The House voted to punish the senator with a formal reprimand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议院投票决定正式对那位参议员予以谴责。

Sense.DEF: if a crime is punished in a particular way, anyone who is guilty of it is made to suffer in that way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In some societies, theft is punished by death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在某些社会﹐偷盗要被处死。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself feel guilty or bad for something you have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you fail, don’t punish yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果失败了﹐不要责备自己。

Sense.DEF: in law, a punishable act can be punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: a punishable offence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可依法惩处的违法行为

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a crime punishable by death
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可处以死刑的罪行

Sense.DEF: difficult, tiring, or extreme
Sense.TRAN: 困难的﹔令人困倦的﹔严重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He set himself a punishing schedule of conferences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为自己定下了繁忙的会议日程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of punishing defeats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串惨败
Sense.EXAMPLE: a punishing exercise regime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰苦的锻炼计划

Sense.DEF: something that is done in order to punish someone, or the act of punishing them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the punishment for treason is death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛国罪可判处死刑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was sent to bed as a punishment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为惩罚﹐我被打发上床睡觉。

Sense.DEF: rough physical treatment
Sense.EXAMPLE: tough plants that can take any amount of punishment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不怕粗暴对待的坚韧植物

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The court decided the original punishment was too severe.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭认为原先的判罚太过严厉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The punishment seemed very light.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一处罚好像很轻。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: appropriate and right
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Death would be a just punishment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 死刑是公正的惩罚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Children respond more to affection than to physical punishment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童对爱的反应比对体罚更积极。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone punishes a child by hitting them
death as a punishment for a crime

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He deserved the punishment he was given.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是罪有应得。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give people punishments
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The courts are handing out harsher punishments to reckless drivers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭对鲁莽驾车者的处罚更趋严厉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He received the maximum punishment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受到了最高的处罚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The thieves managed to escape punishment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些窃贼设法逃过了惩罚。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when saying what the punishment for something is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The offence carries a punishment of up to 10 years in prison.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一罪行最高可判十年徒刑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: punish someone, especially physically

Collocate.COLLOC: the punishment should fit the crime
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it should be appropriate
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The public believe that the punishment should fit the crime.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众认为量刑应与罪行相当。

Exponent.DEF: something that is done in order to punish someone, or the act of punishing them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t think they deserved such a severe punishment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他们不该受这么严厉的惩罚。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The usual punishment is life in prison.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常是判处无期徒刑。

Exponent.DEF: a punishment given by a judge in a court
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was given a long prison sentence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判长期监禁。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They asked for the maximum sentence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要求判处最高刑罚。

Exponent.DEF: an amount of money that you must pay as a punishment
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I got an £80 fine for speeding.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我因超速被罚款80英镑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are heavy fines for drink-driving.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒后驾车要受重罚。

Exponent.DEF: a general word for a punishment given to someone who has broken a law, rule, or agreement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s the penalty if you get caught?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你被发现的话会受什么处罚？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He called for stiffer penalties for crimes involving guns.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他呼吁对涉枪犯罪施以更严厉的刑罚。

Exponent.DEF: the system in which people are killed as a punishment for crimes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If he is found guilty, he faces the death penalty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他若被判有罪,将面临死刑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A number of states have abolished capital punishment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些州已废除了死刑。

Exponent.DEF: unpaid work helping other people that someone does as punishment for a crime
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was given a choice between doing 200 hours of community service, or a big fine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他可以选择200小时的社区服务或交付一大笔罚款。

Exponent.DEF: the punishment of children by hitting them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t agree with corporal punishment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不赞成体罚。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Corporal punishment was abolished in schools in 1987.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1987 年学校中废除了体罚。

Sense.DEF: intended to punish someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The agency sent a letter, but took no punitive action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经办处寄了一封信﹐不过没有采取惩罚行动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The jury awarded punitive damages money paid to someone who is the victim of a crime .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团判定支付损害赔偿金。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government is expected to take punitive steps against offenders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府应该对罪犯采取惩罚措施。

Sense.DEF: taxes etc that are so high that it is difficult for people to pay them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US could impose punitive tariffs on exports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国可能对出口产品征以高额关税。

Sense.DEF: the language used in the Punjab
someone from the Punjab
a type of loud music popular in the late 1970s and 1980s
Sense.TRAN: 朋克摇滚乐〔一种20世纪70年代末期和80年代流行的音乐〕

Sense.DEF: someone who likes punk music and wears things that are typical of it, such as torn clothes, metal chains, and coloured hair
Sense.TRAN: 朋克摇滚乐迷﹔追随朋克风格者〔如穿褴褛衣衫﹑佩戴金属链子﹑将头发染成鲜艳的颜色等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: punk hairstyles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朋克发式

Sense.DEF: a young man who fights and breaks the law

a substance that burns without a flame that is used to light
firework s
etc

in the past, a large
fan
that was hung across a room and was swung backwards and forwards by hand

a small square box used to hold soft fruits such as
strawberries
Sense.TRAN: 〔出售草莓等软质水果的〕小方盒[篓]

Sense.DEF: a long thin boat with a flat bottom that you move by pushing a long pole against the bottom of the river
the activity of travelling in a punt
Sense.EXAMPLE: a punt down the river
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撑方头平底船沿河流而下

Sense.DEF:
in
rugby
or American football, the action of kicking the ball after dropping it from your hands
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式或美式橄榄球中的〕抛球凌空踢出﹐碰踢
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 45-yard punt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 踢出45码的凌空球

Sense.DEF:
the standard unit of money used in the Republic of Ireland before the
euro
Sense.TRAN: 爱尔兰镑〔爱尔兰共和国货币单位﹐已被欧元取代〕

Sense.DEF: to go on a river in a punt
Sense.TRAN: 乘方头平底船﹔用方头平底船载运

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pete punted us back to the boatyard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮特用方头平底船把我们载回了船坞。

Subsense.DEF:
in
rugby
or American football, to drop the ball from your hands and kick it
Subsense.TRAN: 〔英式或美式橄榄球中〕抛球凌空踢出﹐碰踢
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He punted the ball 40 yards.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他踢出40码远的凌空球。

Subsense.DEF: to kick a ball hard so that it goes a long way

Sense.DEF: someone who buys a product or service

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The technical details mean nothing to the average punter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术上的细节对普通客户来说没有意义。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You need something to pull in the punters attract them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要有些东西来吸引顾客。

Sense.DEF:
someone who
bet s
on the result of a horse race etc
the player who punts the ball in American football
a puny person is small, thin, and weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: a puny little guy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘦小的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: puny arms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘦弱的臂膀

Sense.DEF: not effective or impressive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a puny attempt at humour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有效果的幽默

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our efforts look puny beside Fred’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的努力与弗雷德的相比简直不足挂齿。

Sense.DEF: a puny amount of money is too small
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was awarded a puny £1,000 in compensation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只判给她区区1,000英镑的赔偿金。

Sense.DEF: a young dog
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spaniel pup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙猎犬幼崽
Sense.EXAMPLE: a litter of pups several pups born to the same mother at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一窝小狗

Sense.DEF:
a young
seal
or
otter
a young man who is rude or too confident
Sense.TRAN: 粗鲁的小子﹐自负的小子

Sense.LEXUNIT: be sold a pup/buy a pup
Sense.DEF: to be tricked into buying something that is not worth what you paid for it
Sense.TRAN: 受骗买了不划算的东西

Sense.DEF: an insect at the stage before it becomes adult, when it is protected by a special cover
Sense.EXAMPLE: moth pupae
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛾蛹

Sense.DEF: to become a pupa
someone who is being taught, especially a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: About 20 pupils study music here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约20名小学生在这里学习音乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: staff and pupils
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教职员工和学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: a star pupil a very good one
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名优秀的小学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: a third-grade pupil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名三年级小学生

Sense.DEF: the small black round area in the middle of your eye
a model of a person or animal that you move by pulling wires or strings, or by putting your hand inside it
Sense.TRAN: 〔牵线〕木偶﹔〔套在手上操纵的〕布袋木偶﹐手偶

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 20-minute puppet show
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20分钟的木偶表演

Sense.DEF: a person or organization that allows other people to control them and make their decisions
Sense.TRAN: 受他人操纵的人[组织]﹐傀儡

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government is in danger of becoming a mere puppet of the military.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府面临沦为军方傀儡的危险。

GramExa.GLOSS: a government etc controlled by a more powerful country or organization

Sense.DEF: someone who performs with puppets
the art of performing with puppets
a young dog
Sense.EXAMPLE: a six-month-old puppy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只六个月大的小狗

Sense.DEF: used instead of the name of a thing, especially when you do not know the name
Sense.TRAN: 这/那东西[玩意儿]〔尤指不知如何称呼时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you turn this puppy off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么把这东西关掉？

Sense.DEF: fat on a child’s body, that disappears as they get older
Sense.TRAN: 〔长大后通常会消失的〕婴儿肥﹐小儿虚胖
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carol had shed her puppy fat and was now very elegant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡萝尔已经不像小时候那样胖嘟嘟了﹐现在出落得优雅大方。

Sense.DEF: a young person’s romantic love for someone, which other people do not think is serious
Sense.TRAN: 〔少男少女〕幼稚的迷恋﹐不成熟的爱﹐少年初恋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bad case of puppy love
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早恋的糟糕实例

Sense.DEF:
a small
tent
for two people
to buy something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can purchase insurance online.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在网上买保险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the growing demand to purchase goods on credit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断增长的赊账购物的需求
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where did you purchase the car?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在哪里买的车？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tickets may be purchased in advance from the box office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以预先在售票处买票。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: France was the no. 1 purchaser of Iraqi oil.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国曾是伊拉克石油的头号买家。

Sense.DEF: something you buy, or the act of buying it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She paid for her purchases and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This product should be consumed on the day of purchase.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本产品应于购买当天食用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a loan towards the purchase of a new car
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买新车的贷款

Sense.EXAMPLE: She made two purchases from my stall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

Sense.DEF: a firm hold on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ice made it impossible to get a purchase on the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上的冰让人走不稳。

Sense.DEF: the price that has to be paid for something, especially a house
Sense.EXAMPLE: We borrowed 80% of the purchase price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买价的八成我们依靠借贷。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that a person or group has available to spend
Sense.EXAMPLE: increases in purchasing power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买力的提高

Sense.DEF: the amount that a unit of money can buy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The purchasing power of the local currency has halved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地货币的购买力减弱了一半。

Sense.DEF: the custom in some Islamic and Hindu societies in which women stay indoors or cover their faces so that men cannot see them
Sense.TRAN: 〔有些伊斯兰教或印度教社会的〕深闺制度〔妇女闭门不出或蒙面﹐不让男人窥见容貌〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bride remains in purdah until the wedding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新娘直到婚礼才公开露面。

Sense.DEF: a period of being alone, especially to keep something secret
Sense.TRAN: 独处的生活〔尤指为了保守某个秘密〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: 18 months of self-imposed purdah
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 18个月的自愿离群索居

Sense.DEF: a pure substance or material is not mixed with anything

GramExa.EXAMPLE: pure wool blankets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯羊毛毯

Sense.EXAMPLE: rings made of pure gold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯金制成的戒指
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our beef patties are 100% pure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

Sense.DEF: complete and total
Sense.EXAMPLE: a work of pure genius
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝对的天才之作
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smile of pure joy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由衷的微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother’s life was pure hell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲的生活简直糟透了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By pure chance, I met Sir Malcolm that morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯属偶然﹐那天早上我碰到了马尔科姆爵士。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairman dismissed the report as pure speculation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席对那份报告不屑一顾﹐认为纯属臆断。

Sense.DEF: clean and not containing anything harmful
Sense.TRAN: 纯净的﹐洁净的﹐无有害物质的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had trouble finding a pure water supply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很难找到洁净的水源。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Up here the air was purer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这上面的空气更纯净。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that there is only one thing involved or worth considering
Sense.TRAN: 完全﹐不折不扣 〔用来强调只有一件事有关系或值得考虑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted revenge, pure and simple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一心只想报复。

Sense.DEF: without any sexual experience or evil thoughts
Sense.TRAN: 纯洁的﹐贞洁的﹐无邪的﹐清白的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pure young girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯洁的少女
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re too pure and innocent to know what’s really going on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们太纯洁太天真了﹐不了解实际上发生了什么。

Sense.DEF: very clear and beautiful
Sense.TRAN: 纯正的﹐无杂色的﹐清晰而优美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cloudless sky of the purest blue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碧蓝无云的天空
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice, clear and pure, soared up to the roof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的嗓音清晰纯净﹐声振屋宇。

Sense.DEF: typical of a particular style
Sense.EXAMPLE: His music is pure New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音乐是典型的纽约风格。

Sense.DEF: bred from only one group or race
Sense.EXAMPLE: My husband is pure Japanese and traces his family back 800 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我丈夫是纯正的日本人﹐他的家族可以追溯到800年以前。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Highland is the oldest and purest breed of cattle in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰高地牛是英国最古老最纯正的品种。

Sense.DEF: done according to an accepted standard or pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gothic architecture in its purest form
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最纯粹的哥特式建筑

Sense.DEF: work in science etc that increases our knowledge of the subject rather than using it for practical purposes

Sense.LEXUNIT: be as pure as the driven snow
Sense.DEF: to be morally perfect – used humorously to say someone is not like this at all
Sense.TRAN: 像白雪一样纯洁﹐〔道德上〕完美无瑕〔谑指与此根本不符的人〕

Sense.DEF: a purebred animal has parents that are both the same breed
Sense.EXAMPLE: purebred Irish wolfhounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯种爱尔兰猎狼犬

Sense.DEF: if you puree food, you crush it so that it is almost liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a processor to puree the apricots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用食物加工器将这些杏子搅成泥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: puréed potatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马铃薯泥

Sense.DEF: completely and only
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decision made for purely political reasons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯粹出于政治原因而作出的决定
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building was closed purely on the grounds of safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座大楼被关闭完全是出于安全考虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It happened purely by chance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事纯属偶然。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I do it purely and simply for the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我纯粹是为了钱才干的。

Sense.DEF:
a substance that makes your
bowel s
empty
something that makes you suffer – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sewing is relaxation for some, purgatory for others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缝纫对有些人来说是享受﹐而对另一些人则是受罪。

Sense.DEF: in Roman Catholic belief, a place where the souls of dead people suffer until they are pure enough to enter heaven
to force people to leave a place or organization because the people in power do not like them
Sense.TRAN: 清除﹐清洗﹐肃清〔对手或反对者〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sought to purge the Democrat party of conservatives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图清除民主党内的保守派党员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: plans to purge ethnic minorities from rebel-controlled areas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在叛军控制的地区清除少数民族的计划

Sense.DEF: to remove something that is thought to be harmful or unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 清除〔有害或不可接受之物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an initiative to purge the PC market of software pirates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 清除个人电脑市场中制作盗版软件者的倡议
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local languages were purged of Russian words.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地语言中的俄语词汇被清除了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to imagine now that Lawrence’s novels were purged from public libraries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在很难想象﹐劳伦斯的小说曾被清出公共图书馆。

Sense.DEF: to destroy something that is no longer needed
Sense.TRAN: 销毁﹐除去﹐删除〔不需要的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system automatically purges unread emails after two weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统会于两周后把未读的电子邮件自动删除。

Sense.DEF: to remove bad feelings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have to begin by purging our minds of prejudice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须首先消除头脑中的偏见。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Any doubts about his leadership were purged by the courage of his performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他所表现出的勇气彻底打消了大家对他领导能力的质疑。

Sense.DEF:
to take a substance that makes your
bowel s
empty
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anorexics may overeat before purging themselves or vomiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厌食症患者会在暴饮暴食之后服用泻药或者把吃下去的东西呕吐出来。

Sense.DEF:
to force yourself to bring food up from your stomach and out of your mouth, especially because you have
bulimia
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤由于患有贪食症〕吐出吃下的食物﹐催吐

Sense.DEF: an action to remove your opponents or the people who disagree with you from an organization or a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Stalinist purges
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯大林进行的清洗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a purge of military commanders
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 清洗军事指挥官的行动
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a purge on tax dodgers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对逃税者的整肃

Sense.DEF:
a substance used to make you empty your
bowel s
something used to remove dirty or harmful substances
to remove dirty or harmful substances from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: chemicals used to purify the water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于净化水质的化学品

Sense.DEF: to make someone pure by removing evil from their soul
Sense.EXAMPLE: They prayed to God to purify them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们祈求上帝为自己涤罪。

Sense.DEF: someone who believes that something should be done in the correct or traditional way, especially in the areas of art, sport, music, and language
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在艺术﹑体育﹑音乐和语言上的〕力求纯正者﹐纯粹主义者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The puristswon’t like it, but opera on TV certainly brings in the audiences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯粹派不会喜欢这么做﹐但电视上播出歌剧的确吸引了观众。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Architects with purist views were suspicious of his work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持纯粹派观点的建筑师对他的作品表示怀疑。

Sense.DEF: someone with strict moral views who thinks that pleasure is unnecessary and wrong
Sense.TRAN: 过清教徒式生活的人〔道德标准严格﹐认为享乐没有必要并且是错误的〕

Sense.DEF: a member of a Protestant religious group in the 16th and 17th centuries, who wanted to make religion simpler
Sense.TRAN: 清教徒〔16世纪和17世纪基督教一教派成员﹐主张简化宗教仪式〕

Sense.DEF: very strict about moral matters, especially sex – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 道德作风〔尤指性方面〕极端严谨的﹐清教徒式的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a puritanical father who wouldn’t let his children watch television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不让孩子看电视的清教徒式的父亲
Sense.EXAMPLE: The atmosphere at the school was oppressively puritanical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那所学校是清教徒式的风气﹐显得很压抑。

Sense.DEF: strict religious and moral attitudes – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔宗教和道德行为上〕非常拘谨的态度﹐清教徒式的主张〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a harsh and repressive sexual puritanism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严苛而压制性欲的清教徒式的态度

Sense.DEF: the quality or state of being pure
Sense.EXAMPLE: the purity of tap water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自来水的纯净度
心灵的纯洁

Sense.DEF:
a type of stitch that you use when you
knit make clothes from wool
the area in and around a place
to obtain something without permission – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 偷窃﹔擅自取〔某物〕〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He must have purloined a key from somewhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肯定是从哪里偷了一把钥匙。

Sense.DEF: a dark colour that is a mixture of red and blue
having a dark colour that is a mixture of red and blue

Sense.LEXUNIT: purple with rage/purple in the face etc
Sense.DEF: with a face that is dark red, caused by anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face turned purple with rage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他气得脸色发紫。

Sense.DEF: a time when you are very successful – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 处于顺境的日子〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve’s purple patch continued with a second victory on Tuesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫继续一帆风顺﹐周二获得了第二次胜利。

Sense.DEF: writing that uses difficult or unusual words – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 辞藻堆砌的散文/过于雕饰的段落〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
a
medal
given to US soldiers who have been wounded
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国授予作战负伤军人的〕紫心勋章

Sense.DEF: slightly purple
to claim to be or do something, even if this is not true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two undercover officers purporting to be dealers infiltrated the gang.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位伪装成毒贩的警员打入了那个团伙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The document is purported to be 300 years old.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份文献据称已有300年历史。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅据说是莎士比亚的肖像画

Sense.DEF: the general meaning of what someone says
the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: What is the purpose of your visit?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来访的目的是什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The purpose of conducting a business is to make money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 做生意就是为了赚钱。

GramExa.PROPFORM: for the purpose of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Troops were sent solely for the purpose of assisting refugees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 派遣军队目的只在于援助难民。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It should be legitimate to use cannabis for medical purposes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为医疗用途使用大麻应当是合法的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The protection of children is the primary purpose of this legislation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护儿童是这项立法的基本目的。

GramExa.GLOSS: achieve something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would serve no useful purpose to re-open the investigation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 重新开始调查是没有意义的。

Sense.DEF: a plan or aim
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick had no particular purpose in mind when he started.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克开始的时候头脑中并没有明确的目标。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Attending the race was not my purpose in coming to Indianapolis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来印第安纳波利斯不是为了参加比赛。

GramExa.PROPFORM: with the purpose of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He came here with the purpose of carrying out the attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他来这里是为了实施攻击。

Sense.DEF: in a particular situation or when being considered in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: For tax purposes, you will be treated as a married couple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报税时你们俩将被视作已婚夫妇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The details are, for the present purposes , irrelevant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前情况下﹐这些细节无关紧要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For the purposes of this book, America is taken to include the continent north of Mexico.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这本书里﹐美洲是指墨西哥以北的大陆。

Sense.DEF: deliberately

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You make it sound as if I did it on purpose!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的话听起来好像是我有意那么做的！

Sense.DEF: a feeling of determination to achieve things in life
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s so important to have a sense of purpose that it underlies human happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活目标很重要﹐有了它人生才会幸福。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My football career was over and I had no purpose in life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球生涯的结束让我觉得生活失去了意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He possessed great strength of purpose .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拥有坚强的意志。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is so close to the truth that it can be considered to be the truth
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war, to all intents and purposes, was over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争实际上已经结束了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have a Secretary of State for Scotland who is for all practical purposes a Scottish Prime Minister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有一位苏格兰事务大臣﹐实际上就是苏格兰的首相。

Sense.DEF: if something has served its purpose, it has done what you needed it to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: We delete the data once it has served its purpose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据一旦用过我们就把它删除。

Sense.DEF: to fail to achieve the result you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anxiety will cause tension, which defeats the purpose of the exercise the activity or plan .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忧虑会引发紧张情绪﹐一紧张就达不到目的了。

Sense.DEF: without any useful results
Sense.EXAMPLE: She called after them, but to no purpose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在他们身后叫他们﹐可是一点用也没有。

Sense.DEF: useful or helpful
Sense.TRAN: 有用的﹔有益的﹐有帮助的

Exponent.DEF: the reason you do something, and the thing you want to achieve when you do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What is the purpose of your visit to England?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去英国的目的是什么？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plant is used for medicinal purposes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物可作药用。

Exponent.DEF: what you want to achieve when you do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The main aims of the project are as follows.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目的主要目的如下所述。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their ultimate aim is to find a cure for cancer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的最终目的是找到一种治疗癌症的方法。

Exponent.DEF: something that you hope to achieve in the future, even though this may take a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It took Mandela over forty years to achieve his goal of a democratic South Africa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼德拉用了四十多年时间终于实现了南非民主化的目标。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the goal of ending child poverty
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 消除儿童穷困的目标

Exponent.DEF: something that you are working hard to achieve, especially in business or politics
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bank achieved its objective of increasing its share of the market.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家银行实现了提高市场份额的目标。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government’s long-term objective is to cut CO2 emissions by 50%.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的长期目标是把二氧化碳排放量减少50%。

Exponent.DEF: the specific purpose of an activity
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The object of the game is to get as many points as possible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项比赛的目标是尽可能多地得分。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The students will benefit, and that must be the object of the exercise the main thing that you are trying to do.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 让学生从中获益必须是这项练习的目的所在。

Exponent.DEF: the purpose of doing something and the reason why it is right or necessary
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At fourteen, I couldn’t see the point of going to school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 十四岁时我不明白上学意义何在。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s the point in waiting? I don’t think it is useful or necessary
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 等下去有什么用？

Exponent.DEF: the purpose that you have in your mind when you do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He kept his real intentions well hidden.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很好地掩盖了自己的真正意图。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Although we made a lot of money, this wasn’t our original intention.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我们赚了很多钱,但这并非我们的初衷。

Exponent.DEF: the result that someone is trying to achieve – used especially when you disapprove of what someone is doing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They are using religion for political ends.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在利用宗教来达到其政治目的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ends do not justify the meansyou should not use violence, cruelty, dishonest behaviour etc to achieve your aims.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可为了达到目的而不择手段。

Sense.DEF: designed and made for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 为某用途特制的﹐专门设计制造的
Sense.EXAMPLE: purpose-built toilets for disabled people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专为残疾人设计的厕所

Sense.DEF: having a clear aim or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 有目的的﹐有明确目标的﹔坚决的﹐果断的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a purposeful and consistent foreign policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明确而一贯的外交政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: a purposeful movement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目标明确的运动

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He walked purposefully to his desk.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他径直走向自己的书桌。

Sense.DEF: not having a clear aim or purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: hours of purposeless activity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几小时漫无目的的活动

Sense.DEF: deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: A clause in the contract had been left purposely vague.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同中有一个条款被故意定得模棱两可。

Sense.DEF: if a cat purrs, it makes a soft low sound in its throat to show that it is pleased
if the engine of a vehicle or machine purrs, it works perfectly and makes a quiet smooth sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆或机器的发动机正常运转时〕发出平稳低沉的声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: The big Bentley purred along the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆大宾利车隆隆地行驶在路上。

Sense.DEF:
to speak in a soft low
sexy
voice
Sense.TRAN: 以轻柔低沉而性感的声音说
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That feels good,’ she purred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那样感觉很好。”她柔声低语道。

PIC.HEADING: PURSE 手提包﹔钱包
PIC.PICCONTENT: handbag BrE【英】/purse AmE【美】手提包；purse BrE【英】/wallet AmE【美】钱包

Subsense.DEF: a small bag in which women keep paper money, coins, cards etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Julie opened her handbag and took out her purse.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉打开手袋﹐拿出钱包。

Subsense.DEF: a small bag used to hold coins, used especially by women
Subsense.TRAN: 〔放硬币的〕小钱包﹐零钱包〔尤指女式钱包〕

Sense.DEF: a bag in which a woman carries her money and personal things
Sense.EXAMPLE: I locked the door and dropped the keys in my purse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我锁上门﹐然后把钥匙丢进手提包里。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that a person, organization, or country has available to spend
Sense.TRAN: 〔个人﹑组织或国家的〕可使用资金﹐财力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Election expenses are met from the public purse money controlled by the government .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竞选费用从政府经费中支出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A visit to the new county museum will set the family purse back by around £12.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个家庭去参观新的县博物馆要花费大约12英镑。

Sense.DEF:
the amount of money given to someone who wins a sports event, such as a
boxing
match or a car race
Sense.TRAN: 〔给予体育比赛获胜者的〕奖金
Sense.EXAMPLE: They will compete for a $100,000 purse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将争夺10万美元奖金。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the control of spending in a family, company, country etc
Sense.TRAN: 控制〔家庭﹑公司等的〕开支﹐掌管钱财

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It all comes down to who holds the purse strings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切都得由掌管钱财的人说了算。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She keeps tight control over the purse strings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她严格控制着开支。

Sense.DEF: if you purse your lips, you bring them together tightly into a small circle, especially to show disapproval or doubt
Sense.TRAN: 噘起〔嘴唇﹐尤用于表示反对或怀疑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Biddell pursed her lips and shook her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比德尔太太噘起嘴﹐摇了摇头。

dictionary.Entry:
66
purser purs‧er
'pɜːsə ˋpɝsɚ
n C
an officer on a ship who is responsible for money and the passengers’ rooms, comfort etc 〔客轮上掌管账目﹑管理旅客房间等的〕事务长

Sense.DEF: with the aim of doing or achieving something, or while doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In pursuance of this objective, 8,000 letters were sent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了实现这个目标﹐寄出了8,000封信。

Sense.DEF: done according to a particular law, rule, contract etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy was provided with an interpreter, pursuant to the Individuals with Disabilities Act.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依据《残疾人法》﹐为那个男孩配备了一名翻译。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她计划从政。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了完成课业之外﹐学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: companies that pursue the traditional goal of profits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 照例追求利润的公司

Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

Sense.DEF: to continue trying to find out about or persuade someone about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 追究某件事/继续争论/深究某问题等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Janet did not dare pursue the matter further .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特不敢进一步追查那件事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The defence pursued the question of Dr Carrington’s state of mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告方深究卡林顿博士精神状态这个问题。

Sense.DEF: to chase or follow someone or something, in order to catch them, attack them etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔为抓捕﹑袭击等而〕紧随…之后﹔追捕﹐追击
Sense.EXAMPLE: Briggs ran across the field with one officer pursuing him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里格斯跑过农田﹐一名警察紧随其后。

Sense.DEF: to keep trying to persuade someone to have a relationship with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was pleased, but somewhat embarrassed, when she pursued me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她追求我我很高兴﹐不过也有些尴尬。

Sense.DEF: someone who is chasing you
Sense.EXAMPLE: They managed to escape their pursuers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们设法摆脱了追捕者。

Sense.DEF: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pursuit of liberty and happiness
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对自由和幸福的追求
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the pursuit of war criminals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 追踪战犯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People are having to move to other areas in pursuit of work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了找工作﹐人们不得不移居他处。

Sense.DEF: when someone chases or follows someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were four police cars in pursuit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有四辆警车在追赶。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit following closely behind .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区﹐詹森穷追不舍。

Sense.DEF:
an activity such as a sport or
hobby
, which you spend a lot of time doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: pursuits such as swimming and tennis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳和打网球之类的爱好

Sense.DEF:
containing or producing
pus
to supply goods, services, information etc to people
Sense.TRAN: 提供﹐供应〔货物﹑服务﹑信息等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: DJ Dominic purveys a unique brand of music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐节目主持人多米尼克播放一种独特的音乐。

Sense.DEF: a business that supplies goods, services, or information
Sense.EXAMPLE: purveyors of farmyard fresh poultry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场鲜禽肉供应商

Sense.LEXUNIT: within/outside the purview of sb/sth formal
Sense.DEF: within or outside the limits of someone’s job, activity, or knowledge
Sense.TRAN: 在某人/某物的范围[权限]之内/之外
Sense.EXAMPLE: This matter comes within the purview of the Department of Health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事属于卫生部的管辖范围。

Sense.DEF: a thick yellowish liquid produced in an infected part of your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wound oozing pus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化脓的伤口

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It didn’t move, so she pushed harder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它一动不动﹐因此她加力去推。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I promised to push him on the swings for as long as he wanted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我答应他想在秋千上荡多久我就推多久。
Sense.EXAMPLE: shoppers pushing their grocery carts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推着购物车的购物者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pushed him away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她推开了他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maria pushed her hair back from her forehead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚把头发从额头往后拢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Philip pushed him towards the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普把他往门口推。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I slowly pushed the door open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我慢慢地把门推开。

Sense.DEF: to press a button, switch etc in order to make a piece of equipment start or stop working
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got in and pushed the button for the fourth floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我进去后按了四楼的按钮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Push the green button to start the engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按绿色按钮发动引擎。

Sense.DEF: to use your hands, arms etc to make people or things move, so that you can get past them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t push. Everyone will get a turn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别挤﹐每个人都轮得到。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A fat man pushed past me in his rush to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个胖男人急着离开﹐从我身边挤了过去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pushed her way to the front.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挤到了前面。

Sense.DEF: to encourage or force someone to do something or to work hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: Encourage your kids to try new things, but try not to push them too hard .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要鼓励你的孩子们尝试新鲜事物﹐不过尽量不要逼得太紧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: athletes who push their bodies to the limit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将体能发挥到极限的运动员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been pushing himself too hard, working 12-hour days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给自己的压力太大了﹐每天工作12小时。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My husband pushed me into leaving the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我丈夫硬要我辞了职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teachers pushed the students to achieve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师们鞭策学生要学有所成。

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade people to accept your ideas, opinions etc in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president is trying to push his agenda in Congress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统正力劝国会接受自己的议题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was pushing hard for welfare reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正努力推行福利改革。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Company representatives are pushing to open foreign markets to their products.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司代表正力图把产品推向国外市场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We don’t try to push our religion on anyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想把自己的信仰强加于任何人。

Sense.DEF: to change someone’s situation, or to make a situation change, especially when some people do not want it to change
Sense.TRAN: 促使改变〔尤指一些人不愿意改变时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law would push even more children into poverty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法令会把更多儿童推向贫困。
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to push the peace process forward
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推动和平进程的尝试

Sense.DEF: to increase or decrease an amount, value, or number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Slow sales have pushed down orders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售不旺导致订单减少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New technology has pushed the cost of health care even higher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新技术进一步提高了医疗保健成本。

Sense.DEF: if an army pushes somewhere, it moves in that direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army was pushing north.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队向北挺进。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We pushed deep into enemy territory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向敌占区纵深挺进。

Sense.DEF: to try to sell more of a product by advertising it a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sports stars earn big bucks for pushing everything from shoes to soft drinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育明星们大做广告﹐从鞋子到软饮料﹐赚得盆满钵满。

Sense.DEF: to sell illegal drugs
to be nearly 40, 50 etc years old
to do something or ask for something, especially something you have done or asked for before, when this is likely to annoy someone or involves a risk
Sense.TRAN: 〔因曾经成功而〕再次冒险﹔得寸进尺﹔想（再）交好运
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she doesn’t want to go, don’t push it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她不想去﹐就别勉强了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s 26 miles, so you’re pushing your luck if you try to hike it in a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路途有26英里﹐要想在一天内走完未免太相信自己的运气了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: push sth out of your mind

Variant.LEXVAR: push sth to the back of your mind

Sense.DEF: to try not to think about something, especially something bad or worrying
Sense.TRAN: 把某物抛在脑后﹐忘记〔不愉快的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pushed the thought out of his mind and tried to concentrate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把那种念头抛诸脑后﹐尽量集中注意力。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel strong emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Movies shouldn’t be afraid to push a few buttons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影不应该害怕触动人们的某些情感。

Sense.DEF: to spend more money than you usually do, on something special
Sense.EXAMPLE: Push the boat out and get tickets to the theatre or ballet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奢侈一下﹐买票去看看戏或芭蕾吧！

Sense.DEF: to keep trying to make someone accept your opinion in a way that they think is annoying
Sense.TRAN: 〔令人讨厌地〕拼命劝说某人接受自己的观点

Sense.DEF: to do something that is new and that goes beyond the limits of what has already been done in a particular area of activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ideas that push the envelope of design and construction
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开创设计和建筑新境界的观点

Sense.DEF: to be dead – used humorously

Exponent.DEF: to make something or someone move by pressing them with your hands, arms etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Push the door, don’t pull it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 推门,不要拉门。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She pushed him away and walked out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她推开他,走了出去。

Exponent.DEF: to push someone or something in a rough or careless way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People were shoving to get to the front of the queue.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们互相推搡着想要挤到队伍前面。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tom shoved his suitcase under the bed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆把衣箱推到床底下。

Exponent.DEF: to push something quickly and carelessly into a small space
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She stuffed a few clothes into a bag and left.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往袋子里塞了几件衣服就走了。

Exponent.DEF: to push someone or something with your finger or something sharp
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I poked the snake with a stick but it was dead.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用一根木棍捅捅那条蛇,但它已经死了。

Exponent.DEF: to push someone beside you gently with your elbow to get their attention
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Toby nudged me and pointed out of the window.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 托比用胳膊肘碰了碰我,指指窗外。

Exponent.DEF: to push something round or something on wheels so that it moves forward
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They rolled the logs down the hill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把原木滚下山。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The car still didn’t start so we tried to roll it off the road.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车还是发动不起来,因此我们试着把它推离大路。

Exponent.DEF: to push something with wheels, for example a bicycle or a trolley, so that it moves forward, while guiding it with your hands
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Rob wheeled his bike round the back of the house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布把自行车推到屋后。

Sense.DEF: to continue with a plan or an activity, especially in a determined way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指坚定地〕继续进行﹐大力推进〔计划或活动〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Quinlan decided to push ahead with the deal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昆兰决定继续进行那笔交易。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think it is time for you to leave a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s getting late – I think we should be pushing along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天晚了﹐我想我们该走啦。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone what to do in an impolite or threatening way
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人〕发号施令﹔摆布〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europeans sometimes feel the Americans are trying to push them around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲人有时候觉得美国人在试图对他们发号施令。

Sense.DEF: to try to forget about something, especially something unpleasant, so that you can give your attention to what you are doing
Sense.TRAN: 设法忘掉﹐不去想〔尤指不愉快的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She pushed aside her anger, forcing herself to focus on her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她压住怒火﹐强迫自己专心工作。

Sense.DEF: to force someone out of their job or position, taking the job in their place
Sense.TRAN: 强迫〔某人〕离职﹔排挤〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Primakov was pushed aside but later became head of Intelligence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普里马科夫遭到排挤去职﹐但是后来却成为情报局局长。

Sense.DEF: to try to make other people notice you
Sense.TRAN: 〔为引人注目〕表现自己﹐出风头
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rupert was a quiet type, not one to push himself forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁珀特沉默寡言﹐不是个爱出风头的人。

Sense.DEF: to go in front of other people who are already waiting in a line for something, instead of going to the back of the line
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of boys pushed in at the head of the queue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个男孩插到了队伍的最前面。

Sense.DEF: to start moving in a boat, on a bicycle, or when swimming or jumping, by pushing against something with your arms, legs etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad pushed off and jumped into the rowboat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸双腿一蹬﹐跳进了划艇里。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone rudely to go away
to continue travelling somewhere, especially after you have had a rest
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to push on a little further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定再往前走一点。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing an activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nixon pushed on with the weapons development program.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克松继续实施武器开发计划。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something fall to the ground by pushing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went wild, pushing over tables and chairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他暴跳如雷﹐把桌椅都掀翻了。

Sense.DEF: to get a plan, law etc officially accepted, especially quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指快速地〕使〔计划﹑法律等〕获得通过
Sense.EXAMPLE: The planning application was pushed through as quickly as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规划申请在尽可能短的时间内获得了通过。

Sense.DEF: when someone pushes something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jodi had stopped swinging. ‘Want a push?’ her dad asked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔迪的秋千停下了。“要推一下吗？”她的爸爸问道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the door’s stuck, just give it a push .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是门卡住了﹐只要推一下就行。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at/with the push of a button
GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize how easy a machine is to use
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 按一下按钮就行了〔用于强调机器容易操作〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Files can be attached to your email at the push of a button.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要点击一下按钮就可以给电子邮件附加文档。

Sense.DEF: when someone, especially a business, tries to get or achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了达到某目的而作出的〕努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pre-Christmas advertising push
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节前的广告促销

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has recently made a big push into the Japanese market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家公司最近在努力打入日本市场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the push for improved productivity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 力争提高生产率

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a push to attract new members
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸引新会员的努力

Sense.DEF: if someone gives someone else a push, they encourage or persuade them to try something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She just needed a gentle push to get her to join in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要稍加劝说﹐就能让她加入。

Sense.DEF: a planned military movement into the area where the enemy is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The army has made another big push into enemy territory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队又在敌方领地挺进了一大步。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb the push/get the push

Subsense.DEF: if your employer gives you the push, they make you leave your job
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was scared I’d get the push.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我害怕被解雇。

Subsense.DEF: if someone you are having a romantic relationship with gives you the push, they tell you that they no longer want to continue the relationship
Subsense.TRAN: 与情人分手﹐断绝恋爱关系

Variant.LEXVAR: if it comes to the push

Sense.DEF: if a situation becomes very difficult or action needs to be taken
Sense.TRAN: 别无选择时﹔需要行动时
Sense.EXAMPLE: If push comes to shove, you can always sell the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实在没有办法的时候﹐你总还可以把车卖掉。

Sense.DEF: if you can do something at a push, it will be difficult, but you will be able to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have room for five people, maybe six at a push.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有够五个人待的地方﹐不得已时也许可以挤下六个人。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will be difficult because you do not have enough time to do it
Sense.TRAN: 时间紧迫〔因而觉得某事困难〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll do my best, but it’ll be a bit of a push.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会尽我所能﹐但时间会有点紧迫。

Sense.DEF:
a
bicycle
operated by pressing a button with your finger
Sense.EXAMPLE: a push-button telephone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按键式电话

Sense.DEF: a large flat container like a box with wheels, used especially by people who sell goods in the street
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指街头小贩使用的〕手推车

Sense.DEF: a small seat on wheels, in which a young child sits and is pushed along
to not have much time, money etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a bit pushed for time today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我时间有点紧。

Sense.DEF: too busy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d love to help, but I’m a bit pushed at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很愿意帮忙﹐但我现在有点忙。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of difficulty doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was hard pushed to keep my mind on my work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很难集中精神工作。

Sense.DEF: someone who sells illegal drugs
to be nearly 40, 60 etc years old – used only about older people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheila must be pushing 40 by now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉现在肯定快40岁了。

Subsense.DEF: to be easy to persuade, influence, or defeat
Subsense.TRAN: 是易被劝服[影响﹐击败]的人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They aren’t the best team in the league, but they’re no pushover , either.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不是联赛中最优秀的队伍﹐不过也绝不是容易被打败的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tony’s a pushover for blondes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼很容易被金发女郎迷住。

Subsense.DEF: to be very easy to do or win
Subsense.TRAN: 是容易做的事﹔是容易获胜的比赛
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The exam was a pushover.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次考试很容易。

Sense.DEF: to push a vehicle in order to make the engine start
an exercise in which you lie on the floor on your chest and push yourself up with your arms
someone who is pushy does everything they can to get what they want from other people –used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 急于求成的﹐咄咄逼人的﹐执意强求的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pushy salesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纠缠不休的推销员

Sense.DEF: frightened of taking even small risks
used to talk to or call a cat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come here, puss, puss, puss!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过来﹐猫咪！

Sense.DEF: a cat – used especially by or to children
a very offensive word meaning a woman’s sex organs. Do not use this word.
not polite an offensive word for a man who is weak or not brave
a cat – used especially by or to children
someone who is very nice and gentle – used especially when they do not seem this way
Sense.TRAN: 温顺可爱的人〔尤指表面上看来并非如此时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greg? He’s a pussycat, really.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格？他是个温文尔雅的人﹐真的。

Sense.DEF: to be too careful and frightened to do something, such as making firm decisions or telling someone exactly what you think
Sense.TRAN: 缩手缩脚﹐畏首畏尾﹔优柔寡断
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t pussyfoot around when it comes to keeping kids safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事关孩子的安全时你可不能犹豫不决。

Sense.DEF: a tree with white flowers that are soft like fur

a small raised spot on your skin containing
pus
to move something to a particular place or position, especially using your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put the coffee on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把咖啡放在桌上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where did you put the programmes?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把节目单放在哪里了？

Sense.DEF: to change someone’s situation or the way they feel
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t put yourself into a situation you can’t handle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让自己陷入无法收拾的局面。

GramExa.PROPFORM: put sb in a good/bad etc mood
GramExa.GLOSS: make them feel happy/annoyed etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The long delay had put us all in a bad mood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间的延误使我们大家心情都不好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to put you in danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让你陷入危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pit closures have put thousands of miners out of a jobmade them lose their job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤矿关闭使成千上万的矿工失去了工作。

GramExa.GLOSS: give someone authority over a group, activity, or organization
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 让某人掌舵/指挥/负责等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His boss resigned and Murphy was put in charge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上司辞职后墨菲奉命主持工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Politics puts me to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治让我觉得很乏味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A knee injury put him out of action for three months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 膝盖受伤使他三个月不能行动。

Sense.DEF: to write or print something or to make a mark with a pen or pencil

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Put your name at the top of each answer sheet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在每张答卷的顶端写上你的名字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He put his signature to the contract he signed it to show he agreed with it .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在合同上签了名。

Sense.DEF: to say or write something using words in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The question was well put.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这问题提得很好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: So it was an accident, an ‘act of God’ if you want to put it like that .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么这是个意外﹐是 上帝的作为”﹐如果你想那么说的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When women joined the organization, it ‘took on a new look,’ as news reports put it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性加入以后﹐就如新闻报道中所说﹐那个机构“面貌焕然一新”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is hard to put into words express how I feel now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在的感觉难以用语言描述。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not very musical, to put it mildly he’s not musical at all .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说得婉转点﹐他不是很有音乐天赋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We get on each other’s nerves, to put it bluntly to say exactly what I mean .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩都让对方烦﹐坦白地说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s fairly risky. Or to put it another way say it in different words , don’t try this at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样相当危险﹐或者换句话说﹐别试着在家里干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The subject matter makes the painting a little, how shall I put it how can I say it politely? , undesirable for public display.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个主题让这幅画有点﹐怎么说呢﹐不适合公开展览。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put a stop/an end to sth
Sense.DEF: to stop an activity that is harmful or unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 结束某事﹐停止某事〔指有害或者不被人接受的活动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must put an end to their threats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须让他们停止威胁。

Sense.DEF: to start using a plan, idea, knowledge etc
Sense.TRAN: 开始把〔计划﹑观点﹑知识等〕付诸实施[实践]
Sense.EXAMPLE: James was keen to put some of the things he had learned into practice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯渴望把自己学到的一些知识付诸实践。

Sense.DEF: to ask a question or make a suggestion, especially to get someone’s opinion or agreement

GramExa.PROPFORM: put a proposition/proposal/case etc to sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He put the proposal to his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向妻子提了那个建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The budget was put before the board of directors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预算被提交董事会批准。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I put a question to you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能问你一个问题吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I put it to you that this proposal has to be considered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我请你务必考虑这条建议。

Sense.DEF: to make a situation better, especially after someone has made a mistake or behaved badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a chance to put things right by admitting a mistake was made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还有机会扭转局面﹐那就是承认犯了错。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone the true facts when they have made a mistake that annoys you
Sense.TRAN: 〔当某人犯了令人不悦的错误时〕说明事实真相
Sense.EXAMPLE: A young man was in here asking for ‘Miss’ Whalby, but I put him right on that one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名年轻男子来找威尔比“小姐”﹐不过我向他挑明他弄错了称呼。

Sense.DEF: to make something look clean and tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took us all weekend to put the garden straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们花了整个周末才收拾好花园。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something work or do something, or to use it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scheme to put unemployed people to work on government construction projects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让失业人员参与政府施工项目的计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you have a spare room, put it to work for you - take in a lodger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有空闲的房间﹐就把它利用起来——收一个房客。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer games are being put to use in the classroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑游戏正应用于课堂教学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We put 15 cars to the test we tested them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们测试了15辆汽车。

Sense.DEF: to consider something as having a particular level of importance or quality
Sense.TRAN: 认为〔某物具有某种重要性﹑品质等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A recent poll put Dr Martens among the world’s top thirty designer labels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近一项民意调查把马丁大夫列入世界设计师品牌前30名。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some companies put profit before safety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些公司视利润高于安全。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The job’s important to him, but he puts his family first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作对他很重要﹐不过他还是把家庭放在首位。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for someone to go to a place, or to make them go there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is putting in new management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正在部署新的管理层。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pneumonia put him in the hospital for a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肺炎令他住院一个星期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Put the boys to bed around eight o’clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 八点左右让孩子们上床。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put sb on a train/plane etc
Sense.DEF: to take someone to a plane, train etc to start a journey
Sense.TRAN: 把某人送上火车/飞机等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I put her on the plane for London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我送她上了去伦敦的飞机。

Sense.DEF: to spoil and end your hopes or plans completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: A car accident put paid to his chances of taking part in the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一起交通事故使他参加赛跑的机会成了泡影。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I wouldn’t put it past sb (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: used to say that you think someone could easily do something wrong or illegal
