Sense.TRAN: 我看某人干得出〔错的或违法的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t put it past him to use force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看他干得出动粗的事情。

Sense.DEF: to make extra work or cause problems for someone
used to tell someone to put their hand in yours, either as a greeting or after making an agreement with them
Sense.TRAN: 来握握手〔表示问候或达成协议等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: $500? OK, it’s a deal. Put it there!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 500 美元？好吧﹐成交了。 握个手吧！

Sense.DEF:
to throw a
shot a heavy metal ball
in a sports competition

Exponent.DEF: to move something to a particular place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve put the wine in the fridge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已把酒放进冰箱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Where have you put my grey shirt?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把我的灰色衬衫放哪里了？

Exponent.DEF: to put something somewhere carefully
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s beautiful,’ he said, placing it back on the shelf.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “很漂亮。”他边说边把它放回架子上。

Exponent.DEF: to put someone or something down carefully on a flat surface
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He laid all the money on the table.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把所有的钱都放到桌上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She laid the baby on his bed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把宝宝放到他床上。

Exponent.DEF: to carefully put something in a suitable position
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Position the microphone to suit your height.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把麦克风放到适合你的高度。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Troops were positioned around the city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市四周安置了军队。

Exponent.DEF: to put something somewhere with a quick movement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He slipped his arm around her waist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他悄悄伸出手臂揽住她的腰。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Carrie quickly slipped the money into her bag.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽迅速把钱塞进包里。

Exponent.DEF: to put something into a space or container quickly or carelessly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shove anything you don’t want in that sack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你不要的东西都塞进那个袋子里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve ironed those shirts so don’t just shove them in a drawer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些衬衫我都熨过了,别胡乱塞进抽屉。

Exponent.DEF: to put something somewhere quickly or carelessly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I stuck the address in my pocket and I can’t find it now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把地址塞进了衣袋,现在找不到了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Could you bung those clothes in the washing machine?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把那些衣服扔到洗衣机里去好吗？

Exponent.DEF: to put something down somewhere in a careless and untidy way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t just dump all your bags in the kitchen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把袋子都乱丢在厨房里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People shouldn’t dump rubbish at the side of the street.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们不该把垃圾倒在路边。

Exponent.DEF: to quickly put something somewhere, usually for a short time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pop it in the microwave for a minute.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 放进微波炉加热一分钟。

Exponent.DEF: to put something somewhere suddenly or forcefully
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Hide it,’ he said, thrusting the watch into her hand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “把它藏起来。”他边说边把手表塞到她手里。

Section.SECHEADING: TO PUT SOMETHING INTO A LIQUID 将某物放入液体

Exponent.DEF: to put something into a liquid for a very short time and take it out again
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She dipped her hand in the water to see how hot it was.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把手放在水里蘸一下看看有多烫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Prawns are delicious dipped in a spicy sauce.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大虾蘸一蘸辣汁很好吃。

Exponent.DEF: to put something quickly, firmly, and deeply into a liquid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Plunge the pasta into a pan of boiling water.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把意大利面放入一锅沸水中。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had to plunge my arm in up to the elbow to reach the keys.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只好把手伸进去直到肘部，去够钥匙。

Exponent.DEF: to put something such as a piece of bread or cake into a hot drink or soup before eating it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I love biscuits dunked in coffee.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢把饼干浸咖啡吃。

Exponent.DEF: to put something deep into a liquid so that it is completely covered
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If the plant’s leaves look dry, immerse the roots in water for a while.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这植物的叶子看上去干了,就把根在水里浸一会儿。

Sense.DEF: to give other people news or information, especially when it is unpleasant or untrue
Sense.TRAN: 散布某事〔尤指不愉快或不真实的消息或信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After he was fired, he put it about that he was fed up with working for such a large company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被解雇以后四处说﹐为这么大的公司打工他感到厌倦了。

Sense.DEF: if a ship puts about or if you put it about, it changes direction
to have sexual relationships with a lot of different people
to explain your ideas, beliefs etc in a way that people can understand
Sense.TRAN: 表达清楚﹐解释清楚〔自己的想法等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was trying to put across a serious point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想解释清楚一个重要的问题。

Sense.DEF: to explain your ideas and opinions clearly so that people understand them and realize what sort of person you are
Sense.TRAN: 清楚地表达自己的意思﹔有效地传达自己的想法等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue’s never been very good at putting herself across at interviews.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试时休一向不善于清楚表达自己的意思。

Sense.DEF: to sing, play music, or act in a film or play in a clear effective way
Sense.TRAN: 清晰地演绎〔歌曲﹑音乐﹑电影角色等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can really put a song across.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能把一首歌唱得很动听。

Sense.DEF: to try to stop thinking about a problem, argument, or disagreement, because you want to achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某事物〕撇开不理﹐不考虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must put aside your pride and apologise to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须放下自尊向他道歉。

Sense.DEF: to save money regularly, usually for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: She put at least £30 a week aside for food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每周至少留出30英镑用于购买食品。

Sense.DEF: to put down something you are reading or working with, in order to start doing something else
Sense.TRAN: 放下〔正在读的东西或正在干的活〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He glanced at the note, put it aside and went on with the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他瞥了一眼字条﹐把它放在一边继续开会。

Sense.DEF: to keep a period of time free in order to be able to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re planning a trip to the museum, be sure to put aside at least an hour and a half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你计划参观博物馆﹐那就一定要留出至少一个半小时。

Sense.DEF: to calculate or guess an amount, number, age etc, without being very exact
Sense.TRAN: 推测〔某物〕是…﹐估计〔数量﹑年龄等〕是…
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her fortune was put at £5.5 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的财产估计有550万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to put something in the place where it is usually kept
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某物〕收拾起来〔放回原处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put his toys away every night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每晚都把自己的玩具收拾好。

Sense.DEF: to save money
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re putting some money away for expenses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们省下一笔钱来应付开支。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in a prison or in a mental hospital
Sense.TRAN: 把某人送入监狱[精神病院]
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you are found guilty, the judge is going to put you away for life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你被裁定有罪﹐法官会判你终身监禁。

Sense.DEF: to eat or drink a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s amazing the amount that child can put away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那孩子的食量真是惊人。

Sense.DEF:
to score a
goal
, especially after other failed attempts
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seized the opportunity to put the ball away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓住机会进了球。

Sense.DEF: to defeat your opponent in a sports competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two plays later, Smith scored to put the game away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两次进攻以后﹐史密斯得分拿下了比赛。

Sense.DEF: to put people or things in the place or situation they were in before
Sense.TRAN: 放回〔原处〕﹔使…回到原来的状况
Sense.EXAMPLE: She put the saucepan back on the stove.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把长柄锅放回炉子上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our win today put us back into third place in the league.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的胜利让我们重回联赛第三的位置。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for an event to start at a later time or date

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meeting has been put back to next Thursday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议推迟到下周四举行。

Sense.DEF: to delay a process or activity by a number of weeks, months etc
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某过程或活动〕延迟〔数周﹑数月等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This fire could put back the opening date by several weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场大火会使开业日期延迟几个星期。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something have something that they used to have before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The win put a smile back on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次胜利让他的脸上重现笑容。

Sense.DEF: to make a clock or watch show an earlier time
to try to forget about an unpleasant event or experience and think about the future
Sense.TRAN: 把…置之脑后〔指忘掉不愉快的事或经历〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had dealt with the guilt years ago and put it behind her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她早就克服了内疚的心理﹐把它抛在脑后了。

Sense.DEF: to save money regularly in order to use it later
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re trying to put a little by each month for a new car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正试着每月存一点钱﹐准备买辆新汽车。

Sense.DEF: to put something or someone that you are holding or carrying onto a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put those heavy bags down for a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那些沉重的包放下一会儿。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone and make them feel silly or stupid
Sense.TRAN: 批评某人﹔使某人出洋相
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate the way Dave puts me down the whole time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很讨厌戴夫老是批评我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop putting yourself down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再责备自己了。

Sense.DEF: to write something, especially a name or number, on a piece of paper or on a list
Sense.TRAN: 写下﹐记下〔尤指姓名或数字〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put down your name and address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写下你的姓名和地址。

Sense.DEF:
to stop a
revolution
etc by using force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The uprising was put down by the police and the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起义遭到警察和军队的镇压。

Sense.DEF: to pay part of the total cost of something, so that you can pay the rest later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They put down a deposit on the goods until Christmas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们付了货物的订金﹐圣诞节时结清。

Sense.DEF: to put a baby in its bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: We try to put Amy down at six every evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽量每晚六点把埃米放在床上让她睡觉。

Sense.DEF:
to put the
receiver
back onto the telephone when you have finished speaking to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She put the phone down on me suddenly ended the conversation .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没说完她就把电话挂了。

Sense.DEF: to kill an animal without causing it pain, usually because it is old or sick
Sense.TRAN: 〔无痛地〕杀死〔年老或患病的动物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to have the dog put down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不得不让这条狗安乐死。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you found a book, game etc extremely interesting
Sense.TRAN: 我欲罢不能〔用于表示你认为某本书或游戏等极其有趣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once I’d started reading it I just couldn’t put it down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一开始读就爱不释手。

Sense.DEF:
if an aircraft puts down or if a pilot puts it down, it lands, especially because of an
emergency
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine failed and the plane put down in the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机失灵﹐飞机迫降在海上。

Sense.DEF: to suggest a subject, plan, change in the law etc for a parliament or committee to consider
Sense.TRAN: 提出一项动议/修正案〔供议会或委员会考虑〕

Sense.DEF: to stop a vehicle so that passengers can get off at a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: He asked the taxi to put him down at the end of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让出租车停在路的尽头让他下车。

Sense.DEF: to guess what someone is like or what they do, without having much information about them
Sense.TRAN: 〔无充分根据就〕认为〔某人〕是…﹐把〔某人〕看作是…
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t think he was unfriendly. I put him down as shy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他并非不友好﹐我觉得他是害羞。

Sense.DEF: to put someone’s name on a list so that they can take part in an activity, join an organization etc
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人的名字〕登记在参加者的名单上﹐为〔某人〕报名参加某活动[加入某组织]
Sense.EXAMPLE: They put themselves down for a training course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们报名参加了培训课程。

Sense.DEF: to write someone’s name on a list with an amount of money that they have promised to give
Sense.TRAN: 登记某人认捐5英镑/20英镑等

Sense.DEF: to think that something is caused by something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was having difficulty reading, which I put down to the poor light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我读起来有困难﹐我认为是光线太暗。

Sense.DEF: to try not to feel too upset about failure, especially when you learn something useful from it
Sense.TRAN: 把它当作一次经验教训
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone gets rejected from time to time; put it down to experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都偶尔会遭到拒绝﹐把它当作一次教训吧。

Sense.DEF: to suggest an idea, explanation etc, especially one that other people later consider and discuss
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arguments were put forth for changing some of the rules of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人提出理由﹐主张改变比赛的某些规则。

Sense.DEF: if a tree or bush puts forth leaves etc, it begins to grow them
Sense.TRAN: 〔树或灌木〕长出叶子/新芽/根等

Sense.DEF: to suggest a plan, proposal, idea etc for other people to consider or discuss
Sense.EXAMPLE: They put forward a number of suggestions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们提出了一些建议。

Sense.DEF: to suggest formally that you or someone else should be considered for a particular job, membership of an organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her name was put forward for the lead role in the play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被提名出演该剧主角。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for an event to start at an earlier time or date

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men’s final has been put forward to 1:30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男子决赛提前到一点半举行。

Sense.DEF: to make a clock or watch show a later time
to fix a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to have a new bathroom put in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定安装一套新的盥洗设备。

Sense.DEF: to spend time or use energy working or practising something
Sense.TRAN: 花费〔时间或精力〕做某事[练习某事]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dorothy had put in a lot of hard work during her six years as chairperson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多萝西当主席的六年间呕心沥血。

Sense.DEF: to interrupt someone in order to say something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How old are you?’ ‘Sixteen.’ ‘I’m sixteen too,’ put in Dixie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你多大了？”“16岁。”“我也16岁。”迪克西插话道。

Sense.DEF: to ask for something in an official way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She put in an insurance claim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她提出保险索赔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must put in an order by tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今晚之前必须预订。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I put in for a pay increase.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提出要加工资。

Sense.DEF: to trust someone or something or believe that they can do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m putting my faith in the appeal judges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我信任上诉法官。

Sense.DEF: to do something in a particular way, especially a performance in a play, film, race etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某种方式〕做某事〔尤指戏剧﹑电影﹑比赛等中的表现〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put in a brilliant performance in the British Grand Prix.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在英国大奖赛中表现出众。

Sense.DEF: to go to a social event, meeting etc for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔在社交活动或会议上〕短暂露面
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an hour yet before she needed to put in an appearance at the restaurant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小时之后她才需要在餐馆露面。

Sense.DEF: if a ship puts in, it enters a port
to make money available to be used for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government appears to be putting more money into education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府似乎要在教育上投入更多资金。

Sense.DEF: to use a lot of energy etc when you are doing an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Candidates put a lot of time and effort into gaining qualifications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了获得入选资格﹐候选人耗费了大量的时间和精力。

Sense.DEF: to add a quality to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: These simple recipes put more fun into eating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些简单的食谱为饮食增添了更多趣味。

Sense.DEF: to delay doing something or to arrange to do something at a later time or date, especially because there is a problem or you do not want to do it now
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match has been put off until tomorrow because of bad weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于天气不好﹐比赛推迟到明天。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I put off going to the doctor but I wish I hadn’t.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我推迟了去看医生的时间﹐真希望自己没有这样做。

Sense.DEF: to make you dislike something or not want to do something
Sense.TRAN: 使某人不喜欢某事﹐使某人不想做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let the restaurant’s decor put you off – the food is really good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让餐馆的装修风格破坏了你的兴致——这里的饭菜真的很可口。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let your failures put you off trying harder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别因为失败就不再加倍努力了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone wait because you do not want to meet them, pay them etc until later
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于不想见或不想付款等原因而〕让某人等
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he calls, put him off as long as you can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是他打电话来﹐能拖他多久就拖多久。

Sense.DEF: to make it difficult for someone to pay attention to what they are doing by talking, making a noise, moving etc
Sense.TRAN: 影响某人做（某事）﹐使某人分心
Sense.EXAMPLE: It puts me off when you watch me all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一直看着我﹐我都分心了。

Sense.DEF: to let someone leave a vehicle at a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll put you off at the supermarket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在超市让你下车。

Sense.DEF: to put a piece of clothing on your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took off his uniform and put on a sweater and trousers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱下制服﹐换上了毛衣和裤子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have to put my glasses on; I can’t read the sign from here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得戴上眼镜﹔从这里我看不清那个标志牌。

Sense.DEF:
to put
make-up
, cream etc on your skin
Sense.TRAN: 在皮肤上涂[搽]〔化妆品﹑乳霜等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to put this cream on twice a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得一天搽两次这种乳霜。

Sense.DEF: to do something that affects or influences someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 做某事〔以影响某人或另外的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government put a limit on imports of textiles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府限制纺织品进口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pat was putting pressure on him to leave his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特向他施压﹐逼他离开妻子。

Sense.DEF: to make a light or a piece of equipment start working by pressing or turning a button or switch
Sense.EXAMPLE: , turn on
He got up and put on the light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他起身打开了灯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall I put the kettle on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我烧壶水好吗？

Sense.DEF:
to put a record, tape, or
cd
into a machine and start playing it
Sense.TRAN: 播放〔唱片﹑磁带或激光唱片〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She put on some music while they ate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们吃东西的时候她放了点音乐。

Sense.DEF: to pretend to have a particular feeling, opinion, way of speaking etc especially in order to get attention
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为吸引注意力而〕假装有…﹐装出
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheila’s not really that upset; she’s just putting it on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉其实并没有那么生气﹐她只是在装样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leaving the court, the families all tried to put on a brave face not show that they were sad or worried .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开法庭的时候﹐几家人都尽力表现出坚强的样子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put on weight/12 lbs/4 kg etc
Sense.DEF: to become fatter and heavier
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rosie’s put on five kilos since she quit smoking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗西戒烟以来体重已增加了5公斤。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for a concert, play etc to take place, or to perform in it
Sense.TRAN: 上演〔戏剧等〕﹔举行〔音乐会等〕﹔表演〔节目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One summer the children put on a play.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一年夏天孩子们演了一部戏。

Sense.DEF: to show what you are able to do or what power you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team need to put on another world-class performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支队伍需要再一次拿出世界级水准的表现。

Sense.DEF: to start cooking something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall I put the pasta on now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在可以开始做意大利面食了吗？

Sense.DEF: to provide a service for people, especially a special one
Sense.TRAN: 提供服务〔尤指特殊服务〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: BA is putting on extra flights to cover the Christmas rush.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国航空公司正在增开航班以应对圣诞高峰期。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you think they are joking
Sense.TRAN: 你是跟我开玩笑吧！你骗我！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wouldn’t do that – you’re putting me on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不会那么做的﹐你在骗我！

Sense.DEF: to risk an amount of money on the result of a game, race etc
Sense.TRAN: 把钱押在某物上﹐对某事下赌注
Sense.EXAMPLE: We put £50 on Brazil to win the Cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们押50英镑赌巴西队赢得奖杯。

Sense.DEF: to add an amount of money or tax onto the cost of something
Sense.TRAN: 增加某物的价格﹔对某事物征税
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can smokers really complain if more tax is put on cigarettes?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果对香烟征更多的税﹐吸烟者真的会抱怨吗？

Sense.DEF: to give someone the telephone so that they can talk to someone who is telephoning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you put Janet on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能叫珍妮特听电话吗？

Sense.DEF: to give someone information about something interesting or useful that they did not know about
Sense.TRAN: 向某人提供〔有趣或有用的信息﹐向某人介绍某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo put us onto this fantastic French restaurant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔向我们介绍了这家很棒的法国餐厅。

Sense.DEF: to make a fire etc stop burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rescue services are still trying to put out the fires.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援部门仍在试图扑灭大火。

Sense.DEF: to make a light stop working by pressing or turning a button or switch
to put things where people can find and use them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls helped her to put out the cups and plates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 姑娘们帮她把杯盘摆好。

Sense.DEF: to feel upset or offended
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were a little put out at not being invited to the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有获邀参加婚礼﹐感到有些生气。

Sense.DEF: to make extra work or cause problems for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary can’t come to dinner tonight. She hopes it won’t put you out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽今晚不能来赴宴了﹐她希望不会给你带来不便。

Sense.DEF: to make an effort to do something that will help someone
Sense.TRAN: 努力做某事以帮助某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had put themselves out to entertain her during her visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她来访期间他们尽力招待她。

Sense.DEF: to take something outside your house and leave it there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember to put the cat out before you go to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记得上床之前把猫放出去。

GramExa.GLOSS: put unwanted things outside your house to be taken away
put clothes outside to dry

Sense.DEF: to push your tongue out of your mouth, especially as a rude sign to someone
Sense.TRAN: 伸出舌头〔尤作为不礼貌的表示〕

Sense.DEF: to move your hand etc forward and away from your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put out his hand toward her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向她伸出手。

Sense.DEF: to make someone unconscious before a medical operation
to injure your back
to broadcast or produce something for people to read or listen to
Sense.TRAN: 播出﹔制作〔电视或广播节目〕﹔出版〔书刊等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They put out a half-hour programme on young refugees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们制作了一档关于年轻难民的节目﹐时长为半小时。

Sense.DEF: to try to discover information or opinions by listening to people or watching what is happening
Sense.TRAN: 通过倾听[观察]发现信息[了解观点]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had already put out feelers with local employers but they hadn’t been interested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接触了当地的雇主﹐但他们不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: if a ship puts out, it starts to sail
if a woman puts out, she has sex with a man

to prevent a baseball player from running around the
base s
, for example by catching the ball that they have hit
to succeed in telling other people your ideas, opinions, feelings etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The advert puts over the message clearly and simply: nuclear power is clean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那则广告简明扼要地表达了这个观点: 核能是清洁能源。

Sense.DEF: to deceive someone into believing something that is not true or that is useless
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody could put one over on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也骗不了他。

Sense.DEF: to connect someone to someone else on the telephone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you put me through to Eddie?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请帮我接通埃迪好吗？

Sense.DEF: to pay for someone to study at school, college etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She worked as a waitress and put herself through school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她当女招待挣钱供自己上学。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do or experience something difficult or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 使某人经受某事〔困难或不悦的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were put through eight weeks of basic training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们经受了八个星期的基本训练。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They really put me through it at the interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试的时候他们真让我受不了。

Sense.DEF: to do what is necessary in order to get a plan or suggestion accepted or approved
Sense.EXAMPLE: Production will start up again when these changes have been put through.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些改动完成后﹐生产就将重新恢复。

Sense.DEF: to prepare or produce something by collecting pieces of information, ideas etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过收集资料﹑观点等〕整理出﹐拼凑﹐凑成
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took all morning to put the proposal together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整理出这份提议花了一上午。

Sense.DEF: to form people or things into a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are currently putting together a sales and marketing team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们目前正在组建一支市场营销队伍。

Sense.DEF: to make a machine, model etc by joining all the different parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t work out how to put this table together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搞不清如何拼装这张桌子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: more…than the rest/the others/everything else put together
Sense.DEF: used to say that one amount is greater than the total of a set of amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul seemed to have more money than the rest of us put together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗的钱似乎比我们所有人加起来的还多。

Sense.DEF: to use some money in order to pay part of the cost of something
Sense.TRAN: 以…支付某事的部分费用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alec put the money towards a trip to Australia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克把这笔钱用在去澳大利亚旅行上了。

Sense.DEF:
if a doctor puts you under, they give you drugs to make you unconscious before
surgery
to build something such as a wall, fence, building etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re putting up several new office blocks in the centre of town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在城中心建造几幢新办公楼。

Sense.DEF: to put a picture, notice etc on a wall so that people can see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I put up some posters?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能张贴几张海报吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shops have started to put up Christmas decorations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各商店已经开始挂上圣诞装饰品。

Sense.DEF: to attach a shelf, cupboard etc to a wall
Sense.TRAN: 把〔架子﹑橱柜等〕固定在墙上
Sense.EXAMPLE: My dad put up five shelves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸搭了五个架子。

Sense.DEF: to increase the cost or value of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most big stores admit they daren’t put prices up for fear of losing their customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数大商店都承认他们因为害怕失去顾客而不敢提高价格。

Sense.DEF: to raise something to a higher position
Sense.EXAMPLE: I put up my hand and asked to leave the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我举手要求离开房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Philip put his hood up because it was raining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为下雨了﹐菲利普拉起了兜帽。

Sense.DEF: to let someone stay in your house and give them meals
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was hoping Kenny could put me up for a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望肯尼能让我在他家住几天。

Sense.DEF: to stay in a place for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can put up at a hotel for the night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在酒店过夜。

Sense.DEF: to show great determination to oppose something or get out of a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gina put up a real fight to overcome the disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉娜为战胜疾病而顽强斗争。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels have put up fierce resistance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子进行了激烈的抵抗。

Sense.DEF: to give an amount of money for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 提供金钱〔用于某一用途〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paper put up a reward for information on the murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家报纸提供悬赏征集这宗谋杀案的线索。

Sense.DEF: to make something or someone available for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 准备好某物﹔让某人做好准备

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They put their house up for sale .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的房子正待售。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby was put up for adoption .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个婴儿正等待收养。

Sense.DEF: to explain a suggestion or idea so that other people can think about it or discuss it
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you can put up a good enough case, the board will provide the finance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能提出足够好的理由﹐董事会将提供资金。

Sense.DEF: to suggest someone as a suitable person to be elected to a position
Sense.TRAN: 推举﹐提名〔某人担任某职〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was put up for the committee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被提名加入那个委员会。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they should either do what needs to be done or stop talking about it
to encourage someone to do something stupid or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 唆使〔某人〕做〔愚蠢或危险的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did Shirley put you up to this?’ ‘No, it was my own idea.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “是不是雪莉让你这么干的？”“不是﹐是我自己的主意。”

Sense.DEF: to accept an unpleasant situation or person without complaining
Sense.EXAMPLE: She put up with his violent temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她忍受着他暴躁的脾气。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people usually prefer to use tolerate , which is more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们一般喜欢用更正式的 tolerate
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They had to tolerate many hardships.

Sense.DEF: believed or accepted by most people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the putative father of her child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她孩子的推定父亲

Sense.DEF: something you say that is intended to make someone feel stupid or unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was tired of his put-downs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听腻了他那些贬低人的话。

Sense.DEF: something you say or do to try to make someone believe something that is not true
upset or offended
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt put out that she hadn’t been consulted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人找她商量﹐她觉得不高兴。

Sense.DEF: if a dead animal or plant putrefies, it decays and smells very bad
dead animals, plants etc that are putrid are decaying and smell very bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔死去的动植物〕腐烂的﹐腐臭的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the putrid smells from the slaughterhouses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屠宰场散发出的腐臭味

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a putrid green colour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难看的绿色

Sense.DEF: a secretly planned attempt to remove a government by force
Sense.EXAMPLE: the failed putsch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未遂的武装政变

Sense.DEF: to hit a golf ball lightly a short distance along the ground towards the hole
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫球赛中向球洞〕轻击（球）

Sense.DEF: a long piece of cloth that soldiers wrapped around each leg from the knee down, as part of their uniform in the past

a type of
golf club stick
, used to hit the ball a short distance towards or into the hole
to spend time doing things that are not very important in a relaxed way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I puttered around for a while, cleaning up the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我瞎忙了一会儿﹐打扫了一下厨房。

Sense.DEF: to walk or move slowly and without hurrying
Sense.EXAMPLE: A little boy puttered along the sidewalk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小男孩在人行道上闲逛。

Sense.DEF: to make the low sound that a vehicle makes when it is moving slowly
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆等缓慢移动时〕发出突突声
Sense.EXAMPLE: A motor boat puttered by.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一艘摩托艇“突突”地慢慢驶过。

Sense.DEF:
one of the smooth areas of grass on a
golf course
where you hit the ball along the ground into the hole
a smooth area of grass with special holes in it for playing a simple type of golf
Sense.TRAN: 小型高尔夫球场〔用于玩简易高尔夫球〕

Sense.DEF: a soft whitish substance that becomes hard when it dries and that is used to fix glass into window frames
to be easily controlled or influenced by someone
Sense.TRAN: 易受某人摆布﹐易受某人影响

Sense.DEF: an event that seems real but has actually been arranged in order to deceive someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been suggested the kidnapping was a put-up job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人暗示那宗绑架事件是个骗局。

Sense.DEF: someone who feels put-upon thinks that other people are treating them unfairly by expecting them to do too much
an offensive word for someone, especially a man, who is stupid, annoying, and unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 愚蠢的人﹐令人讨厌的人〔尤指男人〕

Sense.DEF:
a
penis
to spend time doing very little, or not doing anything important
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just been putzing around this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天早上无所事事。

Sense.DEF: a game or toy that has a lot of pieces that you have to fit together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child’s wooden puzzle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童木制拼图

Sense.DEF: a game in which you have to think hard to solve a difficult question or problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: a crossword puzzle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纵横字谜游戏

Sense.DEF: something that is difficult to understand or explain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the puzzle of how the sun works
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳发光发热之谜

Sense.EXAMPLE: The meaning of the poem has always been a puzzle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那首诗的含义始终是个谜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thought he had solved the puzzle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为他已经解开了那个谜。

Sense.DEF: a piece of information that helps you to understand part of a difficult question, mystery etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔有助于理解难题﹑神秘事物等的〕信息﹐线索

Sense.DEF: to confuse someone or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a question that continues to puzzle scientists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直困扰科学家的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was puzzled by the reactions to his remark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己的话引起的反应感到困惑不解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What puzzles me is why his books are so popular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令我不解的是﹐他的书为什么如此受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: to solve a confusing or difficult problem by thinking about it carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lay looking at the ceiling, trying to puzzle things out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他躺在那里盯着天花板﹐想要弄明白是怎么回事。

Sense.DEF: to think for a long time about something because you cannot understand or solve it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The class puzzled over a poem by Shakespeare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全班同学仔细琢磨着莎士比亚的一首诗。

Sense.DEF: confused and unable to understand something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Dinner?’ Sam asked, looking puzzled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “吃饭？”萨姆问道﹐看上去很迷惑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John seemed puzzled about what the question meant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰似乎不明白那问题是什么意思。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harry was puzzled that Nicholas didn’t seem to recognize him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼古拉斯似乎没有认出自己﹐哈里感到不解。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alice read the letter with a puzzled expression on her face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯读了那封信﹐一脸迷惑。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being confused and unable to understand something
something that is difficult to understand or explain
Sense.TRAN: 难解的事﹐难以说明的事

Sense.DEF: confusing and difficult to understand or explain
Sense.TRAN: 令人迷惑的﹐令人费解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a puzzling fact
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人费解的情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gary found her reaction puzzling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里对她的反应感到迷惑。

Sense.DEF: a type of plastic, used to make pipes, window frames, clothes etc

a piece of equipment that can record television programmes for you
digitally

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=private, the lowest military rank in the army【美】列兵﹐二等兵

Sense.DEF: used in writing to show that something happens, is paid etc each week
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rent is £55 p.w.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租金为每周55英镑。

Sense.DEF: a shop selling food and other supplies on a US military base
Sense.TRAN: 〔美军军营中的〕福利商店﹐服务社

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to a race of very small people, especially one of the tribes of central Africa
Sense.TRAN: 俾格米人〔身材非常矮小的一个种族﹐尤指中非的一个部族〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is not as good, intelligent, strong etc as other people in the same group – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔与别人相比某方面有所不足的〕侏儒﹐小矮人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a literary pygmy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文学上的侏儒

Sense.DEF: used to describe a type of animal or plant that is much smaller than other similar types
Sense.TRAN: 〔比同类动植物〕小得多的﹐矮小的﹐微小的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pygmy elephant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小矮象

Sense.DEF: a soft pair of trousers and a top that you wear in bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: striped pyjamas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条纹睡衣裤

Sense.DEF: loose trousers that are tied around the waist, worn by Muslim men or women
a tall metal structure that supports wires carrying electricity

one of a set of plastic
cone s
placed on a road to control traffic and protect people working there
Sense.TRAN: 〔放置在道路上控制交通并保护路上工作人员的〕圆锥形警示路标
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=pick your own, used by farms that let people pick fruit and vegetables to buy 水果[蔬菜]自摘〔农场用语〕

Sense.DEF:
a large stone building with four
triangular three-sided
walls that slope in to a point at the top, especially in Egypt and Central America
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指埃及和中美洲的〕金字塔

Sense.DEF: a system, society, company etc that is organized in different levels, so that there is a small number of people at the top and a much larger number of people at the bottom
Sense.EXAMPLE: different levels of the management pyramid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金字塔式管理体系中的不同层次
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the bottom of the pyramid are the poor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 位于社会金字塔最底层的是穷人。

Sense.DEF: a pile of objects that have been put into the shape of a pyramid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pyramid of oranges
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆摆成金字塔形的橙子

Sense.DEF: an object shaped like a pyramid

a dishonest and often illegal way of selling
investment s
, in which money from people who
invest
later is used to pay people in the system who have already invested
Sense.TRAN: 金字塔式骗局〔一种不诚实且通常违法的推销投资项目的方式〕

Sense.DEF: a business activity in which the main income comes from people who buy the right to sell products, rather than from the sale of the products themselves. Pyramid selling is illegal in many places.
Sense.TRAN: 金字塔式销售﹐层压式推销〔一种商业活动﹐收入主要源自商品经销权的买卖﹐而非商品本身。 这种销售方式在很多地方被视为违法〕

Sense.DEF: a high pile of wood on which a dead body is placed to be burned in a funeral ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: a funeral pyre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火葬柴堆

Sense.DEF: a special type of strong glass that does not break when it gets very hot and that is used to make cooking dishes, plates etc
Sense.TRAN: 派莱克斯玻璃﹐耐热玻璃〔用于制造炊具〕

Sense.DEF:
a mix of
sulphur
with a type of metal, usually iron, or iron and
copper
Sense.EXAMPLE: iron pyrites
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄铁矿

Sense.DEF: someone who suffers from a mental illness that gives them a strong desire to start fires

a public show of
firework s

the skill or business of making
firework s
Sense.TRAN: 烟火制造术﹔烟火制造业

Sense.DEF: an impressive show of someone’s skill as a public performer, musician etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔演奏技巧等的〕出色表现﹔炫示
Sense.EXAMPLE: the guitar pyrotechnics of Eric Clapton
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾力克·克拉普顿出色的吉他表演

Sense.DEF: a victory in which the person who wins suffers so much that the victory was hardly worth winning
Sense.TRAN: 以极大代价换取的胜利﹐得不偿失的胜利

Sense.DEF: a large tropical snake that kills animals for food by winding itself around them and crushing them
